The hashbrowns were mushy consistency, not the crusty deliciousness Guy made it seem like. And the pancakes were good but again just average.

I ordered grilled Chicken sandwich with avocado and fries for takeaway. Cashier seem to doesn't care for the customer, she didn't provide napkin in the bag, didn't care to offer for ketchup or anything else. When I asked her about after I opened the box, her response was very casual and didn't care about customer experience. Food quality is medium but the experience is very poor.
Best. Waffle. Ever. Oh, and the bacon... man... Super high quality, thick, seasoned well... Def a must have

Go to Matt's...wait in line if you have to...fight for parking...just go.  I don't like going too early, as the American fried potatoes haven't had the opportunity to soak in enough rosemary and get that nice crisp crust from the grill yet.  Hands down, the best breakfast I've had in the Valley.  Bacon arrives fresh each day...I think everything does.  Coffee is terrific and then there's this woman...(Matt's wife), who just simply lights up the place.    I go to restaurants a lot...more than most...more than I probably should.  I will go once on a recommendation from someone.  I will go back again, if the place measures up.  If I go back more frequently, it's because of the people.  And Matt's is about the people.  I've met great people there and although I maybe get there 5-6 times a year, they remember me.  That's cool...and very important.  Simply put, I have not found a meal there I haven't liked, but most often, the Special of the Day is just out of the world delicious.  Also, just trust me here...get the American fried potatoes...again...trust me.  Delicious.

Went here for breakfast today with a friend. The special was a spinach scramble, which my friend had. I had the Belgian waffle.  Both dishes were excellent.  We arrived at about 8:00 a.m. on a Tuesday morning, so no wait at all.    Only complaint: the music was a bit too loud.  Definitely a winner!

YUM! Great breakfast and service--in an airport?! SO SO good! French toast, sausage, eggs over medium; even their ice tea with fruit infusion is fantastic. Sat at counter: served politely and efficiently. Excellent experience! Matt's and Sky Harbor Airport are recognizing Phoenix and Arizona well. Makin' this home girl proud!!

Totally worth the wait, for all the people complaining about the wait... If you dont have the patience to wait for quality food, call ahead or go to Denny's. Their portions are very large, and honestly I don't get why that is a complaint, get a togo box and enjoy the rest of your lunch or breakfast later.  Everyone is always friendly who works there and you have to respect the fact that almost all of there food is locally sourced.
Cherry bourbon sausage...amazing. Came here at the recommendation of a friend. They were fast and efficient and only a 7-10minute walk from my hotel.

Wow. I would love to go into details about this gem but I'm too full to do it. So all I'm gonna say is cheese omlette, hash brown, and bacon. What a great day to start a day! Parking is a bitch but... I didn't expect any different.
Its just a regular breakfast joint.  Defiantly not worth a wait in line.

I've been looking forward to trying Matt's Big Breakfast. After seeing it on Diners Drive-Ins and Dives we were really excited to try it. We were off to a good start. The wait staff was pleasant and the coffee was terrific. Classic eggs benedict was the special and I was so looking forward to it. Sadly, the eggs benedict was inedible. The poached eggs were cooked all the way through, the Canadian bacon was dried out and there was no hollandaise to speak of. Home fries were soggy and tired. My plate was picked up basically untouched. The wait staff didn't ask and I didn't volunteer what the problem was as we just wanted to leave. My companions had a very average breakfast with soggy bacon. The bill was pretty high. Needless to say, we won't go back. Such a disappointment. The place is really cute.
Great food, the waffles were out of this world! But there weren't very many options to choose from.
Amazing. Felt like I was back home in Texas at an organic restaurant. Full of love.  Everything was filled with taste. Nothing bland.

I've been coming to AZ for spring traning baseball for the past 6 years. Only this year I was able to discover this little breakfast joint. They have the BEST hashbrown I've ever had and of all places, the best strawberry lemonade. They have a simple menu which is what I like and their service is excellent. The only down side is that this restaurant is too small! We had to wait over 1.5 hr to get seated. But it's worth the wait, so we end up eating there 3 times in 4 days. A+++

Simple, wholesome ingredients, unpretentious food = home run breakfast.  Coffee was the only let down, it was decidedly watered-out, the classic dinner coffee.    Sign up for a spot on the waiting list and check out the farmer's market that's kitty-corner on Saturdays.

This place is awesome!!! It is a popular spot so be prepared for a bit of a wait however it will be worth it! Excited to hear that they are opening in Tempe as well! Everything here is so farm to table fresh  and the service was outstanding! Great place to bring out of town visitors in a charming spot of Downtown PHX.
I don't see what the hype is about. Food was good, bacon was incredible but I won't make the 20 minute drive back and 20-30 minute wait to eat there again. Also, not a good spot to bring kids.
This might be my favorite breakfast place in Phoenix.  The pancakes are awesome and all the other food is really good.  Restaurant is very small and the wait can be long.  But the food is worth it.
If your really hunger this is the place for you ! Took home half my meal pancakes were on the mark . Service I little slow . Will be back
The hash browns are too die for. My omelet was well done, not over cooked, and the strawberry spread is delicious.

Very disappointed... Nice clean place and very friendly staff, but the food just really isn't that good!  The coffee was weak but flavorful, the OJ was good (freshly squeezed), the wheat toast with preserves was good, the pancake was very plain, the home fries were bland and covered in grease, the pork chop was under seasoned/bland, and the eggs were good but greasy.  Not worth the wait in my opinion.
Service very slow ... took 10 minutes to get someone attention at take out counter ... chicken sandwich dried out ... should have gone to Wendy's Not you typical Matts
Oder eggs, hash brown and bacon person next to Oder the same to go after he had his breakfast because bacon smell great
Had the Classic Eggs Benedict, it was amazing. Vanessa our waitress was great. Always moving and very attentive. Thanks.
I love love the waffles at this place so delicious sweet and the syrup is tasty.  I've had only pleasant experience's at Matt's.  The staff is also excellent very catering to your needs.

I had the waffles which came with a side of bacom strips. The waffle was good and fluffy but the bacon was burned to a crisp. It was dry, overcooked. The service was pretty bad. The waitress was nice though unattentive. I noticed this with the others there as well. And the music? TERRIBLE!

There's only one thing to complain about and that is that I got too full to eat more. Great food, hot, fresh, made to order! Got the opportunity to speak with the executive chef and he was an absolute delight. There's no doubt I'll be back again!
Matt's is my fav breakfast place ever! I live in la And want to go to phx all the time just for Matt's:) waffles are the bomb.com.  I love the scramble specials too. Wish I lived In phx!

Solid breakfast place. Not as expensive as a lot of other places you will find in airports. Beer prices vary from $5-8 depending on the size and type. Wine will run you about $8 per glass with a pretty limited selection.  I had the Kilt Lifter draft and it was very tasty and helped my 3 hour layover go by a little easier. (May regret the fluid intake as soon as I board)  I also had two eggs and a side of toast, which for $5 I felt was a steal. I will definitely stop in if I am swing back through.

Hands down, best pancakes I have ever had. I would wait three hours for those babies! Went on a Sunday, waited almost 2 hours and boy was it worth it. I would suggest going on a weekday early morning to avoid the wait but I promise you will be glad you waited! You can also do take out. Oh, and get the orange juice!
Just plain yummy in the tummy! I love shredded hash browns and they do them up right! I love everything they have, though!

Go Early or be prepared to wait!  Smallest restaurant ever.  SUPER good food!  I've tried almost everything on the menu.  I've enjoyed it all.  They also have fresh squeezed juice and rosemary potatoes and an interesting bread when they don't have sourdough.
Best waffle I have ever had, and the five spot ain't bad either. Food is a bit greasy, and I recommend going on a weekday.

Great breakfast down to the toast. Delicious fresh-squeezed OJ and the Hash browns were to die for. Ham was a bit tough to cut but good flavor. Was traveling alone for work and enjoyed sitting at one of he window seats. Imagine there'd be quite a wait if it hadn't been 645AM on a week day. Will recommend to friends passing through PHX for sure.

There is nothing bad about this place. It's missing something, and it certainly won't make you say wow. That being said it's a nice restaurant, everything is clean and new, the menu descriptions are well written, there's attention paid to the little details. But the food just isn't that great.
Great simple fresh breakfast menu. Whenever I travel to PHX I make it a point to hit this place. I like the "skinny" breakfast but it all looks great

The Matt's new location at 32nd st & Camelback had me excited that it was coming to my area way before it opened it's doors and tho it was later than anticipated, it was awesome. Back was the great food I'd experienced at the downtown Matt's during their first months of business. The place was crowded again this past Saturday morning around 8:00 when I arrived, but a true benefit of dining alone is no waiting. The server was pleasant and cheerful and FAST. I was seated at 8:05 ate my delicious pancakes and superb bacon and paid my tab all before 8:35. I'm hoping it stays this fabulous, as the downtown spot fell out of favor with after the first year.

Many reviewers indicate that it's worth the wait, and I MUST wholeheartedly agree!  Knowing there would probably be a wait on a Sunday morning, my co-workers and I hustled ourselves out of bed a little earlier than we otherwise would have, checked out of our hotel, called for the valet to bring our car, and drove to Matt's.  I was frankly surprised at how very tiny the building was - I knew it was small, but WOW!  There didn't seem to be *too* many people waiting before us, so we put our names on the list.  We waited probably 45 minutes, and were very glad that it hadn't gotten truly HOT out yet.  Once inside, the place looks even smaller than it did from outside.  We were seated at the bar, which honestly looked a lot less cramped than some of the other tables with "large" parties (read: more than 2-3 people).  I think the entire place might seat 20 people?  We were immediately asked for our drink orders (coffee, orange juice and water), then our food orders.  I should have paid more attention to what my co-workers ordered (I know Hayden and Sheri shared an order of pancakes and bacon, and maybe something else, while John also had pancakes and something else with hash browns), but seriously?  Once my Belgian Waffle arrived, there was little room for me to pay attention to anything else.    I can't say I consider myself a connossieur of waffles or anything like that, but I've truly never tried another waffle that even comes close to comparing to this one.  The consistency was absolute PERFECTION!  It was crisp on the outside, fluffy on the inside, and the texture was hearty enough to hold up to the (real!) butter and (real maple!) syrup I subjected it to.  Oh, yeah, I also had the thick-cut bacon.  It was just a little too peppery and a little too done for my taste, but it was still quite good.  John declared the hash browns to be the best he'd ever had, and the pancakes got the same pronouncement from Hayden and Sheri.  Service was spot-on and cheerful.  There's just a couple things I would change about Matt's if I had the opportunity:  A) Expand.  With the demand, they could easily seat and serve twice or even three times as many customers and still have a wait on weekends!  B) Get a public restroom.  My very first desire upon leaving was to find a restroom!  C) Relocate.  Seriously, Austin needs a place this good!!!  I know at least 4 people who would ensure good business forever after...
I drove by this place several times and Decided to stop by as there is always a line of people outside.  Well was I surprised...now I understand why...great breakfast!

I had breakfast here yesterday morning - early on a weekday with one of my best friends, and had no waiting time.  It was a really nice meal and the staff was really pleasant.  The decor is a little too bright for this early morning wanderer.  I'm not a morning person - I need time to wake up & charge up for the day.  I don't suggest this place for any more than 2.  I suggest avoiding the crowds and going early so that the experience isn't tainted.

I love this place!  They have great specials every time!  This time I got the special which was 3 egg scramble with sausage, cheddar & pepper jack  cheese, and their home fries which are amazing... They grilled onion and a little bell pepper with fresh sprigs of rosemary!  My boyfriend got the pork chop with 2 sunny side eggs and home fries.  His pork chop was delicious & seasoned in loveliness!  We both got their oj... I loved it but my boyfriend added sugar to his.  Everything was amazing! Oh- they also have some of the best pancakes I've ever had... I HAD to have one pancake! Mmmmm

THE best breakfast EVER!! We have been eating here for 10 years and never have been disappointed. From the fresh squeezed OJ to the homemade jam and bread and everything in between! In fact I'm craving it now and may just head over to get my fix before they close today!!

Matt's is definitely a go to food place while traveling through sky harbor!  I travel a lot for work and I am always flying out of sky harbor airport, when I do I usually always stop by Matt's. They have a variety of stuff to choose from, everything from breakfast to burgers as well as some great sandwiches. You get a lot of bang for your buck as well, most places in the airport are super expensive and you don't get a lot of food. Matt's gives you great size portions! They are also very quick so if you are in a hurry but don't want to eat fast food, Matt's will get you in and out in a hurry.

Great food and service,  especially considering the location. Best airport food I've had.  Reuben was sloppy and delicious.  Cobb salad had a Mediterranean twist... Kalamata olives and balsamic vinaigrette. Yum!

We came here on a recommendation from a local and were really impressed. There was about a 45 minute wait to be seated and the place was hustling and bustling--but the food and service were both exceptional. The iced teas and lemonades have honey in them, which makes them tasty, but also a little surprising if you're not expecting it. I got the Hog and Chick with bacon, and it was very good. The bacon comes crisp and thick, the eggs are good, hashbrowns were dense but throughly cooked, and the sourdough bread with strawberry jam was buttery and fantastic. I also sampled a little bit of the griddle cakes, and they're light, fluffy, and slightly sweet with a cornbread flavor.   I would highly recommend Matt's Place. Well worth the wait.
What a treasure! Warm hospitality, absolutely delicious, fresh ingredients with a real homemade taste. Definitely recommend.

Breakfast was very good! We had strawberry honey lemonade, waffle and the $5.49 meal. The waffle was sweet and delicious, as was everything else. Bacon was alright, coated in pepper, maybe too much. Gave 4 stars just because of the wait. There was 2 of us and we waited about 45 minutes at around 11 am, but understandable being a very small Venue. Few, but good options on the menu. Overall great experience nice staff, cool little place.
Always great food and smiling faces!!! I know its a breakfast joint but try the butter burger!!!

Good quick eatery in the B - Gates of the airport.  They are zagat rated which was surprising, but I can tell the ingredients was quality.  Food came out a bit cold and was missing ingredients from what the menu stated.  All considered, I'd go back but not rush back.

Awesome American breakfast joint, the portions are big and the ingredients fresh. This place is small so you may need to wait but going on a weekday morning before work is not to bad  of a wait. This place is a great breakfast place but please no parties of six because you screw the rest of us who want to eat too :)

The food and coffee were excellent. I got the breakfast sandwich, which was better than my husband's pork chop. The menu was a little ho hum, but I still would go back in a heart beat. The potatoes were very tasty. Get there early, we waited about 20 minutes or so.

I grew up in AZ and did not know about this place until just recently from a friend's recommendation. This is the greatest hole in the wall breakfast I have ever had! Be prepared to wait or make sure to go grab a coffee so you are ready for the 45 minutes you have ahead of you. Also, you write your name on the list yourself outside (we were newbe's and a few skipped in front of us on the list because we were too timid to write ourselves at first until we knew it was the norm). Got the special scramble and the waffle and would recommend both again. Above all though, make sure you try the honey lemonade! It is made with local honey and has the pulp from the lemon in there to show you how real it is. Will be back soon, the service was great as well :)
Breakfast is off the hook. Crowded but short wait time. Excellent staff. I doubt there is anything on the menu that isn't as excellent as what I ate.

I don't get it. I was one of few in the place. Ordered the Benedict, which was the special, and a coffee and o.j. They couldn't even get the poached eggs right. If that's your special, get it right. Sadly the poached eggs were overdone. I didn't ask for hard boiled eggs. That doesn't bother me so much however they have the audacity to charge $5 for an o.j., or maybe it was $4.50. Whatever. Same damn thing. I can't imagine the profit margin on the juice. Paid 21 and some change for a poorly executed eggs Benedict "special", a coffee, and an orange juice. Yikes! Congrats on gettin one over on the suckers that think this is a value. This was my first visit. I don't get it and probably won't be back.

Solid breakfast. Is it so good that it warrants all the attention it gets?!? Absolutely not. But like I said before, solid breakfast. Nothing fancy, just plain old good breakfast items that are done right.

WOW! This is one of the best breakfast I've had in years, from the fresh OJ, amazing Cave Creek Coffee, special three egg scramble with bacon, locally grown peppers and fontina cheese, with a tortilla and oh the rosemary home fries... drool. My family took me here and I would recommend this to anyone who lives in or is visiting Phoenix. Tuesday morning we waited about five minutes for a table. This really is the best quality local produce in a great little diner. Next time I'm in Phoenix I will have to try the Butter Burger.

Sooooo overrated.  I've been here three times now and this last time will be my last.  I don't mind a wait if the food and experience are worth it, but when you finally get seated at a teeny table with  not enough room for the plate, coffee cup and flatware and then the menu is limited to Denny's fare and just a hair above their quality....well, just go to Denny's.  I haven't been to Denny's in ten years; it will be longer than that before I go back to Matt's Big Breakfast.  Not a fan of greasy food.

Nice location and you can park in the garage for two hours without a charge. However, Saturday morning breakfast was totally chaotic even though there weren't that many people in the restaurant. Obviously the kinks need to be worked out. Food was OK... Not what it is at other locations of Matt's. I'll give it another try in a few months.

Everything was good including the fresh squeezed oj, eggs and sausage. The griddle cakes weren't my favorite, they were just ehh. My husband had the waffle and that was delicious. It's a small place and seems to always be busy. Service was quick. Staff was friendly.

Excellent food and service. I loved that they use all natural fresh ingredients from local farms. The place is small so get there early on the weekend if you want to avoid the wait and I don't think they have a bathroom so get that sorted before going. I was very happy with the overall experience and  I would  highly recommend a visit.
Love their cheeseburger, can tell it's real meat no 90% fillers! Hotcakes, real maple syrup and best bacon ever! Do expect about 1 to 1hr1/2 wait but totally worth it!

This place has horrible customer service. I had been wanting to try this place for some time. Put my name on the list up front, checked it three times. The third time my name was scratched off. In this hour of waiting I hadn't even been acknowledged. I love small places like this and don't mind waiting, but I would rather drive to Tucson and wait for a table at Franks or BoBos than go back and try this place again. No food is good enough for an hour+ wait and to be forgotten. Again, don't bother.

I've tried all of Matt's locations and this by far has the best views, seating and overall size (less wait times). The food was the standard Matt's, which is great. The five spot with their special bacon is great. They have great rosemary potatoes. Unfortunately this visit to the Tempe location was not up to par based on the service. Hardly had the waitress come by the table. I asked for water but it never was delivered and had a funky tasting glass of ice tea that I wanted to trade out because there tea is good but this must have been mixed with something or brewed too long. Good breakfast just low on the service scale today.

First time here and was pleasantly surprised! The quick and extremely FRIENDLY service! The food was amazing! Delicious! We hope to be able to come back soon! Ordered the Hog and Chick, waffle, pancakes ! All delish!

A must for breakfast fans in the valley. You can tell by the pictures they have quality food. Can/will be busy on the weekends. The staff is friendly. I've only ate at the bar and have had the same server...... who is absolutely beautiful.

Breakfast math.  quality real ingredients + cooked  well = Great food  My wife and I stopped by to find that we were too late, the place closed 20 mins earlier.  Nuts!   As we were walking away discussing how we were going to come back another day, the door behind us opened and we were invited in!!! yahoo!!! What a treat.  That never happens!!!  Thanks Matt's you rock!

This place is just decent nothing spectacular. My family and I went just recently to the downtown location. My waitress seemed to be in a hurry asking if we're ready to order every 30 seconds. The menu sucks in my opinion not enough options to choose from. Also, from the getgo I told my waitress that I will have my drink with my food(apparently she forgot). Instead of her pouring that out she put it in a refrigerator and then brought me the same glass of Strawberry Lemonade once my food was ready. This is just not the place for me. I went to IHOP and got a better breakfast the next day. With a much cheaper bill.   P. S. Original Breakfast House is much better!!!

This place under-promised and over-delivered. It was a definite whole in the wall feeling, and I'm assuming you should be prepared to wait should you go at peak hours. We went on a Friday morning and had around a 20 minute wait. The food was so fresh and the pancakes were absolutely delicious. They really up the ante on diner fare and go fresh and local. The difference is in the taste. Even the sourdough toast was homemade. Well done...and at a great price.

Good place, real friendly... Good food and drink. Not sure how these folks hold down an airport restaurant though. 10+ min to find a waitress or bartender to order, 10+ min to find someone to pay. If you're in a hurry (as ppl at the airport generally are), consider another option.
This place has perfected the breakfast sandwich. Also, order the hash browns. Awesome breakfast after a tough hike up Camelback Mountain.
Regular old American bacon eggs potatoes breakfast. Like an updated, higher-quality Denny's. High quality ingredients, but definitely not healthy. I couldn't get excited about the menu.

I don't understand the hype about this place. Looked up best breakfast in Phx and this is the place that came up. No parking area, had to wait forever outside until I actually got seated inside. Then once I got inside I paid way too much for food that wasn't even good. Maybe I'm missing something,  but needless to say I won't be returning

Fabulous, fresh food. I was alone and was seated immediately at the counter. The waitress and other patrons were warm and friendly. The coffee mug never reached "empty." This was a good experience. It seems to be a happy place--and the food is special.

BUSY, BUSY Place & I had read LOTS of positive reviews - we waited 50 min. for a table (after being told 30-45 min wait time), crammed 5 ppl. at a table for 4 & could not even hear each other talk it was SO loud.  I was expecting a much larger Menu selection, food was fine when it did arrive but all in all this place did NOT live up to the hype whatsoever.  SO many other good choices for breakfast, we won't be back to Matt's - sorry!
Ate here once after seeing it on TV and it didn't disappoint. The breakfast was great and plenty of it. The place is small and has a fast paced diner atmosphere. Not fancy but the food is worth it.
Friendly staff. Great drinks. Delicious salsa. And most importantly the exquisite ice.

Best breakfast in Phoenix, or anywhere else I've been.  The toast is soaked with butter, it seems as though a quarter stick per slice was used.  It is tasty but probably not the most healthful, if you're in to that sort of thing.  Small small building and busy busy busy.   If you are dining with the sort of person who demands that they be treated as though they are special and likes to order around the waiters, you may want to go somewhere less crowded.

This is the best breakfast in town. All very fresh. The wait staff are wonderful. They don't seem to have a certain area that only they handle. Everyone helps everyone. But get there early, it gets crowded fast....But if you have to wait a bit...it's worth it. Honest
Friendly service and fresh food.  Both are usually hard to find at an airport. We enjoyed our breakfast very much.  They make homemade bread.

When downtown, for breakfast or lunch this is a great option (best at seating parties of 1-4). Upscale greasy spoon with a short menu that includes all of the standard options. They have a ever-changing daily special that is usually the best option to go with, if it sounds tasty to your likes. Some free parking is available in the back of the restaurant, and in the couple blocks around (mostly metered).

Visiting Phoenix and I wanted to revisit Matt's.  I was here two years ago and I had heard that they moved, 4 months ago, to a new larger space.     The new space is nice, but I somehow miss the tiny old one.  The little place was unique and atmospheric where the new place is cool, but somehow generic-cool.    Staff was nice enough, but it put me off a bit when they wanted $1.50 for more maple syrup.   I said OK because the pancakes were SUPER DRY.   Not good at all.   And the maple syrup is totally sub par.  Tastes like Aunt Jemima.  It's stored in big plastic jugs in the dining room.     Friend's omelette was overcooked and greasy.   Potatoes were just average.   Thick cut marble rye toast was good, but then he loves anything rye.  Come on Matt, you can do better.   Spend more time training your kitchen staff.  And does your wife always wear UGGs, no matter the weather?

When we first arrived, there was a long line. Fortunately, the staff is friendly and efficient, so the line went fairly quickly. Service was great, the food (griddle cakes for me, pork chop for my guy) was good and arrived soon after we ordered. The only suggestion I would make is that you don't sit at the counters. The metal stools were so slippery that we had to brace ourselves against the counter to keep from slipping off. Otherwise, I recommend the place.

My boyfriend and I were passing through Phoenix on a road trip and I heard about all the good reviews about Matt's so we decided to try it. The wait to be seated was about 40 minutes but it was definitely worth it! They're wheat bread and strawberry preserves were incredible along with everything else on our plate. Too bad we don't live closer otherwise I would be here all the time!

100% bomb! Everything they make oozes amazing, homemade, quality goodness. The pancakes are heaven, the hog and chick is fab, and the rosemary breakfast potatoes are perfect. I have been a handful of times, and it's always worth the wait.  Note: This place is ridiculously small (but charming), so don't go with a bunch of friends and expect to sit together...or be seated anytime soon. Carry out is a good option, but only for those who have had the sit in experience first ;)
One of my favorite breakfast places in town. I always tell out-of-town guests to eat breakfast at Matt's for a wonderful lasting memory on your tastebud and mind!!

Love the food there and the portions are big.  Service fast and the servers very friendly. My only negative comment is that the stools at the counter area area a stainless steel and very slippery.  I felt that the whole time I was there I was fighting to stay on the stool.  Maybe they should put some non slip strips on them LOL. Or invest in a different style of stool for the counter areas

I wanted to really love this place because of the reviews, but the food was definitely not worth the wait. Sorry, but not sorry. I was excited for the "homemade" pancakes but they were so dry and didn't taste like pancakes should. We also ordered an omelette that was super cold and the cheap sliced cheese wasn't melted. Maybe because it was fake. I give two stars for the good fresh squeezed lemonade, but I won't be back!

Food was above average I will give them that. Seating is jam packed and a little uncomfortable. I definitely wasn't impressed with the location considering the hype it has. I've been to the one on camelback and enjoyed a much better experience. Wasn't too happy that I couldn't sit at a 4 person table on a Tuesday at noon when there were plenty of spots available. Need my space

Took our large family to this place at noon on a Sunday, they accommodated us rather quickly for how busy they were with an 8 top booth right next to the host station.  Nice surprise.  Ok the negatives, I've never understood the restaurants with limited beverage menus but this place takes it to a new level.  RC. cola.  Nothing. Else. This might work for the millennials crowd searching for some tough love therapy but how about a coupe of more choices? I get the fresh squeezed OJ and honey lemonade as high margin items for Matts kid's college funds but maybe a clear soda and a diet soda of some kind for the young ones.  The food. Breakfast is the meal I love to take family out to so we do a lot of breakfast places.  This is seriously the best breakfast food I have had in the last year.  Waffle was simple with powdered sugar sprinkled but had this sweet flavor that no doubt came from some kind of ingredient in the recipe.  Incredible.  The cheese omelet with $1 add ingredient  of mushrooms. Wow, simple but another winner.  Older Kids had menu standards of "hog & chic" and they raved about it.  I took a bite of the hash browns, not really a hash brown kind of guy but they were unbelievably unique- not crunchy, not greasy, just about right.  The negatives.  Service was pretty sparse. Could be they were overloaded.  They were pleasant and all just not around enough. Sat for long periods with an empty coffee cup trying to make eye contact with someone....bright spot was Lupe.  Attentive to tables that were not even his (ours included) seemed to be looking at the whole place ready to help.  Great part of the crew that lifted the sub par rating of the staff to a passing grade. Funny side note was the manager?host? seating everyone.  Guy was metrosexual hipster caliber right down to the intentional single side front shirt tuck.  I kind of got a kick out of the soup nazi meets Nev Schulman  attitude but the older kids were annoyed....

Still good as ever.  They have Moved one block up so there isn't a ridiculous waiting time anymore.  I usually go by myself so always sit at the bar/counter area.  Staff is super friendly and my usual:  Waffles with bacon, OJ, and black coffee.  I always end up going there after I land at the airport.  Love this place!
I really thought this place was going to be super good. The menu was limited and the food was good but not as great as everyone makes it out to be. I will not be back.

What a fantastic place for breakfast. Prompt service, great coffee and good food.   I ordered the Five Spot and my other three family members ordered Thursday's special- Eggs Benedict. Everybody at the table was happy with their food, the waiter was courteous and we had our breakfasts on the table in very short time. We will definitely be coming back.
One of the best breakfast places I've visited.  Everything we had was fresh and tasty.  Service was great.  A bit hipster, but well balanced by smiles and quality eats.

My bacon came from the pig in back, the rosemary in the breakfast potatoes came fresh from a garden in back right next to the chicken coop that layed the eggs that went into the waffle mix.....at least in my mind, because that's how fresh all of the ingredients tasted.
The food is awesome. The service is too notch and the prices are reasonable. If you are looking for a breakfast spot, this is it!

The fam and I were hitting some DDD spots last week in Phoenix while we were out there from LA, and we had to hit Matts.  I've actually thought a lot about this place since, and I have to say I dig it.  It has a serious funky factor - it's tiny, loud and the servers are friendly and outgoing.  As for the food, the pancakes were rock star - absolutely delicious.  If I was on death row getting my last meal, those cakes would send me to the great beyond in peace.  Other foods were good, and I don't get the deal with everyone saying the coffee is crappy - it's better than chain restaurants, so I don't know what the problem is.  There is one thing that's keeping me from giving it 5 start.  While we were there, about 5 minutes after we ordered, the power went out on the whole block.  To their credit, they finished our order, but the place heated up and filled with smoke from the grill (the fans weren't working), and by the end of the meal we couldn't see the back of the restaurant from the smoke.  That's fine and all, but someone called Matt and he came down and was stomping back and forth through the restaurant - walking around outside, back in, back outside.  The place was full, and it would have been appropriate for him, as the proprietor to talk to the customers, let us know what's going on - he didn't do anything, and we were all just staring at each other and him.  It was a weird scene - he could have set everyone at ease, and at least poured everyone some free iced tea, but there was nada.  Power failures aside, the place is the bomb, and just what a breakfast place should be.

One of the best breakfasts I've ever had! Get the Hog and Chick and the chocolate milk. The thick cut bacon is awesome... My only negative is the wait is about 20 minutes at 9:00 and gets longer as the morning goes.

I've been hearing good things about this place for so long, it was ridiculous I hadn't yet been. I'm all about supporting local business & breakfast is my favorite meal, so this past Saturday I decided to check it off my foodie bucket list. I met 2 friends at 10am. One of them had gotten there at 945 and put our name on the list for a table of 3. Almost 1 hour later, we were seated at a 2 top with an additional chair pulled up. To start, a hipster waitress wearing a huge gold watch and too many bracelets asked what we wanted to order after we had been seated for no more than 2 minutes. Menu-  I've been craving French toast all morning. Come to find they don't have French toast. "French toast is seasonal". Really? Waitress is back again asking what we want after an additional 2 minutes. I ordered a waffle that came with 2 pieces of bacon for $7.50. Waffle was good, served with real cream butter. They do have real maple syrup which is a plus. The bacon was thick, but peppered on the sides which I don't like. Maybe I'm greedy but I also think they should have given 3 slices for a $7.50 plate. I also ordered a cup of coffee (which admittedly I am a coffee snob). Ick.  Burned and watered down at the same time. Needing the extra caffeine, I got my coffee refilled once the cup had been empty for almost 15 mins. I actually asked a server passing by twice if they could refill it.  They never did bring the creamer I asked for (also twice) so I couldn't even drink the 2nd cup. All in all, we waited entirely too long for a crowded place whose food was nothing to write home about. Our bill was almost $50 including tip for 3 people. I recommend you skip this hipster spot that has been hyped up entirely too much. Simply doesn't meet up to expectations IMO. If I'm craving a hipster breakfast and am prepared to shell out $50 for 3 people, I will swing by Postino's for brunch on Saturday/Sunday and get a meal with fresher ingredients and much better coffee and service. Likely a shorter wait, too.

This is a kind of place I picture of when I see that Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives show on tv. That obviously not being an insult. This place is a must try. Little loud but the food and prompt service made up for it.
Absolutely delicious breakfast!! Waited a little more then an hour but the bike/coffee shop down the road is the best time kill.

Loud, crowded, overpriced, mediocre.   Poached eggs came with the whites uncooked and gooey - Twice! Pork chop which was recommended by server was dry and bland.  They are not friendly for allergies or food intolerances. I ordered almond milk and they brought regular milk. They did not offer a substitution for toast.   I gave two stars instead of one because someone (manager?) did come to the table and tried to assist, but there's only so much you can do when every food item received was unacceptable.  Not worth the price or the wait. Very disappointed.
I've been a regular here the past 3 years. Other than the wait being long, the five spot sandwhich and waffle make this place one of my favorite in the nation.

Went in today for lunch, and ordered the AM special. The special was originally a 3 egg scramble with provolone cheese, ham, and fresh locally grown organic spinach. I subbed out the ham for their amazing bacon, and this was definitely a treat! I got this with white toast and their delicious home fries (they're the best I have ever had).   It's too bad Matt's doesn't open more locations around the valley. I really wish they had one closer to Scottsdale/ Tempe. I would be there 4 times a week!
Loved it the pork chops were Amazing and the jam and bread was the best honestly long wait.. But definitely worth the wait!

Best Breakfast Place I've ever been to hands down.  The bacon is heavenly, and the pork chop is amazing.  I usually just go for the special of the day when it is a scramble, can never go wrong with that.  One thing though is that they recently made their hash browns thin cut.  I miss their thick cut hash browns, they were the BEST.  Please go back to your thick hash browns Matt's!

The wait can be a bit extreme at time but if you bring a friend to talk to it helps the time pass.  However, I wouldn't recommend waiting out there in the heat if it's 100+ outside that's for sure.  As for the food, the pesto pork chops and rosemary potatoes will satisfy any man's appetite.  In general, the handful of times I have been there never disappointing but I also have never been blown out of the water either.  I will still keep going back though.

Like many others saw this place on triple D.  Have eaten here a couple of times since and have enjoyed it every time.  Go out on a limb and order some of the odd combos they have as speacials and you won't be sorry.  A lot of people complain about the wait however there is one sure fire cure for it.....get up a little early and be there prior to 8am and the wait will be very short.  A group of 8 of us arrived at 745 and were in at 8am.  Highly recommended!

Big Portions.  Come hungry.  Leave satisfied and fat.  Food quality is top notch and you MUST try the bacon.  Peppery, thick cut, and just as good as bacon gets. I had the special (which was eggs benedict). Sauce is a little on the sweet side but really very good.  No shortcomings here.  Great place for high-energy, busy breakfasting to get your a$$ going!
Just walk by...food was cold, although our server was very nice she forgot to bring toast and hostess was rude. Giving the place 1 star is a stretch

OMG, you must be kidding and this place is in business?? so i have heard of Big Matts and wanted to try it. This afternoon i went their for the first time and what a JOKE. first of all i arrived at 12:15 PM and the front door was locked. I asked couple of men that were standing outside how to you get in this place and they told me from the front door, which i was standing in front of. So i knocked on the door and the server opened the door. My first thought is to the owner, dont be cheap and just go ahead and get a real lock for the front door. Then I asked servers where the bathroom was? she told me they dont have one, however they share one with the hotel next door. (this is not a Hilton by the way). I asked i just want to wash my hands. She told me they had hand sanitizer up front. so i used it . I understand the place is small, however, there is health requirement and I am not sure how they pass this. I believe the employees would wash their hands more then once a day. CAUTION!!!! HEALTH.   Food. the server was nice and took my order. I asked for their best item on the menu and she highly recommended the daily special. Okay that is what i will get. I got two scrambled eggs, fresh motezzerla, sausage (disgusting) and sweet peppers, this was served with home potato's and toast. how bad can the eggs be, the sausage was uneatable, the potato's were full of Rosemary, and ONE slice of toast for $ 8.95. I have been to numerous breakfast restaurant  and never remember being served ONE slice of toast. Please dont be cheap for $ 8.95 you can serve two slice of toast.  I am not sure what the hype is about this place, i will never go there. if you want breakfast go somewhere else like "the breakfast club".
Great food, quick service, good atmosphere! The hash browns and omelette were delicious.
Great food! The Hog & Chick is perfect! Eggs cooked properly which is a challenge for most places.  Average service.   Glad to see Matt's expanding.

The service  was good however  the food  was very greasy.  The ham was very salty and the rosemary  potatoes  was full of oil. Not allot to chose from the menu. Had a waffle  for dessert  and was really  good.
Just had breakfast prior to my flight. This location not as good as original in downtown Phoenix. Matt needs to oversee more.

Have heard so much about Matt's but never tried it before, so waking up early on Sunday, I decided to head over and check it out. Got there around 7:30 this morning, and it wasn't very busy yet-plenty of open tables and counter space. I picked out a table and noticed the Sunday Special of steak and eggs. Decision made. It did take my waitress a couple of minutes to come over, but no biggie (for now). On her first approach, I ordered iced tea, and the steak and eggs (rare and over easy eggs) plus sour dough toast. The food came up very  quickly...Unfortunately, it was the last interaction I had with my server until I was finished. The food was very good. The home fries were delicious, tender chunks of potatoes, sauteed with onions, salt and pepper and rosemary.(A little heavy on the rosemary for my tastes, but that is just me) the eggs were a perfect over easy. The steak was a flavorful centercut sirloin, cooked to a perfect rare as requested. I always worry a little about sirloin being a tougher cut, but it was tender for sirloin. The toast was a slice of thick cut sourdough, definitely NOT straight out of the grocery store. On the side of the toast was a ramekin of some sort of homemade preserves. I couldn't quite figure out what it was, though.  Food gets a definite "A".   Service on the other hand, left me wanting more.. As I was waiting for my food, (and while eating), I noticed that the waitresses all kept huddling up and talking, instead of working. I never got a "check back" to make sure everything was ok. Especially when ordering a steak, it should be done quickly to make sure the steak was cooked correctly. I never was offered a topping off or a refill on my iced tea. Even when I was finished with my meak and my glass was empty, the waitress finally came over and offered clear my plate, she still did not offer a refill..  I would come back for the food, the another poor service experience would make me reconsider a third visit.
We didn't end up eating here because there was a weird vibe in there. The waitresses were staring at us and one waffle with nothing else is $9.

ate there this am. Waited 45 min. This is part of the culture of this place so be prepared to wait. The food was great. We had the special, extra bacon and lemonaide. this bill was 30 bucks including tip. I am a fan. If you are not a fan of the AZ heat, you may want to wait until fall to chow down. It's hot outside and hot inside. It's a tiny place with great food! The bacon is yummy and the toast is THICK sliced with homemade jam.( Didn't have coffee cuz we got it across the way while we waited for our time to eat.)
Great place! Local fresh food, fast service, always delicious! Great location and views as well!
Good if you like your food cold and over-cooked.

First off I LOVE this place! I have never been disappointed with the food or service. If you love breakfast food this is your place. You have to try the Salami Scramble with home fries (which are the best damn potatoes this side of Idaho).  Also, if you're lucky the special of the day might be the eggs benedict that are making me hungry just thinking about them.  If you get there around 11:00 am be prepared to wait but they will seat you pretty fast. The customer service is great and the prices are cheap! Don't come here if you want a healthy breakfast because it won't be but it will be some of the best breakfast food you will ever have!
Great Service from the moment you walk in! Food tasted good and good presentation! Martha was great!!!

I'm sorry to rain on people's parades in Phoenix, but this place is average. Is it good for breakfast? Absolutely. Is it worth the hour-plus wait people go through every weekend? No way.  The couple of times I've been there, service has been okay. Friendly servers, but slow with refills on drinks. Also feels rushed - who can blame them with lines out the door? Atmosphere is loud and a little cramped, but not terribly uncomfortable.  The food is good. I would go back, don't get me wrong. But is it anything special? Not really. I've had pancakes there as well as eggs with bacon, and it's pretty standard.

The menu is extremely limited and the service here was HORRIBLE! The workers weren't too friendly, except for two of the guys that worked there. The portions were decent sizes but the food definitely wasn't worth the price. At the end we split the bill and when we told the girl that she had split the bill wrong she started to argue with us so we just decided to pay the incorrect total and leave. We are definitely NEVER going back there.

I would totally give this place a 5 star rating if it wasn't for the long wait. The food was delish!! My kids had the waffle which is huge and the real maple honey is to die for. The staff is very attentive and friendly. If you have time to kill due to the wait and want some yummy breakfast, then this place is it!
Flippin' AMAZING! Portions as big as your head. Bring you appetite and check your diet at the door. There was a short wait, but totally worth it.

After hearing rave reviews, we finally went to try for first time.  Between the long wait time just to be seated, poor service, the constant waiting and having to ask for refills.  We even went to the front and asked for our check rather than continuing to wait for it.  The food was good no doubt about it, but with as much hypster hype as there has been about Matt's Big Breakfast, we expected better.  Probably wont be back....

Matts Big breakfast is great.  We go there frequently.  Yes it is small but isnt that part of the deal that makes Matts place special?  I think so.  They really do a great job of using every inch of the place to feed hungry patrons.  Almost always the service is quick, and typically the staff is helpful.  There has been the occasional bump in the road but we go there often and everyone can have an off day.....I will be back!   If you want a great breakfast Eat at Matts!!!!!

Greets spot for breakfast. We waited an hour for a table on a Monday morning which I assumed would be dead. Once seated we were helped right away. The menu was small but a thoughtful selection of breakfast and lunch options. I had the salami and scramble with home fries. Delicious. The salami was a perfect salty meat for the eggs. The home fries were perfectly seasoned and the Orange juice was amazing. Who knew OJ could be that good. I thought this was a great breakfast and well worth the wait. I'll be back

I had their belgian waffle, which came with bacon and advertised real cream butter and real maple syrup. Also got orange juice and my girlfriend got a salami-egg scramble thing.  The lady's salami-egg scramble was great (and a new taste!) but my waffle was THE BEST WAFFLE I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE. I sipped my tiny $2.50 (I think) orange juice and FELL OFF MY CHAIR, AMAZED BY THE DELICIOUSLY SWEET FRESH SQUEEZED OJ.  After being revived by my frantic girlfriend, I quickly JUMPED UP AND HUGGED EVERY EMPLOYEE IN THE BUILDING.  True story.  We went at 1:30 PM on a Sunday and sat right down-- your mileage may vary as this place is apparently legendary and I hear can attract quite a crowd when busy. There's like 10 small tables in the whole place plus a bar, and virtually no parking, and no shade, so don't expect to be catered to (outside of delicious food.)  Also, Matt has inspired a new invention: fresh squeezed orange juice shots. Seriously, I'd buy a few if they existed.

They have Mr. Pibb. That's fun. I first read about Matt's in an America West in-flight magazine and put it on my list of places to go.  You know the wait was about 20 minutes, the staff was quick and the food was good. I would say the biggest appeal about Matt's is that it seems like the food is reliable, you go there for breakfast and guess what you get it straight up.  What I most appreciate, is that Matt saw potential in an old downtown building and is doing his part to bring business to that part of town.

One of the best morning meals I've ever had. The griddle cakes and chicken apple sausage were so, so, SO good. The atmosphere is real laid back and the service is excellent here. Next time I come to Phoenix I will most definitely be eating here.

Can never go wrong with a nice fluffy waffle! The waffle comes with thick cut bacon that's delicious but a bit too peppery for my taste so I sub sausage (doesn't cost extra).Yummy light maple syrup. My boyfriend is literally obsessed with their pancakes and could probably eat them everyday! Definitely plan on ordering the french toast special on Wednesday!

Had friends in from out of town and had heard how great this place was so why not.  Visited on a Saturday morning (8:30am).  Very busy, long wait and parking is a challenge. P.S. feed the meters. I didn't get busted but lots of others received parking tickets on the street.   We had a variety of meals (breakfast sandwich, cheese omelet, hog and chick and a special of the day) and waters around (for four people).  The meals were good, wouldn't say great.  The ambiance was less than desirable.  It's very loud, very cramped, not very comfortable and rush, rush, rush.  It felt as if they couldn't get your order quick enough and get you out the door even quicker.  We had plans so the speed was ok.  What I later found annoying was that I had been grossly overcharged.  This is partially my fault, as I should have checked the check, but the rushed atmosphere along with my trusting nature, (I just gave her the credit card to settle up, without looking at the check) got me in the end.  Looking at the check later, I realized we received another tables check as there were six meals and drinks on the ticket and we had only four people in our group.  In the end, I was overcharged about $20, not including the 25% tip I left on the overinflated bill.  My fault, just a warning to beware due to the extreme haste at this place.

It's in a great location; I have to give it that. However, the food is not worth the long wait! My friend and I waited 45 minutes to get seated. We knew what we wanted right away and ordered the steak Sunday special (medium rare), the five spot, waffle plate, and one pancake on the side. They brought out my steak well done and although more than willing to cook me a new one, the new steak was still subpar and quite pricey at $15! The waffle was soft and kinda deflated. The five spot was pretty good, but our pancake on the side never came out. The overall experience was meh, but the long wait on top of the subpar service gives this place an overall 2/5 score. Pass!

I rarely agree with the culinary opinions of Guy Fieri, Human Cheese Fry, but I guess even a stopped clock is right twice a day.    For about a year, I was at Matt's once a week when work would take me from North Phoenix to Tempe.  Service was nice, food was good, prices were silly, chairs were cramped, pretty much what you'd expect.  But after a while, I realized I was paying around $8 for eggs, bacon, toast and hash browns.  Sure, it was good, but it was a little much.  Still, I stop by Matt's every once in a while to enjoy the food and atmosphere.  It's a great place to take your vacationing relatives, foodie friends, or other people who you wouldn't mind being crammed into a small space with.  HOWEVER: If you stop by after around 7 AM on most weekdays, or at all on a weekend, be prepared to wait.  The weekend lines are ridiculous; you can hear people proudly proclaim how they woke up at 2:00 AM to drive down from Flagstaff to get the food.  Plan accordingly.

What can I say about Matt's?!  I feel very lucky that a friend stumbled upon this place and shared it with me in the early years.  Well worth the wait and one of the best not so hidden gems in town.  There is only one thing keeping me from 5 stars.  Tabasco... really?  In my humble opinion, a breakfast restaurant with no Cholula or Tapatio is missing the essentials.  Tabasco is bush league and Matt ... that is one thing you are not.  Your wife is hispanic, right??  C'mon brother - ditch the tabasco and get the real stuff.  Even your cooks keep a stash of the good stuff.

I reached out to management via their website to point out a problem I had at PHX airport B terminal location. They seemed concerned and interested in my input. Then I got a message telling me to call them 5 days later. It makes sence they would contact me and ask for a good tome to call ME. I'm a customer trying to voice a legitimate concern. I told them i would still try it again and report back to them. I never heard back. I dont think they realize frequent flyers like me try to find good reliable places to eat and become regulars. I even offered to come back again! And let them know how it went. But by not bothering to contact me again shows they dont care. They must figure most people will come in only once. No interest in cultivating a reliable consistent customer base means they will miss out on alot of revenue. Most people do NOT bother to write reviews. They just dont go back. BTW the reason i contacted them was that my big beautiful salad had all white chopped up romaine lettuce. They use very low grade romaine. And then try to hide it by chopping up the white lower part of romaine heads. I assumed they got the white super finely chopped by mistake from thier produce purveyor. And simply wanted to point it out. But their decision to not follow up tells me the very low quality romaine is the norm. This restraunt is designed for tourists I'm guessing. One time only customers. To bad they dont care. I could have been a regular customer as i fly through PHX 4 times a month. Keep it up and you will close in 18-24 mo.

We decided to go to the Phoenix location for Father's day breakfast. Hubby saw them featured on Triple D.  While yes the wait was long (almost an hour) we felt the food was well worth it.Hubby and I don't like blueberries and I am not a real big fan of eggs, but their blueberry jam is so amazing I wanted to buy some to take home (which you totally can!). They even cooked my eggs the way I wanted (done very well) without me having to send it back to cook longer. The food was so much and so good that we couldn't finish, but we wanted to so badly. Will definitely come here again and wait.

I have been to Matt,s mean time and had good food but this time was not good in matter-of-fact it was of-full . The potatoes where undercook. The sausage was sliced but dried out and chewy. I just paid and left. I will go back someday.
Overpriced. Bland. If this is what Phoenicians rave about, no wonder they're so unhappy...

Been here twice - best breakfast in town. You will have to wait - but the staff set the right expectations, so you know exactly how long you're waiting. Once you sit down - they are fast, efficient and again . . the food is outstanding.  Good job Matt's. Keep it up!
This place is amazing. We sat at the bar so we could see the food go out. It all looked and WAS great. Fresh squeezed juice, homemade preserves, strawberry honey lemonade.

One of the best "diner style" breakfasts I've ever had. I ordered the "chop and chick," a rosemary slathered pork chop with 2 eggs. The chop was (at my request) cooked with a perfect pink center and the "over easy" request on eggs was executed perfectly. Great, friendly service, too!
Delecious! Big servings and helpful staff. Their menu is a bit small, and the lines often require a 60min wait, so come early! We only waited 5 min. Not sure I would have waited 60!

Yeah, Matt's definitely deserves 5-stars.   Did I have to wait longer than normal for a Wednesday morning before 8 AM? Yep. But I knew ahead of time that Matt's has some hefty wait-times. (As long as I know ahead of time that I'll need to wait, I never have a problem with it.)  The service, once we were seated inside, was awesome. The waiter came over and saw that we were ready to order and didn't dally at all. He took our order and drinks at the same time. Within 10 minutes, our food was in front of us. I think that is impressive - for a place with such a long wait time, once you're inside, they get you eating as soon as possible.  I had the salami scramble. I loved the huge strips of salami. The eggs were cooked perfectly - not too runny, but definitely not too cooked and dry. My friends had the chicken sausage with artichokes scramble (it was a special). They were both as happy as I was.   Matt's is worth it. Go, have a great time with your friends, and eat a great breakfast.
Loved the food especially the hash browns! I do wish they had offers for soda as a drink option.

I like the bright, small-diner atmosphere and the use of cage-free eggs, organic produce and grain-fed natural Iowa pork and Angus beef.  I found the rationale stated on the backs of the menus and on the website, "We believe that food prepared this way not only tastes better but is better for you" quite ironic considering the amount of butter and olive oil their food is fried in.  My stomach couldn't take it.  I guess if I go back for breakfast, I can always get the Frosted Flakes for $4.

School teacher with a summer vacay mission: eat breakfast at every joint in town that you can't normally go to without waiting in a weekend line!    Matt's was at the top of the list!  Five stars for the buttery delicious waffle - a little crisp on the outside, a soft and tender inside and the BEST bacon in town. 2 stars for the chop and chick, eggs and skinny over-cooked pork chop with the wimpy soft breakfast potatoes. I'll round up to 4 for the ROCC bottomless coffee and the nice counter waitress. (BTW, do all restaurants just top off the creamer containers from other tables and give them to someone else? Maybe that's standard but it kind of freaked me out.  Maybe it's better for me to just not know!)
Amazing service and great portion and food. Thanks yelp! This place has many great ratings for a reason! Hmmmm bacon!

We had to wait about 35 minutes,  but once we sat down service was very quick! I got the special scramble and my husband got the waffle. Both were very tasty!! Coffee was good. The toast and preserves with some bacon are a must. It was worth the wait!

took car for repairs this early this morning and had time before taking friend to work so he said, "Where are we going for breakfast?"  I said, "I don't know, where are you taking me?"  Realized we were in area of Matt's Big Breakfast, looked it up on Yelp for address and decided to try it.  Special today was Eggs Benedict with choice of hash browns or home fries.  I normally don't like poached eggs but thought I'd give it a try.  Glad I did.  The hollandaise sauce was delicious, the canadian bacon was very flavorful, nice sized english muffin and I choose hash browns which were soft and moist but a little too dark.  friend got the 3 egg salami sopprosata omelete (sure spelled wrong) with hash browns and oj.  the homemade, organic strawberry preserves they serves with his toast was amazing.  not too tart, not too sweet, just wonderful.    will go back again, however, probably not during the snowbird season.  we were able to get right in this morning and we did hear some regulars talk about how it was nice to see so many people in there today, considering it's now off season for visitors.  apparently, as others have indicated, there can be very long waits to get in.
I had the scrambled eggs special with ham and sweet peppers and home potatoes. The herb smell and flavor notes were very lively.

Stumbled across this place on Yelp. We order the Omelet with the Wisconsin cheddar cheese with hash browns/home fries and sourdough toast. I have to say it's some of the best brunch food I've ever had. The omelets were perfectly cooked and loaded with cheese/ham. The hashbrowns were perfect and the toast was to die for! To top it off the service was prompt and friendly. We will come back if we are ever in the area again!
One of the must in Phoenix. Really nice breakfast before heading off to work/visiting.

After seeing all of the reviews when we first moved out here, we decided to give it a shot one morning while exploring Phoenix. We really weren't all that impressed. The food was "ok," the service was "ok," the dining area left something to be desired, for sure, and was incredibly noisy. I guess if we're around the area and literally can't find anything else, we may stop by again... But it was just "ok." We don't understand the hype.

After seeing all of the reviews when we first moved out here, we decided to give it a shot one morning while exploring Phoenix. We really weren't all that impressed. The food was "ok," the service was "ok," the dining area left something to be desired, for sure, and was incredibly noisy. I guess if we're around the area and literally can't find anything else, we may stop by again... But it was just "ok." We don't understand the hype.
First time here, service was excellent the portions where big and the rosemary potatoes where awesome
My favorite breakfast place for breakfast. Try the hog and chick . Daily specials are sure to please

Just as everyone says, the food is awesome! BUT...if it's served with an attitude, damn it drags the experience down. I was totally disappointed in the place. Maybe a too go order would be good for you? Food is still good enough to fetch four stars.

Matt's Big Breakfast has fresh squeezed juices and big portions. My cheese omelette was chock full of lots of cheese and the thick cut toast was so satisfyingly good. Had a side of savory ham, so delish! Love this cute breakfast place.
Great little breakfast spot. Reasonable prices for a great meal. Biscuits and gravy were delicious.

Went for the first time yesterday. It's not a huge place but we got seated immediately. The staff were all very polite, friendly and attentive. I got breakfast potatoes, ham steak and eggs. Usually I would comment on the meat, but the potatoes were brilliant! It was all served in a timely manner and prices weren't ridiculous. My meal was about 9. Which is standard these days I think.   Definitely recommend!

My friends and I found this restaurant via Siri and Yelp. The reviews were so great that we had to go! We went on a Sunday around 11...bad move! Our wait was about an hour. While the food was very tasty,  I'm not sure that it was worth the wait time.  Our service was average; we kept having to ask for small things like spoons. One of my friends had the special,  chicken artichoke sausage and eggs which were delish! Another friend had pancakes and apple wood sausage; pancakes were good but sausage was burnt. Got a free replacement but it arrived lukewarm!  And there was a moderate cost for extra syrup. I had the hogs and chick breakfast which was great.  Nice place but next time we will plan a better time to come.

The location was cool and trendy I loved the decor. Our waitress was very friendly and professional but the other one was showing too much cleavage for a breakfast cafe setting.  My pancakes were dry and not very tasty although the portion size was huge. They were also crumbly sort of like cornbread which I don't really find to be appealing for pancakes.. They had a very organic "made from scratch" taste but not as good as what my mom could make from scratch and she's not a good cook. The jam was very delicious. The lemonade was heavenly. It was very noisy. My husband ordered the porkchop with hashbrown and eggs. He decided his favorite thing was the jam. He normally doesn't like sweets and is a huge meatlover. The porkchop wasn't very flavorful husband thought it was dry too. Both of our menu items could have tasted better. They were quick service was great. I was expecting more of the food. The quality in the ingredients was there I'm assuming organic maybe local? But our breakfast just wasn't that flavorful. Maybe it was what we ordered? After trying our food we both regretted our choices and left disappointed.

As the 5 stars show "Woohoo! As good as it gets!" Ok, it is only breakfast but  great, consistent fair. Tiny little place so you will have to wait but they keep the folks rolling in and out. Been there twice and have sat at the counter both times. The Hog & Chick with bacon, thick bacon...awesome!  Eggs the way you want. Get the hash browns as they are better than you can make at home, but if you like your potatoes chunky then get the home fries but a warning for people who aren't into rosemary, home fries have rosemary on them. Fresh sliced toast and homemade jam, I think it was plum. My wife had the omelet and loved it.

I travel a lot....thrilled with new restaurant options. Matts is first disappointment.   20+ min for a less than mediocre Reuben.  Olive & Ivy much better and worth the hike to A gates.....and most likely faster!

Been here a few times each time better than the last no the best for little one big still greatest pancakes and if you can get the cherry sausage do it in it a big meat consumer but omg this black heresy sausage was to die for and don't get me started on the coffee !!!!! Love this place only four stars cause the long wait .. But well worth it

Great quality breakfast food with awesome drink selection. Friendly staff, wide menu selection and fast service. I almost forgot I was in a airport, one of the best restaurants in sky harbor. Full size bar, to-go ordering and open late with breakfast served all day! I have hard time seeing how anyone wouldn't like this place! It is a little pricey but not bad at all for being in a airport. This place is now a regular stop for me when I'm flying out of sky harbor!

Matt's new location is bigger, but they have preserved the ambiance that makes Matt's a breakfast destination.  It doesn't matter how big they make the diner; there will always be a line to get in there!  The simple secret is the fresh, real ingredients they use, locally-sourced whenever possible.  When you're a regular, they know your name and your order.  Big plus, in my book, is the new digs have a bike rack.  LOVE Matt's Big Breakfast!  It truly is as good as it gets.

So we waited for a table for an hour. in the winter. and it was windy. my hair was flying, my fingers were freezing and I was getting increasingly annoyed. why cant they expand their space just a little bit? The waitress kept running outside to check people off their list, and started handing out menus so that we could order. It took the joy of of looking at the menu and deciding what to eat. I was looking forward to a nice leisurely brunch after which we planned to go to the museum.  We would have left, except that this was downtown Phoenix and dint want to lose our parking spot.   Finally, after a little more than an hour, we were seated. the place is TINY. Tables are close together and just as luck would have it, we got a table right next to the door, where every time she opened it, i was greeted with nice gush of COLD air. And people waiting outside could see us sit in the warmth and eat.  That being said, the food was excellent. I can't seem to remember names of our dishes, but the eggs were very good, with potatoes, toasted sourdough bread, orange juice and coffee.  But was the wait really worth it? I don't know! I don't think I'd want to wait for so long for a table. I'd recommend this place to friends for sure though. I think I just contradicted myself! don't get me wrong - excellent food. just that the waiting pissed me off. a lot.
Ribeye Steak and Eggs... Best Breakfast in 15 years of traveling.  Be prepared for a bit of a wait.  Great service!

Horrible. Really only wanted a bite and cocktail waiting on delayed flight. How hard is NO Butter on toast? Sent it back 3x and it was never returned correctly. This was a side no less. One scrambled egg and dry rye fiasco. If that wasn't enough, she swooped my drink away with 2 sips left.

THERE IS NO BETTER BREAKFAST IN THE CITY! You will most likely wait a few minutes for a table but it is time well spent.  I give Matt's Big Breakfast 5 solid stars for friendly and efficient service,  the finest ingredients and a fun atmosphere.

Visiting Phoenix I went to Matts for breakfast!!! Everything was delicious! The waffle, honey lemomade, breakfast and surprisingly the sourdough bread with the homemade blueberry jam was AMAZING! Make sure you order sourdough and blueberry jam!

This review is for their location in the Phoenix SkyHarbor Airport, which my friends tell me is every bit as good as the main one.  I love Matt's Big Breakfast. Great food - some may say comfort food - but done in a way to make it even more enjoyable and healthy at the same time. I've never had anything bad here. The only problem is that it is so popular - even in the airport - that you need to make sure you have the time to wait if it is busy!
Best breakfast spot in Phoenix! The scrambles are off the charts, as are their home fries. Yum!

Went in with my Son 5 and My daughter who is 18 months. We got seated in 2 top table with the high hair between the 4 top next to us, very tight squeeze. Especially alone ugh two children and other patrons next to is it just didn't seem logical and I would have gladly waited for a better spot than we were in. What really gets me is that they don't have a kids menu at this location??? Really... for being in such a location that has families surrounding it and to not have a option for kiddos is just outrageous. On the family note again, the food can take sometime and they don't supply any crayons for kids as well. End of the review for me is this place seems more of a place suited for peeps minus children and family kinda joint. Kinda a bummer because my kiddo loved your pancakes and syrup!!! And doesn't like any other places.

This restaurant is hard to describe.  The restaurant itself and the menu are really simple, breakfast staples, but they are done so well that they taste better! All ingredients are local and organic.   I always try to do the "special", which is usually a type of scramble.  Always delicious!  There are only about 7 tables in the whole place, so I left off a star for the wait you will see on the weekends.  However, it is 100% worth the wait!

Matt's Butter Burger is THE dish to have here! Matt starts his lunch menu @ 11am. The breakfast here is good don't get me wrong just skip breakfast & go 4 the butter burger. Also make sure u don't park on the empty dirt parking lots in front of & behind Matt's or you'll get a $120.00 ticket! Park on the paved streets/lots only & keep in mind parking is limited.
I could tell the beef was good quality but they could've still added just a little salt and pepper.

Food was great! Had a wonderful breakfast. Highly recommend!!!  Organic and local food. Bacon was so thick and well cooked. The whole grain bread was great, with a homemade jelly. I am a picky eater, but this food was quality!!

I ordered the Hog and Chick breakfast. I order the eggs basted with bacon and home fries.  The bacon was fantastic.  They offer hash browns or home fries with a side of toast.  The home made jelly is wonderful.  I highly recommend this place.

Love this place. Crowded on the weekend, but I'm a fan of breakfast anytime. The food is impeccably delicious, service once seated is friendly and quick, coffee is delicious, and don't miss the homemade jam with your toast. My 12 year old son and I enjoyed our date with bar seating last visit, and he polished off everything on his plate and can't wait to come back. Everyone I've taken here has loved it. Thanks, Matt's!

There hasn't been a breakfast place as good as this for a while. I loved the local produce, the ambience and the location. It's the best way to go out for breakfast and consider the direction of your upcoming day in a relaxing, yet stimulating environment. The menu will have you coming back again and again, you can't do it all in one sitting. I'm happy to recommend this to anyone.

Excellent breakfast in a warehouse setting. We tried the Belgian waffles and bacon and eggs.  The food was served quickly, was hot and fresh. Service was excellent and the staff was friendly. Would definitely eat here again.
Great breakfast spot. Amazing food at a low price. Quality ingredients and awesome service.

It was like we didn't exist. It took around 10 minutes of standing waiting to be seen. We actually watched people come and go behind us because no one was there to greet us. Eventually, somebody came.   The first thing that struct me as odd when we finally got seated was that we could not modify ANYTHING If I wanted a waffle on the side, our waiter said I had to buy another full meal that had the waffle. They wouldn't even give my Mother the option of removing her onions from a meal someone said was optional. Very disappointing.   Aside from that, the food wasn't bad actually. Up until we noticed my Mother had hair in her potatoes. She was only half way finished her food when we informed our waiter. He said he would take it to his manager and return shortly. So while we wait, I search my food like a madman hoping I don't find anything, resulting in me not even wanting to eat anymore. The waiter returned and said that it wasn't hair, it was only a scratch in the plate.   Really...? A scratch that can move and land on other food with a push of a fork? Right  He also returned empty handed. If it was just a scratch in the plate, why didn't he give us the food back? My Mom left not only still hungry, but offended as well. The food didn't take too well to our stomachs either...  Thank you very much, for being terrible. We will NEVER eat here again.
Best breakfast ever, anywhere. Farm fresh food. Lightest waffles. Delicious local bread. Unbelievable bacon.

On my recent vacation I learned that Guy Fieri can be trusted with any food decision.   We waited 1.5 hours on a Saturday morning to get in to Matt's, and I would wait longer next time if I had to.   The staff was incredibly friendly and the food was beyond description.   I ordered the Five Spot, a side of Home fries, and a Honey Lemonade.   The Five Spot was a breakfast sandwich featuring a fried egg, thick cut bacon, cheese, and grilled onions. Its possible that there was another element on the sandwich, but I was in taste heaven and didn't stop to consider what the sandwich was made of.... My home fries were thick cut potatoes with lots of grilled onions and large pieces of rosemary. The large pieces allowed for the flavor to permeate, and I was able to pick around them so that it didn't feel that I was chewing on little sticks.   The honey lemonade was so great that I ordered a second glass to-go!   Matt's is small and seats only 25 diners at a time, but it is definitely a flavor powerhouse!   From now on, I will encourage anyone I know traveling to Phoenix to stop by Matt's. It was fantastic.
Yea!  Matt's on Camelback is open.  Same menu, great service, great breakfast.  Enjoyed the new location. It has the same buzz as downtown.  So far, wait isn't quite as long.  Try everything once!

I'm not sure what the big deal is about?  The place is always packed so they must have something going on but the two times I've eaten at Matt's the food is bland or borderline bad.  It's breakfast food!  You almost have to go out of your way for it NOT to taste good but Matt's seems to manage.

Nice surprise for airport food. Had breakfast with a few people and everything was very good. Food was hot freshly made and tasty.
