Me thinks that anyone with a few simple squares of aluminum foil and heat could cook any of Matt's menu items within their own kitchen and very likely do better within 20 minutes flat, easy.  I don't mean to sound harsh or scathing, but after hearing so many sheep over hyping this place time after time you realize it's all fake kissy-kiss talk.  "Phooey!", I say.  The most important thing you must know and take from this - regardless of whether anything I'm saying here is something you agree with or not - is to beware of the... ehm... "coffee".  Sincerely.  I've heard many others state that you must be an incredibly gracious customer to take a sip.  Merely a whiff of its bouquet brings to mind a vinaigrette of acrid rags and dank wool socks.  Most folks count on having a great cup of coffee with their breakfast; a great cup of coffee is obviously required in conjunction with breakfast.  Like the necessary combinations of two things: Sun & Moon, peanut butter & honey, soap & water, doesn't everyone have a knowing that if you're going to serve coffee during breakfast it needs to taste like coffee?  Even if it's the most watered down brew it needs to taste something LIKE coffee.  Apparently Matt's will hear none of that; they don't seem to be aware nor have heard the talk that some folks don't return just because their coffee resembles what Grandpappy brewed up in a drop-pan a week ago ON TOP OF the coffee grounds that he brewed a month ago, then filtered through newspaper taken from the doghouse outside and used a second time to line the bottom of a bird cage.  (Shwew!)  In fact, I can count two separate occasions when I had actually overheard a server apologize to customers who'd commented on their putrid brew.  Utterly disgusting.  The servers and cooks are nice, friendly and personable (I'm talking - genuinely enjoy what they do) and that, admittedly, counts for a whole lot. Nonetheless, give Matt's a try at least once. At least. But, pass on the coffee... or, "Don't go into the light!" as they say of near death experiences.

THE WAIT IS WORTH IT! Most breakfast places in Phx., even the so called better ones, are medicore to say the least.  I've lived here my entire life and I can honestly say this is the best breakfast I've ever had in Phoenix. I definitely will go back and wait again. Skip H.

So I'm watching Diners, Drive-in's and Dive's on the Food Network and they do a feature on this place.  Go on and on about the waffles.  So the next morning, we head over.  Walk up to the building and people everywhere just standing around.  So I walk in side and was stopped by a server and told to step outside.  She handed me a clipboard and walked back in.  Apparently, I was suppose to put my own name down on the list to be seated, so I did.  We waited almost and hour.  We were finally called to head in.  Walk in and can't believe how tiny this place is...they sit the three of us down at a table made for one so we're all fighting over elbow space.  Look over the menu and decide to order a waffle, eggs and OJ.  Server tells me the waffle iron is broken.  That was the only reason I came here because of the so called world famous waffles.  So I settle for pancakes, eggs and OJ.  They bring out my teaspoon of OJ.  Seriously I have never had such a small glass of OJ.  The food finally arrives, and to tell you the truth, it was good but not worth the hour of my life I spent standing outside waiting.  I'll stick to IHOP.
Great food but usually really busy. I always love what I order and you can tell they use quality ingredients. The only downside is that you usually have to wait.

I ordered the pork chop. It was succulent and drenched in flavor.  We also ordered home fries and hashbrowns. Personally, I don't really like home fries or hashbrowns very much in general. However, these were seasoned to perfection. I couldn't get enough of them.  My husband ordered the blueberry lemonade.  It was also divine.    The only downside was that it was pretty noisy when you went inside. It was also a bit crowded. We had to wait outside for about 15 minutes before we were called in.  They did provide all those who waited outside with complementary lemon water.  Once inside, the staff was friendly and courteous and our food was brought out to us promptly.  I love Matt's big breakfast.
Amazing bacon. Simply superb and unexpected for an airport terminal. Phenomenal. Great price.

Decided to come here after I saw that Guy Fieri loved the Chop and Chick. We ordered the Chop and Chick with home fries and asked for the strawberry preserves with the toast...yum! The chop was flavorful and eggs cooked perfectly! The honey lemonades are a must! We also got the griddle cakes and they were the best pancakes I have ever had! Moist and perfect! There was a wait but for good reason! Everything was delicious!
Great breakfast.   Hip, Cool spot. Only drawback was loud . Everything else great and food was good
This place is super small, we waited more than 20 minutes to be seated. The food is absolutely delightful and generously portioned.

If you like breakfast, and you want to flavorgasms as you eat, this is the place for you. I got the salami scramble which is three scrambled eggs with molinari sopressata salami, and I got the side of hash browns and toast. (Potato side and toast comes with all egg meals) I never would have thought of salami in the eggs, but it was the perfect complement with the peppery taste it packed. That being said, the eggs themselves were extremely tasty and could have been eaten plain. Coffee was hot, fresh and taste good. The toast was Texas sized toast and they had quite possibly the best strawberry preserves I've had in years, if not ever. Service was fantastic; my only negative that is keeping this from being 5 stars is the hash browns.  I'm not complaining about them, but they weren't on par with the great quality of everything else at Matt's. I highly recommend this place, but the wait can be long depending what day and time you get there (this place is loved by the locals) we got there at 815am on a Sunday and were seated immediately (the last available table)

MBB tries to be trendy, tries to be hip, tries to be the face of breakfast in Phoenix.....well, they're 0 for 3 and a big strikeout.  Not worth the wait. Overhyped Food is only average Full of food lemmings Without the DDD episode this place would be slightly below average on it's best day.  There are much better choices for breakfast.

One of my favorite spots to eat at, and I will go out of my way to venture here from Scottsdale. They used to be in a tiny spot that would have an hour plus wait, but they have moved to a much larger location that can seat many more and rarely has a long wait. Try the waffles, or the daily special. Everything is locally sourced and DELICIOUS.

This place is not as good as everyone on Yelp has made it out to be. Be prepared-the whole place is packed and the dining area and the bar are sat by a host who keeps an ever growing waiting list. I was flying solo. The host was able to squeeze me in and offer me one of the bar seats available. The service was fast and friendly. I had the Hog and Chick (two eggs scrambled with thick cut bacon, hash browns and wheat toast). The hash browns and toast were drenched in butter and my thick cut bacon was greasy and fatty. I probably should have went with the Skinny Chick (their egg white and more healthful breakfast option). The jam/preserves they give you for the toast is very scrumptious. And the coffee was good.
A great local place for a filling breakfast!  Just get ready to wait for a table...the space is small but they do a good job of getting people in and out quickly!

There isn't much I can say that hasn't been said so I'll be fast and say stuff that possibly hasn't been addressed. -A big minus for me, the menu online is outdated.  Add two dollars to the price of everything.  Also the portions seemed to have shrunk a bit from whenever pictures here were taken. -There is only one 4-top, everything else is 2-top or counter, so plan accordingly.  We got there early and put our name on the list despite the agonizing taunt of all those empty 2-tops.  The bf was a little grumpy the waitress didn't put 2 tables together, but admitted there really wasn't room to do that without blocking a path. -The decor is cute and Ikea-esque.  Very clean and bright, I felt like I was in a Real Simple spread. -The blueberry jam tastes like normal blueberry jam.  It's cute and nice to get in a cup instead of a package, but otherwise not special. -I ordered bacon because everyone said the bacon was amazing, even though the sausage looked really good.  My bacon was thick-cut but burned and not particularly tasty regardless of doneness. -They cooked my eggs over medium!  I always ask and usually get over easy anyway.  I appreciate the effort, maybe he was concentrating and accidentally burned my bacon. -The home fries have a LOT of rosemary, so don't get it if you're not a big fan.  It perfumed the whole plate and the leaves soaked in the oil seeped into everything.  I liked it. -Don't come here if you want a quiet, private breakfast experience.  The guy sitting behind us seemed grouchy as soon as he was seated and spent the meal glaring at my in-laws, presumably for speaking loudly over the restaurant noise (like everyone else).  He made a lot of pointed throat-clearing and loud newspaper rustling that seemed to embarrass the crap out of his wife and perplex patrons around us.  I really don't know what we did, but don't be this guy.
(The opening times on Yelp aren't correct)  Decent burger - decent beer, decent service 3.5 stars rounded up to 4 stars.

Best breakfast spot in downtown Phoenix. Not that there's a ton of competition. Old school food with modern twist. The staff was super nice and quick. Prices are decent. Definitely check this place out if you're in the area.

Matt's Big Breakfast:  Yes it's busy.  Yes it's tiny.  And yes there's a 45 min. wait on a weekday @ 10:30.  Don't you people work?!    But you know what?  All these things add to the charm of the place.  I secretly believe that people like to wait, they love the anticipation, people eat that sh*t up.    Now, with that being said, on to the food, it truly is delicious. There is no hype when the restaurant can actually deliver and prove that it was worth every minute of the wait.   Lemonade: fresh squeezed and flavored with honey.  A natural sweetener that is incredibly refreshing on a hot day.   Waffle: most definitely the best waffle I have ever had.  Fluffy, light, piping hot, real butter and real maple syrup.   Omelet: quite possibly the best omelet I have ever had.  Cooked to perfection with American cheese, mushrooms and bacon.  No skimping on these additions either, large button mushrooms, plenty of cheese and large chunks of thick cut bacon.   The bottom line....  Matt's Big Breakfast:  Big on taste.  Big on portions.  Big on appeal.  Even bigger on charm.
I remember watching this on Diners Drive-Ins and Dives. I really liked this place. Great food and the staff was great. The wait...More than worth it!
Awesome place. Be ready to wait because it is very popular place.
A good place to enjoy a late breakfast marred by relentless crowds insistent that eggs waited an hour to eat taste better. Easier to get in as a solo diner.

The food was unique according to breakfast standards. All the staff were very friendly and able to provide excellent service - even with all customers. The food was delivered quickly and tasty, and the waitress behind the bar was always quick to refill my coffee and ice water during my stay here, I Recommend.

We initially thought it was a cozy place and enjoyed the atmosphere. They seemed to be disorganized or confused about which server was helping each table. We never knew who was our server as we had 3 different people ask if someone had taken our drink order. The hash browns were extremely burned. The server gave us an attitude when we asked for separate checks. Not sure if they deserve a second chance.

Worth the wait AND the hype. I ordered the pancakes, which admittedly are a standard staple, but they were amazingly delicious and I had to finish the entire massive portion. I didn't eat again until dinner after consuming these fluffy, flavorful pillow of carbohydrate bliss, which were just accentuated by the whipped butter and maple syrup.  The service is fast and the line moves quickly, but there was a line even at 10 a.m. on a random Friday.

This place is amazing. The only reason I only gave it 4 stars is because the menu is somewhat limited. However it had everything I wanted and was delicious. People are very friendly and a cool sort of vibe..
From LA area visiting Scottsdale AZ this place was great bought some strawberry jam ketchup and bbq sauce for Home breakfast was awesome will return

Matt's Big Breakfast is pretty yummy. I would have to agree though that a big fuss is made over this place. I have had the pancakes twice and both times they seemed dry. I think the biggest problem I have had is having a "big breakfast" and not enough to wash down my pancake the size of a UFO with. The juice is understandably "freshly squeezed" but a glass the size of a shot glass for almost 3 bucks is ridiculous. Personally I'm not one to enjoy water with a meal, which is probably your best choice so you don't end up spending your life savings on shots of OJ. They do have sodas but in a can and that's if you are an RC fan. The funny thing is I tried once to bring in a drink to help with the aid in digestion of my breakfast and they have a sign on the front door that reads "No outside beverage". Damn!

What do they do to make a basic breakfast so good? Well, actually mine wasn't basic. I took the special off the board: Andouille sausage, havarti cheese (I think), a lovely red spicy pepper three egg omelette AH-mazing, their famous potatoes on the side. Thick slices of whole grain bread on the side with a tiny bit of butter (I wish it had more). One of my kids had the breakfast sandwich with bacon, one had the chicken marinated in pesto sandwich, and the husband had something I can't remember but everyone was very full, very happy even after waiting well over an hour to get seated.  We did ask for a grilled cheese sandwich for our kid and the waitress looked at us stunned and said it's not on the menu. True but they have bread and cheese right? Oh well. What I loved more than anything was every staff person you come in contact with says: Thank you for waiting!   I hope to go back soon even though it's a 40 minute drive from my house and more than likely an hour wait to get in - it's worth it.

The best breakfast you will ever have. I can't tell you why - maybe take the most simple foods but make sure they are the highest quality, cook with butter or olive oil and you get perfection?  I don't know the secret but people will wait in line for over 30 minutes to eat OATMEAL there?!  I've eaten there twice - my first review must have been written on the other location. This time I had the simple breakfast sandwich. Two eggs, bacon, cheese on a soft fluffy roll. The bacon is outrageous, thick, peppery yum. The sandwich is really big and luscious.  My older kid gets the basic eggs, potatoes, toast and bacon. The younger got the waffles - incredible light, fluffy and flavorful. I can't remember what my husband got but he was a happy, happy man.  The wait is tough especially in summer heat. I've been approached by homeless folks both times. The last one was hilarious. He asked me for a cigarette and I told him I don't smoke. He looked at me with amazement and asked: How did you quit??? Like we have been the best friends forever and he is in awe in my ability to quit. Ha! I laughed and said I've never smoked. He nicely moved on to the next group.  **I had to edit this as I forgot to compliment the service. I love, love, love how everyone says "thank you for waiting". There is no arrogance here. Super attentive service always offering more water or coffee.
Best breakfast I've EVER had! At an airport?! It was almost worth missing my next flight. If you have to be stuck in an airport, look for this restaurant!

It's everything and then some.  I only give it four stars because of how packed it is, and it can be kind of claustrophobic at times.  Other than that, I will wait all day in that line outside just to eat here!  So super yummy!  Definately a must try!

Because of all of the other yelpers describing the long waits, my partner and I decided to try Matt's on a Wednesday, mid morning.  We waited about 10 minutes before being seated.  I enjoyed the unpretentious atmosphere of Matt's Big Breakfast.  The service was excellent.  When I say excellent, I mean our waitress took our drink orders immediately, answered our questions expertly, and brought our meals exactly as ordered (which is impressive because I can be a tad high maintenance).  Our food was pipping hot and very tasty.  I had the cheddar omelette and added mushrooms and onions. I ordered home fries (roasted potatoes with rosemary and onions) and fresh squeezed orange juice.  The orange juice was just the right size, and not too sweet.  The omelette was chock full of mushrooms, onions and cheddar.  The potatoes were golden brown and delicious with a little extra salt.  My partner ordered the griddle cakes which she said were soft, buttery and with the real maple syrup, yummy.  While Matt's is pretty small, I think there's plenty of room to enjoy a great meal!

Beware food may be unsafe!!  Three of us ate here yesterday.   Service was fine, but we were sick all last night and today.  100+ temperatures.  Clearly food poisoning.  They should have their cleanliness and food preparation checked.

I love this place, this is basically the Harlow's of downtown Phoenix.  The food is great - that cook makes one hell of an omelet, the first one I ate was so good I sent a tip back to him.  The waitresses that work the counter remember your usual order after 2-3 times, and it's just a great experience.  The only reason I would put it a tiny notch behind Harlow's is that they don't have as diverse a menu, but that's not that big a deal to me, as long as I get my omelette.  Great breakfast place.

Ate here for the first time about 10 days ago, on a Saturday morning around 9am.  We had to wait about 30-40 mins.  Holy smokes!  What a meal!  Menu - very limited!  Like 7 items for breakfast.  I was dubious...  Coffee - A+ - locally roasted by the Roastery of Cavecreek.  Fantastic! What a surprise and a delight!  Toast - A+ - artisan bread, very thick, with real butter.  We got the whole grain.  Amazing!j Oh - with homemade fresh preserves.  Hashbrowns - A+ - holy smokes, I don't know how they managed to take something so mundane and make it terrific.  Crispy, crunchy outside, softer on the inside without becoming mushy (retaining texture) and flavorful to boot!  Eggs - A - I can't really evaluate the eggs too much, because I put 'em on top of the hashbrowns and diced 'em up.  Service - B+ - Service was great - until the end when our guy left the check and dropped us like a hot potato.  I wanted more coffee.  They were SUPER busy, and scurrying all over.  I'll give them a B+ overall on service.  We even had an older guy check in on us to make sure everything was alright - like a manger or owner?  But ya gotta finish strong, too.  Paid our bill, and was able to get a small "to go" cup from the cashier.  That coffee was so delicious!  In the end, it was absolutely amazing to me that such simple familiar fare could be so outstandingly better than typical.  It really was quite a surprise.  I love breakfast at restaurants - probably my favorite meal of the day.  I SO MUCH WISH this place was closer to where I live.  This is what all restaurants aspire to be.

My family took me here for breakfast today 9/13/15.  See my yelp review for Charlston's yesterday which was 5 star.  This was my first encounter with Matt's.  It was for my birthday as was Charilston's yesterday.  Unbelievable!  Are you nuts?  Almost, not quite an HOUR wait on the street??????? And then, when we get in there, NO ice in the water?  No lemon slices for our "free NO ice water".  And, NO  salsa for the potatos?????   We asked the waitress to break down the bill (11 of us) and she said they will not do this.  HO HO  HO.  NEVER AGAIN!!   Finally NO regular white bread toast???  This place is a joke.  I spent a dollar extra for a BIG piece of burnt ham steak.  I wouldn't do this for TJ's out on Avondale south of Van Buren which is truly great!!!  If you're on the West Side, go to TJ's.  If you're on the East Side, try Mircle Mile on the the weekends for breakfast or the Bisbee Cafe on Dobson and Guadalupe.    This place is way the hexx overrated..

I refuse to tell anyone about this place.  The last thing I want is for it to get so crowded that I have to wait an hour and a half to get a seat, like the Matt's downtown. So, stay away! It's all mine!   But if you insist on continuing to read this, then I guess I'll have to tell you that this is the best breakfast joint around. Everything is cooked to perfection and the staff are very friendly and attentive.   Hog alert! If you love bacon, you won't find any better-anywhere in Arizona. Period.   This particular Matt's has a great open view next to Tempe Town Lake. The only down side is that parking is a premium because... it's at Tempe Town Lake.   Don't let me catch you here making me wait for a table! lol

We stopped here on the road home to Austin.  We try to eat gluten free which was kinda hard for me as a vegetarian. So, I went for the waffles, which comes with bacon, and they would not let me substitute it for eggs. So I had to buy eggs on top which was kinda weird.  They also tried to sit my husband and I at a two top table with our toddler and infant.  I'm sure you can imagine how crazy it was trying to eat with our drinks, etc... For four people on a two top.  They did eventually let us add a second two top, but I was already feeling anxiety from the logistics of juggling the situation that it was hard to enjoy my food when it came.  The food was AWESOME.  Three rating for the logistical issues.

Yes on every level! I love the small, hipster vibe. I feel like this place is authentic in that regard even though it's becoming "so mainstream" to have a restaurant that is laid back. I love the bacon!It is my favorite bacon in Phoenix! I eat a TON of breakfast restaurants/takeout . It just depends on what you are looking for in a breakfast or brunch and mood. I am sure you will enjoy this rustic vibe. And did I say BACON?
Our favorite bruch spot in Phoenix. Great food, good portions and fast and kind service! The toast and jam is so good!

Matt's has spoiled me for breakfast anywhere else...even at home. Remember the days when  you were satisfied with fast-food breakfasts or even Shoneys? They say a dog will chew on a bone until you give him a steak..and once I tried Matt's, I couldn't go back to growth-hormone, trans-fatty el cheapo choke n puke.   Been to Matt's at all locations, including the airport, and the Tempe location delivers the goods just like you want them to. Everything locally sourced, jam home made, and pure maple syrup.  Organic cage free eggs, and their iconic thick cut bacon. I personally love the french toast! There is literally not a bad item on the menu. Yes, it is popular...yes, you might have to wait. But that's a trifle when you are sitting down to the highest quality, tastiest breakfast/brunch meal in town.   If you want to try the lunch, go for the Reuben, the Burger or the BLT. They all rock.

Wowzer ! I love this place. I get to a lot of breakfast places but this is awesome.  #1. The service is some of the best I have ever seen. Very happy attentive folks!   #2. The food was always fresh, local, cooked perfect.
Great spot for breakfast. Hash browns were awesome along with cheese omelet/onions/ mushrooms and sourdough bread. Cool spot in Roosevelt Row.
Every time I fly out of phx, I always eat here. It's amazing. Great food and great service. Sit at the bar, Paul the bartender gets you in and out fast.

So the food is fine..but the "new" location eeew! Its sooooo gross!! We sat st the bar and right at the window next to us was  a homeless guy takung off his socks..then makinga drug deal..then across the st a guy jumped in the dumpster and a transient couple was making out on a tarp..came from california and was wanting to eat here..never again!! The parking scks too if you do come here the reuben looked good and strawberry lemonsde was yummy. My salad was meh..

Enjoy it when I can get in, but the last two times that hasn't happened courtesy of their new host. Both times went by myself to sit at the counter. Both times was asked to wait, then watched multiple others show up and just grab the seats. He has no control of the dining room and appears continuously overwhelmed.
This place had really good food (especially the bacon) and was timely with my takeout order. It saved me from early morning starvation so 5 stars !

It's 5 freakin Stars!!!!  I've had the pleasure of eating at this establishment several times and I am continuously impressed by the goodness of the food and customer service this fine establishment has to offer.   The  food prices here are more than reasonable based on the quality and portion sizes offered. You can order the special and it will feed two at the right portion sizes. I leave food on my plate almost every time as I am stuffed.   Two areas to be prepared for are: 1) to wait outside in the phoenix desert heat to be seated, this is the rule; the exception is walking straight in and being seated. 2) The restrooms are there but the only hold one person at a time. If you got to go you may wait again in line.!In the men's restroom they have a toilet and urinal but no divider, so it's one at a time. Can't speak on the ladies as I am not one nor am I a pervert.  The customer service is awesome to me; I am called by name. I go here but I'm not a regular.

Attentive and creative service is hard to come by these days. This 5 star is mostly as a result of the service provided by Michelle. After looking over the menu which seemed pretty limited I had made up my mind that I'd just enjoy the amazing coffee at Matt's and opt for a short ride to Snooze instead for food. I let Michelle know that nothing really stood out so I'd take my check for the coffee. She said with a warm smile "Is there something you were looking for? I'm sure we can make you happy!" I told  her I was a fan of a skillet type of breakfast. She immediately said she could do that and started making recommendations on what to include in it. Just seemed to genuinely care about making me happy with a great breakfast which kicked my Friday off perfectly. Off-menu skillet was great Michelle! Matt's lucky to have you:)
Be prepared to wait, but it is so worth it. Must try the Belgian Waffle!! so so good. Totally homey, down to earth deliciousness. Just GO!!!
Best breakfast in town. Be ready to wait almost any time. Better towards closing time at 2:30. They use local ingredients. Yummy waffle with huge piece of bacon is the best.

Boring menu, super long wait, everything here is just OK. You will wait more than an hour if you go on the weekends, you will Be starving by the time you're seated, and you will get your food and think: "that's it?"   Not sure why this place is so popular, it could be so much better.

Best airport breakfast EVER! One of the best breakfast joints ever. Potatoes well seasoned with fresh rosemary. Bacon is thick and meaty and also peppered nicely. Food has really good flavor. We got double charged for coffee because we got it at the to-go side & then decided to sit, but it was an understandable oversight. Other than that service friendly and attentive. Love that they have ketchup without high fructose corn syrup & pure honey.

Recommended by a friend. Don't let first impression fool you. Very small. Air conditiones. Street parking. Service was phenomenal. Food was great. Ate the daily special omelette (3 eggs, turkey sausage, peppers) with tortilla and hash browns. Very good. Will definitely return next time I'm in town.
Best waffle ever! Cute atmosphere, you can tell he loves what he does! Good job, Matt
I love this place. The service is good. The food is AMAZING! It's a must go here in Phoenix. Just be prepared, because of how awesome it is- it will be crowded. But oh so worth it.
Our first stop when arriving in Phoenix! It was fantastic the very vegetarian friendly! I loved my veggie omelet and my boys said the best waffles ever! Definitely a must while in the Phoenix area
LOVE this place!!!  Everything on the menu is incredible.  Especially loved the Belgian waffle.  The ambiance is a bit basic and hole in the wall, but the service is great and the food is the BOMB!!!

I was willing to wait for 1 1/2 hour  for the best breakfast I  was reading about ... boy, I was disappointed.  CON: *Bacon was dry .. really really dry *Hash brown  ... burnt on the outside soggy with butter on the inside. Don't get me wrong. I love my butter .. but that was just way too much. *Tables are tiny - we had 3 pple and a toddler  and they put us with a table  for 2. Please explain to me how we were suppose to eat ?  PRO: *Matt was really nice *Service was great *The sour dough bread with blueberry jam was really good.  Will I go back ?  ... No.

**Disclaimer: this post is long.  For a summary/breakdown of my rating, scroll to the bottom.  Let me begin by saying that if I could award this establishment 0 stars, I would have. I visited Matt's for the first time yesterday morning with a few of my coworkers.  I was told great things about this restaurant and was excited to try it out.  I ordered their special which was an egg and cheese scramble with pepper jack cheese, pork tenderloin, and roasted green chilies; it came with choice of hash browns or diced potatoes and a flour tortilla.  A friend told me they had great diced potatoes so I went with it. Wrong choice. I love potatoes, I love flavor, but there is such thing as over seasoning, and Matt's perfected the act.  I took a bite of the potatoes first, before trying anything else, before adding anything to flavor my food, and was blown away by the amount of rosemary.  I assumed it was just a fluke, nope. Tried another potato and it was just as bad.  You couldn't taste the potato at all!  Just seasonings.  I doused them in ketchup and still couldn't choke them down. The scramble was decent, nothing spectacular, nothing awful. The flour tortilla was terrible.  I assumed they were homemade, since Matt's boasts about all their natural, non-gmo, freshly this-and-that food.  The only way to describe the flavor was salt dough, the kind you have a five year old put their hand in to create a Christmas ornament... Yuck!  I asked for some butter, which came with a side of judgement that I will get to in a moment, to put on my tortilla but it didn't help at all, I gave up on it and tossed it down on my plate next to my unfinished rosemary...I mean potatoes. I also had a "large" glass of fresh squeezed orange juice.  It tasted good, but silly me, I didn't think to check the price before I ordered it.  $4.50 for a large glass that was /maybe/ 16oz.  I get that they offer freshness where most do not, but get a grip!  I know this issue was my own fault, it could have been avoided if I had just glanced at the price.  The juice is not factored into their low rating.  Let's discuss the service!  Since it was a late, weekday morning, I didn't anticipate much of a crowd, and to my relief, there wasn't one, so we were seated rather quickly.  Someone promptly brought us water and took our drink orders, then made several trips to bring us our drinks (there were only 5 of us).  Whatever, we got over it.  Then we went to order and discovered that substitutions are not made, even for those with food allergies and intolerances.  Because that's fair, right?  We didn't have to wait long for our food to come out, which was nice, but then the service fell flat, like their job was done, time to move on to the new paying customers (not that there were a whole lot of them).  A completely new waitress came and asked as we were finishing up how things were, which was when I asked for a side of butter.  She looked at my plate as if to see what I could possibly need butter for, as if it was any of her business.  Got the butter, it didn't help make my tortilla taste better, then they dropped the check off (I had inquired about separate checks when we were ordering...they don't do that here).  This may just be my own issue, but I feel that we shouldn't have to ask the waitress to refill our water, yet I did.  It's called being attentive in your customer service.  The vibe that this place put off was just plain snobbish.  I stem from Southern California, where restaurants with natural, non-gmo dishes are a dime a dozen, and they don't serve up near as much of a pretentious attitude as this small diner in downtown Phoenix.  Honestly this place needs a huge reality check.  Rating summary:  Customer service: 0/5 stars for being completely unaccommodating Food quality (taste): 1/5 stars because natural food should not taste this bad... Prices: 2/5 stars because I understand that natural food is not always cheap, but that doesn't mean gouge your customers. Atmosphere: 0/5 stars; over-priced, penny-pinching and pretentious do not make for a good restaurant vibe.  Overall: terribly overrated.  Do yourself a favor and make your own natural breakfast at home; it'll taste better, save you money, and the service you'd get couldn't be any worse than what you'd receive at Matt's.
Delicious breakfast!! One of the best I think. You have to wait for it but your won't regret it. If I return to Phoenix I'll go back here for sure.

I am an avid visitor at the downtown location, so this visit was very disappointing. I had high hopes at first because they were able to accommodate my request to substitute meat for pancakes at no extra charge, however my dreams were crushed when the food came out less than 5 minutes later.   The pancakes just weren't good. I've had "just add water" box pancakes better than these.  I requested scrambled eggs, but I got a fried egg chopped up. The potatoes were cold and tasted as if they threw some hour-old potatoes on my plate. I love Matt's potatoes, so I know how they should taste.   When I told my waiter my issues with the food she took my plate back to the kitchen. Then she returned with the check, expressing how she gave me a 10% discount. I hate ate a few bites of my food, so I was baffled that she was charging me basically full price for a meal I did not eat. I agreed to pay for the pancakes because I ate most of them, but refused to pay for the eggs and potatoes. The manager approached me, and with a not so great attitude told me they weren't going to charge me for the meal. He didn't apologize for the terrible service, but instead acted as if I was just being problematic.   Again, I love Matt's Big Breakfast, but I will stick with the downtown location and never patronage at the airport location again!

So, this place is hidden so it was a little hard to find but when I finally found it there weren't very many parking spaces available. So, I found one and walked over and noticed there is no sign or anything explaining what to do because when you get there you walk through a little gate and there are people sitting at tables outside and inside people are sitting and eating. We sat at the table outside for about 15 min before being told we had to get our names on the wait list.... so we did and the wait was long. We were finally seated inside and they don't have much variety so we ordered and my companion got a side of hash browns that came out looking like green ramen noodles. The food was mediocre and the server was getting really friendly with my companion. Wasn't terrible but wasn't great, I probably wouldn't go back

Not the best but not the worst.  I took a seat at the counter since there was a wait for a table and I was a party of one. Bartender/waitress flopped down a menu.  After perusing, I ordered The Hog and Chick, which was basic eggs, meat, potatoes and toast. I asked if I could pay extra to substitute a pancake for the toast.  Waitress gave me a dumbfounded look and said "yeah, I guess but I don't know how to do that".  That was the red flag I should have paid attention to. Then she asked, "sausage, bacon, or ham?" I picked ham.  Ordered a coffee that came in a tiny cup. They don't have cream, just milk.  Food arrived, decent in taste and usual presentation.  Pancake was small and average.  Here's the kicker...ticket showed pancake substitute was $5! For one pancake.  Ham was an extra $5! (which I just discovered should have only been an extra $1)Tiny coffee that I had to ask for a refill was $3.50. My ticket was $26 for a slightly better breakfast than Dennys! I didn't question it as the waitress didn't seem like one to mess with.   Entertainment was a super flamy and friendly waiter catering to his customers and giving much better service than I had and watching a line cook repeatedly digging out waffles that were stuck in the waffle iron and ripping in half. He used them anyway for the waffle orders to go. Too spendy for what I ordered, probably wouldn't recommend nor return.  The place should be called Matt's Big Ticket Breakfast. Boo.

One of the best places for breakfast. The place is very cute,the staff is very friendly. The food is one of the best and the homemade jelly is outstanding! The owner is nice and a hard worker, so is the rest of the staff !
Great place to eat between flights. Was hungry and tried their breakfast and it was amazing!! Definitely coming here again. Super great friendly service makes this a top notch place for me.

I wish I could give 31/2 stars...  First of all...just check this place out and decide for yourself- that is if  you don't die of heat stroke while waiting in the 110 degree summer sweatfest that is most notably Phoenix. Or better yet just thank Matt once you make it inside for not bothering to accommodate patrons with some type of effing shading device!!!!! PLANT SOME TREES!!!! UMBRELLAS!!!! OVER HANG! PATIO! A GUY U PAY $3.35/hr WITH A HUGE PIECE OF CARDBOARD! ANYTHING! ok..you get the point.  (I understand this setup in any other state people, but seriously....!) and btdubs..the outside is just fugly...trees plz!  blah blah blah... once you make it inside everything is great! Simple, basic food, friendly service, quaint atmosphere, decent prices. Yeah you could make it at home, but you can make any breakfast food at home, that is the point of "going out" for breakfast.  *TIP! call ahead and order and then eat while you walk to your car! superkewl time saver DOH!

This morning's target was Matt's Big Breakfast in Phoenix. After all of the media hype over this little original were they going to be as good as promised?  We were thrilled to find that Matt's is very close to the Light Rail stop at Roosevelt and Central, so we took the train and didn't have to worry about finding a parking spot. A very good thing as it turns out as there are a few parking lots near Matt's but all of them were full.  I had heard that's Matt's was small, but I was not prepared for just how small. One car garage small. Including the kitchen! This causes a major problem for hungry customers, the wait was nearly two hours! Wow, this place must be great if people are willing to stand out in the rain for nearly two hours to get in.  Once we were inside and seated things actually moved pretty quickly. We actually had food inside of ten minutes of ordering. The only con inside I saw really was how loud it was. But hey, I could live with that.  The food was very good. My wife had the Chop and Chix, a lovely seasoned pork chop, eggs perfectly cooked, home style potatoes and toast. I had a Salami Scramble, three eggs, Molinari sopresseta, hash browns and toast. It was all very good, very flavorful.  However, after the hype and the nearly 2 hour wait to get in I was expecting outstanding not just very good. The other reality check item for Matt's was the price. I ordered a soda, $2.75, what I received was a 12oz can of soda. Yup, nearly twice the price of a six-pack of soda at any store in town for one can. A 4oz glass of orange juice, granted freshly squeezed, was also nearly $3.00. Hmmm, I didn't order any.   Total bill for our breakfast was $27.00 plus tip.  Bottom line? Matt's Big Breakfast has very good food, but only very good food. There was nothing exceptional here to justify all of the hype, there are many other breakfast places here in town with food at least as good if not better than Matt's for less money and without the marathon wait to get in.  If you go to Matt's expect to wait at least an hour, you will enjoy the food I promise. Only you can decide if the wait and the price are worth it.

thanks to diner drive ins and dives and guy fierri for bringing this place up on the show wow its the best place in town from service from start to finish thanks sooo yummy and clean worth the long waits to get in try it!!!
In town for meeting and found Matts Big Breakfast.   Great food and service.  Recommend highly.
This local eatery was excellent.  From the eggs to the irresistible home fries and the awesome sourdough toast with fresh preserves, a truly great meal.  Parking was tough due to local construction.

I've been in love with Matts since my first visit to the Phoenix location! The food is delicious, the service is fantastic, and it has, in my opinion, the most delicious breakfast served anywhere. I'm so happy they've expanded to Tempe.  I would recommend The Chop and Chick as a great place to get a sampling of savory heaven. The pork chop is seasoned perfectly and is a perfect example of being tender yet firm. The eggs are always sublime, and the home fries will never disappoint.  If you've got a sweet tooth, the pancakes or the waffle are also delicious. I'd kill for their batter recipe.  Will continue to keep coming back for more

This was our first visit to this restaurant. First, let me say that this restaurant has awesome fresh squeezed orange juice, excellent coffee, and great service. The food was generally good. Ham was tough in spots, and my meal was definitely in need of salt and pepper.The port in my breakfast special had no taste at all. Hashbrowns were somewhat burnt. I could live with this though. However, I had to mark this restaurant down due to the lack of comfort of the "urban" stainless steel stools that are provided to customers at the counters. Here I think style was a major concern over comfort, and I urge the owners in this eatery to sit on their own stools for an hour to experience the whole dining experience. While eating there, I spent most of the time trying not to slide off of these quite small, hard and slippery shiny stainless steel wonders, and since no rail to rest your feet on is provided, staying on them depends on you using the small rails along the bottom of the stool to try and stay on them. By the end of the meal, we couldn't wait to get out of there, just so we could stand up and stretch out our backs from the lack of support, hardness, and strain of trying to stay on these little torture devices. If the idea is to make it uncomfortable enough to keep the turnover quick at the counters, then they are perfectly suited for the task. However, we will strongly reconsider whether to return, and if we do, will never sit at the counter again. Good food is available all over the valley, and being comfortable while eating is also available all over the valley.   As a suggestion to attract and keep customers, I want to make a couple of suggestions:  Fix the stool situation. They are a big drawback.  During the breakfast wait, instead of that watery whatever it is that you offer to all the people waiting outside (water? lemonade?), serve coffee. When the guy brought that out, many of us said "Coffee, awesome!", and then realized it was something far less appealing. By bringing out coffee and mugs (OK to use a variety from Goodwill or whatever), you will have an automatic coffee sale and people will enjoy hanging out while waiting. You can stage it from inside to control losses and offer it to those on the waiting list if you want, but it would endear a customer such as myself to the restaurant.   When you put down the check, explain how it works. "We can take care of this for you or you can pay at the counter" would be helpful. We weren't sure what to do and had to ask.  As it is, we may or may not return to this restaurant. Might give it one more try.
little gem, i love it! Good local positive vibe!
Best Breakfast and their bacon is to die for...I always stop when flying thru..skip their brkfst sausage tho but be sure to get a Bloody Mary...Yumm!

Very disappointed the second time around. Service was awful as in she took my order delivered it and never once came back to see how it turned out. When I was leaving I told her how awful it tasted she said sorry have a great day. My french toast was so undercooked and burnt on the outside I couldn't even finish it.

This was my go to place for breakfast then about 6 months ago I realized my last two visits had drastically changed. The hash browns were not cooked like they used to be at all and were disappointing. The food over all was just ok, not the GREAT experience it used to be. I hope they have improved again and weeded out that bad cook. I might add the new location although bigger has lousy acoustics and all sound is magnified beyond comfort. VERY LOUD! Not conducive to a good time.

Matt's was the perfect breakfast after a wedding the night before. The food is delicious and high quality. I loved the taste of all of the ingredients. I had the chicken sandwich and the breast meat was juicy, and paired fantastically with the pesto sauce.

I've heard a lot of people talking about this place so decided to try.  Small space with a lot of 2-tops so I'm glad I came in a party of 2!!  Expect to wait a long time if you bring a bigger group.   Food is good, executed well and quality ingredients.  The waffle is great!   It's EXTREMELY LOUD in here and for that reason I probably won't come back.. I couldn't hear my breakfast companion at all which kinda ruined the point of going out for breakfast in the first place. Concrete floor, brick walls.. They would do well to make some small changes, hang up some fabric or canvas on the walls, panels on the ceiling to cut down on noise.

Yum, yum, yum! I waited an hour for this brunch while visiting friends a month ago, and the memory makes my mouth water.   I never, ever drink hot coffee -- but even that was delicious.   The waffle was light and flavorful, and I practically inhaled its buttery goodness. (It was admittedly kinda wimpy compared to my friends' plates, especially without the bacon for this vegetarian).  The macaroni salad was unusual -- with a vinegar or vinaigrette dressing -- but lighter than traditional and very tasty.   Totally worth the wait.
Excellent breakfast! This has to be one of the best in Phoenix. The waffles were light and fluffy and the bacon was perfect
Great food, and the service from Chelsea was second to none. Overall the experience was fantastic.
The best! I love to stop and eat at Matt's while waiting to leave from Sky Harbor.

Stopped by on Saturday.  Placed was packed (no surprise), so I rescheduled my visit to Monday morning when it was less crowed.  Grabbed a seat at the counter and was cheerfully greeted and offered my choice of beverage.  I ordered the waffle which came with bacon (unlike the pancakes which don't) and a 2 eggs on the side.  My order came lickity-split except there was only one egg, not two.  Not to worry, I was assured that it would get corrected and it did.    The waffle and bacon were delicious.  Authentic butter and real maple syrup.....yummy.  The eggs were.....eggs. Coffee cup never reached the bottom and was always being refilled.  Considering the place is called Matt's Big Breakfast, one would think that there would be offerings on the menu....but the place was still packed so Matt must be doing something right.  I'll be back and recommend that you pay them a visit when you are in the Phoenix area.

Nice enough server, but evidently there is a condiment shortage: no ranch or bleu cheese dressing, no sour cream. Bread for tuna sandwich looked as if it had the possibility of tasting good but I didn't try it as it seemed to have been left in the arid AZ sun all day today; dry as a bone. Beer good. Glass warm. May be my least favorite airport meal to date.

I wanted to come here because it's close my house and the gym I became a member at. I walked in with my girlfriend, there were two spots open at the bar and 2 or 3 tables open, we didn't wanna wait behind the two people waiting and no one was at the counter. So, we decided to sit at the bar, ever place I've ever been the bar is open, we sat down, looked at the menu only but a second and a mar came up to us very loudly and said "there are two people in front of you, you can't sit here". Mind you there were several tables open and the two people in front of us had been sitting there waiting. Was very unprofessional to announce it like that and since when is the bar part of seating? I'll avoid this place and take my business elsewhere, I understand this might be minor, but when there are multiple places open and you disrespect customers, it's never ok.

Matt's food is fantastic. The BEST hashbrowns I've ever had in my life. I often get the chop and chick and it's delicious. The toast is thick and comes with homemade jam. My one complaint--and it's a huge one for me--is that they do not have cream for their coffee! I simply don't understand their thought process in not offering cream. Their coffee is good, but not with milk or almond milk. Sorry, but this has actually been a dealbreaker for me and I will go to the Phoenix Market Cafe close by instead. I couldn't take a star off for it though because their food is so good. But PLEASE PLEASE Matt, offer CREAM for your coffee and I will be a regular!

I don't usually write reviews but this one needs to be known. I live in Phoenix and usually fly out of gate B where this restaurant is located. I past by it going to my gate today and it was very busy. After I checked into my gate I had some extra time to go and have some food and a drink. I stood there for the hostess to take my name on the reservation which she never wrote it down, I asked how long and she said it would be 5-10 mins. I said okay, she continued to take others peoples names with 1 to 4 people in their party. She never acknowledge me, I finally said you didn't write down my name and then she finally did. No sorry, nothing. In the end she went over my name twice and sat two different reservations, I finally walked away. I am glad I didn't spend a dime at this restaurant. The worst customer service ever. I recommend going somewhere else to spend your money.
Just about the best waffle and bacon I've ever had... Wow! Excellent coffee and service too.
The food was good but the 45 minute wait ruined my experience.

What can I say That Ayesha didn't already cover? I love breakfast..and I love butter. Breakfast + butter + more butter = Matt's.   I had an omelette which was filled with delicious cheese and as Ayesha mentioned the mushrooms had been cooked up in butter before going into the mix which is how I do it at home. The eggs were fluffy and delicious. The toast was thick. THICK.   Yes the wait was long. The windows are huge so you can make those already eating uncomfortable by staring at them as they eat which is sort of fun right?  The shooting pain in my left arm makes it hard to type, but with the smile on my face I am forced to try to put out this one last review before my early death to butter clogged arteries.   They also got a boost when on the way out every single staff member shouted to us thank yous, and have a good days, and come back soons. Sweet folks. I will have to go back after the bypass surgery.
Great food! Very creative menu with basic breakfast foods. The service was prompt, but the wait was 20 minutes so be prepared for that....

Be prepared for a very very very long wait and don't come hungry. What? Don't come hungry when you're coming out to eat breakfast? Exactly! Wait time may be 2-3 hours so please do yourself a favor and snack or eat light before you come. So what tempted a Tempe girl to come out to Phoenix to eat at Matt's Big Breakfast...Triple D DUH! Haha...Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives with Guy! He's the man! Who doesn't love him? I'm sure many people are stalking his eating stops. So cool, they have his face stenciled on the wall.   Okay, so you get here and it's so teeny tiny that there's just a little stool with a waiting list. Write your name down and feel free to take off for a bit. Walk around downtown...bring board games...don't plan on just waiting outside because #1. There may not be anywhere to sit and #2. Your bottom will be very sore from sitting so long. This restaurant is in an old lobby of an old motel. You know, the old motels with the little detached lobby the size of a one car garage. I would not recommend bringing a group here...they will not be able to fit you. If you're not up for the experience but would like to try the food, they do have carry-out as an option and it will probably only take 15 minutes or so. Once you finally get seated you can't help but wonder, how oh how do these people work in this tiny room all day? Man! It is t-i-n-y! Okay, so now that I have stressed how small this place is (tiny) lets move on. :-) I ordered what Guy ordered, The Chop and Chick. A pork chop with eggs. It comes with toast and your choice of hash browns or home fries. The chop was smaller, not life changing, but very tasty...it had great seasoning. Only $8 too. Home fries were a five out of five. Very good! No soda machine here...they sell RC Cola by the can though. $1.25 a can...My Dad had the griddle cakes and he said that they were the best pancakes he's ever had. So funny because we talked to a waitress and she said it's just a regular batter but my dad is a pancake connoisseur and he loved them! Overall, yummy food, great prices but the wait is just way too long to make this a regular spot. I would eat here again but would definitely take it to go...maybe even eat outside where everyone's been waiting for hours.

I heard about this place not to long ago and decided to give it a try.  It was packed, so the wait was pretty long but it worth it.  The fresh squeeze OJ is awesome but be ready to drink some thick pulp. I like it but I'm sure it can be a shock for the american taste of the shitty artificial juice that they have us so used to.  The waffle was pretty good. The bacon was crisp and full of flavor.  I ordered eggs with the rosemary fries and bacon. Those fries worth the trip!  Cheers!  PS Great service

These guys ain't kiddin about breakfast, Me and my lady's first time trying out Matt's. I had the biscuits sausage and gravy with house potatoes( mmmmmmm it was good and well portioned) my lady tried the Belgium waffle with bacon(it looked delicious). Definitely coming back to try a different breakfast special..

I travel to Phoenix often and after several attempts to bypass long lines, I was able to get seated after a 20 minute wait. With that said, dishes with eggs and home fries were excellent. The chops were dry and not really flavorful. We sat at the counter and the service was efficient without feeling rushed. I liked this place, but the wait and the metered street parking doesn't make this a very convenient option for a weekday breakfast.
LOVE this place! One of the best breakfast experiences I've had in my travels to Denver. Awesome atmosphere and amazingly fast service (serving hot, fresh food)! Run, don't walk. Get in line!

We came here based on good Yelp reviews. Delicious fresh and great. I am not a big breakfast fan so for me to be psyched is unusual. The restaurant is darling with exposed brick and utilitarian pendants. They moved down a block last year to accommodate the crowds.   We sat at the breakfast bar and enjoyed a fabulous breakfast. I had a cheddar omelet with mushrooms and sourdough bread. The former was cheesy and exceptional The toast was served with marvelous fresh apricot preserves. My dining mate raved about his home fries (with fresh rosemary) and the special which was a ham scramble with fresh jalapenos. Both were winner choices.     Our server was really efficient and rather mesmerizing to see her take care of dozens of people with apparent ease. Watching her whisk around, felt like I was watching a lava lamp while waiting for breakfast, I am dinging a star because the place is really loud. Also my bottom kept sliding off the half dollar size bar stools. Noticed the ASU kids didn't seem to have that problem.     We will definitely return.  Thanks Yelpers

The best airport breakfast I've ever had. Free range eggs, house made home-fries and thick cut bacon- delicious!! You can order to - go if you don't have time to sit down and be waited on . My to-go order was quick!

Would you like some food with your butter? ------------------------------ Finally made my way down to Matt's Big Breakfast with some friends. We got there at about 10:30 and waited about 10 minutes for a table for 3, so that was pretty good, considering how small the place is.  The cute and feisty waitress got us all coffee, plus I got the OJ (Sarah K's review was spot on - it really is a tiny glass with half of it pulp). I ordered the cheese omelette with mushrooms & sauteed onions, sided with home fries and wheat toast. My friends got the hog & chick and a cheese omelette, both with well-done hash browns. We then ordered a plate of griddle cakes to split three ways.   The food soon was laid in front of us. All I can say is, I hope you like butter. Because butter was everywhere. I came prepared though, armed with my quiver of Lactaid pills. So bring it on, Matthew. I'm ready.  The food was great. Omelette was perfect and the home fries, seasoned with rosemary, were excellent. The griddle cakes were perfect for me, since I'm a big fan of the real maple syrup and light, fluffy flapjacks. My friends were fans of their hash browns, completely crisp and crunchy on the outside, and runny with butter on the inside. I'd never seen hash browns like this before, but I took a biteful to see for myself and the verdict? Really, really good. My friends enjoyed their meals, and our coffees and water were always being refilled, which was a great plus, along with our ongoing bantering with the waitress.   Definitely a great place to start off your Saturday morning.
Excellent food! A Great little Place to eat breakfast at! Service was excellent and would dedimitely come back again! =)

The food's great. The pork products are amazing. The owner has a line on the best around. My gripes: the crowded conditions, the wait and, occasionally, the service, which seems to suffer because of the crowd. Two times now I've had to pull a Shirley McClaine in "Terms of Endearment" (think hospital scene and an ailing daughter needing pain medication) to get my coffee refilled even once. If Matt's has space, and that seems to occur only at opening, I'll slide in and enjoy. But I'm not going to get sunstroke for it, as great as the food is (and it is great).

Nothing but fat and grease! EEEK.   Griddlecakes are great, however... everything else comes with fat, cut from fat. I'm sure it's good, just not my thing.   BTW, be prepared to wait, and wait, and wait some more for a table. Come in with a bag of snacks if you're really starving and ready to eat.   P.S. did I mention the wait??! YES!

Sorry Matt, this was my third visit and became ILL from the FOOD.  I had brunch around 11am with my wife and brother. My brother and I both ordered the same item "French Toast",  1-1/2 hours later he and I experienced the same VERY ILL STOMACH!  Oh, one other suggestion, every movement in your establishment creates a decibel of sound.  Now add that up to a full house times a thousand movements...well you get the picture. I suggest sound abatment at least on the ceiling that way you could keep the character of the interior and serve your patrons best. Well that's my 2 cents worth.

Definetly 5 STARS. Matts BB is my favorite breakfast spot in Phoenix, in the world really. I'm definitely not a regular there but they know me by name. Even the owner, Matts wife, know my name.... Very cool. Everything is great, my favorite is the waffles with real maple syrup, huge bacon, and toast. With either coffee or RC Cola in a CAN.    It may take awhile to  get in, but I promise you... Well worth the wait, it's funny because nobody in the line complains, because they know....
If you're craving breakfast food Matt's BIg Breakfast is a must. Probably the best bacon I've ever had!

The service was great but the pancakes and eggs were cold upon arrival. This was the airport location so maybe there's something to be said for that but the cold food didn't excite my early morning experience.

Maybe it was an off day.  Saw it featured on Food Network a while back so we drove from Queen Creek to give it a try. Was not worth the drive or the wait to get in. Very disappointing. Was nothing like what the show aired.

The Cobb salad used wilted lettuce, and was served minus the bacon. The tuna sandwich was all bread and a pathetic excuse for tasty.   Matt needs to eat his own food once in while.  Don't waste your time and go to Wendy's next door.

Been on a run of DDD joints this week while PHX area.. so caught early breakfast at Matt's BB in sky harbor .. got the big breakfast and while I would not say any one thing was the best I ever had every item on the plate would rank in the top 3.. and everything is fresh homemade .. very unique in an airport. While just like everyone else I could discuss unique homegrown and homemade artisan bacon, one of the best pancakes ever . I have to say I wanted to order more of the breakfast sausage and take it home with me on the plane.. if I had a cooler would have filled it up.  My grandfather would butcher his on pigs. And make his own fresh sausage the flavor and perfect taste I had missed for 50 years. Matt's breakfast sausage was the perfect replica. I will be back ever chance I get when going thru Sky harbor airport . MattsBB thanks for taking me back to one of my favorite childhood memories .

We were 50/50 on this one. I hated my meal the salami scrambled, but Christina enjoyed her St Louis special.  If I went back would stick w/ the waffle. Very small place cant say I would wait an hour to eat here.
if u want awsome pancakes... then come here.. but,get ready to wait for a table,and wait outside in the heat for 40mins!!! but,worth all the wait!!!

This is one of my favorite "go-to" places for breakfast in the area. The waffles are outstandingly delicious! I love the atmosphere, very open and airy. The staff is super friendly and they seem to truly care about providing a good service. I love the location in the very modern Marina Heights Business district and also being close to the lake. I can't recommend this place enough!

My party of 7 only had about 15 minute wait. Cute atmosphere!   Loved the the window bar seating area. We ordered chop & chip, butter burger, the chili and the chicken breast sandwich.  The chicken breast was delicious. Pesto seasoned just right on a soft bun and very filling. The chip and chop was also good but the portion size left you wanting more.  The butter burger patty was cooked to order and very filling. The chill was amazing!! The bummer was that it was served warm. They had a yummy blue raspberry lemonade. The service was quick and friendly except our waitress who looked like she was pissed.  Not a friendly person at all. The bus boy should be promoted to waiter he had the perfect personality.  All in all it was a good experience and I would have given it 5 stars if our waitress was better.
That moment when you wonder who this person is that didn't give this place 5 stars? Perfect, thank you

Pretty near the Heard Museum and the Phoenix Art Museum, I found Matt's accidentally while curiously driving around this little hipster/artsy pocket of Phoenix. We got there at 2pm when they close at 2:30 and I was really happy to get my afternoon breakfast fix while visiting town for a mini-vacation with my mom. Luckily it was not packed at all at this time on a weekday and they were happy to fit us in before closing.  We both got a daily special egg scramble which was really tasty with chorizo, jalapenos, and aged cheddar. I loved the home fries, though if I'm being nitpicky mine were a little burnt in spots and the rosemary would have been nice chopped up finely instead of big sprigs. Overall, the plate was very oily and greasy and it was definitely something I could whip up at home but it still hit the spot. I appreciate a relaxed diner that uses fresh and less-processed ingredients. Also, fun fact: in Phoenix unlike Portland or San Francisco, the waitstaff at a hipster diner are blond, tan, and in great shape. Everyone was extremely nice and we left to a literal chorus of "Bye! Thank you! Have a great day!"

This place is my favorite breakfast place in Arizona. The food is delicious and made with high quality ingredients, the atmosphere is perfect, and the service was prompt and friendly.   If you like breakfast, you'll love Matt's Big Breakfast. 12/10 would recommend.

Very nice experience.  We went about 1:30pm and there were no crowds to worry about.  Staff was very attentive and friendly.  Waffles were light and fluffy.  My husband loved the special which was an egg scramble with roasted peppers and andouille sausage thick slices of sourdough bread and house made strawberry preserves.  Would recommend trying.

Came to Phoenix for Spring Training from Los Angeles, this was an amazing breakfast! I ordered the waffle and I'd say it was the best waffle I have ever had. The place was quite a wait, but it was well worth it. The service was fast and the waiters were very friendly. Food was great! I would recommend Matt's Big Breakfast to anyone in Phoenix!
Great Place to Eat, LOVE to food, the area, the service is GREAT, Wish they were closer to me, or I was closer to them....  Thank You

I read about this place on Yelp and made it my mission to stop in before my flight on the last day of my trip. I thought I planned enough time, but with the July 4th holiday, the place was packed! Being packed is always a good sign and since I planned my time poorly, I almost didn't stay since there was a bit of a wait for a table. Since I was so determined to try their food, I ordered my meal to go. I got the cheese omelette with provolone, onions and roasted red peppers and an oj. The oj tasted so fresh, it was like it was from hand-squeezed oranges! I waited a bit for my omelette and started getting a bit nervous about making my flight. Right about when I was about to ask about my meal (maybe 15 - 20 mins since my order) it came out. I ran to the car to take off for the airport, but not before taking a bite. When I cut into my lovely omelette, it had mushrooms! There aren't many things I hate more I hate than mushrooms and I was so disappointed. Due to tight timing, I thought of just eating the home fries and sour dough toast and tossing the omelette, but decided to go back in and see if anything could be done. The host sincerely apologized and very sweetly promised to make it right. I explained I was in a super rush and she assured me it wouldn't be long. My meal was out so quickly, and I was so thankful. This time when I cut into my omelette it was perfect and was honestly one of the best brunch meals I've had in a long time. I am picky, but everything was perfect. I really appreciate a business that takes care of their customers and treats them with respect - THANK YOU. In addition, in the time I spent inside, I could see the staff hustling and interacting with every single customer. This seems like a great place for the locals and I would spend every Sunday here, if I lived in the area.
I love this place, if you are looking for a great breakfast spot check it out. The wait is a little long at times but well worth it! Best pancakes ever!

Matt's is my favorite breakfast spot. The food is amazing and you can taste the farm fresh ingredients. The only downside is that Matt's is extremely popular so plan on at least a 45 min wait during the weekend.

Great pancakes fresh beacon , and really good coffee !! They even gave us refills to go in to go cups !! Super sweet of them !! The black cherry homemade sausage was amazing and I'm not much of a sausage person but I loved it !! Only reason not 5 stars is because the wait can be crazy !!
$1.50 for a thimble size of extra syrup, yes you read that right syrup. Food was very good, never in my life have I been charged for syrup.

It's one of those mixed blessings.. do you eat/sample at the Farmer's Market or eat breakfast here first and then feel too full to impulse buy from the market later...  But if I'm driving 1/2 hr from EV to hit Phoenix's Farmer's Market, then it is totally worth the stop here.  This place is an awfully darn good breakfast joint that sources from locals... the last time I checked:  Bacon -- the Pork Shop in QC Jams -- Cotton Country Jams Coffee -- C4 aka Cave Creek Coffee Company Breads -- MJ (drool)

Never should have waited so long to finally experience Matt's Big Breakfast!!  My daughter is a flight attendant and was laying over in downtown Phoenix so I suggested we go to breakfast up the street from her hotel at Matt's. Waited outside about 15 minutes on a very busy Sunday.  As we entered the noise was extremely loud so conversation was not going to be the highlight of our meal.  But the food was so good we didn't need to talk, just enjoy the meal!  My daughter said the coffee was excellent and the OJ terrific.  I had the honey strawberry lemonade it is was refreshing.  We both ordered exactly the same breakfast, the hog and chick (bacon and eggs with home fries).  Dish was served with sour dough bread and fresh strawberry preserves, delicious!!  Our eggs were cooked perfectly, sunny side up.  The potatoes were to die for.  Tasty chunks of potatoes with fresh rosemary and onion, these are a must try if you eat here!  But the thick cut bacon was my favorite of all!!  Thick slices smothered in pepper and cooked perfectly, not burnt nor overly crispy, just enough where the bacon was fully cooked yet tender.  It was a bacon delight.  I'll be back without a doubt, still want to try the waffle with real maple syrup and more!  Great breakfast, thank's Matt's!!

It's always a gamble when I stop in at Matt's because the line is unpredictable.  However, the fact that there IS a line should tell you that this place is pretty stellar.  Because I'm a creature of habit, I don't normally order anything besides the special or the hog and chick.  You really can't go wrong with either.  Every dish is made with high quality ingredients.  I always rave to my friends about how the spinach in the special was the most spinachy spinach I've ever tasted (that's a good thing).  Thick slices of peppery bacon = party in my mouth.  Their caramelized onions tossed with perfectly crispy on the outside but soft on the inside potatoes are also a different yet equally awesome party in my mouth.  What gets me every time is their thick slice of toast and organic preserves.  SO GOOD.  And a coffee mug that's never empty, that's always a plus too.  Matt, I don't know who you are but your breakfasts are delightful.

Our first stop in Phoenix and super happy we came here for brunch! Simple rustic little restaurants with excellent service and food. We were in and out of there in 35 minutes but I can imagine the wait over the weekends here.  I ordered their Wednesday's special, sweet and savory dish...french toast and apple pork sausage. WOW was the French toast fluffy and tasty! Best I've ever had and pork sausage was delicious.  Bf ordered The Skinny, basically an egg white omelet with spinach and apple sausages with a side salad. A very healthy choice and that's exactly how it tasted. Lol.
This place is worth the wait! Excellent food, fantastic wait staff, great prices. Totally missing out of you go elsewhere. Upgrade your breakfast to off the bone ham, you won't regret it.....

First, Matt's "Big" Breakfast is quite an overstatement.  It's medium at best.  They also have no reasonable low carb options and everything comes with potatoes and toast.  No creamer for your coffee.  Seriously?  I don't mean they were out, I mean they don't provide it to their customers.  Ok so I'll have a soda.  Soda machine is broken.  I had the pork chop and eggs, and the steak knife they brought was by far the largest thing on the plate.  The chop had zero seasoning, was undercooked, tiny and chewy.  All this for $13.  Rip off.  The young lady who served us was very nice; she was the only positive aspect of this  experience and I will go hungry before ever going back to this place.

If you like waffles at all, then you have to come here. The waffle is like no other waffle I've ever had. The real maple syrup and heaping of butter don't hurt either. The side of bacon is always perfectly cooked, and balances out the sweetness of the waffle.  The hash browns, lemonade, and fresh jam are also must-haves. sure, the wait sucks but if you stick it out the food is well worth it!

Being in the Navy, I've faced two-hour lines for some of the worst meals our galley slaves can conjure up, since the other option was "starve", and walked away hungry. Back home in Phoenix, though, I'll happily pace back and forth for two hours outside Matt's Big Breakfast because I know in the end it'll be worth the wait.  Breakfast on a fall morning is a particular treat due to the presence of seasonal apple cider, which is phenomenal. Same with the blackberry preserves served with your side of toast. On my first visit, I ordered the day's special, an omelet stuffed with spinach and mushrooms, though couldn't help snitching from my mom's plate--she'd ordered the Chop and Chick, eggs served with a perfectly browned pork chop. The hash browns--my god. Studded with deposits of melted cheese that oozed out with every poke of my fork. Amazing.  I've only been once for lunch, but I can say without hyperbole that the Big Butter Burger is the best cheeseburger I've ever had. Cooked in rich creamery butter that calls to mind a particular episode of the Simpsons. BEST CORONARY EVER. I couldn't even complain about the presence of chips as opposed to french fries.  I really don't get the reviews dismissing Matt's as "meh", I'd love to know what heavenly manna these people consume the rest of the time

So I had been wanting to try this place. But, I have always been in such a hurry when I am at the airport I had not had time. The plus side is ,it is inside security so you don't have to worry about getting through Security. Which can always be stressful. It is a very popular place as it is on the low B gates and there is a lot of flights out of that side in the morning. I came here with a friend from Denver after coming in from a flight. So we were not rushed. It is a very clean looking place. A great menu to choose from as well.  I ordered the Steak and Eggs, just a note, they do not do poached. So I got scrambled. It was very good and the steak was cooked just the way I like it. My friend got potatoes ,eggs , and bacon. The food was delicious and cooked just right. It was hot when it came out and it came out fast. The only thing that makes me give it 4 stars instead of 5. Was our server. She never brought us more coffee.  Seriously we had to ask 2 other servers for more coffee. Which they brought us and with a smile.  Our server Alexa( I think that was her name). Did not seem too happy to be there and did not want us to have more than one cup of coffee.  The bright side is, Food is great, place is clean, and most all the other servers are awesome.

We heard about this from a friend and when I did a google search to find it I came across a video clip from "Diners, Drive-ins and Dives" on Youtube. They made it look yummy so I took my hubby there one weekday morning last week. The parking lot was full and there were about 6 people waiting outside. Take a timetravel trip back to the 40's or 50's...there is an old motel and attached to it is this little, TINY diner. You walk up to the door and add your own name and # in party to the paper on the cart by the front door. Find a seat on a bench, if you can. Oh, if you have to park on the street because the lot is full bring some quarters because the spaces are metered.  We waited about 15-20 minutes. When you go in there is a counter and tables for two around the outside wall. There is at least 1 table for 4 in the back.  I wanted to go here because they claim that they use all fresh ingredients "No freezer or microwave" and they use organic when possible. I saw the eggs being delivered and they were regular, not organic. When we were seated the waitress was right there to take our order. Since it was the first time we had been there we were a little slow, felt pressured because they want to turn the tables in this 7 top restaurant.  My hubby and I both ordered the "local, organic apple cider" at $3.95 per glass. It was an 8 oz glass so I felt that was steep! He ordered the bacon, eggs, hash browns and toast. The eggs were perfect, the bacon was limp- he asked for extra crisp, but it tasted good. The hash browns were a very large serving and crisp on the outside but very creamy, mushy on the inside, tasted good. The bread was homemade, 2 thick slices of cranberry walnut and he enjoyed it.  I ordered the waffle. It was a waffle, sprinkled with powdered sugar- which I can't stand and served with warm maple syrup. It came with 2 large slices of pepper bacon. It was all good, but with all the hype I was expecting more.   I saw a woman at the counter eating what I thought was eggs benedict so I asked the waitress. She said it was but that they had just run out! Boo hoo! I would have really enjoyed that! She said it is their special every Thursday and to come back. Now, I checked the website before we went and did not see this special or any others. If it is a weekly special I don't understand why it isn't on the website so people know.   I had to visit the ladies room. Now I have been to some out of the way places but this was really odd! You have to go out of the restaurant, into the hotel next door, wander down the hall...you can hear a tv, there is a no vacancy sign. There is a small sign for "Matt's customers", turn right (into a room) the restroom is a unisex bathroom in a hotel room. There is no waste basket for ladies and the hand towel is a real towel on the bar. It was vintage and clean but using the same towel as everyone else is NOT sanitary.  I would go again if I happened to be in the area, but I wouldn't go out of my way.

What Happened... Haven't been in a while and dreaming of Matt's, but was greeted with disappointment. Matt's to me has three things going for him... Great food, great food, and customer service.
