Well the latter is there,but the food...Got the special which is usually fantastic,but this time small portions and my home fries which are my favorite were cold and waxy. Matt what gives,the quality of the food just wasn't what I remember, I can only hope this was a one time thing... don't know what could've happened and you even went up on your prices.

Been wanting to come here since it was featured on Food Networks Diners, Drive-Ins& Dives. Guy Fieri knows good food so this was the first place I thought of when my parents wanted to grab breakfast in Phoenix. Luckily, on a Monday afternoon, we avoided the rush, and only waited 5 minutes! Score! Now on to the grub.  A lot of the food here is locally grown, they use cage-free eggs, and they even make their own jam/preservatives. I loved everything we ordered. Pancakes were different- they are very sweet- no need for any syrup. The hash browns were very good, but very heavy- and a bit soggy (which I actually prefer). The toast is large, freshly baked, and served with real butter. (nothing beats real butter!) My pork chop was very tasty and seasoned just right. Also, our server was a sweetheart, very helpful and patient.   Tip- try the homemade berry lemonade if available Tip- call ahead to find out about the wait- avoid the rush!  Tip- as mentioned in almost all other reviews, this place is very tiny- not a good for large parties or the claustrophobic.

Little disappointed in the menu selection also if you order pancakes bring your own syrup. The 2oz you get will hardly moisten the stack additional 2oz syrup costs an additional $1. Other menu items were good.

I loved this place. I found them on yelp because I wanted a diner. I went her 2 days in a row. The food, the staff and the vibes were spot on. If I enjoy my food and experience I always come back. Hopefully when I visit Phoenix again I can have a good ole breakfast.  The pancakes melt in your mouth and are responsibly priced. The sour dough bread with strawberry preserves was the best. Organic eggs. I loved this place!!!!!

I have been going to Matt's big breakfast since it opened up in that little tiny building. I remember when we could walk in and pick where we wanted to eat but that didn't last very long before everyone had their own experience and word spread fast just how amazing the food is and service has always been very pleasant.  I'm so happy that the moved to the other corner of the block for the larger location. The food is worth the wait  it's just to bad everyone else has to agree. If you are smart and a regular you can time the wait and do something else until you think you will be called next.

Four stars for Matt's Big Breakfast is high praise. I'm selective with my enthusiastic brunch recommendations. This is the kind of place that will appeal naturally to men.   Portions were large and lines were long. Even on a Monday morning at 9 am, we waited on a table for two seemingly forever before ultimately taking a seat at the bar. Judging by all the baseball paraphernalia on fellow patrons, Spring Training and the World Baseball Classic were clearly a major influencing factor on the crowds. Perhaps other times of the year will be slower? I can't imagine trying to land a table on a weekend.   As for the food, I liked my omelete but the hash browns were the standout. I am almost frightened by what must have been done to the hash browns to get them to taste so good.

Matt.....Hey Matt! Dude, way to go! Love the - Eat at Matt's on the outside wall. Decor is invitingly cool, service was fast and efficient. The food hit a home run, hash browns crunchy on both sides (hard to find anyplace that gets this right) thick cut peppered bacon to friggin die for, nailed the OE eggs and the WW buttered toast with what looked like homemade jam was amazing. Great Job and keep up the good work!

Been here twice ...and both times were worth the wait.  It is a tiny little place with nice, genuine staffers.  Both times I ordered their specials of the day...and both times...YUM!! One was a scramble with Anaheim chilies in it....delish!  The potatoes were scrumptious too!!  Do yourself a favor and check it out...if you can...go during the week...weekend waits can be pretty long!

Above average breakfast and will most likely be going back. The waffle was wonderful and the syrup was real. Fantastic thick cut bacon. One thing though it seems strange to me that biscuits and gravy is missing from the menu of a breakfast joint. Very busy place however we were seated quickly and service was quick.

Want a simple breakfast without doodads and sprinkles? Hate when people come clapping by your table to sing Happy Birthday to little Timmy in the booth behind you when all you want is some f-ing breakfast and coffee? Matt's is the place for you.   I had the pleasure of meeting Amy D for lunch here a while back. I must say I was seriously surprised how simple everything was. I don't know what I was expecting, but this is a pretty straightforward breakfast joint. For my breakfast, I had bacon, eggs, hash browns and 1 pancake that was large enough for two. I washed it all down with their honey sweetened lemonade, which I thoroughly enjoyed!   So why three stars? First of all, a three star rating is NOT a bad rating. Second, it's breakfast. There really is no way to mess up a simple breakfast. I definitely will go back to try their burgers and maybe I'll boost my rating.   Matt's is A-OK in my book and I look forward to going back!

Good food that gets to your table fairly quickly. The staff seems to work hard. Big negative- long lines and minimal waiting area (especially in extreme weather). My advice- go during off peak/non-weekend hours or don't bother (unless you enjoy waiting 60+ minutes for breakfast). I've been twice now and probably won't be back.

Googled best breakfast in Phoenix and this place  popped up, saw Guy F's review from April this year and it was good so we gave it a try this morning. It is easy to miss because it is so small. It had awesome service, was very fresh and tasty but disappointed because they only have RC Cola ( no refills) and not a huge menu but overall it was good. The special was awesome with home fries, around $8, my son got the waffle ( only get 1) with 2 bacon for around 8-9$ and my husband got 3 pancakes for about 9$ as well. You only get a small amount of syrup so an extra side is $1.50 ( too pricy for 3 pancakes). Bill was $28.00 and I think too much for what we got. The food was good, had to give it a try. Would never wait for more then a few minutes to eat there.

This place is always on wait, but well worth your time. After being discovered by Diners, Drive in and Dives, this place is jam packed. I love their pancakes and peppered bacon. MMM...my mouth is watering just thinking about it! Yum!
Yum Yum Yum. The pancakes are the best and that peppered bacon is to die for. Go just go and you will see why it's the best.
Great place for breakfast, get there early! We sat at the bar and had a quickly served delicious meal. Fresh orange juice rounded out the home fries, eggs and pan seared chop just like on DDD!

I am a big breakfast person. My day rises and falls according to the quality of the breakfast. Mat''s is one of those places where I am going every Saturday morning now. After you eat there, you have a good clean feeling instead of the gross Denny's greasy feeling after you eat their breakfast. I always get the Hog & Chick and man oh man...the best thing I love about this place is the toast. Sourdough toast and it comes with homemade preservatives. It is awesome!

Visiting for the holiday weekend. Had to try out the place after seeing it on Triple D... Not at all disappointed- fresh farm to table concept. Even the most basic foods was perfect from the eggs to the baked bread. Thanks for the Triple D and Yelp tips. I'm glad we came- will come back again and again.

Not only is this one of my favorite breakfast spots in Phoenix, it's probably one of the most recommended ones I tell everyone to go to when they have family/friends in town.   My wife and I usually get the 5 Spot, this delicious breakfast sandwich that I could easily eat every day. Then we'll typically get the special and split that, so we're always trying something new and the special has never let us down yet. I wish I could say some of the specials we ordered but I'm bad at remembering things.   Yes there can be a wait, but it's always nice out in the morning, they have a great outdoor seating area and your in an awesome part of Downtown Phoenix. If it's Saturday morning you can even walk over to the Public Market and grab some fresh produce or goods of your own.   Once inside, service is fast, almost too fast. I'm always surprised at how fast they bring out the food. They have these small coffee mugs but they never get empty because staff is always checking on you. It gets a little loud inside but we're always able to keep up great conversation with our table of 5 or 6.   So great food, atmosphere, neighborhood and a spot we'll always be going to!

I love Matts and feel everything about this place is IMPECCABLE. But unfortunately the small capacity seating and over an hour waiting in line ALWAYS turns me away.  Id be around more often if I wasn't wasting my weekends sitting on a hot bench.

We had a long wait for a table at Matt's Big Breakfast recently, but the food and service were worth it.  I had the Skinny, which is made with four egg whites and chicken apple sausage and comes with a small side salad.  My guy had the Chop & Chick, which is made with eggs and pork chops.  The food was really tasty, and the price was very reasonable.  We shall return!

The bacon served here is something special.  However, this place not only has big breakfasts it also has big waits.  The waits are to be expected with such an establishment, but once you reach your seat... well it is not a comfortable one.  The seating is too hard and the set-up does not support a leisurely weekend breakfast with friends...  a yummy breakfast... yes... but not a leisurely one.  Nevertheless, give it a try and enjoy the bacon.

Food was awesome!! The wait was about 20 minutes, They gave us coffee and added it to our bill. ( we asked) The service is why I give 4 stars. It is super busy!! And I had to ask a few times for refills/ water... But that's expected with such a crowd. I loved the energy of this place and the atmosphere was positive!!

DIVINE WAFFLES. I have had amazing food every time I have come. Except for the bacon..... unless you like pepper I would skip. Cool vibe, the wait is worth the waffles. But I have had bad experiences with the manager, very snippy and rude. The waitresses are so nice though. Would recommend for food not service .

We went around 8 am on a Thursday, and we had immediate seating. The coffee was amazing. We had the eggs benedict, which were quite good and the hashbrowns were extremely crisp. I had the waffles which melted in my mouth. The batter was not salty but sweet. We were really impressed. Matt's has a tiny parking lot next to the building but parking can be a problem.
It was organic ingredients which is always a plus but I wasn't to thrilled with there choices or what we got. Not sure what the fuss is all about, might have to give it another shot.

Been to the location at the Airport, which was great.  Thought we would try this location, staff was friendly and quick food not so much.  Extremely limited menu hash browns were greasy and burnt.  Ordered toast Which was burnt beyond saving asked for new 2nd order came out just as bad gave up.  Going to I hop next time
I'm partial. There is just noooo place better for authentic, organic, delicious breakfast and lunch items in Arizona. Love, love MBB's!
Typical breakfast place, but I would recommend it to anyone! Food is delicious, the servers are usually doting and kind.   I know there are a couple locations, so try both!

Ok, so I have heard all the hype over Matt's and just never thought to go, as I don't usually have the patience to wait 2 hours to eat.  Fortunately, the missus and I had this morning off together and thought it might be easier to get in for breaky.  The wait was about 15 minutes when we got there, which is nothin.  We were seated at the table why the window and were greeted promptly.  I had a coffee and we both had fresh squeezed oj.  We both opted for the cheese omelette with mushrooms and onions, I had whole grain toast and she had sourdough that was served with house-made preserves (the bread, I learned, comes from Wildflower Bakery) and it was soooo effing good!  The hashbrowns were magical, all golden brown delicious on the outside and soft and gooey in the middle. We also shared a waffle for a breakfast-style dessert.  It was very good and I will definitely go back for more!!

This is another place I've seen on Triple D on FoodTV.  The breakfast definitely lives up to it's name - Big Breakfast.  The portions are pretty hearty.  The only downside to this place is it's really, really small and the wait can be very, very long.

Greasy spoon diner, had the tuna with potato chips and without the bread. It needed a little more mayo, but overall good it came with a pickle.   We did wait outside for about 30 minutes to get a table. They have a water dispenser with lots of ice and lemon wedges to keep you hydrated in that Phoenix sun.   Worth the wait, good hangover food. Only wish they had a liquor licence , sometimes momma needs hair of the dog.

Went to breakfast at Matt's this morning. Walked in and there was a bunch of people bustling around, but I don't think it was very clear where you check in. Hostesses didn't make any eye contact or greet us when we walked in the door.   Seems like a lot of hype for something that wasn't that special. It was all just simple food that tasted fine. It was a nice atmosphere, but very loud. If you are looking to have a good conversation with the person sitting across from you, this is not the place to go. Just tasted like breakfast cooked at home...except more boring. Moderately inexpensive, but probably won't go back. Service was great though!

In the movie "The 40-Year Old Virgin," there is a line they repeat often to Steve Carrell: "You're putting the pu$$y on a pedestal, that's your problem!"  Matt's Big Breakfast was on a pedestal. We'd tried to go there a couple years ago, but the crowd outside was always too threatening a wait. Then, in August, we tried to go, but when we asked "What's the probable wait time?" We were told, "Oh we don't really provide anyone with wait times." The line outside was pretty long, and there wasn't really any shade, and with no potential end to the wait, we came to terms with the possibility that we'd turn into bacon ourselves sitting outside waiting for a table.   Then this morning I woke up at 6:30am on a Saturday due to insomnia and we said "Hey there might actually not be a line if we go right now."  I just came back from breakfast at Matt's Big Breakfast and now I'm waiting for my heart attack.  I'd tried to find out what the big deal was about this greasy spoon so many times in reviews, and nobody ever gave a good explanation in detail of what makes the "traditional breakfast food" so "different."  I ordered the special - which was an egg, cheese, onion and sausage omelette, with hash browns. Since it was our first time there, we also ordered a belgian waffle to split.  The omelette was more like "Onion and Sausage with a side of egg and cheese." The sausage was giant sliced links, enough to feed an army. The amount of onion was not what I expected - it was probably two entire onions sliced up and thrown in there. The hash browns are a serving for 4 people or something. They're not sliced like ordinary hash browns are sliced - they're ultra skinny slices like angelhair pasta. There are a lot of really crunchy crispy areas of angelhair sliced hash browns which are tasty. Thankfully, they are not all salty. But what sort of human can ingest this much potato in one sitting?  I'm one year away from having been a vegetarian for 5 years, and I was willing to "go there" at this meal because I had to see what everyone was raving about, and I read on the menu that the meat is natural and grain-fed. Not free-range, grass-fed, but at least not corn-fed and hormonalized and antibiotic-ridden. Also, I eat burgers at Delux and Rokerij and I'll eat the prosciutto at Bomberos. So I thought, why not see what the fuss is all about?  It was a'ight. Not FABULOUS. I tried to figure out why this place is SUCH a big deal to so many. Maybe it is shocking to some people's palates to taste food made with real butter and real cream - people who ordinarily cook at home and fill their cupboards with the healthy substitutes of every ingredient. Or maybe typical people buy Kraft cheese or something, I don't know. The ingredients were definitely "real," which is, I suppose, a big deal if you ordinarily eat Crap for breakfast or eat at Denny's. It most definitely beats "Moons Over My Hammy" for instance.  But we really missed Pallate, which really WAS the best breakfast downtown.  The bread they brought for the toast was delicious ... but it's BREAD. Most bread is pretty good. The waffle was uber fluffy. I had a few bites and said "That's a tasty plate of diabetes right there," while I felt my blood sugar go through the roof.  Mostly, I really felt a lack in the vegetables department.   I might seem like a health nut, because of this, but trust me, I'm not. I'm a tall, big person and I eat breakfasts at Dick's Hideaway several times a week. It's just that at Dick's Hideaway I can have them substitute the potatoes for veggies (usually asparagus and broccoli), and substitute the meat in the breakfast burrito with avocado. I'm used to having an entire day's worth of greens at breakfast. I suppose meat, for me, is like dessert: I'll eat it but it has to be high quality, and it has to be really worth it. It has to be tremendously delicious, I won't eat meat for meat's sake. This was probably somewhat ethical meat, but it wasn't an irresistible herby or spicy delicious sensation.  The "thick-cut bacon" that came with the waffle was definitely thick, and was lined with pepper. It was good, but it was also bacon ... bacon SHOULD be good, it's hard to do bad.  I see the trendy hipster appeal everywhere - orange countertops, orange everywhere, down to the stapler on the counter, the 1950's signs that say "Eggs!" and stuff. Whatever. I get it, it's better than Denny's, and it's better than 5 & Diner. It's NOT "The Best" and it's most definitely not worth standing around outside in no shade, without any idea how long the wait will be for a table, like a sucker.  The chalkboard on the wall inside says "Visit our bar The Roosevelt around the corner." I hadn't known they own the Roosevelt. I recommend going to the Roosevelt and waiting around for a seat there, where it's worth the wait.  I'm glad I finally went, to knock the place off its pedestal. Now I just need to wait like a month or something for my arteries to un-clog.

I wasn't sure about this place at first. Reading through the menu, I flipped it over several times looking for the rest of it. It's a short menu. My belief is that if you have a small menu, then whatever you do make, better be good. And this was. I liked my breakfast sandwich- the bacon was nice and thick and the sandwich was big and filling. Potatoes had rosemary in them which I'm usually not a fan of but I actually liked it this time. Hubby had a waffle which I took a bite out of (of course) and it was delish. The prices are decent enough. Will return.
I am not sure what the big deal is. The food is good but nothing was spectacular. If you have to wait more than 15 minutes I would go somewhere else.

So after we went hiking in south mountain park we couldn't find any place to eat that was open at 6:30 am! So we searched and found this place. It was absolutely amazing! I couldn't believe how great everything tasted! It was by far the best place we had for breakfast in our entire trip! I had the breakfast sandwich the brad was soooo good and soft mmmmmm. The thick cut bacon was to die for. Although they could've added an extra strip or two. And I had my eggs potched it was amazing I wish I lived in Phoenix I would go here every morning! I also had some seasoned potatoes with mushrooms and onions! Idk how they seasoned it but it tastes like as if it was seasoned with smoke sausage!!! And don't get me started on their lemonade!!! I had the blueberry honey lemonade! DELICIOUS!!!!! when I tell you you would be craving that as much as I am now!!! I hesitated getting it to go because that'll be another $3.50 but I had to it was soooooooooooooo good!!

After an early/long drive from Anaheim to Phoenix, my wife and I desperately searched Yelp for a great breakfast place. Thankfully, Matt's jumped to the top of the search and we headed to the restaurant.   We were greeted by some friendly faces and quickly grabbed a couple spots at the bar facing the window. We were waited on VERY quickly and we both tried the Strawberry Honey Lemonade. That truly hit the spot after getting hit in the face with 115 degree weather.  My wife ordered the special, Eggs Benedict and I had the Salami and Eggs scramble. The food came out REAL fast and boy am I glad it did. Everything had that "home cooked" taste. The salami and eggs had that salty deliciousness you'd expect from a dish like that. The hash browns were extra crispy with the right amount of seasoning. What I'm still craving (12 hours later) is the fresh baked sourdough bread with the homemade strawberry jam! I could eat a loaf of that and be one happy (and fat) Yelper.   My wife's Eggs Benedict was also incredibly well put together and tasty. The English muffins were thick and crispy and the Canadian bacon was generously cut.   Next time we're in Phoenix, we definitely want to try out the lunch options. Great work!!!
Will be back.  Good portions, terrific service. The food is well sourced and excellently prepared.  Best.Bacon.Ever!!
Amazing food, as advertised. Thick cut black pepper bacon was some of the best bacon I've ever had. Busy place with a bit of a wait, but worth it. Going to the Camelback location next.
Amazing breakfast. Just as good as Tempe location and just as busy. Waffle was outstanding.

The food here is amazing. Their specials are usually the best thing on the menu! The bacon is extra crispy and thick, which I love. The eggs are great and usually accompanied with sausage, cheese and whatever else you'd like. There's a jalapeo and eggs special that is to die for if you like a little kick in your food. The only downside to this place is that there is always a wait (30-45 min) on weekends to be seated. But it's worth the wait. Also, they don't serve mimosas but you won't care about that once you've tried the food.

My new favorite place! From the bottomless coffee, to the service, everything was great. The wheat bread, and home fries are amazing. Our server, was very helpful, and super sweet. Definitely coming back!

We were visiting AZ this past weekend, and decided to try Matt's based on all of the great YELP reviews.  After an hour of waiting outside in the rain, the host called our name and said, "we'll be seating you shortly" and handed us menus.  He then came out 5 minutes later and said he was going to take our orders so he could get the kitchen started.  When we were finally seated (at the counter - not even a table) our food was served in about 10 minutes.  It was good (a little greasy) but I would never again wait an hour for breakfast.  Also, they don't have a bathroom in the facility.  You have to go next door!

Great tasting food and coffee. Their place has gotten to be too loud. We noticed that it can be so loud in there with so many people sitting and talking that we have to talk loud to be able to hear each other. I don't recommend going there if you need to talk to your friend. I do recommend their food and coffees.

Good Lord, is this place overrated!  Anyone from the Northeast or mid-Atlantic could name about 50 Greek Diners that serve up breakfast favorites with better quality, larger portions and much lower prices 24 hours/day! I feel so sorry for people in Arizona who don't know how they're being ripped off. The fact that this place ONLY serves Eggs Benedict on Thursday and ONLY serves steak and eggs on Sunday is a pathetic joke. There is NOTHING on their menu you couldn't get at Denny ' s for a much lower price. What you're paying for at this place is fake cool minimalist artsy atmosphere and nothing more.
Everything was excellent, delicious ingredients and well prepared. We ordered the waffles, salami scramble and chipotle sausage scramble. Service was efficient.  Coffee was just ok.
This place was delicious! My husband and I came here for brunch. The eggs Benedict was amazing.

I came in this restaurant at 5:50 a.m. there was probably five or six people that work here walking around. Every last one of them walk right by me pretty much did not give me eye contact nor even say good morning. One young lady walk right by me and walk to the other side of the restaurant to help someone. It gets so old coming into an establishment to give your hard earned money and just be blatantly ignored. Finally I asked a young Lady,"hey, can anyone even see me here!!" The Manager Desi walked by and asked was everything ok, I said absolutely not!! You have 5 people includifee yourself that saw me come in and no one even said good morning!! Not to mention everyone simply ignored me!! I told the manager Desi this is totally unacceptable not to mention I am an Airline employee, also I frequent the first Matt's Big Breakfast downtown for years. Then her attitude changed a little. Truly this is not a good way to start your day or to spend your hard-earned money for breakfast. I could not figure out what was so different about me ...I can only guess!!....after all that I had to ask for water, more Coffee, wow!!!!

Well I have heard the hype, seen it on DDD and viewed the lines wrapped around the block. A few friends raved about this place. I should have taken note to "who" of my friends were raving about it. They tend to eat anything.  I will not say the food is bad. It is actually good. However, nothing that requires this much attention. I grew up in NYC and we had tons of great diners serving bkfst, lunch, dinner and late late night meals. The food is freshly made. The most impressive thing on my visit was the fresh squeezed o.j. It was perfect.  The menu is small and I swear they don't have a green veggie or fruit in that place. It is carb and fat overload. The portions are huge. But I know this is what some people like and what they go for.  I was bamboozled by a friend into going here. He suggested lunch and was paying. Of course I will be gracious and go where he wants to go. I guess a part of me wanted to see what all the hype was about.   I don't usually eat this type of food, which might be the problem right there. I don't get excited off plates full of pork, flour, syrup, carbs and more carbs. After waiting 30 mins or so I was hungry and decided that I will pay for the meal ltr by a kick butt hike. Well lets just say no hike happened. I took an extended nap ltr that day. That heavy food sucked the living energy out of me for two days. Ohh Matt your big breakfast was so not for me.   If this is your kind of food I am sure you will enjoy it. If you don't eat this way often be prepared to feel like you ate a ton of bricks the next few days.

Looked up great breakfast places in Phx. We checked out Matts. Worth the hype. The Belgian waffle with thick cut bacon. Oh that bacon! Cheddar omlette with roasted peppers and More bacon. Perfectly cooked rosemary onion house fries. The strawberry jam was just right. The staff was super nice and brought our food out in five minutes. Delicious!

Honestly, I was disappointed with my trip to MBB. Ever since I moved here, I have heard amazing things about this place and was so stoked when my friend and I came in for breakfast. I ordered an egg sandwich--which was good and I liked. But I also ordered a side of potatoes--they were covered in oil and an excessive amount of rosemary. The potatoes were completely inedible. When the manager came around to ask how our food was, he looked surprised when I told him the potatoes were inedible to me and had too much rosemary; he politely acknowledged me and told me he'd check with the cook(s) about it. When the bill came, I was surprised to see that I was still charged for the potatoes that I did not like and/or eat. I had to find the manager and politely ask him to remove them from my bill, and he did. It was decent customer service once I had to go out of my way to find someone, but honestly I don't want to go back. Not worth it when Phoenix is a city filled with brunch/breakfast places far better than this.

Met friends for breakfast this morning and was sadly disappointed.  I expected the 30 minute wait, but did not expect the over cooked eggs.  Now I did ask for crispy bacon and crispy hashbrowns and neither came out that way.  Maybe it was just a bad day, but I do not expect I will go back again.

Stopped in while traveling for work. On the downside, the atmosphere isn't great/comfortable, but the staff are friendly and the Monday breakfast special was delicious. If I were in the area again I would stop in, but wouldn't go out of my way for it
Great food! Had the special scramble of the day. Husband had the eggs with bacon (which was incredible) and hash browns. Will be back!

While popular, we were still able to get a seat at the bar pretty quick for a Saturday morning. I'm surprised it wasn't a longer wait to be seated!  The scrambled eggs were the best my girlfriend had had and my ham, green chile, and jack cheese scramble (their special for the day) was exceptional.  The homefries and hash browns were both fantastic and the toast was great. Probably one of the best breakfasts out I've had in a long time. Definitely going to go back next time I'm in town.
Very concise menu for breakfast but covers most of the bases. The waffles were good but the bacon was fantastic! The scrambled egg special with chorizo was great. We will be back.

The first time I came to this place I found hair in my food. Which I was disgusted but since its so close to my job I decided to give it another chance. But this last time was horrible. I come in following behind me is a group of white people. I come to the counter to pay for my food. I called in my order and the waiter looked right over my head as if I wasn't there and proceeded to help the group of white people that entered behind me. Needless to say I walked out and wont be going there ever again. Which is unfortunate because they do have a waiter there that I really enjoy

basically i dont give a rat's **s on what the majority say i have never been treated like this in my life! saw it on foodnetwork, we just moved to az a month ago from los angeles. so after a 2 hr wait and it rained.....we were seated and for $4 we get a teeny cup of oj fresh squeezed i might add. we get the waffles with potatoes and thick bacon. it was ok but not worth the wait w/ kids! i didnt tip her becuz she just acted snippy. but we spent $47 so oh well. she comes running out the store like we stole something! was everything ok? (loud as ever) nevermind its a crowd waiting oiutside..she says rather loud...u didnt tip my server i said lady get out of my face u actlike i didnt pay the bill. its gratuity and there was no gratitude. i said your millionares after that show ...damn b&^%$# i will never go back. i also disputed the charge becuz she has the nerve to add 4 dollars in the tip line that i presigned. sheesh!

Not sure what's going on in the kitchen, but it shouldn't take over an hour to make "scratch Belgian waffles". Then I spectate other people wait in line, ordered their food, eat their food, and walk off while I'm still waiting for my order to go.

I'm not sure why I didn't have great time here. I'll describe my experience and you can decide. I came in and it was pretty busy. Came on a Monday morning too. But by myself, they gave me a quick seat by the window. My server came and I was a little caught off guard cause she was really cute, actually all the girls that work there are really cute but this one had a big rack and was demonstrating her cleavage wide and loud. I got it, I know it makes her better tips but for some reason it just rubbed me the wrong way and I think I just got really bad vibes from her. I'm here to have breakfast not ogle cleavage. And this is a family place too. Yeah, I know, what does this have to do anything about the food?  Well, I got the hog and chick (with home fries) and ordered the strawberry honey lemonade. She said they were already out (it was 0900!) so I opted for the blueberry lemonade. Well my meal came I start eating. First, I kinda thought my eggs would be bigger, they're not, they're like normal sized eggs. I don't know, is it too much to expect extra jumble eggs at a place called Matt's Big Breakfast? I ordered the thick cut bacon with it and it's good but overcooked. The bacon's almost burnt, actually it is slightly burnt and I'm pretty sure that's the style here, look at all other pictures. That's not the best way to serve bacon. And I like my food slightly burnt but this isn't the best way to serve thick bacon. It being burnt takes away a lot of the flavor especially with thick bacon. It's almost a crime. The home fries, everyone says how good they are. They're not. Why? Because they're cut too thick. They're mixed with rosemary while being cooked and other seasoning which is awesome but because they're cut so thick, you taste more potato than anything else. It almost makes the seasoning non existent. That's not good home fries. Might as well just cut up really thick fries and serve them.   Finally, my server forgot my drink completely. Never served it. I told her as I brought her my bill. She offered to put it in a to-go cup but I declined. At this point I just wanted to leave. So the food was just ok but I think that server really put me in a foul mood. I don't know, I really need to go back and give this place another try. Probably with another server, lol!

During one of our Spring Training trips, we stopped by here for breakfast on Guy Fieri's recommendation on Diners, Driveins and Dives. The place gets packed and it's a small little area, so expect to wait at least an hour. We waited for 90 minutes before we got in on a Sat morning...  Well worth the wait! Ben had their omelet scrabble special with spinach, cheese and sausage. I had a simple scrabble eggs with sausage. Obviously, I liked Ben's dish WAY better. We ordered a side of their peppered bacon, they were thick and juicy and DELICIOUS! Ben was in love with their home fries, the hint of rosemary really added to the favor. Their pancakes and french toast looked good too, but we were too stuffed to try it.  We are going back on our next Spring Training trip! Definitely a must try, but like everyone said, be prepared to wait a LONG time.
Everything is delicious but I have a question for you guys: why you don't put all those dishes from the special weekly menu on the regular menu? I really wanted those Huevos Rancheros this morning :(

I was looking for a place to eat in the airport and even though this place only has 3.5 stars overall I decided to give it a chance. I ordered everything ala carte because there was no combo that actually matched what I wanted. I had two eggs, a pancake, and homefries. Everything was DELICIOUS. The pancake was nice and thin and barely needed syrup or butter. The homefries were amazing and the eggs cooked perfect. Total came out to around $14 incl. tip which isn't too bad. I would go back again.

I've been here before and I did not remember, somehow, that the breakfast food here is amazing. The bacon and patty sausage are the best I've ever had. I'd describe the bacon as being marinated and slow-smoked under and angel's wing. It's that good. The eggs are perfect, the greens were delightful. This place was 5+ stars!

Still our favorite breakfast place.   The airport just isn't quite as good as the original. But it's close.  The hog and chick here with the ham is just the best choice in town.  We keep coming back, if you can get in without waiting an hour it's even better.  A real gem.    Thank you Matt!

This was one of the best brunches I've had anywhere. The servers were very knowledgeable and eager to share their opinion on what's best on the menu. Honestly, everything looked appealing. The portions are fair, the prices even fairer, and the food all excellent. My waffle with two slices of bacon was the best waffle and best bacon I've had. Bacon was thick, not too fatty, and perfectly charred. Waffle had texture and crisp. Real maple syrup on the side :) The special chorizo, jalapeno scramble was nice and hot and spicy! Definitely coming back.

Every bit as good as what you've come to expect from Matt's Big Breakfast but in newer and bigger digs! Team service never leaves you hanging, anyone can get anything for you and everyone is super friendly. The food is as good as the day they opened, still wish they had the green eggs and ham though! Will be back as it is closer and did I mention bigger, with a lovely patio to boot!

The food at Matt's Big Breakfast is pretty great. I defy you to find a better omelette anywhere in town.  However...  I don't know why they had to go ahead and screw up perfectly good food with such terrible service.  Do not go to Matt's if you are thirsty. It takes forever to get your drinks and forget about re-fills. The waiters all act like you are bothering them if you ask for anything. The act like the good food gives them carte blanche to drop the ball on service entirely. Also - STOP using so much OIL. Yucky!  ***Edited on 10/07 to add the following: The staff at Matt's must be reading all the Yelp's about their poor service because I went back there today and they were really NICE! It was the first time they have ever been so attentive, quick and nice. And they were not just nice to me. They were nice to everyone. It was awesome! There is one kind of bitchy, slow, mean waitress who was not there today - so maybe everyone is in a better mood on her day off. I hope this trend of excellent service at Matt's continues. It it does I will re-Yelp with only positive things to say. Except...still...chill out with the oil!

Love this place! Delicious food, cool vibe, friendly service. Amazing cheese omelette..their strawberry jelly is to die for and mouth watering waffles..even their toast was delicious! Highly recommend this place. I'm making it a tradition every time I visit Phoenix :)

i have been going to the OG Matt's in Phoenix for years and this new location did not disappoint. attentive service, bright and open interior and food absolutely on par with the quality i have always enjoyed from Matt, Ernie and crew. grateful for a location close to home!

I normally have enjoyed Matt's Big Breakfast, particularly their coffee. Had time before a flight this morning to grab a cup of coffee after making the trek from gate C. Stood in line at Matt's Takeaway only to be told I could not purchase the plain, black coffee I have always been able to enjoy when sitting down for breakfast at their airport location. This seemed odd to me, so I clarified, receiving the same response without any explanation as to why this was the case. Seems odd to me they can sell only coffee with cream and sugar added. Based off of this, I can't recommend them for an early cup of joe at the airport.

*****reader note: i rate based on ambiance and yumminess of food. i never consider service in my rating (no matter how bad or good)******  Typical brunch place. Nothing special really. Come if you want something solid without cooking, but honestly you're better off saving your money and time. Food ain't bad just not worth it.   Food: 3/5 Ambiance: 3/5 Service: 4/5 (not factored in ratings)  Worth it?  Nah fam

This place is your typical American diner. Great hash browns, their jalepeno scramble is super good. Fresh squeezed OJ and their bread with their home made fresh blueberry jam was delicious! I will bring my boyfriend here before I leave AZ.

i was a bit skeptical after reading some of the less stellar reviews. but i have to say, it really depends if you appreciate the small touches to cooking that make the difference between ok food and absolutely thoughtfully executed food.   for example, some people say the hash brown potatoes are just no big deal. but if you've ever tried to cook them, it's hard to get the perfect combination of crunchy on the exterior and soft-almost fluffy on the interior.  and this level of execution follows all the way through to the eggs, the choice of peppery bacon (often called millionaire's bacon in san francisco), and coffee.   if you have cooked breakfast, are not easily fooled by heavy buttery sauces, and look for excellent technique and execution, this place is worth the wait. so grateful to have found this in phoenix.

Awesome. Had the 5 Spot: egg, bacon, grilled onions on a roll. Also had a pancake on the side and an ice tea. Full of deliciousness. This place is truly wonderful. I'd be a regular if I lived in Phoenix. The Sunday morning B'fast line was long but well worth the wait. Clearly full of regulars.

Really good airport food. I've eaten here a few times since it has a great location amongst the American Airlines gates. They have pretty great food and the only comment I have is that the service is spotty. Overall I've had good service but the last few visits the tables around me have gotten their food first, even if it was the same as my order. All in all I will definitely go back, but don't stop to eat in if you have less than an hour to spend.

This place is awesome!!!  I am a die-hard fan of Robert's in Tucson but this is the first place that gives them a run for their money.  Homemade thick slabs of bread served with fresh strawberry jam and an egg scramble with spinach and havarti = breakfast heaven.  This place is tiny and I'm sure gets packed as we went on a Tuesday morning and there was a small wait but it's so worth it!

Truthfully, I just don't get the obsession with Matt's. While the food is good, it is just basic breakfast food. Meanwhile, there are always ridiculous wait times?? Another Yelper cited Matt's as "[The] best American breakfast joint in AZ"--I've been here a few times and each experience is lack-luster. Maybe I'm ordering the wrong dishes?? I usually order eggs; any recommendations fellow Yelpers? What am I missing? Ha! Further, I preferred their old, tiny location, which gave them more charm than their new, darker location. Neverthless, it's not that Matt's has bad food nor does it have bad service, it's just not wow-ing me.
OMG, the best. Fresh everything, I was there when they were in the smaller building. But, still as good. Well worth the wait.

Today's experience was a little so/So, kind wasn't the greatest, come to Matt's breakfast if you want an overly packed restaurant with not enough seating, also get ready for a pretty plain breakfast menu! It's a basic restaurant with kind of high prices for something so basic.   Also embrace yourself for shitty service. The manager is a rude fat women that I'm my opinion stares people down as the pay to eat there, other employees weren't attentive, shitty service.   As for the food it was ok.

Passed through here with enough time for a sit down lunch...had the Hog and Chick with ham steak (plus an extra ham steak because it is just that good)  It is honestly almost coming to the Phoenix airport just to hit Matts.  I don't like potatoes usually but I will clean the plate with Matts potatoes, just the right amount of fresh rosemary and onion.  Great sourdough toast, delicious raspberry jam.    And the ham!   Just please do yourself a favor and get the ham.  This is what you think about when you think ham, salty, smoky, crisp and soft all at the same time.  Can't wait to fly through terminal four again.

I work at the State Farm building that is connected to this Matt's Big Breakfast and wow I am very impressed! The food is amazing always! And the staff is so friendly.. I am greeted with a friendly hello every time I walk through the door by either Daniel, Asia, or the manager Jason. Jason is always helpful if I ever have questions about the menu and Asia does a great job explaining the specials for the day. If I get a to-go order Daniel is always a big help! Excellent location! I keep going back!
Good food but like the old location better. The metal chairs are very loud and annoying to listen to all the time. Food is good as it always has been.

Great cup of coffee, best waffle I've ever had, got there just in time to beat (most of) the breakfast rush. My husband got a steak & eggs special. I loved that their water glasses are recycled jelly jars, coincidentally the kind we purchase and now we will be using at home. I can't wait to go back.

This is our favorite place to go for breakfast. It is so delish however, it's not the healthiest food, so be advised. The wait time is usually a bit high but the service is super fast. From the time we ordered, it was only around 10 minutes until our food came out. My boyfriend and I would totally recommend this place!  From My Boyfriend: ...but he didn't even mention the real maple syrup you can use to dip your peppered bacon in, or the fluffy waffles, or the kickass rosemary potatoes with onions and butter, or the thick cut toast with homemade preserves! This place is truly special... just watch your waist line!

Well known and busy Matt's is a fabulous place to eat.  Be prepared to wait but today we only waited about 10 min.  They are efficient and the food is so good.  I've only been here on a weekend and I have been to both locations a few times. No trip to PHX is complete without Matt's!

LOVE, LOVE, LOVE that I didn't have to wait on a Sunday for an hour to get me some Matt's. I will be back. Once upon a time in the original location I was quoted an hour & half wait. This time upon arrival I was told we don't give wait quotes but you've only got 4 in front of you. So we waited a minor 10 minutes & were happily eating in another 10. So we aren't early risers by any means so it was more like lunch time & the eggs bene was all gone. Sad faces but hey it's our fault for staying up too late. You know the whole early bird blah blah.

Perfectly cooked pork chop with eggs and home fries, sourdough toast was a perfect compliment. Had to get the side of bacon, well worth it. Everything was great! Nothing much else to say but try it! You won't regret it.
Perfect!! Order matched instructions. Nice, clean location.  And Blakey is a great waitress!!
they have a few of the Matt's in the Phoenix are.  they are open for breakfast and early lunch.  food is good but sometimes prepare for a wait. Danny

I was excited to try after all the hoopla. Seriously disappointed. For the price I had extremely high expectations. The staff & service was great...but my particular order was.   Well..Tasteless. I had the pork chop. It was dry. My potatoes & toast, burned. And since I HATE the flavor of rosemary...double whammy for the papas. I had a to go order so, my bad. Probably won't go back. I can get potatoes & eggs anywhere.

I'm a huge fan of the food here.  It's all good.  Breakfast sanwich , the hog and chick, the butter burger, the list goes on and on.  All made with fresh, lucally sourced ingredience.   Darnell Dockett was in for Breakfast today.  Peppered bacon, and homemade preserves are to die for

Not one to write reviews, but I felt people should know that this place isn't all it's cracked up to be. First of all, the menu is very limited and doesn't leave many options to choose from even for the simplest meal of the day. I got the waffle with bacon and I asked for strawberries with that. Instead of strawberries I received what looked like strawberry jam. The bacon was covered in black pepper-not very appetizing. The service was okay, but I couldn't tell you who my server was as three different people greeted me, served my food, and took my check. Overall, not the best breakfast place in town. I would much rather go elsewhere in the future.

Ehh it was ALRIGHT ! The honest were very nice. I chose this place because of the what seemed great prices, then when I started ordering I realized it's one of those places that charge you for every little thing. I got charged an additional $1.50 JUST for some syrup. Like you're a breakfast spot cmon who does that? And if you're a syrup lover like me it's kind of a big deal. I'd probably go back but VERY rarely

Salami scramble--that is all.   (Chicken sausage is just OK... don't go healthy here--get the bacon.) Rosemary home fries are crispy and made with so much butter it hurts (in a good way).  Sourdough bread is thick cut and buttered served with amazing homemade strawberry preserves. I seriously could have this for breakfast everyday.  So sad we don't live in AZ... this place is totally worth the hype.

The Matt's Big Breakfast in downtown Phoenix is much better than the Airport location.  The service at the Downtown location is faster and friendlier, and the portions more generous.  Our bartender/waiter at the airport looked like he hated his life. Never smiled once and wouldn't make eye contact or speak at an audible level when he talked to you... it was actually kind of amusing to my husband and I.  The people sitting next to us were vocal about his poor manners/service, but we just wanted some bacon so we got over it and managed to laugh about it.  I got the Hog and Chick; the potatoes here were not as crispy here, but it's all the same locally sourced ingredients for sure.   (Seemed like it was a smaller kitchen but the restaurant had more seating than other locations, so maybe they were rushing the cook on the food? We waited about 30 minutes for our food from the time  we ordered.) Overall 3 out of 5 as the service had major issues, the dining room was crammed (my legs  and elbows were touching the stranger next to me), but the taste was just as good as the other locations.

Great Service Great Food !!!   We Tried this place for the first time. On Thursday morning around 7:30a.m. we were seated right away. Great menu selection. Large biscuits, very good food, large portions. The food came out accurately, quickly and hot. We were in and out in 30 minutes!  Ask for Skye she friendly and a great waitress.  Also, nice and clean dining area.

Such a surprise to find wonderful food at an airport! The homemade strawberry jam is the best! The sourdough toast is thick and delicious. The staff is great. Cannot day enough good about this place. Will come here anytime I am at Sky Harbor!

Pretty nice breakfast spot. Went here at around 10:30am and it was busy, but not packed. Waitress came to me right away for drink order and gave me the special of the day. I ordered it. It was delicious and came out pretty quickly as well. Menu options are pretty typical breakfast. I contemplated the salami egg scramble but was worried about quantity. I did not really browse the lunch side but looked to have burgers, sandwiches and salads. It's a consistent good place to eat. Last time I was here was a few years ago at the downtown location.

After all the hype I've heard for Matt's I was underwhelmed and left hungry. The service is quick and friendly. The strawberry jam is delish, I honestly would just want to come back to buy jam if they sold it by itself. Otherwise there are plenty of places in the valley that can also pride themselves on great ingredients without the long wait time or uncomfortable dining room.

I just made my final visit at this location. I ordered about month ago, I called in and when I came to pick it up, I saw there was only about 6 people in the restaurant but I waited to get my breakfast I had called in 20min earlier... The girl was nice about it so I wrote it off. BUT today was unacceptable. I called in my order and was told 15 min, I came in and my food was waiting, while waiting 2 older gentlemen came in and right after them a group of 6 came in. The manager came up, gave the other guy waiting his to go order and grabbed her clip board to help the people who walked in 4 min after me.  I would really hate to think that is was because I am a black women and everyone else was caucasian, but that what it felt like. I asked the manager after she looked past me to talk to the man standing next to me, "is someone one going to help me, I've been waiting and I need to get back to work?". She said "Oh we just have some many people, I'm sorry". Not genuine at all and after leaving the parking lot and attempting to go to the ATM I noticed I didn't have my debit card. I had to go back and the same women was at the counter and when I told her she didn't give me my debit card she explain to me where she had laid it down with my receipts to sign, well she pointed to the right of the register when I actually signed on the left and she had every excuse to get me out of there.  Its really unfortunate that people are rude and discriminate against loyal customers. I will continue to visit the semi-org Matt's on 1st st but this location has lost my business and I will not refer any of my colleagues or friends here. The food is good but not enough for me to be treated like a second class citizen, my money is the same color as everyone else's, she didn't have a problem with taking it.

Went here for breakfast and got more than I was expecting. The portions are really big and everything is delicious. I had an omelette with cheddar, mushrooms, sausage, their home fries, and wheat toast. Their home fries have a great flavor and I love that they use rosemary. My husband got the French toast special and a side of bacon. I didn't care for the sausage that came with the French toast and it didn't taste like the sausage in my omelette.   I also suggest getting coffee. Their coffee is absolutely amazing!

I went with my friend on a Saturday morning between 730-8am upon her recommendation of amazing pancakes. She ordered Pancakes and My order was for The Hog & Chick breakfast, that came with 2 eggs, 2 slices of bacon, 2 slices of bread and potatoes with herb. Bacon slices were nice and thick and pancakes tasted great as well. Looking at their menu, there is not much of it. Breakfast from the looks, was pretty mediocre. Their homemade Blueberry jelly was amazing, right amount of sweet and tasted very light. In my opinion, the prices are high for the amount of food. Service was great, couple servers passed by, always filling our coffee and water. The server did not spend much time in asking if we had any questions but were quick with their services. Food came pretty fast as well. No problem there. The high stools were little uncomfortable to sit with trying to park the legs somewhere. It is a noisy place and i had a hard time understanding my friend until we started talking loud to make up for the noise. I saw the reviews of this place, i did not encounter any service issues. It is not a bad place, i would definitely go back but i will not go out my way to go back there.

Visited on  a Sunday morning around noon and they had line of people waiting for tables. We must have waited for about 15 minutes before we were seated. The girl at the front was very polite and professional. Our server was amazing and continued to check on us throughout our meal to make sure we were comfortable and happy with our meal. It was a second time for me and first time for my husband. I ordered Cheese Omelet (with extra mushrooms and onions) with the side of Hashbrown, Wheat toast and Blueberry jelly with some iced tea. My husband ordered the special of that day which was scrambled eggs with spinach and bacon with the side of Hashbrown, Sourdough toast and Strawberry jelly and their freshly squeezed Orange Juice. The orange juice was very sweet (little too sweet for my preference) but tasted really great. The server brought our drinks in 5 minutes and food came about 10 minutes later. My omelet was very delicious, hash browns were greasy, both jellies were great but Blueberry is my favorite, less sweeter than the Strawberry one. My husband's eggs were too salty. Their bacon slices are nice and thick and extra peppery. Their customer service was great, their prices are a little pricey for their Breakfast menu, if one ends up ordering extra such as mushrooms, peppers or onions for their eggs, the price can go higher pretty quick. Taking 2 stars away for making the food salty and for the price of items, limited menu, loud place. There is no presentation to the food, please ignore the zig zag of ketchup (that was my creation!).  They can definitely work on the menu, their presentation and may be their prices. Time will tell how much they really pay attention to their customer reviews.

Awesome local breakfast spot. Ordered the special and was extremely pleased with it variety and taste. Wasn't overly crowded and the servers were very attentive. Would definitely recommend and will return.

People in Phoenix seem awfully unsophisticated about the quality of food - especially for breakfast places. There are not many really good options in Phoenix. The Buffet at the Biltmore during the season is great. But you don't feel like going to the Biltmore every day (unless you live there in which case - why not?)  But to gush about Matt's Big Breakfast calls to my mind the one question?  WHY?  Seriously have you never had a really great breakfast place in your life experience? Apparently not or you wouldn't be so impressed with Matt's which is merely average at best, although their sour-dough toast can be excellent if it's fresh.  And their strawberry-honey lemonade is very nice, too.  But world-class it's not.  The place needs some serious competition in the Valley and maybe that would force them to raise the bar a bit. As of now, it's far too low in my opinion.

Amazing Bloody Mary with a slick slice of bacon, 2 chunks of cheddar and pepper jack cheese plus olives and a pickle. Not too strong but not weak,  a prefect drunk for a long morning! Loved the breakfast sandwich and the breakfast burrito with jalapeos, pefect amount of kick :) wish we had one in Portland Oregon!

The visit to their Rio Salado location began with frustration. We stood around for 15 minutes with no hostess or waitress even acknowledging us. Because it's such a pain to get to this location, we stuck it out to finally try this fabled restaurant. I ordered the Friday special, basically a deconstructed breakfast burrito, and my lady ordered the hog and chick, sausage and potatoes and scrambled eggs. The food was okay, and the price was comparable to any other yuppie brunch spot that feels the need to advertise things like "cage-free". The mimosa was alright, but the Gin Rickey was made with a lemon instead of a lime. Overall they seemed under staffed. Will not be returning, but I don't think I'll need to. I don't think this place will be here long.

This was my first time here. I came here for the sixth "meeting" of the Breakfast Club UYE. I might have to update this after going a few more times but first impressions were very good. I don't know what else I can say that hasn't already been said. This place has been on every "watch someone else eat" food show around and been reviewed a hundred times over. I am told this is their new slightly bigger location. It was very nice. We did have to wait until all of our party showed up to be seated. Which ended up being 14 strong when it was all said and done. Once we were officially on the list the wait wasn't too long and they had put together a few tables to seat all of us together. Due to the noise level inside the waiter addressed each end of the table separately so he didn't have to yell across the table. Drink orders were taken and soon after water and other drinks started to come out. Two people went around the table getting food orders. I had to get the griddlecakes even though the egg scramble with chorizo special was very tempting. I came for pancakes and that was what I was sticking to. Now I thought the food came out fairly quickly unless I was just caught up in conversation which is known to happen at the Breakfast Club. So many great people to talk to. My griddlecakes were awesome. Some of the best I've had ever. My one small complaint was extra syrup is $1.50 and I love a lot of syrup on my pancakes. But it was worth it because it was real maple syrup and the pancakes were so good. I finished off the entire stack of three pancakes which I'm told is quite a feat as they are big and rich. I was hungry and was determined to make it through. They didn't split the check but let each of us pay our share and in the end it was all taken care of. I will definitely be back to try all of the other stuff on the menu which is why this review may or may not change. I hope it doesn't because based off the pancakes alone this place is one of the best and deserves all of the attention and the line outside to get in. Can't wait for the next Breakfast Club "meeting".

The food was good and the staff were nice. Not necessarily gluten-free friendly. No gluten free toast and they refused to substitute toast with potatoes, only a tomato slice (the tomato was bad). Their spices on the bacon were good but overall I would rate my experience as average.

This is a great option for breakfast. The service was great, the food and pricing was awesome! I got the waffle which came with bacon. Danny got the breakfast sandwich and thoroughly enjoyed it. Even the butter used for the waffle was yummy and I'm very glad we went here. One of Danny's favorite podcasters recommended this place and I am sure glad he did. The place looked urban and clean. Lots of use for wood and metal. I would recommend this place, they came around filled our waters and coffee often. We were also seated right away and got to choose where we wanted to sit. When we were leaving, it did look like there was a wait for forming. So try to come early if you can !

We decided to try the place out after seeing it on food network's diners, drive in, and dives.  I thought it was pretty good but my wife did not like it becasue it was to greasy. she did not like the butter fat.  We did have to wait a long time to eat.  It's small and they had a lot of flies in the windows which was a big turn off.

I was really looking forward to finally going to Matt's Big Breakfast after hearing about it for many years. I was kind of disappointed. My wife's pork chop looked good, but lacked any kind of seasoning. My omelet was OK, but could have been better. The hash browns were delicious, but the toast was to thick, and was hardly toasted. I think I'll stick with Black Bear Diner.

One of my favorite breakfast places out of Arizona! Any out of town guests I take them here for breakfast!  They have many options for being such a small menu. They support local business and even sell homemade jam!  I usually get the 5 spot sandwich! It's fulfilling and you get a bite of everything.  Definitely worth the wait
Solid good breakfast at a fair price. Nothing earth shattering. I had a breakfast sandwich. Expected a big wait (that's what we were told) but there wasn't.

Often when you go to a place you saw on Diners, Drive-Ins & Dives, to get anything that resembles what you saw on TV you need a camera crew and Guy Fietti in tow. Well, not here. The food was great and plentiful and the service was very friendly. There was a bit of a wait, but it was worth it.

We came into the place starving and ready to devour our food. But the trouble had started with getting seated and having to fight with a father and a little girl for our seats because they thought they were sitting there even though they never got seated by anyone. After that we ordered and ended up waiting 20 minutes for our food. I ordered the 5 platter plate (breakfast sandwich), it was really good. My cousin ordered a omelet and loved it. My sister ordered the salami scramble and it wasn't good, I could make better eggs. My brother ordered the big breakfast and ate it fast.The only thing that we hated was the potatoes. The potatoes in general were fine but they were sauted in rosemary or something foul and were just nasty. The food was decently priced and you get what you pay for. Wouldn't recommend for a quick meal. Nothing special.

As far as the food goes it is absolutely delicious. I had the special which was a 3 egg scramble with asparagus, top sirloin steak and fontina cheese and it was very tasty. One thing I really like about this place is that they have fresh squeezed orange juice. I love fresh squeezed orange juice and it is rare to find it in restaurants these days - or at least at the ones I have been going to :)  The glass of orange juice was awesome but it was tiny. There is also always a long wait here since the restaurant is very small and cannot accommodate very many people.  I am deducting one star for the wait and the portions of orange juice, but the food was delicious - my wife and I ate every bite.

General rule of thumb: condescension toward your customers is never a good look, but if you're going to try it anyway, your quality better be damn good. Unfortunately, at Matt's it was just ok. Want half and half in your coffee? Prepare for a lecture from the waitress (who has been alive for fewer years than I have been drinking coffee) about how they only offer whole milk, but it's organic and you will be surprised by how delicious it is if you give it a try. Want salami in your omelet instead of ham? They charge $5 extra because the salami is "really high quality." Never mind that the salami scramble on the menu costs less than an omelet with ham.   Sometimes there are really legitimate reasons why restaurants can't fulfill a customer request, but here it's just pretension. Next time I'll be having my breakfast at a place that asks me how I'd like my coffee instead of telling me how I should.

Let's be positive.  Matt's has the best waffles I have ever had. And the pancakes are pretty darn amazing.   But, Matt's has too many rules. Especially for a diner-style resturant. I feel like every time I go there, I leave being pissed off about something.  First, NO substituions.  I'm a vegetarian and most of their dishes come with a side a meat.  I would rather have a side of potatoes (and that is cheaper for the resturant than a side of meat). But, NO substituions. I have to order "no meat" and then pay for a side of potatoes. C'mon, now.   Also, NO outside beverages.  Matt's is located in an epicenter of amazing local coffee shops.  I would like to enjoy a handcrafted latte from Lola's instead of Matt's drip with breakfast - but the waitress will jump on your butt about that coffee cup before you even sit down.   Loosen up, Matt. It's a diner.  Awesome tip: Matt's does take-out orders. If you're craving some yummy pancakes on a Sunday morning and have no desire to stand outside for 90 minutes - call it in! It will be ready in 15 minutes and you can enjoy a local latte with it!

What can I say??? Matt's Big Breakfast can do no wrong!!!  Delicious food and amazing locally roasted - ROC2 Coffee!  Now I just need to pick the right day for their traditions - their term for specials.....  Monday - Huevos Rancheros Verde Tuesday - Biscuits & Sausage Gravy Wednesday- Sweet Savory....French toast with               Schreiner's pork apple sausage Thursday - Classic Eggs Benedict  Friday - Special Scramble Saturday - Special Scramble Sunday - Steak & Eggs    There you have it!  Go and enjoy and don't forget to read your coffee cup!!!

Why hello hashbrowns smothered in rosemary!  Stopped by here for a quick bite before my connecting flight and I literally fell in love with the potatoes. The coffee was strong and good but they don't offer cream and this girl likes fat in her coffee so thumbs down to that. Come for the food, not a service filled experience.

I have seen the lines here on the weekends and avoid the place but I drive by during the week sometimes and notice nobody standing around so I sneak in for some food.  The specials I have tried were all very good. I love the buttery hash browns. Mmmm.. Tried a waffle and it was great also. This is one of the best breakfast resturants I have tried.

Great breakfast. I wasn't sure what to expect. But we took a chance and it was delicious. The waffle was cooked just right. My nephew had eggs bacon potatoes and toast. The servings were gigantic. My niece had an awesome salad but again it was huge.   The place was a little difficult to find. You actually are turning into an office park. If you pay attention to the sign it does say Matt's.

This breakfast was so good. Split the special with my niece also split pancakes, all was delish!!had to wait 1/2 hour, but weather was beautiful and they have a nice waiting room/patio. Very big portions so share dishes if possible

Service was fast and friendly.    Food was just mediocre and not a big selection of choices.  Not seasoned well.  Major complaint was we ask for sausage on the side and they refused.   Not good customer service.

I've been twice, at the behest of coworkers who are more enthusiastic about the place than I am.  It's OK.  It's trendy and seating is limited (though better by far than in their original location), so it can get crowded and noisy.  Lots of nouveau-downtown hipsters with bedheads, nursing hangovers.  Food quality is excellent and features lots of "natural" options.  Service is hurried but friendly.  It's a fair walk (or a short drive, with ample street parking) from downtown.
Excellent breakfast spot! The foods really served well and could actually accommodate a small customization which most Phoenix servers/cooks (somehow) can't. Very friendly staff
Matts used to be the place for breakfast in Phoenix, now it has spiraled down blah-over priced tooo hip not the great experience it used to be.

Food was delicious and I love that they had healthy options. I got "the skinny" which is egg whites, chicken sausage, spinach, and Gruyere cheese with a side salad. Huge portion and absolutely delicious! Pairs well with their homemade honey lemonades.

EVERYONE hyped this place up waaaaay too much. I waited with 2 friends for 1.5 hours. I got a Cheese/Sausage omelet with grilled onions... it came with a piece of toast, 2 eggs (I think), and hash browns.  People seem to talk about the hash browns... I don't see whats so special. Shredded potato that's burnt on the top and bottom, while hella soggy in the middle... is not my idea of damn good hash browns.  In my honest opinion, if you like A LOT of butter on everything, as well as waiting in line for a hour and a half, for a chance to sit down in a crazy small restaurant... then this is the breakfast stop for you.

First time here. I've heard great things about this place since I've lived in Arizona. Let's just say, my expectations were exceeded. The bacon and toast are out of this world. Add the simplicity of the menu and the local feel to the place, and you get the best breakfast in the Valley.

Ok so I heard that it was a wait to get seated but the food is worth it plus my homie lives on Roosevelt so it seemed like a no brainer. Aaawww it's true and it's a hot min unless u waiting right by the door when they open but that's up to you to decide if all the hype is worth it. I waited close to 40 min @10am on a Sunday so that should tell u. Im not fond of a long wait especially for a simple breakfast because basically I was just to lazy to make it myself. If it's eggs Benedict or some other fancy poached egg saucey type dish than I can understand but ummm no this is ur simple breakfast establishment.     So let's get into the meal;  Love me an egg sandwich and a connoisseur of these tasty impactful little buggers so of course I got the 5 spot. The bacon is so thick and amazing, the cheese is perfectly melted and the huevo was nicely cooked and is nestled in this locally made tasty roll that is so soft w/a pinch of sweetness. I give this egg sandwich a must pick up to go item and eat it in your car or walk home. No need to sit and eat there it takes to long. I do have to say that I think it's super wack home fries nor hash browns come with this sandwich and besides the bacon I can't imagine why pay $6 for a sandwich that doesn't even come with a side of extremely cheap veggie item, which is another 2.95, blasphemy. Anyways I ordered a side cuz my sandy was lonely and gosh darn it they forgot my order. Half way through my egg buddy I realized I still had no cheapy potato shreds in front of me. I had to ask and they still had to make them so u know they was rushed and a lil underdone. Mistake of the waitress not the kitchen staff, which was totally played off and they didn't even hook it up w/a free ice tea or coffee so they get a boo!  Nevertheless this place gets a whatever and if I go again it will always be an order out cuz waiting hella long for nothing wowwing is not the buizness, but if I do ima wear a side braid or bun like everyone else who works there as an ode.  FYI this place really deserves a 2 for long wait, forgetful waitress,  simple way nothing on the menu is to exciting hyped up eats but it gets a 3 only for the egg sandwich deliciousness only! Plus I can't seem to figure out how to get a halfsies .

This is one of the best breakfast places I have been, Had two eggs with a delic ham steak, hash browns. Add fresh in house made bread with home made jam. What more could you ask for?? Everything was cooked to perfection and totally awesome!  Mayor Greg Stanton was sitting at the next table. This is one of my favorite breakfast places, I will be back!

Busy busy  busy. This place is very busy. Food was great. Hash browns were almost a meal itself. It is typical American. Loud!!!! To many people trying to talk over each other. So if you want to have a quiet breakfast you better look somewhere else. But all the noise ain't that bad for a great meal.

Short on menu, long on taste. A small diner, with a great small town atmosphere rules the morning meals.   I got a recommendation from a collegue who like me was hungry for a good meal to get the day started. That said a short walk from the hotel, we quickly found a place with a crowd surrounding it.   We signed in and found a place outside to sit and wait. Friday morning, 9 am, we waited about 20 minutes.   The tables are small, their glasses of orange juice aren't very large, however it was freshly squeeed from what I could tell.   We both had the special, and it was a nicely portioned meal that filled is both up without regret. Their fasted fresh, and it was full of flavor. It was perfect for the morning.

Its good if you like pepper, or whatever spice they use, on everything. Everyone there was nice and efficient, it's just not a place I would go again for a healthier choice. If you have no problem with carbs galore and sugar, minimal fruit and veggies then you will love this place. I did appreciate having an option for a salad with my breakfast.

I love that this place has free range chicken eggs in all of their dishes. My breakfast was delicious. They played good music too. The reason they didn't get 5 stars from me is because it's so loud in there because, unfortunately, like many other restaurants in Phoenix, they have a concrete floor.
What a great place for an airport restaurant!  My cheeseburger was fabulous.  The fries, however, were not that fresh.  But in general, this is the best airport restaurant I have ever visited.

So, it turns out the place should have been called Matt's Semi-Pretentious Yet Tasty Breakfast. Had the Chicken & Artichoke Sausage with organic baby spinach and Fontina cheese scramble, breakfast potatoes and rustic sourdough toast. Quite tasty... but not the blue spoon diner I thought we we're walking into with the name like "Matt's Big Breakfast". It was not a big breakfast. Coffee was slow to refill and waitresses were a bit inattentive. Food gets 4-stars, service gets 3.

AAAAAAMAZZZING!!!!! The best overall breakfast experience that I have ever had. Here's why:  1. Proper flatware. Not that cheap junk that overpriced , low quality restaurants usually use. 2. NonGMO ketchup 3. Homemade preserves for the homemade bread. 4. Myers soap in the restrooms 5. Waffles to die for with real maple syrup So much more but who wants to read all that? Matt's BIG Breakfast IS the best this fussy, Non GMO, organic, frugal, prefers to eat at home Gal has ever eaten!!!
This has to be the best breakfast eatery at any airport  in America.  Try the french toast

Went to Matt's for breakfast. If you are not a patient person, then I dont recommend coming here on the weekend. We had a 30 minute wait but its always worth it. The food is always so good and just healthy enough that you don't feel guilty afterwards.  We had a server (a girl with dark hair who is shorter with a higher voice) come up to us for our drink order and we just ordered the honey lemonade and asked about possibly using the chicken sausage as an add on to a plate but she said they had run out of the chicken sausage, we understood. We saw her walk away and start talking to someone else. We were sitting for a little bit when we noticed the chalk board with the flavors for the honey lemonade. The server never told us that there were other options that day. The manager (Jason?) happened to have walked by and we asked to change our drinks to a strawberry one and a blueberry one (Blueberry was AMAZING). He then got them changed but they werent actually changed because the server hadnt even grabbed the drinks yet (we could see her standing talking to someone) the manager came back (note: we still hadnt ordered) and we asked about the chicken sausage. He then said they never run out of it because it is a staple. So we asked if it could be put into the chicken sausage (which the menu says add sausage $1.25) and the manager said of course we can do whatever. So then the server  came back to take our order and then said she asked the kitchen about the the chicken sausage would be a $4 charge to add it to the omelet. We decided not to add and just ordered everything as is. I got the waffle, and my boyfriend got the cheese omelet. Both plates were so good and actually my favorite part was the sour dough toast. I understand that its a busy place but the place is small and its obvious to see when a server is standing around and on a saturday morning at 10am I cannot imagine why they would. The food and the management was good so I still wanted to give to my review 4 stars.  And keep the blueberry lemonade all the time!!

Worst service in any airport. Order a beer and Cobb salad. I was sitting in front of the beer tape. Still took her  five minutes after I order the beer. Order a Cobb salad waited  25 minutes and it never came. She forgot to order my salad. Terrible service
If you have two hours between flights I guess this could work.  Worst service I have ever had in an airport.
Just stopped for a quick cocktail between flights - awesome bloody mary and really nice staff.
Really good Breakfast.  We enjoyed the waffles and thought they tasted great.   We will def be back!
