No frills basic breakfast.  Hash browns were soggy and oily. Chop was cooked nearly perfect. Chop and chick, side of bacon, and glass of OJ came to $18 including tip, so it's a little pricy for a basic breakfast.
Best breakfast I've ever had in my life!!!!! Everything is organic. Great service and the food is definitely worth the wait. Also they make sure they get you in when it is busy.

Local owned, Local Grown this place is all the hype and more.  We ride our cruisers here for breakfast and even before we get in for work.  Why? This place has a warm feel to it and the food is AWESOME!  They have daily egg specials that are remarkable.  The Honey Lemonade is fresh and like no other in town.  It gets busy so get in early and put your name in the notepad at the door.  I would not recommend for large parties, because they are very small. Steak and Eggs every Sunday.

I was sooooo disappointed!  I really cannot rate the food as I never got to eat. I live in Tucson and my family is mostly in the east  valley of Phoenix and I have been waiting for 2 years to go into downtown and eat at Matt's. I go and put my name on the waiting list. Other parties of 2 come after me and the guy kept sitting people that had been there for 20-30 minutes and I had been waiting exactly 1 hour. What really upset me is that I saw him seat 3 people at tables for 2 and when I walked in said he couldn't sit 3 there when there were others seated that way (i think he knew them).  I am truly disappointed as I've been waiting like I said for "2" years to eat there. If you have a party of more than 2, like a mere 3, you'll wait forever!
We went here for lunch. I had the chicken sandwich and it was huge. It tasted amazing. This place is louder than normal but that food it great
Super nice staff. Breakfast was good. Nothing earth shattering. The bacon was awesome and loved their toast. Good solid place for breakfast.

With all due respect if you are religious, but on a Sunday morning Matt's Big Breakfast can be even more spiritual than church! This is Phoenix's best breakfast hands down. The pancakes are so light and fluffy it's like someone took the clouds straight out of heaven and onto a griddle. The bacon is thick and satisfying too and the ham steak is just another level of flavor I've never experiences during the day hours.  Portions and prices are spectacular, but now comes the bad part: the wait is worse than vegas' best nightclubs. Just like vegas too, if there's more than two of you, you're not getting in. Best bet is to order over the phone, get it to go, and enjoy this goodness at home where at least nobody else can see you drool.

Amazing food, amazing service, amazing experience! On the weekends they are very busy - probably about a 20-30 minutes wait, but it's worth it! I have tried the eggs and bacon, the Reuben sand which, and their scramble special with sausage... All of them were superb!

This place is SO WORTH THE WAIT! Came here on a Saturday morning so there was a huge line and we waited for over an hour but your patience will be rewarded.   They do good, old-fashioned comfort breakfast food and they do it well. They also use local and organic ingredients and cage-free eggs.   I don't remember what my friends had as we ate there awhile ago, but I had the Hog & Chick. Bacon was crisp but not overcooked and was delicious! Eggs were cooked perfectly as well and the potatoes were crisp and perfectly seasoned.    Once you get seated you are well taken care of by friendly and knowledgeable waitstaff who are more than happy to help you decide if you're having a hard time, which is understandable given the variety of tasty options on the menu. They keep coffee and drinks topped off and make sure everything is cooked as it should be.   I have not had any of their lunch items yet but if they're anything like their breakfast menu they are sure to be phenomenal.   Definitely plan on going back now that I have most weekends off!
Nice breakfast spot. Most importantly...THE 2nd BEST BACON I've ever had! Their thick cut bacon deserves to be on the Mt Rushmore of pig product. Absolutely worth the price of admission.

Been here twice and don't see the allure. Nothing really Big about the place. The breakfast menu is small, too small in my opinion. No gravy? What kind of self respecting breakfast diner doesn't offer gravy on the side? Ordered the waffle this time and it came with bacon. Waffle was a bit overcooked and dry... Nothing remarkable there. The bacon that came with it was absolutely coated in coarse black pepper...not my thing at all. If I want pepper let me add it. I think this place is just "a thing" because it's busy and has a hipster draw to it. It's just not really a great breakfast diner. The service is decent and quick however. Don't understand why there is always a wait. This area must be starved for a variety of decent breakfast spots.

I wanted to try this place since it has great reviews. The host that took my name was rude and snoby. It was busy and congested. The menu was very simple and not enough options. We decided to leave and eat breakfast elsewhere.
First time coming here. Food was good, tad overrated for that kind of wait. Guy up front was a little rude.

Long wait time....  and they won't seat you till your whole party is there... well, we were, but still had to wait.  I had the French Toast w/bacon.... VERY yummy!  Stole some hash browns from my friend's plate... love crispy hash!

Not really sure how this place only has 3 and a half stars. They've got all the hallmarks of a great breakfast place (aside from being in the airport, of course). But Matt's isn't just good for being in the airport; it's good all around.   The service was spectacular, even the host who had to put up with a lot of attitude from angry people who didn't want to wait for a table.   The menu prices were decent too, aside from the alcohol of course. But the hog and chick breakfast was $10.99 and comes with all the usual fixings. This is more affordable than most brunch places nowadays, but it was stellar! The toast and bacon were memorable.   Next time I find myself in need of breakfast in the Phoenix airport, I will be headed to Matt's!
Excellent food, very fresh. Good service, nice atmosphere. The wait can be killer, but if you have the time, it's worth it.

My husband and I ate here this past weekend.  My son lives in Phoenix  told us to try Matt's, that they have a great breakfast.   I had the egg white scramble w/sausage (apple i think?) with a small salad (which by the way was not a small salad..) it was delicious!  I loved it!  Salad for breakfast was delicious and fresh OJ.  Hubby had the steak and eggs and said steak was melt in your mouth.  Later that day we were walking around downtown Phoenix and happened to walk by, and line was around the corner!  Definitely an early morning option was the best idea:)  Thanks for a great breakfast!  Hope you make it out to Inland Empire area of California!
New Location with way more space, they have a prep kitchen seating available via reservation if you have parties greater than 5.

I really enjoyed this place, and I find it hard to believe it's in the middle of an airport terminal. The service was great. My boyfriend was crabbier than a crab apple since we missed our connecting flight, but the server was so gracious and understanding. I had the Bloody Mary and wawawewa, it put a lil pep in my step. Definitely one of the best I've ever had, from the garnish to the actual drink. I also had the thick cut bacon. It was sick -- some of the best bacon I've ever had in my life. Grumpopatomus had some kind of meat (pork, I think) smothered in onions and gravy and stuff. He said it was really good.  The price was a little stiff, but hey, that's airport fare for ya! Cheers!!

I went here a little while back and forgot to rave about how delicious it was! I went on an Wednesday, and their special was French toast with sausage. I also tried the honey lemonade, and it was amazing! The service was great too, except my food came about 10 min. After the person I was with got theirs, but I can't control how fast things get cooked and I would rather have them serve the food warm than let it sit and get cold waiting for the rest of the parties order. The French toast was delicious because of the house made maple syrup and the great quality of the bread used. I'm not a huge fan of sausage, but this one was soooo good! The bacon though...was...AMAZING! Both of the meats had some sort of sweet glaze, yum! I loved the char on it...yummy. Definitely deserves to be called the best breakfast spot in Arizona.
Always crowded, but wait is not bad - and is worth it. Food is delicious and service awesome. My only "complaint" is that the host today was abrasive with snide comments.
Excellent service here. Large portions- great value. Strawberry compote served with the toast is great - and different.  Unexpected pleasure for breakfast.

Matt's has well thought out food (although not a TON of options), quick service, and a nice ambiance.  Even though the service is quick, the wait to get a table might be long.  This is a popular tourist and local spot but worth a little wait.  The coffee is roasted locally in Cave Creek and the Cinnamon walnut toast is pretty awesome.

Wow. Best breakfast place I've ever been to.  Visited while in town for the Superbowl (boo Pats!) and this was one of the famous go-to places I found. We went and holy crap, the line was LONG. It took us like 30-45 min to get a table. I would've waited an hour to eat here though. The food was THAT good.  I started with the strawberry honey lemonade. Best lemonade I've ever had in my life. The honey complimented the strawberry lemonade so well, I could not believe it was not a more common drink. For breakfast, I ordered the breakfast sandwich and the cherry sausage. My Dad ordered the standard breakfast and we also shared a waffle.  The waffle came out first, so we started with that. Best waffle I've ever had. The flavor and crispness of it was so unique and delicious. I did not think a waffle could blow my mind, but that one did. I ended up finishing most of that waffle, when originally I was just planning on taking a few bites.  By the time my breakfast sandwich and sausage came, I was already feeling full, but I powered through it anyway. I got halfway through both and felt extremely full, but could not let myself waste such quality food. The sausage's flavor was very sweet and almost dessert-like. The sandwich bread was this giant artisan looking bun and the eggs, bacon, and other fillings were cooked and spiced perfectly. I feel like a broken record at this point, but this food was phenomenal.   If this breakfast place was in Capitol Hill in Seattle, they would put everyone else out of business. Our best breakfast places pale in comparison to this spot, and we have some solid breakfast spots.  You've set a new standard for breakfast, and I hate that because you are located so far away! PLEASE come to Seattle!

This place was amazing. I've worked in the food Industry for 20 years, I'm not sure I've experienced a more friendly staff. I was in Phoenix for spring training with a large group of friends and our kids. We were going to an afternoon game and wanted to take the kids to breakfast first. We had heard good things about Matt's big breakfast so decided to check it out. The staff was extremely accommodating, offering plenty of different options for a group our size. In the end we decided the best option would be to split up into separate tables. The moment I sat down, we were greeted by a friendly server who immediately brought us a waffle. I explained that I didn't order one, to which she replied with a smile "I know". We had been having a rough morning after driving for 12 hours straight so this was exactly what I needed. Within another minute, the manager came by and asked if we would like chocolate milks for the kids. We ordered an omelette, griddle cakes, breakfast potatoes, and waffles. Everything was amazing. The omelette was made in the traditional style with the eggs cooked so perfectly that there was no brown, the filling were in the middle then dried out and cooked into the eggs. The potatoes were cooked perfectly crispy and tender at the same time. The waffle came with a side of delicious house made strawberry preserves. Thank you to Matt's big breakfast for starting off our trip on an amazing note!

Decided to try this place for a breakfast to catch up with some friends. Food was phenomenal! I had the cheese omelette with some mushrooms and it was delicious, so were the homefries (although a bit too oily, but they tasted great). One of my friends had the steak and eggs and the steak was tender, juicy and tasty! we loved the food and the service from both waitresses that helped us since it was our first time there. Menu could be considered 'small' but you trade that for the quality of food served there. Be prepared to wait for a table though! the place is packed and busy! If your whole party is not there they will not seat you (for obvious reasons). They have a couple of benches outside and some shade from some palo verdes. Parking is free right behind the restaurant, but only a few spots, if you are lucky you can get a spot and don't have to pay for parking. It is downtown Phoenix after all. Only 'bad' thing, which is not a bad thing really, but it may change your mind depending on what you are looking for, the restaurant ambiance was too loud! Since the place is small and packed with people everybody talking (loud in order to hear each other lol). Food was excellent! Service was superb! I highly recommend this place.
Slowest service I've ever gotten. I think they forget people have to get on flights. Be carful when you eat here you might miss your flight.

we took the red eye flight from Hawaii to Phoenix and needless to say me and my family of 5 were completely exhausted and hungry. fortunately we quickly got a table at Matt's and ordered right away. we didn't even have to wait long for our food and that was awesome because it was a long night and we were completely starving. I ordered the griddle cakes and they were fabulous. light and fluffy and the syrup seemed homemade. all the eggs are from cage less chickens. everything my family ordered look delicious too. would highly recommend this place and I wish they had it back home where I am from.

We had been wanting to try this local establishment for a while. We came before a diamondbacks game last summer so it wasn't too long of a wait maybe 10 minutes. We both had the skinny and both liked it.  The service was fast and friendly, We loved the coffee so we ended up buying a bag. You can only get that blend from a local toaster at the restaurant and it's awesome.

Back in the day we stood in line for an hour and a half to stick a fork in one of those fabulous, juicy, tasty pork chops and were happy to do it. Flavors were fabulous and portions were huge. I think success has meant a lot of watering down. A while back I ate in the airport terminal and had a bad experience which I attributed to the rush of dealing with airport traffic but the pork chop I had this morning was dry and tough here at the Biltmore location. My wife complained about her's as well and for the same reason.   She declared her hash browns average but loved the toast and home made jelly. I thought the home fries were fabulous with lots of onion and nice crispy brown edges on the potatoes. So good. The iced tea was great and the servers kept my glass filled so that was good. Other than the dried out chop, the food was fine. My real problem is that it simply isn't as great as it used to be. The experience is kind of like the candy bar as big as your head that you used to get for $.99, but now it is a third the size for the same price. You're not disappointed because, you know, chocolate, but it just doesn't measure up to what used to be...   We kind of decided it's not really worth the wait.
Pretty good place.. Service is quick food is well proportioned.. Just good old fashion breakfast.. Nothing stellar like others I have reviewed but just good.. Nice walk from downtown hotels.

I had breakfast here on a trip to Phoenix and it was to die for! I got the special which was a 3-egg scramble with cheese, spinach, and ham - SO GOOD. The eggs tasted SO fresh. THE BEST PART - the HASH BROWNS. Oh my gosh, I have never tasted hash browns like that before - they were perfect! Crunchy on the outside, perfectly cooked on the inside - yum yum. The toast was made fresh (like my mom's), and was THE best toast I have ever had at a restaurant. Fresh squeezed OJ was dynamite! SO GOOD! Best OJ I have ever had. Even the coffee was good!! Great vibe - really small place so no wonder there is a wait. PLUS, I saw the workers give a little to-go box to one of the homeless guys on the street - LOVE THAT!! Not only does this place have great food and great service, but they are caring people!

Today was our last visit to this restaurant. The first time we went was n a weekend, Service Good and the food was very good. We were hooked right away. BUT we have gone there several times in the last few months. Something has changed. This morning we waited for awhile to be waited on. Not many people there so that was a puzzle. Food came. Potatoes cold and GREASY with large springs of rosemary! Rosemary should never be served as large sprigs. OK for garnish but can be a chocking hazard. My husband ordered the Tuesday special.  I can make sausage gravy and biscuits at home that would be far superior to what was served. My eggs were also disappointing. Over Medium were almost hard yokes but still with runny white. Can't figure that out.  Never asked for a coffee warm up. Bye Bye Matt's

The food is very good at Matt's.  I usually get one of the specials.  My wife always gives me a strip of bacon from her plate, and I must say, they have excellent bacon there.  It's a nice thick cut of bacon, which is right up my alley.  The service is as it should be.  No frills, but they get the job done.  That's all I really care about.  I'm almost never in the mood for the fake banter you get from chain restaurant servers.  There is a little bit of a wait, but people who are not originally from AZ are used to waiting 2x as long, so it's not really a big deal to me.  I'd eat here again.

Breakfast, coffee and homemade orange juice? Any day, anytime!   I was so curious to come to this place after I saw it being featured on the Food Network channel (yes, yes.... "diners drive ins and dives" is one of my MANY guilty pleasures) And it didn't disappoint!  Honestly. You know it's a a good spot when it starts getting full on a monday morning.   First things first, if you can find parking on the street. Do it. You'll probably thank me later. The restaurant has a tiny parking lot in the back, but it's so tiny that you pretty much have to back your way out. Just save yourself the headache.   As for the food, amazing! The breakfast menu is not the most extensive, but it has all the right stuff. Omelets, pancakes, waffles, oatmeal, you name it.   Since I'm such a bore when it comes to my food, I opted for the cheese omelet with a side of home fries and wheat toast. The omelet was cooked to perfection. But I have to admit; the country potatoes and homemade strawberry jam were the best part of the experience. Who would have known?!  Definitively will come back next time I'm in town.
I had the Cobb salad and a diet coke. The food was excellent and a great option at sky harbor airport. The bartender was very friendly and even noted to someone else how great the Reuben sandwich is.

Being the breakfast fan that I am, this was one of my first stops after a long trip to the East Coast.  I love Matt's because of the freshness of the ingredients they use.  Everything is hot and REAL, from the eggs to the the thick cut multigrain bread and scrumptious rosemary potatoes.  The daily specials are great, but classics like the "Hog and Chick" are just as tasty.  Be sure to come early or be prepared for long waits!
Food is fantastic... Atmosphere is too loud portions are reasonable prices are on the higher side... Bottom line the food is really good!

I love breakfast and I'm a fan of visiting places from the show Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives show so I had to check out this spot. There was a long line to wait when my sisters and I showed up and wondered if it was worth standing in the summer heat for. Our thoughts were "Come on, how good can you really make breakfast???" My doubts were all erased the moment I bit into their delicious golden waffle! Apparently, they can make breakfast so good that it is worth waiting outside in the heat for an hour!!! And the joy continued...the thick cut peppered bacon was awesome as well as their sourdough toast. They have a homemade preserve to put on the toast that changes all the time since they buy local and seasonal produce. I have had their strawberry and plum preserves with the sourdough toast. Just mouth watering thinking about it. One of my sisters had the pork chop with pesto. Delish!!! And I am not usually a fan of pork chops. I have been there 4 times now and recommend it  to anyone!  One piece of advice: the best case scenario is to go as a party of 2 since so you might get seated quicker ;)

My first and last time!   Nothing in my order was correct but it was so busy that it would have taken so long to get it corrected.  My server was unapologetic, so that I think, made it worse. Never going back. Was really expecting much more.

Went to matts big breakfast in the Phoenix airport while waiting for a connecting flight. We had the most delightful bartender serve us. They have a really awesome breakfast menu! I am just not that huge of a breakfast person and after being on vacation and eating badly I just really wanted a salad! They do serve salad and lunch items after 11. I didn't eat there as a grabbed a to go salad and just ate it at the bar with my beer! My dad God a burrito that looked super amazing! I with they had more beer on draft! So over kilt lifter and Stella.   I was also super bummed that I didn't get a chance to try their bloody Mary's! They looked so amazing!

I am a fan of Guy Fieri and this makes the second restaurant from DDD I have visited. I will be honest and tell you that he co-owns two restaurants in California, one of them being a place called Johnny Garlic's. The food was VERY VERY mediocre so I started to wonder if I should trust his taste in food, but then I said ok he goes to these places because people write to him and tell him they are amazing, not because he has any participation in the restaurant itself. So my mom and I went yesterday (Saturday) morning for breakfast.   We got there around 9 I think and we had to wait about an hour before we were able to be seated.   We looked at the menu and were like what the heck this is just basic breakfast food, did we just make a huge mistake? Boy were we wrong. The OJ was great. The coffee on the other hand, eh. I've had a lot better.   I ordered the omelet with provolone and mushrooms and onions and home fries and sourdough bread.   My mom ordered the eggs with hashbrowns and slice of ham.   The omelet was huge and gooey with cheese. The mushrooms and onions were cooked to perfection. The home fries were only ok, and that might be because they were a tad cold. The bread is obviously homemade and the jam that came out with it was incredible.   My moms ham was great. We were not expecting such a big slice and such a thick slice. The taste was amazing as well.   After breakfast we walked across the street and went to the farmers market.   I am visiting from California, and should I ever find myself in Phoenix ever again, I will definitely come back and maybe next time try the bacon egg and cheese sandwich.   The only thing keeping this place from 5 stars is the coffee and the limited menu options.

You had me at Bacon Bloody Mary. With it's rimmed bacon salt, stuffed olives, cheese, and its penultimate bacon, I was surprised how effective this airport spot was. Could go without the pickle, but that's my preference. I don't write too much for airport eateries, but this one in Phoenix has reason to return between flights.

Very good, if you're looking for fancy decor you won't find it here.  If you are looking for a delicious well cooked breakfast, this has to be one of the best places in Phoenix.  I had the Hog and Chick very fulfilling meal.  Only thing I didn't like was the parking situation, not good.  Parking meters in front bring change.

Delicious, fresh squeezed OJ. Best pancakes I've ever had. Bacon was served crispy and cooked just right. My eggs were a bit more over easy, not over hard but still yummy. Excellent, attentive service. Parking was a breeze. We'll definitely be back for more.

i have tried three times on weekends to get in here, usually not in top form, i may have thrown up the parking lot once...sorry. but on a sunny thursday morning i manged to get in without much fuss.  usually the fussiness is outside, oh! there is shade now jane l. this makes sense because summer is ovah...duh. so anywho...screaming tots a go go. this is a tiny place...why would you bring your spawn here? i hear tell ihop has balloon animals? maybe you could have them fashion  an anchor shaped balloon creation to match your tattoo flash inspired t-shirt?   the choices here are slim but the portions are large as well as the amount of grease. hey i like grease...but like red grease dripping out of the back end of my burrito at 4 a.m. because in the gleaming light of the morning it makes me feel so dirty. i had the oats, surprisingly grease free and my partner in breakfast crime had the cheese omelette. i also ordered home fries on the side, some have complained about the rosemary...mine had rosemary, but it looked like it was accidental. pretty bland and boring. the entire experience was pretty bland and boring. i don't see what all of the fuss is about, sure it's good, but it's also breakfast...how hard can it be?

Yes there is a lot of hype about Matt's and yes it's worth it. So is the wait. If you arrive any time after like 8:30 am on the weekend you will have to wait. It's no fancy brunch spot, just a good ol' traditional American breakfast that hits the spot. Eggs toast potatoes jam waffles pancakes and options of meat if that's your thing too - ( I've heard they have the best bacon around) it's all delicious and it really is BIG.

Again guys I dodge a line here! So be prepared to wait if you go after 8. Anyways it was 7am and there I was drinking a mimosa, the airport has weird rules and no judge zone am I right?  Their mimosa was pretty standard but it was actually fresh squeezed oranges which is a plus. But you know it's a mimosa so eh.   I had French toast and smoke sausage which the toast was amazing. The sausage however was so salty it wasn't even edible. So I left it.   The biggest flaw was that buzz me if you need a waitress button. It made the whole thing uncomfortable. At one point I wanted another mimosa but it didn't feel right to hit the button to buzz her over. That's just weird. I get their trying to under staff and save on waitresses but it's a weird encounter. The waitress was nice though with good recommendations but still.   If their is no line go if there is an obnoxious line skip it.
Very nice food and friendly service. We had the omelette and the french toast. Everything was fantastic! Best food I have ever had at an airport!

Absolutely adore this place. Matts' serves the best breakfast in downtown Phoenix!! I usually order the special which is always amazing!!  The toast  is delicious with their organic preserves. The homefries are also yummy. I love the local vibe. The owner is always friendly,  and greeting you with a big smile! Stop by and you won't regret it! Can't wait to go back!!

We've been back to Matt's Big Breakfast quite a few times now and after having had breakfast food at many other places in the valley, I have to update my review to 5-Stars!  I think that if you're a fan of breakfast foods then you'll be a fan of Matt's. My favorite item to get there is the cheese omelette (except I ask for it to be scrambled) with mushrooms, a side of the house potatoes, and sourdough toast. They serve all omelette dishes with 3 eggs so it's definitely a generous portion. Same for the potatoes, you'll get quite a bit of those as well, and they offer you an option of regular hash browns or the house potatoes. The house potatoes have lots of seasoning & taste different with rosemary ... I recommend trying them out! Even the toast tastes great as it's thick cut sourdough, and they serve it with yummy homemade preserves.  The only annoying parts are the parking situation and sometimes the wait time. Parking can sometimes be challenging to find and the wait time can be long if you are part of a large group. Either way, the food makes it all worth it!

I was first introduced to Matt's Big Breakfast when I was a resident of Flagstaff, AZ, where waiting for a good breakfast is an everyday part of life.  I know that some people in Phoenix will not be able to wait, since they have their Denny's and Waffle Houses in their neighborhood.  With that said, Matt's Big Breakfast is worth the wait.  Waiting is good for you.  And the wait is usually not that long.  And, while you are waiting, there is stuff to look and see and do!  The Downtown Public Market is adjacent to Matt's, the people at the Coronado Hotel are pretty cool after you give them a cigarette or "shfifty shents".    The staff is always in a rush but as pleasant as cherubs.  The coffee smells delightful, and the honey lemonade is the bees knees  The food is the best part! I love the ingredients that Matt picks, which are local and organic when the product is convenient, affordable, or rockstar status.  All the eggs are from local cage free chickens.  All of the jams and jellies (which rotate on a daily basis) are from local businesses and they will probably help relieve any allergies you have (if you live in Phoenix).  When I was a young Big Breakfast eater, I enjoyed the Five Spot and worked my way up to the to the succulent egg and pork Chop and Chick before graduating to simply ordering the special, and trusting that Matt and his minions will take care of me.  The specials are the reason why I keep coming back, and why I bring my friends.  I have brought out of town poets, musicians, and artists to Matt's.  They all love the diner feel, the orange and simple menu, the nice and friendly staff, and of course - the BIG breakfast.

I was first introduced to Matt's Big Breakfast when I was a resident of Flagstaff, AZ, where waiting for a good breakfast is an everyday part of life.  I know that some people in Phoenix will not be able to wait, since they have their Denny's and Waffle Houses in their neighborhood.  The staff is always in a rush but as pleasant as cherubs.  The coffee smells delightful, and the honey lemonade is the bees knees  The food is the best part! I love the ingredients that Matt picks, which are local and organic when the product is convenient, affordable, or rockstar status.  All the eggs are from local cage free chickens.  All of the jams and jellies (which rotate on a daily basis) are from local businesses and they will probably help relieve any allergies you have (if you live in Phoenix).  When I was a young Big Breakfast eater, I enjoyed the Five Spot and worked my way up to the to the succulent egg and pork Chop and Chick before graduating to simply ordering the special, and trusting that Matt and his minions will take care of me.  The specials are the reason why I keep coming back, and why I bring my friends.  I have brought out of town poets, musicians, and artists to Matt's.  They all love the diner feel, the orange and simple menu, the nice and friendly staff, and of course - the BIG breakfast.
Excellent. Great food, great service. Busy on a Friday morning, obviously others know about it.

Wow - just delicious food. Fairly limited menu and nothing fancy but the food was just fantastic. So much of it was made in house (including the bread and strawberry preserves). Their fresh squeezed honey lemonade was awesome. It gets pretty busy on the weekends but I can see why. I wish we had something like this in Tucson!

Ate here for the first time a few weeks ago on a Sunday. Only had about a 30 minute wait, mainly because we got there later in the day. The food was good, but $4.50 for a glass of orange juice is a little over priced. I don't care if it's fresh squeezed, that's to much to charge for a glass of juice which is not refillable. I wanted French toast & found out they only had it on Wednesday. WHAT?! What kind of place that serves breakfast doesn't have French toast. They need to put it on the menu for EVERY day.

If you anticipate the wait at Matt's Big Breakfast, you'll have nothing to complain about. Put in your name, go get a coffee from Jobot, and relax. The staff is friendly and doesn't seem stressed about getting people in and out, and once you're seated and order your food, it comes out super quick. And it is fantastic. Hashbrowns have never been so glorious. Thank you Matt's, for a delicious place to start the day.

After driving from Lake Havasu to Phoenix, the bf and I were ravenous and wanted something big and breakfast-y.  Matt's Big Breakfast was the natural choice, and we didn't regret it, not one bit!  We arrived at 2pm, and the place closes at 2:30, according to the sign on the door.  Luckily, they let us eat.  I got the waffle and eggs ($6).  The waffle was possibly the best I'd ever had - big squares of Belgian waffle fluffiness.  The eggs, scrambled, were organic, and they made sure we knew it.  I appreciated this very much because I live in organic capital of the world.  Also on the side was a delicious, fresh thick-cut of bacon, perfectly peppered.  The bf had the salami scramble ($6.50), equally delicious, with authentic, not-out-of-the-bag salami.  These were thick chunks, and tasted wonderful in the softly scrambled eggs.  If I'm ever in this neck of the woods again, I'll be sure to stop by Matt's. Overall, a delicious breakfast experience for a steal!

This has to be my favorite place to eat breakfast! They have such good simple food that is delicious!! We ordered the Chop & Chick, Belgium-style waffle, Hog & Chick, and the Breakfast sandwich. The pork chop was cooked perfectly and was super moist and flaverful. The size of things is pretty big, as there were 7 of us and we shared and finished everything! The bacon here is thick-cut and soooo good!! And the bread that comes as a side with the strawberry jam was fresh and toasted to prefection. It may just be bread and strawberry jam, but is was REALLY GOOD bread and jam! And they have daily specials, so make sure to check the chalk board outside to see!

Very busy.  Warm atmosphere.  Service was quick and friendly.  We just beat the rush when we went.  We waited 5 minutes for a seat.  Pretty sure when we left the average was wait 30 minutes minimum.  Make sure to go early if you want to beat the rush.  The food was decent.  You get just enough food for the price.  I got the sweet and savory special.  It was French toast with a large breakfast sausage.  Everything was good, nothing blew me away.  I would eat here again, but just make sure you get there early to dodge the wait.  It's not worth the long wait at times.

YUMMMMY!  What more can I say, great service and exceptional food!  Everything is fresh and cooked to perfection.  We only waited a little while to be seated, but good things are worth the wait.  We will be back for sure.

Just had brunch at Matt's.  Service is wonderful, you never feel rushed even though there are people anxiously waiting to get a table. Food is fresh and delicious. They really care about the food they serve.   The only things I wish were different are the bacon and sausage.  The bacon is thick cut....I love me some crispy bacon but even if you ask for it crispy it just never comes out that way. The sausage is good but I wish it had more seasoning like sage and all the other yummy stuff they put in sausage. I'm a sausage eater not a sausage maker;)  Those are the only things I wish were different. Other than that Matt's is awesome!

The menu isn't overwhelming. The scrambled eggs I ordered with chorizo were really good. Hash browns had subtle taste and didn't need much of anything else to taste good. Would recommend if your looking for a good place to get breakfast.

The world famous Matt's big breakfast. Came down here specifically since I'd heard so many rave reviews. Maybe I ordered wrong - some of the most bland and dry pancakes I've ever had. And after spending $15 for breakfast (hash browns and milk) when I asked for a little more syrup for the pancakes, was informed they charge for xtra syrup - even though the initial syrup was a tiny metal container. Wow. Pretty sad. Won't be coming back here for sure. Otherwise the service had been quite good.  Extraordinarily noisy location as metal tables and chairs being slid around all over concrete floors - In my opinion the most underwhelming meal for the most overrated restaurant. They did end up removing the charges without my asking when I mentioned how bad the pancakes were. At least did the right thing, and like I said, maybe I ordered the wrong thing. But very disappointing meal. Manager apologized again and asked if I wanted anything else. Maybe you will fare better than I did
Had a big group here, and it was a wonderful experience. Great staff, food was awesome (especially the potatoes), and Ernie couldn't have been nicer. I will be back next time I'm in town!

The owner Matt has a very stupid rule of no substitutions on his meals and offers really no options for people who don't eat pork even the chicken sausage has pork casing. Luckily the manager Jason is very helpful and friendly and accommodated us in every way. I would have given this place a 1 star if it wasn't for Jason.

A better name would be "Matt's BAD Breakfast". Service is horrifyingly bad.  The food isn't much better. After waiting 45 minutes to be seated and then sitting on uncomfortable barstools for 30 more minutes we found out our order mysteriously didn't get placed correctly and had to be submitted again. Then when it finally arrived the "overhard" eggs were runny and cold, the hash browns were partially burnt, yet raw in the middle. Our server offered no apologies - only excuses. The server never asked us if we wanted beverage refills (we did), nor were we provided with an order update-  even after it was obvious someone screwed up because customers seated 30 minutes after us had ordered and left before our food appeared.  Don't go unless you want overpriced Bloody Mary's, which are admittedly the only consistently good thing on the menu.
Atmosphere is super cute and chill, service is amazing! Very nice people. Went with my family and everyone loved the food, all got different dishes

Staff was friendly, clean restaurant, cozy overall. My family and I were in town on a visit and this "hit the spot" The food was delicious. If I were to visit the area again, I would go back. We are a family of 8 and everyone ate their food :)

i was always told about this place. The waffles was all everyone talked about. But i went with a breakfast sandwhich and i do not regret it one bit  it was so delicious!!! The bacon was thick and perfectly cooked. I def. Suggest it. My friend had the waffles and I had some, those were so delicious  as well. Definitely will be going back again and again

Oh my Goodness, so amazing!  Breakfast foods are some of my top favorite items to eat. The griddlecakes with sweet cream butter and real (Yes i said "REAL") maple syrup. Seriously these griddlecakes melt in your mouth. The thick-cut bacon was crispy and delicious and i dream about the breakfast potatoes with rosemary.   If you are in the area, or even if you are not.....you definitely should stop at Matt's Big Breakfast!  P.S. I hear the breakfast rush wait time can get a little crazy, I didn't wait in any line however I went around 1pm.

Midwestern hipster breakfast of champions - that's how I would describe it in 5 words.    Good down-home breakfast, but not for weight watchers.   Bright orange formica counters and rooster orange juice glasses.  Love that the place is smaller than a shoebox.  It means you have wait ahead of you, but it keeps the breakfast experience a friendly intimate one.   The hog and chick is what I usually order. But most recently I've been ordering the sopressata salami scramble with provolone and the five spot breakfast sandwich.  The burger buns are a lackluster choice, but the grilled onions and thick peppercorn bacon slices more than make up for it.  The hash browns can be a bit greasy, but hey, that's what happens when you cook with butter.    Can be a wait on weekend, but worth it in central Phoenix, especially when the Good Egg and other places get old.

Just passing through here on the way to San Diego. This place is amazing!! Had an omelette with mushrooms, roasted peppers (actually roasted well), Ham, and cheese. Came with hash browns, and toast, all equally delicious. Staff was very friendly and on top of their game.
Hands down, the best breakfast in town. The biscuits have spoiled me for all others. I wish they were always available

This was my first time visiting the newer downtown location since it opened. It was bustling and very busy. There was plenty of action, and things were loud. However, I knew that going into the situation. The food was awesome, I had their huevos rancheros special and ate every single bite. Service was swift, and coffee was plentiful. Yum!

Best pancakes I've ever had. They're so big and fluffy and the butter is sweet. They just melt in your mouth. The syrup is so good too. Not too sweet but light and such a good flavor!! Between hashbrowns and home fries, I'd have to go with the Home fries. They come with some sweet onions mixed in and it's delicious. Hashbrowns are just a lil mushy under the crispy top layer. I'm not a huge fan of toast (it takes up precious pancake space) but the strawberry preserves it comes with makes it a necessity when eating here. Love the interior and the service!

Not just for breakfast but they do breakfast right. The big breakfast is enough for any hungry traveler! Like any airport place it depends on time of day for service and timing. They do a great job of getting people in and out but at peak times its a wait but if you have the time it's worth the wait.

I was really excited to try this place and had heard great things about it. We had a party of 4 and all of us felt it did not live up to the hype. In addition we all ordered different things. The food was good, the potatoes had a little to much rosemary and the OJ was ok. Considering the Yelp reputation and other reviews.....It was not a place any of us would crave to go to again. This was the first time a place that was rated so highly on yelp did not deliver for our group.  I am a Yelp fan....So With reviews this great, I would still consider trying it even after reading this review. Maybe we had an off day. I don't see myself going back, but encourage you to at least give it a shot.

Why do I punish myself. I had an hour before my flight so I gave them another shot.  Seriously, what takes so long to cook 2 eggs?  After 25 minutes and 2 server apologies later my order arrived with bacon instead of sausage. I grabbed the plate and said "i don't have time for you to fix it". They brought me sausage. Right away. Hey they can cook some things fast.  Just a mistake to stop here at the airport before your flight. Give yourself more than an hour.
Worse Cobb salad ever for me! Nothing but blue cheese and romaine lettuce. Also ordered gin and tonic but was served premium without being asked in a tall glass. So not worth the $26.00.

When in Phoenix, this is THE place to go!  The hot cakes? AMAZING! Soft and fluffy and heavenly and sooo good!!! everything was good, even the maple syrup. I also ordered the lemonade...just as good! it was made with real honey not sugar. Forget any of those breakfast chains, dont even think about it just get yourself to Matt's!  Do expect a wait, likely and hour in the morning, though if you come in later (got there closer to noon on a week day) the wait is much less and the ambiance less hectic also. The decor is cute and everyone was very friendly. It's a must for sure!
Visit Date:  10/4/14  This. Is slowly getting worse. .. today strike 2.  Last week was not good, today the same. Eggs over cooked, potatos burnt. Quality is dropping.  I'll give this 1 more chance.

The ambiance is what makes this place. Fast service and up-beat atmosphere. Big portions will fill your stomach. The food was so-so. The sausage in the biscuit and gravy has MSG which makes your whole mouth and lips feel like there is a party going on. Not great for people who it affects negatively. They should really disclose this, especially since they are so proud to advertise that they use real butter and extra virgin olive oil.  My spouse had the ham and cheese omelette, and he said there was a lot of chewy fatty ham. He said it was a little bland for his liking.  Also had the blueberry lemonade at the waitresses? recommendation, it pretty good, very sweet, I couldn't finish it.  The rosemary potatoes were delicious, but probably not good enough for us to come back during our stay.   Good: -Ambiance -Price -Speed -Rosemary Potatoes  Could Use Improvement -Stop using sausage with MSG -Use less sugar in the Lemonade -Get more creative with spicing up other dishes

Best breakfast in town that I have had the pleasure to sample in Phoenix You will likely have to wait a while to get in, and seating is limited.  If you take a big party, you should be ready to wait a bit longer.  The food is always done great, and they have a daily special.  The ingredients are part of the success, and they use local fresh organic ingredients in the food.  The waffle is the best on that I have ever had in my life.  The eggs and ham or bacon are mucho terrific.  My cousin is a fan of he chop and eggs, and that its two healthy pork chops with eggs and sides.  I have eaten most of the stuff on the menu, and there is only one clunker in my book.  that is the home made potato chips with lunch items.  They are a little heavy for my taste, and its would be nice to see fries with stuff like a huge butter burger.  Sample the organic lemonade, and you won't be disappointed.  The restaurant is close to the light rail, so you could go there on that, and parking is limited.  Visit Matt's BB and you will be back without a doubt.  This is the kind of place that is more old school, and if you want a lot of space and don't want to be close to your fellow diners, you might not like the dining experience.  I see more of these kinds of places popping up now in Phoenix, and it is a great trend in having a more varied palette in the dining experience beyond the huge chains that seem to dominate such new cities like Phoenix.
Loved the fresh jam on the thick wheat bread, I was a lil disappointed with the meat selection all that was offered was pork. I would love to see turkey added to the menu.

I don't know what people expect from a "diner".  I took my parents there this week and both of them loved it.  This is not some "health food" place for the Birkenstock crowd.  This is traditional diner fare.  Greasy yes, and good.  My Father had the omelet with the hash browns and he loved it.  He even commented on how good the hashies were due to the fact they were slathered in butter/fat.  My mother had the pancakes and she loved them too.  They have corn meal in them which might not appeal to a "traditionalist", but they were very good nonetheless.  I had the Belgian waffle and it was very good too.    The coffee was typical diner fare as well.  I would not call it drek as I am a coffee snob and roast green beans at home.  The coffee was what I expected from a diner.  We went at 8AM on a Tuesday and walked right in.  The staff was friendly and prompt.    I would go again with no problem.

The line and wait explain it enough. Matt's is a great place to wait, especially if you are willing to wait in line. The best times I like to go are during the weekdays when the service and food come out as quick as you order it appears at times. The staff and customer service is as good as it gets, especially given the busy rushes. The plate sizes/portions, and the selections are a main reason why we all keep going back no matter the wait. Dont wait too long, head out now and beat the rush....

We had a great time at Matt's! We walked in on a Sunday morning and we're greeted and sat down right away. Their Sunday special is steak and eggs so that's what my boyfriend ordered. I, a self proclaimed breakfast sandwich aficionado, had the Five Spot with a side of potatoes. The sandwich was very good, the bacon and onions made it. It was on a roll which is different but the roll held the sandwich well. The steak and eggs were cooked perfectly and the boyfriend was happy. Overall very solid breakfast place with good food and a nice atmosphere. I will definitely keep it in mind the next time I am in Tempe!

Delicious breakfast! really, everything I had was great. I got eggs, bacon, hash browns, & one pancake on the side. I most definitely couldn't finish it all, but I loved every bite.  I would have loved coffee with my breakfast, but they provide no non-dairy milk or creamer for those of us who are allergic to milk. This always feels a bit offensive to me when businesses don't care, if people are allergic or intolerant to milk. It's pretty common. It's very easy to remedy this slight Matt's. Get on it, & you'll be 5 stars.

Matt's is very very good and mostly organic! There is a long wait time during prime breakfast hours though usually around 30 min-1hr but definitely worth the wait especially if you have never been! The food is all very fresh and service was quick! The prices are a little more expensive than a typical breakfast place but you're getting fresh and organic food verses frozen. Their coffee was very good and would recommend trying it! Overall we had a great experience and would love to go back again!
Excellent food. Waffles and pancakes are light and flavorful. Servers were attentive- coffee cup was never empty.

Ok, first of all - if you're not up for a wait, don't go here.  Simple as that.  The place is small and it's popular - put those two facts together and there's a wait.  In the summer - yea, it's tought.  Now - that being said, I usually go to a place just down the street (don't know the name, but it's a 30 second walk to the south from Matt's) and have a bloody mary inside (or you can get coffee, juice, whatever) and do my wait there while reading the paper.  So, this works for me - no big deal.  Once seated the food is simply great.  If there's a better restaurant serving fresh, sometimes creative breakfast fare in Phoenix I'd love to know about it.  But, as a Phoenix native, I haven't found an equal yet.  I usually get the "five spot".  Simple, delicious and reasonably priced.  I've had the specials from time to time and they've always been good to excellent.  The service is attentive and friendly.  And, as someone mentioned, the juice serving might be a bit on the small side - but it's always been enough for me and I'd prefer the excellent quality over 8 ounces of something average any day of the week.  So, take your favorite paper, prepare for a bit of a wait, enjoy the great weather (much of the year) and enjoy.

What's that you say? This is the best breakfast in town? Why I think you're right! Simply put, Matt's does the simple American breakfast and they do it rather well. I go for waffle, eggs, bacon, home fries. BAM. A good morning indeed. Small, cute, very 50s feeling. Sure, there's a line out the door, but it's well worth the wait. Trust me.

A really nice place for breakfast, especially on weekdays. The wait in weekends makes it a bit hard to justify at times, and the crowd feels different - folks in their groups who aren't as willing to socialize with others. The weekday crowd feels like more of a community - more solo diners willing to chat.   Food is solid all around - I've had almost everything on the menu and thus stick to the specials most days. You can't go wrong if you're looking for a hearty, well-prepared breakfast.

Had a great breakfast this weekend.  Downtown Phx... fun vibe. We had 8 in our party but didn't wait long... got the little private room in front window.  Had the bfast sandwich... $5.95! Very good.. bread was awesome..DEF ..get the potatoes vs the hashbrowns. YUM. Homemade jelly made me order toast... glad i food.  Cool little place very reasonable.

Food was delish. I had the Hog & Chick, the preserves that came with the toast was tasty. Coffee was good. Niece was impressed they got her eggs done right. A bit of a wait but I had expected that, considering the amount of people we had before us the wait wasn't long.

My gal and I were downtown on a bit of a staycation, since we're locals, and I'd been to Matt's before... at the airport. This place lived up to expectations...!  There was significant road construction so you couldn't park very close to the place and it was a Thursday morning... and still, when we arrived, the place was packed with a bit of a wait - 5 minutes.  The food was good, I had the breakfast sandwich and we ordered the special eggs benedict as well as a waffle to share... all of it was really good!  The service was fast and attentive... and even though the place was busy the food came up quickly.  This place has had quite a local reputation... and I have to say if you're in the area and would like to get some breakfast - definitely try this place out.

It's just not the same as the original downtown location. The food was good, but the service wasn't as friendly. Granted we came in 40mins before close on a Sunday, so that's partially our fault. But definitely felt unwelcomed for coming in so late. Plus they were out of the steak and eggs Sunday special. :( Lesson learned, come earlier and hopefully you'll get the five star service to go with the five star food.

I had a bit of a wait for a table, but I expected that as it was Sunday morning. I was dining alone, and was seated in about 20 minutes. My waitress was engaging, and promptly brought water to my table. I was ready to order, so she took my drink (coffee) and meal orders at the same time. She returned quickly with the coffee, and I was surprised how quickly my meal (steak and eggs) came, given how busy it was. Steak was cooked as ordered, everything was hot and fresh!  I visit Phoenix on a regular basis and have eaten here several times. Staff have always been friendly and accommodating. Nice job.

Ever since attending college in downtown Phoenix I've attended this place on a semi-regular basis. I always take friends from out of state here and introduce them as the establishment with the the thickest slices of bacon you can find in the city. Out of 30+ visits I've never had a bad experience. I recommend getting their daily specials. Their produce is some of the freshest I've had at a local breakfast joint. I think they take advantage of the local farmers market that is hosted by their location althougg I'm not 100 percent on that, but whatever it is, it's awesome.

We decided that we would take in another great breakfast this Saturday at Matt's.  The food again was awesome that is not my beef.  We arrived at 0600 and our course there was no one else there since they still didnt open until 0630.  The employees were busy getting ready for the day.  Meanwhile some other customers started showing up and it seemed that a few of them knew each other so they must be regulars there.    The door opened and 0630 and a young blond lady invited us in with the others that were waiting.  This is were it happened!   I walked in the door and chose a table to the right and was informed that "that table is set for three".   WTF??    We were the first people in the door and anyone who has ever eaten knows that it is open seating and if seats are not available then you put your name on a notebook sheet of paper by the door and wait.  So, we sat down and watched three "men"  cruise over to the table "set for three"....   I guess that they get prefered seating over other customers.   I know it sounds petty but the tone of little blondy completely pissed me off.......  I dont think it was right and I think her tone was rude and you could tell she really didnt care what we thought about it..  I will think again before returning to eat here.   There are a lot of choices alot closer to home for breakfast.

Great food, we got two pretty basic breakfasts (eggs toast bacon ect) and the huevos rancheros special. They were all really good, especially since they came with a house made jam, cage free eggs, and some locally roasted coffee (cave creek roasters, a great place). The house potatoes had a lot of great flavor, but I personally think they had a little too much Rosemary. That's a personal preference though. The service was good too, the people were friendly and the drink refills were en point. The reason why I give the place 4/5 is because I think he atmosphere was lacking. The place isn't very comfortable. Aluminum chairs are super loud, lighting is very industrial, we could see into the kitchen which wasn't the most pleasant view, and could hear every single thing the servers were talking about from across the room. It wasn't busy either, only one other table, so the sound was ridiculous.

***Matt's Big Breakfast is a good, fresh and made-from-scratch breakfast featuring both good sweet items (like French toast and waffles) to high quality breakfast meats (thick-cut bacon and maple sausage links)***  Matt's Big Breakfast was featured on Food Network's Diners, Drive-ins & Drives.  It was in a smaller location back then and had an incredibly long wait.  It is in a much bigger space now though I believe it still has a very long wait; we were able to avoid the long wait though by coming early (a little after 8:00am on a Saturday).  I am not sure what their old space looked like, but the new space is nice.  It has an industrial look and there are great touches throughout the dining room from exposed pipes and a variety of seating to the big blackboard that announces the daily specials.  I had their French toast (which was a special).  It came with maple sausage links.  The French toast was very good.  It was thick toast and the outside was very good.  It had a nice, slightly crispy edge that had great sweetness.  There were great notes of cinnamon and the eggy crust was very addictive.  The inside was fairly moist too without being soggy.  However, because the bread was so thick, the very center of the French toast probably was not as moist as I would have liked.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/matts-big-breakfast-phoenix-2?select=6WCwYFxcTuQs-1nZktVsCg#QVj5TsuHRcV3qV5qcpzb5A  The French toast came with very good real maple syrup.  Extra maple syrup is available at an extra charge, but the portion they provide complimentary with the French toast and waffles is more than enough in my opinion.  The maple sausages were excellent.  The outside sear was very good and the inside was very juicy.  It had a great mix of salty and then sweet from the maple syrup.  Bob Evans used to do (and maybe still does) maple sausages and Matt's Big Breakfast's sausages were very similar to them though I would say Matt's sausages were thicker.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/matts-big-breakfast-phoenix-2?select=6WCwYFxcTuQs-1nZktVsCg#_MwLXLWjCU_o_fZ2Q3JiZg  I also tried their waffle and it was very good--nice, thick Belgian waffle that was light and fluffy with the right amount of sweetness.  Their hash browns were good as well--the right mix of soft shredded potatoes as well as a great crispy top.  These hash browns were seasoned just okay; ketchup and hot sauce was necessary.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/matts-big-breakfast-phoenix-2?select=6WCwYFxcTuQs-1nZktVsCg#B7lMBvpvsIg5opeOwymeVw  I also had their bacon and it was very high quality.  The bacon was incredibly thick.  It was not crispy.  Instead, it was a thick, meaty and chewy bacon (the fat was all rendered down).  The bacon was also heavily peppered.  While the bacon was definitely high quality, I would have preferred a thick bacon that had both a good crispy exterior as well as a meaty, chewy interior.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/matts-big-breakfast-phoenix-2?select=6WCwYFxcTuQs-1nZktVsCg#_3YUclGMUq1-1LN20B1CgQ  Service was good.  The food came out at a quick pace.  The restaurant gets busy though and it can be difficult at times tracking down a server.  Prices are not that bad.  Some of their items (like their specials and a la carte sides) are definitely on the pricey side, but a lot of their regular menu items feature good portion sizes and are under $8.  Matt's Big Breakfast is a worthwhile breakfast spot and definitely worth visiting if you are a breakfast fan and find yourself in Phoenix.  The food is very straightforward, but It is also immediately recognizable that a lot of the food is homemade/made-from-scratch.  This combined with the high quality ingredients really make this restaurant feel like a very special breakfast place.  I believe this restaurant has its own free parking lot in the back.  Expensive metered street parking is also available.
Worth the wait if there is one!

So beyond sad that I have to write this review. I have been coming here off an on for a year... And today was my first bad expeirence but after reading some of the other reviews I don't think my expeirence is off par. I sadly won't be attending this establishment any more. It ties directly in with service and possibly the cooks... Normally its quite busy at lunch however I showed up at 11:15am so I think I beat the rush because I was able to sit down immediately. I asked the waitress how much just a side of one little pancake in addition to my meal would be and she said $3. I know the are a tad overpriced but for the healthier food on the menu I would pay that little bump in cost... not so much for little pancake. I ordered the special which was Eggs Benedict and asked that my eggs were cooked overhard. As I'm waiting for my food I realize that my water wasn't a fresh water (strange) it possibly was sitting out for awhile because it had 3 half melted ice cubes at the top (strange). So I asked for a fresh water which I felt like I was a bothersome. I received my food and took a big bite out of my eggs benedict only to realize that I was eatting a raw egg. I looked down and saw the dizzle of the yolk running down my food. Since my server didn't check on me after the fact, I motioned the first server I saw and told her I ordered it overhard and showed her the egg yolk. She looked a little dumbfounded and took my meal away. Returned shortly after with a new plate... or so I thought. Seeings how this was the special for the day I can only imagine that they had a big o pot of water in the back harvesting all these poached eggs. Well what they did with my eggs was throw the half eaten and the other poked egged into the pot because I received the same eggs I parted with earlier. I was so beyond hungry I just ate it. Luckily I have no dieases or anything that the next eggs benedict customer would be concerned with but still I'm a stranger... with my food all up on their food. I don't know doesn't sound appealing and makes me think what else do they do back there?! In addition, while eating my food, I ran out of water. No refill. Nobody came to check on me. No service. I didn't even get a bill. I had to walk up to the front to pay.   I did note that the owner who is usually there wasn't there this time. Not sure if that had anything to do with it this day. I just don't feel I was treated like a customer. Text my husband on the way out saying... well looks like I won't be back to matts big breakfast again... Overpriced food plus bad service... I rather go elsewhere.

Wow! Considering this is an airport restaurant, I am very impressed with the quality of food served here. Their breakfast sandwich was flavorful and well worth the $9.00 I spent on the plate. If you are ever in terminal 4 of the Phoenix airport check this place out!

Upon arrival, we came across a past customer who left a travel bag behind at lunch, when he stated his situation the manager refused to show any compassion "it's been passed to the city of Phoenix, here's the number, that's all you got." lack of empathy as a manager, especially for a customer who already came though. This is how you treat your people, huh? Nice situation to walk into, it could have been handled better and not for everyones display. Everything else: Despite the trendy styling, the food was mediocre...Plain, flat, overpriced, nothing to write home about, chicken pesto and Cobb salad. Next time I'm in the Arizona airport,  I'll find a different restaurant.
I'm just piling on at this point, but Matt's is as good as it gets.  Reminds me of big homemade farmboy breakfast.

Was in Phoenix visiting from California and found this place on Yelp. Food was amazing only bad part is i couldn't eat more and its so far away from home. I ordered a waffle and it was super delicious. Would highly recommend to anyone visiting the area.

So I walk up to this place and the surrounding area actually almost made me turn away. Then I walk in and it's really nice. I was greeted right away. Servers are great. I have to say the Manager seemed to not be very helpful as I was brought the wrong food TWICE and when he brought me what I actually ordered he said "sorry she messed up when she put it in" I'm pretty sure that wasn't the case but even if it was for a manager to place blame on his servers I felt was wrong especially since he brought me the wrong food the second time! Other than that the food was good can't really mess up eggs. I would prefer two slices of thin toast then one thick piece but that's just me.
Solid breakfast, the menu does not habe anthing fancy on it but what they cook it is done to perfection.

Never tried the Down town location, because didn't want to do the long wait times!  So after knowing this restaurant just by fame and recognition, went and tried it out.  Showed up and there he was; Big Matt with a big smile in his face; at the door being the hostess of his restaurant.  When do you see than any where else or any other owner with half of his reputation even attempting it.  Just by seeing that site and his humble positive energy I was really ready in trying the service and the food.  I never had an American Breakfast like this before.  Crispy waffles on the outside and gooey and soft in the inside.  Freshly squeezed orange juice and bottomless awesome coffee.  The pork chop was a little dry, but that was about it, everything else was awesome!  Matt does so many things right, stevia on the table, perfect selection of coffee cups made in the USA!, the fresh cut flowers on the table, but the very especial thing, was the staff!!  I think everyone of his staff including the two managers came to check up on us, and ask if they could get something for us!  Spectacular service, restaurants in the Valley should learn from Matt's philosophy!  Everything is honest, fresh, authentic, simple, taught off and  delicate.  Keep growing guys, keep getting better, maybe a Dinner menu with late hours could be a possibility!!  I can Dream right, and Dreams are meant to be lived!  Blessings

Was initially excited to see a Matts location in Scottsdale, even tho I don't get up there often. I remembered the menu at the downtown location used to have some unique offerings so was disappointed to see that this location's menu is pretty much the same as many other breakfast places.  Decided to order the cheese omelet and hash browns...and even though I added mushrooms to the eggs, they were pretty tasteless, and they had no salsa... Really? In Arizona? The hash browns were so greasy I couldn't eat them. All in all a big disappointment. I think I'll pass...

Sat down and had the Mamacita burger with seasoned fries. Possibly the best airport meal I've ever had. The server was great, the food was out quickly, and unlike McDonald's didn't look like it was rushed to be put together. The bacon was crispy, the bun was lightly toasted and perfect and the burger itself was cooked as I asked and tasted awesome. I would recommend this place to anyone with 20 minutes to enjoy some great food.

Best breakfast I've ever had.  Hands down, the best breakfast joint Ive eaten at. The bloody Mary was excellent, home fries were so delicious, the waffles were perfect and so was the omelette. If we ever move to this area we will most definitely be regulars here.

A Big Breakfast with a small menu!  Note: this review is for the vegetarian options.  Small, cute restaurant in the middle of a neighorhood area that ALWAYS seems to have a line. Words of advice- WAIT. IN. THE. LINE!   Service- we sat at the bar, which isn't huge (I think there were between 12-15 stools), and the  server was very friendly, very helpful, and very nice. Our food was brought out promptly, water was refilled before we could get close to finishing, and we were checked up on every 5 minutes. 5 stars.  Atmosphere- Really cute place that's always full. It's not huge, but it's not tiny either. Everyone seems to be in a good mood, and its a wonderful BRUNCH location. It's fairly loud, so not a quiet, date location, but great to come with 1 person for good food, or with a small group for brunch at the tables. 4 stars  Food- And now for the best part. The food! They have a small menu which I don't mind because everything is well thought out and creative. The cheese omelet (with Wisconsin cheddar of course) was well-cooked, didn't have too much cheese to make it goopy, and went very well with the sauteed onions. The made-from-scratch Belgian waffle was DIVINE. Every bite was delicious and the REAL maple syrup it's served with is delicious. Don't drench the waffle so you can taste the amazing batter itself and the syrup to compliment it. 5 stars.  Drinks- ORDER THE FRESH HONEY LEMONADE! Wonderfully refreshing on a hot day, fresh, homemade taste, and sweetened with honey to add that kick at the end. 4 STARS.  Bottom line- come early, wait in line with good company, try 1 thing with syrup, 1 without, and order the lemonade. Go home happy.
No one liked the thick pepper crusted bacon. Prefer a thinner crisper bacon.  Slow service.  Sour dough toast too thick.  Does not carry coke.  Only RC

Came back because I recalled having a nice breakfast about 1-year ago. My connecting flight is at another terminal and left there to try this breakfast again. Had Matt's Biggest Breakfast for $13.99. Sausage and bacon were special. Would have preferred the toast over the so-so pancake.  Eggs came out slightly more 'easy' than 'medium', but was acceptable for me since I like it either way.  Sat at bar. Katie provided good service while working the bar. Checked back. Kept busy. Even made sure my water was refilled. Thanks Katie. (normally don't write reviews)

This place has got the recipe for success!  Their wait staff are always friendly and accommodating, their food is of the highest quality and prepared to perfection.  The downtown Matt's is usually quite busy with a wait, whereas the one on Camelback and 32nd Street is typically not difficult to get into right away.  I guess it depends on what time you go.  Early is most often the best time to go.  One of the best breakfast spots in Phoenix.  Give it a try!
Don't get all the hype. Ridiculous wait for ordinary food. If you have an hour or more to kill on your weekend then go for it.

After a 45 minute wait we (party of 5) were seated at a good table...service was great, food was great, management not so great.  My daughter and a friend came in to join us toward the end of our breakfast...we asked if a chair could be added to our table...manager said no...very loudly and drawing attention to our table, that they could not join our party bc it wouldn't be fair to those who had been waiting.  We asked for a chair so she could sit with us. We understood the reason why she couldn't order, but his grandstanding in the restaurant was impolite & unprofessional.  After upsetting my daughter, my wife went to speak to him about how he handled the situation...rather than hear our concern regarding how he embarrassed a teenaged customer with his grandstanding, he proceeded to argue his point and justify his actions...he finally relented and offered an apology.  Fast forward 4 days, same teenaged daughter goes to breakfast w friends.  One of the party drops the check tray and it breaks....same manager gets upset and asks if the young lady had $32 to pay for the broken check tray...not joking, not playing around, but with the same arrogant and impatient attitude displayed just 4 days prior.  The place has great food and the service has been good each time we visited Matt's.  But this one manager's attitude, arrogance, and actions will keep us from visiting the Tempe location in the future.

I have been to two locations since I've moved to Phoenix and both are equally amazing! Their waffles, bacon, jam, toast, everything is to die for! And don't even get me started on their homemade syrup! I think I could drink it its that good! 10/10 would recommend!
Definitely worth the wait if you're a breakfast person. The hash browns were amazing. I hope to go back again very soon.

Always good, Always a smile!   A" must-go" if you are anywhere in AZ ...!  ... get to Matt's and you can thank me later! ;)   A HINT: get there a little before 6am or bring an umbrella for the sun in case you have a wait.   Regardless ... wake early, travel with an umbrella or sunscreen OR sit for a bit ... you will be glad you "close this deal!"   Bfast or Lunch ... the answer is YES!  Bon Appetit!  - Britten

Overrated and not worth the wait. I thought the bacon was decent but definitely not the best I've had. Was slightly too charred too. Hash browns were okay but a lot of dirty potato skin in it. Waffle was dry, even after dumping syrup on it. I would go back if there wasn't a wait, but definitely not worth waiting for.
Great food, fast service and an electrical plug under my seat; exactly what an airport diner/eating place should be.

Summary:  crowded, high priced, mediocre food,  good service.  I read the mass volume of amazing reviews and showed up here with high hopes.  A roughly 20 minute wait and we were seated and served promptly at about 10am.    After approx 10 minutes or so, food was served.  We ordered the special (thick cut French toast) and a plate with eggs, bacon and hash browns.  Hash-browns were thick and oily,  practically dripping.  French-toast was thick cinnamon and raisin bread, maple maple syrup.  Nothing more.  It was really just thick toast.  Bacon... thick and dry, pretty crispy.  The homemade lemonade was really really sweet and seemed to me a mix of strawberry or blueberry syrups in our cups with lemonade.   Wasn't exciting or homemade in flavor.  All in all,  food was sub-par on a scale with a typical IHOP or Dennys, but much more expensive.  Food and drink for three before tip tallied at over $50.  Kind of a bummer.  Service was good all around.  I wouldn't come back.

Food is very subjective so what I'm not crazy about, someone else may like.  I had an omelet and had bacon added to the inside.  They were generous with the amount of bacon.  If you're one of those people who can't tolerate even a little golden color on your omelet you'd be unhappy.  It wasn't a lot or bad but there was some.  I don't care about that.  The orange juice was obviously fresh squeezed from good oranges.  My problem was the hash browns.  They were in a rectangular, flat shape, overcooked (crisp) and oily.  It was obvious the rectangles are made ahead of time and thrown on a grill as needed.  My toast was a disappointment too as it seemed like instead of spreading butter on each piece they had put an indentation in the middle of one slice, put a huge glob of butter in the indent and put the two pieces together.  One piece had very little butter on it and all in one spot.  The other piece had a well of mostly melted butter so that piece had too much on it.  The service was very good and people were friendly.  The seating leaves a LOT to be desired.
Affordable and delicious food! There's still a wait-time even after moving to a bigger location, but it's well worth it.
It was greasy, they don't put onions in the hashbrowns. I would not recommend this place

Eh?  How have I not written a review for Matt's?  I went there a while back, but thankfully it won't be hard for me to recall the experience!  Place - Small. Food - Fantastic. Wait - Usually. Bathroom - An adventure.  We didn't have too long of a wait when we went, but that was entirely luck. I've seen crazy waits here, which is just par for the course when the food is good. Most of it is local and very, very good. Service was fast, and spot on.  The bathrooms are next door in an old motel. Apparently a separate room set aside just for Matt's. Just one more stand out feature for a very stand-out sort of place!

Great place for breakfast. It's a local hotspot in the city of phoenix. I was stoked when they opened one in the airport. All of the food is made from fresh I frequents often from local producers. I got a breakfast burrito. It was bomb, but I wish the potatoes in it were hash browns instead of slices.   Will be back again.

Gotta say, I was underwhelmed. I was surprised because of the great number of super-positive reviews.   I ordered the Hog & Chick. My first shock was the much-lauded bacon. While it's nicely cooked, it's almost completely covered in coarse-ground, strong pepper. To me, it was inedible. They very kindly replaced it with sausage, but that was almost burnt. Puzzling.  The next thing was the hash browns. I ordered them "extra crispy." What came out was a pale, limp, undercooked, slight greasy brick of potatoes. They looked nothing like the pictures I've seen posted.  Since I'd already sent back the bacon, I sucked it up and ate it but it wasn't appealing or tasty.   I don't live in Phoenix but, if I did, I don't believe I'd be back.

We are visiting from Atlanta,GA. Found this place in a thrillist list.   The place was worth the 45 minute wait.  My fianc order the scramble special with amAzing apple sausage. It was a huge portion and tasted amazingly.   I ordered the chick and the hog with over easy eggs and the house potatoes. The taste was amazing. The potatoes aren't the healthiest option but it tasted so good with the grilled onions. I had the sausage which was a little too salty.   They gave us bread with strawberry preserves. They were sweet and Greta taste.   If we lived here, this would be a regular spot.
Matt's Big Breakfast has wonderful food cooked from scratch. The bottomless cup of coffee is excellent and goes with the omelet so well!

Went to go check on this place for the first time. I had heard such great things. Walked in to get seated the guy who was taking our order was rude.
