So we told him we were not ready yet so he went about his work another person came by took our order. Once we got our food. My potatoes where completely burnt and way to much oil. Had to send them back. Got a new order in less than a minute. They were not burnt. However still lost of oil. Other than that the food was okay.

Where do I start? Well to be clear, I never actually ate here...unless you count my stomach eating itself from utter and total starvation!   Coming all the way to Matts was a stretch for us, living on the west side and having a breakfast place we already love. But...we had heard great things and wanted to check it out. MISTAKE one.   We called and were told there wasn't much of a wait. We arrived and were told it should be pretty quick. I think that's the point where they realized we had kids. This place HATES kids. MISTAKE two.  We waited for 90 minutes! We watched parties come after us, get seated and leave while we were waiting outside. And these were parties of ALL sizes. They even LIED to us and said we were next and sat a party of the exact same size that arrived 20 minutes after us.   We left and went around the corner to the Phoenix Public Market. I doubt that the food here could be good enough to put up with their complete and total bullshit.
Monday late afternoon...50% full tables...fast service...tasty Reuben...nice waiter. Will come again.
1. Awesome location. 2. Fantastic Food. 3. Great environment.  Only reason to not give it 5 stars is because the wait time is so long but this place is a must go.

Being new to the Phx area and trying new breakfast spots was not all that exciting, came up on Matts Big Breakfast. And let me tell you, best breakfast ever! Service was absolutely wonderful the second time around (; and we will be going back soon! Thanks Matt for being awesome!

What an awesome place atmosphere and the food so good ! The coffee and fresh squeezed OJ , the only bad thing that is always so busy ! But is worth the wait !!! Those potatoes and the omelette sandwich made my brunch expectations, really nice and clean place the customer services was excellent!

Perhaps if I waited outside in the heat for an hour plus to the point that I became starved and dehydrated, I too would have thought Matt's was worthy of 5 stars. Or maybe the 5 star reviews come from people too ashamed to admit that they wasted most of their morning on a very average breakfast.  In my case, we came here before 7am on a Friday and got the last available seats by the window. Service was great; I didn't detect any attitudes from the waitstaff that has been mentioned in some reviews. They got our meal out quickly and made sure our coffee mugs never got empty.  With the exception of the toast and jam, the food never rose above "good." Isn't that pretty sad that the best offering from a breakfast diner is the bread? I liked my waffle since it was a bit crisper than what I can do at home with my geriatric waffle iron, but there was nothing noteworthy about the flavor. My husband said his eggs were cooked perfectly with his chop and chick dish, but the pork chop was under-seasoned. He found the hashbrowns way too greasy to be enjoyable, and the bacon suffered from being overcooked.  Maybe we're spoiled since we have two great breakfast places within walking distance (Joe's Farm Grill and the Coffee Shop). Matt's just isn't worth the drive or wait.

I went for brunch with my boyfriend this morning. The omelette I had with added mushrooms was very good. My boyfriend had the skinny and he liked it. The service was mediocre. We were seated and had to wait about 10 minutes before someone came over and asked if we were offered drinks yet. They then got our server to take our drink and food order. The check was dropped off about 3 minutes after our food was served. I hadn't even tried a bite of everything on my plate yet. Before we had even finished the meal, forks were in hand, they asked if we were done eating. It definitely felt like we were being rushed out of the restaurant.  We got to the restaurant at 11:20a and there was no wait, there was still no wait for our table 30 minutes later when we were asked if we were finished about 5 minutes after receiving our food. Yes the food was great but would I go back, no.

We were seated and the server took our orders almost immediately. The service and attention is not lacking, however sometimes quick is not always great. The atmosphere is "hip" or fresh, but it was loud and echoed. The food came out fast but was just ok. I had the French toast special, which was a bit too thick and rather dry. The apple smoked sausage was ok, but not all that flavorful. The real maple syrup was a nice touch though. I ordered some scramble eggs on the side which were hard/ overcooked. If you like them well done, then the eggs are for you. My wife had their eggs/potatoes/bacon breakfast. The bacon was almost too peppered, and she has a pepper allergy. She said the eggs snd potatoes were ok, but that I make better at home. All this cost us just about $30 before tip which is much pricier that I am used to for breakfast food, and not outstanding enough in taste to justify it. Also to note is that they can't divide checks. My wife needed a separate itemized check as necessary for her company to reimburse her expense and they cannot and will not do that. Apparently it is mentioned somewhere on their menu about that but our 2 minutes to order meant we had to look at the food offerings instead. We have had better experiences at other places nearby and have also received other recommendations for better breakfast food.

Gotta try Matt's! They really are putting out a superb breakfast. Love the thick cut toast and Pork Shop (queen creek) thick sliced bacon with cracked pepper. Even the bottomless cup of coffee is a great coffee. Keep up the great eats Matt!!!

Went to Matt's Big Breakfast with 6 of my peers after an informational session on a Saturday afternoon. It was very busy, there was at least a 30 minute waiting period, and we had to wait for all the members of our group to be present before our waiting period even began.  Even though we ended up waiting for a little over 30 minutes, it was well worth the wait because we got to sit at this big table located in a little room they have off to the side. It made the setting very intimate and homey since we were surrounded by cute decor and a refrigerator holding Matt's homemade preserves.   The first time I ever went to Matt's Big Breakfast I was really craving egg salad so I ordered the egg salad sandwich, which even though it was good, it wasn't anything I would return back for. With that in mind, this time I decided to order something Matt's Big Breakfast is known for, that being BREAKFAST! I ordered the special of the day, the egg scramble complete with local cheese, spinach, and sausage. Between the hashbrowns or home fries I ordered the home fries  (basically quartered potatoes, crisped to perfection and seasoned with rosemary, YUM). The scramble came with a side of toast with butter and a little cup of their famous preserves. I ordered sourdough toast and the preserves that it came with were strawberry. Their preserves are definitely worth a try! Not to be confused with jelly, their preserves have a nice consistency with bits of fruit noted.  I would not recommend dining here if you have big groups in which the check needs to be split. I say this because if we wanted the receipt split according to what everyone ate, we had to take it up to the counter where we were informed by the cashier that she was unable to split it by item, we had to give her dollar amounts. This got a little tricky since the receipt wasn't itemized but rather grouped into by item (i.e. 3 hog and chick's were ordered and the receipt only showed the total for all three). Additionally, we didn't have menus in front of us to determine the individual item prices and our group was fairly large which made standing at the cashier doing math quite the inconvenience for anyone in line behind us.  It mostly seemed like there were families and parties of one here at Matt's Big Breakfast so definitely go solo or with your family.  I would definitely recommend Matt's Big Breakfast if you're looking for homey breakfast food with subtle modern nuances.
Love this place! Friendly staff and great food. Daniel, who takes togo orders, is incredibly friendly and professional.

Ok ok, this place is fine.  But it's so LOUD.  Don't expect to have an actual conversation with whoever you are dining with.  And it's a little hard to find something on the menu that doesn't have bacon.  If you're a veggie there is one option you can, but the veggie option (like for an omelet) are scarce.  However, what I did order tasted good, it's just not something I wanted to eat really, it was kinda my only option.  When I go out for breakfast I want an amazing breakfast burrito with a side of fruit, not some eggs I could have made at home.

Christmas Eve at 9:50pm and the waitress Corrina was the rudest person I've ever encountered. I'm stunned. I literally left the restaurant because of her. I would have left you a $10 tip for my $12 sandwich Corrina, it is Christmas Eve after all. I'm not a grinch... For the record, she was immediately mean. Even before I could say hello.

I finally made it here. The staff was genuinely friendly, I chatted with a few and a manger. The lemonade is delicious I had the blueberry. The waffle with the chicken apple sausage was delicious. My son enjoyed the pancakes and bacon   They do not have a kids menu but both of our meals where big enough to share. The location is in a beautiful facility. I would definitely go again. No wait not a lot of people. I'm sure it's different on the weekends. The prices are also reasonable.

Good service and good food and good prices. We came here on a holiday morning and waited about 15 mins before getting seated. Be warned that there is no dedicated parking area for this restaurant and you'll have to use the metered street parking. The atmosphere of the place was very busy but aesthetically pleasing enough. However, we came here to catch up with family, and it was just too noisy to hear most of the conversations. I strained my voice as if I was talking in a club. In the end, I would still recommend this place because the quality of the food is good for their price.

Had an extended layover in PHX airport and decided to try this place out. I had forgotten that Guy Fieri highlighted the downtown spot on DDD.  Local coffee served from Roastery of Cave Creek. The panda needed that caffeine.  Five Spot Platter ($8.95): Breakfast sandwich with bacon, American cheese, two eggs, and grilled onions. Potatoes on the side. The roll is large, with a small layer of filler. On the plus side, the roll was soft and fluffy. The roll's flavor reminded me of a croissant. The potatoes were seasoned generously with salt and pepper. Bacon was excellent. Good portion. Overall, I'd say The Five Spot hit the spot.  I just sat at the bar for this one. Good service.  I saw others at the bar ordering Reubens. Hefty sandwiches that are recommended by the staff if you want a nice-sized lunch.  I'll have to remember this place next time, should I opt for a very gluttonous meal.

For starters the food really is great here. But I would choose a different place if you have any interest in actually hearing what anyone is saying at the breakfast table. The place is so overcrowded and loud, it makes it difficult to enjoy the time with friends. Frankly this place is over rated.

I love this place for many reasons! One the atmosphere of the place is just really cool and modern. Second, the service is great; all very friendly staff. Third, the food is beyond delicious. I ordered their breakfast sandwich, I couldn't even finish it all. They serve you huge portions here, so come with your appetite. Don't even get me started on the bacon; so fresh, juicy, and delicious. Overall this place just is amazing for breakfast. They have my business. Try them out!

Meh.   I was excited to try this place because my friend loved it last time she came but it wasn't worth it to me. For $60 on brunch I'd expect better service to be honest.  The place wasn't busy at all and our sever never checked on us. We're halfway through meal and champagne glasses are bone dry and our server brings us our bill stating no rush... to me when I'm still eating and the bill is brought that is rushing me out. We were there around 130 which they still had an hour to close so idk why we were being pushed out so fast. We asked for another drink and our server acted like he didn't wanna work anymore. We said thank you and he's like mhm, crumples the bill he originally brought to add extra drink and walks away. I'm sorry, but adding more drinks to bill raises the bill which means more tip.   The food was pretty good. I had the skinny eggs and it was a good portion for the price. I'm all about service though and this place fell short of that. The manager was checking on table but never came to us. The manager came to our table to take my card to pay, and I said oh it's already paid I need to just sign and he drops card and walks off.. doesn't say anything. Kind of odd  I live in north Phoenix and drove to Tempe cause my friend said it was worth it but I don't think so. The service was meh and the food was alright. Not worth the drive tho so this will be the place that I skip next time.

Delicious food overshadows poor inattentive service. My party of four waited nearly 40 minutes today(Friday morning) and when we were finally seated our waitress promptly greeted us and took our drink order. After that, service was slow and had poor follow up. Forget trying to get a coffee cup refilled(I got up and went near the kitchen window to get a refil).    The good news is that the omelette and egg scrambles are delicious and large.  Homemade breads are wonderful. Our meals were delivered by some other team member and we never saw our waitress again until it was time for a check.  No follow up!!! Management may think the team approach is fine but someone, ie the primary waitress, needs to maintain some degree of attention to the table once food has been served. When we were leaving we mentioned this to our waitress and she just shrugged her shoulders and thanked us for coming...wow! I must reiterate how good the food is...We will return again because of that fact.

I'm all about the QUALITY of food and the quaintness of the facility. The fact they use local grown, organic ingredients... SOLD ME then you add in the cute decor and limited tables I WAS HEAD OVER HEELS! They treat you VERY WELL, we had our 2 little girls with us and they came by to offer pens for them to color while we waited for the food (which wasn't very long) - the food was hot, fresh & Delicious the Coffee was AMAZING and they HUSSSSLLLEEE to get you in and out to accommodate the people waiting which as a consumer is important because we all get discouraged by long lines or tons of people wiating out front. I can't wait to go back-

They told us it was going to be a 30 minute wait but it was only about 10 minutes and we were glad we waited.  Great little place. Yummy food and charming decor! I wish I tried the honey lemonade but next trip to Phoenix

We visited Phoenix last week and ate breakfast here twice.  The food and the staff were terrific.  I wasn't hungry for many, many hours after having breakfast!  It's a bit on the noisy side and you do have to wait.  I think we waited between 20 - 30 minutes each time.

So, there are several kinds of hyped places to grab a good breakfast.  One is the hyped vegan/paleo fresh squeezed kale juice place that soothes guilty thoughts about enjoyed food by giving you overpriced mush. Next is the trendy place that overcharges you for average food and makes you wonder what all the hype is about    And THEN you hit a place like Matt's and you understand that even the unwashed ignorant masses get something right occasionally.  Matts is a breakfast place, low on ambience and high on service and amazing on food!  Thick cut bacon great eggs and fantastic biscuits and gravy make you glad that you did something right today.  The things that really get you are the great big buttery pieces of toast and killer jam and the epic hash browns.  If anyone has ever written poetry about hash browns, you know where they went to breakfast that morning.  Great place great food, just get there early and on a weekday unless you have literally nothing else to do that day besides stand in line!

BACON! The bacon is the shining star! We went later around 12-12:30 on a Sunday, so we only had to wait about 10 minutes to be seated. There were about 2 other couples waiting after us and then there was no wait to be seated. So going later could be a good tactic; however, the specials had run out, so as long as you don't care about that, you got it made.  I ordered the hog and chick with home fries, The bacon is the bomb, thick and delicious, the home fries are also so flavorful, and my scrambled eggs were cooked perfectly.  You also get a large slice of buttered toast and jam.  The man had the chop and chick and a side of bacon with home fries. I tried the chop and it was good, but a little over cooked (dry) in my opinion. He also had the strawberry honey lemonade which was delicious! I can't order drinks with no refills because I drink a lot, so I had the iced tea.   Overall, very good! I wouldn't wait 2 hours to be seated though, I'd come back for the bacon!

My boyfriend and I ordered the waffle that comes with amazing flavorful thick  bacon with just the right amount of pepper. We also ordered the special, which was a chorizo scramble with cheddar cheese and jalapeos, it was to die for. We switched out the tortilla for toast so we could try the preserves based on other Yelp reviews, the flavor was blueberry and it was AMAZING! I couldn't believe how great the hash browns were, they really take pride in them with a cheese filling, no ketchup needed. The food came out really fast and service was friendly.

I haven't been here in years. I really liked the food the very first time, but this second experience was pretty mediocre. I thought there was a big menu selection but there's only a few choices in the typical American breakfast categories. Prices usually range around 10-15 dollars. For that price I really hoped for better tasting coffee but it's your average typical coffee found in every Denny's. I ordered the basic breakfast (what my son calls a typical breakfast) 2 eggs, bacon, country potatoes and sour bread toast. My favorite thing on my plate was the sour bread toast! Fantastic! The bacon and potatoes do have their own unique favor. With strong hints of rosemary and black pepper.   Would I come back? Sure, if i was in the neighborhood and it was around a non peak hour. This place does seem to get a bit congested. Be willing to wait 15+ minutes for a table.

Best breakfast I've had at a airport hands down,  Good size portions and very good. Had ham and cheese omelet with fried potatoes and they actually had seasoning fried with them and onions Was good stuff, Price was very fair for a airport

Went here this morning. As usual, the wait was crowded out to the corner of 1st Street. People are willing to wait for good food, I suppose.   Once you get inside Matt's Big Breakfast (it was about an hour wait for us on a Saturday morning), you see why it took so long. There's about 15 seats in the whole place and it's tiny...like a Manhattan hotel room. People are bumping into each other, sliding around and the commotion is high. It's loud, it's gritty and it's the perfect diner setting.  For all the press it's gotten, the food better be damn good. And it is. The eggs are cage raised and organic, the pork is from high-quality Iowa farms and most of the produce is local. The fresh-squeezed OJ is legit. And the coffee is from a premium roaster in Cave Creek, AZ. The hash browns are very much like you would find at a joint in the Midwest: buttery on the inside and crispy brown on the outside.   Do yourself a favor and brave the wait and the commotion... it's worth it.

Not really worth the wait. food was ok, hash browns were under cooked and my pork chop was dry, boo hiss. Staff was very nice, but they seem to have a hard time keeping up with all the people. Biggest disappointment of the morning was when a party of 8 showed up 15 mins after our party of 3 and was seated before us???? not really sure how that worked out? Oh yeah no bathroom, make sure not to order any coffee.

Found a great breakfast place about 10 minutes outside of the airport. I noticed they list a location inside Terminal 4 but, for some reason I missed seeing it.  As I arrived at their downtown location, I noticed a crowd waiting outside the front of the restaurant. This is always a good sign that you're in the right place. I sat at the counter and ordered their classic Hog and Chick (bacon and eggs) with home style potatoes. Their potatoes are well seasoned and their bacon is nice and thick with the right amount of black pepper. It came with 2 thick pieces of sourdough toast with a special home made jam that you should not pass up. It actually looked like a small side of salsa. But, it came served with my toast. So I tried it and it was amazing. I don't know what's in it but, trust me when I say it's worth a try. This is significant since I'm normally not a jam person.  Great friendly staff. I highly recommend it if you're ever in the downtown Phoenix area and have time for breakfast, stop by Matt's Big Breakfast.

My boyfriend came here on a Saturday morning (probably one of their busy days) and waited maybe 10 minutes. The short wait was SOOO worth it. We ordered two blackberry honey lemonades and my bf said it was the best lemonade he's ever had in his life!  A customer next to us ordered the special of the day and it looked so good we had to get the same! It was some sort of sausage hash with rosemary potatoes (writing this review a few weeks later so I can't remember exactly.) First off, it was a HUGE serving. the rosemary potatoes were perfect and the strawberry jam that came with the toast tasted like biting into a fresh strawberry.   This is definitely the best breakfast in Phoenix.

My friend read some great reviews so myself and 3 friends just went today.  Had the special it was great cool atmosphere great service,  very attentive. .. A must go if you want good scratch cooking breakfast. ..

I went to Matt's BB for the first time last weekend.  Took me a moment to get oriented - it's not immediately obvious if you present yourself inside to get on a list or not.  The answer: not.  You sign yourself in.  Once we had that figured out, we waited - but not for as long as I thought.  They certainly have an efficient little operation.  The staff brought out menus for any large parties so the kitchen could start in on their order before they were seated.  Once inside, we were greeted warmly and had our orders taken promptly.  My wife tried the special - an odd scramble of eggs, spinach and chicken sauage.  She got hers with hashbrowns and some really nice, thick, fibrous toast.  I had a few bites of her toast and was frankly tempted to order some for myself.  I thought the hashbrowns were OK, but I am not crazy about hashbrowns.  I ended up with a bowl of their steel-cut oatmeal, which came with raisins and brown sugar (and milk), then got a side of the homefries.  Sure glad I ordered that side - they were the highlight of the meal.  Perfectly cooked, with nice big chunks of potato, slightly blackened, with fresh rosemary.  Now, I am not always enthusiastic about rosemary.  Can be too strong.  But they'd added the perfect amount.    I commented to my wife that I could see coming there and having a couple orders of their homefries as my meal - they were that satisfying.    The oatmeal was also very tasty.  I wasn't going to bother with it until I saw it was steel-cut.  It was my first time having steel-cut oatmeal at a restaurant, and I enjoyed the contrast to the typical restaurant oatmeal.   Someone at the next table ordered the pancakes, and they looked fantastic.   Service was very attentive and efficient.  We'll definitely be back.

I'm a sucker for hash browns. And boy does this place do them right.  They are almost like a potato pancake, but even better.  Perfectly crispy, salty, greasy, but not overly greasy.  Everything else was just the cherry on top of the sundae.  Came here on Friday afternoon (around 1ish) and it was still packed.  We still had to wait about 25 minutes for a table, which wasn't too bad.  The place definitely needs to bogart a few more buildings and expand.  But we sat at the counter and bar stools which made me love my hashbrowns even more.  The griddlecakes were alright.  Nothing to rave about.  The rueben was good, a little too much sauerkraut for my taste, but others loved it.  The three egg scramble looked fantastic, and by the evidence of the licked-clean plates of my friends, it was a winner.  Definitely worth a 30 minute wait in my book.  A 2 hour wait?  Eh, probably not.  Even if those hash browns are calling my name right now.
Six of us ate here. The food is great & served hot. That alone impressed me. The waitresses are not assigned to stations so the servers don't get distracted & forget about you. We will be back.

Went to Matt's on Monday morning. Quick seating. Looks to be a roomy location. My wife got the Huevos Ranchero which is the Monday special. My biggest complaint would be that this isn't a regular menu item. What the heck?  It was outstanding. I got the Pork & Chick with the sour bread toast. They have a magnificent jelly or marmalade. I must've been asked if I wanted a refill on coffee 5 times. Great service, excellent food!
Amazing! Love their food and service were always attentive if we needed anything. One of my favorite places to eat breakfast in Arizona!
Got the breakfast burrito and it was about 90% potatoes and 10% eggs and bacon. Not very good at all.

Great place. Will 100% go back again the next time in Phoenix. The whole wheat toast that came with the omelette was insanely good, and it came with homemade strawberry preserves. It was covered in butter and was just awesome. The omelette was great, and the homefries were delicious. The coffee was also great; fresh roasted and solid. It's not a cheap place by any means (reasonable), but you can get a garbage bfast at any chain for 5$, or pay a little more and get a quality meal that leaves an impression. Boom shockalocka!

Great breakfast spot in Phoenix! Hash browns were incredibly buttery and creamy, the special 3 meat scramble w/pepperjack cheese was excellent, and the kids liked the pancakes. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/matts-big-breakfast-phoenix?userid=QhYJx2jQdPuSq3fGe3aGcA#mOrO9Ye3lyhOiv-mD-K_JQ  They recently moved to a new location at 1st St/Garfield since being featured on DDD. Look for this mural as you go down 1st St.: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/matts-big-breakfast-phoenix?userid=QhYJx2jQdPuSq3fGe3aGcA#6zWWyXZVsPp83YplKgGr5g  Cozy little place has 12 tables and a breakfast bar section to hold maybe 50(?) people in there. Apparently it's no secret because we attempted to go at 9:00a on a Saturday morning. WHOA. 1hr+ wait.   We tried again at 1:30pm the same day and there was no line. So if you can't get there at 6:30am when they open, I would recommend going after the lunch crowd dies down, before they close at 2:30p. Look at how empty it gets: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/matts-big-breakfast-phoenix?userid=QhYJx2jQdPuSq3fGe3aGcA#l4u6G9p-5Jzlbw7oS2kCjA  At that time you can order off the breakfast OR lunch menu, if they haven't sold out of everything by then.
Matt's Big Breakfast has great food!!! Our family loves to go on the weekend, but it can be crowded.

Matt's Big Breakfast, much like Notorious B-I-G, isn't a player- but it crushes a lot.   MBB has the trifecta of amazing food, great friendly service, and a gorgeous setting, inside and out.   I've been a fan of MBB since the early days where only 25 people could eat there at a time. MBB was quickly known for thoughtful hearty breakfasts using only the finest ingredients from the best purveyors. Since that time MBB has grown and added locations and yet somehow has managed to maintain its integrity and heart- which is no small task.   This Tempe location is just stunning aesthetically. Nestled in the beautiful glass canyon that is the State Farm campus, MBBs sits like an inviting beacon- welcoming hungry office workers, students, and other people with superior taste buds.   This location is airy and bright, with beautiful touches everywhere the eye can see. It's immaculately clean and you can tell there is a lot of pride from the staff who keep it spotless.   The service is just awesome. I go weekly with my Sis and Niece- and the crew at MBB could not be more pleasant. My niece insists on showing all the staff her baby doll (Her name is "Baby" in case you were wondering) and they all take a minute to ask questions about the baby and talk to my niece, which is so sweet.  While they have so many awesome staff members, Michelle is our favorite. She's so warm and friendly and sincerely cares that all her guests are well cared for.  Having Michelle take care of you feels like you are a guest at her home- in the best possible way.   The food at MBB is epic in every aspect. I know some people make the argument "It's just breakfast- I can make this stuff at home."  Two things. 1. Stop being a monster. 2. No you can't. You can make SOME kind of pancake, but you cannot replicate these griddle cakes. They are untouchable. Fluffy clouds of goodness that give you hope for humanity. My sis and I argue about waffles Vs. griddle cakes. Sadly she was dropped on her head a lot as a baby so she feels waffles are better, but we all know the truth.  See for yourself, either order a stack of griddle cakes or you can get one on the side to try for the table. I assure you that it will change your life.   After breakfast- take a stroll around the campus and see the beautiful fountains. You won't be disappointed by MBB or the views surrounding it.

Love, love, love this place.  Got there at 7:15 on a Sunday, waited only five minutes and got right in. Today they had a great steak & eggs special, it was out of this world. I brought a friend who had never been there, and she loved her food as well. One thing I recommend is to order a pancake on the side (in case no one in your party orders a full order). The pancakes are unreal, they are SO good, and if you've never tried them, do yourselves a favor, and try them.  As usual, service was on point, and even though the place is packed and super busy, everything was taken care of. When I read negative reviews of the place, all I ever see is complaints because there is a wait, etc.  It is important to note, this is NOT an IHOP, or Goodegg. You WILL wait to get in, and it is worth every minute of the wait. If you're not able to do that, then perhaps you should go elsewhere. Also, if you have more than a party of four, please consider either breaking into smaller groups, or go somewhere else.   The food at Matt's Big Breakfast is thoughtfully planned, prepared, and executed. If you haven't been yet, enjoy it!

This was a case of high expectations falling short. After seeing it on a Food Network show and reading about it in numerous sources, I had high hopes for Matt's Big Breakfast. After waiting for 45 minutes, we made it inside the tiny restaurant.    Everything was ok, but nothing spectacular. I do appreciate their no microwave, no freezer rule, but I feel it didn't live up to the hype I had read/heard about.   Maybe I'm just spoiled by good Bay Area coffee options, but the coffee here was BAD. The salami scramble was pretty average and the Belgian waffle for which a lot of people rave about, was fine, but again, didn't stand out as amazing. The thick cut bacon was awesome and a nice accompaniment to the waffle.   However, waiting for 45 minutes and feeling rushed to get out the door, just isn't worth it.

Went over to this spot based on the Yelp reviews here, and there wasn't many options honestly in the downtown Phoenix area to choose from for a breakfast spot.  Wait time was pretty quick. Food was good, but not spectacular.   Honestly, I don't care to give a in depth review on this location since I will probably not come back unless I need to get breakfast somewhere and we are close by :)   Try it out if you want. Your not missing anything.

This place has been on our bucket list for a while now and totally lives up to the hype. This place is the epitome of what deserves 5 stars.  The food is spot on. Orange juice is pristine. Every single thing that touched our lips was incredible. We sat at the bar, and the waitress was friendly and efficient. People stand in hellish heat outside to wait for a table here, and let me tell you, it is worth it.   Go. Put down your computer and run to eat here.

Came here for brunch. Cute little restaurant in a nice area of Phoenix. Had an omelette Ava country potatoes. Really yummy.. They allow for substitutions.  Not too many options on the menu. However the options they have satisfy many taste buds. I think there's another location make sure you choose the right one.

This has to be one of thee best breakfast spots in Metro Phoenix!  The service and the quality of food at the price point is out of this world!  Make this place somewhere you regular hit for breakfast.
Best breakfast I've ever had! You have got to try this place! I had the special today only substituted egg whites it is delicious!!!!! The iced tea is sooo yummy too!

Food was good  I was pleasantly  surprised.  Walking in the place in doesn't  look like much  but it must be good as there weren't any empty tables in there.  But breakfast was very good  better than denny's  or ihop I will definitely  return.

Not kid friendly, despite Yelp's recommendation. There is no kid menu so the kids have to order adult portions at adult prices which is a waste of food and money. There is also no changing table in the bathroom for the youngest kids. This was disappointing and frustrating. Also, the bacon is not plain regular normal bacon. It's peppered bacon. Nowhere on the menu is this mentioned. It wasn't bad, my partner enjoyed it. But kids typically don't eat peppered anything so it was a waste of money to order it for them.  The waitstaff need to be assigned tables. It seems they have their waiters visit any and all tables which means guests are either being underserved or overserved. We had to ask three different times for water, but then we received two checks. It was just weird.  The food wasn't anything spectacular. I ordered a waffle which was really good. The breakfast sandwich was just ok.  Overall disappointing. Definitely wouldn't recommend or visit again.

Cant say much that hasnt been said already.  Matts serves some delicious breakfast.  Yes its small.  Yes theres a wait.  Yes its worth it!  Bring a newspaper or a book, sign your name in and chill out.  At least now they have added a few benches to relax on.  Once inside anything you order will be fresh and delicious.  From amazing waffles, to the freshest fruit, to the tastiest bacon.  If Im in the mood for a bomb breakfast and have some time to kill Matts is at the top of the list.

I loved this cute little place!! The food was amazing! Everything was organic and fresh. If you stop by here get their bacon! It's sooo sooo good! This place fills up pretty quick so if you are willing to wait, do it. You won't regret it.

Service is so far above expectations at an airport.  Server April is a game changer.  Food is way beyond the norm.  Looks, smells, and tastes amazing.  Listen to the servers as to what you should order.  The house makes classics.  Oh, and "good portions" is not adequate.  Behemoth portions is the word, and for a great price.
The griddle cakes were the best I have ever had anywhere.  The chicken apple sausage was very tasty too.  The service is as good as the food.  Highly recommended.

I'm not sure why Matt's gets so much vitriol from some of these reviewers.  Maybe it's just the usual Food Network backlash?  In any case, Matt's makes a solid breakfast.  The home fries are seasoned with rosemary and taste great.  The much-hyped bacon really is good... it's the right balance between chewy, fatty, and crispy.  Eggs are always cooked up well and the portions are a decent size.  The coffee is good too.  The sandwiches for lunch are good too, and the BLT is the standout.  I've actually taken to ordering home fries instead of chips to go along with my lunches.  The only real downside i can think of is that it's sometimes packed, and it can be a  wait to get a table.  When it gets like this, the staff naturally tries to turn over their tables quickly.  It's good because the food comes out lightning fast, and good because your wait to get a seat isn't too long!  But it's not so great when you feel rushed.  That said, this is a really good breakfast, a solid lunch, and well worth a shot if you haven't been here before.  This isn't just Guy Fieri hype... it's good food and one of the better breakfast places in the Valley.

Found Matt's Big Breakfast while searching for restaurants in the area and Matt's popped up. We came in at 11am on Sunday doe NYE brunch and it was busy. There were probably 25 to 30 people waiting on benches outside of the restaurant. They provide complimentary flavored fruit water for waiting patrons. We checked in with the host inside with our name and number in our party. They call us by name when they are ready for us.  The aesthetics of the restaurant is amazing -- magazine pages worthy. They have several table options -- bar top and window seating for diners of one or two. There's also tables around the rest of the restaurant for two or more diners.   FOOD: - STEAK & EGGS ($15.95): the steak & eggs are Sunday's daily special. My 8 oz steak was cooked medium as I requested and I was surprised it came out cooked perfectly. The steak comes served with a side of A1 steak sauce. You also have a choice of either hash browns or home potatoes -- of course I opted for hash browns cooked well done for that extra crisp. The hash browns tasted exceptional and not commercialized. The inside was moist while the outside was crunchy and crisp. There was a lot of flavor in the hash browns. It goes great with their ketchup. My meal also comes with two eggs prepared any way you like -- over easy for me. It also comes with your choice of sourdough, white, or wheat bread and I opted for sourdough seeing how everyone else opted for that. I don't usually like eating bread, but I really enjoyed the sourdough bread. It comes out toasted and buttered. They also provide homemade preserves -- ask for the strawberry preserve. It's so good. They also sell it by the mason jar for $7 each. Soooo gooood. - CHEESE OMELET ($7.95): my friend really enjoyed his omelet. He added additions to the omelet such as spinach and roasted peppers for an additional $1.00 each. The omelet was huge and so cheesy. He requested hot sauce and they brought us Tapatio Hot Sauce -- yum. His meal also came with choice of potatoes and choice of bread. He opted for the home fries. Our server said the home potatoes are cooked with rosemary, olive oil, and other ingredients that I didn't catch. She made it sound so goood. I was able to try some and I would say it is the best home fries I have ever had. You don't really need ketchup because those home fries had so much flavor. - THICK CUT BACON ($3.50): we all love bacon, but the bacon here is out of this world! The bacon is thick cut and is lighted peppered with black pepper. The bacon was crisp and so good. You MUST order it.  SERVICE was okay. They were nice but very busy. Our drinks weren't delivered until our meals came which was maybe a 10 to 15 minute wait. They did clear our plates from our table right when we finished.   In conclusion, I would definitely recommend this gem of a restaurant to anyone visiting Downtown Phoenix. My friend said it was probably the best breakfast that he has ever had and I can't disagree. We ate like savages haha.
The service was great!  Didn't care for the blueberry lemonade (too tart for me) but the food was fresh and delicious.
Good customer service and the breakfast is good. We usually order the hog and chick and waffles.
Great service & love the home potatoes, bacon and waffles. Good coffee and great home made fresh honey lemonade a must have.

Great atmosphere. Food was delicious. Simple menu with great specials. Loved the strawberry jam. Home fries were amazing. Very busy. We had a big group of 11 and it's a small space but it was still family friendly and accomodating. Overall, great experience.

Finally made it to Matt's for breakfast.  I had to check out the hype and see if it is what everyone says it is!  I took my nieces with me and I wasn't sure if it was very kid friendly...let's say I wouldn't bring young ones there just because it is so small and there is no room to run around.  But since my gals are 10 and 11 there was no problem accommodating them.  They split the delicious belgian waffle.  Let me tell you this is the tastiest I have ever tried!!  Real maple syrup is the key and they serve the best.  All piping hot and fresh off the griddle (my mouth waters just thinking of it).  I ordered the egg sandwich with no bacon, so it was a fried egg with american cheese and sauteed onions.  Not the healthiest option but I really enjoyed it.  I am not sure what kind of bread it was on but it was soft and fantastic.  The fresh squeezed OJ is like eating a ripe orange and the coffee was very well made.  All in all I can see why people are willing to wait for a long time to eat here.

My girl friend and i went there on a crowded Saturday morning. Customer service wasn't great. Our server Leyva seemed somber and wasn't able to get us a glass of water. The pork chop was dry and tasted like chicken. The prices were ok. I would have been pissed if i had to pay more for the mediocre food.

Matt's Biggest Breakfast!   First time flying out of this terminal, decided to belly up to the bar here at Matt's. The gentleman beside me had three plates of food in front on him, each looked better than the burrito I was contemplating on the menu. I asked what he was having and learned it was "Matt's Biggest Breakfast". I'll have that!  A pile of scrambled real eggs, a huge pancake, fried potatoes, two sausage patties, two really thick slices of bacon with peppered edges, and I added toast.   Oh my, that wasn't only the best airport breakfast I've had, but may have been the best breakfast I've had in Phoenix.

Yum yum yum....these guys know how to do it right. The potatoes are served hot and crispy, and they taste amazing. They know how to do a perfect poached medium egg. The service is fast and there's a counter if you need to eat in a jiffy. Great coffee, local biz....great place all around.
The food was pretty good. They make their own jelly/jam, so that was pretty fun! Very busy, so it is hard to get in sometimes.

I can never decide..sweet or savory..so I usually get eggs, bacon, toast, hash browns and something sweet!!!!   I didn't see that as an option here..no side waffle..pancake   I got the hog and chick. Potatoes are gluey and only one egg was over easy.   The oj was warm the bread was okay..yeastey

I really loved this place.  Our waiter was charismatic and attentive and fun!  The decor inside was cute and interesting to look at.  There were tvs to watch news or sports if you wanted.  The wait wasn't too bad-maybe 15 min at most.  The bacon was the best I've had!  My son got the kid's waffle and it was huge!  He ate every bite.

My girlfriend brought me here on Wednesday morning and it is now somewhere I can't wait to go back to. I had an order of pancakes which were good, I like drowning my pancakes in syrup but decided to control myself and just accept the one 2oz container that came with the plate. I also added to eggs on the side which were fine but decided to get a chicken apple sausage and man I am hooked! I haven't stopped thinking about it since we left (don't tell my girlfriend), it sounded like a weird combination but for some reason it works and it works well! I got a cup of coffee and our waitress was on point with the refills. My girl got French toast with a country sausage and a side of hash browns. The side order of has browns were huge and all of her food also tasted great. Really looking forward to coming back and trying other things on their menu.
Go early to avoid the wait. Excellent food and excellent service! Best organic apple juice. And fresh delicious food. Server Miranda is the best.

Amazing Breakfast... Farm fresh ingredients.. Friendly staff.  Had "The Chop & Chick" (highly recommend), come with a juicy pork chop, two eggs, hash browns or Rosemary Potatoes, and toast. Side of thick Peppered Bacon (Amazing).  Place was packed (not sure why people complain about things like this, it means it is really good), but no wait on a Thursday morning.
Spotty service - but friendly staff. Everything was fresh and great tasting. Order the ham off the bone.

I don't understand all the hype and excitement behind this place because there wasn't anything special about the food. Don't get me wrong, it was good but it definitely does not deserve all the attention it gets. If you're gonna do breakfast it's either gotta be flashy or tastes amazing and this was neither. Also, would it kill them to refill my water?   Oh but the bathroom was clean and parking wasn't bad at all so if you want to eat generic breakfast food, it is easily accessible.
Tasty twist on Simple menu, extremely fresh.  Food is top notch, service good as well.  This place is 5 stars.  Location much nicer than downtown as well.  Priced modestly.

I think Matt's has had its '5 minutes of fame'.  Note to owners: Your food is good enough,  your staff is great, so please save your money and move to a better location.  Right now, you're next to a rundown hotel with police baracade tape all over the place.The local residents(?) pan-handling all the waiting customers outside your place. Seriously?   Just sad.  Won't go again, won't recommend it either.  Good luck this summer, the heat will melt all your 'waiting area' customers out .

Matts has one of the best breakfast menus in town and has for many years now.  The original location is by far the best one.  Nothing is really fancy or special but the food is always delicious.  Almost everything is made from scratch and locally sourced.  What is so unbelievable is that there are so many bad breakfast joints out there and all he is doing is fresh, local, and simple food.  Seriously how can nobody do this right out there?  My favorite is the egg benedict but it is only done on Wednesdays.  Pretty much everything on the menu is good but a few of my favorites are the waffle with the perfect mix, salty, savory, fresh, crisp yet fluffy.  Perfection.  Another favorite is the salami scramble.  Schreiner's sausage, eggs, onions, and cheese.  Always solid.  And another one that is really good is the 5 spot which is worth the six bucks.  A huge breakfast sandwich that tastes as good as it looks.  Everything else is just done right: thick crispy peppery bacon, thick sliced bread with homemade jam, fresh squeezed oj, homemade honey lemonade.  You really can't go wrong with anything.  The only thing that keeps me from giving them 5 stars is the service has always been hit or miss.  The first time I went many years ago the waitress was so rude I almost never came back.  The last few times we have been we have had to not only wait for our food but weren't offered refills on our drinks, weren't offered condiments, we finally went to other tables to get them, the food took forever, and the waitresses never bothered to check on us.    Understand-idly this place is packed and always has a line but refills, check ups, and condiments are very basic levels of service and should be part of any dine in experience regardless.  Part of the problem is the waiters don't have assigned tables.  The other part is they need to be trained better.    That aside Matts is still the best breakfast in town rivaled by none.

Came here for the 1st time with high expectations.  Service was super slow and we sat at the counter.  The waitress recommended the pancakes, which were not good, dry and not fluffy as told.  Honestly have had better pancakes at McDonald's.   The hashbrowns are amazing though, a must try!

Came here for breakfast with friends and family. Great small caf atmosphere and Decore parking is tight because they are doing road work around the restaurant. Great lunch and breakfast menu we came here for brunch and were delighted. Pancakes, omelettes, salads were delicious service was great we will be back

What can I say that hasn't been said about this place, other than the fact that my dad was visiting from Mexico and found this place as he strolled through Downtown back when this place first opened and recommended it to me.  High wait times are WORTH THE WAIT. Even the water with lemon they have outside for you while you wait is delicious and satisfying. I always go for the special, and my oh my it has never disappointed. You can tell the difference between this place and other breakfast joint once you taste their food, its natural, organic, with lots of flavor and it smells fresh.  Their rosemary garlic potatoes are the best, their pancakes are a trip to Neverland, and their coffee is just as good as the one at a Starbucks.  This place has a special place in my heart because I remember going to it when the hype hadnt started and I hardly to wait to eat there at first, so I am glad for them because they really deserve all of the attention that they get for their delicious food. Plus, the owners wife always remembers me and even tells me she hasnt seen me in a long time when I go, its just a wonderful place that knows how to treat its customers and how to keep em happy.

I have been going there for years, and took my brother who was visiting from out of town and we were extremely disappointed in the service. We sat down and we had to wave at the wait staff after we were ignored for five minutes. We tried giving the wait staff a chance but it was all down hill from there. Disappointed especially after going there for years.

The hours posted here are incorrect, they were open at 9pm when I got to the airport.  I just had one of the best breakfast burritos of my life here! Asked for well done bacon and it was perfectly cooked and so thick, jalapeos were a great addition too! The man working at the counter was super friendly and the prices are very reasonable for such delicious airport food!

I've been here a few times now, as it's directly downstairs from where I work, but so far I've been very impressed. The service is friendly - Daniel in particular has been a great help, always had a smile on his face. Today, for example, they were running a little behind and so I was offered a complimentary lemonade due to the wait, which was still only about 10 minutes, so not bad at all. The food is also really tasty - the menu isn't anything complex, basic breakfast and lunch, but it's done well. Definately recommend if you want bite in the area - also good parking, which is helpful in this part of town.

If you want great quality food thats made with love this is the place! Simple , delicious food with home made recipes.  The place is absolutely beautiful and located in the stunning Marina Heights buildings.

Bad service. Bought the food from the cashier. Thought i can sit down to eat. But it's a to go order so they said no you can't sit down to eat even though the restaurant is empty. Sub-standard service.

I never thought I would say this, but I recently had a breakfast better than one consumed at Matt's.  It's best not to go any further.  That being said, whenever I am off on a weekday, the urge to go to Matt's emerges at the crack of dawn and does not subsist until I have either satiated myself with hash browns at their tiny digs or have painfully decided to deny myself the rich excess.  The wait is almost always 45 minutes even if you are a party of 1.  Going later helps reduce the wait.  Sometimes.  The wait though only builds the appetite and anticipation.  This is food that deserves such dedication.  I almost exclusively get the special.  And they are all special.  However, the most special of all specials was my first and one that I hope will make a comeback soon.  Imagine for yourself: Chicken Artichoke Sausage, Fresh Mozzarella, Organic Spinach (locally grown, mind you), Hash Browns, and Whole Wheat Toast (with some local fruit preserves that they like to give a lot of props to when they deliver it to you).  Also, cheers to the wait staff who work frantically in such a small space.  I also appreciate their sort of Mother Hubbard, pseduo-indie, partially jeans and a t-shirt dress code.

After hearing all of the hype on diners, drive in and dives and reading the yelp ratings, we decided to try it.  We waited over 30 minutes  for a table.  The place is small and outside of a dungy motel.  The service was extremely fast once you got in the door and the waitstaff are very friendly.  I had a waffle and it was good but nothing memorable.  My partner had an omelette with portguese sausage that he loved.  The hash browns were so buttery and they were good.    I wouldn't make a special trip back.

I visited Phoenix for the first time a couple months ago because my friend moved out west. Being a big Diners, Drive In's, and Dives fan, I decided I need to try a couple spots since Guy almost always ends up in Phoenix or Bakersfield, CA every episode. I specifically remembered on the plane the episode with Matt's Big Breakfast...it's amazing what you remember, considering that episode first aired 5+ years ago.  For the daytime portion of my trip, I was alone to discover what Phoenix has to offer as my friend had to work. I'm completely fine with that, and the morning after my arrival I set my off to find Matt. I was pleasantly surprised to find it was only about a 20 minute walk from my hotel, which was perfect considering the weather was 60 with a slight wind. (I didn't know Phoenix had wind!?)  I arrived shortly after 10am to a filled restaurant. Luckily I was by myself so the hostess was able to seat me almost immediately at the bar. I had decided on the Skinny, but the scramble of the day was almost the same but with a different sausage. I decided to go with the daily special and waited only 10 minutes tops for my food. I was surprised by their ability to get food out to me; perhaps their motto of serving simple food makes it easier to serve food fast? Whatever the case, I was very impressed. The scramble, along with the accompanied potatoes and sourdough, were hot and delicious. The scramble was flavorful without being too cheesy, and everything was seasoned perfectly. I didn't add salt or pepper to my meal, and it's very rare that I don't.   They live up to the name of Matt's Big Breakfast - for some reason I took my leftovers home even though I had no intention of eating them.  (Not because they weren't delicious, but I was only there for 4 days! I had many places to eat at!) Guy Fieri, thank you good sir, you done good man, you done good.

Very busy, but still quick and attentive service coupled with great food...the place is a winner.  It is relatively small so expect a wait on weekends.  I will go back, and I can recommend that you give it a try, too!
I moved out of town and I cry a little each time I want go to out to breakfast and there is no Matt's around.   Seriously the best breakfast spot I've ever had in six states.

In town to visit some family.  This spot is great!  very small seat area.  The food is amazing.  I had the pork chop, Yum! Kids had the waffles.  Honestly the best things i tasted were the bacon and the pancake.  Staff was very helpful considering my family put them through their paces ( not taking them again - they don't deserve it).
Been here too many times! Big, greasy, Scrumdiddlyumptious breakfast!!! Good vibes, excellent service and delish home made food!!!

Sorry Matt, but things are going downhill at least at this location. The breakfast today was a bit of a disaster and the menu is way too small.  Bacon - undercooked and chewy Creamer - curdled upon entry into coffee Coffee - burnt, way too strong Potatoes - drenched in about 1/2 cup of Olive Oil Waffle - powdered sugar was over used, white waffle Omelette - best of the bunch Toast - forgotten until halfway through meal  Matt don't care anymore because he has five locations now. Profits matter more than good food now.

I bet the food is great. It's too bad we didn't get to that point. My friend an I arrived a few minutes before meeting our other friend so we sat at the bar because we were kinda in a hurry. We saved her a seat and expected her any minute. Now, as far as I've ever been told about dining customs, is that the bar, whether it be one that actually serves booze or what, is open seating and can't be reserved and the host can't make you give it up. Two other girls walked in and wanted a booth but the host told them to sit at the bar instead. We told the girls we were saving this one seat for our friend and the host came over and rudely said, "YOU ARE NOT SAVING THIS SEAT!" As our friend walks in. The other girls were like hey, it's all good, we wanted a booth anyways and he MADE US sit here. Rude as FFFFFFFFF. We were confused. But hey, Jobot is just a block away and I suggest you try their chorizo biscuits and gravy because it's AMAZING.

Breakfast perfection!   Everything was spot-on perfect....  Worth the wait (and there always is a wait)...  Fresh ingredients, made-from-scratch delish breakfast is THE BEST BREAKFAST in  metro Phoenix....

Good food, great drinks, and even better service! I had a couple lovely ladies serving me and keeping me company as I was flying alone and arrived to the airport way too early! The only thing about this place that bothered me was their god awful uniforms! Those shirts would be better worn for servicing the plane over serving me drinks.

This is by far the best breakfast in AZ. Their bacon is the best you can get. Oh and the hashbrowns! The hashbrowns are yukon gold potatoes and they are crunchy and a little soft in the middle and just melt in your mouth. The service is amazing. Everyone that works there is super nice and the owners are always there to great their customers. If you're in town you must stop by.

Staff is great- friendly and efficient. The quality of the food is amazing. Everything was very fresh and came out a lot faster than anticipated. The restaurant was very busy but we had no problem getting a table in about 15 min.

We'd always wanted to try this place out, especially after it gained fame on The Travel Channel. It's a literal hole in the wall in downtown Phoenix that's known for fabulous breakfast and endless waits.   "Matt's Big Breakfast on N. First St. is a popular diner that serves heaping plates of Chop and Chick (pork chops and eggs). A local favorite, the small dining room fills up fast causing a line of early birds to pour out onto the street." - the Travel Channel  Everything about this place could be described as, well, cute. The yellow door, tiny juice glasses with roosters on them, vintage art on the walls, even the waitress aprons.   My bf ordered the special; a concoction of eggs, hashbrowns and Andouille sausage in a hearty sauce. I opted for the waffle that came with A. the best butter I've ever had and B. some bacon.   The service was lightening fast once we were seated and the food was tasty. My waffle was by far the winner of our two entrees.  Would I wait an hour to eat here again? Doubtful. Am I glad I got to experience it? Very.
Solid little place. Food was great with a very generous portion and servers were fantastic. Very friendly and inviting

This place is very good.  We came on a Saturday afternoon and were sat within 5 seconds.  No joke!  The decor is trendy urban with the concrete floors orange walls exposed brick and vents. Love the corrugated aluminum walls outside.  Service was quick and on point.  Very friendly!  The food was more than aqueduct. The omelette was very filling and the sourdough toast with jam was great!

All the morons who think this is the airport location...your wrong. Ok, it has been a few years since my last visit, but seriously nothing has changed and that is good. The joint still had a wait at 10:30 Am (less than 10 minutes) and the waffles are still tops in town. Of course the bacon ain't too shabby either. It's just a unique waffle that is somewhere between a lolo version and a real Belgium variety. Just soft and buttery, a must try if waffles are or even aren't your thing. Only $7.50 for a filling meal, but you likely will have to wait, so try coming at some off peak hour. Park at deSoto market for free parking.

Just popped in for a quick bite and glass of wine between flights.... the bartender was wonderful -- fast and attentive, but not intrusive and the grilled cheese w tomato soup was probably the best decision I've made all day.  It could stand to have a little bit more cheese, but totally delicious-hits-the-spot-comfort-food otherwise.   The only thing that I found to be bad was he host -- a young man. He was looking down at his phone and did not look up at all as I approached nor as I was standing in front of him. He asked "bar or table" without even looking up but completed his text message. I waited for him to at least make eye contact at which point he asked me again, "bar Or table" in a tone that made me feel as though I was seriously inconveniencing him.

I went here after an overnight shift because it was featured on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives. I thought the food was decent and good. Not spectacular but for a dive it was fine. It is very small and can get fairly packed adding to the character. I didn't get to see Matt but would return for basic breakfast food.    Visited April 2012

I feel kinda silly writing about a place that already has over 200+ amazing reviews, but this is the internet and goddamnit, my opinion matters. But its true.. All 200+ rave reviews are spot on...   Matts. Is. The. Shit.   If it weren't for the long-ass wait in the three thousand degree AZ summer heat, I'd probably be there on a regular, but sorry dudes, I am a ginger kid, and I burn. I also have no soul, but you all already knew that.  Anyway.  I was skeptical for, ohhh, about a year... yes, it took me that long to actually muster up the patience to deal with the wait.. but I have very persuasive friends who have really good ideas., so last Saturday, I went, and the fact that its been almost a week since i've tasted the sweet spuds in their hashbrowns makes me want to cry. They are seriously, one of the most delicious things ive ever eaten. I got the Chop & Chick.. because i love pigs and eating them. The pork was perfect, nicely seasoned, tender and delicious. I got my eggs over medium, because egg yolk is one of my favorite things to dip shit in, and an order of home fries because the waitress said the hash browns were "kinda funky, not like usual", that day.. but she lied. or maybe she didn't, but my friend got them and either way, they were amazing. My friends got the 5 spot (breakfast sandwich thing) & the daily special (some chorizo mexicany mash up of yum), which were both equally amazing, but for real, my yolk covered pork chop superseded anything those fools were eating. Its been on my mind for days.  As usual, I drank way too much coffee, but what I should have done was order a chocolate milk like my good friend Georgie S. had.. For whatever reason, it was better than any other chocolate milk in the universe.  Its small, cramped, kinda retro, no booze and there is no bathroom.. but whatever, I like places like this. its totally worth it, and did I mention its CHEAP?!  Go here at least once in your life. Make sure to get the HB's and visit The Downtown Phoenix Farmers Market across the street when you're finished. Its the perfect way to start your Saturday.
Our experience was only alright but the owners did take care of us afterward.  I could taste the quality of the food but we came on a Sunday morning which I don't advise.

The food was good. I had mamacito burger and a local beer. There were perfect. The burger is a little bit spicy, but i love spicy food. So no big deal.  I had coleslaw for the side. I didnt like it i wish i had something else.   The service was a little bit slow for the airport. Others than that were good.

I finally had the opportunity to go eat here. The first time I tried was on a weekend and there was a line around the block. This time I went to lunch with some coworkers. It's a small but cozy place. The wait staff was friendly, but when asked to have waters in the larger glasses then what was provided it seemed to start a confusing conversation. In the end larger glass waters were achieved! The food came very quickly. I forgot what it was called in the menu, however I tried their scrambled eggs, country potatoes extra crispy, and it came with thick cut peppered bacon. The eggs were delicious, the bacon was good but at some points seemed almost too thick, and what seems to be the case is  not truly extra crispy potatoes, but they were still very good. My coworkers wanted pancakes, so we ordered their griddle cakes, which came with 3, so we could each have one. I was already full, but that griddle cake was delightful. Overall I definitely recommend this place to anyone who wants a tasty breakfast. It hit all the marks for a nice breakfast for lunch treat! I'll be back.

Only reason for a one rating is that I could not give a zero. That is because I was not  able to eat because I left because of the terrible service.  No one at the door seating guests... the waitress lecturing about needing to wait to be seated at an empty bar and half empty restaurant. People lined up at the door waiting to be seated while waitress stands behind the counter doing nothing. Beware: The place is operated by millennial snow flakes that need a safe space to hide if someone says anything to them...

Got here around 11:45 on a Saturday morning. You put your name on a list but they don't quote wait times. It ended up taking about 20 minutes.  We ordered a 5 spot, a chop and chick, and a hog and chick. Food came really fast, within 10 minutes. The bacon is some of the best bacon I have ever had. It is thick and has great flavor. The hash browns might have been the best thing on the plate. Buttery and just enough salt. The sourdough bread was soft and sour and with some of the jam it was the perfect bite.  From being seated to leaving it only took like 30 minutes. It's fast and delicious.
We checked this place out after seeing it on the Food Network and it was delicious. The rosemary potatoes are top notch and the strawberry jam would be great on almost anything.

Would love to tell you about the food but I stood at the entry for a few minutes and then left. No sign about seating yourself or waiting. No employee made eye contact. Guess they don't need our business.

Quite literally the best breakfast I have ever had. I had the French Toast special today and my mouth has never been so happy. I think I had a foodgasm. In addition to the amazingly flavorful food, the ambience was really cool inside and the entire staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. The owner herself even came out to see if we had any questions!  This place is the best.

Service sucks sooooooo bad. I waited 25 minutes for a bowl of chili? Really? Did they have to hunt a cow? I mean you scoop it in a bowl and you serve it. It should only take 5 minutes but 25 minutes???? I walked out. Oh and by the way I told my waitress I've been waiting for 25 minutes---- she said ok. No apologies. Wow! Avoid it like a plague.
Always the best! Love Matts Big Breakfast! I go here with my mother and then to Easleys Fun Shop for Halloween shopping. It's a tradition.
Very limited menu but seems to work in your favor because everything there is delicious.

Yes, yes.  This place is awesome.  The other reviewers are right and have covered the details.  In order to not waste your time, I'll keep it short and simple.   - Best pancakes I've ever had.  - Bacon was quite delicious.  - Spectacular, thick cuts of bread for the toast.  - Yummy, homemade jam.  - Quick and friendly service.  - Don't forget to ask for your to-go cup of coffee.  I went on a Friday morning, and we only waited 5 minutes for a table of four.  Like "they" say, this place is small so it's going to fill up quick on the weekends.  Not sure about you, but I instantly think, "What can I do to avoid the wait?"  Here's my tip . . . find a reason to go out to breakfast on a weekday.  Plan a "business breakfast" with some co-workers (we do "business lunch" all the time . . . why not breakfast?).  Or pick a day when you can go in an hour or two late and have a friend meet you.  Make it a birthday breakfast for your signification other, parent, or sibling.  Whatever the reason . . . just find one!  It's a nice way to mix up the regular weekly routine with something fun and treat yourself at the same time.    And trust me, Matt's is worth it!

Food was good but the service wasn't very good and we sat at the bar. It was hard to get hot water for my tea or coffee refills. There was very little attention given to everyone who was sitting at the bar. There was not that many people there so there was no reason for the lack of service. Out of the other locations this was the worst service.
Sooooo good. They're very quick with their service. Always have unique specials that you do not want to skip out on. Homemade preserves for sale are especially worth it.

yep, good ol' simple home cooking, and by 'home cooking' i mean back when no one cared that there was about three cups of butter in per serving.  if you've never gone, don't be scared off by all the butter references, it's not that bad. the place is teeny tiny, and our table of two had to wait about 10 minutes for a place, parties of more than four, you'll probably have to get split up.   the omelettes are wonderful, and the rosemary home fries are too good. the bacon is so good.. i can't even describe it. let me stress i am NOT a pork fan, and rarely eat it. i never eat bacon from a restaurant since i'm so picky about it. everyone raved about it here, so i dived in and thought, 'what have i been missing my whole life?' ha ha, yeah, i has an awakening of pork love right in the middle of the joint! seriously, it's unbelievable. it's worth the trek no matter where you're coming from, especially on a sat morning. afterward we checked out a small famer's market that was going on right up the street, and then popped in Circles records and tapes, also within walking distance.  ***Update 3/8 I just went over the weekend and we waited more than 45 minutes. i was ok with it, but i was with someone who does not really place value on waiting a little longer for great food, which kind of put a damper on things. def do not bring someone here who is not willing to wait for a good thing.

I'll qualify this review up front: all I ever ask for in a breakfast is a pile of extra crispy hash browns and two to three eggs, over easy.  I put the eggs on top, dump some salt, pepper, and tabasco on there, and mix it all up.  If you learn nothing else from me, learn this: that is the way to start the day.  Having said that, damn does Matt's have some good hashbrowns and eggs.  But I give it extra credit for having delicious looking pancakes, which I've never eaten, and some really damn good honey lemonade.  I had pork chops and eggs there, and I've had the T-bone and eggs there, but the meats are really just a distraction from what I love so much.
Really delicious breakfast. Super cute location and friendly staff! We'll definitely be back to try more things

Order the Waffle and get a glass of orange juice. Eat some bacon and have some of that bread with jelly. If I started my morning like this, it would be a great day!  The only problem with the place is not a lot of seating so there is always a wait. Other than that you have the best breakfast in town.

You could tell this was a popular place just based on how many people were waiting outside.  Even with all of the people waiting, the wait wasn't too long.  We might have waited for 20 minutes around noon with 6 parties in front of us.  Their menu is short, but they get bonus points for offering breakfast all day.  I decided to go with a basic breakfast of 2 eggs, toast, bacon and home fries.  Now I usually love hash browns, but the home fries were delicious.  If you don't like grilled onions and black pepper, then you might want to skip the fries.  Bacon was also pretty peppered, but I thought it was tasty.  So why not 5 stars?  The service was average. Nothing particularly good or bad.  They were efficient, I will give them that.  If the service was great, I would have added that last star.

In town for business and my colleague took me to Matt's. As soon as we walked in we were greeted with a smiling face. We were served by yet another smiling face. Then both smiley faces tag teamed to make the service superb. The food was amazing and the thick cut bacon was actually meat and not fat and the taste was awesome. I highly recommend Matt's!

My husband and I just left and it was not very good. We went because I saw it on Diners Drive in and Dives and had really high expectations. We first got there the guy at the counter was nice, but when we sat we did not get very good service. I had the chop and chick. The pork chop and eggs were okay, but the potatoes were not good. My husband had pancakes and bacon. The pancakes were really good which is why I gave 2 stars instead of 1. The bacon had a lot of pepper which we didn't know it had pepper at all. The orange juice was fresh squeezed which was the one good review I could give. I don't know if it was a fluke that we had a bad experience, but we will not be going back. We spent almost 40 dollars and I couldn't eat most of it. I would prefer to go to Denny's!!

If you love a classic American breakfast, Matts is the best in Phx hands down. I've only been once, mostly because its downtown and the long lines. All their ingredients are local, organic, and farm raised. Their bacon is something I always tell people to try. Its insanely thick and peppered to perfection! I would go there just for a side of bacon! Their toast is thick and baked fresh. Even their OJ is fresh squeezed. I wish I lived downtown because I would go here every weekend!

The standards for an airport restaurant are pretty low. Just some food in a clean place. But don't expect to be greeted nicely...at all. And don't expect an item listed as a "Tossed Cobb Salad" to not be tossed, served in a pile with cold fatty bacon, and dressing on the side.   But the worst part was the amazingly grouchy hostess. Have you seen the Seinfeld episode with the soup Nazi? Picture that. Super rude...lately me rephrase that SUPER RUDE!!! I mentioned it to the waitress who told me that I need to give her a break because it was only her third or fourth day on the job. I thought, are you kidding me? This is how she behaves and she JUST started there? What will her behavior be like after she gets tired of being there.  To be clear, I was in a really good mood when I got there. I had the perfect amount of time for a layover, had a great flight and a great business trip, I wasn't too concerned about the price as my meals were being covered by my clients. I smiled and tried to be friendly and she was just a grouch. I have no idea what her problem was but projecting it on me was unprofessional and just unkind.  A hostess is "paid" to be friendly. That IS their job. To kindly greet guests, warm them up for the waiter, and then find an appropriate seat.  Honestly, the server wasn't much better. She had a "mildly pissy" attitude. Not as bad as the other.  I gave this 2 stars and I'm not sure why I even gave that many. I guess 1 1/2 would be appropriate but I'm feeling generous.  I'm pretty sure that the restaurant won't contact me but I wish they would.  If you're stuck in the airport, try somewhere else.

I am so sad. You see, we have nothing like Matt's in the San Francisco Peninsula.   My wife said it perfectly as we were eating an orgasmically great breakfast there yesterday morning. "There are places that serve breakfast. And this is most places. And then there are those food establishments that pay homage to the very art of a hearty American breakfast." THIS is Matt's.   Oh, and the service is great too. For breakfast as an event, I can't imagine a better place. And not that you care, but I had steak and eggs with succulent crispy hash browns and buttery delicious sourdough toast. The steak was perfect. And the teeny cup of A1 sauce on the side? Way to keep it classy.  Their bacon is crispy thick peppery goodness. I'd like to take this opportunity to thank my five year old daughter for not eating her bacon.  And now I'm starting to weep again.  THE END

I decided to take a nice long bike ride along Tempe Town Lake. I needed some refueling and remembered that this place is along the route.  The menu here is somewhat limited providing maybe 8-10 options for breakfast. I seem to be a creature of habit, so again, I order the skinny breakfast consisting of 4 egg whites with apple sausage, tomatoes, cheese (I request easy) and a salad with vinegarette on the side. Very fresh and yummy.  I also got a hot coffee with almond milk as a substitute for cream. By the way, the coffee here is a locally roasted brew and it is rich and Delish!!!  As for the service?.....always very accommodating, friendly and fast. Our server was more than willing to make sure our experience was above and beyond.  The atmosphere is clean and modern. They also offer outdoor seating with a nice view with ample seating.   I recommend this place especially if you're out and about exploring the lake or taking in an event at the ASU stadium across the street.

I would like to share my recent experience dining at this establishment.  To give you a bit of background, I found Matt's Big Breakfast off Yelp months ago and my sister and I visited the location they have in downtown Phoenix.  I read the reviews and although most people spoke about the long wait time, but how worth it to still visit, was definitely something worth trying out.  I absolutely fell IN LOVE with the breakfast that I had (salami scramble w/cheese, side of sausage and home fries ...bomb.com)  I've visited that location twice and never had a problem.  Recently I was visiting my sister in the East Valley of Phoenix and she began craving Matt's Big Breakfast.  I said, Ok...let's do it.  To my surprise they have a new location that opened up about 10 months ago (I was told) and we were excited about trying it out.  Here are the Pro's and Con's:  Pro's:  This location is much bigger than the location downtown.  I loved the scenery, the waterfall and the outside seating.  I absolutely love the open kitchen which allows you to watch your food being made.  Our server Michelle was AMAZING (more details about her in a bit).
