Con's:  We were served our drinks in plastic cups and not glasses like everyone else.  My sister elected to order the Steak and Eggs breakfast, but she could not because they ran out of steak.  It would have been nice to know this information when we were given our menus to look over.  It's on the menu, so how come you don't have it available for a customer to purchase?  She then selected home fries, cheesy eggs and 3 pancakes.  She did not like the pancakes.  I again ordered my usual, salami scramble with home fries and side of sausage.  My home fries came out cold.  I asked the waiter if they could give me some more and they used a top broiler of some kind to heat it up because they do not have a microwave.  When our server Michelle came by to ask how our food was, I told her that it was just alright, nothing special.  After telling her what was wrong, she immediately took my plate away without further request and had them remake the whole meal.  She explained to me that my happiness is what matters to her and that is what I call some damn good customer service.  When my plate arrived, my potatoes were hot, cheese melted on my salami scramble.  That remake, but most importantly her eagerness to satisfy me is what allowed me to give this place a 2 star.  I hoped that my experience would have been better because this location is close to my job and I would have planned to visit more.  Would I go again, probably not.  I would travel to the downtown location if I ever crave Matt's again.  I hope that one day I can update my review with something much better for this location if I do visit again  They seem to be new and getting things together so I won't bash them for that.  I wish them the best and hope it gets better.

Love this place.  My FAVORITE breakfast spot....hands down!!!  The portions are great and the food is greater.  I have several friends wanting to check this place out when they come to town just because of a picture I posted on Facebook.  Keep up the good work Matt's Big Breakfast.  I am a fan and will continue to be one as long as you keep making my stomach proud.

Great breakfast! I finally got to have breakfast here. We heard about the lines so we left early and got there at 6:30 am. I am thankful for the storefront pictures on Yelp because we could easily drive by without realizing that was it. They had a nice parking lot behind which, when crowded, when it often is, can be hard to maneuver out because it only has one entry.  We were greeted and seated immediately! Yay for the early birds. The homemade preserves in the little cooler looked so appetizing. Our host graciously told us that when we got toast with our breakfast, a sampling of those preserves also came with our meal.  My husband and I enjoyed the daily special, the Chorizo Scramble. Because it came with a tortilla and not toast, we thought we'd better order toast and the preserves. No regrets! The toast and preserves were AMAZING! The sourdough toast was nicely buttered and crunchy. The preserves were just the perfect blend of tart and sweet. Our scramble was good. I loved my raspberry honey lemonade. It was heavenly. When I have a sore throat, can someone give me the recipe, pleeeease?  Everyone else polished off their breakfasts at our table. The consensus was the home fries were tastier than the hashbrowns. We will be back!

Ok, someone please explain something to me, WHAT ON EARTH HAS MADE THIS PLACE SO POPULAR????? I went to check this place out after seeing it on DDD. It looked interesting and the food looked like it could be pretty good. Well, not to sound mean or anything but, I can make much better breakfast in my own kitchen for about half the price. Any Denny's in America makes a better breakfast and you don't have to wait in line for an hour and a half either. Im sorry but I just don't get it. The only thing that "wasn't" completely average was the bacon. The portions were WAY to small and the food was WAY, WAY over priced. "Good food, good portion size, good price". This place breaks all 3 of those rules. Come on people lets stop following the crowd and lets try and open our minds a little. If everyone would do that I don't think Matts would be in business much longer.

Omgoodness!  Simple breakfast done right!  You literally can taste the quality & freshness. Even the ketchup was exceptional. I had The Hog and the Chick - 2 eggs, bacon, home fries, toast. The average breakfast but Wonderful!  Really fresh eggs scrambled just right - not too hard, not too soft. Thick wide slices of sweet peppery bacon which had less fat. Oh my, the home fries. Chunks of potatoes with onions, some with crispy edges, some without. Thick slices and of sourdough toast with delicious butter served with blueberry preserves. It seemed as if the blueberries were picked yesterday. And not too sweet. The perfect breakfast to say the least. The guy next to me had the Sirloin steak that he said was fabulous. I also ordered the Strawberry Lemonade. I almost drank the whole glass full on my first sip. Go there you will not be disappointed. All fresh local food.
What a simple breakfast menu and yet the food taste nowhere near simple! There was just something about the food that made it one of the best breakfasts I have ever had!!
Best breakfast in my life. I've never been a huge breakfast food person but this place showed me what I was missing. This place is absolutely phenomenal. You MUST try!

I got the 5 spot sandwich with a side of home fries, which were heavy on rosemary. The sandwich was tasty (can't go wrong with bacon). Wife got the pancakes, which were good. Our friend got the oatmeal, which was really soupy. Small menu.

Amazing service. I got seated pretty quickly and was impressed by how friendly and attentive the staff was (not only to me, but also to the people around me). Food was good, not the best I've had but still pretty good for the price. Would recommend!
Good food, long wait but if you are in good company it's worth the wait. I love the pancakes, they are sooooooo good. Their bacon is just the right thickness and crispiness.

I am not a huge breakfast person but when I am out of town I like to fuel up and indulge!   Matt's is the place to do so in downtown Phoenix. This place gets busy so expect a wait, but don't leave, you'll regret it. The menu is rather simple and short but the food is top notch. I had the Hog & Chick which was scrambled eggs, homefries, thick cut bacon, and sourdough bread. The difference between this place and a million other run-of-the mill breakfast places is that Matt's pays attention to the very last detail. The breads, the jellies, the lemonades, ect are all homemade and delicious! The freshness and attention to detail will have me craving their breakfast til the next time.

* There will be a wait. * It will be crowded. * It will be loud. * The food will be worth it.  I came here on my birthday. On my wedding day. On the first day of the year. Whenever I have a friend in town. Whenever I wake up early. Whenever I'm hungover. Whenever anyone mentions breakfast... There's just never a wrong time to eat the most perfect waffle ever created.

I love the high quality food at this location but the home fries that many have cheered about lacked taste. I appreciate that the food is all natural and that they cook everything in butter, but the food is not mind blowing tasty.   The staff is really friendly and the service was excellent.

First time grabbing a late breakfast at this downtown spot. We ordered our food and within only a few minutes, I had an amazing Belgium waffle with 2 thick, peppered slabs of bacon sitting before my very eyes. I barely had time to squeeze my lemon slice into my passionfruit iced tea before this feast sat before me.   After I had lightly buttered and drizzled a fourth of my waffle with syrup, I ceremoniously cut a generous piece out and placed it in my mouth. Seriously, my taste buds didn't know what to do. This was one of the best waffles I've had in my life. After my brain had sufficient time to process what was going on with my tongue and this heavenly piece of Belgium, I relentlessly devoured the rest of the waffle in a matter of minutes. I swear people must have thought I was in a food eating contest.   Then it came time to eat the bacon. After a mere nibble from a corner of one of the slices, the two slices that originally came atop my waffle simply teleported into my stomach. Yeah, that's how good the bacon is. It can teleport. Needless to say, I will be finding any excuse to eat here again in the very near future (i.e. tomorrow).
Food was delicious and service was super fast. I'm trying the verde rancheros next time.

OMG - eggs Benedict special was amazing! I usually try to eat somewhat well, sauce on the side, eat half, cancer causing sweetener. All that went out the window when i walked in there this morning. Luckily there was a short wait and it was a great day out! Put your name on the list by the door. Don't come into the restaurant unless you know you should - it's too small!!  The staff is amazingly friendly and down to earth! We were seated promptly when called, got coffee and oj (order the double oj, small is really just a taste!)  Hubby did the Hog and Chix - mmmm! Bacon looked amazing. Bread is thick cut and comes with fabulous strawberry rhubarb jelly. Mmmm! I did the Benedict and it was amazing - did i mention it was amazing? The sauce, oh the sauce. The ham The home made english muffin - smothered in butter...  yes my arteries are clogging as i write this...  but wow! The home fries with the caramelized onions. The coffee with the organic raw sugar.  Amazing!  Cute little location. Limited parking - but we walked so it didn't effect us much. Short menu, but super yummy!
Not the Matt's it use to be. Hash browns greasy, eggs not done right. Very disappointed

I've heard great things about Matt's so my expectations were pretty high. They have a very simple approach and their menu seemed very natural and homemade  which I liked. I honestly think that's what adds to their charm. The bacon is thick and very tasty. My husband loved the home made strawberry preserves, we even asked if they sell it to take home but they were out. I plan on going back and buying some when they have more in stock. All in all it was good but OBH still continues to be my favorite bfast place in PHX.

I was disappointed too.  I waited an hour and then took at seat at the counter which is ok with me, but if you've got long legs your only option is to sit spread-eagled in order to get close enough to your plate and there's not that much legroom to each side.  In the small space in front of the counter the staff was in perpetual motion squeezing past each other to get drinks, etc.   My cheddar, jalepeno, sausage omelette was very good, but not huge, and the hash browns were crisp and tasty on the outside but soggy on the inside.  The whole wheat toast was great, but no choice of toppings...I was given a small dollop of peach preserves.  The waffles next to me looked fabulous, but I'm not a fan.   Basically I didn't think it wasn't worth the hour wait in 100 degrees and I was relieved to get outside where there was some breathing room.

wow! i did not know i could get a great meal, and an attitude change at the airport! my flight was delayed, do i was going to miss my connection.... when i walked into "Matt's Big Breakfast!" my server greeted me, like i was his best friend and intuitively knew i needed a BlOODY MARY, with BACON! so now that my mood is getting better, i order an omelet, OMG, this is the best bacon i have ever had! my server was as efficient as he was HILARIOUS! i had heard the rumors about Matt's Big Breakfast, now i am a believer! Michael! ask for MICHAEL!

The waitress was very rushed. She didn't wait until I was done ordering before asking others at my table for their orders. I enjoyed my scramble and hash browns, but was disappointed when the description of my plate included toast but "it actually doesn't come with toast." I had to order an extra side of it, and when it came, it was just two plain slices of bread.
Everything was delicious especially the fresh squeezed lemonade with honey is on spot!!!

Finally made it to Matt's.  Sat for ten minutes with four workers walking right past us not even acknowledging our existence.  Not even a glass of water! Portions were tiny!! and tasteless.  Definitely did not live up to the hype!

Wow this is good breakfast food! I am so impressed with the food scene in Phoenix, it really could rival Philly or New York pretty soon. So I got the strawberry honey lemonade (divine!), pancakes (HUGE for 1 order- my boyfriend and I could have split one order, live and learn) and hash browns. I was so full I barely touched the hash browns and could not remember why I ordered them- I felt I needed them, for some reason. But they come in the shape of a pizza slice with a crunchy outer crust. Matt's Little Breakfast it certainly was not but we were thrilled to discover this place in our quest for pancakes!

The Home Fries are to die for!  No...the Chipotle Sausage is to die for!!!  Forget it...I died and went to breakfast heaven!  You can tell the place is worth the try, by the lines and the fact that people are more than willing to wait.  Nice local experience, worth the trip. I would definitely go back!  Oh yea, they said goodbye to me by my first name...awww, they remembered (nice personal touch!)

Ernie is a sweetheart! Food is great. I frequent here a lot. I always get the Hog'n Chick. Sometimes I get the special. I love the bread, preserves, the peppered bacon. AND THE HOME FRIES! Sometimes, the fries are not consistent. They may be too soggy with butter or done too well  but, in general, AWESOME! I am glad they moved and have restrooms now! I am glad to see they are open in the airport. Blessings and success to you all! :)

This place was excellent ! We came in on a Tuesday morning - there was a bowl game at Chase field so it was fairly busy. Our wait was around 25-30 minutes. Coffee was good and food was even better ! I had a basic eggs and bacon plate with hash browns and it was very good. The other people in my party had biscuits and gravy and waffles. I should have ordered the biscuits and gravy because these looked amazing ! Service was outstanding and the food lived up to the hype ! If ever in downtown Phoenix check this place out !

The breakfast burrito I just had was not good. Besides being tasteless, it was dry and the cooks terribly burned the potatoes. The fresh squeezed orange juice also tasted like it was made from green unripe oranges. Maybe worth another shot some day but today was not a good experience.

If I could give negative stars I would.   Absolutely the worst lunch experience my two friends and I have ever had.   We all have a rough day at work, but it is all in how you handle the bad situation.  The restaurant  manager was clueless.  Sat for 50 minutes and still no Lunch   Asked them to make it to go. That took another ten minutes.  Took it to go and two of our sandwiches were disappointing at best.  No apology ... just here is your bill.

This is the second time I've been here, and I LOVE it!  The last time was at the old locations, and I like the new location a lot better.  It's bigger and has this hipster-feel to it.  This place would be a huge hit in Seattle or SF!  Whatever you order, get the hash browns.  It tastes like buttery goodness.  I don't know what they put in it, and I don't want to know.  But it tastes like angles flying around your mouth and dropping butter on your taste buds.  Yep, that good!  And cheap too!  Every plate is under $10.  Definitely coming back!

Layover in Phoenix and this looked like the best option outside of burgers, Mexican and fast food chains. In B gate area.  Got the chicken pesto sandwich on wheat. Nice bread and large chicken breast that was cooked perfectly. Upgraded from chips to home fries and it was well worth it. No Coke, just Pepsi. Friendly service, too.

Cool atmosphere and great food. Will definitely go back. I had the waffle with thick cut juicy bacon and  Home potatoes. I added bell peppers to mine for extra flavor. They were a little over cooked & kinda mushy but overall a great experience during my visit to Phoenix

The best way to describe Matt's is "breakfast nirvana."  I've been going to this cheery downtown spot for weekend breakfasts and weekday lunches for around 2 years now and have never been disappointed with the food.  Small touches of quality abound: freshly-ground pork sausage patties, perfectly browned, homestyle potatoes o'brien (not of that cubed pre-frozen crap), thick-cut bread with homemade jam, and what tastes like real maple syrup for Matt's awesome pancakes.  What keeps a breakfast enthusiast like me from hitting Matt's at each opportunity are the insane queues, especially on weekends.  The air conditioning can also be a bit sketchy at times, too, given the cramped space and swarm of humanity in there at busy times.

Been here several times.  Breakfast is always fantastic and the coffee is great!  The only downside is the wait during the summer.  But even then, the food draws people (even me).  Whenever I'm up and in downtown for breakfast, this is my go-to.

When we walked into Matt's Big Breakfast, initially I was hesitant. There was a line out the door and I was sure we were in for a lengthy wait. We walked in to a nice open space and warm smiles from all the employees. After waiting about 5 minutes a couple of seats opened up at the bar. Chelsi greeted us as soon as we sat. All the patrons made a point to say goodbye to her as they left, and I can see why. Her excellent service and ability to make all those around her feel welcome. The food came out fairly quick. Now I know why they call it "Matt's Big Breakfast" there was plenty. The food was pretty good, but in addition to the atmosphere and service, this place is amazing.
One of the best, BLT's I've ever had. Great find in PHX airport. Friendly & fun staff. You have some time to kill, waiting for your flight, then get here.
Pancakes very good coffee a tad rich for my taste. Staff helpful. Atmosphere awesome with open doors on a great a day . Would come again

i can never remember if i like the hash browns or home fries. it's the home fries, definitely. portions are super huge. i don't go here nearly enough, but maybe that's a good thing. breakfast is too delicious for words.

Great food!! Everything tastes great and was truly fresh as advertised. I got here early enough to not have to brave the long line out front (although knowing what I know now I would have happily done it). The eggs were fresh, the bacon looked and tasted like real bacon, the waffle was fluffy and delicious and the orange juice which came out of a gigantic plastic jar I'm sure was squeezed that morning. A+

My server (Miguel) was super awesome, right on point with everything, quick, friendly, and attentive. I ordered a Fancy Salad. The plate arrived greasy which was weird because a salad with chicken shouldn't be greasy. The manager came out and apologized immediately. They built another fresh salad.   While it wasn't a perfect experience, the staff made up for it in friendliness and caring.
Sooo good!! Had the eggs Benedict and it was amazing! Came here for breakfast and it was a great environment for the group and kids. Great coffee too!
Eggs were good.  The hash browns were saturated in oil. The toast wasn't.  Just warmed bread.  Coffee was ok. Nothing special. Overall?  Meh

I will wait an hour in the blazing sun for this food.  Now that i have become a regular, I don't enjoy eating breakfast anywhere else.   Every time I go,  I try something different and nothing on the menu disappoints. If you go between 8 am to noon,  expect to wait but it's worth it.

We have frequent Matt's for a while now and enjoy the downtown location. As for this location I can only give 3 stars. It can easily be 5 if the servers were more friendly. The entire time we were here  we did not see one friendly smiley face from any of the employees. No thank you or you are welcome. We had to literally wave down one of the servers to refill of coffee and water. I don't about you but when I go out for a nice meal I expect friendly service.

We try to come back here any time we visit Arizona. The bacon is chewy instead of crispy (really good), and the eggs just taste better. I highly recommend the fresh squeezed OJ, and the bread with homemade jam. If you happen to be in the Phoenix area, it is more than worth the wait!

We have loved Matts food for a long time. We met our kids with their new baby for breakfast and found they have no baby changing station in either bathroom in their place on the lake in Tempe.   The most disturbing part...when we asked about it ....the manager was disinterested.   Wondering.... what are they thinking?
Well I say they're doing a great job transformation is amazing the food is exactly the same except there's less of a wait :-)

Great place!   - Perfectly cooked omelette stuffed with mushrooms, bell peppers, (whatever other veggies they offer)  - Bread was really good, and the jam o my!   -honey lemonade was top of the line. I really enjoyed that!  -The waiter, Jackson, was a really nice guy. Stayed on top of things, despite having probably 8 tables!  Only Down side:  - Jackson told us we could split checks when we pay at the front. The girl at the front said, "we don't do that, but I'll do it for you this time"... Which is pretty pathetic, because no one is doing me a favor by having me pay for my meal. That was the only part of my experience which was poor. Other than that, a great joint for friends or family.

Okay. So my sister mentioned she saw this on Diners, Drive-ins and Dives. It wasn't the same spot, as they had moved from the original location to open up a larger restaurant. The back lot parking is tiny and awkward, since you'd have to back out of it to get out. But, there is plenty of street parking.   We showed up on a Saturday morning, after a walk through the nearby farmers market. The wait wasn't all that long. It was only 15 minutes for us, as we were here at about 9:30am. But, it got pretty crowded when we left.  As for all the great reviews, hrmmm... Overall, I think the food is just average. My parents got the griddlecakes, bacon and eggs. My sister got the porkchops with homefries. I ended up getting eggs, sausage, hash and toast. The parents griddlecakes were huge. They could have easily split them to share. I snagged a piece of bacon and found it quite tasty. The hasbrown was kinda overcooked, almost to the point where it was sorta burnt. Not quite, but almost. Some nice soft, white bits in my hashbrowns would have been nice. The toast was pretty chewy and took some teeth gnawing action, in order to swallow. My sister's porkchops and homefries were just okay. Though the chops look like they were seasoned with something, it wasn't all that flavorful and a bit dry.  The servers were friendly and prompt. They were quick to refill drinks. The only notable thing that stuck out was that they were sitting 3 people at what I would consider a 2 person table. A bit of a tight fit there with all the knee bumping action going on.  The place is good. It's just not great. Definitely nothing spectacular.

I've been to a number of places featured on DDD - some live up to the hype, others disappoint.  Matt's did not disappoint!    My Belgian Waffle was topped with a mound of delicious sweet cream butter.  When it melted together with the pure maple syrup on my fork full of waffle, I  reached breakfast Nirvana!  The hash browns were the best I've had in recent memory.  Clearly fried in lots of butter.  The outside perfectly crisp, and the inside was soft, buttery potato perfection.  My companions had a cheese omelet and pastrami scramble  I tried them both and they too were outstanding!  The mixed berry jam was wonderful.  The Chef (owner?) stopped by our table and explained she makes it weekly from whatever berries are available.   Service was outstanding and all the workers seemed to be having a great time, which made the visit even more enjoyable.  A big tip-o-the cap to everyone at Matt's.  If I lived in Phoenix I would be a regular!

We walked here from the Hyatt on 2nd Street and it was an easy stroll. We queued up and got a few coffees to lift the early morning haze from our brains. That was some super tasty java, I must say. Great start.   We ordered the Waffle (well done) and Peppered Bacon and also the Skinny eggs with the side salad and apple chicken sausage and spinach mixed in with a single pancake side.   Holy Mother of Waffle Nirvana!!! I am still dreaming of that first crunchy, tender, savory and slightly sweet Waffle. It literally blew my doors off. The bacon was perfectly salty and peppery next to the sweet syrup. Ahhhhhh ... easily an addiction.   The skinny egg dish silenced my partner for a good five minutes except for the mumbled "Oh my gosh, this is sooooooo good" in between forkfuls of steaming hot eggs with gooey cheese and sauted spinach punctuated by occasional "pancakes so amazing" ... and a sound that was almost an unintelligible bleat for the lemon dressed arugula salad.   Seriously good breakfast, folks. Service outstanding. Prices totally reasonable. Almost every table around us had at least one order of the Sunday Special Steak and Eggs. The steaks looked nice and plump and juicy and folks really seemed to enjoy them.   MBB is located near the University and I imagine there is a line around the block to get in here when schools in session. We had to wait 20 mins on Fathers Day which wasn't bad at all. Guess that might explain all of the Steak and Egg orders.

Average at best.  I have been here 3 times, primarily based on all the hype and wanting to be sure that I was giving Matt's a fair shake.  Listen, it's not terrible...but it's just nothing special at all.  The menu is basic and unimaginative.  I guess I would expect some creativity in the menu selections for such a "hot spot," but alas there is none.  The execution is ok, but not great.  I thought the hash browns were terrible (greasy and overdone) and the rest of it was quite ordinary, if not excessively greasy.  It's small and crowded.  The service was generally fine.  I also thought it was a bit overpriced...particularly the OJ, which I think was like $4 for a tiny glass of what seemed to be made-from-concentrate OJ.  Anyway, I think I'm done with this place.

Oh man, I am so glad that a super friendly patron sat next me because the service was disappointing. With that being said, the food was really good.  Service: No one cleaned the area I sat at, it took a while for anyone to get me a drink, my order was wrong and I asked for an iced tea to go twice and didn't get one. Luckily, the nice fellow that sat next me ordered an iced tea to go and he gave me his.   Good: While my order was wrong, I did enjoy what I got which was the breakfast burrito without jalapeos and potatoes. Also, their salsa is bomb.com! I want to buy it.

So, my Ma and I just finished breakfast here and told a couple waiting to get in that never been there that it's great food and service. Thank goodness theirs was as ours pretty much was just okay. First, the coffee was lukewarm, then when she brought our breakfast my Ma's eggs were cooked scrambled hard (our waitress started to argue with my Ma saying that she had to say she wanted them scrambled soft. Which is untrue since she's had them cooked regular not soft on other visits to Matt's) and scorched and she was charged for cheese where there wasn't any, her home fries were scorched and hard, both of our toast wasn't toasted just warm bread, we both weren't offered water or given water, my Ma only got a cup and a half of coffee she would have liked another refill with her food but the waitress just looked at our table and walked away, my hash browns were somewhat raw in places, and bacon burnt when I asked for crisp. Then when paying for our bill the waitress brings us someone else credit card and says "oh, well that's what happens when I run two at the same time." How do you get 2 males mixed with 2 women? A different waitress with a smile and happy attitude came and offered coffee but we were already ready to get going so she asked if we needed anything else and brought us to go boxes and a cup of ice. Very nice girls another brought back our card again with a good attitude and smile. Wish we had names to put to their faces because they deserve the acknowledgement for their customer service skills. Not such a great Birthday breakfast as planned for my Ma after all.

Really disappointed by this place. I heard such good things from multiple people and was completely let down. The management here is horrible and was hard to watch. For some reason they have a huge patio that is used as a waiting area instead of set up for service. We waited 45 mins to be seated for a table of 3 and multiple times during that time I witnessed tables cleared and ready to be sat to have the manager who was calling guests let the table sit empty for 10 to 15 minutes. The food and Bloody Mary I had was pretty good but not good enough to make up for the aggravation of inefficiency and having to spend 2 hours for a breakfast that would of taken an hour tops anywhere else.

Matt is a Kansas City native like me and like Kansas City folks knows great food.  Though breakfast is busy, it is worth the outside wait even in the middle of the summer.  The wait staff is great and always on their toes, it is fun to see the owner's wife active in the restaurant filling coffee, delivering food and following up on your experience.  Though the menu is not too long, it has all the classic greats, plus great specials.  For those who like to feel at home for breakfast, this is the place to go.

Every-time I go here it's always a great experience. The staff is mellow and nice. The self serve water outside is always refreshing. The fresh air and downtown vibe is always great. Once you get In the service is fast and painless. Yesterday, I took my family and they enjoyed every last succulent bite of their morning special. I don't ever mind waiting, ever. This place is just that good.

Oh my goodness do I love this place! Truly an inspired breakfast/lunch spot in Phoenix. I had the bacon and fried eggs with country potatoes. Delicious especially with the fresh rosemary on the potatoes. A really nice locally roasted coffee, plus fresh squeezed orange juice. Yummmm. I loved it so much I went back the next day! It's pretty crowded on the weekend but I was seated after only a short wait. Whatever the daily breakfast special is, get it! I had a ham, aged cheddar, spinach scramble on my second visit and it was fabulous. I really really love this place and encourage you to go when in Phoenix!!

Our experience was disappointing from the very beginning. After waiting for over 30 minutes, which we were fine with, they proceeded to seat another couple who signed in after us. I brought it to the hosts attention, no big deal, they got us another table. We sat down, and the host rudely came back over to us and told us to sign in next time, which we had done, they just skipped over us. Them missing us wasn't a big deal, his attitude when he approached us was a huge turnoff. Whatever. We were ready for this awesome breakfast after reading all of the reviews. I got a waffle and bacon. The waffle tasted the same as any other regular waffle on planet earth, the bacon was good. That together was $7.95, at least throw an egg or two in there! They also give you 2oz of syrup, which was enough for my one waffle but not enough for my husband's 3 pancakes (no one likes choking on a pancake). It was $1.50 for an additional 2oz of syrup, which I find absolutely ridiculous. Again, the pancakes tasted just like any regular pancakes. My husband sat with no refill of his water for over ten minutes before I had to get up and ask for it to be refilled.   Overall, we were unimpressed with the service and food.   We did eat breakfast at Vovomeenas on our visit and it was phenomenal from start to finish and reasonably prices. I would take their breakfast ten times over Matt's big breakfast, no questions asked (get the BMOC!)

Service is sub-par, they're still getting the hang of things. Small restaurant but nice atmosphere in the new Marina Heights! Menu is very limited. Ordered the Saturday Special Scramble. 3 eggs, apple sausage, jalapeos, cheese with choice of toast. Scramble was soggy and hash browns were over peppered. Was going to order a Bloody Mary but they're $12 each. Overall, not my favorite breakfast place in Tempe.

I visited a friend in Phoenix. She knew I was a breakfast buff so she took me to Matt's Big Breakfast since it was so well known around the city and the country. I enjoyed my meal but "big breakfast" was a bit misleading.  For starters, I thought the breakfast menu was particularly small and the options on the menu were strange. There was a breakfast sandwich, cheese omelet, pork chop and eggs, pancakes, salami scramble, waffle, oatmeal and frosted flakes. Yes, you could order frosted flakes for $4.50. Why? I don't know. Nothing really appealed to me on the menu which was strange.  I chose eggs over easy, bacon and hashbrows with toast. The bacon was phenomenal. This may have been the best bacon I've ever had. The hash browns were thinly shredded and very crispy but not burned in the slightest. The toast was thick and chewy with homemade jam. Everything I ate was excellent.  The service was atrocious. I ordered a coffee. I got one cup which was luke warm. I asked for a refill but that refill never came. I asked for water and that didn't arrive until the end of the meal. No one checked on us after we got our food.   I heard they moved to a new place which is nice, industrial and modern inside (think Chipotle) but it's small. The lay out is also stupid and there is a lot of wasted space.   Even at 9am there was a 1/2 hour wait to eat. I don't know if it's worth it. The food is excellent and well prepared but the rest is a bit of a mess. The menu may be small but it's all done well. I don't think I'd wait very long to eat here again. I've had better breakfast in Phoenix and I'd go there instead.

This place is now one of my favs. You can tell it is a staple for Phoenix. Definitely a place you take your friends who are visiting from out of town. I had the five spot, which is a breakfast sandwich is better than you think it would be. Great and fresh two eggs with bacon and cheese! Yummy! I also got some homefries which are seasoned with rosemary and olive oil. Those are good as well. My girlfriend got the Reuben which she said was one of the best she had. The mustard has a horseradish flavor which I'm not too fond of but it went well with the sandwich. My other friend that was with us had the egg salad and she said it was bomb! I also had the blueberry honey lemonade which was great. It was a little pulpy but not too sweet and not too tart. My girlfriend had the strawberry lemonade which was less pulpy and a little more tart. Both were great. Overall a great experience and we will be back again!

My home girl has been to the Phoenix location and she said it started as a hole in the wall breakfast joint that was so good. She's been wanting to check out the Tempe location and I've never been to this place, so I was all for it. We couldn't decide if we wanted home fries or hashbrowns, so we got both. Why not?! The hasbrowns were crispy and greasy, just the way they're suppose to be. They were sooooo good. And then, the home fries had rosemary seasoning in it and it was fantastic. I love both of the sides. Also, the waffle was AMAZING. I would come back. The food here is amazing.

Working at a large hotel downtown I am always sending people to Mat's Big Breakfast and I finally had the opportunity to hear what all the talk was about this morning when a friend and I decided to eat there. As usual there was a wait, but there was some seating outside for us. I have to say I really liked the desert landscaping out front. I ordered the special which was an omelet with fresh jalapenos, cheese, with hash browns. I also ordered a side of the bacon which was delicious! Actually it was all delicious. All of the servers were extremely friendly and said goodbye and thank you to every patron that was leaving. The orange juice is also a must to try. It was like they picked an orange right off a tree. I can't wait to give my money to this place because it's local, the food is fresh, and it's just great.

First come, first serve so put your name down quick on that notepad... Super friendly staff with super friendly comfort food.    Don't go with a big party! The three of us ordered grass fed steak and eggs, the pork chop and egg, the bacon and home fries... all were delicious!  The wheat bread came with their home made strawberry preserves.    Great for an american breakfast spot!

I wish that i just ate at the place all of these good reviews were for. The bloody Mary had no flavor, salt pepper and hot sauce made it ok. The big garnish polished it up a bit, worth $10 airport price at best, not $14.  I had an omelet with mushrooms. The plate was covered in the grease from the omelet, which was overcooked and chewy .The potatoes were both burnt and cold.   The bartenders treated the patrons like a nuisance. Zero chance of getting a coffee refill. The place was packed when I sat down and emptied out by the time I got my meal. I sat with and empty coffee cup and bloody glass for 15 min until I threw down my card.   I'll skip a meal before I come back.

The best breakfast spot ever!! It reminds me of hash house a go go. Fresh farm to table food! Service was impeccable too! It's a must try! Found this listing on DDD from food network. So glad we came here. Try their specialty drinks as well!

What a surprise to stumble upon this restaurant. My connecting flight changed gates two times, ending at gate 10....and net door is this fine establishment. My mind thinks breakfast at any time of the day or evening is a perfect choice so why not at least give this place a quick once over...  Interesting menu...the pork chop catches my eye so hey, why not, lets give this a go. It came out to the table in 5-minutes...steaming hot, with my eggs scrambled lightly as I asked, breakfast potatoes....I would have preferred hash browns, but these were good...toast, and one huge pork chop...awesome.  My eggs were perfect, and the potatoes were perfect as well, and the toast...I ordered rye, but didn't expect to get TEXAS rye toast...LOL, these were huge slices...buttery and quite tasty....and that pork chop...it was amazing, thick cut, minimal fat around the edges...bone in, and so moist and tasty.  What a real surprise finding this place...good service, excellent food, and the price...$9 I think....incredible.  Definitely earned a 4-star, perhaps a 5-star after a few more visits...in any event, a good experience all the way around. And speedy...in an airport waiting for your flight or making a connection, you don't have much time to sit around waiting for a server, food or a check when your meal is all done...this place was conscious of that requirement and did a great job. I will be back...I hope to see you there...!!!

Coming from a diner-centric middle america, I was a little underwhelmed at the limited menu at Matt's, but boy, what he does cook he does excellently. The scrambled eggs I had in my special were easy enough, and I liked the combination of the local shishito peppers, ham, and jack cheese, but the hashbrowns are a shining example of how to execute them perfectly. I wish I had the bacon, too, because that also looked outstanding. Like many of the best places in Phoenix the line grows exponentially by the hour, so get there early and prepare to wait. It's interesting to see the large amount of abandoned restaurant concepts in the surrounding area, but I don't expect Matt's will be among them anytime soon.

Love this spot - it's pretty close to the convention center so Natalie and I went here to check it out. The bacon is awesome here!  Their philosophy is great too - local, organic, etc. etc.  The place is tiny and quaint too and as always it's great to support a local independent business.    Best breakfast in Phoenix that i've had and definitely one of my fave spots - went there the next day too - got the special and it was delish - check my photos to see what we got!

I was so disappointed in my whole experience here. I was really looking forward to trying this place and been waiting for a few months to go. My boyfriend was visiting and we thought Sunday brunch there would be great.  We arrived at 830AM and they said a 20-30 minute wait. No big deal, we can do that.  The crowd was moving quickly and the host was efficient at seating people quickly. He came or and said we were next. With the way the crowd was mocking before, we thought we would get seated soon but nope. We wait another 10-15 mins, which didn't make any sense.  We sat down and figured out what we wanted to order. A girl came over a while after we seated to drop off water. She asked if anyone had taken our drink orders and we said no and that we were actually ready to order food.  Waitress was unfriendly and didn't even tell us he specials.   The food was good, don't get me wrong but it's definitely overrated. I travel a lot and love to try restaurants in different cities, this isn't even worth a second visit. Potatoes were way too over flavored with rosemary, it was overpowering.   The omelette is just jut eggs with your toppings folded inside not mixed in and cooked with the eggs. It was eggs with a few things inside, nothing special. Even hotel omelette stations mix the eggs and toppings.  We had to flag our waitress down to give us more water.  When we went to pay, the cashier was very short with me. He was chatting up the person in front of me but was very quiet with me. Half way through the transaction he asked "how was everything". It seemed very forced! I said "things were okay" and he didn't respond.   Honestly, the food was a good but not worth the terrible service. Small menu and gross bathrooms.  Maybe if the staff was a little nicer I would return to try something else on the menu.  Will not try again.

Matt's Big Breakfast is located in a little building on the corner of 1st Street and Garfield. It is always packed and if you don't arrive before roughly 9AM you will wait for a table. Luckily we were able to get the last table on a recent Saturday. It is at this moment that our luck ran out.  I have said this before: there are only a handful of breakfast spots in downtown Phoenix so to hear people tell it, this is the greatest breakfast place in the world. However, this analysis is false, the breakfast is average at best and is elevated in lieu of other options.   There is parking located behind the building and all along the streets. At various times a song would come on the speakers inside and drown out the chatter, and then silence for 10 minutes. Maybe we came on an off day.  Perhaps someone can help me with something, I ordered the hash browns and they tasted as if they were smothered in vanilla or something sweet. This was immediately off-putting and I could not tell if this was intended but it ruined the whole experience. I did like the jam they served with the sourdough toast, it was probably the best part of the meal.  Ordinarily I would ask a server about this strange flavor choice for the hash browns but it was so incredibly busy that waiting 10 minutes for a water refill seemed to signal to me that I should just move on with my day.  I tried the salami scramble and there massive chunks of sopressata haphazardly tossed in a mountain of eggs. It came with potatoes on the side, they were tasteless and I couldn't finish them.   I may return to try their lunch menu at some point but I will not eat breakfast here again unless forced to.
Anyone who gives less than 5 stars clearly hasn't tried their pancakes. This place is amazing, and will always be my favorite breakfast in town!
A total fave of mine! Service was a bit slow but the food was worth any and all wait! Thick peppered bacon, sourdough toast with homemade preserves & butter cant be beat!
I might not be the Duke at Matt's big breakfast but I'm always given the special treatment! Thanks guys!!

Ive always wanted to try Matt's BB at the airport..... Even though this is the only Matts that serves alcohol, it  doesn't compare. Stay with the original location, even the food portion was different.

Wow, so the bacon was amazing, there's the 1 star... but if you order an alcoholic drink don't order the liquor. Well liquor (base model) is over $12 dollars a shot. These are more than the highest Priced clubs in Scottsdale. So if you're catching a flight and think, oh a screwdriver would be nice... think again, or go elsewhere. The prices are outrageous and the staff was crazy defensive about me questioning the price. Yo, this isn't the Encore in Vegas.
Breakfast is always consistent but customer service isn't. It suck that the service is not consistent. I come here like 3-4 times a week . Well looks like I'm going to have to find a different spot .

Ok. I started coming here when Matt could only get the local downtown area news channel to cover his place. It was only open for about 2 weeks and you could walk in at the height of the lunch hour and grab a table or spot at the bar. That was then and the food "F" rocked! Ok flashed forward to present day! Service is still pretty good, the wait can be a bit long, the food now is just ok. It has lost it's charm a little. Menu is sit short. If you are in the area and can afford to kill 30 minutes for a spot then check it out.
Love live love the omelette with ham, American cheese and onion.  Also their homemade jam is awesome.  The only draw back is it is a bit loud.
Very good breakfast that was well prepared.  The Bloody Mary is an excellent choice. It comes with a salad bar in it! I highly recommend it.

Good place to grab a bite-- not your normal airport grub. Breakfast is Served all day.   I had the "smothered and covered"-- chuck steak with mushroom, onions, and mushroom gravy.  very good. The mashed potatoes were better than most steakhouses.   Good TVs around the bar-- an odd music playlist. Drink selection ok. Employees were high energy and pleasant and accommodating.   Typical airport pricing was the only negative.

I love this place. We've been going every Saturday for the past few months, and although there is always at least an hour wait on Saturdays the awesome food and cute cozy atmosphere has been worth it. This is definitely a gem in the heart of downtown Phoenix, I personally love the Hog and Chick which is two eggs cooked to order, three big strips of peppered bacon, your choice of hash browns or home fries and your choice of fresh baked toasted bread on the side served up with preserves from a local source. Their honey lemonade is inspired and their iced coffee is pretty good too.   They are right across the street from the Phoenix Public Market and if you want to go walk around and see the shops instead of waiting outside (for an hour) you can write 'market' by your name and you will be seated next up if you get back after you've been called. My daughter always orders the waffles and devours them and her dad keeps 'waffling' between the pancakes and the waffles but always cleans his plate (and usually some of mine as well!) the hostess is very cheery and efficient, she calls us 'Team Justin' and she always checks in with us at least once or twice during our meal.  I'd definitely check this place out if you've never been, they used to be closed on Monday's but very recently that's changed and I've been told that if you want to get in WITHOUT the wait, Monday is the time to go! Happy Eating from Team Justin!

Whoa! I have never had such a good breakfast! This place is really good!! I got the The Five Spot which is a breakfast sandwich and I added a side of hash brown.  And wow, the hash brown is so good. It so creamy and crispy!!! The sandwich itself was ok. I liked the sandwich but I felt like I could make it at home. Although the bread is pretty good.  I tried the bacon and it's so crispy!!!   Overall, this place is really good. Got seated right away and the manager here he is so nice. Good service, good food, and good vibes. Will definitely come back soon

I've been coming here for a long time, and there's been no dip.  Kudos to Matt and Erenia for holding true to the idea of making rad, no-frills breakfast food like they do back on the farm.  I don't eat here as often as I'd like, because the lines are impossible and I don't have the time to devote to an hour wait for Saturday or Sunday breakfast, but if the night before was long and I end up sleeping in, I have no shame about grabbing some breakfast at 1:30, and the lines are usually gone by then.  I will miss this place dearly.
Tuesday morning no wait!! Food was stellar, small menu, simple and good, price was a little rough thirty five bones for two... But worth it for triple D,spot.

Save your money! This place is way to over-rated! Stopped in for breakfast and as usual it is so loud, you can't carry a conversation with your friends. The chairs are hard and uncomfortable, the table is unsteady... wiggles back and forth, which is annoying. I ordered the "Special".... isn't the special supposed to be lower price?? Well it wasn't. Paid 10.00 for 2 pieces of French toast with one hot dog type sausage..... it was ok, not worth the money...I could get a bigger, better breakfast for a lot less at Denny's. Now the real reason I'm writing....I had 1 cup of coffee because the waitress refused to even ASK me if I wanted another cup, which I did.... she stared right at my empty cup, gathered our dirty dishes, gave us our check like "Hurry up and get out of here!" and walked off. She came to our table 3 times and never asked.  I decided, I will never be back... Check came to 26.00 for 2 breakfasts, 1 coffee.... They were very crowded, so she just wanted us out... terrible service... skip this place. There are better places to eat... more comfortable, less noisy and the waitresses will treat you right!

I'm surprised how busy this place was for a Monday morning. We checked in for a table of two, five ten minutes later we had a table. I really enjoyed the environment but I really really didn't like the fact that I had to order 2 times because every time I would ask for something it was only for Thursday's or Wednesday, apparently the restaurant has two different menus which didn't know so that was frustrating but after the 3rd time we ordered. Our food came in fast and the waitress was kept checking back with us and making sure our drinks where full at all times. When I'm back to visit I'll make sure to come here again.
Excellent, speedy service. Restaurant was packed at 8am on a Sunday morning. Food was awesome!

Plenty of parking. They were busy but would not seat us till everyone  showed up . There was a 30 minutes  wait . The portions were large . I ordered bacon to small stack. The pan cakes  were a little  sweet so I did not use any syrup  just a little  bitter . Bacon was a little  overcooked  and  on the small size.. it was good experience  . Good service

Always a solid breakfast. They don't have a big menue but what the make they make well.  I really wish they had biscuits and gravy but the toast and homemade jam almost make up for it.  The bloody Mary is great! The Gin Rickey was light and refreshing but they forgot to add a lime wedge.  Thats just being picky though.  It's a great breakfast place. Period.
This place is a an amazing addition to an airport. The food is absolutely delicious. If there is a wait it is worth it!

On our trip to AZ we had to stop by here. We wanted to dine in, but on our way to the airport it only made sense to bring the food back to the place we were staying at since we had yet to pack. This place brings the traditional simplicity of breakfast back to the kitchen table.  We opted for the "Hog & Chick" and Griddlecakes. Both were delicious and very filling. Simple breakfast made with that home made touch. We were glad we stopped by here before we headed back home. On top of the food, the service was amazing and friendly, and the bill was not a big dent in the wallet either. Overall an amazing experience with Matt's. We will definitely be back for our next trip.

Matt's Big Breakfast wasn't bad but also wasn't great. The breakfast menu didn't have many options. I ended up getting the five spot breakfast sandwich and my girlfriend got a omelet with veggies since there weren't any vegan options. Overall the food was good, simple, and inexpensive. It is more of a casual atmosphere so expect it to be a bit loud and quite busy at times. If you're looking for a simple and inexpensive breakfast this might be your spot.

I really don't understand what people are ordering that they say that the serving sizes here are small. My meal came with a pork chop, 2 eggs, and hash browns, which I could barely keep all on my plate (it was so much food) and a side of thick sourdough toast (2 slices). Mike ordered the fives pot which was just a sandwich. Considering we had waited almost an hour for breakfast we also ordered a side of bacon (so yummy!) and one pancake so we could try a few other things. The people sitting next to me at the counter ordered the special omelet which also took up the whole plate.   This place is so tiny. There were three tables in the main eating area (which could seat 2-3 each), 6 seats at the counter, 3 more seats in the side room at a counter and two spaces where they could seat parties of about 4-5.   Although it took quite some time just to get in (and you have to wait outside to be called, keep this in mind if  you are there on a cold day) it doesn't take very long to get your food. It took 10-15 minutes to get our food. By the time we finished they had already turned over all of the tables.   The staff was very friendly and the food was good. My pork chop was juicy and I loved the hash browns and bacon. Mike's five spot wasn't as tasty. The eggs were overcooked and a bit dry. He wished he would have had the pancakes instead.   They have some good eats.
Jen was a great server. Very attentive and friendly. The big butter burger hit the spot.
Matt's was awesome. Both the food and service was perfect. I'll definitely be back On my next trip to Phoenix. You'll be very happy you chose Matt's Big breakfast.
Matt's is awesome for breakfast. Go hungry because the portions are large. I really like the ham steak and eggs. There fresh jam is also amazing. The breakfast sandwich is fantastic.

So lets start with the bad. I asked for my eggs to be over medium and the came over medium/hard. Ok, now that that's out of the way......WOW!!! The food was amazing. I got "The Chop & Chick". The pork rib chop was cooked perfectly. Great seasoning blend, I did add salt, but then I add salt to everything. The homefries were delicious. And the eggs, even though they weren't as runny as I like, were good as well. I also had white toast which you could tell was made from scratch and came with a blueberry preserve, which was also delicious. 5 Star restaurant. I will definitely be talking about Matt's Big Breakfast to all my friends. Keep up the good work.
The BEST breakfast in town !!!!! Friendly staff ! I love the griddle cakes !!!!
Some of the best bacon hands down also I don't drink coffee and for some reason I found myself drinking 4 cups of it and the weird part was I didn't put cream or sugar it tastes so good

Happy with my experience.   Came here recently for breakfast with my girlfriend. We arrived and were informed the wait would be 45 mins to an hour. Luckily we only waited for around 30 minutes.   We ordered the daily special which was steak and eggs...also got some eggs, toast, and hash browns. Unfortunately, we ended up waiting nearly 40 mins for our food which was a tad bit disappointing because I heard good things about this place and service.   Food eventually came out and was delicious... What amended the situation for me was managements handling of the everything. Without us even complaining they paid for our meal and apologized for the wait.   Shout out to management for the professionalism. We will be back.

Great food (not just breakfast).  Everything is better than you think is possible.  Matt and Erenia are genuinely nice people who deserve all of the success that they've achieved.  Even when extremely busy, the staff does everything possible to make the guests feel comfortable and to be accommodating.  I do try to avoid the crowded times.

Matt's is a cute little breakfast place in downtown phoenix.    They are always busy and the staff is really nice and sweet.   I always seem to get the special every time I go there.   The one thing I really like about Matt's is that the food is always fresh.     There is sometimes a wait on a Saturday morning.  But normally the wait is about 15 to 20 minutes long.  The only thing I wish they had on the weekend is french toast and that the coffee was a lot stronger.  It normally takes like water down coffee.

Matts big breakfast is awesome. This is my third time here. Each time I visit I order the special. Today's special was 3 scrambled eggs with meat, home fries and a tortilla. Awesome. The portions are Drake and thick and enough to keep your for the entire day. I wish there was a location in Scottsdale.

I have been a fan of Matt's for the last 3 years. I go there at least once a week to meet with my circle of friends. Ernie the owner has become a great friend and is an awesome example of someone who has connected with the culture of urban Phoenix. The only drawback which is also Matt's strength is that it is a small place good for only groups of 4 or so. I have had Matt's all to myself with bigger groups of 20 but it requires planning ahead. I suggest going with either the Hog and Chick or try the waffles.

I was afraid this place would be overrated, because most breakfast places are. I usually think, how hard is it to cook up some eggs? and most places can't cook pancakes and waffles better than my mom. I was very wrong, this place was so, so, sooooo good. I had the salami egg scramble with hash browns, everything was cooked perfectly. The toast that came with fresh preserves and butter was amazing! My husband had the waffle with REAL maple syrup (a requirement in my mind) and sorry mom, but this one was actually better than yours. With the waffle came a side of the thickest, most flavorful bacon I've ever had. I would come back here for the bacon alone! This place is well worth the wait.

It's worth the wait just for the orange juice - but the food is good too.  The boys went camping, so my daughter and I woke up early and headed downtown for the farmer's market and some breakfast. We stopped at Matt's long enough to put our name on the list and then ventured across the street to meander through all the local wares. We took our time and when we came back, we met and visited a couple of moms who had brought their daughters all the way from Calgary to try this place. (wow)  Here's what we figured out about the wait: it's about 30-40 minutes per page of names ahead of you... (ish) Two pages of names ahead of us when we signed in = 1 hour 10 minutes total wait on the day we went.  Once inside, I loved the quaintness of the place ( and our service was superb. It's also obvious that they recognize people who have been in before and sometimes even know their names.  Being somewhat indecisive, we ordered the cheese omelet and the belgian waffle and shared. The omelet had just the right amount of cheese, making it a perfect accompaniment to the oh-my-gosh! fabulous wheat toast with locally made strawberry preserves. The hashbrowns were nothing to get excited about, but in the nirvana of the previously mentioned last bite, who cares?!?  But wait. Then I tried the waffle.  One of my best friends and I make waffles all the time - and have been making them for years. She's know for hers. I'm really sorry, dear friend, but Matt's has you beat. Their belgian is the ultimate experience of amazingness with just the right combination of being fluffy without being soggy. Add the 100% maple syrup and I'm good... so very very good. There's no need for the sweet cream butter - but it's there if you want it.  If they could pick the perfect orange at the moment of ultimate ripeness and squeeze it into a glass, you might be able to imagine the essence of every sip of the juice we drank. Just for kicks, we ordered the honey lemonade. Not really a breakfast beverage, but a must have for when we go back for lunch.  Go knowing that you will wait and that it will be worth every minute. Definitely looking forward to going back.
LOVE this place! Gets packed on weekends so I try to make it a weekday treat!

This is one of the best breakfast places I've tried in the Valley. The freshness and quality of their ingredients are manifested in the very good food they serve. Service is friendly and quite fast, considering that our group came at a time when the eatery was very crowded, which seems to be typical of the establishment. The popularity of the place had its downsides, of course - long waits outside and parking can be tricky in this part of downtown.

Yum!   Loved the atmosphere and menu!   Was even busy on a Friday mid morning!! I can just imagine how packed the place can be on weekends. Good service, and easy parking.   Got the breakfast special-scrambled eggs with spinach and sausage. Hash browns were a little different, Kinda mushy. I will be trying the country potatoes next time. Friend had the salami scramble. Also delish! And good size portions! We had left overs to take home.    Will be back for sure!

It's tempting to suggest, "an egg is just an egg". You hear that kind of thing a lot, and admittedly, there have been plenty of "legendary" breakfast places that have made me feel just that. Matt's Big Breakfast is not one of them.  What makes MBB unique is the quality of the food and the quality of the ingredients they use to make it. True, there menu is small, and when you read it, nothing particular will jump out at you , but that doesn't mean there's nothing special on it. For instace, everybody serves hashbrowns but these are without a doubt THE BEST hashbrowns I have ever had. The omlettes and eggs are great too.   No doubt, Matt's serves five-star food. It only loses a star because it's a little pricey and the wait is usually waaay too long. Maybe I shouldn't hold that against them, but I do...so get over it.   Also, their lunch is just average, and of course, they close far too early.

This is the best breakfast I've ever had.  Period.  The food was SO good that it totally outweighed the wait outside on a hot day.  Yes, you WILL wait if you come here, but it is absolutely worth it.  The staff here are quite adept at quickly moving people through the restaurant without making anyone feel terribly rushed, and other than your wait to get seated, you won't wait long on anything else.  Most breakfast places excel at one or two things, usually the sweeter side of breakfast (pancakes, waffles, etc).  I don't tend to eat a lot of these, so I'm stuck getting some half-toasted toast, eggs, and potatoes.  Not here.  Here everything on their menu looks good and is even better in execution.  I did end up ordering the toast, eggs, and potatoes, to be fair, but I still can't forget just how good they were.  The toast was a whole-grain variety, thickly sliced, nutty, and perfectly toasted.  It was served with butter and jam, and it was so good that I was reluctant to let my friend try any of it.  The potatoes were crisp on the outside and fluffy on the inside, but both the toast and the potatoes paled in comparison to the eggs.  Yes.  Eggs.  Matt's Big Breakfast earns my nod as the best breakfast joint I've ever patronized because of their eggs.  They were scrambled, but something about them was so mouthwatering that I was disappointed when I finished them.   Most scrambled eggs at other restaurants are served cold, dry, chewy, or any number of other unappetizing ways.  Not at Matt's.  I'm sure they cooked them in butter or something equally as awful for you but, damn, were they ever good.  To this day, nearly a year later, I still have not had better eggs anywhere else.  Believe me, I've tried.  Nothing beats Matt's.  Everything else looked amazing, and they frequently feature specials.  This is the Pizzeria Bianco of breakfast in Phoenix.  Long waits, but a must-attend for each and every Phoenician.

I really don't see what the big deal is about this place. It was packed on a Sunday morning, yet the food was just standard stuff. I've had better breakfasts at IHOP. My pancakes were extremely dry, and the real maple syrup was too expensive to get more of it. The coffee was fine. The hash browns were good and it's interesting that they served a pork chip. But it was tough, and the eggs were undercooked. We liked our lemonades though. And it's great that they use local suppliers.   Unfortunately our waitress was very unfriendly. She didn't smile once, and seemed like she'd rather be anywhere else. I get that you're busy, but a little interest would have gone a long way.   Bring from the Midwest, I know what a good breakfast place is like. This ain't it.

The food was not good and special.  The service was bad, we never received refills on our waters.  The cashier was irritated with us when they over charged is by $10.  The cashier was arguing with is on how their calculations was right until i pointed it out to her.  I was very disappointed in this restaurant because i have heard good things about the place.
Bomb.com anyone who doesn't give this place five stars is insane! Service is great and the food never disappoints.
Pretty solid cafe in the middle of the PHX airport.  one of the few places they will seat you and bring a menu vs. cafeteria style. decent lunch and bar too.

Very bad experience, and we didn't even get to taste their food. When we arrived we were told that the wait would be 45min to 1hour so we put our name down and waited. After seeing two couples who arrived after us able to sit down to eat, we asked what was going on. The guy simply said "sorry I skipped you".So we left and will never go back

This food tasted as bad as it looks! The potatoes were gray/green in color, and tasted awful! How in the world do you screw up a fried potato???? The food was just as dark as it appears in the photo. Really bad food for $16.00. Go some place else!

So Matt's Big Breakfast's manager or employee named Jason is one rude jerk. We brought friends with us to have breakfast today and there was a line by the door when Jason yelled at us in the most aggressive manner, "Can you not block my door?!". He was so demeaning to us the whole restaurant almost heard. With no apology, my friends and I felt we were targeted and not welcomed because we are all minorities. I cannot believe how rude he was to us and then when my fianc tried to talk to him regarding that, he denied and said he asked us nicely which was a lie. We left and more people came in and blocked the door. My friend called him out on it as to why it was okay for them to be by it and all Jason did was smile and walk away.Then he got really mad and called security on us to get us "off his property". The property managers in the area came and actually spoke to us and understood the gravity of the situation more than that jerk did. I really hope you get in trouble Jason. That is not the way to speak to anyone at all!

I have lived within 200 meters of this fine establishment for two months and I finally ventured there today.  Why did I wait so long?  I have to admit, I was unimpressed with the petite breakfast menu.  I am used to pages of breakfast options.  1 page for eggs, 1 page for scrabbles etc.  Well Matt's has 1 page (period).  What they lack in options they more than make up in quality.  They are not a jack of all breakfast trades, they are masters of a few.    I started my first foray with a simple two eggs, sausage, hash browns and toast.  Potatoes were actually browned to a wonderful golden brown.  The cinnamon raisin, walnut toast was thick and great.  the home made country sausage links were a nice blend of spice and subtle sweetness.  Ok, my eggs were a bit runny they were more over easy than the over medium that I wanted, also a bit cold.  But I survived.  I sat at the counter and the young lady that served me there was wonderful.  She really added value as a friendly attentive server.  I tried to see if she had a name tag so I could specifically mention her, but I never saw one.  I will return with friends and family soon.  Side note- I was a bit disappointed to find they do not open until 6:30am.  I got there at 6:00am.  I can also tell you that on a Saturday morning, they were already full and had people queuing up for tables by 6:55 AM.

This is the type of restaurant you only go to once. I have now been there twice - once at the old location, once at the new one. The reason you only go there once?  HOLY WAIT TIME, batman.  I'm sorry, but there has to be a way to make the seating more efficient.  When you're hungry, there's nothing worse than 30-60 minute wait times, or a giant party of 15 people who arrive later than you do and they get to "squeeze in". Although Matt's has just upgraded to a new, bigger space, this still isn't the type of restaurant that should be accommodating 15-person groups (AKA almost the entire dining area).  We went here for my husband's birthday on a Friday morning. After waiting about 45 minutes, we were next on the list but got bumped to the uncomfortable street-facing counter seats, when at that very moment there were three empty two-top tables, completely set with silverware and everything. We asked if we could be seated there instead, but were turned down by the host, because they were being reserved for the aforementioned party. My husband was having trouble with knee pain that morning and the counter seats did not physically accommodate his needs, so we asked our waitress if there was anywhere else we could sit. Again, we were turned down. I was getting a little flustered, not the way you want to feel on your loved one's birthday. We considered leaving, even after we ordered our food. Eventually, they did allow us to sit at a two-top, which I appreciated.  The food was the only redeeming quality, but again I was too flustered to truly enjoy it. I got the cheese omelette with hash browns. Very good, although hash browns were a greasy, mushy mess. My husband got a ham scramble of some kind. We had a side of rye toast, which was tasty. Beverages were served in cute little jam jars.  PROS: Food, Decor, Charm, Ambience, Supporting a local endeavor  CONS: The most hyper-inflated wait time and some of the worst seating options of any restaurant I've ever known.  The take-out option sounds nice, and would eliminate a lot of my frustrations.

Matt's Big Breakfast!  I came in on a Monday morning around 11 and believe it or not, only waited 5 mins. for a seat!  Sat at the bar and was able to order right away. I had coffee and The Hog & Chick plate which comes with Thick cut bacon (or sausage if you'd rather).   The thick bacon was incredible and so tasty and totally lived up to the hype that this place generates.  Tasty coffee as well and the staff is super friendly but fast and efficient.  Overall awesome food and experience!
Other than the wait it was really good. I got the pork chop and it was okay but i wouldnt order it again. Everything else is made really well and with great ingredients. Its simple but delicious.

Assholes! Don't eat here. They forgot to write our name on the waiting list and then where jerks about it as if it was my fault Had the nerve to roll his guys and everything. Ruined my morning. So irritated.
Been coming to Matt's Big Breakfast for over 6 years now. We actually got to see Faizon Love there. Really a nice kick back place for breakfast. My daughter likes the Belgium Waffle most.
Food is good but staff tends to be cold and distant.  Get the fresh squeezed OJ. It's really good!

I've eaten here about 3-4 times and for whatever reason the staff seems annoyed that they are here, distracted and almost rude.   I've eaten breakfast at Matts downtown PHX and the experience and frankly quality of food is much better.   Ordered Matts Big Breakfast: bacon was cold, sausage was undercooked and the eggs I ordered over medium were also under cooked.   Whole experience was disappointing.

Nowhere near living up to it's hype. I have been hearing people sing the praises of this  place for a while now and my girl and I decided to give it a shot since it's so close to home. I have also heard horror stories of horrendous wait times so we aimed for after breakfast but before lunch. It was indeed packed but we were seated fairly quickly. The place really aint much for the eyes. No real decor and kinda rough looking. Right away we noticed how sparse the menu is. Really not much to choose from. Especially if it is before lunch time.   I ordered the Chop and Chick while my girl had the Hog and Chick. Well... where do I start? First thing, my glass of Iced Tea was filthy! 2 different colors of debris no less. I quickly dismissed it so as to not alert my girl who can be quite sensitive about things of that nature. Her glass was fine. The food comes after a wait that was starting to feel too long. It really seemed as if the cooks ONLY paid attention to the meat and couldn't care less about the rest. My eggs were slimy, my home fries were over cooked to the point you couldn't hardly chew the parts that weren't mush. My girl's hashbrowns were a big greasy mess that she said had no flavor what so ever. My chop was actually pretty damn good as was her bacon. But that was not nearly enough to save a breakfast that was NOT worth the $30.00 bill. Too much worrying about hepster, hippy,  vegan, yada yada not enough focus on good cooking. All the cracked sea salt (which won't come out of the holes in the shaker mind you) and raw sugar (which I freaking hate!) in the world doesn't make up for a lack of attention to detail.  Think twice folks. Don't believe the hype. We won't be going back. Certainly not when Mel's Diner is so close!!!

Love Matt's big breakfast!!! Whenever I go through Phoenix, I make it a point to stop by Matt's   Real ingredients makes for real Food!  I can eat at Matt's and be full for the rest of the day, and be satisfied!  Great waffles! Great pancakes! Great eggs! Great thick pieces of bacon, and not mention their brunch menu.  To bad I live 200 miles away, I'd be a regular! :)

After all the hype, and an hour wait, I was not really impressed with the menu. I got a cheese omelet which was fine, but not crazy good. The side of toast was the best part-served with homemade jam-I would have been happier with just an order of that and coffee. Went here for the surrounding area which is known for art murals in this part of the city, so overall, was worth it.

Awesome joint for Breakfast. Been trying to get for years and finally made it. If you like breakfast food this is the place with everything is made from scratch. Had the biscuits and gravy with egg and hash browns.  Reasonable prices, and large portions. Lots of parking available. A must stop when your in Phoenix. BTW this is a Triple D joint

I was specifically looking for a good breakfast place in Phoenix. The concierge suggested Matt's Big Breakfast. I looked at some yelp reviews and figured I'd give it a try. I took the light rail over from my hotel and got off too soon and ended up doing a bit of walking in 100 degree weather. The place was small, had air conditioning, and I was hoping I wouldn't have to wait, even though the reviews said otherwise. I was by myself and able to sit at the counter right away! I ordered the belgian waffle, which had sweet cream butter, sprinkled with powdered sugar and maple syrup on the side. It was served with a side of thick cut bacon, which I have never tasted like this before - it was peppered and tasted really good! I also ordered a side of scrambled eggs. Let me tell you, the food was good - I ate my entire breakfast! The staff was very friendly too. As I was paying and getting ready to leave, I noticed a stamp of Guy Fieri's face on the wall! This place had been featured on the Food Network and I had no idea - usually I look up where he goes or places featured on Man vs. Food. I'd say stop in and check it out if you're in the area!

Went back to Matt's to try another breakfast entree today.  I ordered their omelette with Wisconsin cheddar cheese and added sausage.  Killer omelette and to get it with my favorite home fries, sourdough toast and a strawberry lemonade?  I had another smile tattooed to my face walking out of Matt's this morning.  We got there around 9:45 and waited about 25 minutes for a table.  The weather was a perfect 70 degrees outside so no complaints here.  The service was top notch as always (just like the food).
Amazing food. I travel all the way from Tucson monthly just to eat breakfast here. It's delicious. There's always great service and the food is the best. If you're in town, I'd check it out for sure!

The good thing about going here alone ...its practically no wait. I came in got a seat right at the bar. Yay for me.  I order a coffee omg it was delicious home grown natural. I ordered the special three egg scramble with sundried tomato chicken sausage, button mushrooms and local baby organic spinach and fontina serve with potatoes and toast.  I also order a side of Bacon because I had to try it. THIS PLACE FOOD was so good and filling.. I will definently come back here when I come back to Phoenix.. It was very much worth the drive.

This is my favorite breakfast spot! It can become very busy especially with the wait times but that just reminds you of how many people enjoy it! Friendly people and great food! Definitely,? recommend? ?coming here.

Breakfast surpassed my expectations. Service was good, food came pretty fast,  and was so delicious! We were in town visiting from California, and randomly picked on yelp due to it being conveniently  close by. Let me tell you, potatoes (cooked to perfection with rosemary) are so tasty, eggs fluffy, and the homemade jelly is Y-U-M. We had a slight issue and was remedied immediately by the manager. Awesome customer service- two thumbs up!

I go to Matt's quite frequently because I love the Hog n Chick. However, today when coming in, my company and I wanted to sit at the half booth and I was quite appalled at how the lady manager acted towards the decision, she said "Uhm here? You don't want to sit at this two top?" She made me feel like I was inconveniencing the entire establishment. Mind you.. It was a Tuesday morning on a 102 degree summer June day in Arizona....I work in the industry, and I would never act how she was acting towards a guest. So unprofessional. Other than that the staff is great and highly recommend their breakfast.
Seen it on Diners and drive ins. Went the next day. Great food. A little bit of a wait, but nothing terrible. Had breakfast and it was amazing. Pork chop for breakfast! Will definitely go back!
