I went to Matt's Big Breakfast with my mother-in-law a few days ago and had a great experience.  It seems like everyone on this thread is already raving about this place, so I guess I'm just going to add more to it!  Yes, it's busy. So be prepared to wait for a table. Wife, her mom, and I waited for about half an hour for a table. But that was okay.   It's very simple, clean inside the restaurant. Their food portions were big and plenty.   Their country potatoes are stellar and so is their bacon. Eggs are eggs anywhere. It seems a lot of people liked the orange juice here, but I didn't try it.   Their coffee was great though! The server was very nice. But when we asked her about a few of the entrees, she wasn't very helpful because she said she didn't eat meat.   I think that's part of the reason I chose a more traditional breakfast. Eggs, bacon, potatoes and toast.   It was good though!

Service here is great.  Despite how busy it gets, the food came promptly and the wait was bearable (though 30-40 minutes on a Sunday morning can be hard for those running short on time!).  It's funny how you can smell bacon/greasy meat before you even walk in!  I eventually got accustomed to it.  I didn't get to try the waffles, but their hash browns were soo good!  I will definitely come back again if I'm in Phoenix again.

We have heard of Matt's Big Breakfast  many times since moving out here to Phoenix. Our family from other states have heard of this place as it has been featured on Travel Channel & Food Network. So we finally decided to give this place a try to see what the big deal was all about.  Matt's actually moved down the street from their original location, which I had heard was very small. The new location which did appear much bigger, still had a long wait out side. There were a few benches that patrons can sit on & orange flavored water was offered outside for those waiting.   There was approx a 45min for out party of 4. Good thing we didn't come hungry. Once inside we were offered Bar seating, otherwise the wait would have been at least another 20 min. In my opinion, the bar stools were very slippery, or maybe it was just mine. I was wearing jeans, but I felt like I has to keep one leg on the ground in order not to slide off. & i'm kinda short so I was basically standing at the bar to eat.  Definitely a busy Breakfast spot. They state they use local resources & organic foods.   The food was tasty. I ordered the griddle cakes & they were BIG. I had to ask for more syrup which they said they would charge us another $1.50 for.   No one in our party was able to finish what we had ordered. We left with very full bellies.   Still not quite sure what all the hype is about. The act of supporting Small Business?Yes, we will always try to do that. Or maybe I just needed to order something more adventurous?  Know you must come with a BIG stomach, but not hungry, because the wait is ridiculous. At least we can cross this place off of our Food Bucket list  Happy Eating

Matt's Big Breakfast... Is it as good as everyone says? YES... It is absolutely worth every minute I had to wait. The atmosphere, the service, the food, all A+ in my book. I was surprised in how relatively cheap it is to eat at Matt's concerning the incredibly fresh ingredients. I highly recommend that you make this a stop in at Matt's Big Breakfast, it will never dissapoint.

This place is great. Simple menu and great prices. It does get a little crowed and can have a wait but it sure is worth it. I have also done pick up on a saturday and I was in and out and under 5 min.

So good! Food is always fresh, good portions and service is always fast. Best part is, breakfast is served all day!!  And if you enjoy a good Bloody Mary from time to time, this place really knows how to serve them up. Ask for the house Bloody Mary with their famous crispy bacon! Amazing!!

My husband's favorite meal of the day is breakfast, so while we were in the area I decided to take him to the much ballyhooed Matt's Big Breakfast.  The line wasn't unreasonable, especially for a Saturday midmorning.  Food was served quickly and was made with fresh ingredients, but choices were surprisingly limited...no biscuits and gravy, no chicken fried steak, no quiche.  I just assumed, based on the name, that they'd offer every breakfast item under the sun.  My husband got the omelet of the day and said it was pretty good.  I got the pesto chicken sandwich, and it was alright.  We were both underwhelmed.

Big breakfast is a bit of an overstatement considering you can get the same-size meal or a larger one at a chain breakfast joint for less. Really, the only thing big is the check. Talk about overpriced!  The food is okay. The pancakes are very light and fluffy, but the hash browns were soggy and gross. I don't think the coffee was all that fresh, either.  The customer service is also lacking. I almost got the feeling that my table was being avoided. I sat without water for almost the entirety of my meal while a server walking around with a pitcher visited every other table. I guess I'll be sure to bring my own water bottle if I ever come back!

On our way down from Paradise Valley we decided to go to Matt's Big Breakfast for brunch based on Meg's past visit for The Breakfast Club. Even at 10:30, the place was packed full to bursting with a large group of people waiting outside. After a twenty minute wait I found out why. The service was very quick and friendly and the food was great. I ordered the five spot breakfast sandwich. While the sandwich only came on it's own, it was easy to understand why when it arrive. The sandwich took up most of the plate with what was likely 2-3 eggs, two strips of bacon, and cheese all on a roll bigger than a softball. Honestly, if I could, I'd come for the bacon alone. Very thick cut and choice slices and well seasoned. The eggs were well cooked and very fresh and the roll was very light and flaky. I would definitely come back again though I would recommend coming early to beat the crowds if you can.

Oh Matt,  Why-O, why-O did you have to move? Who cares that your old place was small? It was part of the quaint location. No matter.....your food is still worth waiting in the beaming heat. Keep it up with the 'no microwave' & local produce kitchen. Cheers!

They only serve whole milk with coffee. You ask for cream but they don't carry it. They won't poacher eggs, my eggs were not cooked thoroughly even though I asked for over easy. My has been asked for a little bit of maple syrup with his waffle and I told him it would cost $1.69 more because it's pure maple sera up. Won't be back again and we fly frequently. Took over 35 minutes just to get our breakfast this morning on Saturday at 8 AM.

After all the hype around this place we happened to be down-town and decided to give it a try. I'll be honest it was good food but nothing amazing, I am just glad there wasn't a wait when we went otherwise I think our expectations would have been much higher. I got the griddlecakes because I read they are a must to try and my husband got the Chop & Chick (pork chop with eggs). The pancakes were good, I would say comparable to the good egg, but I would choose the good egg over Matt's. The husband's pork chop had a lot of flavor with a nice crispy outside served with your standard scrambled eggs and above par hash browns. The one thing we got which I will say was very good would be the thick-cut bacon. It was cooked perfectly and for a side order you got 3 huge slices which was enough for us to share. I would come back here however, I would definitely try the BLT because of that bacon, but I don't see myself waiting more than 15-20min for a seat.

Great waffles, buttery & fluffy. Awesome syrup too. Bacon was perfectly crisp, and even had a nice amount of grease on the strips to add some moist texture. Honey lemonade was very refreshing. Great little place for a simple, well done, breakfast menu.

Good breakfast, a tad over-hyped. Big portions and a good deal. GOOD, fresh juice! Would definitely go back. However it's always packed and there is normally a wait. Tried weekdays to avoid the rush but it's just a hot spot! Work checking out for sure. Be prepared to spend a little time. Staff was wonderful!

If I'm flying out of terminal 4 then I'm eating at Matt's Big Breakfast.  Even if my flight is at 10:00 or noon or 2:00.  Even if I have to traipse the rest of the way around the terminal to my Southwest gate, it's worth it to me to get here early and have a delicious breakfast.  They have the best bacon for sure, and the staff has always been fast and friendly.  Maybe someday I'll try something else, but for me the hog and chick is the way to go.  Love everything about this breakfast from the bacon to the roasted potatoes to the homemade raspberry preserves on the fresh baked marble rye toast.    Delicious!

Read about Matt's Big Breakfast on Triple D.  So far, Guy has not let us down.  If you love bacon, you have to check out the smoked Applewood bacon.  Even if you are not a  bacon lover, you'll fall in love with these nice smokey slices.  Nice and thick and cooked to perfection.    I had the Hog and Chick with thick sliced bacon.  3 slices bacon, 2 eggs, hash browns or home fries and your choice of toast.  What is the difference between hash browns and home fries you ask....hash browns are shredded potatoes cooked in butter.  Home fries are chunks of potatoes cooked in olive oil, rosemary and onions.    Hubby had the special of the day.  3 meat scramble with hash browns and flour tortillas.  This is definitely a meat lover's delight.  They do not skimp on the meats either.  Canadian bacon, Chipotle  and Cheddar sausage and Spicy sausage and cheese.  One drawback, parking lot is very small and difficult to maneuver around if you have a large car.  The staff were all helpful and friendly albeit a bit slow with coffee refills.  Some say breakfast is on the pricey side.  However you get a lot of bang for your buck!  Definitely recommend you check out Matt's if you are in the area.
Food was excellent, the staff knows the menu well and they are all so nice! Wish there was one in Colorado. Loved the waffle and the bacon Bloody Mary.

Everyone says they really like this place. I have to say it was good. Especially for being in the airport it was a nice change from the usual. We had a long flight in front of us so I wanted to eat a real meal. So we went to Matts. We had a small bit of a wait. They were packed very popular place. We were seated and quickly served. Our server was great! She was fast, refilled out drinks and even brought us a to go box. Sorry to say I do not remember her name. as this was before we went on vacation. A lot has happened since then. The food was good but, not great. I got the pancakes that I ordered with my meal when I was almost through with my breakfast.  I realize they are very busy. It was decent. I would go back. Maybe when I am not so rushed. The price is a bit high I think. But, it is the Airport and rents are high there.  I will give it a go another time. Coffee was good. Service was great , food was so so.
Love this place it was rustic it was fun it was happening and the food was bloody spectacular great service great attitude

Breakfast does not get any better.  After eating the bacon at this restaurant, I can't order bacon at any other breakfast joints... it simply does not compare.  They use thick, smoked bacon that is incredible.  Definitely worth the extra dollars.

Simply put, my favorite breakfast in Phoenix.  No other breakfast joint can match the deliciousness that is Matt's Big Breakfast.  The waffle is still my go-to meal, as it is the right amount of fluffiness.  Plus it comes with bacon!  And the bacon here is amazing... thick, peppery, and cooked just right.  I have a hard time ordering bacon at any other restaurant as it simply does not compare with Matt's.  The daily special usually consists of an egg scramble and a side of potatoes and is wonderful as well.  The food here cannot be beat.  Now that they've moved to a larger location, too, going to eat is more reasonable.  The wait can still be long during peak hours, but it's not nearly as bad as it once was.  The restaurant still maintains its character even with a new home.  If I had to pick one restaurant to take a friend for breakfast, this would be it.  Breakfast at its finest.

I loved this place. Its super tiny but the food comes out pretty quickly and they turn tables fast. I ordered the special which had eggs, ham, Fresno peppers, and cheese and came with hashbrowns. Everything was absolutely delicious. Their toast, as well, was a huge highlight. We didn't wait long because we called beforehand and were put on the list. They don't really have a host/hostess, you just write your name on the list, which I found interesting. I spent most of the meal gawking at one of their employees, Travis, who was absolutely adorable. I wish they had eggs benedict, but the food they had definitely made up for it.
Best eggs Benedict  I've ever had in all my travels! Highly recommended especially if you have kids. Lots of food! Come hungry

The breakfast was just okay. It was expensive for the daily special, and the potatoes that the waitress recommended were not fully cooked and a little under done. I would not probably return or recommend.

tasty pasty!    my favorite part of my experience was the butter and the jam. DEEELISSHHHH.   i could hardly make a dent in my pancakes but I couldn't just let that butter go to waste, so i put the rest of the butter on a piece of pancake and ate that. it would have been weird if i just ate the butter, but i would have. I got the rest to go and asked for extra butter to come along with it. I think the pancakes were amazing, but it could have just been that butter.   I must have thought I hadn't eaten in years bc I also ordered the bacon which is the best bacon i've ever had. let's add that to my list of best part. bacon, strawberry jam, and butter. healthy eating at it's finest.   I also had the homefries but they needed salt and didn't go well w the ketchup they are served with.   I would go back and order strawberry jam toast,  mountain of butter, and 12 slices of bacon.

My wife and I were in the neighborhood as we had taken our daughter to check out PHX zoo. We heard about this place from diners, drive in and dives and had to check it out.  we were starving and had a wait for a full two hours prior to being seated! :( This place is a hole in the wall!! However, the breakfast was worth the wait! My wife had the bacon and waffle and enjoyed it so much that she ordered another order of the waffle. I had the special which was to die for, scrambled eggs with turkey sausage, peppers and cheese.  will definitely come back if we are nearby!!

I will go 3 stars instead of 2 because it is in an airport. I sat down and was greeted by an unhappy, unhelpful bartender. I ordered food right away. After 25 minutes I asked her very politely to check on my food, as I had a plane to catch. She snapped back that the kitchen got busy. I told her I was not upset, I just had to get going. She went on to snap back that everything is made fresh so it takes time. I got a medium rare burger. Shouldn't take 25 minutes in an airport. When I did get my burger it was less than mediocre. I love burgers, it is hard for me to be unhappy with one, especially when it is supposedly cooled in butter. Meh.  I normally fly out of concourse A, I wss really excited to be in B to try this place. Next time, I will take a walk to another concourse. I won't be back here.

I miss Matt's!  I haven't been able to find decent, let alone great breakfast in LA.   What I like: - The coffee.  Seriously people. What are you bitching about the coffee for?  I'm guessing most of you are Starbuck's frequenters that think over-roasted burnt beans = delicious coffee? That a macchiato is really a sugary drink with lots of milk?  That drinking a coffee concoction containing 1000+ calories daily is good for you?  That's what I thought. - The daily specials.  The bacon, spinach and cheese omelet they do sometimes is amazing.  If you are *lucky* enough to walk in on the rare occasion they are making French toast, well then you had better order it while you can.  Best freakin' French toast I've ever eaten! - The ingredients.  Fresh, local and organic. - The staff.  They are awesome.  Enough said. - The size.  I like the fact that it is small and quaint and that you can peer at your neighboring table's order.  And even say hello...try making a new friend instead of whining.   - The prices.  Perfect.  What I don't like: - That it is in Phoenix and not LA.  Tips: - Don't bring your kids.  - Order your hash browns well done.  They are PERFECT that way. - If you aren't a fan of waiting a little bit, go to Denny's.  Or go early! - Don't go to a diner if you only eat health food.  It's not called Matt's Granola & Fruit Bar.....

This is hands down the best traditional breakfast place in the valley. My boyfriend and I are huge foodies so we have eaten at almost every breakfast place in town. Matt's has the best bacon and hash browns I've ever had. Their bacon is thick-cut, seasoned with maple and black pepper. Their hashbrowns (and probably everything else on the menu) probably have three tablespoons of butter in them, but trust me its worth it. There is usually a wait, so be prepared. But just do what we do and go there anticipating an hour wait, not when you're starving. Sip some cave creek coffee and enjoy the day while you wait. You'll be glad you did!

First time trying out this place after all the hype online...sad to say I was unimpressed and pretty disappointed with the service, menu and prices. Our waitress was unwelcoming and seemed bored or angry. She brought my 2 year old a glass of milk in an actual glass with no lid and no straw. We had to ask for a child's cup which they did have(wtf). She refused to make any exceptions or changes to the menu items at our request. We were not allowed to substitute anything without paying for it. The menu is fairly small and uninspired for a breakfast place. Pretty basic. The prices were high though, I paid 10.95 for a burger which was actually really good(earned the 1 star on this review). The other items ranged from 1.50 for 1 egg(lol) I can buy a whole carton for that price, up to 13ish. They only have basic drinks as well. Plain old coffee, tea and lemonade. The chocolate milk was $3.25!!!  When the bill came we asked to have the items split between my friend and I, the waitress refused and said she couldn't do that. Ok so we asked for two separate checks then, she said she couldn't do that either!!!! Wtf?? So we got a little testy with her and asked for her manager. She went off and came back with two split checks lol saying her manager helped her-whatever. So rude and I would never come back here. Not worth the money for stuff that IHOP has.  Go to snooze down the street, so much better all around and cheaper!

I had the Chop and Chick with a Honey Strawberry Lemonade. This food was BOMB! The only knock I have is that due to the small size you are rushed to eat. The wait staff comes by often asking "can I take that plate." I still had half a porkchop on my plate! As for food though.... It was really good!!!! Indefinitely recommend this place!

Solid. Just had a trip to Phoenix to pick up a Diamondbacks game and tried Matt's Big Breakfast, well, for breakfast. I read the reviews for this place and decided to choose it based on the high rating.  Had eggs, bacon, toast and the OJ. It was easily one of the best breakfasts I've had. When I visit again, I'll go back for sure and highly recommend it to anyone looking for breakfast.  The price was about right for the organic and natural foods they offer. It's probably a little more than most tiny breakfasts stops, but knowing the food served was chosen from natural food markets, the price was spot on for the quality of food.  There was a wait because the restaurant was tiny, but well worth the wait. Trust me, definitely swing by this breakfast diner. You'll be glad you did!

Staffing needs work. I'm at an airport. I want a breakfast burrito. They took my order and 20 min later I asked for a refund. Ni complaints from me. I just have to go. There are 4 burritos ahead of me. Manager starts yelling at the staff, refunds my order and takes someone's elses burrito and gives it to me. I'm like look its ok I don't want you to throw together an order. Relax. He doesn't. Burrito that he hands me after I take it and run to my flight, is completely different and a mess nor cooked.
The Chick and Chop is one of my breakfast favorites. Ask for CHELSIE at the front counter.   Excellent service, food and coffee...TOP QUALITY.

Great find on our trip to Phoenix!   Breakfast was great and service was even better.  Very friendly staff!  The breakfast sandwich was amazing and the grilled onions added great flavor.   The salami omelette was very tasty!
Great breakfast spot. So hearty, quick and amazing service. Felt like I had a good ole fashioned diner breakfast that got classed up in a great environment. Definitely get the country ham!
This was a good honest breakfast.  Love the lemonades made with honey.  I have tried to duplicate but still trying.  I would have breakfast here every Saturday if I lived there
THE BEST EVERYTHING. I love how they use REAL maple syrup and just real ingredients in general. I live in Tempe but the boy and I go the extra mile to come here. Love breakfast food and LOVE Matt's!

Pretty darn good! I hate waiting in line to get into restaurants, but Matt's is actually worth the wait. I would have given them 5 stars, but I have to give one star to the Farmer's Market a block away that made the wait fun and enjoyable. Support local farmers AND support your belly.

There are times when Phoenix tries my patience, event though I am here only a year.  Why, as someone else more accurately put it, are there only  two decent breakfast places?  Please, if someone knows of another, I'll be grateful for the kind referral!  The pluses:  the best home fries, real sour dough toast, very excellent marmalade  The average: decent, above average omelets and waffles, fresh butter  The minuses: the usual 30-45min wait, cramped, stuffy setting, waitresses are so busy, they bring the check right after the meal, no bathroom  All I can say is I miss real, well done home fries and crepes!  Where are you Chez Vachon?

We came as a group of people and they refused to split the bill for us. They asked us to calculate ourselves. The girl who did that didn't even have good attitude. She said it and walked away.  The place itself is very small and tables are next to each other. I wouldn't say that's comfortable. The food is okay.

The perfect breakfast place! We visited the 1st street location downtown. I ordered the cheese omelet with veggies and home fries that were deliciously seasoned with rosemary and it was very good. I would recommend the home fries over the hash browns. I also had a side waffle that was perfectly fluffy. For any vegetarians, they don't substitute any of their meat options unless you want tomatoes, but they do price correct your meal if you don't want meat.

Good food and good service.  I really like the food and I've been here two times with a friend who referred me, and once on my own.  They have home-made bread and jam, and good food overall with good portions.  Daily specials will change frequently over a morning or afternoon, and the specials are good--unique.  Now for why I didn't get it all 5 stars:  It's pretty busy all the time, which means packed, which means you probably will have to wait.  That's the mark of a good restaurant, and they are quite efficient at getting people in and out, and served efficiently.  You will usually have to wait in a line to pay, but often the wait staff will take it up for you.  Tables are very close together and you are right on top of your neighboring diners.  Most of all, it's so noisy you can hardly hear yourself and your tablemate talk.  If you are by yourself, you will be put at the counter, period.  They rightfully maximize space. The environment is a little overwhelming.  But the service and food are good.  One a single one-room bathroom is inside each for the Guys & Gals, and there was a line each of my visits.  Even if you are not waiting, if other people are in line, they can be right in front of your table where you're eating.  It's a small place that is open for breakfast and lunch and does a booming business.  I've only been here for breakfast and I would go back with my friend.
Ate there once with family.  So noisy in there you can't even hear yourself chew. Everyone talking, they need to do something about the acoustics. The food was good

Get the salami scramble and enjoy.   Great service and amazing food makes the wait almost bearable, but sometimes you just want quality breakfast without putting your name in and getting dolled up  for the paparazzi.   In the end I'll continue to go and wait in the line, but I don't have to like it.
Great customer service and great tasting food! Their fresh lemonades are AWESOME, they are very quick when it comes to service. If there's a wait, it's worth waiting!

Classic case of overhype leading to disappointment. After waiting 30 minutes to get sat, we ordered off their tiny, tiny breakfast menu.  I ordered a cheese omelet and waffle. The waffle was excellent the rest was blah. The eggs in my omelet were not scrabbled all the way so chunks of yolks kept presenting themselves and they clearly added the cheese at the last second because it wasn't melted. The home fries were greasy and had no seasoning besides rosemary. I had to cover everything in salt until I finally gave up and left the greasy mess on my plate. On the plus side my husband enjoyed his breakfast and the service was good

Yes, the menu looks small and simple, but this place is really good!  I went for breakfast. We both had eggs.  My eggs were eggs. But, the eggs with salami were really yummy and salty. The hash browns and home fires were awesome! Some of the best I'd ever had.  The toast was delicious and came with (I think homemade) blackberry preserves. So good!  And my coffee and water glass was never empty.    We went on a weekday at 7:30 and there was no wait.

Went to Matt's Big Breakfast before our morning flight out of PHX airport after seeing reviews here.   We were lucky to find them open on Monday since they were not open Mondays in the past.  There was no wait for our party of two and were promptly greeted and informed of the daily special.  The waitress was very nice and attentive.   I had the special which was a three egg scramble with canadian bacon and locally grown asparagus along with home fries.  K had the eggs, bacon, and hash browns.  Both meals came with toast and preserves.  Both the wheat and sourdough toast were thick slices and very fresh.  Everything was  fresh and tasty.  (Total bill $22.)  We will definitely be stopping back here in future trips to the area as it was a delicious meal.  I highly recommend this place to anyone although it is so very small that it is a good idea to get there early (they open at 630) seeing as we got there at 730 and by 815 there was a line to sit.

Its been a long time since my last visit to Matt's.  I used to make the pilgrimage pretty regularly to their old location, but hadn't taken in the new place.  Boy, what an upgrade.  Their old place was essentially a shack that (somehow) managed to cram about 20 people inside.  It was a cool place and was unique to the neighborhood, but it was really crowded inside and the wait times could be epic.  The new place is roomier, can seat twice as many patrons, and feels much more like a neighborhood restaurant than a corner hole in the wall.  The wait outside can still be long at times, but at least now you won't feel as cramped inside as you do waiting in line.  Not wanting to wait in line, but wanting a hearty breakfast, I came here at about 7am on a Saturday.  Just came by myself and grabbed a stool.  My server told me its usually just after 8am on Saturday that it gets busy and the lines start to form.  So my timing was perfect.  Even at 7am the place was a little over half full, but no wait time.  The patrons I saw ran the gambit from families with kids, to ASU Downtown students, to workers in suits, to neighborhood artists.  Similar to what I remembered at Matt's old place.  For my meal, I went with the Salami Scramble.  Molinari salami mixed with scrambled eggs and accompanied by toast with homemade strawberry preserves and hash browns (you can substitute home fries if you want).  To wash it all down I went with their fresh squeezed lemonade mixed with honey.  Unusual drink mixing the sweetness of the honey with the acidic taste of the lemonade, but very good.  The scramble was incredible as the salami had just the right amount of kick, wasn't oily and they didn't skimp on the salami portions.  The strawberry preserves tasted very fresh and accompanied the sourdough toast perfectly.  Total cost for the scramble and sides, lemonade, tax, and tip was $15.  Good deal given the hearty portions I received in return.  The server was very friendly and the staff were all alert, attentive, and in good spirits even this early on a Saturday morning.  As with their old location, the detractors would probably tell you the biggest negative about this place is the wait.  Even now that they have a new location twice as big as the old one, the wait can still get long.  Take it from the waitress I talked to, get here before 8am if you can.  I did and was in and out in 30 minutes.  Matt's has a following for a good reason.  Great portions of hearty, locally sourced food at reasonable prices.  A legion of fans will tell you its worth the wait.  Count me among them.
Damn where to start... hash browns are amazing, the honey lemonade is delicious, the bacon omg... I get lost in the rich fatty piece of heaven lol. Highly recommend it!

Matt's Big Breakfast is the real deal - celebrating tons of local ingredients and making everything from scratch. But the wait can be killer.  We were a party of three going to Matt's about noon on a Sunday. I had heard about the wait, but the hour we sat there was still pretty rough. Once we were seated, though, the service was fast and friendly.  Our friend (who's a local) told us the best thing on the menu was The Hog & Chick, so that's what all of us ordered. I was totally pleased with everything:  * Coffee - from a local roaster * OJ - freshly squeezed (in a teeny tiny glass) * Eggs - fresh and local * Potatoes - buttery, herbed, and delicious * Toast - thick, buttery, and delicious * Preserves - homemade at Matt's and super delish * ham - a giant slab of serious goodness  The price was very reasonable too - especially for the quality of food. For all the items listed above, I paid about $15. Next time I'm in the area, I'll totally go back to Matt's, but I'll try to pick an obscure time when the wait isn't quite so bad.
Food was great!!!

Awesome food and worth the wait.  My sis and I showed up at 10 am on a Wednesday morning.  Had to wait about 5 min.  All waitresses care about everyone and not just their own table.  Sis had the chop n chik.. I had the special...  Some sort of vienna Guada sausage scramblers with cheese....  AHhh-- mazingly good!!!   Juice, preserves, and milk all taste super fresh.  Some of the best hashbrowns I have ever tasted.  Have the perfect crispyness but yet the right texture in the middle.

I've been reading a lot of reviews about Matt's big breakfast so I stopped in to give it a try. I have to say I was a bit disappointed in the size of my meal. It wasn't BIG at all. The tables were very small to, barley enuf room to fit two people. The restaurant itself is small to,very little seating. We had to wait for about 30min. before being seated. The food is just ok,I won't be coming back. Matt's breakfast would be an appropriate non misleading name.

Busy place! Delicious fresh squeezed orange juice. I probably could have just ordered a gallon for breakfast. Service varied - some people were great but a few that seemed like they didn't care. Pancakes a little dry.

I came here with my wife and I had the chick and chop. I am not exaggerating when I say that it was the juiciest pork chop I've ever had. The sour dough bread that came with it was very good and you can tell that its home made or at least bought from a local bakery. My wife had the waffle which came with 2 strips of thick cut bacon. We also had the freshly squeezed OJ which tasted as advertised. I will definitely come back and recommend this place to all my family and friends.
There's a long time to get in for a reason!  Best service, best food.  It's a place you have to try and fall in love with.

One of the best steaks for breakfast EVER!  Perfectly cooked w/ awesome flavor. A bit loud inside, but fantastic service, great food, and extremely reasonable.  I hardly ever give 5 stars, but I can give this place all 5 without hesitation!
Incredible servings and consistently good food. Better come early or be prepared to wait - there is a long line for a reason.

This is the idyllic breakfast stop for all you yelping food fanatics. Matt's is an upscale diner that will keep you believing breakfast really is the most important meal of the day; no matter how many carbs you just ate. My game plan was to order a meal and save half of it for later or even the next day; unfortunately, it was sooo good that I just couldn't stop.  When they asked me what type of toast I wanted I half shrugged it off as just give me the "whatever" flavor and I won't eat it anyway. I generally stay away from generic tasting food in an effort to make my calories count for at the very least and awesome tasting meal.  Even the toast was awesome! If they didn't bake the loaf of bread that my toast came from just as I was making my order, you could have foolded me. The hashbrowns were awesome, so much that I ate them all.  I wish I knew how to make my scrambled eggs taste like Matt does. You will not be dissapointed with any meal you order here.  Words just don't give this breakfast joint justice, so be sure to check out all the pictures!  Expect to pay about $10-11 per person after tax and tip for one of these awesome breakfast meals.  **WARNING** Don't eat here if you are looking for just another breakfast place. **

This is the best breakfast joint in the valley of the sun.   I have been here many times and the average wait time is about an hour.... but is totally worth it!  Food:  The food here is great!  Everything is freshly made and full of favor!  My favorite is their pork chop with eggs... and you must get their rosemary home fries and wheat toast!   Also thick cut bacon as a side!  The bacon is what keeps bringing me back to this place.   They are thick cut and peppered... 3 slices for $2.95 might be a little pricy but they are really good!    Their daily specials are also very good, most of the time is some type of egg/ sausage scramble.  I also love their homemade bread and jam.  Matt's switches up their jam favors.  Service:  Their staff is great!  Very friendly and attentive.  But you must prepare to wait... the only time that I didn't have to wait was when I got there 10 mins before opening.   Otherwise prepare to wait at least 1 hour.   They new location is more than twice the size of the old location, but wait time is still very long, especially you have a large group.

First time eating here and ordered the burger. The burger was good and was big. I tried the bacon and the waffles and have to say the waffles were amazing. Bacon was thick and had a nice pepper flavor.
Great Food. Great Coffee. Great Service. Amazing Hash-browns! Can't wait to go back.

1. Best bacon i have ever had. 2. The sourdough toast and blueberry jam was delicious.  Seems like those two things did it for me, but not necessarily.... I ordered the hog and chick(wanted their french toast special bit french toast and sausage was just not enough of choices). Over medium eggs, 3 pieces of bacon(thick crunchy bacon may i add), hash browns and sourdough toast with jam. Water to drink. Eggs were nothing special but still delish. Hash browns were a little too buttery for my taste but definitely not your average tasting which i definitely enjoyed. Bacon was the best i have ever had as already mentioned, it was seasoned just right and no sogginess, all crispyness. The sourdough toast i could really keep eating. Im not sure if it was the toast or the jam but it was just perfection. Water- no sink water taste. ;-) Overall it was really good. Party of 3 only had to wait 5 minutes at 11am on Tuesday. I guess this is rare but we were fortunate. Service was friendly but did feel rushed at times. But as you see still 5 stars because at the end the food was the star.  Note - coworker had the waffles and said its one of if  not the best they ever tasted.

Food here is good however the service can suck at this location. I ate at the downtown location earlier this week and had a great experience. I stopped in for a to go order at the Camelback location and Riley took my order but was very short and rude. I understand  restaurants get busy however that's not an excuse for poor service.
Delicious and filling breakfast. It is always super busy. The downside? No parking. The parking in the back of the building is for the Velo

I journeyed off after on my quest to find a good breakfast spot. Decided to drive to Phx and give Matt's a try.   Parking isn't easy. My super hero foresight made me move my car just in the nick of time! Sorry for the truck that got the ticket.. Anyhow not a big selection to choose from. I decided to have two eggs over easy, off the bone ham(extra$), hash browns, wheat bread, and a Coffee..coffee was okay just coffee...not that I was expecting more..plate came up right away. Looked good. Ham was great! Would make a great sandwich with cheese. Eggs were eggs..Hash browns were good but I have a better idea...they were crunchy on outside and oily in the middle, it's bot bad just missing something... I would NOT stand in a ridiculous line for this place....
I just needed to get something to eat before my connecting flight. Lucky to find this place. Good food and really friendly staff. Made me feel like I was at a local hangout.

You gotta love Matt's -- but, don't you miss the bright, sunny old place (assuming you could get a seat!) as opposed to the concrete-bunker feel of the new place? Plus, while tiny tables made sense in a tiny spot, the tiny 2-tops in the new place give you no room at all.  I had the oatmeal (served just barely lukewarm), their wonderful bacon, and coffee.  Service was great.

Matt's Big Breakfast has got to be one of the best breakfast spots in Arizona. I've been going to Matt's for as long as I can remember, and it never disappoints. I could never get enough of their house fries, which consists of yummy potatoes, onions and rosemary cooked just right. Try their belgian waffle and the specials they have. Oh and prepare for the long wait!

A buddy of mine invited me to breakfast. Payment for fixing his computer. We meet on location and as I pull up, my friend is sitting outside and signals me to park around the back. The back parking lot was full, so I parked on 1 street, having to feed the meter. As I walk up I notice people outside waiting, so I sit on the bench next to my buddy out front for about three minutes when one of the girls calls us, we're next. The place is small and the atmosphere is loud because of the small space, but hey, this is downtown phoenix, who cares. I ordered the triple stack pancakes with a side of sunny side up eggs and a order of bacon. My buddy ordered the Pork Chop breakfast with potatoes. The food was great, all home made. The only thing that bothered me was there was no reg sugar, just brown. Next time I will have to bring my own sweet and low for the coffee. Girls are cute, service was great. I would definitely be coming back.

Saw this place on Diners, Drive-In's and Dives on the Food Network and I knew I had to go if ever in the Phoenix area. As luck would have it I was out there this weekend for a wedding and this place was on my must visit list. Even at 10:30am on a Friday there is a line out the door for this place. We happily waited the 30 minutes and it was well worth the wait. The husband had the pork chop and eggs served with hash browns and thick hand cut toast. I opted for the breakfast special of the day which was a hot link scramble with fresh jalapenos and cheddar served with a warm tortilla and hash browns. I will go on record as saying this is the best breakfast I have ever had. The eggs were cooked perfectly, the tortilla warm and fresh, the hash browns were crispy (not greasy) on the outside and perfect on the inside. We couldn't resist trying the pancake made from scratch as well. Fluffy and light served with warm maple syrup. YUM!  We didn't have room for all this food but we wanted to make sure we sampled all Matt's had to offer. WOW great food , excellent prices and warm friendly service. This is a must visit local breakfast joint in Phoenix.

Like most great places, a review isn't necessary, so I haven't done so.  My latest visit gave me the need to do so, though.  I needn't say what's already been said, as most of the reviews are the same.  1) You will wait, no matter what time of day or time of year.  Hot summer mornings, early, will have the shortest wait.  If you've never been here, what you do is show up, write down your name and the number of people in your party, snag some water and find some shade.  It's suggested you have good company or a book - you can get bored waiting!  2) All the food is good.  All the food is fresh.  If there is a daily special, get it.  3) Everyone rants and raves about the potatoes.  I could remove one star just to prove a point, but this is a five star place.  The hashbrowns are good because of the potatoes.  They are extremely fresh and full-flavored, unlike anything you get at most restaurants.  That said, they're not the *WORLDS GREATEST HASHBROWNS EVERRRRRRRRRRRR*.  They're fantastic, but they are a bit mushy on the inside.  They are possibly the very best potatoes in town, all said and done.  4) Four Barrel coffee is served here now, instead of Cave Creek.  I'm all for this.  Despite it not being local, it is better than a lot of local roasts.  5) Go here.

I decided to stop here in the airport while I waited for my flight. Although they were busy I was greeted and automatically offered a drink and menu. I ordered the Matt's big breakfast with medium well eggs. Everything was really good, kind of with it was cooked just a tad bit longer for the eggs. However, the potatoes were perfectly seasoned the pancake was just right light sweet flavor to it and everything else was just right. I enjoyed the food and customer service. I'd go back when visiting.

This place gets so packed! I had to see what all the rave was about and I'm just not too sure. Their menu had very typical items that are prepared as expected. No knock against the place, but it has nothing that would bring me back.

Top notch food and service, done quickly and with a good understanding attitude. My BLT was fresh, with tomatoes that tasted like tomatoes should and fresh crisp lettuce on some great bread.  My buddy had a breakfast that was also fresh, plentiful and delicious. There's an amazing amount of good food in the Phoenix airport, yet this stands out for both great food and service.
Fast and friendly service. Food is amazing and Fresh. I like going out of my comfort zone and ordering the special. I've never been disapointed and I can't wait to go again.

When in downtown Phoenix, this is a "must stop"!  A short wait, excellent service and a tasty breakfast served until 2:30 pm. The pork and apple sausage had a great snap to it. The hash browns were crispy, buttery, and had a hint of sweetness. Definitely, put Matt's on your list.

First time at Matt' Big Breakfast. Arrived at 10:15 on a Saturday morning and waited 20 mins: much less than most reviewers.   My son-in-law and I both ordered identical breakfasts: the special meal and drink of the day. We each got the Three Egg omelette with Schriner's Chorizo a jalapeos and it came with potatoes. We both got a side of sausage and a Strawberry Honey Lemonade.   It arrived in about 10 mins. The eggs were nicely cooked and the potatoes were cooked crispy, just as I prefer them. The sausage were a bit small for the price but I got full anyway. The drink was too sweet and would've been better without the honey.    Overall a good experience. I will bring my gluten-intolerant wife and see what she thinks next time.

Nothing special about the oatmeal.  Service was decent but felt rushed- which is fine- I get it- we're at an airport....But then when I did want to leave I couldn't get my card run until I stood up to leave. But worst of all:  THE COFFEE WAS HORRIBLE!  Guys, this is a breakfast restraint and you can't make a half way decent cup of strong coffee?  I've had water that had more flavor!!

http://stevelerer.com  I traveled to Phoenix only a few days away from the LA marathon in March and was determined to start carbo loading early. My first stop was Matt's Big Breakfast, a place I had patroned back in 2010. That time I ordered the item that Guy tried on triple D and it was really good. He ordered the chop and the chick which was a pork chop and two fried eggs. It was delicious, with a great pesto topping, I only wished I could have had more pesto but they may have given it to me if I had asked.  The restaurant is small usually with a 10 minute wait even for one person. I didn't mind and hung out with the locals for a little bit before I was able to sit at the bar. The decor and ambiance is not much different than most other small breakfast spots but it is clean and welcoming. The staff was nice and took my order quickly and it was only a short while before my order of the hog and the chick was in front of me. Placed at my spot of the counter was beautifully cooked think cut peppered bacon, crispy hashbrowns, and two perfectly cooked over medium eggs. Everything on the plate was cooked really well and was a perfect breakfast. The eggs were right under medium which is where I like them and the hashbrowns were crunchy and crispy on the outside while still creamy on the inside. Somewhat like a potato latke, just without all the onion. By far the star on the plate was the think cut bacon. Sometimes when a restaurant says that the bacon is think cut it really isn't and other times it is so thick that it comes out uncooked. Matt's got it just right and peppered right to the edge of too much. Just where I like it. I could have eaten platefuls of this stuff, if only they were in LA at the end of the marathon.  The last thing in my order was the real reason I returned to Matt's. Each breakfast arrives with a side of bread of which you have a few options. Bread aside, the start was the strawberry jam they served on the side. The jam is without a doubt the best thing in the restaurant. It is super sweet with chunks of fruit inside. It has so much flavor in such a simple concoction, I could eat a jar of it. Too bad they only give you about two ounces. I wonder if they bottle and sell it because I would buy.  All in all Matt's Big Breakfast is a really solid breakfast joint in downtown Phoenix. No wonder it always has a wait. The peppered bacon was delicious and the rest of the meal was nothing to scoff at but, in the end, I would come here every time I visit Phoenix just for the strawberry jam. Check out Matt's Big Breakfast the next time you are in town and let me know what you think.  Overall Review: 7/10

I've been going to the location in downtown Phoenix for years so I was so thrilled to find out that there's one that's a lot closer to me. I found that this location is not as busy. Generally, the quality of food is the same as the one in downtown Phoenix.   The hog and chick is their basic breakfast - delicious, peppered, thick cut bacon paired with perhaps the best breakfast potatoes I have ever had. The way they make their potatoes is absolutely perfect. Yukon gold with onions and rosemary cooked just right. Salami Scramble is excellent as well. My boyfriend always gets one of their specials that has jalapeos in it (I can't remember what it's called!) and he loves it.  Their pancakes are to die for. We have just discovered how good it is a few weeks ago, and couldn't believe how amazing they taste. Their waffles are delightful as well. I have yet to try their lunch menu.  Their service has always been decent. Can't say that it's great or top notch, hence the 4 stars. I've read some of the reviews here and I agree that the male host (or manager?) can be rude and off at times. My boyfriend and I have agreed that he seemed like he didn't want to be there.    If I were just to rate the food, it would no doubt be 5 STARS!

At the bar I ordered the standard two egg breakfast, named some kind of hipster BS like two chicks and a pig or something. I opted for fruit instead of the home fries. My server was prompt and the drinks / food came quickly, however, the fruit was so old looking I couldn't bring myself to eat it. One of my pet peeves is wasting food so I can't recall a time I sent something back but in this case I was willing to forego that side all together. The server tried without me asking to get a fresher bowl but she even admitted upon her return from the kitchen that it all looked unappetizing. She didn't offer another side of anything else to make up for the rotten fruit. If you have the time for a sit down meal, take a moment to find another eatery. In hindsight, I'm sure Wendy's next door would have been better...

When you've been traveling since 3 am, you just want to stop for a big breakfast and coffee. Luckily, my gate was a mere 30 second walk from Matt's, giving me plenty of time to enjoy a "Matt's big breakfast" with pancakes, eggs, bacon, and sausage. The bacon here is peppered, thick, and delicious. The rest of the breakfast measured up just as well. They also have a full bar in case you aren't traveling at breakfast time and have other menu items as well. Overall, I'm pleased that this was an option in my terminal.

Easy 5 stars from me.  I travel for work a lot and all my AM trips start at Matt's.  The food is fantastic and comes out fast.  Both the steak and eggs and the Belgian waffle are top notch.  Bacon Bloody Mary is best ever in my book, too.  I've been to every major airport in the US and PHX is my fave.  So much good food here.  Sucks that you have to have a ticket to get in.

A bit of a wait but well worth it. Hog and chick breakfast! So so good. Bacon is peppered and AMAZING. And their sourdough toast and homemade preserves! The final treat of this perfect breakfast! And don't forget to get a strawberry honey lemonade to go! Got to try it!

This place is phenomenal. I would only be adding to a long list of gushing reviews, so I'll be brief.   When you go (and you're planning on going -- right?) ask about the food. So much of what they serve isn't store-bought. It's hand crafted. That toast you get? On fresh baked bread. The bacon? From a special local butcher. The jam to spread on your toast? Homemade. And delicious.   Service with a smile.   Great new (larger) digs.   Go early. This place is POPULAR for a reason.
Great breakfast spot ! first time here... Food tasted great and they served great portions! will be coming  back here for the waffle, herb potatoes and wheat bread !

Was in town for a training event and had to check this place out! Saw it on Triple D and it was as advertised if not better! The service was fantastic (all the girls were very attentive and friendly) and the food was amazing! Probably one of the best waffles I've ever had anywhere! The home fries, toast, and bacon was top notch!  I'll definitely be back whenever I'm in town! If you haven't been, you gotta check it out!
Was excited to try this place because of all the reviews. Food was ok, way overrated. Won't be going back!

Came here for the first time and absolutely loved it! I had the chop and chick and it was amazing, loved the toast. Food is fresh and service is friendly, the line was out the door, but so worth the wait. Prices were great, had an awesome experience. We will be coming back for sure!

I ordered an omelette & potatoes. The entire plate was swimming in grease. The meal was crazy greasy - not impressed. The service was as good as can be expected during the holiday rush travel hour. If this is my only choice in concourse B I'll opt for Wendy's next time.
I think its not what its all hyped up to be, and its overpriced probably due to location.

Food was good. Service was pretty miserable. Server seemed annoyed that we were there. We had some questions because it was our first time and it was like pulling teeth to get an answer. Probably won't be back.

Probably the best breakfast I've had. Long wait, over an hour on a sunday but all was amazing. Saw it on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives and it still impressed.  Got the prime flank steak with over easy eggs, sourdough, hashbrowns, and coffee.  Flank steak was fat, juicy, and had a great pink to it. Kind of tough crust but definately impressive for a breakfast place. Eggs were good and cooked good too. Homeade blueberry preserves were amazing and I put them on everything. Bread was nice but the best was the hashbrowns. Best hashbrowns I have had to date. Crispy outside but so soft and buttery inside. Flawless texture and flavor. You MUST try these, you won't regret it. Waiter said to try cheddar cheese on them the next time and I will definately be back and can't wait to try it.   Definately best breakfast and you have to go here if your in the area.

Ok, they've got a wait line.  Consider the alternative then happily proceed 'cause they got it going on!  We were seated in under 5 mins (yes, the hard stool at the counter is fine--its a dive).  My 5 Spot sandwich was spot-on and did not need any help from the hot sauce which was offered.  The best part of the meal was the local bread they use--perfect.  My wife ordered the special (scrambled eggs with cheese, chorizo and jalapeos with home fries.  She thought the potatoes were off the chain, but the scramble was overtaken by the heat.  The service was excellent, no one seemed frazzled, and the placed hummed along joyfully--it was packed, too.  Next time in PHX we'll go back for lunch.

I've been looking forward to trying Matt's for a while, and finally had an excuse to grab a Sonrisa Burrito on a quick layover in Phoenix.  Oh well.  Service was somewhat slow - it was after 8pm and one person was working the register and running orders, as far as I could tell, so she would disappear for a few minutes at a time.  The burrito? Big soft flour tortilla. I got sausage, and the sausage was okay, nothing special. The eggs were dry and scant, and the potatoes needed to be in smaller chunks. Flavor was just missing, and the salsa was unimpressive. Overall, I'm glad I tried it, because now I know not to bother. It's probably better if you get a plate with bacon or something baked, judging by the crowds - I just hope that the disappointing burrito was not representative as I like their farm-to-table concept.

There are things I love about this place and things I didn't.   Loves: concept, (quality ingredients and food), local sourcing, unique sausage flavors, tasty, real maple syrup, real butter  Not loves: seating, not a fan of uber close quarters. If I can reach the table next to me and steal a bite, then for their sake, I'm too close. Loud, cramped, limited menu, long wait time  I do really like this place. They had raw sugar in a sugar dispenser (win) a special of the day (that was not just a discounted version of something already oh the menu) and the food had great taste. Yes taste. HOWEVER, unless you appreciate quality, you will find this place disappointing.  Real maple syrup is not anywhere near the same as Mrs Butterworth. Real butter does not taste like the stuff dispensed onto your movie popcorn. Well you get my point.   I will be back for breakfast another day.
Small Menu and I feel they rush you to eat and leave. Great for sunday morning breakfast but that may be about it.  ............but the canadian bacon is on point

Super cool inside and the food was really really good. Their bacon is unlike any other bacon I have had. So you must get that whether you get that on the side or your actual meal. I had the hog and chick with bacon. Go go go!

Good service. Really good food. I got The Five Spot and my husband got the waffle. Both were delicious. Everything tasted clean (not heavy, greasy or processed). The honey lemonade is really tasty The place isn't very big. It was packed with people but they run it well. Decor is cute, sort of an urban farmhouse.  I would recommend and come again.

Griddlecakes and bacon were fabulous.  As others have said expect a wait.  The place is TINY.  Servers were really nice.  I had griddlecakes, bacon and a diet RC and with tip it was $16.  Portions were generous and I was only able to eat one pancake.  Another side note is it's so tiny your wait is outside... Consider the weather.  There is no shade.  I thought it was worth it but I am not sure I'd wait again.

Really Really good! My daughter had the waffle with Bacon and she couldn't stop raving about it. I got the special with chili strip, ham and egg with home fries. The home fries were delicious with fresh rosemary. Will be coming back to try there dinner.

First time checking it out.  Service was friendly and quick.. Wish I could have given more stars but the food wasn't much to write home about.  I didn't have time to alert my server of my disappointment as I needed a quick bite. Was able to pick apart bits I wanted. I paid extra for sausage, and mushrooms... Come to find out, mushrooms are from can?? Why? Never seen so much grease and water pool up on an omlet.  Best part was the side of sourdough bread!

This place is incredible! I found it on DDD and wanted to give it a shot since Guy Fieri usually hits the mark. I went here for my ASU graduation breakfast with my Mom and boyfriend and we all were beyond satisfied. The waffle is wonderful with a touch of vanilla, the bacon I hear is heart-achingly good, the omelettes are savory and hearty plus the bread and homemade jam is just outrageously good! We went here again today because, why resist?

I got there at 1 on a Sunday and waited for about an hour to get seated. The place is really small so I'm sure there is always a wait. No bathroom.   Food was great. Everything was really fresh. I think there were 5 things to chose from and the one thing I really wanted ran out as I ordered. Majorly bummed.   I would love to come back but seriously am dreading the wait!

Most attentive serve. And, solid menu for breakfast. The portions aren't too big, despite the name, so order as you would at a diner. Those darn breakfast potatoes are addictive! They also cater to gluten free, just ask what you can eat on the menu.

My hubby and I went to matts this morning after seeing the new location on yelp.  We sat at the counter.  Friendly hellos when we arrived but the service disappeared after that even though there were quite a few people working behind the counter.  We never saw our server again after he took out order, had to ask for coffee and water refills.  Good was average.  I ordered the skinny which was described as the eggs with a small salad on the side.  It was quite the opposite.  A small potion of eggs and a huge salad but quite tasty.  My husband got the griddle cakes which were average but disappointed they didn't come  with bacon or sausage side.   The waffle does so why not the griddle cakes?   The manager came over and asked how we liked our bfast.  I mentioned it to him and he made light of it and redirected the conversation.  He was very friendly. Put $ on the counter to pay our bill and it sat there for 15 minutes before anyone asked if we were waiting to pay our bill.  Hoping a few things improve if we go there again

I really don't think I could ask for more in a breakfast.  This place is hopping, but if you're dining alone, they'll do their best to scoot you into the bar amongst the other solo travelers.  I ordered chicks and something: two eggs, hash or home fries, sausage or bacon, and your choice of yum-yum bread with homemade preserves.  I took mine: poached, hashed, patties, and wheat with extra butter and the strawberry preserve.     Staff was attentive, I didn't feel rushed in spite of the congregating line in the courtyard, and the food came fast.  Lots of happy people and smiles.  If I could change just one thing...the coffee is a bit weak for my tastebuds and they make their iced coffee by pouring hot coffee over ice (no-thank-you!).  And if I could change two things, I would recommend that the hashbrowns be cold water washed before frying - this allows them to crisp and prevent that gooey middle that mine came with.  Other then that: bliss.

"What is this? A restaurant for ants? I don't want to hear any excuses! The building has to be at least... Three times bigger than this!"  On a more serious note, this is a teeny, tiny restaurant - so small that the first action of order is to write your name on a notepad that is waiting on a small table outside the entrance. Then expect to wait outside until there is space inside, because there is simply no space to stand and wait inside. But when you do manage to stick a foot in the door, Matt's Big Breakfast invites you in to a cheery, diner-esque environment but with fresh flowers on the table and nicer than average cutlery to boot. Like the establishment, the menu is small. We ordered the Salami Scramble and the Chop & Chick.  SALAMI SCRAMBLE Though I can always appreciate a bacon and eggs type breakfast, the peppery punch of the salami scramble was a nice change from the classic. Of course breakfast isn't breakfast without some made-from-scratch hash browns that were crispy but not too oily. I generally like my browns a little less fried, but I still enjoyed these taters nonetheless.  CHOP & CHICK The pork chop was expertly seasoned which was right up my alley, because huge hunks of just meat just doesn't hit the spot. Huge hunks of meat with lots o' spices though? Oh yes.  All in all, a nice experience at this charming little restaurant. I would definitely visit when I want some good ol' meat and potatoes for breakfast.

Here in town for the wildcard baseball game tonight. Hotel recommended this restaurant for breakfast. They were right, this is a fantastic breakfast. Sourdough toast excellent, ham steak was excellent, hashbrowns are among the best I've ever had.

It was cold for a Phoenix morning (upper 30s over-night) and I stood outside the hospital splashed in sunlight, surrounded by palm-trees and (oddly) shivering despite my wool army-drab button-down and $3 coffee. The doctor's visit went well and my spirits were high. Surgery was not an option. For now.  A few minutes later, my host arrived in a green VW Rabbit. I love the new rabbits. She needed to get some work accomplished and I needed to address some email. A few (Phoenix) minutes later, we arrived at the coffee-shop. I ordered a mug of coffee and picked up a business card. Lux? That sounds familiar... Oh my goodness! LUX! I shot their first cover on top of the Smithfield at 5.30 on a Sunday morning in 2007 and the magazine was named after the coffee-shop in Phoenix where Mark and Cindy birthed the idea.  The world is tiny.  ---  "My work is done. You wanna get breakfast?"  "Do you even have to ask? What was that place you told me about before I left Philadelphia?"  "Matt's. But there's another place I thought of that you might like as well."  "Oh, yeah? What's that?"  "The Welcome Diner."  "Lemme find it on Yelp and I'll think about it."  "Okay."  "This is hard. I can't decide. Let's just go to Matt's. I'll do the Welcome in the Spring when I come back."  ---  The West is a unique place. The cities are different - spread out. The architecture is different, too. I can't describe it. It just feels like it belongs here in the desert. Form over function. Matt's fits in just this way. It's tiny inside and everything's painted white. A few photographs in white mats with white frames take up the rest of the wall space. The small bar occupies a quarter of the main dining area and four diner-orange tables decorated with desert plants take up the rest of the crowded and intimate space which is by now teeming with locals who're there to gather a late morning brunch.  There were two specials that morning and once our server mentioned the first, I couldn't remember anything else, but I told her that I needed some more time so that I could neatly arrange my table for a shot of the menu. When she came back I ordered the three-egg scramble with red peppers, spicy sausage (all their pork comes from Iowa!) and provolone cheese. A side of shredded hash-browns accompanied this beautiful breakfast feast.  For a joint that stays as busy as it does, the prices are fantastic. (I think everything's cheaper in Phoenix). Before tip, my tab was right around $12 and for the quality and quantity of food that I received in one of Phoenix's most popular spots, I had no complaints.  When I make a return visit to the Valley of the Sun in April, I'll be sure to make myself an out-of-town-regular at this wonderful little place.  ...And maybe next time I'll run into Nate Ruess.

Pros: food is great! Servers are wonderful and pleasant. Cozy environment.  Cons: The host! Upon getting called for our table, while talking on his phone, he just pointed to our table across the room and had us sit ourselves. After 5 minutes, while we are placing our orders, he proceeded to yell out our name across three tables and said that he called "Melissa" and not "Marisa" and just stared at us. Not sure if he was expecting an apology or just wanted us to leave! Very unprofessional and low class.

I love Matt's Big Breakfast downtown, but this was a huuuuge disappointment. HUGE. I ordered an egg salad sandwich (which I have had before at the one downtown), and it was just awful. There was literally NO egg salad in this sandwich. The two slices of bread on the outside where so unnecessarily THICK. I took off one of the slices in attempt to actually taste the measly amount of egg salad that was on my sandwich, but even then, the other half of bread was so rubbery i couldn't tear it with my teeth! I was in awe. Even the guy sitting next to me said something about it. Like "wow that's a lot of bread."   Don't get me wrong, their breakfast is fantastic at Matt's downtown! And maybe even good at the airport as well. But I have had their egg salad before and it was nothing like that.  I almost complained to my server it was so bad. Almost. I can't believe I spent money on like a tablespoon of egg salad. I never ever complain about food, I usually just don't ever return if I don't like it. But this sandwich was so pathetic I actually wanted my money back. Of course I'm so passive I ended up not saying anything. Was just kind of hoping my server could tell by the fact that I barely ate any of it. I should have complained and I regret not doing so. I just hate to. But this was so bad. Won't ever go here again.   I still kind of want my money back. :( Sorry guys!
The food was so delicious. Servers came by a bit too much, so it was slightly overwhelming.

After reading all the "best" breakfast reviews about this place we were excited to try it out. It was super busy when we arrived which is usually a good sign. It took about 10 minutes to get out order taken once we sat down and then another 10 to get our drinks. When the food came it wasn't even hot. I had to actually get up and get my own hot sauce because it wasn't offered or did our waitress even return to ask how the food was. They seem to be trying too hard to be trendy. They need to focus more on customer service and hot food than being cool.

Wow great breakfast spot. My friends recommended going after seeing it on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives on the food network and we were not disappointed. Being the norcal gal I am I called and asked if the line was hella long... the gal on the phone mentioned that around 12:30-1pm the line calms down. We got there and were seated immediately. Bonus points for having ice cold water outside too. This place was perfect for recovering after the previous nights drink fest. I had the Five Spot with hash browns and it was amazing. My entire group agreed I picked the best thing off the menu. When I'm back in Phoenix I will be back for the Five Spot again..
Great food...I recommend the waffles with bacon and hash browns....amazing strawberry lemonade. Went on a saturday early afternoon and only had maybe a 5 minute wait...def going again

Okay so there was a wait to get into this place but damn if it isn't worth it!  Omg! Amazing homemade food.. The bread is homemade, the eggs are free range, and the bacon is nice and thick! I'm in love! Definitely coming back to this place.. They serve a big enough portion to fill you up and finish it all!

The food is great! Matts has always been my favorite. This location however, first time here and do not like. It's always frustrating when you feel like you are invisible. I was sitting across from my husband. Not once was I approached or talked to. When they came to get our drink my husband had just parked the truck and came to sit down and they asked him! For food same thing. When management came by to check on us, same thing checked on him! The chick with the check same thing! Heck I even paid for the meal they will thanked him! Wth! I was shocked and confirmed I am not going back.

We went on a Thursday around 10:30 and didn't expect a long wait... surprise, surprise, we waited an hour. Other than the wait (which was expected) the food was delicious. Everyone working at Matt's were friendly (they all say goodbye to you as you leave). I definently recommend getting the bacon as a side if it does not come as part of your meal. If you can't stand the heat, order carryout or show up later (at 11:30 there was maybe a 15 minute wait).

Oh that pork chop is going to haunt my dreams.    I have never had such an a,a zingy flavored pork chop.   The hash browns were tasty and crisp.  We also had eggs, which were cooked perfectly...sunny side up and scrambled.   The special was biscuits and gravy, they were amazing.   The gravy had a slight spice and the biscuits were creamy and flaky.   It was well worth the 1:2 hour wait.

Sleep is really the time machine to breakfast and Matt's is a great spot to take your sleepy head for breakfast. I'm a fan of the Phoenix location but this one is perfect for a bike ride along Tempe Town Lake and nestled among the beauty of Marina Heights. Once inside, it's sleek and modern with colorful chalk drawings displaying. I like the short menu so you aren't overloaded on those hangover mornings. There are a variety of specials each day of the week but I stuck to the waffles....something about those airy pillows of carb goodness had me. If the freshly brewed STRONG coffee from the Roastery of Cave Creek doesn't perk you up, the bellini and margarita are pretty delish good eye openers. Just a note, there's few 5 tops (3 to be exact) so not the easiest to accommodate large parties. You MUST have all people present to be seated. Or if you can squeeze in, sit at the bar and gab with a few Sun Devils. The waiting area is spacious on the outdoor patio that you can stalk the diners to hurry and finish up! Parking is pretty easy and they will validate for the garage. And if you've overindulged, just walk steps to the gym across the yard or take a quick run around the lake.

Usually like this place husband loves their Steak and Eggs disappointed it's only served on Sundays (( He had Pork chop and Eggs instead very small chop ,used to come with 2 now it's only one but it was dry anyway Didn't care for it all. The only thing good was the coffee. We felt very rushed to get out so they could set more people mind you nobody was waiting as yet we got in and out early.
Food is always great, always a wait and yes, sometimes is loud. But, if you want great food, you have to endure small inconveniences

It's so great that I don't have to go to the downtown location while here on business. Been coming to Matt's for years. This newish Tempe location is great. Large. Bright and neat ASU. Staff was super friendly too. I'm pretty simple when it comes to breakfast so I opted for the two egg breakfast with their incredible bacon. What's even more enjoyable is their thick sliced sourdough toast. The hash browns are also delicious. But let me get back to the bacon. Thick cut. Peppered. Perfectly cooked crisp with an outstanding smoky flavor. And while you may be tempted to get Starbucks across the way, their coffee is also flavorful. I'm pretty sure I'm gonna need a nap after this in this hot weather but it's worth it. Vince was a great guy too. Breakfast is also served all day. Parking in the Marina Center. Free wifi. Just happy that there wasn't a wait!

ABSOLUTE WORST SERVICE EVER. Here is the story of our attempt to dine at this restaurant:  We come around 9:40 am and we put our name on the waiting list. There is a large amount of people waiting outside and I ask the man at the front counter if he knew how long the wait is. His reply: "Yup." Silence. I looked at him puzzled and he said "All your question stated was if I knew the wait time." I figured this was his idea of humor and let it slide. I then said "How long approximately is the wait?" His reply: "We don't give wait times, but if I had to guess, maybe 30 minutes?"   So the boyfriend, a bit bewildered, put our name down and decide to get coffee around the corner at Song Bird Cafe (awesome place, good coffee and FRIENDLY staff, something Matt's Big Breakfast could learn a thing or two from.) We wait about 30 minutes and decide to call the restaurant to make sure they have not called our name. The same man we had originally spoken to answered and when we explained we had gotten coffee around the corner and were just wondering if our names had been called he said, "I don't know, I gotta go." And then he hung up.   So by this time we are very annoyed and walk over. I walk inside and go up to the same man and AGAIN ask if our name has been called and he looks at me and says: "I don't know, I don't have the list." I get upset and tell him he has been rude to us and the restaurant is very unorganized and I didn't appreciate being hung up on minutes earlier. His response? Not an "I'm sorry" not a "what can I do?" No, his response: "umm, it didn't happen like that I never hung up on you!" The man had the nerve to argue with a customer! The whole time we were very polite and not demanding. Needless to say, we took our business elsewhere and went to Postino's and had a lovely brunch.  I have A LOT of family and friends in the area (whom I was visiting) and I have told them all NEVER to come to this place. This place has the attitude that they are too good to even have customer service or even be decent and polite to people. They don't deserve my business and they don't deserve anyone's business until they can change their awful ways. I lived in San Francisco for 7 years and now live in San Diego with amazing food and restaurants; I am sure Matt's Big Breakfast doesn't hold a candle to anything in SF or SD and no restaurant in the former category has ever treated me the way the man did at Matt's Big Breakfast. Save your money and go elsewhere!

My hubby and I went to this spot a while ago and I have been meaning to post.  The food was delicious and very fresh, the service was great as well.  It's your usual few suspects in the menu but all in all, very fresh and good taste.

We were invited to eat here at the request of one of my relatives visiting the Phoenix area.  I have seen the establishment on TV and have heard of it's reputation from the media, but, even living in the area for many years, I never found the necessity to travel  downtown  to try the food.  We arrived at about 10 AM on a cool December morning and upon arriving we we noted that the area outside the restaurant was surrounded by potential patrons.  After putting our name on the list for a table we patiently waited fr 40 minutes for a table. With a wait like this I expected something over the top in a breakfast meal.  When we obtained our table it was in a small room with 2 refrigerators a prep table and cleaning sink.  Not much for ambiance, but, I needed to see the food and the presentation.  I ordered the waffle special and others ordered egg meals. I was somewhat amazed at the small serving size of the waffle which was about 6 inches in diameter.  The side was 2 slices of bacon.  The egg dishes were nothing out of the ordinary and were similar to what I cook up in my kitchen. Prices were average for a breakfast establishment.  Serves was a shining star for the establishment.  Our staff was great once we got into the restaurant.   Bottom line...This is a tourist destination made popular by a media celebrity.  As a local, I would not make the trip again to this place. in their defense, they have other locations in the area and I have not visited those to determine if the quality of food was any different.    If in the area and you want to make  the trek to downtown Phoenix and say you've been there, enjoy.

Had a great experience at Matt's breakfast we parked right up front and our parking meter had enough time on it we didn't have to pay any! Then we walk in and got seated immediately it was really cute inside, comfy cozy and friendly! The waitress we had was great and very quick and attentive! We ordered and our food came out so fast and it was all perfect and tasted amazing we definitely recommend giving them a try for a breakfast or brunch!!
Great food, large portions. The lemonade is very good (star berry, as well as blueberry).
Some of the staff at this location is lame as f... the food is trash. I'd recommend the downtown location if you're looking to get your money's worth.

I don't mind lay overs or delays because i know I've got a great crispy waffle and Honey Lemonade waiting for me here!  The bacon is too thick for my liking, but they will sub with 3 links of yummy sausage.
How did anyone give this place a score lower than a 5?? You must hate breakfast. The quality of the food is equal to any in the US.

Well going against the grain for sure but, this is one really over-rated joint. Not even worth the wait. I came here like at least 8 others that were waiting out front because we saw Matt's on Diners, Drive-ins and Dives on TV so it was one of those "Hey that my town, We gotta go!" I ordered one of the plates I saw on the show, the Chop and Chick, a large succulent boneless pork chop, 3 perfectly cooked eggs, nice crispy brown hash browns, thick hand sliced toast,  Whats not to like right,? Well waiting on the sidewalk out front at Matt's for 1.5hrs to finally get into Breakfast Nirvana, order up and here you go  1 thin 25% bone pork chop over cooked and dry.
