Ever compare a Big Mac in an ad to the one you get in a box and you'll see my point here. 3 eggs still slimy and runny, medium eggs means medium 1 huge helping of hash browns that I could have cooked the next 6 orders of eggs with the grease they wallowed in. Sourdough Toast, 4 stars perfect, excellent. So not all bad, just way over rated, and the following day a really great breakfast at a real local spot Big Daddy's up on Cave Creek Rd and Peoria, excellent in every way and we had never been there for breakfast before but we will be back, Matt's not a chance.

Thoroughly impressed! I've never had an actual "real meal" in an airport before. I meant to take a picture of my plate, but I was halfway done with it when I thought about it. This is good, honest food. I just got off a plane from a super early flight and was pretty hungry. I ordered 2 eggs over-easy (which were expertly cooked), rosemary home fries, thick-cut bacon, and really thick rye toast with fresh squeezed OJ. The toast was too thick for my liking because i like to use it to sop up the yolk, but it was accompanied by raspb preserves. left full and walking a little slower. They make everything to order, so don't stop if you're about to jump on a plane, but it's worth the stop if you have the time. The OJ was $5 which seemed pricey to me for what it was. The meal was about $15, but you certainly pay for convenience when in an airport and I didn't have a problem with the price when considering the meal.

Probably my favorite breakfast joint in Phoenix. I love the food so much and the service is great. Also, their coffee is delicious and they are constantly refilling you. Praise. If you want to be seated early, make sure you go early in the AM. Especially on Sunday's, they're normally packed so be there by 8am. Best kn the menu, to me, is the Five Spot, however their pancakes and waffles are KILLER!! Extremely fluffy and made from scratch. You seriously can't go wrong with anything on their menu. Everything is delicious.

The menu is limited but the food was good. There were only a couple of healthy options so I chose the oatmeal with a side of bacon. Both were good. The person I was meeting said the pancakes were great, so good he ordered an extra cake. Service was good as well.  I'd be willing to try it again for lunch or when I didn't want to eat healthy.

Daniel was our counter waiter. Jason is the general manager. WOW! Great service, Food, and FUN! The picture says it all. We ate everything. Then we rolled to the car.  We had two eggs over easy cooked perfectly with hash browns thick yummy bacon (three pieces) and wheat toast. With a single pancake for the home made hot maple syrup. Oh my! Coffee was smooth and bold.  Great place.

Cool Spot. I arrived in Arizona that morning and my dad said we had to try this Triple D (the food network) rated spot.   Good thing we went when we did we waited about 10 minutes, but when we left the wait seemed to be 30+!  Anyway, the service was very good, my dad started asking the waitress questions and this is usually when I get a little embarrassed, however she knew her shit and my dad liked her responses.  Home made juice was great, coffee was good hot and strong.  The food here is VERY BASIC, but they use the best possible ingredients.  The bread for example that came with my omelet was artisan shit, so good with nuts and seeds....mmmmmmm and the jam although may not have been homemade it was the expensive stuff :)  I will definitly be back if I am ever in the hood!

Got off the airplane, did a quick Yelp search for breakfast and found Matt's. What a great find- this place is legit! The food is high quality and tasty. I had the Classic Eggs Benedict special- my favorite breakfast dish, and it was perfection. My companions had the breakfast sandwich and the Skinny. They enjoyed theirs just as much as me. I can't understand how this place could be rated less than 5 stars. Don't be a hater because you have to wait 25 minutes for a seat- it is worth it! I will also say it is clean and has good service.

I'm not a huge fan of breakfast food.  But I got breakfast here just for you~~  :P  So I can see why a lot of reviewers said to go for the home fries.  The hash browns looked fine, perfectly golden on the top, exactly the way I prefer it.  However, I'm pretty sure there weren't the additional flavorings like the rosemary and onions in that~!  The home fries had great flavor AND they cooked crispy on at least one of the sides of each piece.  Absolutely one of the best breakfast potatoes I've ever had.  I got the special of the day which was 3 eggs scrambled with ham off the bone, anaheim chili peppers, and cheese with a side of tortilla.  It was delicious.  Good char on the tortilla too.  It was very slightly underdone, but I actually prefer that over the risk of overdone eggs.  I guess the one thing that detracted from the place was the limited menu.  They don't really serve any alcoholic beverages (which is actually a bit refreshing), and some common breakfast items are not on the menu (ie biscuits and gravy, french toast).  But hey, if I can pick anything off their menu and it will be equally delicious, I would always come back!

We had a great time yesterday on a rainy (yes rainy) Sunday morning.  We arrived around ten-thirty and the place was packed. There must have been two dozen ahead of us waiting in line.  So, after a few minutes we decide to sit at the counter, since it was mostly empty.  Our waitress was Briann, who set us up with some coffee almost as we sat down.  Great start!  We ordered the waffles with thick-cut pepper bacon with a couple of spicy sausage patties and some eggs, hashbrowns and bacon.  Everything was very good and as we came to the end of our meal, we noticed the Hostess and told her to take our name off the list for a table.  LOL!  Turns out the list was for the counter as well. D'oh!  Then why were all the seats empty?  Anyway, the rains let up and we were off to the Phoenix Art Museum.  Great way to start a Sunday morning. Our total was a fair $26.50 including taxes, but before gratuities.  Enjoy!

I have been to the Matt's Big Breakfast at the airport once before but this place has really stepped up their game! The management was on point, making sure we were happy and got our food promptly. I had a custom-made omelet and was not disappointed. Everything from the peppers, eggs, bacon and coffee grounds are all locally sourced and as fresh as it gets. The icing on the cake for me was the bacon, one of the thickest cuts I've ever received at a restaurant and the flavor was out of this world. Highly recommend trying this place out, no doubt you'll be a returning customer!

The chicken sandwich was pretty tasty and a pretty good size for 10 bucks. DON'T get the $3+ coleslaw instead of kettle chips unless you just want thick sliced cabbage drenched in creamy dressing. Should've gotten fries instead!
Scrambled eggs & Salami. Very good, The hash browns & jam were superb
My omelet was average and my girlfriend's eggs were way too oily. The room is cramped and very loud. Not worth the long wait time.

If you want anything more than the most basic breakfast don't come here. No whip cream for a waffle. Nothing fancier than butter. Might as well stay home and make you're own breakfast. Waste of money.
I remember the bacon, and the potatoes the most, we had to wait to get a table but it was very good.

New location is cleaner and has more seating.  But of course still a wait no matter when you try and go.  Waited 40 minutes for table for 2.  People always polite and food of course is fresh and worth the wait.  I'll be back and stand outside for a good breakfast,  if people wait weeks for a new phone or concert tickets,  there will always be people willing to wait up to an hour or so for a fresh good meal.  Prices are right average $5-$15.  Where $5 is a bowl of cereal and $15 is steak and eggs.  Note they do not serve alcohol and while the rear parking is free,  it is limited.  Also phoenix meter parking now charges on weekends.  There is an older grey haired lady riding around with a bad attitude and always unforgiving...

First time here. I ordered the steel oats.  Nothing great about it. Small oats that immediately tuned watery.  Had like 3 waitresses take our order. After, no one else came back to check on us. On the other hand, my mom liked her Friday special. She was full. I ate the rest of her plate.  Kinda disappointed in my first visit.  I heard great things about this place.  I saw that Monday special was Juevos Rancheros.  I will have to try that. Also will have to try the freshly squeezed lemonade.  My mom mentioned that she enjoyed the jam and toast.

4 stars for food, 3 stars for service.  Food was traditional breakfast fare, good sized portions and homemade strawberry preserves on thick cut wheat toast was delicious! Took a few minutes to get served our beverage, I ordered half caf coffee, but when refilled wasn't asked what it was, just auto refilled with full strength.  While busy, a moment to check in with the customer would have been appreciated.

So after many years if wanting to Dine at Matt's Big Breakfast today was the day.  I have read the rave reviews and was excited but that did not last long.  The first disappointment was they moved up the street and gone is the diner feel I so wanted.  The wait was long, about 45 minutes on a Thursday late morning but we were finally seated and the immediate feel was less diner and more industrial.  The server was quick to the table with water and a quick rundown of the daily special.  My partner and I looked over the very brief and very over priced menu and we decided on the breakfast special and a lunch sandwich, it was 11:15 so we thought we would try some lunch.  Ugh....after waiting over 30 minutes we got up to leave, I was hungry and the staff had now deserted us so we were going to leave.   At this time a woman, I can only assume she was the manager came up and said the food was coming.  We declined.  She said she could box the food to go, we declined.  She then said the wait was our fault, you see we ordered lunch.  So sad, I won't be back i will stay a loyal customer of Joes Diner were the food is appropriately priced, the service is great and the staff does not blame the guest for ordering lunch.
Great hangover cure, hipster type of feel with unfinished floors. Food is good

I went in last week for the first time. I must say, the food at this location is hearty and the wait is short. I ordered an omelet and home fries and they were both delicious. If you're craving an All-American breakfast, you cannot go wrong here. The bacon strips are thick yet crispy so I recommend getting them if they aren't already included in your order. Though the prices are a bit more than affordable, it's well worth it and I plan to return here often.

Finally made it to Matt's Big Breakfast.  I was prepared to wait a bit so didn't really mind that part, but they do need more seats in the shade.    The menu at Matt's is somewhat limited.  While I like to keep things simple and can easily get overwhelmed by those menus with zillions of options, I was annoyed by the 'no substitutions' policy.  There was a daily special posted on the board that had jalapenos and sausage.  I don't eat sausage, so I asked if I could get a vegetable instead.  The answer was no.  Okay fine.  Could they add jalapeno to one of the dishes that didn't come with sausage?  No.  Ugh.  I ended up ordering the cheese omelet and paying $1 each for onion and red peppers.    I couldn't get enough of the hash browns, although unfortunately they were probably loaded with butter.  Good thing I went to kickboxing that day.  Overall this is a cute little restaurant with great food.  Just be prepared to wait and plan on your food being made Matt's way, not your way.

Well here we are starving after the morning shopping at the VNSA book sale at the fair grounds.  This my first time here, my husband has has lunch here and said the food is good.  So we put our names on the waiting list and waited about 15 minutes.  When we were finally called to be seated the host stood at the door and pointed across the room to show us our table.   First of all this place is small, very crowed and the noise level is very loud. Not the kind of place to come to if you have a headache. Our waitress came to get our drink order which was good, but not great my bottom was not even on the chair yet. Not good because I wasn't sure if I wanted breakfast or lunch.  The food was good, but I was sitting staring at the bathroom which is the table I hate to sit at.  Not sure I would go back considering there are so many other places in the valley with better atomisphere, better food and they have enough tables that you're not staring at the bathroom.

Worth the wait! The food is big and yummy in this tiny little restaurant! The owner was there and was very nice!! The waffle was great and the bacon was awesome!! I will come back the next time I'm in phoenix!

I heard this place was on one of the Food Network shows and I was expecting a busy place that doesn't live up to the hype - not the case at all.  I got there shortly after they opened, I think it was around 6:30 in the morning, walked over from the Sheraton, sat at the counter, friendly service, delicious breakfast.  Locally sourced good quality ingredients make simple foods very good.  I had the special, some sort of egg scramble with local sausage and jalapenos - yum!!

Solid breakfast!  I've been here four times while waiting for my connecting flights and have always ordered the Matt's Biggest Breakfast - 2 sausage patties, 2 strips of thick-cut bacon, eggs, potatoes and a pancake.  Wow, this meal is solid!  Everything is flavorful and fresh!  They have real maple syrup and ketchup without high fructose corn syrup - another plus!  My husband has ventured to try other menu items and they never disappoint.  The service has always been great and fast, which is needed, especially in an airport.  I highly recommend a stop here if you happen to find yourself at the Phoenix airport - Gate B!

When I first started going to Matt's, 7 years ago, this place was amazing and well worth the wait! Unfortunately, the food is nowhere near as good as it used to be. They overcharge on everything and the service is not great either. It's really disappointing.

This place was on the DD&D places my family wanted to go while in town, I joined them since I'd heard plenty about it but never gone.  The place is small, so yes there is going to be a wait.  You chose to eat there knowing this so complaining about the wait is pretty ridiculous.  That said, I'm not sure if I'd attempt coming here on a weekend, but during the workweek it was fine, the wait was maybe 20-30 minutes.  The food was great, the coffee was strong.  My only complaint is with more than one person checking on our table we asked for water from them 2-3 times and I don't think they ever came back with it.  Wasn't that big of a deal but seemed like it wasn't that hard since they were checking on us about every 2 minutes (got the feeling of being rushed through our meal, but maybe that is their way of keeping the flow of folks coming in and out).
It's ok, the breakfast is solid but I would like a little more variety especially for a place that people really love.

I so wanted to sooo looovvveee this place and while it was good I wasn't oh so impressed.....we waited awhile, it was Saturday morning, once we finally sat down we were greeted quickly but after that it went down hill....my boyfriend got his food 10 min ,before I did...the people next to us who sat down 15 min after us got their food before me...the waffle was ok...nothing special. I will try it again and hope for the best...

Definitely one of my favorite/ go-to breakfast spots! Great service, everything on the menu tastes amazing, and I love the location/aesthetic of the restaurant! And, on top of all that, it's super affordable. A lot of breakfast places in Tempe are overpriced, in my opinion. Anytime someone visits me, this is always the first place I recommend.   I've had the steak and eggs, biscuit and sausage gravy, the hog and chick, and the salami scramble-- all of which tastes amazing. Their sourdough bread is unlike any sourdough I've tried before and it's really good, their hash browns and home fries are also yummy as well. Honestly, you can't go wrong with anything you choose lol. After you've stuffed yourself, you can walk your food baby off around Tempe Town Lake!!

Thanks to our wonderful waiter Michael, My fellow traveling companions and I had a great time. We had awesome food, that was well cooked and the honey lemonade tea was amazing. Thank you for your fun filled service, in the words of Michael "A smile makes all the difference, and it's free." Just what we needed this morning.

The menu is short and simple, but you will find that the food is anything but. Everything is organic and natural, which I'll admit does not mean much to me, but the TASTE is what matters. You have large servings, juicy and grass fed meat, cheesy filling eggs, and Friendly staff!

The breakfast here is pretty good. HUGE portions and solid offerings. The menu doesn't have anything mind-blowing different but everything is very very solid. The wait is a little bit of a turn off though.

One of the better airport food places I've been to.  Thick slices of bacon that you almost need two hands to eat, (exaggeration) and they were delicious.  I also had sausage, 3 eggs, bacon, potatoes and a large pancake for $13.  Liked every bit of my breakfast and can't wait to come back.

Had the breakfast sausage burrito, spicy, meaty, and hit the spot. Service at the bar was a little slow but good server was very friendly.  Coffee was better then the Starbucks 3 gates down  Tv's at the bar, NHRA on a Sunday morning

Great food.Quick service. Laid back vibe. Winning in my book! Whether you are visiting for a day or a longer period of time in Phoenix, this place is a must eat for breakfast. Hash browns are amazing!

Best breakfast in Phoenix? No, if I could rate negative I would. My first time and I will never go back to any location. The time my party and I went wasn't busy the restaurant was not even half way full. Service felt like we were being rushed to order, 3 different people came to our table to wait on us within 5 mins of being sat, silverware was being slammed while sorting in the dinning room I couldn't even hear my conversation at the table, when our food was being ran out the food runner went to the wrong table twice. After five minutes he brought out 2 of 3 plates to our table. Another five minutes go by and the 3rd plate was not out which was a waffle by the way. How is a pork chop and potatoes done before a waffle? As we waited and stared for them to come and even check or let us know that the rest of the food would be out shortly they just looked at us like nothing. We all had high hopes for this place drove from Chandler to downtown Phoenix for a horrible experience.
The waffles are f'n airy and amazing. Generous portions and quick service. Friendly staff at the counter. Definitely recommend it.

Wow such a beautiful done restaurant! The restaurant looks like a old dinner, but a modern  feel. Food is done so well always comes out hot and yummy! Also where this restaurant sit amongst the large buildings and the fountains is just a serial .

I know this isn't going to sit well with a lot of Yelpers, but I was markedly underwhelmed by Matt's.  I had high expectations considering the avid reviews (and the feature on the Food Network), but frankly, I was disappointed.  I was expecting quite the wait to be seated considering the popularity of the place (and the line when I got there), but since I was dining alone, I was seated immediately.  Unfortunately, my seat was at a bar along a window that faced the hot Arizona sun.  I had to wear sunglasses while dining.  I started with a cup of coffee.  It was fresh, but not particularly flavorful.  Anyway, that's not really where I'm hung up on this place.  What do you expect for a buck thirty-five?  No, my issue was with my food.  Here's what I ordered: a Salami Scramble (basically scrambled eggs with salami) and a side of bacon.  The Salami Scramble was served with hash browns and toast.  The biggest disappointment of the meal was easily the Salami Scramble.  Having read good things about the entree, and upon recommendation of my server, I was excited to try the scramble.  Unfortunately, the scramble failed to live up to the hype. While the eggs were cooked perfectly (not too rubbery and not too runny), the overall flavor was off-putting.  The salami tasted okay, but in conjunction with the eggs, and the overpowering use of herbs, the final product was less than delicious.  Even after slathering the whole thing in catsup and hot sauce, the herbal and earthy overtones were overpowering.  I had the same problem with the hash browns: they were entirely overpowered with herbs.  I found myself actively trying to pick out the rosemary permeating the potatoes.  As far as the bacon goes, it was undercooked.  I like my bacon relatively crispy, perhaps more than others, but still, this was very chew.  The toast was fine.  Because of how much positive buzz this place has I may try it again - perhaps I was the victim of a rare poorly prepared meal here.  As it stands now, though, I'm less than enthused.  Lay off the herbs - they're best used sparingly.  They're potatoes, not a salad.

If cost isn't an issue then Matt's big breakfast is a good spot to check out. The Biscuits and gravy were very good except for that mint garnish they put on the potatoes mixed with the gravy and the aftertaste wasn't too good lol. But over all I think it was a fun experience, good food, friendly staff, but save up it's costly.

Yummmmm... Such a great breakfast place.  The epitome of comfort food and all of it homemade.  REAL food, big portions and really nice servers.  This is certainly a place that will definitely have a repeat visit from us!

Food was good.  Greasy but good.  The price of the small glass of fresh sqeezed orange juice was silly expensive but it was tasty.  I had an omelet with sauteed mushrooms and onions and cheddar cheese with wheat toast and preserves as well as home fries.  I would eat here again if there was no wait and I was in the area.

Had not been to Matt's in a while. There was no wait. We went around 11 on a weekday and beat the masses.   Got the pesto marinated pork chop and chick. Riqusimo! Over easy egg and hash browns on side with a splash of tapatio made it perfect. Side of sourdough bread with blackberry jam also was delicious. Service, as always, was top notch!

There were a couple of reviews for Matt's Big Breakfast that didn't make a whole lot of sense to me.  Two people made the comment that "Denny's makes a better breakfast".  That is patently ridiculous.  The only time someone cracks open an egg at Denny's is if you order them sunny side up.  Otherwise, they pour pre-scrambled eggs (as does IHOP) from a bottle.  The other comments I've read are "there's nothing here that can't be made at home."  Completely true, but that could be said of a lot of restaurants.  The whole point is going OUT to eat when you don't want to make food at home.  Frankly, some of the lesser starred reviews would be much different if not for the long waits.  Anyway, I digress...  Like many, I first became aware of MBB after it was featured on Food Network's Diners, Drive-ins and Dives (DDD, Triple D, 3D, etc.)  It looked good, but nothing terribly special.  Certainly not like some of the places I've seen on DDD, which leave me checking travel websites for flights.  But, I thought, "If I'm in Phoenix, I'll give this a try."    So, I'm in Phoenix and craving breakfast.  I make my way down to Matt's and while there are 6-7 people milling about outside, it's not too bad.  After waiting maybe 30 minutes (downright speedy compared to the wait endured by some other reviewers), my name is called and I enter the tiny eatery.  The menu is pretty sparse, but there are some specials so I opted for one of the items on the chalkboard: egg, spinach, mushroom, smoked gouda scramble with hash browns and toast.  While I wait for my meal, I enjoy some of the very tasty coffee.  My plate arrives, and it is a large serving of food, contradicting the reports of skimpy servings.  As a lover of hash browns, I had to try them first.  Crispy and super buttery, just as I recalled when watching DDD.  The scramble was excellent and you could tell how fresh the ingredients are.  I decided to save my toast and housemade jam as my "dessert", so to speak.  I think my only issue was with the hash browns.  They started off so well, but it was a large portion and at the halfway point the richness of the butter started taking its toll.  I soldiered on and finished my plate, but I seriously thought I'd have a heart attack.  Sadly, did not have room for my toast and jam.  If I ever find myself in Phoenix again, I would come back.
Great vibe, HUGE portions. Twilight, my server, was professional and really fun. I had the Cheese Omlet and couldn't finish it was so huge. Recommended.

I went here with a friend after he saw it recommended by Guy Fieri on the food network. It's a true dive; it can only fit about 25 people, your really never going to avoid a long wait and it's nothing special on the inside.  That aside, the food is RIDICULOUS. The butter burger is easily the best burger I've ever had. It's incomparable. I got a side of country fries which were also insanely delicious and tried the waffles which were unmatched in quality. They actually added a slight seasoning to the waffles which give it a nice touch to the sweetness.  Highly recommended!

We came for breakfast and the food was delicious. The meats are very flavorful. Hash browns were awesome. I would have given it 5 stars, but the wait was about 1 hour. Then again, this is a sign of a great place.

went to matt's for the first time for breakfast.  we are huge breakfast fans.  I ordered griddle cakes and another hungry person ordered the salami scramble with fresh tomatoes and sourdough toast.  the jam with the toast was very good; the egg scramble was hot and not over cooked.  my griddle cakes were subpar; have had far better pancakes at snooze, baja cafe...   iced tea was flavored and not informed of that fact when i ordered it so sent it back. nothing to write home about eating here;  we will continue to try different breakfast cafes and won't be returning to matt's.

Grabbed brunch here with some friends after landing at PHX. First stop on our road trip!  It was quite busy for a Friday morning at like 9am (don't people have work?!) but we were seated within 10 minutes. I ended up ordering the cheese omelet and added bacon. This also came with toast on the side, of which I ordered wheat. Yeah ok, this was literally a big breakfast. My plate was FULL with home fries (seasoned with rosemary yum) and my omelette took up more than half the plate. The pieces of toast were massive, yet the perfect level of toasted. Not crispy, nor soft. Perfection. Everything was delicious. I left feeling satisfied and full. Also, our server was super friendly, and was on top of refilling our coffees, as we were all suffering from sleep deprivation.

We found this place while waiting for our luggage to arrive at PHX. Everyone enjoyed their breakfast choice. The griddle cakes were light and fluffy. The Five Spot is a breakfast sandwich on a deliciously soft roll with eggs, cheese, bacon and onion. It was really good. I had the Huevos Rancheros Verde, it had a slight spicy kick to it. I thought it was pretty good. I'd definitely recommend this place and I'll be back.

Great location, cute atmosphere. Staff was super friendly. The food we had was so delicious. I had the Hog & Chick with ham. The ham was super flavorful and my eggs were cooked exactly as I requested. My daughter had the cheese omelette and it was very good. Both plates were good sized portions.

Big Brekfast. Lots of food. Don't be surprised if you can't finish it. A simple 2 eggs, bacon and house potatoes with toast is more than filling.  Loved the fresh squeezed orange juice.  Great service.  Would recommend.

Thanks to Guy Fieri of FoodNetwork fame, this place was at the top of my list for a weekend getaway to Phoenix/Scottsdale! My friend and I drove directly from the airport to Matt's, which turned out to be in a rather desolate location but easy enough to find. Our timing was just right because we arrived a little before noon and were seated within minutes.  Since I'd been up since dawn and not had a proper meal, I went all out and ordered the Hog and the Chick (choice of pork product with eggs), plus a side of the pancakes! It was all fantastic--just wish I could have finished it. The bacon was tasty and the griddlecakes were amazing! They had this wonderful texture, substantial but still light, tasted of corn, and stood up to the syrup. I hate when pancakes go all soggy with syrup, but these didn't. They just stayed delicious to the last bite. Yum!  Will definitely go back if I'm ever in Phoenix again.

Breakfast was awesome. Fresh, fast, and tasty. And coming from San Francisco - this meal was a steal.   We came for breakfast on Tuesday and was seated without a wait and food arrived quickly. We ordered the special scramble - grilled pork tenderloin scramble - and the waffle with bacon. The scramble was huge and the hash browns that came with it were so delicious, as everyone else has described. The waffle was light and heavenly! The bacon was seriously thick-cut and a perfect complement.   The staff was super friendly and attentive.  This was definitely a highlight of our trip.

My flight was in another terminal, but I came to the airport early so I could go to Matt's. My last experience was good. This experience was not so good. The sonrisa burrito is nothing to smile about. The garnish on the Bloody Mary was stale.

Was excited to see them join the plaza. Tried the breakfast a few weeks ago, had The Five Spot. Grilled onions on breakfast sandwich is new for me. It's ok, if I had to order it again would definitely so no to it. Today I ordered the Tossed Cobb salad. It was missing the romaine lettuce. I ordered ToGo & when I opened the container I was disappointment. If they ran out, I should have been told& could have ordered something else. I'm hoping it was a fluke & won't happen the next time.

Matt and Ernie are some of the most genuine people I've ever met. Both very hard workers and the food at their restaurant is amazing!!! I love how they give quality ingredients but the food is still very affordable.
Great breakfast spot for dine in and take out.  Try the daily special.  The Tempe location is a gem.

A great breakfast place in Phoenix.  I had the chop and chick (pork chop and Eggs) with home fries.  It was a solid breakfast.  It is a relatively small place, I did not have to wait for a counter seat (eating alone) but there was a wait for a table.  The food is worth the wait.  You can tell it is all homemade and freshly prepared.  The servers and staff are very friendly and attentive.  Even with my back to the dining room, eating at the counter looking out the window, they were refilling my coffee mug before it was empty.

I am going to make this review short and sweet..  Great food! I love the hashbrowns! I am big fan of the food!  The negative end of this place... the wait. Its a great place to take out of town guests or an occasional place to drop into every now and then. I don't think any place is worth waiting 45 minutes in the heat.
One of the best breakfast places in the city.  "Hog and chick" is my favorite dish.
Great new location. Lots of seating! Counter seats are fun, staff is great. Some familiar faces from the other locations. Love that it's closer to my home.
Believe the hype. That's all I can say.   This place is the kama sutra of flavor for your taste buds.

Came here during breakfast rush on a Sunday. The place was packed and I was worried it would be an hour wait. WE WERE SEATED WITHIN 15 MINUTES! Due to the rush I was also expecting that the service would be slow, but the service was excellent. The special was steak and eggs and I was expecting it to be not great. Most other places have dry steak for breakfast. The server (who was vegetarian) said the steak was really good. I took a a chance and got it. IT TURNED OUT AMAZING. It was medium rare to perfection. The potatoes were good too. Absolutely recommend this place!
Decided to stop by and grab breakfast with the boyfriend. It was really good. Fresh ingredients and for as busy as it was, great customer service.

Wow...I can't believe I haven't been here in years...next time will be much, much sooner!  We stopped in at lunch time last week and I ordered the skinny with egg whites, chicken apple sausage and spinach with a side of grilled tomatoes and a blueberry honey lemonade - absolutely perfect and delicious!  Great atmosphere, great service and amazing food!
Small cute place. Get there early or ull be waiting a long time

MATT'S BIG ATTITUDES! Avoid the bar. There are many other bars in terminal 4 for some reason this bar you are dirt under their feet. Hot beer on tap and cold attitudes.  I travel thru phx airport 42 weeks a year. Eaten here many times. Wasn't till tonight when i met Melissa the bar tender i was compelled to write about it. Avoid her. Mean as s snake.

This place had the best service of any airport restaurant I have been to. They were busy and short staffed but everyone who helped us was cheerful and quick. We got our food fast, our drinks faster. It tasted great. Amazing place!!

Maybe my fave breakfast spot in the west!!  Rustic outdoor ascetic gives way to a well ordered and lively dinning experience inside.  The breakfasts are big and tastes and well priced.   I'll be back for sure!
Good food...good service...bad location...long wait. The food gives it the xtra star. Triple D...c'mon man!

After hearing so many positives about Matts Big Breakfast, I decided after retrieving my friend from the airport to go and get my breakfast on! Love at first sight , no!! But never judge a book by it's cover, right? Huh, maybe... Parking is minimal, and in that part of the city.. It can be dicey to find parking . The place is tiny.. Tinier & more cramped with dreadful decor... Much like Over Easy, in fact! There are a handful of basic breakfast selections.. With catchy names though.. I ordered the 'hog & chick' for example.. Only bc I wanted to have poached eggs.. That was     just the easiest way to get them& I passed my 'hog' on to my hungry hog  loving friend... The eggs are free range &  were perfectly poached, score ! Finally some chef in the desert got my poach correct... I'm very picky on the poach... Not like it's a hard process, I know as I have the calphelon pan for poaching in my own loft! I loved my home fries.. Big nice wedges of potatoes.. Sidenote -- too many Rosemary stems.. For me and my built in retainer , it could become a toothy disaster ! And whoa with the onions... Yikes ! Great for flavor, but not unless your planning on being amongst the masses following breakfast! There were a ton of big slivers of white onion.. But once your past picking all the flavor adding things out,you have great home fries..my friend has the hashbrowns, she said they reminded her of OreIda with alot of grease...I've never been a fan of shredded potatoes seemingly devised to soak up oil from the pan , so I wouldn't test them... Loved the bread... Wow! Homemade jams too.. Yum! There was no fruit on the plate.. It's presented in a basic diner way.. I personally like some fruit when I go down the breakfast path.. Relatively inexpensive.. Coffee , nothing special & no options for espresso ... Thot I was going to have a small panic attack over that alone... One other disappointment... Restroom?? No.. It's next door in a divey looking motel with wooden shutters ... I'll wait & use the Starbucks restroom as I drive home disappointed and needing espresso fast.. I'm thinking I'm seriously picky with my breakfast/brunch & just unable to find a 4star option here.. Oh well, I fly for free... I'm goin back to Cali..

Food was not great. Frustrated with the giant pancakes and the minuscule amount of syrup. Asked for more and they charge $1.50 for another thimble if syrup. I remember eating at the old location and enjoying it. Not any more.  I will not come back here again.

Excellent food as always. Came here for breakfast by myself to relax and read a book. Service was good. Had the special which was the eggs and biscuits with gravy.  Large portion, very savory and tasty! However because there was no wifi and I couldn't get the hotspot to work on my mobile phone so I couldn't download the book I wanted to read on my iPad. Server recommended going across the plaza to the coffee shop if I needed wifi.

Absolutely the best place to stop by for food when in the PHX airport - perhaps the only place to get a decent meal! I ordered a salad to go. The woman behind the counter was super kind to me in talking to me about the different food options they have, as well as getting me a menu to order something directly from the kitchen. I ordered Tossed Cobb and waited a few minutes for it to get prepared. I realized two minutes later that the salad was already available in the refrigerated section, but the woman insisted that I order a freshly-made salad. And it was delectable! Warm chicken on top of crisp vegetables, and enormous - this is the kind of salad I want for $10. Next time, I'll try the true breakfast items that this place is known for.

Don't even bother if pressed for time...after waiting 25 mins for my "to-go" order of one sandwich that never appeared I had to sprint to catch my flight..  before ordering at to go counter told hostess flight left in 30 minutes, response food takes 15 minutes tops.  Told me no problem! Ordered a breakfast sandwich and waited, waited, waited... looked like staff moved in slow motion.. asked hostess to check on the food bc i needed to board.  she strolled off to back of kitchen and stood chatting up staff.  I waited for a few minutes and the ran to catch he flight sans food. Really shouldn't have a Togo counter..  Actually the airport should just get rid of Matt's and replace it with Over Easy - a phx based restaurant that undoubtedly could do a much better job...
Food and service were excellent. It doesn't look like much from the outside but you won't be sorry if you give this place a chance.

Put my name on the list and was told it's a 30 minute wait. Ok, it's a pretty good waffle so I'll wait. After 45 minutes I start to see other people asking where they are on the list as apparently their time had expired as well. I ask how much longer and was told there's 11 people ahead of me??  How can there be 11 people ahead of me after 45 minutes into a 30 minute wait?  I know wait times are approximate, but 30 minutes vs 1 hour and 15 minutes isn't a mistake, it's a lack of knowledge or ability of their staff. For that reason alone, I'll never go back and will be sure to warn anyone who ever mentions this place.

Made the mistake of trying this location after swearing off the original due to the wait times and poor staff. Apparently this location is no better. The wait wasn't bad but the hostess never mentioned the waffle iron is broken today. Only after being seated did I learn the only item I would get from here isn't available today. What a waste of time.
The food is very good, reliably good. Unfortunately, if you have dairy/gluten issues its a tough place to go. I miss the french toast :(

I couldn't be happier that Matt's Big Breakfast moved into my hood :) I'd been to the downtown location before (and absolutely loved it!), but recently tried out the new one in Biltmore. It's exactly what you'd expect: cute decor, friendly servers, fast service.  First time? Try the griddle cakes! These are not your mama's pancakes. They are sort of like the love child of a pancake and cornbread. And they're delicious!!!
Always delicious, have to stop every time I'm in Phoenix. There is always a pretty good wait, but it's worth it. Home made jam, thick cut bacon, what more could you ask for.

Been here several times now and it is soooo good. The wait can be obnoxious, but once you start eating, you know why. Its a got a nice menu that covers a variety of flavors and the service is pretty fast. The money is in the food though. Ridiculous waffles at this place. The bacon is amazing as well. I'll def keep coming back.

We didn't even get to eat here. The guy that took our name never wrote our name down so they took like 4 parties before us. When we went to ask about when it was our turn. He said we never checked in. The same guy who took our name. Now # this would normally not been a big deal. Shit happens, no one is perfect and they're super busy. But the reason they get one star was his attitude about it. He could of been like  " I'm so sorry, let me find a table right away" but instead he chose to argue. Customer service is very important for an experience at a restaurant. This guy pushed us to leave. I dont see us trying this place anytime soon

10 minute wait for a table. There were 2 of us. They wouldn't separate the 4 top for us and the couple right behind us. Wait, a table for 4 finally arrived. No wait, their table was ready.  No waffles ( or any sweet & savory) and no mushrooms. Antone, who originally took our name, was a pleasure. The gal he was working with (no name tag) actually was yawning while talking to us. Might be a little thing but not a good first impression. We waited 24 minutes for our food and I had to send my pancakes back because they were burned on the bottom. My husband's breakfast burrito was mediocre at best (his words) It was a Sunday morning at 9am.

It's ridiculous that this place has such a low rating. It easily serves up the best breakfast in the valley. It's not fancy or complex, but it's quality ingredients are of the highest caliber, making their dining experience tough to beat.  They get extremely busy, so that can be a drawback, and their service staff is a little slow or maybe unobservant but that's never stopped the food from being out of this world.

WOW! I just needed some breakfast and got a lot more than I came for! The thick cut bacon was amazing, the eggs were cooked exactly to order, and the bread came along with some really good jam. This place only uses the best ingredients. I'll be going to this place anytime I'm at at the Phoenix airport - even if it's not time for breakfast!

After my ARR 5k @ South Mountain I drove home on Central.....decided to stop and try this place. Walked right in and was able to sit at the bar. I ordered OJ and the basic 2 eggs, toast, delicious thick bacon and the best home fries.....they are awesome rosemary white potatoes with onions. The only draw back is the place is small so it's a little noisy.....but very popular!

Don't miss out on this Phoenix gem. This place is legit! There may be a line, but don't worry, all things that are great in life are worth waiting for! I love that they have Iowa pork on the menu. It is so amazing!

Everyone is so friendly and helpful. Not one employee walked past our table without asking if we needed something or refilling our drinks. I had the waffle and it was the most buttery, light, delicious waffle I've ever had! Totally melted in my mouth! The wait is totally worth it. I will definitely be back!!
The best pancakes I've ever had!! Definitely a place to visit for good brunch with the whole family

Stopped in on the way to the airport and had a most amazing breakfast ever.  Super fresh food, funky cute place, reasonable prices.  I ordered pancakes with patty sausage.  The pancakes were really hot, which melted the REAL butter perfectly and was served with hot 100% maple syrup.  So good.  The sausage patties were generous (probably 8oz total), uniquely spiced and delicious.  Coffee was great and refilled regularly, which means service was excellent.  My brother in law had the special - a spicy Mexican egg combination with lots of jalapeos, spicy chorizo and cheese. He only had good things to say.  My sister had bacon and eggs, over easy - eggs cooked perfectly.  The bacon was really peppery and thick - yummy if you like peppery bacon.  At any rate, we had a great, big, breakfast - really recommend this cheerful, tasty little establishment!

Stopped here because Yelp had high rating and reviews were positive. Walked in and the place was busy, but got a table right away. Menu was very simple, not a whole lot of variety, because of that my wife and I were deciding if we should eat here or not? We decided to stay, ordered the food on the menu, WOW! We we're so glad we stayed. Food was delish, coffee was just right. We will be back. Thank you for teaching us simplicity.
So good. Soooooooo good. Waffles were on point. Plus they had coffee. Too bad there wasn't any alcohol for the shitty date I was on
The food is amazing! I have tried several items from the menu and loved them all! Daniel is always friendly and makes you feel welcomed! I give Matt's Big Breakfast 2 thumbs up!!!

My dad and I wanted to try a new breakfast place and really enjoyed this one. We got to pick our seat immediately on a Sunday afternoon. The service was good+fast, and the food was yummy too. The only thing we didnt like was how they charged $1.50 for an extra little pitcher of syrup, whereas in most breakfast places we've tried the syrup is free. But overall it was great!
The sourdough and jam is amazing and you don't even need to order it wow I love it. This place is also incredibly affordable. $6 dollar for a great breakfast.

There will be a line ... you will wait - probably for an hour ... and you'll be happy you did. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The burger was one of the best I have ever had.   Don't let the appearance of the building scare you off. Make it happen. This place lives up to the hype.

Saw it on TV and had to check it out while in town. Had the waffle with bacon, all great. Wife had the salami scramble with sourdough toast. Some of the best toast I have ever had. Everything I saw looked great and the owners were both there, always a good sign. There was a wait and parking can be hard, but if you want a good breakfast in Phoenix this is the spot. Next time I am in Phoenix I will be going back.
I didn't have anything wrong with my meal and service was perfect. However, the breakfast is just average. I went because people said so many great things, kind of a let down.

I remember stumbling into Matt's Big Breakfast years ago when I first arrived by car in Phoenix with my crash mate .. we were hungry and downtown. I was a new Arizonian and Matt's looked like a regular Mom & Pop type of place. Once we found parking, ( this was before downtown really 'arrived' and it was still relatively easy), we ventured to Matt's and surprisingly found this long line! That kind of thing always intrigues me, so we waited awhile and thus, my first Matt's experience was born. I remember it being very good, basic, but good. Low and behold when I was in my old neighborhood recently getting my hair blow dried up, over and out , I met up with that same bestie crash mate and we re-visited Matt's. Only HERE, in Camelback. Yes. The long line does still exist, even at this location. No matter what time of day, as I have been to said blow dry bar often, and I always see a line at Matt's! Take note: that means it's good! Basic breakfast foods await you at Matt's. The Hog and Chick is my personal favorite. It's simple and it's good : Two eggs any way, ( I go for poached); home fried potatoes ; a thick slab of bacon; toast of any liking and their homemade jam! Matt's uses high quality, local & organic , when possible on most of their items. Since I am not a fan of what GMO's have done to us Americans... I look for that anywhere and any chance I can get it , is a plus. The coffee is ever flowing as is the H2O for us parched desert people. The juice is fresh squeezed. What more can I say? Matt's is simple , basic and takes it to the level of greatness without really having to try. NOW, as someone who loves to linger over a Bloody Mary or Mimosa at a weekend brekky? I would LOVE to see Matt's bring those two things to their city restaurants. They haven't. The Bacon Bloody Mary does exist at the PHX Sky Harbor location...& it's amazeballs. Maybe in the future! Matt's has done something right... simple is good.. being basic is awesome.
Worst service EVER!! The cashier Stephanie at the to-go spot was terrible and super rude! I get you are busy but rolling your eyes at someone is completely uncalled for!

We wound up eating at this particular location due to the fact that their other location in downtown phoenix had a longer wait time.  It's not a particular expansive establishment, but they managed to make do with what they had. They definitely had an overwhelming amount of patrons. Every table was taken, and there was a prolonged wait.  They have wonderful service, and their food; although not spectacular, was quite tasty. The food selection isn't vast, but what they do offer, they execute quite well.  I had the hog and chick, and my wife had the waffles. She was more enthused about her selection, than I was about mine.   Overall, it was quite a satisfying brunch, supplemented by wonderfully brisk and attentive service.

Despite the waffle tasting very very good, my family's overall disappointments far outweigh the few positives and (I/we) will likely not be returning. Breakdown of the "experience" is as follows:  Hash browns- terrible, no one ate them; to be fair, we did not try the home fries Bacon- LOADED with pepper; probably great for an Bloody Mary Coffee- not a lot of options for sweeteners and coffee cups are stained inside (all 4 at Table) Sourdough toast was good. They could/would not substitute fruit for the hash browns. Patio looked nice, but no outdoor heaters and the temperature was in 46 degrees.  Last but not least, Unfortunately the service was sub-par, we were really looking forward to trying this new location which appeared to have all the ingredients to be a new favorite spot...location is PRIME though, I can see parking being a little tricky on a busy morning. Maybe their lunch menu is better...

When we are in Phoenix  for business we tend to eat breakfast here. The food is yummy, the place is small and Matt tends to be around to say hey and help serve up the grub. I like the oatmeal of all things...my husband really likes the scrambles. I love that it's small and homey the food is good and it's not too pricey. Also, I love to give my business to ma and pa places as opposed to, say...IHOP or Denny's. (YUCK)

The single handed worst breakfast experience I've ever had. The only time I've ever waited over 50 minutes for a table before giving up. I came alone on a Saturday at 9am. I asked how long the wait would be for a party of one and the hostess(I guess you could call her that) stated that, "they don't quote times, but that it goes fast." They don't write down the time you arrive so either management doesn't care how long the patrons are waiting for a table or are to dumb to look into it. I find it rude, disrespectful, and disingenuous to patrons to not quote a time on one hand while saying it goes fast on the other. They must have known that patrons were waiting close to an hour for a seat and they are hoping that we would become "pot committed" and hang out for the table.      Maybe they are hoping that you will wait so long that you get so hungry that the food will taste better. I've eaten at Matt's Big Breakfast before and I would give it 4 out of 5 stars on food quality. They aren't spectacular just good. Sadly Phoenix is deeply lacking in good breakfast joints.      So starving after a 50 minute wait I decided to head home and stop at McDonalds (also a one star restaurant, but at least I won't wait 50 minutes to get to place my order). While en route I drove by LO LO'S CHICKEN AND WAFFLES approx. 2 miles from Matt's big (slow) breakfast and noticed that it was fairly empty at 10am. I pulled in to Lo Lo's and was pleasantly surprised to find a hidden gem for breakfast. How about that the worst breakfast experience turns into one of the best. I was immediately sat at a table(there was enough space for 8 person parties. Coffee was promptly brought and it was perfect in every respect of the word. I ordered the breakfast sandwich and I was dumbfounded why I tried to go back to Matt's Big (slow) breakfast with so many other options available.     Two additional points I'd like to make: first, there was a bunch of people waiting for Matt's Big (slow) Breakfast but it wasn't a constant flow of additional people coming it was the same bunch of people waiting for 50+minutes; second, YOU'VE been warned.     If you want to try something different/unique/and worthwhile give LO LO's Chicken and Waffles a shot at breakfast. I don't mind waiting for a table at a desirable restaurant. What I mind is a restaurant that doesn't value it's patrons enough to respect their time and to allow their patrons to make conscious decision if they want to wait or not.

Service was fast.  Food was terrible. Got the Breakfast Burrito - it smelled weird like it was fished out of a garbage can and tasted like something was rotten inside.  I can't believe I ate even one bite of that thing. I seriously thought I was going to hurl.

We heard this was the best breakfast place in the Phoenix area so we had to check it out.  The long wait wasn't fun, but we figured if that many people were willing to wait almost an hour (10:30am on a Saturday, go figure), then it must be good.  It did not disappoint. The waffles were great, but my favorite was the homefries!  It was small and quaint and we had good service with a friendly staff.  Oh yeah, and they serve RC Cola, which made it even a better experience for me.

A great place to eat!   This time I have to say that I've had a bit of bad luck because the last two times I came (within 30 days) my home fries have been burnt/charred. I can appreciate some crunch but there shouldn't be anything black on my plate. :( my scrambled eggs were semi runny/watery. Sausage and sourdough toast were perfect! Lol  Service was good. Sat unacknowledged for a good 10 minutes before my server came, but was good after.

I love a good breakfast place, but Matt's Big Breakfast is the definition of mediocre.  The menu only has a handful of options for breakfast and lunch, which is fine (especially when the dishes are exceptional) but they are incredibly basic. They didn't taste terrible, but they weren't that great either; the flavor was lacking, and the amount of grease was a little too much for my liking.  I can say the coffee was good, as well as the Arnold Palmer I got, but the food itself... not so great.

Absolutely amazing place, I was in town on a Business Trip from Minnesota and am so glad I tried it out.  The Breakfast was out of this world, hospitality was amazing as Vanessa my waitress at the Front Area (Bar Area) was very conversational, super friendly, very quick and attentive.  The food came out super quick and was cooked perfectly.  Get there early in the AM as they get busy later.  I highly recommend this place for regulars and for sure anyone visiting from out of town!

I ordered the breakfast sandwich to go. It was huge and damn good! Bacon was perfectly crispy too. The only reason I gave them 3 stars (vs 4 or 5 stars) is because of the nasty girl at the take out register who made me wait nearly 10 min without even acknowledging that she would get to me. She was too busy walking back and forth between the kitchen and the take out register for no apparent reason. Then she was doing something with the coffee maker or something - again, all the while I was standing there waiting for her to take my order. Talk about lack of customer focus. I can't imagine management would be happy with her behavior and lack of customer focus.

The food was excellent.  They need to get a much bigger place though.  The waiting for a table is toughest part there.  Its just way too long.  You can get a comparable breakfast at the Farmhouse in Gilbert and not have to wait that long there.
Great breakfast food with decent prices. There's usually a wait but it's definitely worth it! Best eggs and sausage in Phoenix!

Okay hear me out: I think Matt's Big Breakfast is overrated.   There's always a long wait to get in, so I assumed that people were waiting so long because it had to be good. So I finally stuck it out and waited, and boy was I underwhelmed.   Once seated, our server took almost 15 minutes to get to our table. When she did finally greet our table, she didn't say anything but hi before walking off again. Didn't ask us what we want to drink or anything.   When we did order, I got the five spot. It was really, really greasy. Additionally, my friend who ordered "extra crispy" hashbrowns got soggy fries instead. It was just upsetting because we had waited close to an hour to get in, and then the service was lackluster and the food was subpar.   I will say that their jam and toast was delicious, and my friend enjoyed her coffee. However, I think there are better places to spend your weekend morning than at Matt's Big Breakfast.

The name is misleading, not a bog portion at all. Plus horrible service each time I've gone. I work in the same complex. I called takeout and the guy asked for 10-15 min. I did some work and went to get my breakfast. The loud mouthed host who took my order did several rounds of coffee to the guests before greeting me. I stood at the counter for a good 5-10 minutes. No apology when he did, only wanted my name and money. I proceeded to wait patiently for another 20 minutes two people behind me ordered and were served. The host/manger then asked me for my name again and checked the takeout shelf. It had been sitting there the whole time. When I got back to my desk the food was cold. Not worth the $13 for the special. This is the last time I go and I haven't been impressed with the place since it opened. Support another breakfast joint and avoid this location.

besides the wait, being i am not a patient person all i can say its worth the wait  .this is my first visit the breakfast was simple but delicous bacon excellent great hash browns and thick baked bread slices and well priced oh and fab staff

For once, the Hub enjoyed his food !  What is with the warehouse turned restaurant decor???? is this the new fad now...  I have to agree with of the other surveyor on this page....I was not wowed.   it started with my coffee. they didn't have half/half. ..I know, I know but to be a breakfast place, milk just don't cut it for me...sorry semi-coffee snob.  BUT...the service was fast! all the servers worked together so when we flagged down a server, they all came running   Did I mention we got our food lickity  split?!?!?!?!?  I got the hog and chic... (not a fan of crisp (almost burnt) peppered  bacon with crispy Hash brown (that was good) and 2 pcs of thick slices of sourdough. ...they automatically gave me grape Jam, which I don't like, so I asked for strawberry instead. That was homemade...not the smuckers kind with the foil top.  The Hub got the Saturday special, chorizo scrambled. ..he loved it.

My experience at this great little breakfast place was very positive for my first visit. I am looking forward to going back again. Service was excellent friendly staff food delicious and many choices and healthy eating.  It was comfortable and relaxing and not noisy. I actually felt like we were on vacation sitting there it was fun.
Really delicious food, but the wait can be really long. Try and get there early or on a weekday, or often they can have single counter seats available

Matt's Big Breakfast is a wonderful place in the morning to feel the life of downtown Phoenix.  I have eaten there 5 times in the last year and each meal was worth the 10 to 20 minute wait out side on the sidewalk.    At 9:30 a.m. on Wednesday, July 3, my wife Marie and I ventured downtown and decided to have breakfast out.  Matt's was on our mind.  We waited outside only 5 minutes before getting a table by the window next to the kitchen entry.  Busy place, but the service was great.  Quick with the coffee for Marie and ice tea for me.  Marie ordered an omelet with cheese and mushrooms, while I decided on the special, eggs benedict.  We both had the home fries.   When everything arrived, the meal was very yummy.  Marie, in her delicate way, snarfed down her omelet with a smile.  My eggs benedict was on a fresh English muffin, topped with ham, poached eggs, and a yummy hollandaise sauce.  Calories be damned!  The whole meal cost $22.53 + 4.00 tip.  Yes the place is small and you'll most likely have a short wait for a table, but get over that, because the experience of eating good food prepared by great people is worth your time.

When I was at Pizzeria Bianco, the second in line peeps mentioned that I try Matt's Big Breakfast. I had also saw the episode on Triple D with Guy Fieri and the dude raved that this was his fave. Now I had already put it on the "must go" list and then asked for recommendations. I was told to expect an hour wait, order the waffles or griddlecakes and the pork rib chop. Good info...  It was ambitious of us to want to wake up early to have Matt's, but we did eventually get there, even with the stoopid Android GPS getting us lost at First Ave and not First St. We had made a few passes around the block and saw the farmer's market diagonally from Matt's. I dropped off Kathy to put our names down, parked in the lot and headed over to the farmer's market. Now, you couldn't plan this any better, but the market is open Sat and Weds, so what better way to kill time, instead of sitting in heat? After about 40 mins, we headed back and got called immediately.  We got in and ordered waffles with a side of the griddlecakes, since Kathy couldn't decide. I went for the pesto crusted pork rib chop with home fries that were Yukon gold potatoes grilled with rosemary and onions and two eggs over easy. The batter used for both the waffles/griddlecakes were light and fluffy and when you factor in the homemade whipped butter and authentic Vermont maple syrup, the combination is Dyno-mite! My pork rib chop was tender and moist and the Yukon gold fries were absolutely perfect. The thick toast with a side of peach marmalade was delicious. I'm stoked they use locally grown produce, as that ensures that the food is always tip top. The super thick bacon that came with the waffles were just perfect balance of salt and savor. Simply bueno!  I'm always in awe of the other reviewers who were expecting some Iron Chef to blow them away with spectacular gourmet food. To do the basic breakfast items and take them to another level should be spectacular in itself. I highly recommend Matt's Big Breakfast for simplistic elegance and for breakfast that truly did deserve Guy Fieri's adulation.  Housekeeping items: Go Saturdays, so you can check out the Farmer's Market with all the free and tasty samples. That should keep you busy as your name floats to top of the wait list. The wait staff wants to turn over tables, so other Yelpers can get in and eat too.   Stay hungry my friends and happy eatings...

Come here for lunch (but not too late because they close at 2pm). Then, get the Butter Burger. Even the memory of this burger makes me giddy with excitement. It's freakin' huge too. A hand formed patty, and fresh & fluffy bun. Wow, this burger will knock your socks off. Amazing quality and flavor. One of the best burgers in the entire Valley.
Do not miss the chance to enjoy this local favorite! I was so excited to learn that Matt's  Big Breakfast opened a spot in the airport. A real treat.

I ordered a Belgian Waffle, side of hash brown and freshly squeezed orange juice.   The Belgian Waffle was amazing! It was soft, fluffy and so sweet!  The hash browns were definitely crispy and large quantity. The freshly squeezed orange juice was actually freshly squeezed. It's B-O-M-B! It's about $4.50 for a tall glass.   Get there early! They're full all day everyday!

If your looking for a good breakfast in a completely casual setting, Matt's is the place. The griddlecakes (aka pancakes) and waffles were a light and melted in your mouth. My dad has the hash browns and he loved the twist on them. What the atmosphere lacks, the staff makes up for. If you want good breakfast food, eat here.
Every other restaraunt in an airport will get you your food before 30 minutes,  it's not even busy, wtf.

The day after I moved to Phoenix I was wandering around downtown alone, and came upon this gem. I may be a bit biased because breakfast food is my favorite food, but I was super impressed with the quality of the food and the culture Matt's propagates. I felt like a super nerd for eating alone amongst groups of families and friends, but the servers made me feel like a priority. In addition to my waiter, I had several other employees fill my coffee cup and water when they passed my table. It's rare to find a restaurant where the servers watch out for each other, and put the customer first, regardless of whose table they're at.

I was so very excited to eat here as I had been trying for a number of years.  The wait was not bad and we were seated within 30 minutes on a Thursday morning.  Everyone was polite and this being a very tiny spot everything was quick. I ordered the waffle and bacon and my mom had the ham and cheese omelet. WOW is all I can say we were both impressed and I really enjoyed the waffle and the thick sliced bacon.  I really really enjoyed the thick sliced bread with the strawberry preserves and the omelet was amazing. Also the chocolate milk was very very good.  If your in phoenix I cant say enough that you should try Matt 's for friendly service and great food. It is worth the wait.

Perhaps the breakfast joint that I most desire to like, but can't.   NEVER get the hash browns. No one likes soggy, undercooked potatoes. Tastes/feels like diced wet cardboard. Home fries are a marginal improvement, only due to the rosemary, in truth.  I've been to Matt's four times. Each time I leave disappointed. Still, I feel the draw to come back and give it another go. It's like that narcissistic girlfriend who gives you a glimpse of hope that things might get better. They don't.  Downtown has better service, btw. This place sucked it up hard last time I took my parents and kids out to breakfast. Incredibly inattentive and sloth-like service, with latecomers getting served and leaving long before our small group of 5. Never again, Matt; I'm breaking up for good.

Matts I LOVE YOU!  Not only are you an integral part of my joy for life but you always provide my wife and I the best breakfast dates.  I love eating the skinny, or hog and chick, they be my faves!  Oh and the coffee! Heck yes! You guys don't serve that bitter burnt disgusting junk they serve elsewhere.... , your coffee is DA BOMB!  The home fries? Forget about it!  So stinking good!  The experience has always been great 99.9% of the time #nooneisperfect.  If you like breakfast food then you should probably hate Dennys haha and love MATTS!  Matt's doesn't have a you pick 3 for $6 menu, because their menu items are thought out and awesome!  Let's go Tempe come check out Matt's!

Matt's you rock! Thank you for providing me tasty food every time!  Just like humans some times your service is chaotic and lackadaisical BUT I still love you because your food and service overall is top notch, compared to other joints.  Keep being you and keep gettin dem checks! (Shout out Jalen and Jacoby)
Amazing food! Bacon to die for. Had to hunt staff down for coffee, but they were sweet and super busy. Can't wait to go back.

To preface this: I actually really enjoy Matt's Big Breakfast - the food tends to be great quality, and service is fine. I just do not like the customer service at THIS Matt's (at the airport).  Tl;dr - poor customer service will cost you (both reputation and cash).  My wife and I gave our name to the host (who was this older, very curt fellow) and moved about 4 feet away from the entrance to make space for others to pass through and/or add themselves to the waiting list. The host told us it would be about 15-20 minutes but hopefully faster.  My wife and I then started having a conversation off to the side while still listening for our name to be called. Meanwhile there was a really outgoing waiter who was very personable serving people just on the other side of the barrier we were standing by.  As we are standing there, I spot about 5 groups get called in, so I figure we are getting close. It's been about 12 minutes at this point. I go to check the list, and there's a lot more names crossed off the list AFTER us. I mean about 15 names scratched off AFTER us. No way we heard him call that many names for people. It honestly just looked like he was arbitrarily crossing people off the list. And indeed our name was crossed off, but I decided to double check with him anyway.  I ask the host if he called our name (I swear he did not), and he said he did but we did not respond. His tone was incredibly rude, too - like he was gloating about it. We were literally 4 feet from his stand. What?  At this point, I realize it might have been possible that we missed our name being called as the outgoing waiter was really loud, but please, if you see us 4 feet away, just call it again to make sure. Better yet - switch the host and the waiter. No way would we have missed his call. The original host was mumbling by comparison, and he looked like he hated being a host.  The best the host offered was to put us back on the list, but at that point, I had no faith in his ability to be courteous or to call our names when our turn was up, so we just left. Your time is better spent at an establishment that will at least try (and not just rest on the laurels of being a known restaurant).

Was expecting a wait since this place is very popular but we got seated right away. It was definitely packed.  We started the morning with their freshly homemade lemonade with honey. Highly recommended! The honey at the bottom makes it complete.  The special for the day was the French toast and sausage.  French toast was surprisingly not soggy but right texture. It was not overly sweet either. Sausage waa grilled to perfection.   Had the scramble eggs with arugula salad. This was a light and refreshing dish to start the day.  Staff was very attentive!
Fresh food. Very tasty. There is a very good reason why there has been a line to get in EVERY time I have gone. SO worth the short wait.

This is a true breakfast/quick lunch spot. If you go in there with 6 people, you dont get it. If youre mad you had to wait 30 minutes for a 2 top, you dont get it. If you dont put your name down, YOU DONT GET IT! But if you can just show up, put your name on a list, and patiently wait till it gets called you will be privied to one of the best b-fast joints in town. Everything from top to bottom just tastes fresh (mostly because their product is almost all locally provided). The Chop an Chick is a great place to start, a hearty pork chop that has been marinating in some sort of love, most of the breakfasts are served with your choice of gold potatoes with rosemary and onions, or hashbrowns, eggs, and toast from Tammy Co. Bakery, they also serve it with fresh preservatives. The special is always good and always different! All in all I drive 25 minutes to this place atleast once a month and I have yet to have any sort of dissapointment once. If you ask, wheres my toast, YOU DONT GET IT!!!!

This is how mornings should always start - and personally this is exactly what most of my Phoenix mornings have offered.   Get up, get going, stop at Matt's. Friendly greetings and superfluous amounts of hot coffee - admittedly in the thin end of the scale, but then again I love my coffee most when it's stronger than me.  The daily menu is big and full of energy, way larger than a serving should be -  in other words, an average american size. Over a couple of days I had pancakes, hash browns, fries, goat cheese, ham, bacon, lot's of chilly and so many eggs that I had to send friendly thoughts to every egg-lovers favorite scientist, Ying Rong of Huazhong University of Science and Technology ("Higher consumption of eggs is not associated with increased risk of coronary heart disease or stroke"). It's a nice touch that they use real butter and cage-free egg production.   I like the place even better than the food. The place is vivacious, all customers seem happy in the loud way. Sunday was crowded and full of groups of families and friends. Going alone I mostly sit in the bar area - which creates opportunities to talk to other people. Had an interesting conversation with a local cop one day and a student the next, and of course morning banter with the staff.   Get up, get going, stop at Matt's.

My favorite breakfast place.  Love the food, love the prices, love the decor.  But...  HATE THE WAIT.  They know me.  My wife and I bring our two small kids here every week or two.  But our AVERAGE wait time, sitting in front on nice modernist benches, is about 25 minutes.    It sucks.  I wish they would get rid of two rows of parking, put up an overhead tent with heaters/misters.  But I think the fact that people have to wait actually increases the love of the place?  Strange, huh.  Food is delicious.  I love the aged cheese omelet.  Go for the home fries, which are delicious and dusted with fresh rosemary, over the overly buttery hash browns.  Almost everything on the menu is perfect.  My kids do a single pancake, perfectly cooked, with great syrup.    Their bread may be the best part.  Fresh, thick cut bread with butter and fresh jam/jelly.  Look, it's a slightly upscale "diner food" that is well worth every $ you spend and every calorie you consume.    I hate to give a good review... what if even MORE people come and my wait is even LONGER... :(

Great food, great service, great prices. It was our first time here, we definitely hope to come back next time we're in town. We stayed downtown so it was only 5 mins to get here. Hotel breakfast is so dull and all the same, refreshing to get something better. I would come back to Matt's.

I personally prefer to go to the 32nd St & Camelback Location, as this location usually has a ridiculous wait-time. Now, that's not to say the wait isn't worth it, it's just a personal opinion that breakfast food shouldn't take an hour+, and I have been a few times, some of which luckily didn't require an extensive wait. In any case, the food is as good as you can expect, a little pricey, but indeed one of the best breakfast spots in Phoenix. Like any good breakfast place, they'll make pretty much anything you want, and have a daily feature, but it's hard to have to stray from the menu. Between their Chop & Chick (two eggs and a skillet-seared pork chop) or the Belgian Waffle, you simply can't go wrong.

Been here a few times, as well as the downtown Phoenix and the airport location, and it's always a treat. A basic, homestyle hearty breakfast, but their bacon is outstanding, can't help but to have second helpings!

What I Ate - waffle - bacon - 2 scrambled eggs - hashbrowns - glass of milk  Would I Go Again? Yes--I had a fantastic breakfast at Matt's.  I asked the waitress what are the most popular items on the menu, and one of the items she listed was the waffle.  The waffle was so good!  The batter was great, it was cooked perfectly, and the sweet cream butter and maple syrup completed the waffle's deliciousness.  The hashbrowns are my all-time favorite hashbrowns!  No competition.  The eggs were good (hard to go wrong with scrambled eggs), and the thick bacon was delicious.  Big thanks to Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives for helping me find this little gem in Phoenix!

First time today at Matt's. Had the special which was andouille sausage scrambled eggs with spinach and cheese. Let me tell you it was fantastic. The homemade strawberry preserves sourdough toast delicious coffee and great service make this a must stop for those living in the downtown area. Not a long wait, service was quick and I would recommend this breakfast spot to  anybody.

Finally made it in during a weekday, food was good but not worth the wait I see every weekend. Solid breakfast and good seemingly fresh food.  Not affecting the review but I want to mention the waitress not wanting to bring back my change, assuming I'd given them a 25% tip. I was happy to tip that amount and can understand the assumption, but when I ask "where is my change" I was disappointed at the response I got back. I hate to be the guy who writes a food that's less about food, but it left a sour taste to an overhyped staple of downtown Phoenix. Better places, better service.

A friend from Napa was in town and on a whim we decided to go. Matt's, as expected was busy, and as promoted it was absolutely worth the wait.   I had pancakes and my friend had a more traditional egg breakfast with a bacon option. Extra extra good bacon.    My friend was still raving about her breakfast last week and it was over a month ago that we had gone to Mantz. Just remember there will be a wait and it will be worth it!

Went later on Sunday and waited for 45 min for two people, very irritating...when we eventually were served the food was just..OK. I've eaten at many similar type restaurants in So. Cal, like Good Stuff, Scottys, Joe's etc. and Matts food doesn't even come close to quantity, quality or imagination to qualify the more pricey menu for such food...I saw burned hashbrowns and bacon pass me by on its way to being served...Was extremely disappointed and drove 50 miles to try....however, people are lined out the door...just not that imaginative! Come on Arizona!

This Matt's Big Breakfast is located in the new Marina Heights campus. Parking is easy, and they make sure to validate you ticket. There is usually no wait, but it does get super busy during lunch time.  The menu is limited but very delicious. I got the Waffle with bacon, and I could not leave a bite behind. Also, you get your food very quickly, so you are usually in and out.  I will definitely go again, plus I like the location more than the downtown location.

The waffle I had was very good. I found the coffee to be undrinkable though - extremely bitter! Which brings down my review as this is a breakfast restaurant and there's nothing better than starting off breakfast on the weekend with a hot coffee...
Coffee was so bitter I could barely drink it!! My Waffle was really delicious though. Restaurant was a bit small and not comfortable.

Well the name kinda says it all. It's a big breakfast. Very good food. I just had a basic breakfast with eggs, peppered bacon, home fries, and very good thick wheat toast.  No wait on a late weekday morning.  Very unpretentious appearance,  just good food (and lots of it).  Would definitely go back.

We had time in Phoenix before a flight and decided to stop at Matt's Big Breakfast for brunch. My boyfriend had the special; something scrambled with jalapenos.
