I had the belgium waffle and I will say it was pretty delicious. The only thing I wasn't sure about was the coffee (just decent) and they charged for everything extra. It came off as a little "trendy".  I'm cool with charging extra if you have to, but it gives off the wrong vibe. I also dislike when places only have "RC Cola" and no other soda choices - but that is totally just me! haha

I expected it to be much better. At 10:30 on a Wednesday, we waited about 15 minutes for a table for two. We ordered the bacon egg and cheese sandwich which truly was just average and An order of pancakes that were dry, crumbly actually, and overpriced at nearly $8. The tables are very close to each other which is fine except the Muzak is blazing loud. So between the close proximity of the other patrons and the loud music it is extremely difficult to hear the person sitting directly in front of you on the other side of the table. The staff was friendly and the service was good, but that's not going to be enough to bring us back again.

Ok place. To me, a great breakfast place is high on great and inexpensive basic breakfast fare and low on pretense. I've been to this place 3 times and the food has been pricey and middling..cold, bland egg white omelets, peppery gravy, mushy homefries.  When asked..."how was it?" and I've shared, I have been told "that's how we do it," and ignored for the remainder of my visit.  Plus, almost everything has bacon, can we please have some non pork substitutes? I will state the coffee is good.
My new favorite location. I love the big bar area. Our server was very nice and helpful. Food is simple, but delicious. Definitely a go-to.
The honey lemonade is my favorite! Bacon is awesome. The diced potatoes with rosemary and grilled onions are great. My favorite is the blueberry preserves and the thick sourdough toast!

Definitely a fan. Their potatoes, bacon and fresh blueberry preserves are my favorite. The only comments I would make are that their portions are not very filling & we waited a long time before we received our food.

I am so sad that I found this place on my way out of Phoenix. It is perfect. It was mobbed on a Monday morning, but I was alone and they sat me within about five minutes at the breakfast bar. The server there was friendly and fast and helpful. Come to think of it, everyone was friendly and acted like they were glad to have you there even though there were a bazillion people.   I got bacon & eggs with home fries, and seriously, everything was perfect. The bacon is high quality and not over salted. Crispy on the edges, tender in the middle. The home fries were the gold kind of potatoes, the really creamy kind, and they were seasoned with rosemary. The eggs were cooked perfectly and OMG the toast...it was thick slices of homemade wheat bread and homemade blueberry jam.   I really dug the ambiance and it was all I could do not to steal the orange, covered cake stand off the breakfast bar. I wanted it with all my heart and I still have not recovered. The place is done in a very minimal, industrial vibe with pops of bright orange and yellow.   Also, they have a dispenser of ice water outside for the people who are waiting out there which I thought was a nice touch.  Seriously loved this place. LOVED. Hoping I get to go back to Phoenix soon so I can eat there again. And if that cake plate is still there, I hope they've bolted it down. I might not be able to help myself.

They make an awesome Cobb salad here with really thick bacon. I also tried a Bloody Mary to enjoy the thick bacon again and it was awesome round 2!  I will definitely stop back here next time in Phoenix.

Not impressed with this place at all! There was so much grease on the omelet and hash browns it left me grossed out, the pancake tasted like they made it where they burnt some bacon...after all the reviews I thought this would be a good breakfast before flying back to Texas, bad choice for sure. Del Taco would of been a better choice.

Matt's Big Breakfast is THE best breakfast in Phoenix. Fresh, organic, and wherever possible, LOCAL ingredients, cooked up to perfection. Delicious coffee. Crowded, especially on weekends. Worth the wait. Get there early or after rush hour on weekdays. Worth every penny.

Dear Matt's big breakfast. I dreamt of your waffles last night.    Big, unbelievably fluffy, waffles. Delicious waffles. Best waffles. The sweet cream butter and maple syrup makes this amazing waffles out of this world.   The thick cut bacon is perfectly crispy on the edges but chewy too. So good. The hash brown is perfectly crispy without being burnt and tasty. The scrambled eggs were so fluffy. The blueberry jam that came with the toast was not overly sweet and just so full of ripe blueberry. And the freshly squeezed orange juice. I'm salivating just writing this review!  The wait wasn't long. We went around 8:30 a.m. on Saturday morning and waited maybe 10 minutes for a table. Service was fast and great.

Just got home from eating at Matt's Big Breakfast. Waited for about 15 minutes before we were seated which wasn't too bad. However, after trying the food, I don't think it would be worth it to wait beyond 15 minutes especially during the summer months to eat here.  To start, the menu is a little too small and was missing some key breakfast essentials I thought. Biscuits and gravy... Hello? Anyways, I decided on the chick and chop meal with hash browns, over easy eggs, and sourdough toast. The chop was really dry and tough and at times, flavorless. The eggs were cooked perfectly and the hash browns, though really greasy, were some of the best I have ever had. The toast didn't taste much like sourdough to me but the home made peach preserves were pretty legit. My husband on the other hand liked the toast. I also ordered a small fresh squeezed OJ. Maybe its just me but I almost felt I would have rather had something from a bottle. Something just didn't taste right to me about the OJ. Lots of pulp, so if you like to chew your OJ, then you might enjoy it. The husband opted for the special: 3 meat scramble with cheese and fresh jalapeno's, hash browns, and tortilla. He said it was alright but was a little weirded out that one of the meats was bologna.  All in all, the prices were not too bad. We felt they were a little skimpier on their portions than other places particularly with the amount of hash browns and the toast. For a place calling itself "big breakfast," I guess I expected more. Would we go back? Being that we are from Maricopa, this is pretty far for us to travel for breakfast so probably not anytime soon. The wait that is almost always present also doesn't seem worth it for a place that had nothing memorable to me other than their hash browns and peach preserves. Maybe if we are in the area and its not summer though...

An absolutely wonderful breakfast.  I had the special...hot peppers with scrambled eggs.  Couldn't have been better.  Matt's Big Breakfast is a small spot, but I understand they are moving to bigger quarters.

I had heard how amazing this place was and had been avoiding it because it often has a very long wait. We decided to try it on my birthday for breakfast and was so glad that we did! We got seated right away and they served us a great cup of coffee quickly. They also had eggs Benedict as the special that day, which is my favorite! It was wonderful! The service and food was great. I cannot wait to go back!!
Breakfast sandwich is great. First heard of matts years ago but it was always so busy that I never got a chance to try it... it's well worth the wait

Upscale diner food done right.  Had a standard eggs, bacon, potatoes and toast.  Bacon was done perfectly.  Tasty fried potatoes, and thick cut toast.  Super friendly staff, and had me in and out in 40 minutes, in plenty of time to catch my flight.

The service was great, everyone was very nice and friendly. Also great was the sourdough toast, jam, honey lemonade, and crispy peppery bacon. The hash browns were buttery and crispy on the outside and yummy and creamy on the inside. I didn't care for the salami scramble, the salami was different than any salami I have, but it was definitely plentiful.

Matt's food quality is exceptional as a customer I am always provided with an awesome customer experience.  If you like a old school diner vibe with an urban twist, Matt's is the place to dine-in if you want to meet with colleagues for lunch, etc....its ideal. Daniel who works there is absolutely remarkable.

so great!!!! we did have a bit of a wait but it was so worth it!  The stand out was definitely the bread and homemade preserves.  I could eat that from here every day.  Amazing.  We all got omelettes and while they were the perfect size and very tasty, could've used more cheese!

Great place to eat if you're HUNGRY  The portions are big and the taste is flavorful. The staff is amazing and super nice. Although the wait time was a little on the "ALMOST too long to wait" side, I love this place and will eat here again.

Nice breakfast. Another 30 minute wait for food, but I thought it was pretty worth it.  Their special for the day was a three egg scramble with chicken artichoke sausage, organic baby spinach and mozzarella cheese. Very unique and executed quite well - loved the sausage and the freshness of the spinach.  The hash browns were a litte strange (like what would happen if you pressed a potato through a spaghetti-making pasta machine) but nice and  crunchy on the outside.  My wife got the ham and eggs. These were also good, with nicely salted ham.  We also had a side of bacon, which was well peppered and cooked almost to a crisp.

Great airport food but service was over the top.  Michael waited on us and was not only very engaging and attentive but he also made sure we got our order to go on short notice.  Mediocre airport food and service seems to be the standard but this place stood out enough for me to write a review.

Sedona bound from the Phoenix airport, but had to stop by Matt's Big Breakfast after all the rave reviews.  Here's "The Skinny", four egg whites scrambled with gruyere cheese, local organic baby spinach and chicken apple sausage cooked in olive oil and served with a green salad.    They call it a simple salad, but love the flavors.   Btw, the sourdough and strawberry preserves are a must.

Not worth the hype.  They hand you menus as soon as you put your name in, as soon as you rear end hits the chair the waitstaff is demanding your order.  After your food has been served you practically have to jump up and down to get any attention.  Food was mediocre at best  and luke warm by the time it got to us.  Not one of the 3 would ever go back

Beer, bourbon and a side of bacon. Thats what I had here before my flight. Ron Swanson would be proud of me. Great place to catch a buzz before you get on a plane!! Love that they have Goose Island on tap along with local beer!!!

This place was incredible. I had the Thick & Savory thick cut French toast win smoked apple sausage and it was on point. If you love French toast, then Matt's won't disappoint. The waitress at the bar was super friendly and nice. Only bad thing about this location is the construction outside. Limited parking spot, but the food just made the issue go away! Come out and try Matt's!!

Was in town for a week on a work trip. I'm a huge breakfast fan and heard about this place from co-workers. The pancakes are AMAZING and I know pancakes, eggs tasted great as well. They have they own coffee brand which was really on point too. The service and staff was stellar. The only thing I didn't like was the fact they only give a small portion of syrup and charge $1.50 for more of it. Great experience, would highly recommend.

Omg, this is probably the best meal I had in Arizona. The rosemary potatoes (aka home fries) are AMAZING! You must order this over the hash brown, do it & thank me later.   I ordered the pork chop & eggs and it was seriously a piece of pork chop. The pork chop was seasoned right, not too salty or bland tasting. The eggs were cooked perfectly as well, I can't say so for all brunch places unfortunately.   This place gets pretty crowded but we were lucky to grab some seats at the bar without having to wait. I believe we were in and out of there within 30 mins. Probably one of the fastest brunch I've ever been to.

Believe the hype, the food is delicious! I recommend anything with bacon or the chorizo with eggs and jalepenos...YUM!  If you don't like the wait, have breakfast for lunch (its pretty easy to get in around one).

Had the three egg scramble with grilled pork tenderloin and jalapeos that was the special today. Absolutely delicious! If you have a party of six or more be sure to call ahead so you aren't waiting hours outside!

Was in town for business and was craving some good breakfast before flying back to LA. Yelped this place and it wasn't too far from the hotel so decided to stop by. Even though it was a weekday morning, there was still a sizable wait. Luckily, since it was just me, I was able to get a seat at the bar. I ordered the waffle with no bacon and asked for a side of hash browns as a substitute for the bacon. Also go the blueberry lemonade to drink and it was outstanding. Food came it out and I can legitimately say that it was the best waffle that I had. The butter that came on top of it was out of this world good. Hash browns were a huge portion as well and tasted great. Even though they were slammed the food came out pretty quickly. Service could have been a bit better, the girl working at the bar didn't really seem to care to be there. Also got charged for the hashbrowns when I asked for them as a substitute for the bacon. Not a big deal but it's the small things. Will definitely be back. I'm not a huge breakfast person but this place is outstanding.
LOVE LOVE LOVE breakfast at Matt's.  Weekdays are better than weekends, or so I have heard, I have never attempted a weekend.  Menu is simple but the food is not.

Great breakfast spot. Came here with my husband for breakfast and loved it. Food is reasonably priced and the service was very friendly. One of the servers wrote a list of other restaurants we should check out for dinner. The food was delicious and made with care, especially their jam, it's a must-have!

Not a good place for groups.. The food is great! The bacon is better than last time I was here.(at the old spot) Very fast and fresh. The ambience is casual and welcoming. The jelly is Awesome!! I will be back, and I'll take a waffle with some jelly!

Told this was the best in town so made multiple attempts to go, but left twice because the wait was over 2 hrs... When we finally caught them on an odd morning when the wait was reasonable, found the food was good but not worth the hype.  Plus, had to ask 3 times for my side waffle, and when it was brought out she poured the syrup all over me and made only a half effort to clean it up.

Oh my...oh my gosh!!   I love breakfast, and this place is at the top three for my favorite spots.   So I kind of eat like a dude, I'm not going to lie! This place happens to be one of the few restaurants that fills me up! It might be their amazing fresh potatoes, I swear to you they put some magical unknown ingredient in their potatoes and hash browns. Or maybe it's their daily egg scramble specials that just happen to ALWAYS be amazing. No, no...I'd say it's their fresh bread with their homemade jelly. Okay...let's be real here, it's their BACON!!! I love bacon and they make it absolutely heavenly.  Another thing to try are their pancakes. They might just be the best pancakes I have ever had. Simple buttermilk pancakes, nothing added...they are to die for. Try them, you'll keep kicking yourself in the butt if you don't!  Oh, there will be a wait...BUT IT'S SOOOOO WORTH IT!

This was the first time I have been here and let .e tell you it was excellent. When we walked in the place looked clean, casual and with a chic look. We are greeted by Vince who happened to be our server. We decided to sit at the bar. We looked at the menu and everything looked appetizing. The restaurant only open for breakfast and lunch. They have special everyday so today was Monday huevos rancheros and my roommate had well cooked fluffy waffles.
Great classic breakfasts, nothing fancy but very fresh and very good. I'm coming back!

Best Airport Food in the World!!  They use consciously sourced ingredients like free range meats and eggs.  Amazing comfort food.  Better than home-cooked meals!  Not just breakfast..they have lunch and dinner items too.  If you have some time at Phoenix Airport, this is the only place to eat in my opinion.

I did not wait long to try this place after going to the farmers market. I have had way way better. The food was so so. My impression here is that folks who rave about this place have never had really good food with flavor. I actually find that a lot in Phoenix...PEOPLE DO NOT KNOW GOOD FOOD HERE!!!! Look at most of the bad reviews and see where most of the people are from. Yeah, not here with exception of myself but I am actually from Los Angeles and have had access all my live to some of the best food around. Matt's big breakfast is a big joke! I actually prefer to go to wildflower over this joint.

I've sadly become one of those people who turn to the Food Network for restaurant recommendations. Okay, not all the time but when a segment airs about thick cut bacon and huge burger patties cooked in butter, I immediately start making travel plans.  We arrived at Matt's for a late-lunch. Being that it was a weekday and close to 2pm, the restaurant was nearly empty and we didn't have to endure the wait or the harried service. In fact, other than a mix-up with toast, the staff was attentive and eager to please (or get us out so they could go home).  I ordered the jalapeno burger with kettle chips and Jules got the Hog & Chick - 2 eggs with bacon. Her hash browns were buttery and sweet. My burger was juicy with a nice kick.  I don't know if I'll jump on the plane the next time I see a tempting food segment but am I glad that we made a trip for some bacon and burger? You bet.

I'm not quite sure anyone could do breakfast any better.   We came on a Tuesday at about 9am, after previous attempts, and were seated right away. It is definately small and there is no place to wait inside, just multiple benches outside to bask in the blaring sun. If this is the case, bring sunscreen.  There is a pad of paper, just outside the door, to write your name and total number in party down -- that is known as the wait list.  Don't even try to go on a weekend, atleast in my experience.  Anyway, we both ordered the "hog and chick" - it was fabulous. Although they could have cooked the eggs a bit more. The bacon was thick cut and peppered, the has browns were real potatos, the toast was also really thick cut with real butter and local preserves.  The wait staff do not hover, the owner goes around making sure everyone is doing well. It's very heart warming being here.

After standing in line a few minutes on a weekday, we made our way to the bar, I ordered up some pancakes. I should have had the special which turned out to look really good. The pancakes were alright, not great but OK. One thing about pancakes they are designed to need syrup, after all a pancake is a syrup delivery system. The pancakes came with about 1 ounce, about half of a shot glass of syrup. I knew right off that wasn't going to get it done but I figured no problem I would just ask for some more. I asked for more syrup and the lady wanted to make sure I understood they charge $1.50 for syrup, I said bring it on after all what good are pancakes without syrup. The refill came and it was probably about 1/2 an ounce of syrup. I ate most of the pancakes but ended up leaving some since pancakes without syrup is boring.

Matt's is the perfect breakfast place. The menu is simple with only about ten dishes and they have a daily special that is always good. I sat at the bar area and the waitress there was really nice and even offered to put my milk in the fridge so it would still be cold when the food came out. It's a small place,so there will be a wait,but its well worth it.

Matt's has been a favorite of mine for years! The food is good home style cooking that is served in big, hearty portions. The fresh baked bread and house jam are amazing together! The only downside to this place is the wait - come in on a Saturday or Sunday morning and expect to wait for at least 30 minutes. It's worth it but brutal in the summer if you have to wait outside.

This is a long time favorite of ours, all the way back to the OG downtown PHX location. The greatest thing about Matt's is the consistency of the food - it is always perfect every time we go. Scratch made everything. Perfectly cooked eggs, tender breakfast potatoes and the wheat toast is just awesome.   This is the kind of place where they address you by name, and go above and beyond to make sure your service is fantastic. AND they have just started offering their own signature hot sauce -- every part of your experience here is thought of!

This is my favorite breakfast place in the US.  Hash browns are perfectly crispy, pancakes have a great flavor and texture that pushes up on the border of savory, and the Bloody Marie's might be the most delicious I've ever had (I did have a really amazing one at Aria in Vegas).  Anyways, went to this place a year ago passing through AZ, and couldn't wait to pass through again.  Finally returned, and this spot didn't disappoint.  They slightly screwed up our order, and no less than 3 different servers came out to apologize, so excellent service as with, with a staff of people who seem to enjoy their jobs.  Pretty pretty great.
It was good, but I wasn't blown away. Staff was very nice, very attentive. However plenty of 5-star breakfast joints in this area so we are not likely to return.
We were seated right away. Friendly staff, great food nice place. Came after seeing triple d. Worth the drive from Cali

Well, here it is folks. My first 3-star rating since starting this project (http://www.hngrysam.com/?p=20) about four months ago. And I'm sure I'll get some flack for it!  I met a friend at Matt's for breakfast around 9am on a Saturday. I expected a wait, and a wait we got. It wasn't too bad, there were benches and shade and lots of conversation. After about 30 minutes we were seated at the bar inside the teeny tiny restaurant.  I loved the simple old-school vibe. We ordered and our food came out FAST, which was nice since we'd been waiting a bit. The food was simple and good, and the service was really great. But why all the hype?  Is it rude of me to give a lesser rating because the place doesn't hold up to the Yelp standard?  I will absolutely give it a second chance, but I fear Matt's might be one of those places people love because other people love it.

I really enjoyed the chop and chick with the fries but my experience started with a warm orange juice and I was not a fan. And then noticed that splitting checks was not allowed. From a customer's perspective i did not agree. There are no creamers only milk options. An unfortunately, the service was missing enthusiasm. I review only to help better the business.

Food sucked, service sucked. Only one server was nice to us and the one that originally helped us was rude and kept gossiping, using terrible language in front of other customers, and talking about how the other girls working were pissing her off. The food also took forever to come out and it was cold by the time it got to us. Next time I'll play it safe and just do a McDonald's breakfast or something. Do not waste your time or money at this place.

Besides the wait everything was better than expected, the plates were more then a belly full and the service top notch. We ended up in the front room and was nice considering how busy it was. If u have four or less wait for the front room it is quiet and the cashier pays a littler more attention to you.

Great food and service. Waiter Michael is a treasure! Our family was heading to Bakersfield : ( and he managed to put a smile on our faces- service with a smile and truckloads of personality!! Don't let him go!

Read all the reviews about the best breakfast ever. I have to say it was a neat place. They have the best toast and best strawberry jam I've ever had.. I regret not trying the Honey Straweberry Lemondae. I ordered the Chop and Chick. aka a Pork Chop with eggs over easy and hashbrowns. The pork chop had absolutely no flavor whatsoever. The eggs and hashbrowns were your average eggs and hasbrowns, nothing special. I would go back here just for the toast and jam, it's that good.

There are 480 reviews of Matt's Big Breakfast at this time. My guess is that I can't say anything that hasn't been said here or on Food Network. I have wanted to get here for a while, but finally made it in last week with "second wife". She and I are always up for sharing, so we got the cheese omelet with wheat bread and the griddlecakes. Wow.  The omelet was large and tasty; it went very well with the Tapatio that we both tried (for the first time!). We got the rosemary potatoes on the side and they were delish. The griddlecakes were crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside, just perfect. Light and airy with a touch of sweetness.  Saving the best for last... the toast. The bread was dark and amazing- full of seeds and whole grains. It came with a little butter, even though we asked for it dry. There was a small side of house-made blueberry preserves that were incredible. I would go back just for the toast and preserves!  We went on Friday at 1pm, probably a smart move.

When here after seeing it on food network.  The country potatoes and steak omelet with a side of bacon is what I had along with their honey lemonade.  Food was great and service was pretty good.  Everyone was super friendly, it just gets so busy that the work crew can't attend to everyone all the time.  I would definitely go here again.  Probably one of the best breakfasts I've had!
Awesome, awesome, awesome, I had the salami scramble, side of homemade sausage and bacon. I devoured all of it, I really can't say enough,  6 stars!!!! I will be back.

Great breakfast place, especially for crowds coming through downtown Phoenix and the Convention Center. Matt's is very busy- I had to wait 10 minutes for a 2 person table at 10pm on a Friday morning.  The food was fantastic- I got the bacon and waffles. This big, syrupy waffle was cut by two generous strips of peppered bacon. My bottomless coffee was solid and the server never let it empty.  I visited here with a friend and her young son. The staff was very accommodating to this twitchy toddler (and we were not the only group there with a young child) and had a high chair available for the table.

Worth the wait...amazing food! Every member of my family ate each and every bite! From the coffee to the main dishes, you can taste the fresh, locally selected ingredients. Way to go, Matt's Big Breakfast!

Salami scramble - I tried to remove all the salami after I tasted rancid fat, but the rancid taste was also on the overcooked eggs.   So I tried to eat the hash browns. They couldn't be cut, chopped or broken with fork or knife, but I managed to spear the entire brick and gnaw chunks off. I felt my teeth did some manly, brutish work.

Darn. This could've been so much better...everyone liked their meal except all 4 of us ordered hash browns and were surprised to find that all 4 were under cooked on the inside. When we asked for them to be more cooked, they delivered 4 more the same way: mushy and slimy. When the manager came around, we told her that they were also under done and she said that is how they make them, stating that they want them to be like mashed potatoes in the middle. We overheard the table next to us have the same complaint and she gave the same comment. They took them off of the bill, which was good. Limited menu and service was just ok. With so many breakfast choices in the Valley, we will skip this one next time.

Every time I go to Matt's, I always have an amazing experience and a superb breakfast. Sunday has to be one of my favorite days there, they have their "Stake and Eggs" special. The meat is tender,juicy and full of flavor. Their potatoes are delicious and well seasoned. The thick cut bacon is delicious. The hog and chick is always a great choice, the fruit preserves that comes with is also great. The griddlecakes are also a good choice, fluffy and sweet. Their milk, coffee, and orange juice are delicious. Its a small place so I recommend you go in early so you can avoid waiting to be seated!
Here with friends. 1:10 wait, YES the new bigger place. But worth the wait. Pancakes Excellent, Omlette fantastic!!

It's normally a great place but today off on their game. Ordered the Huevos Rancheros but instead brought me the southwest scramble which was scorched and waitress basically dropped it and took off before I could say anything but I didn't want to wait any longer either. Then forget about asking for extra syrup for your pancakes or a side of their green salsa unless you want to pay. They also will not do separate checks even though they're downtown. It's a cool place but feel their attitude is we're so good we don't need your business. Bummer cuz their food is good but customer service is a bit lacking.

When I drove by Matt's, there was a line already waiting outside. I ordered the Chop and Chick since it was highly recommended by My fellow Yelpers. My husband got the Five Spot. I ordered the food to go, since I didn't want to wait and had a baby with me. I'm sure the food would of had me given it 5 stars if I ate it fresh from the kitchen. My favorite by far was their Jam. I'm NOT a jam persons ever but I am for Matt's Jams. It's to die for. It's original and divine flavors can't be duplicated. LOVE!

Love the food at Matt's but this is the second time at this location and service is horrible here. First time waiter didn't put in our whole order, didn't apologize just asked if we still wanted it. Second time, waited 30 minutes for our food just for another waiter to come out and tell us sorry the computer didn't send your order to the kitchen so they're making it now. Pretty sure that's the waiter's job to check on our order but he was nowhere to be found. We just left after waiting almost 40 minutes. This location needs new management.

They had the steak and eggs as a special today.  It was not very special.  It was dry and overcooked, definitely not medium rare.  The eggs and hash browns were exceptional.  Oh, so were their home made preserves for the toast. Big lines and 30+ min wait to be seated.  Counter seating is NOT self seating like most places so you will be yelled at if you didn't know and walked in and sat yourself. There is construction right outside the restaurant where you will be standing out in the Phoenix weather inhaling dust.  Decore inside is so so, kinda plain.  Two chalk boards with daily specials written on them.  The bathrooms are hidden behind one of the chalk boards, but no signage on the doors to tell you which door is the restroom. Overall, I think this place is overrated,over priced and over crowded.  Like all breakfast themed diners.

I am very disappointed with the customer service at Matt's Big Breakfast in tempe. I'm pretty sure our waitress was a bitch or prejudice because all of the other tables she was also waiting on didn't have a problem with their service. We ordered our food and didn't receive it all, and when we asked her for it she just said it will come later and it never came. And I don't know why, but we got really small glasses for water and she never filled up. After that she never came back to check on us. I had to ask another waitress for the check and take it to the to go counter to pay for a meal we didn't even get all of the food we ordered for. I've been here a few times but if the service continues to be like this then I don't think it's worth coming back.

We were in town visiting our daughter attending college in Phoenix. This place is AWESOME, I mean the best place for breakfast I ever had. I scored the food, service, establishment, and management at the highest possible rating of 5, but they deserve a ten. This place is a rare find....

Coffee was good, orange juice was fresh & delicious.  I had the waffle which came with bacon: OMG, my mouth was in heaven! Bacon was sooo good, covered in black pepper, and the waffle was soft and sweet and oh-so-good!  Boyfriend had the breakfast sandwich: also very yummy.  The wait can be ridiculous. The place is pretty small, but it was very well-priced.

Airport food. Let's keep it simple. The greeter was super nice. The server was super nice. The bartender was super nice. The food came out fast hot. The drinks came out quick and were delicious. And the food....probably some of the best airport food I have ever had. Better than some regular restaurants. And I always expect less of airport food. I was pleasantly surprised. I travel through Phoenix often...will definitely stop by here if I have time. And so should you . ;)

This place is great for its food! Generous portions not too long of a wait time and very clean!! My only complaint was they were eager to seat us down that they crammed 3 of us at a table clearly built for 2 with one of our backs awkwardly to the table next to us .. it was crammed and a tight space as our food came. I wouldn't have minded waiting a little longer to have more room haha but other than that no complaints!

I chose this burger place, and I think that Modern Burger would probably have been a better airport choice.  My burger was overcooked, and it didn't taste good at all, despite all of the bragging about being cooked in butter.  Skip it.

Finally had an opportunity to stop here for breakfast and our timing was perfect!  No wait, but within seconds of being seated the entry filled up with hungry folks waiting on a table.  I was surprised (and a little disappointed) that the breakfast menu didn't have more selections/variety.  Once we had ordered, the food was good.  Oddly enough, I liked the thick, fresh wheat toast with home made strawberry preserves.  The liberal application of fresh rosemary in the cottage fries was nice as were the sweet, caramelized onions.  The special this morning was a Schreiner's Sicilian sausage scramble.  It was excellent and I appreciate utilizing local products.    Even though a couple of the tables around me were obviously business appointments, I wouldn't recommend it for two reasons, 1) the wait you can expect, and 2) the noise level makes it hard to conduct a meeting.  This is a good spot, the wait staff is very attentive and friendly.  I have no problem recommending it or returning.

Drove all night and made it here for breakfast.  This looked like the best place it town and I was surprised for a weekday to have a line of people out front waiting.  That just means I found yet another good place with help from Yelpers! Parking was easy and the wait wasn't that long.  The place is smaller than I thought it would be but they were really efficient in taking orders and getting food out quickly so the turn around was pretty fast.  I ordered the scramble special which included hash browns which were fabulous!  The scramble had jalapeos in it and that in itself made it great! It also came with a tortilla which I filled with my leftovers and had as a snack later that day! Hubby got the pancakes which resembled a double layer cake in height and were light and fluffy he said but I knew he'd be out for the count and not driving anymore after that, there was just too much there for one person and he ate them all! My friend got an omelet with the home fries and toast and everything looked and tasted fabulous. I would certainly not hesitate to stop in here again.

Been here three times, really like the food, want to give a good review, but the service is spotty at best, over medium eggs come out Sunnyside up, bill was someone else's, I'm honest so I told them:( quality good, be prepared for only fair service...

Chili is one step down from Wendy's and about 4 times the cost. Even more regrettable was the service and the 20-min wait to get the said order to-go. In an airport, not making your clients sick and timeliness are probably the top 2 minimum objectives. Customers behind me received their orders sooner, which is not great when the waiting time starts to encroach into your boarding time. The most in-your-face obstinance was the supervisor's insistence that, "well, we have to heat it up individually." Yea, okay, soup can be boiled in like 4 minutes and soondobu can be made from scratch in less than 20 min. So no, uh-uh, no thank you, never again. I'll know better next time.

We purchased two "Classic Ruben" sandwiches on the 16th of November 2015 for take-out. Sorry I do not have photos, but my wife gave the second sandwich to the American Airlines stewardess as trash before I could get photos.  What to notice first - despite having many small sealed bags of "chips," Matt's tossed a handful of loose chips in with the sandwich. An hour into our flight, they were all soggy, having lost all crispness. Matt's saved a few cents by dumping in their bulk chips. Shame! Matt's sandwich was premium-priced at about $11.  An excellent Reuben outside the Sky Harbor is in the $6-10 range.  A $11 Ruben should be amazing.  I doubt anyone at this Matt's has ever seen or had a Classic Ruben.  Matt's used bread that was sliced into extra thick 1" thick slabs.  If it was "rye," the grain was a minority contributor.  The sandwich was cut into two rectangles, like a grade school peanut butter and jelly sandwich. Classic Rubens are cut on a diagonal!  The corned-beef was tough and the quantity very small.  You could hardly taste any sauerkraut or Russian dressing.  Sky Harbor diners from the "coasts" should stay away from this atrocity to avoid disappointment. However, we give credit to the "grill-man" for getting nice "grill-marks" on the bread!

Meh. My boyfriend and I were starving for brunch so on a recommendation from a friend we went to the Camelback location. We waited 30-40 minutes then were seated....but no one took our drink order for at least 10-12 minutes. We looked at the menu and were shocked-- no variety! Nothing really stood out to us that we had to try. And I'm sorry but $8.45 for two eggs, potatoes and toast? Insane. We ended up paying for my coffee to go and went to Snooze. Way better experience. I'm not likely to try or recommend this place. two stars because at least the food is organic and everyone else seems to enjoy it. I'm just a normal person who wants a good meal at a decent price.

We have been going to Matt's for over 4 years now. Never ordered from the menu - always went for their special of the day and it has always been great. Love the staff...and they move people in and out without feeling rushed. Keep up the great work guys!!!!

We went there last week because other reviews said it was a great place for breakfast. Glad you think so, I do not. The meal was awful - for both of us. I thought they served the absolute worst hashbrowns I've ever had. Not a place I want to visit twice.

We came here before we went to the SF v Arizona game, we decided to walk from our hotel wow ~ was it hot. I tend to sweat and boy was I melting as we made our way past Arizona State Law School's campus.   The woman who was handling the seating and waiting arrangements did a great job engaging the crowd, despite it being 100 degrees outside their restaurant. It was a Sunday and it seems as though everyone in the historic district had the same idea as we did.   Food was good, came out quickly. Only thing that I was not too happy about was the iced coffee that they offered me and my wife. It seemed too watered down, to a point where my server asked if I wanted more iced tea. Besides that we had a good time service was attentive, Never mind that we were decked out in our best 49er apparel, they still treated us like very nicely.   I had the peppered bacon and the 'world famous' waffle with real maple syrup. (You can really put the words 'world famous' in front of anything.)  Definitely a must if you are in the area and you are looking for a brunch.

The portions here are great! I ordered the chop and chick with a side of bacon. I enjoyed everything I ordered. The toast and jam were very good! My dining partner had ham and sage sausage patties with his order. The sausage patties were outstanding! We weren't impressed with the orange juice. It was too expensive for the quantity and the flavor wasn't impressive. I wouldn't complain about a small glass of OJ whose flavor is out of this world. I will definitely come back. Will try the pancakes and French toast next time.
Cool place, food did not blow me away.

We came here on a Saturday morning and waited 45 minutes. The menu is small but what we ordered was really good. We ordered a blueberry honey lemonade and a strawberry honey lemonade. The best drinks I've ever had. We got griddle cakes and a scramble that was the special of the day. Best pancakes and syrup I've had and the egg scramble was amazing. Definitely I would come back.

MBB needs to first understand this isn't 5-star fine dining and people are here because THEY ARE FLYING TODAY Unbelievable slow service in an half empty restaurant and no food after 20 minutes from ordering with waiters all standing around talking to one another   People - it's an airport - everyone has somewhere to go  - and I did- I walked out

I loved this place! It was a short walk from the downtown hotel where I was staying. I think I was about the only person who wasn't a local. Friendly and attentive service. Great food served in generous portions and a good cup of coffee! I will definitely return whenever I have the chance. Left happy and full, ready for the day.

Went in with my girlfriend before work. We are both vegetarians, I asked for no bacon with my waffle and asked if they can sub out hash browns. Server said yes and yet I got two huge ass slices of bacon over my waffle , after I told him we don't eat meat, and charged almost 3 bucks for hash browns. Also was charged for a coffee I didn't order. The server took our order. Brought us our food, and brought us our check. Worst restaurant I've been to. Had no time to even try to argue for my money back.

One of a good reason to not judge first appearance. When my friends took me for brunch to Matt's Big Breakfast, I'm questioning her option, but since we were near this place, I agreed to try this place out. I ordered The Chick and The Chop, they gave option of eggs and I choose my fav scramble eggs. Fries or hashbrown, I choose the fries. And last time to choose my bread. Whole wheat it is! My best option for breakfast drink is always OJ so I ordered one. The OJ came, freshly pure orange juice served in a small cute cup with chicken logos. It was superb! Although the cup is small and I swore I can chug the OJ in 3secs but it still worth it! The porkchop was excellent! My whole wheat bread was thick and tasty! My scrambled eggs and fries were perfect! And last but not least, the additional bacon that I ordered was great! The only complaint that I have for this place is just the service. My waitress was too busy talking with 2 college guys customer that over-flirt her so she forgot we already gave her our card and wait for almost 45 minutes just to finish the payment. Overall, I will definitely be back for my superb breakfast but hopefully I will get a fast service next time ;))

They are the biggest and one of the better looking among the modest restaurants in Terminal 4 B gates. The big pig on the wall with the retro typeface tries to subvert the overwhelming and inescapable airport food court vibe.   The waitress was friendly and the service was prompt.  I ordered a grilled cheese with tomato soup. The cheese was just tasteless and the soup was more salty than if it had come out of a can. I asked for coffee to go and it was barely lukewarm - made me think if the service was really as genuine as you can expect at an airport eatery.  I will remember this place enough to not go there the next time I fly to Vegas through that airport.

Love quick, delicious breakfast? The portion sizes at Matt's quite satisfactory and I usually go for "lighter" menu like biscuit sandwich. The downtown location is not too far from my work and has a very cozy atmosphere. Just like most breakfast places, they have a bar for people to sit at.
Nothing like a five spot sandwich after the Farmer's Market!! Still super tasty ...I don't mind the wait ... it's that tasty!

Terrible service terrible food. The fresh squeeze Oj is not freshly squeezed at all. Food is super slow. I asked the waitress to check on my food since I have a flight to catch. Her attitude was if u don't have dont don't eat here

Ordered the chop and chick and was not disappointed! SO GOOD! I am a hash browns girl through and through but was advised to try the home fries. No regrets! Those home fries are the best I've ever had! The wheat toast is delicious and the homemade strawberry preserves are worth the wait in line. And you must order the blueberry honey lemonade!

Matt's Big Breakfast is AWESOME The food is great, great retro-atmosphere and the staff is very attentive and friendly.  Centrally located and very easy to get to by the Light Rail or plenty of parking in the rear.

Drove all the way from long beach california for this joint, and it was totally worth the drive. I got the waffle with bacon and a side of of rosemary potatoes. it was amazing and the best breakfast i have ever eaten. Every time i go to AZ i will eat here amazing!!!

I was here the other day and it was a great hangover cute. However their omelette did not have a lot of flavour and the hash-browns needed a lot of salt. It was alright on the whole, the atmosphere and wait staff were great but I expected a more flavourful meal. It's decent but nothing to write home about.

I go back to matts big breakfast always expecting something better because of all the rave reviews but frankly I'm always disappointed.   I love breakfast food, and you'd think a breakfast place would be able to cook eggs to order right? Nope. Every time I've gone the eggs are over easy, I like over medium, and I've even tried asking for over hard, still over easy. I always ask for bacon extra crispy and it still comes out kinda soggy every time. The eggs Benedict I've had before and again the eggs weren't cooked enough. The hash is fine, and the lemonade is pretty good but if I'm paying that much for breakfast at a place with breakfast in the name...you'd think they could cook an egg how you want it...   Log story short, not worth the hype.

Stopped in while driving to Cali...wanted a wholesome solid breakfast.  This place did not disappoint!!   I got eggs Benedict with home fries. My daughter had a Belgian waffle and my mom had a veggie omelet.  All were so yummy! The home fries were prob the best I've had- crispy, flavorful, fresh and lots of onions and peppers. The bread used for toast was legit artisan bread. So good and hearty.  Only complaint: they didn't have half and half for coffee! Had to use almond milk or regular whole milk. But they did have the raw sugar and the coffee was fantastic.  Restrooms were clean too!!

If you're in the area and you have a small party, give it a shot.  It'll be good not great.    I love breakfast so I'd combed the Internet for breakfast joints to visit while in Phoenix.  Matt's Big Breakfast was near the top of the list.    Finally made it there today with my mom - not the most adventurous eater but game for a good experience.  She was turned off by the flies and the heat inside the restaurant but did enjoy her tuna sandwich and potato chips.  The tuna was tasty - light, not too soggy, not too much relish or add-ins.  It tasted pretty fresh and the bread was delicious - definitely not just out of a plastic bag.  The chips were a little cool but the pepper was a nice addition.  I've read complaints about the coffee and I'd agree it wasn't that good.  Not awful but if you're open to other beverages I'd say grab something else when you're there.  I had two eggs over easy, whole grain toast, and hash browns.  The hash browns were some of the greasiest I've ever eaten (and I eat a lot of hash browns) but at least we're dealing with real butter and olive oil at this place.  The potatoes are grated really fine which perhaps adds to your ability to see all the grease.  They were greasy but tasty.  Still, the home fries on a plate nearby looked equally, if not, more tasty.  The eggs were fine and the bread was delicious. I had to order everything a la carte because the only two egg breakfast on the menu involved bacon.    There are mostly 2 seater tables though they can pull up an extra chair to some of the tables but if you've got a larger party, prepare to wait. There's also counter space for people who are open to sitting at the counter.  If you go around 1:30 pm, there's definitely no wait! :)  The service was friendly though not particularly helpful.

As a food lover, I don't ever get the "lighter" versions of food at restaurants, but Matt's Skinny sounded great and it was great!   First off, let me say, bottomless coffee for a little less than $3 - that's a steal! But off to the food, I got their Skinny, which is a four egg whites scramble with spinach, applewood chicken sausage, and a side salad. No skimping on flavors, but still light and actually very large!  On the side, I got their house made toast (sourdough, wheat, or rye) with also, house made, strawberry preserves. Huge, full strawberries, I tell ya.   Did not fail to impress at all!

I think this is the BEST breakfast, not only in Scottsdale, but of anywhere I've ever gone!  The food tastes so fresh, and everything is delicious.  There service is great, and they have a very good thing going here!  Wish we had one in Houston, TX!!

So it begins....I have finally started reviewing all the restaurants that I tried on my tour of the Southwest this summer and Matt's Big Breakfast was a BIG way to start it off!  Being from LA which seems to be the home of trendy but good and always crowded breakfast spots, I understand the love/hate relationship that people have with their local breakfast spot that have just become way to crowded.  That being said, I left LA to try some of the favorites in other cities.  The good thing about being on vacation is that you can schedule your meals around the crowds instead of dealing with them.  So we drove into Phoenix around 11pm under the blanket of the night which was great because the days were reaching 120 degrees.  It was quieter then most cities, almost ghost-town like.  We stayed at the motel next to Matt's Big Breakfast.  I think its called the Coronado or Casablanca Hotel.  It was more of a Motel then Hotel and definitely not the Holiday Inn.  Although a little on the scary side it served its purpose.  The goal was to wake up and walk into Matt's.  And that goal was certainly achieved.    After a super long wait of about...3 minutes (9:30am) we sat down and took a look at the menu.    http://i4.photobucket.com/albums/y143/skptk13/DSCF1410-1.jpg  It wasnt as big as I thought it was going to be (haha)...well, it wasnt as expansive as I thought it was going to be but I would rather restaurants do what they do right instead of tons of things done wrong.  I got the Hog & Chick and Griddle Cakes.  Thick cut bacon and perfectly made eggs with delicious potatoes.  Nice thick bread and homemade jam came along side.  Im not a fan of citrus jams/preserves but this was fantastic!  http://i4.photobucket.com/albums/y143/skptk13/DSCF1415.jpg  http://i4.photobucket.com/albums/y143/skptk13/DSCF1417.jpg  The pancakes were possibly the best of the trip and also some of the best I have ever had.  Everything we had was great!   Our server/owner  even came and talked to us about our trip, the town and even gave us some other suggestions on places to see and eat at while in Phoenix.  I wish I could have tried some of the places she suggested but...alas, we still had a ton of places still on our own list.    Off to Joe's Farm Grill!!!

OVERRATED.  I know it was reviewed on Food network channel as top 10 something or another in the nation.  Did their quality go down since they know that people will seek it out irregardless of the review?  Location- in down town Phoenix- but in a crappy part that doesn't look safe at night.  Dirt lot in back is not an option to park because of city ordinances or safety issues.  Wait time- for those reviewers who waited over 1hour in the hot desert sun- i don't know what to say. There is little to no shade, it's hot, you lean on wooden fences... it's a strange system where you sign your name to be called. However, if you sign in, and say you want to go do something else instead of wait an hour in the hot sun, they will cross you off the list if you aren't there for roll call. Some people behind us, just waited a bit then walked in and sat at the bar (where they were seating other people).  And they say they don't play favorites?  Please....  If you can't stand to wait, you can  order take out and get your food before all the other people waiting.  Do they let anyone know? NO. Do they care that people waiting over 1 hour have to wait another hour for food so To-Go people can get their food? NO...  Food- maybe the food tastes better because your out in the hot sun,dehydrating, standing, waiting... because the food didn't look like anything special and didn't taste special either.  Just run of the mill breakfast food.  Does it take 45min to make waffles and toast?  We told them we had a flight to catch, and our food took a crazy amount of time to make. No wonder the wait is so long outside! 2oz of OJ was $2.50  Ambiance- it's a 3 room (1 kitchen, one bar set up, 1 room with 4 tables and seating on bar-like thing looking outside. Think they can seat ~20 people inside?  Poor decor, crappy furniture.... they must make a ton of money because none of it is going into the location/upkeep/decor.  Don't even think about coming here with more than 6 people.... Where will you put them? Wait til the restaurant clears so you have a room to yourself?  ha...  Once again, OVER-RATED.

After hearing how great Matt's Big Breakfast was, some friends and I decided to give it a try.  Boy, was I not impressed.  The menu is VERY limited and disappointing.  I wasnt too impressed with the food at all.  I ended up ordering a waffle.  It came with bacon, which was so burnt I didnt eat it.  The waffle was "ok", nothing to write home about.  My dining partners had a reuben sandwich and a chicken sandwich, both of which they said were good.  The ONLY redeeming quality about our visit was the staff--everyone was very friendly and offered a smile.  I still havent figured what is so BIG about Matt's Breakfast, and after our visit, I dont intend on finding out.
This place is great, hard to get a table, but the owners are fantastic, and the food is amazing.

Waited 30 mins to find out the girl was skipping me on the waiting list. She said she wasn't skipping me, that there were places for two people to sit, but not one. The last time I checked, one person is able to sit where two people can sit. I don't give a pretty fuck that you are trying to turn more tables, if I am waiting 30 mins, when it's my turn, ITS MY TURN. If someone that came after me, sits before I do, you are skipping me. There is no arguing with me about it. Won't be back.

I came here a couple weeks ago while passing through Phoenix, and it was delicious! As mentioned before, there is a bit of a wait. However, we just walked around a little bit and explored the area, and pleasantly, there was no pressure by the servers to turn over tables once we were seated. The venue itself is small, but beautiful. The windows were large and filled with natural light making it seem open and spacious.  The food was also really good. While the salami scramble didn't particularly suit my taste, they had crispy hashbrowns and freshly made cherry jam to go with the toast-- both were above and beyond. I'll definitely be back next time in town.

Food isn't that bad, it was my third time going as it was conveniently close to my gym. The way I was treated by the manager however was very surprising. We had a group of 6 waiting to get seated for breakfast. We asked the host when we could be seated and she told us about 25 or 30 minutes. Then the manager came by and aggressively said we probably won't be seated for about 40 minutes. This was understandable since it was a busy Saturday morning. After about 10 minutes seats at the bar became available and I asked the host if we could just sit there, she said yes so we did. After sitting down the manager yells across the restaurant asking what we're doing and yelling that we couldn't sit there. I was a bit defensive as the host said we could. Then the manager made a bit of a scene and came over and kicked us out of the bar using a very patronizing tone saying we had to wait like everyone else even though the host said we could sit there. Even the employee behind the bar seemed confused as to why we couldn't sit there. Anyway, the manager didn't even give us a reason why we couldn't, so we all left hungry, and angry at his behavior. My advice is to make customer service a priority and not patronize customers. I usually write positive reviews and maybe he's usually cool, but this guy was acting like ass hole.

I really think this is the BEST BREAKFAST I have ever had!  The 3 times I have eaten here it has been an hour and a half wait!  Other than that I would give it 5 stars...Food is great, staff is friendly

Moma Mia love Big Mat and his Big Breakfast.  This guy knows good food and keeps an eagle eye on staff and quality to make sure all is up to snuff.  No wonder his other locations and Giant Coffee remain in the Snacksters permanent rotation.

Awesomeness from Matt pool yet again.  Packed to the rafters with egg and bacon lovers....plus much much more!  This place is equally as cool as the downtown location skewing a tad older and a tad less hip but that doesn't make us any less hungry or appreciative of great food.  Thanks Matt for making it over here!

Long waits are worth it! I suggest a party of 2 if you can make it happen, just because when you smell the delicious things coming out of the restaurant, you are not going to want to wait for a table to open for a big party!   Local, fresh, and unique dishes that make home style breakfasts im used to with local flair such as AZ grown fruits and veggies or thick cut peppered bacon. Not to mention the REAL fresh squeezed orange juice.   Servers are hit or miss. Last visit I had a gal completely forget to put our order in for about 20 minutes, but the kitchen is fast so it wasn't more than 15 minutes after she did that we had our food.   No real complaints, Matt's food is worth the wait!

Food is decent. My only real complaint would be to not go with a group and expect to pay separately... they don't split checks which is ridiculous. There was only four of us and it was too difficult for them to split the bill. We thought it was just the server the first time we went but same thing happened the second time too. They said their software wasn't capable. We then asked them to pretend we each were a table of one; they still couldn't figure that one out. Sorry but not everyone can afford to front the bill and expect their friends to remember to get cash out and pay them back.  They also charge you almost $2 for an extra tiny bottle of syrup. That better be straight from a maple tree grown in the back of the restaurant, haha!

This place has the dullest menu, the most common food imaginable, and terrible atmosphere - at very high prices. The food isn't bad, but there's nothing to it - a burger, a Ruben, tuna salad sandwich... really? This isn't anything special -except the prices. Tuna salad sandwich with chips, which was no better than I make at home, for $13.00. Seriously, forget what you may have seen on TV, which is someone trying to find something interesting to makeTV, go somewhere that has better food - which isn't hard at all to find.
I love this place, even though it moved a while back. I liked the coziness of the original smaller venue, but the food is still awesome and unique.

I don't think I have anything to share that hasn't already been posted in previous reviews.  The food here is stellar - quality ingredients, great flavor, and nothing cookie-cutter. The atmosphere is comfortable and inviting. Service is friendly, quick, and everything one should expect.  I absolutely love visiting this place and encourage you to do so, as well, if you haven't already. I am one of the lucky ones who has never had to wait more than 60 seconds for a table - I'm not sure how that's worked out, but it has, and I'm grateful. That said, I would gladly wait an hour to enjoy some great breakfast fare at Matt's. I'm looking forward to trying lunch one day, too!

People have been raving about this place to me for the past five years.  I finally made it.  I could smell fresh  hashbrowns and pancakes cooking in the parking lot.  The pancakes were great, the hashbrowns were made to perfections.  The food is wholesome for the most part.  I ordered the special which was sausage and spinach.  The eggs were too buttery and watered down.  This was probably do to the fact the spinach was cooked down with too much fluids.  Instead of flipping the eggs so they were fluffy it appeared as the cooked took the end of the spatula and chopped the eggs.  Big mistake.  Orange juice was nice and fresh.  Overall is was not a bad meal but not the hype people made it up to be.  I met the owner who was very very nice.  She seemed to know how her food was cooked.  I just wish she looked at my plate before it went out.  The wait staff was not overly friendly and seemed a little blah for being a Monday morning.  Over all it was ok but not worth waiting in a long line like they normally have.  There are plenty of other places who will do a mediocre job and have better waitstaff.

Been to Matt's one time and that is enough for me to know this place is one of a Kind.  From the awesome friendly service, to the amazing meals, to the distinctly delicious honey lemonade and FRESHLY squeezed OJ, to the Fresh flowers on the table, Its truly a place I hope to make a habit of!

So for being featured on DDD, I expected a little more than what I got to be honest.  We arrived on a Sunday morning at 8:15 and waited a half hour, which I was fully expecting from the other reviews.  I was underwhelmed by the limited menu but understand that it has to be that way to turn the tables as fast as they need to in order to accommodate the crowd waiting outside.  My omelet was alright and my husband got the salami scramble which he did enjoy.  The sourdough toast, homemade jam and fragrant squeezed OJ was what I enjoyed the most.  I would recommend to visitors but honestly don't know if I would continue to come here and wait as a regular.

I was told so much about Matts big breakfast by friends and colleges before I made a months long work trip out to Phoenix. My wife and family ended up visiting my last week there so we checked this place out! Crazy long line and crazy long wait but once we got in service was quick and smooth customer service great! If you're looking for good food that is just simple and tasty and reasonably priced this is the place for you! Just get there as early as possible because that is by far one of the biggest and longest lines I've ever been in!

I'm sure you're asking how good can breakfast be? At Matt's it's the little things that count. Instead of giving you a piece of bread from a bag they give you a huge piece of fresh baked bread with real butter and homemade preserves. The organic eggs they use to make breakfast taste amazing and the syrup here puts Aunt Jemima to shame! Want to avoid the horrible wait everyone talks about? At Matt's the early bird gets the worm. Arrive between 6am-8am and you won't have to wait.

This is probably the only place I will eat at alone. The staff is so courteous, you don't feel like you're surrounded by strangers or uncomfortable.  Anyway, the food. That's what you wanna know about, right? I mean you're still reading sooo.  I've had a few things on the menu here. The Waffle, is incredible. I wish my vocabulary was better because I'm sure there's a word better than incredible. I also recommend the coffee, it's so damn good - im an avid coffee drinker. The bacon is large and thick, it's cooked perfectly and seasoned with crushed peppercorn, but in all honesty, I'm not a fan. Dunno why, can't explain it. The servings are huge and definitely a bargain for how inexpensive they are. The hash-browns aren't my favorite. They're crispy on the outside and soggy on the inside, but I guess it's just preference.

The first time I went here I thought it was a good Yelp pick.  The last time I went here I shelled out $18 for a scramble without meat, and a large OJ.  If you come here with a party of four your tab would be close to $80.  $4.50 for a large OJ that was probably bought at Costco for $5 a gallon!?  Food is good, but not worth the high cost  and wait considering the location is in an industrial area.  I have been to hundreds of restaurants world-wide and know what is a reasonable cost for your meal.  Diners and Dives made it popular, but now I think they are gouging the customer for their product.  Cashier tried to justify costs, but the #s just don't add up.

Everything we ordered was delish: waffles (is it malt in them? Idk, but it's great), bacon, the daily special with home fries and hashbrowns. Service was great. Only complaint is that most the seating are 2 seater tables. My party of 3 was squeezed onto a 2 seater, but... the food was so yummy I'd do it again anytime!

One and a half hour wait. Cement floors make this place louder than an active warehouse. Waitstaff was present for the order and dropoff but you have to beg for refills on coffee or cokes. Food was OK but heavy on the a la carte pricing and for breakfast, which makes a big margin, I found it expensive for basic fare.

Another DDD try, we had to come here twice. The first time it was just to crowded. Glad we came back. I really enjoyed the daily special, which changes every day. Also enjoyed the waffles. Wife and daughter enjoyed the usual eggs and hashbrowns. Very friendly service would come again!

The breakfast was delicious! Decor was cute and the people were VERY nice and friendly. I wanted badly to give this place a 5 star rating but what was terribly annoying was the noise level!!! We could hardly converse with our family at the table. Unfortunately the acoustics at this location need attention badly.....

Matts was recommended to us by some friends who are well familiar with the Phoenix area. apparently they have a few locations. This one is at Phoenix Sky Harbor airport (we were waiting for a flight). If you are at the airport and need a meal, you can't go wrong here.   We ordered the waffles, and a "Hog & Chick" (Two eggs, bacon, toast, potatoes). Fresh OJ to boot. I enjoyed the Hog&chick but the waffles are a better choice. Overall, not the greatest breakfast I have ever had, but for an airport, it's decent.  I have heard that the other locations are better. When I am back in town, I will try them.
A lot of hype around this place and they lived up to it! I had the salami omelet and was tasty. Their homemade jelly was so good. Highly recommend this place!

Well, the Yelp black hole strikes again! Wife, daughter, and myself ate here about six years ago. This was before we moved to the valley. What I can remember about this place, very small, limited seating, had to wait outside in the heat. With that said, food was great, service was very good. I had pancakes, OJ, I could remember daughter loved the eggs, bacon, and potatoes. I wife enjoyed the food also. Haven't been back, because how small it is. But as much I am at the airport. I have been to that location a few times.

I love Matt's big breakfast. I don't go there all the time. But any place that makes me drive a pretty good distance and wait in line just for breakfast! Must be doing something right. Went there this morning with my girlfriend. And we was greeted by a cute and very intelligent kid that was the owners son. Didn't have to wait to long but it was a nice day. I always get the griddlecakes when I go there. Ive never had anything even close to there's anywhere else. I can't give it 5 stars because of the wait and because its pretty small in there. And its always kind of weird eating breakfast next to a big window where people who are waiting outside can sit there and stare at you. I feel like im on display at a zoo eating. But those are minor gripes. I go to Matts for the food and the food never disappoints.

Another Yelp score for me. I stayed downtown and did a search. It wasn't far from the hotel so we walked over. The area was not looking like there'd be a highly rated food place but bang, there it was. Nothing overly fancy from the outside but man the food does not disappoint. There's a decent selection on the menu and the prices are very reasonable.  No matter what you order, try the thick cut bacon. It's excellent.

I'm going to sum up my own experiences and some Pros and Cons for people from reviews already posted, to give people a good starting information point.  I had the Chop and Chick.  It was great.  If you like breakfast pork chops, this one is top of the line.  The breads and jellies are great too.  The hash browns, crispy and buttery.  What I did not like is getting FLAT OUT RIPPED OFF with the TINY, TINY glass of fresh-squeezed orange juice they offer for $2.50.  I mean it's literally only about 3-4 ounces.  Tiny.  Grossly overpriced.  It's like they priced it like that to DISSUADE people from buying it.  Hate this about Matt's.  Pros:  Fresh, local ingredients, well-prepared and tasty. Many people say this is the best restaurant breakfast they have had, or among the best. People LOVE the buttery, crisp hash browns, and the home fries get a lot of praise also. Although the wait can be long, many people say it's totally worth it.  Cons: The wait can be soul-crushingly long.  The place is TINY. Stupidly overpriced orange juice. Fresh-squeezed, but JEEZ !!! Tiny parking lot also.  So, ingest all that info, and decide if Matt's is for you.    Happy Yelping !!!

Num num num its Bacon. Great breakfast. I had the waffle with Bacon and sausage. I saw this place on DDD and had to make the trip.  It was really busy and they do not have a lot of seating so be prepared to wait 15 - 20 mins on the weekend.  It doesn't sound like much but I went there early and hungry.  A must for Breakfast when you are in the area.

Oh, this place was worth the wait. My friends and I got there at 10:30AM and the wait was about 45min. Thankfully there was a farmers market across the street to keep me busy.   Matt's was very small and there were no bathrooms inside of building. Strange floor plan. I ordered a Cheese Omelet with peppers and ham, coffee, and OJ. The coffee was heavenly...it was what I've been looking for all morning. The OJ was surprisingly tiny...the glass was as tall my fingers, but it was very fresh. The omelet came with a side of home fries or hash browns and bread. I HIGHLY recommend the home fries, which is chopped potatoes cooked with onions and rosemary. I got the wheat bread which was delicious. This is not your typical plain/thin wheat toast!  The omelet was huge and so were the ingredients. The peppers which I thought was be sprinkled in like most places was actually a whole sauteed pepper. The ham was smokey and thick. The serving was pretty good for a $10 breakfast.   Overall, I think Matt's is superior to other popular breakfast joint such as the Breakfast Club or Orange Table. It was worth the wait, but I'll definitely be more strategic regarding the timing the next time around.
Solid food.  Pancakes are super fluffy and tasty.  The maple syrup is incredible.  Fresh oj yes! Really friendly staff. Will repeat.

Everyone knows that Matt's is one of the must-go places in Phoenix for breakfast, which is demonstrated by the long lines on the weekends and the rants and raves from out-of-towners.   The food is fantastic! I have never had a bad meal and the service is top notch. I love breakfast food, and Matt's knows exactly what they are doing!  However, I'm not sure I completely understand the popularity. I only go during the week because while its good, its not "waiting outside for an hour" good. There are a lot of great places in Phoenix for breakfast that are right in line with Matt's.   Don't get me wrong, if you pass by and there isn't a line, by all means get in there and get some bacon. But if there is too long of a line, walk a few blocks to Phoenix Public Cafe.

So yeah. Phoenix's favorite breakfast spot was a little disappointing. I would not recommend the home fries because they taste more like boiled potatoes nor would I suggest the pork chop due to it being undercooked  & flavorless.   It gets three stars because the toast and homemade preserves are to DIE for and they have awesome hash browns.   Would I give them another shot? Perhaps. Their prices are amazing. It could've been a bad day but I see potential.

You know how sometimes you hear about how good a place is so much that by the time you try it the hype is so high the place can't possibly meet your expectations? Well this is not that place. Matt's delivers on everything you have heard (sadly this includes the wait).  Matt's is basically your favorite local breakfast spot on steroids. Rather than a run of the mill piece of bacon it's a thick cut peppered slice cooked to perfection, that is from the Pork Shop (see my review on them) in Queen Creek.  The eggs? Yeah they are awesome.  On a recent trip I went and got the Chop and chick which was a couple of great eggs coupled with a slap of pork that was not only gigantic but super flavorful. The hash browns are about as perfect as hash browns can be crispy outside but not burned and great potato goodness inside.  The coffee here was also really good and exactly what a cup of regular old coffee should be.  Service was great and they are very quick to make sure you are taken care of. The prices are right in line with what they should be especially for the quality of the food.  Only thing is be prepared for a wait if you here as they are pretty busy especially on the weekends. But you are welcome to go inside and grab a cup of coffee while you wait.

Keep in mind, any time you're dining at the Airport, there are going to be some expensive prices that you'd definitely reconsider elsewhere. This is the case here. A burger and a drink (lemonade) cost $18.72 prior to the tip. Yikes! This is not "horrible" but at the same time it is higher than what I would have valued the food at.   Steak fries seemed to be prepackaged. Burger was "just ok." My friend asked what it would cost to add jalapenos to her burger and was told 2$ -- deary me, that was a no go, and put a bad taste in our mouths.   Service was slow on getting the food out. The server, however, was somewhat apologetic about it. All in all is was just an average/ok experience.

I've been hearing about this Phoenix institution for years and finally, on vacation, got to go. It lives up to its excellent reputation. I had the Salami Scramble, my son had the Chop & Chick. Both were superb. Service was quick and very friendly. Food fresh and delicious. Highly recommended.

I have no idea why this place is so popular? How do they have three locations?  These questions boggle my mind.  We ordered the bloody mary after seeing a picture on yelp.  I am always looking for bloodies with fun garnishes.  This one looked fun!  Every garnish was meh.  The cheese seemed like it was going bad, the olives were drying out and the pickle was the worst pickle probably in the history of pickling.  I love pickles! How does one make a mediocre pickle?  I did not think it was possible.  The best garnish was the celery LOL.  Oh, and the bacon was so yuck!  Moving on to the bloody mary.  Nothing special at all.  I ordered a veggie omelette with cheddar.  It was good.  I have had better omelettes.  It wasn't fluffy and the veggies were somewhat greasy.  My sweets had a burger and said it was overcooked and there was nothing special about it.  Like I said, I have no clue what is so special about this place.  All in all don't eat here expecting a fresh over the top delish breakfast.  Expect average truck stop food pretending to be something worth talking about.

The first few times I went to Matt's was at the old location and I instantly fell in love.  Cozy, friendly staff and bomb a$$ food! I mean that bacon, come on!   Everything I ate was always delicious and I loved that everything was made fresh and bought local, it shows in the quality even if it is only breakfast.    Unfortunately I wasn't so impressed with the food at their new location.  Maybe I just went on an off day?! Brought a few friends with me too who have never been and got tired of me raving about the food.  Sad to say that none of them were impressed and a few said they'd probably never go back :(    Please Matt, if you have changed anything since switching locations please stop! I loved you so very much before and now it may be a while before returning again....maybe

Hanging out here before our red eye flight. Cydnie was amazing!!! If you are ever in terminal B, stop in! She's friendly, warm, funny, and kind.  Airports can be nerve wracking but she's such a treasure!  Drinks were great too!!
Too trendy for it's own damn good. They refused to split a check. I really didn't experience anything that isn't available elsewhere with less hype.

Fun Bloody Mary,but  not the best tasting .I Will say I am a bit of a Bloody Mary snob I love the ones that you don't want to smile after you take a drink because your teeth will be full of stuff packed full of spices and goodies ... with that being said the salt around the rim was amazing nice smoky spicy flavor. The cheese was a new twist and it worked good it was a nice cheese. the olives were subpar as was the cucumber.( one cucumber looked old or once frozen and the other one was sooooo very salty and I love salt but couldn't eat this one.. AND IT COSTS  $15.00 EACH..
Really cute spot. Breakfast here was great (and definitely big). The rosemary potatoes were pretty amazing!

This was the FIRST place we ever ate once moving to the phoenix area. I had read many good reviews about it and that it was a MUST try. So we went around 9am on a Saturday. There was obviously a wait since it is a tiny but popular restaurant. So we waited outside for like half hour. But it was pleasant outside and we didn't mind.  Once in, we got French toast and waffles. And they brought out some great jams/jellies as well. The food was excellent. You could tell this place spends time on each dish and making sure it is perfectly cooked.  Great spot!!

Color me shocked. I didn't have high expectations for a place in an airport, now I feel like airports are going to be held to a whole new standard.
