I opted for a Bloody Mary - which hands down is one of the best I have ever had. A small meal in itself. I also went for an omelette with a side of potatoes. Those potatoes, so delicious. Well seasoned with rosemary, crispy on the outside, and perfectly soft on the inside. Paul was an amazing bartender. Hope my flights are all out of this terminal whenever I am in AZ!

Do not expect to feel like Dennys here.  It is a busy little mom and pop shop that produces some of the best breakfast food in town.  Everything tasted amazing and the portion size was almost too large.  The price was very fair for what I consider the best quality around.  My waitress Maritza was great as well.    I highly recommend this business to friends and family.

Ohmergawd I love the pancakes. I love it enough to wait in line and think its perfectly OK to stand outside in the AZ summer for it. The staff is polite and courteous to a fault. The wait, admittedly is the worst part. However they do have a water dispenser and benches for you while you wait and if you are willing to sit at the bar the wait really isn't that bad. They do use locally sourced cartel coffee and not any of that burnt junk from *sucks so that's an instant win. The coffee refills are pretty much limitless and they keep em comin' which given the amount of coffee I tend to drink is an awesome thing. They even offer to get you a to go cup if you wanted to get coffee to go after you are done eating.   Sure it is tight quarters and it is noisy but none of that is why i docked a star. I wasn't even done eating and my tab was at my table. I didn't ask for it, it just came up. That I thought was lame and hence the 4 stars. Not sure what the deal was but whatever.. i'll still go back.. those pancakes... mmm...yummy !

Ok, I am still dreaming about the fluffy, buttery pancakes I had during my last trip to AZ during Spring Training. Drooling now, as I think about it.   Besides the pancakes, everything else is pretty spot on. The chick and chop - delicious, tender, subtle herb seasoning pork chop w/ eggs on the side. The hashbrowns? Off the hook! Buttery and crispy. Bacon? OMG. Perfectly shaped, and wonderfully crisp.   And the service, for being as busy as it is, they make you feel right at home. Sure, the manager checks in with you towards the end, so she can gauge when you will leave the table, but it still felt genuine. Made us feel right at home, like a regular "veteran" - despite really only visiting once a year on our Spring Training trips.   See you next year, Matt. See you soon (but not soon enough).

I heard a lot about this place when the first one opened, but I don't do lines. Now that there are more of them I decided to try them. There was no line and not many people in the restaurant. My touchstone is biscuits and gravy, if you can't make those good, you probably can't make anything good.  I had their biscuits and gravy (Tuesday only). The first thing I noticed was that they were very spicy, I like spicy, the wife does not. I like a lot of sausage in my gravy, they had that. I likes me some good biscuits, these were ok. The thing I did not like was that there was not quite enough gravy to finish the biscuits. The eggs I ordered were exactly how I wanted them, the hash browns were pretty good, crispy on the outside kind of like mashed potatoes on the inside.  The did not have salsa. I like salsa on my hash browns. I tried their bacon since everyone raves about it. I would not call it bacon. Bacon has a smoky flavor, their bacon is peppered and because of that tasted like very tender beef jerky.

My brother and I came from out of town and saw the reviews on yelp so decided to make the trip. Best decision ever. Great service and great atmosphere but the food put it over the top. It's hard to differentiate yourself when it comes to breakfast but Matt's makes it happen. Butcher shop bacon, perfectly cooked steak and eggs, home fries that will knock your socks off. Even the toast was off the charts. Best breakfast place I've ever been too. Well worth the drive!!!

I don't feel like my visit here really compared to all the hype online! The ambience and way the room is set up is very strange. All the tables seem to be crowded, facing different directions and the seating is not comfortable. When my friends and I walked in we were told to seat ourselves and we were greeted by 3 different servers on separate occasions so it was very unorganized. The menu was underwhelming and the food was just decent. Wouldn't be my first choice for breakfast!

Cheese omelet: Potatoes were very tasty, but greasy (and I'm fine with some grease in my homefries). Good whole grain bread in the toast, but disappointing that there was no butter. Omelet overcooked, but much worse was that the cheddar cheese was chewy & stringy--somehow badly overcooked, which is difficult to do in an omelet. Very slow (albeit friendly) service, too--not good in an airport restaurant.

My question is, if the portions were not so huge would people still be giving this greasy spoon 5 stars. I guess if you are very simple in your tastes you could give this place five stars. It is breakfast with nothing special about it except for the names on the menu.   I figured it out, everybody is so goo-goo over it because its trendy! O wait maybe its because you wait outside for so long that you are even more hungover and so famished by the time you get in there that a goat turd would taste good. One more theory, the taste of the coffee made the food taste delicious.   Matt is very popular in the central Phoenix area so word spread like wild fire and he has been incredibly successful by serving good quality typical greasy spoon food, and I do think it is as simple as that.

Overrated, but if you are a downtowner it's a "thing." Don't get me wrong, it's good and you should probably decide to go once if you live in Phoenix to get to know the culture. By the time you wait to get seated in the mico diner you could have cooked up 5 course breakfast and three pots of coffee!

To preface I really enjoy when a restaurant has a nice ambiance, vibe, and awesome location. I love this is love located right next to Tempe town lake. With that said I got the salami scrambler and it really really turned me off. The service was average, and the only thing making me go back and try something new is the location and the way that the restaurant looks and feels.

The service was quick and excellent. I ordered the ham breakfast sandwich thing but was surprised that it wasn't an actual sandwich. They give you the bread on the side and you basically have to assemble the sandwich yourself which is impossible because the ham is HUGE! Not complaining because it lives up to its name, it's a damn big breakfast! I enjoyed the choice of sourdough, white or wheat bread which i chose wheat. Their honey lemonade is to die for !!! The eggs were eggs, I mean who can mess that up?! The hashbrowns however were terrible. Something off about the taste and they were incredibly soggy on the bottom! There's crazy road construction outside of this location so it's hard to hard and navigate to get to it. Their griddle cakes are amazing, good flavor to them and they are huge and fluffy ! Couldn't eat but just a bite

Our family enjoys eating breakfast at MBB's, the food is delicious and the staff are very attentive. However, we have noticed recently that management has been very unprofessional and sometimes lacking sincerity. Not a good look for a wonderful place...

Ordered a Bloody Mary at the airport. It had a meal with it! (Bacon, cheese, olives, pickles) Tasted great. However, was treated rather rudely by the waitress when trying to engage her to ask if I were to order a second, if they had one without all the food. Not impressed.
Love this place.  Simple menu and great food.  Totally worth the wait!

I've been coming here for a few years now and it is like coming home. I am greeted by name and the food is always great. The owners use local farm ingredients and I feel good supporting local people instead of a nameless, faceless chain restaurant.
The scrambled eggs with chorizo are absolutely delicious. The waitress is very hot.. very friendly service. Love the vibe!
Quality and quantity. Come with an appetite. Always seems busy but the service is still pretty quick.

I've been to Matt's a bunch of times when it was the small house on the corner and now at it's larger location. On the weekends there always seems to be a huge line. At least now they have more seating.   The food has always been great, but the line is always way too long. When we were there last, people were piling into the cashier area waiting inside because of the warm weather. They packed into the restaurant and crowded around us at the front counter. I definitely didn't like the feeling of people hovering over us while we ate. Some were even rude enough to be leaning on the counter that we were eating on. Overall not an enjoyable experience.  I like the overall vibe of the restaurant and the food, but because of the lines, I'd opt for another breakfast spot. The Valley has plenty of other amazing breakfast/brunch spots.
Yup this is it! Came back from Canada and 1st place I had to hit was Matt's! Always take my out of towners here!

To be fair, we went to Matt's based on the raveswe read on various sources.  Like the emperpr's new clothes, we fail to see what the hubbub is all about. I recently went to breakfast there and order a cheese omelet with home fries and wnet away hungry and very disappointed.  The home fries were mostly uncooked and badly seasoned,  The eggs were hard and disappointing and the toast was hard and cold.  This was very unsatisfactory and it is certain that Matt's Breakfast lives off its laurels and not the food.

I couldn't think of one thing wrong with this place or  with the service. It was my first time here and I actually had my puppy with me. The employees were so friendly. I got the blt and I was so impressed. The bacon is absolutely amazing. I gave this place five stars because I honestly didn't have any problems at all. I highly recommend it if you're looking for a nice environment and good food.

I loved Matts! We went around 7:30am and there was no wait, it was full but tables for two available! Short and to the point menu but still hard to choose because everything sounds great. I had a ham and cheese omelet with hash browns and toast with marvelous jam. Mom had the breakfast sandwich which she loved, the bacon!! Cant wait to go again, even if we live in east Mesa!

I consider myself an expert on breakfast. I know this place is all the rave, but I think it stinks. Let me list the reasons. First, the place is tiny. Second, you can never get in. Third, the food is OK, and their soda sucks; they serve RC! Fourth, the place is always hot in the summer. Fifth, when you finally get a seat it is uncomfortable (They serve fat people food, but yet their seating is set up for a 5'1" 100 pound girl). Sixth, it is a small neighborhood place so you would think people would be nice, but they are pretty stand offish. If you have ever been to nasty truck stop (versus a good one), this is the same type of food and atmosphere. Unless you are a yuppie and looking to slum it and want to say you experienced it, I suggest skipping this place.

Ate here during our layover. Usually, I prefer pancakes over waffles, but no protein was offered with the pancakes, so I chose the waffle since it comes with some bacon.  HOLY COW!  I actually set my fork down after the first bite. That was the best waffle I have ever had in my life. I usually don't react to food that way, and I wasn't happy with our somewhat rude waitress, so for the food to turn me around on the place that quickly is impressive, to say the least.  The waitress is the only reason I took a star away, and I'm willing to accept that we may have just caught her at a bad time. Unfortunately, we don't travel through that airport normally, so I'm not sure if I'll ever be able to go back and give them another shot.

This was the first time I had gone to Matt's Big Breakfast. I had heard some amazing things about it, outside of the fact that the wait times were horrendous, due to the fact that their original location was SO small. Low and behold, they opened up a second location, more than twice the size of their original one (still pretty small to be honest), so we HAD to try it.   We arrived at 7am on a Saturday morning, thinking we'd have NO issues getting in THAT early. We were wrong. We waited an hour or so... it could have been a longer wait though since our whole party didn't show up til 7:15ish. After the long anticipated wait, we finally ordered! Let me just mention, you really can't substitute or make many changes, if any, to your order. I ordered pancakes and wanted some blueberries, but was told no, lol. Regardless, the pancakes were super delicious! And they came with real maple syrup. Side note... use the syrup sparingly, asking for any extra will cost you an additional $1.50 :P  On another note, I heard their eggs benedict was AMAZING! Sadly, it's only a special and it wasn't on the day I went. I may just have to go again to try it!

I think everyone in Phoenix comes here for breakfast. Everyone. This place was packed with people eating inside, and with people waiting outside to eat. I probably waited 45-50 minutes to eat here. Was it worth it? Maybe. I had looked at the menu while waiting, so I knew what I wanted to order. I ordered the Chop and Chick, which is eggs made to order, and a pork chop, which I think they must use some sort of pesto rub or marinade. I had also heard about their strawberry lemonade, but they didn't have any that day! The server said they had blackberry lemonade, which also sounded good, so I ordered that to go with my breakfast choice.   The food came out pretty quickly. I had ordered my eggs over medium and my pork chop came with choice of hash browns or rosemary home fries and choice of toast (white, wheat, rye, and something else). I picked rosemary home fries and the wheat toast. The potatoes were delicious!!! Best part of the meal and I devoured every last piece. The rosemary flavoring was amazing. The wheat bread seemed to be made in house - it came in thick slices and was buttered. The server brought over (I think) blueberry preserves which went great with the toast. The pork chop was also really good, but the meat was a little on the dry side. I ate all of it, because I was really hungry after waiting almost an hour to eat. The lemonade was yummy but it was too sweet - would've been perfect if I added a little water to it.   Service was fine - it took a while to flag someone down to get the check and to pay.   Overall, I liked the ambiance - it's a cute and fun place, and obviously everyone likes to come here to eat breakfast/brunch. The piggy decorations are cute and I like the orange accents. What I ordered was okay - the potatoes were amazing. If I were to come back, I'd probably order something else (the Hog and Chick was the other one I was eyeing). They have a location at the Airport in Terminal 4, so perhaps I'll try to eat there and hope that it's not crazy busy.

This place has received a lot of hype, so be prepared to wait. and wait. and wait.  To make the trip more enjoyable: - don't actually come hungry (or risk passing out in the lot from low-blood sugar) - show up at least hour earlier than you want to be seated then get on list - go hang out  at the farmers market across street while you wait - expect solid (but not mind blowing) food  Go for the experience at least once, then find another breakfast spot.

Guy Fieri's recommendations never disappoint.   Came in with the expectation that this place would be good considering it was on the Food Network but my expectations were exceeded! Had the Salami Scramble which was DELICIOUS! The side of hashbrowns were AMAZING (maybe the best part of the meal) and I was pleasantly surprised the side of toast was a legit piece of bread, like something you would find at a bakery, and not just a slice of bread you could buy at the market. Eggs were fresh and light and the salami was perfection.   Only downside was that they made us wait outside for our table which was a little ridiculous considering it was 115 degrees outside. But I got nothing bad to say about their food.
I'm new to Matt's and I agree with the hype.  Great food, great prices, and now they're in the Biltmore area.  Definitely try this spot.  Great Food!
Matts Big breakfast is a quaint place to enjoy a simple meal.  Great location, easy parking and friendly people.

Good place for a classic breakfast. Service is quick and friendly. The menu is pretty basic but down really well. However there is always a crazy long wait which I don't really get. There is another Matt's big breakfast location and I would much rather go to that one since it tends to be less crazy! I just can't justify waiting an hour for a table at breakfast

Wish I  of found this place  years ago.   You'd never know it from the store front but if your looking for a great breakfast look no further.    Matt's is great. The staff is accommodating, the food is amazing, and the prices are very reasonable. The quality of the ingredients is evident in every bite. Matt's takes breakfast to a new level.  Matt's Big Breakfast is just that..BIG..  Matt's serves Classic breakfast food with a twist of unique combinations and freshness.  On my first visit I had the salami and eggs, home style potatoes  with sourdough toast and homemade peach preserves. All I can say about the peach preserves (which is made daily at Matt's) is   AMAZINGLY ADDICTING.  Try it Your taste buds will thank you.  So if you love breakfast like I do  give Matt's BIG Breakfast a try.

I have been here twice and both times I have enjoyed my meals and came away a very happy camper.   On my first visit, I tried the Chop and Chick, which was really good, but being I currently have braces on my teeth, I found the porkchop was a little hard for me to chew, but it didn't deter me from eating it. I also had their infamous Rosemary Home Fries, which are cooked in olive oil and Rosemary and SO DAMN GOOD!   This time, I had the Waffle, which came with bacon and I ordered a side of the Rosemary Home Fries. They are so addicting! The bacon as thick and cooked just the way I like it...and so tasty! MMMMMM MMMMMMM GOOD!!!  Got in and out of there this time within an hour and barely had a wait for a table but then we went earlier this time too. The first time, we waited I'd say between 20-30 minutes for a table but it as well worth it.   I recommend giving Matt's a try. This place is great and the service is excellent.
The place was packed.  The staff was friendly.  The food was huge portions,  it was ok not great.  Nothing special except the jam was really good.  We'd probably stop again if we were in the area .

Wish I would have found this place years ago.  You never know from the store front but if you're looking for a great breakfast, then look no further, Matt's is the place for you.  The staff at Matt's is accommodating, the food is amazing, and the prices are very reasonable.  The quality of the ingredients  is evident in everybite. Matt's takes breakfast  to a new level.   Matt's big breakfast, is just that, big. Matt's serves classic breakfast food with a  twist of unique combinations.   Today I had salami  and eggs, homestule potatoes, sourdough bread with homemade peach preserves.  All I can say about the peach preserve is it was absolutely delicious and it's made at Matt's daily.  If your looking for a great breakfast at a reasonable price give Matt's a try.

We arrived around 945am on a Tuesday morning.  There was already a line to get seated.  We didn't have to wait long to be seated.  It's a smaller place and very loud.  I had the special, sausage biscuits and gravy, eggs, and home fries.  The biscuit was gigantic and the sausage gravy full of sausage.  The eggs were cooked perfectly, over-medium.  I didn't like the home fries as they had too much rosemary and it overpowered the potatoes.  I did try the bacon.  It was very good.  The best part was the blueberry jam on toast!  Excellent blueberry flavor!

Very odd location (in the middle of a corporate park), but DELICIOUS food. As my husband said, "It tastes like a home cooked meal." Everything seemed fresh and made from scratch--even the bread and OJ. We each got omelets. I got the hash browns, he got the breakfast potatoes. Both great, but I'm a sucker for hash browns. The service is friendly and there's a fun, casual vibe. We both agreed it was the best meal experience we had in Tempe.

The food was great, the staff was okay, and the specials were confusing. I thought I order the correct thing until I looked at the chalkboard and realized I had to be that annoying patron that wants to change everything about a special because the server didn't inform me of the special.

I ate breakfast here on the 4th of July. Honestly, the food is decent (nothing special)-it's also overpriced.   MBB is a small restaurant that always has a line out the door and around the corner, but since I've eaten here, I really don't understand why.  Maybe everyone's visiting Phoenix like me????  I highly recommend going to LoLo's, it's better (more options and taste wise), and you get more bang for your buck. A stranger (Phoenix resident) also leaned over to tell me that LoLo's is definitely the better option.

Matt's Big Breakfast lived up to it's name! We definitely had a BIG yummy breakfast. My husband had the sirloin special*picture posted. Which he absolutely devoured. I enjoyed their basic breakfast with bacon. I wish I would have snapped a pic of the thick bacon. Great food, reasonably priced, and fast friendly service!

I'd heard so much about Matt's and couldn't wait to try it. I was surprised that the place wasn't full during lunch. I expected to at least have a short wait since I'd heard how popular Matt's is.  We went out for lunch knowing we'd have breakfast. Service was good but I was underwhelmed with the selection. Yeah, I know, it's breakfast. My egg sandwich was just average as well. My colleagues' meals looked good and maybe I just made the wrong choice. I'm not sure I'd try this place again. If we're in the area, maybe.   Tip: for those not working in one of the buildings at this location, there is parking just north of Matt's don't try this before attempting to park in the structure. We happened to luck out.

This place came highly recommended.  Perhaps my expectations were too high.  They have a boring, uninspired menu. Nothing special. The food itself was fine.  It was fresh, and they apparently use all-natural organics.  We had the special Denver scramble. The home fries are chunks of pan-fried potato. Lots of rosemary.  But the flavors just weren't very exciting or bold.  The strawberry preserves were very good, as was thick cut toast.  Yes, the toast is worth mentioning.  Cut thick, toasted to perfection.  And the bread itself is a really good bread.  I doubt I will return.  If I'm going to go out for breakfast I would choose someplace that features bolder flavors, like The Farmhouse in Gilbert.  My wife liked it better than I did.  It's really not bad, but if I'm going to go out and pay for a meal I prefer something less pedestrian.
Hand down, the best breakfast place in town. I love the weekly special and the waffle here. Came here every other weeks for the last 3 year!

And Babe Ruth lines up to the plate and points to rafters in the outfield...and the pitch- it's hit deep-it could be- IT'S GONE! HOME RUN!   My party and I arrived during the bustling Sunday brunch rush around noon and waited about 30 minutes for our table. When we arrived at our table we were greeted by a very attentive and soothing server and surrounded by a cozy yet comforting ambiance. Our server was fantastic in her suggestions on food choices and when my friend declined the toast that came with the meal, she suggested that we get it anyway as the bread is speculator. Our server was correct. The toast was thick, fluffy, and delicious with just the right amount of butter and a side of fresh in house strawberry preserve. The breakfast menu is limited to around 8 or 9 items but every dish we ordered was damn near perfection. I ordered the rib-eye and eggs and could not be more satisfied. The steak was juicy and seasoned with just enough to give a great flavor without being bland or overbearing. I will be coming back to frequent this wonderful restaurant for many a brunches to come. Well done Matt's Big Breakfast, well done!

Food looked good & smelled good. Place was packed with people enjoying their food. Tuesday's special is biscuits, gravy, eggs, potatoes & bacon. Unfortunately I don't eat eggs or gravy. They don't sell their biscuits any other way, so I had a choice of paying for the gravy & eggs too or not getting any biscuits at all. I go to restaurants so I can eat exactly what I want...so I didn't get biscuits, or anything else except the coffee I had unfortunately already ordered & the fee I paid to park at the meter because their lot was full. I'm bummed.

I thought this place was great! The wait wasn't that long at all, coming from NY I have seen alot worse. The actual restaurant itself is very small, obvious reason for the wait.  I ordered the Special of the Day - Huevos Rancheros along with an order of Griddle Cakes, both were quite delicious. Overall, the only negative was the wait which again wasn't as bad I was expecting.   I definitely will come back to this place, guaranteed a good breakfast.

Exceptional customer service, the waitress was very friendly and helpful. Delicious food!!!! All of the ingredients used are natural and of quality. They buy from local suppliers when possible. I had the Griddle Cakes, to die for! Especially when they have me handmade strawberry jam. I definitely suggest these if you love pancakes. I wish their floors would have been cleaner, but I can only imagine how hard it is to maintain them when they are extremely busy. Definitely check it out! My friends from out of town truly enjoyed it.

Matt's Big Breakfast truly lives up to the hype. Friendly staff even when the place is Uber busy. The host is amazing, food was great and don't expect jam from a little plastic tub their stuff is awesome. We will be back.

This Matt's 'Big' Breakfast location is actually very small, and loud.  But the service is very good, a bit chaotic but friendly.  The average breakfast of eggs, bacon, sausage is nothing special (but bacon and toast are thicker).  If that's all you're interested in, you might get a better deal at a Denny's or IHOP that's less crowded.  However, if you go for their more interesting dishes, that's where Matt's shines. People really like the french toast and pan cakes with REAL maple syrup, large hash-brown portions, beautiful omelettes, homemade preserves and more.  Matt's was also featured on 'Diners, Drive-ins and Dives'
The food at Matt's is great, and you'll expect it to be based on the wait and the reviews. The portions might not be quite as big as the name, or especially the price, might suggest.
This place is great!!!!!! Great food,  fast service and fresh food.   If I'm ever in the Phoenix airport again I'll be back
THE LINE IS HELLA LONG!!! so is the wait!! other than that I thought it was good..... Oh yah phoenix is hot.... and you will be standing in line outside!

Overpriced is my first thought. Overall our food was good and service was friendly and all but I wasn't going "wow" because of the price. I don't mind paying for large portions or something super good but $7.50 for a couple pancakes is too much for my retired wallet.

Great Food ! Attempted Matts in downtown Phoenix this past Monday, lines up and down, had company, couldn't wait. Today we were determined to get to Matts so we found location  nearer our home on Camelback, 1:30 arrival, safe, not as busy.  Service very sweet, friendly, everyone was soooo nice. Simple menu, simple operation, and everything we ordered was hot, fresh, so good, we ate too much, worth it though. Waffle, delicious, bacon perfect, coffee excellent, it was flawless, and the service was genuine, such a pleasure to discover a non chain feel (so done with chainy experience) I cannot wait to return to Matts again. Manager was very attentive and very hospitable, Great Job, see you soon.

I almost didn't stay to even find out how the food was because of the rude bald guy. I don't know if he's the host or an owner or a manager...I didn't see any kind of name tag or anything. We walked in, stood there for a bit, then bald guy greeted us. We asked for a table for 2. He replied "Ok...it'll be a bit of a wait." We asked about how long. He replied "I really have no way to tell". Seriously?? I mean, restaurants of all types and sizes have been giving approximate wait times since the beginning of time. You can't give me a ballpark? 5 minutes? 5 hours?? Something??? I was parked at a meter and had already paid for an hour so I decided to wait at least a little longer since parking was paid for. Had I been in a free parking place, we would have left for sure. We sat on a bench out front behind an old guy with a big fake boob lady whose backs were facing us...he kept putting his thumb inside her panties and molesting her butthole. They continued inside the restaurant as well. I'm sure this entertainment helped us pass the time, but unfortunately they probably aren't there all the time so your wait might be more boring.  Thankfully bald guy wasn't our server. We got Britney (dunno if it's spelled right, sorry!). Britney was fantastic. She was friendly (which is something I wasn't expecting because of reading other reviews while waiting for the...maybe 15-20 minutes it took for us to get a table.) She made great recommendations and was very prompt and pleasant. She is the only reason I give 3 stars instead of 1 or 2.  The food was...decent. The bacon was kind of thick and floppy for my taste. I like crispy bacon, but to each his own. The special was decent, the waffle was edible but not great by any means. The hash browns were delicious and tasted like buttery mashed potatoes inside. It was stuff I'd eat again but wouldn't see myself craving and traveling across town for.

Open early for breakfast. Ordered steak and eggs. Medium well came out bloody and blood on eggs. Server noticed it when he got to table and asked if it was ok? Was not. He took back and made a comment "our cook is really bad". After overcooking steak brought back to me with cold eggs still covered in blood. Not my best experience.

YUMMY breakfast spot! Matt and his wife are super nice and the food is excellent. Tried the porkchop breakfast and it was soo good. Even Guy Fierri from foodnetwork thinks its the best breakfast he's ever had!   The restaurant is really tiny but didn't wanna take away a star for that cuz its definitely worth the wait. The homefries are reallly good too and you get that on the side with almost every dish anyway. =)
We love this spot for breakfast. The food is delicious and the service is even better. Also Vince is adorable

I would have given this a better review, but the hostess knew my friend and apparently had a personal issue with her and chose to skip us several times on the waitlist intentionally. I brought this up with a manager finally when people who were just walking in were being sat after we had been waiting for 20 minutes. Given it was a Sunday morning, we knew we would be waiting, but not after people who were under us on the waitlist and who we witnessed walk in and put their name down after us.  Once we were finally sat, I am not sure if our server was super busy or forgot about us, but a manager ended up taking care of us the entire time. The chocolate milk claimed to be organic, but when I got it, it was poorly mixed with syrup which I do not like at all. They use ghiradelli apparently to mix it, but still, mention on the menu that it is not organic or that it is made with ghiradelli chocolate syrup.  I got the waffle with berry compote and it was very yummy and I had a side of bacon which was amazing as well. Had it not been for the start to our meal, I probably would be rating this restaurant at least 4 stars, but the experience starts the minute you walk in the door. Being rushed to sit in a section where the server was not ready was not exactly what we were hoping for either. I would love to say I'll give this place another try, but I probably won't. The parking situation is sort of annoying since you have to park in the garage and have a two hour limit before it's not free (no validation needed) and the walk is not really enjoyable either.

We've been here a couple of times and have always loved what we've ordered. Bacon is THICK. Coffee is GREAT! And most (if not all of their ingredients are local. Bread comes from Wildflower Bakery, coffee is from a local distributor in North Phoenix, meats come from local supplier in Queen Creek and owner's wife makes the preserve spread herself from local fruit  in season.   #1 Best LOCAL Classic American Breakfast

Great breakfast at Matt's Big Breakfast.  Arrived at 9:20 on a Friday, perfect timing to avoid the morning rush.  It was busy but we were seated right away.  Went for the Friday scramble.  Home fries were very flavorful with carmelized onion.  Eggs and sausage also very good.

We were in Phoenix visiting relatives and met for brunch.  I had the 'fav 5' or something like that... it's a breakfast sandwich.  Best $5 breakfast sandwich I ever had.  Everyone else seemed to like the food and all of us said we would eat here again.    Food: Good food.  Worth the wait!    Service: Good service.     The complaints: We were seated in the stock room.  We were constantly interrupted when they needed to get into the fridge and the room itself was very warm.  The main part of the restaurant seemed cooler, but louder.  Even so we would still recommend this place.

It was good. Reasonable price for extremely large portions. Constantly very busy. Friendly staff. Kind of feels like they're trying to rush you in and out. Tasty food, but nothing I'd insist someone to experience.

As soon as we got word that class was canceled for the day we hit road with one destination in mind: Matt's Big Breakfast. This was my first experience with Matt's; my classmate is a little more cultured that I am, so he knew the ropes from previous experiences.   There really isn't a lot that the general public can use for parking near the restaurant, but I used my university parking pass to park in the ASU lot right across the street. Even though we went on a Tuesday morning the place was still packed. But the 20 minute wait wasn't bad because the weather was as nice as the outdoors waiting area.   Once we were seated (in pretty close quarters I might add) our waitress took our drink orders almost immediately. I got the honey lemonade which was such a great (and different) combination.   My classmate and I ordered the same breakfast entree: the five spot sandwich with a side of homestyle potatoes. Sweet Mary, the bacon on the sandwich was literally perfect. Everything tasted fantastic and complimented each other so well.   I will eat here again whether or not my class has been canceled!

You better have a LOT of time on your hands. Waited 29 minutes for my breakfast sandwich, and the finally asked for my money back. That took an additional 10 minutes, during which time the sandwich still never came out. Finally got my money in time to barely jump on my plane. The best part is on top of everything I was ace to feel as if everything was my fault somehow. Not one "sorry for the inconvenience" or anything of the sort. Every single person I encountered including two managers (?) were completely rude.   Great way to spend my 45 minutes in Phoenix.
The place to have breakfast when you are in Tempe! The food is great as is the service. Not wild about the office building location but don't let that stop you.
This great breakfast spot is now open on Mondays too!  YUM!!!!

If you are ever in the downtown Phoenix area I highly suggest you drop in on this retro/modern diner that was featured on Guy Fieris Diners, Drive-ins and Dives.I have been in phx area for 10 yrs and finally decided to try this critically acclaimed diner. Aside from being slightly difficult to find (my inability to give directions, lol), Matts is an excellent healthy alternative to your run of the mill breakfast places. I went on the thursday morning prior to Superbowl 49 expecting lines to be around the corner even though it was close to 10 am. Although busy, our party of 3 didnt have to wait at all.  While ordering and eating it became busy enough that people began to have to wait.  I chose to order the cheese omelet with mushrooms, onions and sausage. I also had  their hash browns, wheat toast and coffee.  where do I begin? The coffee is so good that it needs little if any sugar in the raw (rather than processed) or milk (organic).  The toast is thick and grainy (aka awesome) and best of all not processed. To accompany the great toast was a sweet yet all naturally made on site raspberry preserve. I was informed that this was a rare occasion that they were sering the raspberry as they normally serve strawberry or bluberry also both all natural and delicious (im guessing).  The first few bites of both the omelet and hash browns threw me for a loop until I figured out that I was tasting or rather wasnt tasting artificial cooking oils or grease (which unfortunately Im used to). I was actually TASTING the food. I typically do not care for hassh browns because they tend to either be too dry or not dry enough but these were perfectly done with just enough crisp and moistness....no need to add anything other than a bit of hot sauce.  The omelet was thin and large enough to hold all the cheddar cheese, onions, and mushrooms. Unfortunately either the waitress didnt hear me order the sausage or the cook forgot to add them to the omelet. Had the sausage been in the omelet I think they would have needed a third egg to hold all the additions. The atmosphere on this particular day was one of turn and burn (aka busy) and locals, and out of towners.

Waited a half hour on a Sunday afternoon to try this Phoenix hotspot. Mostly a young crowd (this location was close by an ASU campus), I would guess they are drawn by good eats at good prices. I ordered the Sunday special, a nicely trimmed center cut sirloin steak, two eggs, home fries and sourdough toast with homemade strawberry preserves. The steak was cooked to order perfectly (medium rare), the home fries, eggs and toast were equally good. My wife ordered the Niman ranch hamburger with thick sliced bacon. Unfortunately, it came to the table well after my meal came and then had to be returned because it was underdone. By the time a properly cooked replacement arrived, I had already eaten my meal(at my wife's insistence!).  On the plus side, the burger was delicious and she yummied it up. No less than three of the staff members apologized for the mishap and the manager let us know he was taking the burger off the bill, even though we never griped about the delay.   I am from out of town, but I'm loving Phoenix hospitality! I would definitely return to Matt's; hoping I get the opportunity during my short stay here.

Good breakfast. Be prepared for a wait list. Also limited parking, so you may need some coin for a parking meter down the street. Very small interior, don't bring a group. Gotta try Matt's Big Breakfast at least once.

Overall the food was pretty good but no kids menu. Thumbs down on that one. Had to order from full menu for my 4 yr old and she hardly ate it.  I went here a few weeks ago.   My negative review has to do with families with small kids me being one of them I went to change my 6 month old and went into the restroom where I saw there was no changing table.  This was a newer restaurant and I was appalled that I had to change her on the floor. The handicap stall was large enough where a table could've placed on the wall. After changing her I looked for the manager.  He said it was not his doing and if I would have said something before changing my daughter he would have had me go behind the barn door where they store chairs etc and i could change her there.  That's horrible too.  He apologized to me again on the way out and proceeds to tell me they are getting one installed soon but yet he didn't tell me that earlier. I would be curious if someone can tell me one was actually installed.  Other females in the bathroom also said this was bad as they saw me in the floor with my child.  Luckily I had all my stuff with me so she wasn't entirely on the floor.

Two airport employees recommended this place. It's the only sit down in the American Airlines terminal, and I was just trying to get my contractions to stop after my mad sprint to my flight after the connecting one was late. I got a meal voucher out of it *le sigh*  I really like that there's outlets pretty much everywhere you sit. That is awesome. Service was fast. I got a honey lemonade... which tasted like.. uhhh.. honey lemonade. It was off, but that's totally my fault.  I got the Sweet and Savory, which was French toast and apple sausage. The entree was no bueno. I am not reviewing to James Beard winner status, but it's a few rungs below IHOP and Denny's. I didn't finish my food, and I'm totally pregnant and exhausted. Something in the execution or the recipe went horribly awry.   Food and drink: $16 something.

Perfect local restaurant for breakfast. Be prepared to wait. We came in on a Friday morning and it was packed. I had the hog and chick... Fantastic. Thick cut peppered bacon that's delicious. If ur a fan of bacon give this place a try. Love the ambience. Fits in the downtown area real nice.

Was looking forward to this place because we visited another location which was great. But the service was very poor, we asked the waitress to move us from the bar because the chairs were very uncomfortable and she 'pretended' to go ask the hostess and never got back to us. The food was not the greatest either. There was a hair on my toast, the bacon was over cooked, the eggs really runny and the hash brown very hard to break through and eat. Will definitely not come back to this location.

Holy pancake orgasm, Batman!    The richest. smoothest. buttery-est, fullest, fluffiest, tastiest cooked-to-perfection pancakes you'll ever eat. Those of us who haven't had the pleasure of dining at Matt's thought we knew a good pancake... WRONG!  Matt's is where it's at, 1/2 hr-1 hr wait and all (We were seated in 1/2hr Tuesday @ 10am).    The restaurant is very busy, so one cannot expect the servers to build rapport with the customer.  Rather it's more important they keep my coffee and OJ full with a smile, which they did well.  I had the ribeye, eggs and home fries, which was one of the specials of the day.  While my steak was cooked medium when I requested medium-rare, it was delicious, well cooked and seasoned to perfection.   Eggs over easy done text-book as well, fresh, hot and you can't get any better.  The portions on most of the orders seemed small, so we had to order some sides which drove up the bill total.  The menu can be inexpensive if you just order one thing, but there are so many great things to try!.. like the fresh strawberry preserves!  Hands down this is best breakfast gem in Arizona and I can't wait until we can go back!

We have been here a few time, really hard getting in, expect a line because its that good.  I have had their  Chop-N-Chick; eggs and pesto pork chop, let me tell you, that is one dish you need to try. I tried it because it was on Triple D, Guy would never send us down the wrong path. It is a bit pricey, but the food is worth it.   Homemade jam. I understand that everything is all fresh, they don't even have a freezer, shipped fresh and organic every morning. 4 stars instead of 5 is for the gluten free options. When we are in the area in the morning, we will be back for our breakfast fix.

The waffle was so light! Homemade sausage exploding with flavor and home fries that make you lick your plate!!  I'm so mad that I didn't find this place when I was in Phoenix before!  This restaurant has made my top 5 restaurants in the country!

3.5 stars!  There is a huge hype about this place. It was featured on tv. I get there early to eat here with my brother in law and there was a half hour wait. While we were waiting, a huge line started forming to the outside of the restaurant around 8:30am on a Friday.   My brother in law had the special of the day, which was a chipotle jalepeno sausage and cheddar scramble served with potatoes and a tortilla instead of toast. I ordered the Salami scramble. I liked his dish because the chipotle sausage was spicy and full of flavor! My Salami scramble was good, but on the salty side. The salami was cut similar to fries, in long rectangular thick pieces. For some reason, I expected thin slices, but it was good all the same. The "home fries" looked more like a hashbrown cassarole and were much, much better than the regular breakfast potatoes. The home fries were my favorite part about being there, more than the salami scramble itself.   The side of sourdough toast that came with my meal was impressive. The toast appeared to be nearly 2 inches thick, and that was a single slice! It was served with a savory homemade marmalade.   The owner and the servers there were very friendly, and despite the chaos of the line of people waiting and people constantly checking to see if a spot opened up yet, the staff handled it very well! That alone I give them 4 stars.   For being a big breakfast, I'd say that my dish was just the "right portion size for me." For some place with big breakfast in the title, if the portion is just right for me, that means that the dish is on the smaller side.   After telling about my experience to another friend, who adores this restaurant, I guess I was supposed to order the pancakes, because they are ridiculously good. I've yet to experience those pancakes. If I'm in the area, I will definitely stop by this place again and give it another try, but I'm not sure if it's worth the 40 minute drive from where I live to wait another hour to get a table once I get there, so that's why I took away half a star, but I still really like the place.

We ended up here after our late evening layover flight dropped us off.  We had an hour and a half to kill, so we wandered about the Phoenix Sky Harbor airport unsure what eatery or drinkery to patronize.  Many places were somewhat busy, but Matt's Big Breakfast was spacious enough to draw our attention.  Even though Matt's advertises breakfast, they have a full bar also!  This was our first official day of vacation and decided to celebrate with a cocktail. We found room at the bar and ordered drinks.  I got a Patron Tequila Sunrise, while Joe K ordered a Captain Morgan rum & coke.  They actually offer you choices of premium brand liquors.  Our beverages came in ample sized glasses and they really hit the spot, quenched our thirsts and gave us a mellowing buzz.  Joe was not feeling well and was having a hard time relaxing, so the cocktails were a welcome availability.  Even though our drinks cost $14.00 each, it was a nice splurge that we don't often indulge in.   As for the food, I can't form an opinion on, but other patrons received some delicious looking meals.  And yes, those breakfasts were quite big!  If we were hungry and had more time, I would have definitely tried out their breakfast!

Rated one of the best breakfast spots in AZ!  I can see why.  The downtown location is the original location and the one you want to go to.  They have a small menu which is good because they are great at what they make so you do not need a big menu.  All there food is made from scratch which is exactly what you want.  Homemade food.  The one item i suggest to get is the waffle which comes with butter, real syrup and 2 strips of bacon.  It is simple and will knock your socks off!    BrandonFitFoodie
Ate at the Matt's in the airport, excellent food! Will go to the downtown location when I get back to Phoenix!

After reading the reviews, I had to try it and All I can say is Really? 45 minute wait, limited menu (not too healthy either).  The hashbrowns were burned on the outside and undercooked on the inside, eggs were a little runny for my taste, toast was cold and the bacon was burned.  Would not recommend

Was my first time here but didn't know it was on DDD. (Diners, Drive Ins, & Dives). The orange Juice is  and the bacon is peppered. The OJ  is the best I've ever had. I hate has browns but this is the only place I will eat them at. When I go to IHOP or Denny's they just sit on my plate. The construction  might deter you from coming in. But please don't pass this place up. They have breakfast specials as well. I sat at the bar because all the tables were full. The service was really fast. I could have sworn that the food was already prepared, but that wasn't the case. This place has my vote. I wish there was one in North Phoenix.

Contrary to the reviwers below...I love Matt's. Yeah the wait is long...the place is small...once I went in the summer and I was sweating in my coffee...  BUT....  This is Phoenix people. When the breakfast choices are a tasty meal at Circle K (heated under heat lamps) or Denny's and IHOP, you can't beat Matt's.   I love breakfast. I eat breakfast everywhere I travel on business. I have never had a better breakfast than at Matt's. Fresh ingredients, great food, excellent bread and jam...kick $ss hashbrowns.  I wish the place was bigger (and cooler) and the wait not so long. But as a special breakfast treat...you can't beat it.  Just bring your own fan.

Yea, it's okay. A little stuffy in there--lots of tables placed closely together and very loud because of it. I had the 5-Spot. Meh, it was okay. Nothing too exciting. The service took a long time. I was running late so I had my co-workers, whom I was meeting up with, order for me. I arrived 10 minutes after the order had been placed and we still waited another 15 minutes for our food. Very basic. Nothing exciting. I'd go again but only if invited by someone else.

So my hubby and I found ourselves in this area and the first place on my yelp search is this one... and we may had not paid much attention to it, but it sounded like a place a friend had just mentioned a few days back so we decided to try it... You know those little things that set a place apart from the others? this one is full of those! the tap water tastes good, the glasses are quaint and beautiful. The home potatoes had tasty herbs, I ordered eggs and pork chop and the pork chop seemed to have something like pesto. The Wheat bread was better than I ever had, and instead of jelly, real blueberries... I could go on and on. Yes, the place is tiny, and perhaps a little pricey, but I think it is worth it. Service was great too. And since we were there at the right time, we didn't have to wait to be seated, neither had trouble parking. Good luck and enjoy.

Came here for brunch. Waited about 20 mins outside to get a seat. Ordered their chick and chop it was good! Shared a waffle with a friend and it was delicious! Real maple syrup was to die for! I was gonna order french toast with maple sausage but it's only part of their specials depending on the day. Hence the 4 stars. Overall, food that I ordered did not disappoint!

A solid 4.5 stars for this downtown Phoenix breakfast joint!!  I went with the 'daily special' (which was erased and replaced by a different breakfast dish before I was done eating, sooooo . . . maybe it's more of an hourly special?).  Eggs Benedict with hash browns.  I also added nourbon cherry sausage and a side of toast.    Everything was phenomenal.  I've got absolutely nothing to complain about regarding this place.    I'll finish with the strongest compliment I can pay a restaurant which is this:  I'll be back.
One of the best breakfast we ever had. The hash brown has so much flavor that its so worth it to drive downtown just for this. dAt potato, i would recommend to anyone.

Stopped at Matt's Big Breakfast in Tempe Friday morning at 8:30 May 19th. Was confused with the set up, no hostess around.  Finally a guy came from the back. We asked to sit outside which we did. Waited a few minutes and asked the same hostess if we would get service outside. He rudely answered and said you just got here, what do you expect, there will be someone out here! We just didn't know if it was a full service or of we had to order at the counter. It was quite embarrassing with his tone of voice! Rude people like him should never work as a hostess!

I ordered the omelet with 3 cheeses and home style fries. I asked if they could add grilled onions and raw onions and they did!!It was so good. Everything taste so fresh! The people were so friendly and I had the best server, Darnell.

visiting the area and got this recommendation from yelp. One of the best breakfasts I have had.  The food came out hot and fresh cooked. I had a basic breakfast eggs, potatoes and sausage, good good good.  not much to look at from the exterior but this was a great breakfast.  only reason no five star, canned soft drinks.

Matt's Big Breakfast is quite an institution in Phoenix, absolutely the place to go for breakfast. It's great to see the same quality, efficiency and competent wait staff replicated at the airport here. The three point breakfast made for a great lunch, waitress Toni was attentive and helpful, service was quick and the food very solid, not fancy, but tasty and nourishing. Fresh avocados rounded out a two eggs with meat sandwich and rosemary tomatoes. Airport food in general has come such a long way, but Matt's stands out.
Nothing worse then a cook that can't make eggs over-medium. Potatoes were good but the Thick cut bacon is seasoned with way to much pepper.  Nice friendly staff. Will have to try something different.

Another downtown joint I hadn't bothered reviewing because it's such a part of my regular routine.  I love hash browns and Matt's is a hash brown lover's paradise. I don't know exactly how they cook their eggs; I just hope that whatever they do, they keep doing it. It's tasty.   I have friends from Tucson who crash at my place on an occasional weekend, and every Sunday morning before they head back to the Old Pueblo, they insist on my taking them here. They're as addicted as I am.   Long lines on Sunday mornings so expect a wait and bring good conversation topics with you.  NOTE: MrK took some great shots of the place that you can see above. His last interior shot does indeed have Matt in the background, and the very cute Gretel toward the right (she also waitresses at the Roosevelt).
Recommend. I ordered the classic breakfast with bacon. Best hash brown ever had. Really nice coffee. However, my gf does not like the oats she ordered.
This place does have really good breakfast, the homemade jelly and hash browns are pretty good. But the 12oz OJ for $4.50 is ridiculous!!! I know it's fresh squeezed but really?

Breakfast is consistently good! I usually get the ham and cheese omelette with potatoes. My favorite part is the buttery sourdough bread with homemade strawberry jam. It's the main reason why I come to this place. It's amazing!  There's usually a wait time but we've never had to wait more than 15 minutes. The food is always out surprisingly fast and most of the servers are really nice.

I have been a customer for many years but I was only compelled to write a review today. There are a few things I want to address.   First, the menu is extremely limited. I don't feel that the quality and presentation are up to par for such a limited menu. If you serve few things, those few things should be executed with perfection.   Next, there is most always a wait here. I have seen the crowds and lines on the weekends. I never visit on the weekends because I don't believe that it is worth the wait. You can usually score a table with 5 mins or less wait during the week days, but you do need to arrive early.   Now let's talk service. I consistently get trash service here. It's just one square room where the servers can see you all the time but seem to just avoid your eyes when you try to catch their attention. My drinks have always sat empty, even the water! They are always rushed and don't make friendly conversation. The one compliment I do have is that the food is always FAST here. The kitchen has their act together.   Last, it is loud in there. The metal chairs scrape on the concrete floors, and those sounds combine with three dozen or so different conversations and kid noises. It is labor intensive to have a conversation! I don't want to have to scream at breakfast like it's a nightclub.  This is allegedly a Phoenix great, but not for me. The food is okay, the service is bad, and the atmosphere is better than when it was in the little house, but still not good.

I ordered the "Five Spot" breakfast sandwich and orange juice.  The sandwich was good, nothing spectacular but good quality food.  Fresh squeezed orange juice was good.  Nothing memorable but I would come back for the good quality ingredients, if in the area.  The place is very loud with everyone doing their own thing.  There is a little bit of a line on Saturday mornings but the wait didn't seem to be too long for most people, maybe 15 minutes.

***300th Review***  This place is so nice, we went there twice!!!  I was on my own for breakfast one morning and had read awesome things about this place. I am so glad I went!  Service was friendly and lightning fast!  I went with the recommendation of the server, and got the special: 3 Eggs Scrambled with Wisconsin Cheddar, Chipotle Sausage, and fresh jalapenos.  So simple and so fricken good! OMFG!  The fresh jalapenos were so spicy and yummy!  It also came with hash browns.  I know this is a simple thing, but, seriously, I've never had better hash browns in my life. I also had to order a side of bacon and am so glad I did. YUM!  Good coffee to go with all this too.     Later in the day, the hubby got out of his meeting early so we went to grab lunch there!!!  He loved the Reuben: its flavor, quality and quantity of meat, etc.  Had more hash browns and bacon =)  and tried the waffle. Tasty!  I would go here every week if I lived here. Matt's really has a commitment to local, fresh ingredients and it shows in the food and how buy this place can get!  Am so glad I didn't have to wait for a table though...

Great, great spot to wait for your plane if you're in Terminal 4. When I went to Phoenix ages ago (and ate carbs with no abandon), this was my favorite place in Phoenix!  Now that I don't enjoy the pancakes or the hash browns, I am still glad to post up at Matt's, enjoy some of their delicious peppered bacon, grab a drink (or a few), have great service, and listen to good music while sitting in an airport.  Thanks Matt's!

I would highly avoid the Matt's Big Breakfast Takeaway location in the airport. They state it will take only 15 minutes to receive your order. However, it took almost 40 with no customer service apologizing for the wait. I would pick up breakfast else where because their time estimate is unrealistic. I had an hour until my flight boarded and left the food at the restaurant because it still was not ready by the time I needed it.

This place is amazing and has since branched out to a few other locations so you don't have to battle the parking and crowds of downtown! Their scramble of the day is usually really good, but don't skip the sourdough toast and jam! My only hesitation for not giving 5 stars is the menu is on the short side and drinks are really limited.

I came here with a group of friends a few weeks ago. We were ready for a good brunch before heading up to the Grand Canyon. I had heard about this place for awhile and been wanting to try it. We got here around noon on a Friday and there was still a 20 minute wait.  It's a pretty small, bustling place. We were seated near the back and had to pull up a chair at the end for the 5th person. Our server was nice and friendly, brought our drinks and took our orders promptly. I had a scramble with salami and cheese, and I subbed the potatoes for grilled tomato. My other friends got the egg white scramble, the special of the day, which I think was an omelet with pork and cheese.   Everything came out pretty fast which was nice since we were starving. For all the good that I had heard of this place though, I was mildly disappointed. I will say the food tasted good and clean, not greasy or overly salty and buttery. So that was definitely refreshing, but in terms of amazing flavor, it just wasn't there. Got a decent portion for the price though. Honestly, I'd say it's more 3.5 stars than 3, but I don't exactly understand or agree with the hype.

Best American breakfast joint in AZ! I've come here many times and will be coming back.  I love there applewood thick cut bacon it has a lot of flavor. The hash brown is to die for its crunchy and crispy. The strawberry preserve is fresh and complements the toast real well. The orange juice is freshly squeezed and sweet.  Be prepared to wait at least 25-30 mins but it is well worth the wait.

I love  Matts Big Breakfast  but this location isn't the same as the one I go in downtown Phoenix. They don't have any hash browns which is a must have every time I go to Matts. The toast here was not even warm my butter didn't even melt (wtf)? It looked like they were pre toasting the bread to save time. I asked the waitress and she said it's what they do since it gets so "busy". I've seen the original location twice as "busy" as this place but they don't half assed on their quality.  Save yourself the disappointment and go to the downtown location.

At least 4-stars, if not 5, for a breakfast place in the airport.   Great peppered bacon, crisp as requested.   Very attentive staff.  Solid omelette, decent cheese.  Even the breakfast potatoes have rosemary and are thoroughly cooked and nicely done.   Love that they have cocktails, but didn't try any.

Fail, Fail, Fail, Fail..... so after trying to get to this place for months, after reading all these amazing reviews I can not begin to explain the disappointment of our long anticipate wait for this supposedly fantastic spot for breakfast.  Where to start. ... Cold-reheated potatoes,  not just one of our plates but 2 of our meals came out like this ( we arrived right at 6:43am) expecting freshly made food first thing in the morning...followed by "Center Cut Sirloin " a.k.a. Hamburger Patty priced at $15.99 Daily Special.  Seriously guys, Dennys serves a better Sirloin Steak breakfast. Then seeing Costco "Kettle Chips" bags stacked in the open view kitchen and showing them on the menu as if they are something that was prepared there fresh. Lastly,  one of the male workers complaining about his work schedule to another in a very unprofessional manner,  in short form, I would not recommend spending  $58.00 for breakfast for 3 Adults and 1 child.... First and LAST visit my family will be making to this place.

I first heard about this place on Arizona Highways.  I had no idea what to expect, but since it is a very rare occasion for me to be up at 7am and I happen to be in the area,  Matt's big breakfast was my destination.  The venue is pretty small with an equally small menu.  I was expecting more options.  We ordered waffles with bacon and The Five Spot (breakfast sandwich).  Both were very good.  Coffee was from cave creek and was pretty good as well.  Service was great.  Our server was upbeat and friendly.  She told me how much she loved working there and I can see she was sincere.    I do plan on coming back here.  I grade them a solid A.

There and back again..  We ventured this morning to a great land called Phoenix (though today we shall call that Gondor) from our little Scottsdale burrow (we shall call that the Shire). The Shire has many wonderful things to offer so we don't venture to far.   There's been talk of a movement in the great land of Gondor.. this movement is called Slow Food. Were great humans feed others based on sustainable crops, dairy and meat. These humans try to whenever possible, use only locally grown ingredients. There was word of an outdoor market that believes in these philosophies and shares with all the locals there. So off to Gondor.    After an easy and painless journey we arrived at the great outdoor market to find that it wasn't open yet. A very small distance east of there were a few humans mulling around a classic Gondor building that looked to have been turned into some sort of eatery. Once inside we discovered a great man named Matt and his magical Big Breakfast! We were seated at a counter with many other hungry travelers.   A fair maiden appeared.. she was so friendly and welcoming.. then took our orders.. the great man Matt had created something just for that day.. Salsa Verde Huevos Rancheros. The way the maiden pronounced these words we though for a moment she was speaking Elven.. only moments had passed and then set before us were 2 huge plates filled with roasted potatoes, 2 eggs over easy atop a corn tortilla covered in a green sauce. You see hobbits love good food, you can tell by their round bellies and lack of defined abs.. this was indeed a bountiful feast!  The fragrance arose from the plate and filled our nostrils.. we both stared into each others eyes then quickly began eating.. the flavors and textures were simply heavenly.. each better then the last!   We could see ourselves making the journey to Gondor quite often from the Shire.. we could see someday perhaps living in Gondor close to the outdoor market and of course the great Matt's Big Breakfast.

I dont know how the breakfast is, but the "Mamacita Burger" (could be Diablo) was fantastic. Perfect medium rare, jalipeno's kick'in it. Great flavor and perfect with a Kilt Lifter Scottish ale to help smolder the beast of burger!   Nice job Chef!
Get here early busy,busy even on Easter Sunday. Can't beat Matts big breakfast!   Three egg scramble with smoked pork tenderloin. Yummm
2nd time eating here for breakfast. Really like this place. Service is great & solid, fresh food that's made to order. Perfect for when you have to spend a morning at the airport.

Fun and unique  Mom and pop restaurant. A very small dining area with a menu that helps you decide by only being a page long. The food is very good with the pancakes and hash browns being note worthy. Expect a wait due to its popularity.
I would definately eat here.  I have been to three different locations and have not had a bad experiance at one.  I highly recommend this as a place to eat.

I've heard about this place for a while so I thought I save up a big appetite before I went. There was a wait to get seated which I didn't mind. It was the weekend after all. About 25 minutes later I was seated by the windows. I got an omelette and toast plus coffee. It was good. I think the toast was actually the best part.

We have been here plenty of times and keep coming back because of the food, one time our waitress dug her tiny shorts out of her ass and proceeded to serve us without washing her hands first. We made a comment to the owner she apologized but then we saw the cook cough all over our food. We went there today with our daughter, only a party of 2 was on the list ahead of us. Well once they were sat the hostess sat people that came in after us. When we questioned her about it she said that they only seat party of 3 at their ridiculously tiny tables. Which wouldn't be so bad if they didn't bring every item you order on its own plate. We weren't given an option of the bar or table. Which we would've picked the bar because there is more room and it was available first. They attempted to sit us at the baby table and sat a party of 3 white people at the bar. She was very friendly to the white costumers but not us. My money is green just like theirs. Will not be going back for a long time...please make the little girls that work there wear shorts that are longer than their vagina. Very unprofessional!

Buttery Buttery Buttery...YUMMY!  After dealing with the WRONG way on 7th (thanks for nothing Yahoo! maps), we were now super duper hungry...and secretly, I need breakfast within 30 minutes of waking up. I knew there could be a weekend wait and with some toast in my belly I braved the hot noon sun. Located next to a sketchy hotel/residence space (hash browns AND heroin!), this small space is DAMN small. A nice walkway with cacti and rustic fence create a lil space, and dumps you into the counterspace/dining room. First impression-this place is WHITE-I mean, like the walls are white, the counter is, the seats are re-upholstered vintage chrome stools white, but the tables are a beautful blood orange formica-oh yeah, I like that...with lil' orange gerber daisies. Like so, cute.  We thought about sitting at the counter, but with a chance for shortie chairs, we went next to the window that actually gave a promising look of artsy downtown PHX-def. added to the experience instead of what I would consider a dreaded smooshed in one in the small room in the back (is that where bad people go to eat eggs?). After some confusion over why one would need water AND iced tea, I got to sample their coffee and orange juice. Man, I LOVED that orange juice-simply the best. And the coffee was good black, always a test of quality. The menu is small and due to the lack of veggies with the breakfast (does cheese count as a veggie?), I went with sweet instead of savoury. I got the belgian waffle (an option of fruit would have taken this to a whole 'nother level, btw) and WOW-but-ter-ry. I think made with real buttermilk too. With butter melting on top. Was the maple syrup made with butter too? Possible. I think maybe all of Matts Big Breakfast may be made of butter...mmmmm. It was so rich I really had to leave one lone piece on my plate. I could not eat it. Really. COULD NOT-immediate expulsion from the clean plate club. Totally ashamed of my inability for the MBB money shot.  Nice asides:  The taters are with caramelized onions and rosemary sprigs-HOLLA. I asked to have the bacon substituted with the afore-mentioned, and the waitress said that wasn't possible-but she did deduct buck and some change from the price of the waffle, which as a veggie I deeply appreciate-CLASSY Parking lot and parking on street.  Bonus: Cute children will linger around your table and smile, much like nervous men at bars with bottles instead of beers, and not say much, making your experience alternate between unbearably cute and creepy.

All in all, good breakfast joint . Little parking but you can find metered parking on street. We had a the special egg scramble of the day and the cheesy omelette. And the Toast and jam was great ! A little salty for my taste but I'd come again.
The line is always out the door and around the corner. The food wasn't worth it.
Great downtown spot & in the Arts district. It is an easy walk to other local downtown spots & the food is always on point.
This was the first time that I ordered eggs Benedict and it came to perfection. Everything is fresh and delicious. The staff are friendly and prompt. I do recommend this place.

I had eaten at MBB downtown once and was a fan of the food they served there. I really am behind the city's initiative to encourage local successful restaurants to open up locations in Sky Harbor airport, and Matt's Big Breakfast is a treat! They also have Lolo's Chicken n' Waffles, Deluxe Burger and Chelsea's Open Kitchen to name a few local fav spots that we frequent in town and at PHX. MBB is precisely what it sounds like Big Breakfasts. Keep in mind, it is located at Terminal 4 AFTER YOU CLEAR SECURITY.  Whatever tickles your first meal of the day fancy can be tickled deeply and thoroughly here. The menu is a true journey through morning comfort food presented in more bountiful and gourmet style that your regular combo #6 at your local slop n' drop diner. Last time I ate there before a flight I had a massive omelette with rosemary potatoes (which are amazing btw). My wife had poached eggs and off the bone ham which seemed to have come right from the farm! The only caution I would give is to make sure you have time to have a sit-down-and-order mea. The service is pretty fast but the clients come in waves and everyone seems to need to catch the same flight. l had to chase down our server to run my card as it seemed everyone in the place was trying to pay at once and were likely mostly on the same flight so be sure you're not in a photo-finish situation to your gate. For those in a rush, I think they also have a walk-up counter and sling breakfast sammies to go for those wanting to stink up economy class with their brought-on food...a practice I abhor. I never bring hot food onto a plane. It's rude. Bring a cold sandwich or a salad and leave your stinky McRaunchy's or Blazing burritos in the terminal! MBB...come hungry and then enjoy your post breakfast drooling coma as you soar the clear blue skies!

If you take nothing else from my review of Matt's, hear this.  GET THE OFF-THE-BONE HAM!  Get it.    I love this place, it is my go to breakfast spot.  I've taken family and I've taken friends and the reviews are always A+  I am a basic breakfast guy.  I like cured meats, over easy eggs, potatoes and toast.  The hog and chick breakfast does each of the above elements as well as I can imagine.  If I lived closer I would be here twice a week.  Do yourself a favor and go!

Came in For Breakfast, I Tried the Breakfast Sandwich it was good! Included Bacon, Egg & Cheese I loved there House Potatoes had a lot of flavor to them. The Pork chop and eggs is a good choice as well. The coffee was a bit too strong and I wanted to try there biscuits & gravy but unfortunately they only serve those on Tuesdays and I came in on Saturday (bummer) the waitress explained to us that everyday there's a breakfast special and it can only be served on that day which doesn't make sense, they should be able to serve it everyday and maybe just one day make it at a discounted price since its the special of the day.

It's an ok breakfast place.  The place is overhyped.  This is no different than what I can make myself.  The coffee is ok.  I was disappointed they did not offer real cream with it.  Instead, it's organic milk only.  The hash brown were mushy on the inside.  The waffle is nothing special.  If you want some quality breakfast, go to Butterfield's.

We had just landed in Phoenix for Spring Break/ Spring Training. My husband had heard about Matt's Big Breakfast on one of his podcasts that he listens to so I thought we'd try it.  Saturday late morning....PLEASE be prepared to WAIT. It was a little over an hour for a group of 6. Altho the empty tables sat dirty for a while - so maybe they were short on bussers. The wait wasn't too bad because you can walk along the lake, sit in the grass and enjoy the architecture of the State Farm campus.   We were seated inside, and our waitress was super cool. I have to forewarn you; the actual menu itself is pretty limited. 10 items max for breakfast and maybe 6-7 sandwhich/lunch items. Their ice tea was delish. I ordered the special that was a "chicken enchilada sausage" scramble with jalapenos. Yum! But even better than that were their breakfast potatoes. YUM! My husband ordered a side of bacon, but by the time I was ready to try it - he had eaten it all! HAHA!   I love the area, and the food was yum, so I would probably come back!
This doesn't belong in an airport. If you only have 45 minutes to connect you won't make it.   We ended up getting it to go and barely got our flight. Others had to just leave without their food.

This a great place if you are in need of a great tasting, hardy breakfast.  We ended up arriving there with a large party.  Wait time was crazy since it was a Sunday.  But it was definitely worth the wait.  I ordered the steak and eggs and my wife order the chorizo and eggs.  Both were delicious!  The steak was just how I wanted it.  You can tell that their coffee was freshly brewed and it came in endless amounts.  There was only a couple issues with this place.  The place was loud and they don't have the technology to split the bills.   Other than that, a definite joint my friends and family would return to.

We came to Matt's Big Breakfast on a Friday around 8:30. It was packed, but we were seated without a wait. I had the skinny which was chicken sausage, egg whites, spinach and cheese scramble served with a side salad. Dining Partner had the cheese omelet with home fries. The hash browns would have been the way to go. Good service, food came out quickly. Solid breakfast spot in downtown Phoenix.

Second visit to Matt's. Thought I would give it one more try. The food is ok. I might even say good, but service is always my issue. Wasn't my best experience but when I expressed my dissatisfaction Chelsi was all over it and I appreciate her immediate response.

I don't normally think of food at the airport as a great place to have breakfast. However, I have been proved wrong this morning.  What a little surprise in the middle of the airport. This place is taking breakfast seriously. I don't feel I am being given sub par food for an exorbitant amount of money. If this was a restaurant anywhere else, I would go back again.  Our servers name was Matthew. Although they are very busy, and I can see why, he is a great waiter and very attentive. Awesome service and a True professional.   I must say that the bacon is awesome. Nice big piece of meat very peppery.  The porkchops were amazing as well. The art of cooking eggs is not over looked here. They know the difference between an over medium and an over easy egg.  Would you like toast with your breakfast, don't expect the generic toast that you get in every restaurant across America. Beautiful thick slices of great read. The sourdough bread was absolutely amazing, and I'm from the San Francisco area.The raspberry preserves were amazing and tasted house made.   My hats are off to the manager and the staff at this restaurant. Job very well done. We are very pleased!!!

Omg. I went here with my family and got the egg whites with spinach, chicken sausage, and house salad. So good!!!!!!! This place is small but mighty and has amazing breakfast. I am all about the atmosphere and this place has a great one!

We dropped our daughter off at work today so that we could use her car to drive to the mountains for a hike. She highly recommended Matt's for breakfast on our way back to the hotel. This is a great find and a MUST when you are in Phoenix. Especially if you're fueling up for a mountain hike. We pulled in at 7:15 and we're back in the car at 7:55. In those 40 minutes we had great food (daily scramble for husband and waffle + bacon for me) and top-notch service (friendly, attentive, and FAST) in a really comfy and happy environment. And good coffee too! Two more days in Phoenix? Maybe two more visits to Matt's.

I really like Matt's Big Breakfast. The bacon is so delicious and so is the coffee. I would prefer the breakfast potato's be cut a little smaller and cooked a little more tender, but that is minor.
