My only complaint it how noisy it is. You really can't carry on a conversation at all. I think they need to add something to deaden the noise. It's a little better if you sit at the bar by the window.

It's a cool cozy spot. Eating here I feel like it's false advertising though. It's called "Matt's BIG Breakfast," more like "Matt's BIG Priced Breakfast," the portion was really small for the price. Got the two eggs, bacon, hash brown, and sourdough bread combo for about $10. The food was good, but still left feeling a little hungry still. Overall it was a good experience, the service was on point, and the place was clean. I would of gave them 5 stars but like I said the portions wasn't up to par with the price.

The bacon is - amazing, thick and perfectly cooked. The waffles are surprisingly delicious. The maple syrup is genuine and not the commercial stuff that you buy at the grocery store. I found Matt's by accident. Then I mentioned it to locals and they all said, "YES!" it's the place to go for breakfast.

Good coffee, fresh orange juice, delicious waffle, and fabulous brunch. They also have homemade jam for toasts. And I really like their sausage. Downside is there is a waiting line most of the time. However, it's worth waiting for.

Worth the trek and worth the wait!  Thanks to my D D& D app (thanks Guy!) I found out about Matt's while in Phoenix and convinced my sweet boyfriend to take a detour downtown and, yes, wait a while to have breakfast.  It was worth every minute!  The pancakes were absolutely fantastic and I'm the ultimate pancake snob.  They were possibly the best pancakes I've ever eaten.  You could taste the batter.  Don't know how else to describe it.  They were just the freshest most batter-y tasting pancakes I've had in years.  Orgasmically good! I also got a decaf, which was fantastic.  My boyfriend loved his omelette.  Mine was actually just OK, not great, but the pancakes, coffee and service made up for it, 100%.  Our server at the counter was a hoot and although super busy, kept us refilled and entertained.  Real maple syrup.  Yay!

We went to Matt's on a Wednesday morning and it was packed.  The wait was relatively quick however as they turn people over quickly.  I had basted eggs, hash browns, and bacon with sourdough toast.  All the ingredients were excellent quality and cooked to perfection.  The jams were homemade and there were 2 offered though they only bring strawberry to the table.  I requested the blueberry and they gladly brought some at my request.  Both were excellent, but I preferred the blueberry.  The bread was also homemade and was also great.  All in all, well worth the wait and drive.

Great breakfast sandwich here called the Five Spot. And yes, it hit the spot!  Came in around 11am with one of my frat bros. It looked busy, but we were greeted and seated right away. Friendly staff.   Also recommend the Honey Lemonade, but heads up--they don't do free refills!

Hands down it is the best Breakfast place in the phoenix metro. I came all the way from Maricopa, AZ to check this place out. I'm not a native Arizonan, but this place competes up there with all the breakfast places I've been to. The pork chop is is awesome! I was lucky enough to be the last guy that made it through the door when it opened hehe.

Worst service I've ever had. Matt was there and he didn't even talk to people, he seems like he doesn't care. I am all for supporting local businesses because they show they care but he didn't. Food is overrated, I heard it was the best but it's comparable to Denny's.

I was a bit turned off by the place at first because it's menu is so small, but I soon forgot about that. A limited menu is fine when the establishment does the menu items well, and they do. We ordered breakfast sandwiches and they were DELICIOUS, and a great value. The bacon was cut thick, the bread was warm and soft and croissant-like, and the eggs were hot. I would definitely go back and get this again.
Best breakfast in Phoenix. Everything is simple and flavorful with top notch ingredients. Be prepared to wait a while to get in though.

I travel a lot and this is by far the very best in airport food if not in all of burger-dom.  I picked this place at random as it was near my gate and I am so glad I did.  The food and service were outstanding.  I sat at one of the high top tables.  Plenty of room for my bag under my feet sitting there.  It was lunch so I ordered a burger.  I ordered straight from the menu, but many people requested special needs burgers and they were happy to comply.   My burger came out fast, it was cooked to perfection, very flavorful, well seasoned and just the right temperature.  My iced tea was fresh and clean.  My server, Valentin, was top notch.  A fun guy who took care of everyone with special requests and understood that in an airport environment people need to eat fast and pay fast.  He made each person around me feel special and like they were his only customer.  I can't explain it. Some people just have a gift of working with the public.  He offered to get me a to go cup of iced tea.  He is now a friend for life.  I fly into Phoenix a lot so I will be a regular customer here and, in fact, look forward to it being a highlight of future trips.  It's that good.
This place did a great job with a small space. The good had big flavor and our whole family enjoyed it. Waffles, pancakes, and even Mac and Cheese. It was also very hip.

Bravo Matt's Big Breakfast! What a great meal we had during our first trip to this place. We both got the Saturday Special which was a scramble with chicken enchilada sausage, eggs, home fries, jalapeos, cheese, and a flour tortilla. The plate was bursting with fresh tasting flavors. The wait was only about 35 min. He food is worth the wait. I love Snooze but I have to say this place beats it in flavor and quality of food. Snooze has a wider range of selections tho. My only knock against Matt's would be the limited choices on the menu. The entire staff was great and the service was awesome!

Waited for 40 min to get breakfast and once seated had a non existent waitress. The host and busboy basically helped us after 4 other parties that were behind us. Found out they pool the tips so really not much incentive for good service. Food is good but otherwise not impressed. Certainly not worth the wait to be treated as though we are invisible.   Edit: the manager was kind enough to take care of us. The food is very good. Worth the wait had the service not been so non existent. Hopefully it was just a fluke.

Highly recommend!  Got the Tuesday's special biscuit and gravy with fresh blackberry lemonade!  My servers name was Daniel he was fast, kind and very knowledgeable. Overall a great experience!  If your from Arizona or just passing by I would make sure to put it on your list!

Fast service! Food was fresh and good. Not huge portions, but no too little either. The staff was friendly. Didn't wait long for a table of two. New to area so we wanted to check this place out cause of all the hype.

After waiting 30 minutes and being the 4th person on the list to get seated, when asked if we could sit at the bar where there were at least 10 seats open we were told that they couldn't seat anyone at the bar because the kitchen was behind. What?? If you're behind tell the patrons up front. Too bad we actually went out of our way to eat here.

Food was okay, place was tight and small very busy though so thats why I decided to eat here. The charge $2 for extra syrup because i ordered kids pancakes for my friends son which where dry. I got an omelette which i felt i could make better at home. The food lacked seasoning alot it was all very bland. Across the table we all got different items to experience the menu and this was our first and last time. I have had worst trust me but nothing worth coming back for.

What's better than a waffle as a late brunch when you have a layover at 3:00 pm? I don't care where you are in Terminal 4, this place deserves your business. My server was friendly and prompt. The waffle I ordered was hot and delicious. The bacon was crunchy and flavorful. It satisfied my breakfast sugar craving.   4 out of 5 stars, because the food took longer than expected and there were a lot of crumbs and pieces of paper on the floor. The waffle could have been slightly crisper also. Overall, I would go back if I'm in the mood for breakfast food.

Stopped in with my wife for breakfast before boarding our flight. It's a small place so expect to wait sometimes when they are busy about 30 min. So I recommend planning ahead to arrive at the airport early so you get to try this amazing food.  The pancake was amazing nice and fluffy with just the right amount of very subtle crispiness. What else can I say about BACON!!! BACON ROCKS and the bacon here is a little thick, crispy, and very tasty! The home fries are seasoned and cooked with friend onions so if you don't like onions might want to let them know.   Our server was Tim and he was AWESOME. Great personality, friendly, and just a cool guy.  Highly recommend visiting this great place!

Used to be a alright place when they opened but they had a horrible dip in quality recently and so now I will try to avoid this place.  I ordered a Cobb salad like i usually do and its typically decked out with olives, 1 to 2 eggs sliced in, blue cheese scattered through out, a big piece grilled chicken laying on top, dressing, lot of their bacon chopped in and freshly sliced tomatoes.  Well I think they have switched to more of a fast food format because when I went there for lunch like usual and ordered it again, I was baffled and thought at first I got the wrong order so I went back and returned it because it just looked like plain piled on lettuce with dressing mixed in, the person working at the front noticed too and said it may have been due to a new employee so had it redone. So I brought to try and eat it again as he assured me that he saw it get made this time and it was done correctly.  And it wasnt, it was disgusting. The chicken was diced and kinda tasted like cold packaged white chicken that was just poured at the bottom, and not much of it at that maybe like 2 fork fulls if I were to attempt to stab every little squared diced piece.  The tomatoes were now also diced and again like 2 fork fulls worth tasted like they were again just bought pre done at a grocery store although there was so little mixed in it was hard to tell. No olives. A single chunk of cheese not spread throughout probably about the size of a quarter. Half of an egg sliced into 3 sections sitting on top of the salad. 2 Teaspoons of crumbled bacon. And a whole lot of romaine lettuce. And 2 packages of dressing on the side.  Like what the heck happened o.o how does a place go downhill that fast. I could understand a cheap $2 premade side salad being like that but not a main menu item that im paying $11 for on a salad. I didnt go back to return it a 2nd time as apparently this is just the quality of the food they serve now and the guy that works the register at the front is just always so nice that itd be kinda weird to cause a stink over this again as I know it wasnt his fault its prepared like that now. Oh well. :/

Service was Good got in pretty fast  .. Got Hog and Chick   Eggs were good  Bacon wasn't my favorite wanted it way crisp  and wasn't  and potatoes  were my least favorite seems like they were cooked ahead of time  and they were just BLAGH     and im a big time potato girl ..   toast was good Jam was good little runny    over all was ok  i might go back one more time  and try different choice  but  not sure when . for all the reviews i read  i dont think it should get more than 3  but that's just my experience..PS  i did think prices were some what high for the quality of the food   but thats just me

I asked for poached eggs,  he brought me scrambled, after a long wait, he came back with COLD poached eggs. Ugh.  No excuse for that.  Also he said "I'll take care of that for you" and it was not removed from the bill.  Unimpressed!  The potatoes and the toast were good but that's about it.

food was spot on service was friendly and comforting only drawback is no alcohol served... the bottomless coffee was at a nice drinkable temperature and was strong!! the butterrrrrrr. so buttery...yummmmmmmy the 8oz orange juice for kids were served in cute plastic cups! the fruit infused water while you wait in the AZ heat was refreshing
This place is great, food and service is very good. The wait is a bit long to be seated but well worth it.. The home fries are my favorite potatoes..

Found on Yelp and Guy's Triple D. Hard to find because they moved and there are One Way streets. Worth the search. Big Fresh Hearty breakfast. Really enjoyed. Staff brisk, not busy time, but courteous.

I have been dying to try Matt's Big Breakfast but every time I went to the downtown location it was packed and I had to wait too long,  which increased my curiosity.   I learned of new location of Matt's this morning at 32nd  Street & Camelback and I had to go for it. It was packed on Friday morning at 9:30 and I thought, wow they must have some great food.  I took a look at the menu and was disappointed.  I saw only a few choices and a daily special of scrambled egg surprise.  The waitresses were friendly, the coffee was great but the food was only okay.  The sausage links are nothing I would order again but the bread they used for toast was tasty but it was too wide for my liking at breakfast.  The  preserves were great, but only one selection that day, no strawberry today.  The prices were about the same I find everywhere else around town.  I would have like to see a bigger selection on the menu, like eggs benedict...my curiosity has now been satisfied with my only visit to this restaurant.  Your missing it.
Ate here Fall 2015 and enjoyed it. Would definitely go back if I'm ever at the Phoenix airport again.

Was out in Phoenix for a business trip and found this place thru Yelp (obviously)... Cute breakfast/brunch place... Small in size, but what I'm used to for a place like this. Decoration and table condiments cute...salt & pepper shakers are like little mason jars. Okay the food... I had the daily special which was the normal Eggs Benedict. It was decent, nothing to write home about...the Hollandaise sauce was waaaay too lemoney for my taste but the potatoes were delicious.

Had great expectations after highly recommended by others. The breakfast was good, nothing extraordinary though. The service was a disappointment, server was very forgetful and put off by some simple requests. It doesn't look like they need my business though, considering the line to get in. I probably wont be back.
French Toast and eggs is absolutely delicious here! Breakfast lovers this is a must stop shop! Five stars all day!

was in town for a convention and was so surprised how good the food in phoenix was!  Coming from the LA area, you become kind of a food snob, but Matt's Big Breakfast beats all.    The BEST Belgium waffle I have ever had. Wait was a little long on the Saturday morning for a table for 3, but it was well worth the wait.

Unclear what all the fuss is about. I certainly wouldn't stand in line for this place. There was nothing too interesting on the menu. I had pancakes. They were fair. Wouldn't get them again. The server at the counter was very pleasant and efficient.

For some reason, we hit Phoenix on the first rainy day since October but that did not deter us from checking out Matt's Big Breakfast based on all the Yelp raves.  We had to wait outside for about 10-15 minutes in the rain, but finally got two seats at the bar.  When people describe this place as tiny, think 8 small tables and 6 bar stools tiny.  Do not try with groups...it will not work.  The waitress behind the counter was a riot telling people to "Smile, it's Christmas!"  She definitely kept the spirits up.  Our service was great, but we were at the counter where coffee was readily available.  First impression was that the coffee was great.  It is local, fresh and delicious.  My husband's waffle was really good but I won with the cheese omelette with mushrooms, onion and bacon.  It was full of gooey cheese and my husband helped me polish it off.  The hashbrowns were good, but a little greasy and the sourdough was perfect.    Bottom line - it is worth the trek downtown if you are on vacation or do not live downtown.  Good simple breakfast with plenty of butter for you arteries to soak up.
I honestly don't understand the hype for this place. It's just breakfast, nothing special.
Great waffle. Great bacon  great hash browns.  This works for me. Put this together with friendly, attentive service and you have a winner

Great breakfast place!!! The taste of the food was amazing.  I had the five spot sandwich with homefries and it was delicious.  The service was fast and the people were very friendly.  One of the best breakfast restaurants I've visited in the valley.

This airport location is an insult to the actual restaurant. First, like all airport restaurants, this was overpriced. The chili bowl was extremely small and I ordered a side of steak fries. There were less than 10 fries. To make things worse, I waited 25 minutes for takeout.   I had to eat the chili on the plane because I didn't have time. The staff did not pack my oyster crackers and the chili was small and way too salty.  The fries lacked taste. I loved the Phoenix Matt's Big Breakfast and hated this one.

I usually steer-clear of places that are rumored to have a long ass wait but my Mama selected this place for her birthday brunch, needless to say it was a yummy breakfast. We got there around 815 and were seated around 9, so if youre being leisurely, its worth the wait.  The menu is small and concise, making it somewhat easy to decide; it all looks and sounds so good. But it's all pretty basic meals with a couple of daily specials. One of which I had; scrambled eggs, jalapenos, cheese, onions, and a shit ton of delicious, partnered with home-fries and a tortilla. The jalapenos were just right and so fresh! We also had tried some of the walnut, raisin bread toast; which was fantastic. My boyfriend had the waffle which was good but I could tell he could use another one ($8 for one waffle?). I don't eat swine too often but the bacon was heavenly; thick and peppered. One thing I do regret about the meal was I saw someone order some chocolate milk, definitely should've got some instead of coffee; what's the rush to wake up on a Sunday anyway?  When we came out, some people who had been waiting near us, were asking what we got and how it was. It seemed our leaving Matt's got everyone outside's mounths watering. Everyone lit up to hear our reviews, which I thought was pretty funny...So all-in-all it was good but nothing so amazing (which is what I've heard about this place). Great for a special occasion or once in awhile.

Yes, sometimes you have to wait in a long line. No, the line isn't that long if you don't come on a weekend (like everyone else does).  Yes, get whatever special they have on the board for the day. And damn well better get 2 or 3 glasses of that fresh squeezed OJ. All the waiting is worth just that alone.

After eating here I simply cannot understand the hype. It's kind of like the whole restaurant has a chip on its shoulder. The only positive is that our wait was short and the food came to the table in a timely manner. I ordered the Hog & Chick with bacon, over easy eggs, and home fries . The bacon was incredibly overcooked and splintered into individual fibers in my mouth. I've completely burned bacon before and it tasted better than this. The eggs had no flavor and were somehow watery. The home fries were decent, but there were multiple, half inch long Rosemary stems in  the way which provided a challenge to eat around. Final point of contention is that nothing can be subbed. I have a gluten intolerance and asked if anything could be subbed for the toast that came with the meal...nope. I get that some restaurants think gluten intolerance is a bunch of hoo ha and don't want to cater to that particular group of eaters, but in my thinking, as long as the sub is of equal or lesser value to the toast, why not? Matt's clearly doesn't agree. Regardless, I don't believe I shall return. No big loss.

Wow. I stumbled across this place on a layover, and to be honest, didn't have high expectations since it's airport food, right? I was so wrong-fresh orange juice, thick peppered bacon, awesome home fries, and big pieces of homemade wheat bread toasted just right, with delicious raspberry jam. It was a little pricey, but nothing out of the norm for an airport restaurant. I'm flying through PHX again in a few weeks, and I'll definitely walk however far to eat here again.

You are in for a treat if you don't mind an hour+ wait!  Cute little place with good service. My favorite dish is the the Chop and Chick.  Definetly worth a try and if you're really lucky you might get to witness a drunken bum fight in their parking lot.

Let me start by saying I hate waiting in line.  If I could, I would get an intern just to wait in line for me.  Having said that, I have waiting in line more than once for breakfast here.  The food is delicious.  I'm not sure if its the copious amounts of butter in the food but I swear it is the best toast and breakfast potatoes in town.  Oh and the main dishes are great too.  The place is tiny, and they really didn't spend much money on decor.  But really, who cares when breakfast is this delicious?!

Best breakfast period!  Quality, experience, value, service etc. etc. etc....menu is short and to the point so makes it simple to order. Pork chop is the best item to order and their bacon is bangin!!! Yes slang is the best option to describe their bacon and overall experience.

What can I say.... I LOVE MATT'S BIG BREAKFAST! Everything I have had there has been fabulous.  The atmosphere is friendly. The food, while traditional, old fashioned comfort breakfast, which has the real butters and goodies that make their wonderful recipes taste so yummy, it is absolutely, hands down the best breakfast place I know! I am hooked on their waffles! If you go during peak times, expect a wait.  There are many dedicated Matt's aficionados.

WOW. There isn't one thing I could complain about. The wait was worth it (our fault for going to breakfast on a Sunday at 10 AM). The service was great, the hash browns were great, toast was good, waffles were AMAZING. Fresh squeezed orange juice was delicious, their fresh preserves were even better. They had the best ketchup money could buy (sir kensingtons).. Hell, even their butter was delicious! Well done, Matt. Now come to Portland, Oregon, we need breakfast joints like you.

Seriously, what the fuck are you people waiting in those long ass lines for?  Did I miss something?  Are they giving handies in the restroom... wait... do they even have a restroom?  It's so small, it's impossible to not have people in your personal bubble and who wants strangers breathing on them when they're trying to eat?  The servers are these bitchy girls that argue with each other and one looked so dirty I wanted to squirt her with my hand sanitizer each time she passed by me.    The food - it's a normal breakfast.  Nothing about the meal made me think I was having something special.  Yes, the bacon was good but really, have you ever had bad bacon?  They don't have fountain drinks, just canned RC so I stuck to coffee.
Absolutely not worth the wait. I've given two tries... done. Has to be the worst breakfast in town.

Went here after everyone I know in phx recommended it.   Space. Felt very temporary and cold.  But that doesn't effect the review.  I'm assuming maybe it is?  Service.  Solid.  Was greeted by friendly staff and the server was nice and helpful.   Food. Got the chop and eggs.  Eggs are eggs.  They were good.  And I liked my cottage cheese, but it probably came from a tub so whatever.  Hash brown was great, super tasty.  Chop. No flavor. Unseasoned.  Bland to the point that I had to cover with ketchup,  which is a shame BC I'm sure they get great product.  Wife got the waffle.  Super good.  Anyways.  3 stars BC its good not great.  Nothing I would go out of my way to come back for.  But if someone asked me for a solid breakfast spot I'd still recommend.

This is a cute little breakfast place located in downtown, I've read great yelps and decided to give it a try. The service is great! The prices are fair, I tried this breakfast sandwich and it was only 6 bucks! The quality was good, and the bacon is to die for!
Had some of the softest freshest waffles ever! They literally melt in your mouth!! And, the thickest most delicious bacon.....now, my mouth is watery!!
Everything everybody says about Matt's is true. A fabulous breakfast with good service.  The hog and chick is the way to go. Go after 9:30 during the week to avoid wait time.
everything was sooo fresh and the service was great. Fresh organic apple juice to go with chop n chick!   crowded and I know why the food is impeccable cooked perfectly

I've been trying to get over to Matt's for some time - but since I live in Chandler, it's not often that I'm in Phoenix during breakfast hours.  That said, boy oh boy was it worth the extra 30 minute drive.  Everything was spot on.  The service, the food, the ambiance - just wow.  We got there close to closing time, so they were out of a few things, but that's to be expected when they're so busy.  Probably the best breakfast potatoes I've ever had - and the pancake is in the top three of all time.  Very few restaurants bother with real maple syrup, but for me it makes all the difference.  The bacon was up near the top I've ever had, and I will be back as often as possible.  Simply put, it's the best breakfast destination in Phoenix, period.

Matts big breakfast has some very excellent breakfast options. I've never been disappointed. But even if their food was just ok, I would still continue to go back just for the bacon. It is the best bacon I've ever had at any restaurant or home!

Stopped at this place for breakfast and drinks when heading home from a work/play trip. The food was great but the alcohol was even better ! Try the Bloody Mary, it contains the full package. Bacon, olives, celery, cheese blocks, it is like a meal with a side of booze ! It gets very busy !

This is a quintessential breakfast joint even though they serve lunch also. I have had breakfast here a couple of times and have been very happy. In addition to their menu they also feature a daily special.  Earlier this morning I tried their 3 egg scrambler (today's daily special) and it was superb. Scrambled eggs with habaneros, protein and choice of potatoes (I chose hash browns).  The eggs were delightfully prepared, not too soft and not too well done. Just right. Big pieces of habanero were intimidating but had just the right amount of heat. The hash browns were excellent: crispy exterior and nice and soft inside. One big slab of goodness. BTW, great coffee too.  The restaurant is small so expect a wait. But it's well worth it.
This will make me the most unpopular man in Phoenix, but I just don't get why such a big deal is made about this place.  Is it good? Sure.  Is it worth waiting in line for? Not really.

A huge waste of time.  The host guy was funny to watch, but not at all effective in getting tables turned and seated, and seems to believe his low level job gives him a pass to be rude to customers. I'm fairly sure they intentionally stretch out the wait to create a false sense of demand and hype.  There were always 3-4 empty tables while cranky people waited as if at the DMV.  The food is fine, service is a bit awkward and certainly nothing worth putting up with their complete lack of urgency.  It makes customers upset to feel like there's no priority in taking care of them.  Hospitality 101 failure.
Simply good food--great ingredients and wonderful service.  Yes, the wait is worth it.

(Lyrics - Big Country - In A Big Country)  I've never really eaten breakfast without the season Another coffee ordered through Another bacon passes by me  You never took the smile away from anybody's face And that's an appetizing way to look  For someone who is just a Yelper  At Matt's Big Breakfast foods stay with you  Like a hungry voice fires the griddlecakes Stay hungry!   Matt's Big Breakfast is now located in Tempe, but with not 1, not 2, but 3 locations popping; this local breakfast joint is the place to be!  I'm sure they're working on expanding to another!  I came with a group of runners after a quick run!  The place was banging with patrons and we had to wait another hour just to get seated.  Needless to say, I couldn't wait cause as the food passed us by and the smell of coffee; man I tell ya I was hungry!!    When we finally sat, I ordered some coffee and beer of course to carb load!  I proceeded with The Hog & Chick breakfast; 2 eggs, 3 slices of bacon, hash browns, and wheat toast.  I also got the griddlecakes on the side just to try it.  Overall, a solid "Big" breakfast cause portions are not lacking here; I can hear Julia Child now, more butter!  The hash browns were crunchy on the outside and soft in the middle.  The bacon was meaty and salty to the bite.  The eggs I liked over-easy and indeed it was.  I got some wheat toast which was thick like Texas toast, but I ate it as I progressed to my griddlecakes; which was sweet and toasty along with my warm maple syrup!  My friend ordered the Skinny; 4 eggs whites scrambled with gruyere cheese, spinach, and chicken apple sausage, served with a side salad.  She enjoyed her breakfast except the salad became soggy with dressing.    In the end, Matt's Big Breakfast did deliver some solid breakfast, but nothing spectacular.    Service was decent and the overall atmosphere was popping.  I rather enjoyed my breakfast and it was done the right way.  I appreciate them using local and organic products in Phoenix so that's always a plus in my books! - Enjoy!

Ok, I have to admit I'm a secret admirer of Matt's delicious ever so crunchy, thick and well seasoned bacon!! Bacon, Bacon, Bacon is what keeps me coming back to Matt's Big Breakfast and of course their pancakes, pork chops, omelets, hash browns, home fries...  This place is small as many Yelpers have stated already and no thanks to Guy and his "Triple D" it's hard to find the right time to come to Matt's with out having to wait due to all the foodie followers of Food Network.    The service at Matt's is what you make of it. If your in a rush, let your server know and she will accommodate you, but if you don't say anything you'll wait for refills.   As many Yelpers have already stated their food is amazing!  Matt uses the freshest ingredients, most of which are organic and locally grown.  I had something not on their normal menu: scrambled eggs with sliced chorizo, jalapeos and cheesy goodness with a side of their hash browns, toast and of course bacon!  It was FANTASTIC! Great combination and it wasn't spicy at all!  Ask for it when you go, you must try it!! They bacon and chorizo are made special for Matt at a market.  He uses Wildflower's bread and the egg and veggies are all from local farmers.  Recommendation:  Stacy C is right, the best time to come is during the week and in the early or late morning.  Plan a business breakfast in lieu of a luncheon.  We went last week and the three of us had problem finding a table, be it a small table : -)
I can't get enough of this place, everything is so good it is totally worth the line you see on the weekend! You should always try the specials the offer and the jam!

My favorite breakfast place in the entire world (and i am a New Yorker who has been to many breakfast places). The eggs are amazing but the hash browns and toast are incredible. The toast is the best toast i have ever had in my life and i wish i could eat it every day!!!

3.5stars. What can I say about Matt's that hasn't already been said? Generous portions, fresh ingredients, seriously amazing toast. I never thought the day would come when I'd rave about toast, but Matt's thick-cut toasted wheat toast with homemade blueberry compote is what I crave when I think about homey brunch food now.   This downtown location has a small parking lot of its own. The inside is decently sized, but lines are out the door for lunchtime and brunch most days, weekdays included. Service is mediocre, not the most attentive because it's always bustling in here, and there have been a few times where I've needed to aggressively flag down a server to ask for coffee refills or to-go boxes.   Matt's has a small menu, but there are specials for each day of the week. The menu items stay consistent, and the daily specials are written up on a huge chalkboard at the back of the restaurant.   Drinks: Coffee is decent and comes with bottomless refills. The strawberry lemonade and honey lemonade are both really good and not too sweet, although they come with quite a lot of ice.   The Hog and Chick: Standard breakfast fare, this comes with two eggs, choice of meat, choice of hash browns or home fries, and a slice of thick-cut toast. The hash browns are made well, and I like the crunchy exterior and soft interior. I did notice that the first time I came, the hash browns were made perfectly and the second time they were slightly mushy in the center. Still good though. I tried the sausage links, and I don't know that I'd order them again.. maybe I'll opt for the ham next time. Eggs were well-cooked with a nice runny center.  Salami scramble: This comes with scrambled eggs and salami (additional toppings for extra charge), hash browns or homefries, and toast. I really like the homefries because they come with sprigs of roasted rosemary, which are incredibly flavorful. I've found the homefries to be consistent and delicious, especially with the house made thick ketchup. One thing that did disappoint me a bit was that the scramble was undercooked. When I got to the middle, the egg was still oozy and watery, which left an unappetizing puddle on the plate. I'd gotten a different scramble before where this didn't happen, but I think the chef probably just underestimated the cook time by a minute.   Cheese omelet: This omelet was so cheesyyyy. I thought the flavor was really good, and I really recommend adding in toppings (for an extra charge) because it really helps balance out the cheesiness and richness. I did find the inside a tad runny again, but it wasn't super noticeable with the cheese mixing in. This dish again comes with choice of potatoes and toast.   Toast: The toast here is so good it deserves its own mention. The thick-cut toast comes out sliced in half and smeared with butter. One of the servers said that they use an old-fashioned toaster (which must be magical), and the slice comes out perfectly crunchy on the outside but still soft and fluffy on the inside. The blueberry compote is made with fresh blueberries and sugar, and it always tastes fresh and not too sweet. I haven't always finished my meals here, but I've always finished the toast.   I'll be back to Matt's for its convenient location and comforting breakfast food, and of course the toast.

I'm not much of a breakfast guy, but I've heard a lot of good things about this place, so we finally made it a point to stop in and see what all the hype was about. So, some things seem overpriced, some things seemed pretty fair. I dig the vibe of the place, though it's very small, and very loud inside. We ordered a few different things off the menu and had no complaints there. Overall, it was a good experience, and if I ever go out for breakfast again, we just may pay Matt's another visit.

Every Phoenix visit, I make it a point to come to Matt's. BUT... once a year is just not enough. And though my time in Phoenix is always limited, that hour and a half wait for a table is worth the wait every single time.  If you're here for breakfast, order the special. You will never be disappointed. It's usually some sort of scramble, with fresh local ingredients. The potatoes with rosemary always hits the spot. Do yourself a favor and get the LARGE freshly squeezed orange juice. The small is a tiny little thing, and if you're gonna spend the money, spend the extra buck and get more.  My favorite lunch item is the Rueben. BEST RUEBEN EVER. And I've had my share of reubens. This sandwich is magic in your mouth. The last time I had one, I decided that I also wanted breakfast, so I had them add an over-easy egg in the sandwich. That was heaven in my mouth---- I still dream of that particular sandwich.  A majority of the items on the menu are made with local ingredients (jam, bread, and coffee included). The service is ALWAYS fast and friendly. And as tiny as the place is, they turn tables quickly and keep everything immaculately clean.  I love Matts. Best breakfast in the entire state of Arizona. Oh yeah. I just said that. And I meant it.

A cool little spot off Tempe Town Lake. They have a small menu but it doesn't feel incomplete. The pancakes are amazing, they have daily specials, and the coffee is roasted locally! We sat at the breakfast bar and service was quick and attentive, you can tell the employees are passionate about the food. A great place if you're looking for a tasty breakfast

Realizing the truth about Matt's is that they are simply short-staffed in the summer. Not sure why it is, but winter service is far more consistent (read: better). Over the past few months, when we have visited, we see some table fly right through while others just wait (we even spoke to a couple at a table next to us on the last visit who had noticed the same thing, as they had been waiting a while).   Hey -- Matt's is great and, in a few months, we'll be right back to taking winter visitors there. But, for summertime, I'll be taking a pass.
Came for brunch today. Sometimes service is good, sometimes it's not. Well today it wasn't. Food is always good. Had the cheesy omelette, coffee and pancake. Delicious. Will be back

I ADORE this place. Matt's has been a staple breakfast, brunch, whatever place for me since I moved to Downtown 5 years ago. They just moved to a great place up the street (where Verde used to be for locals) with more room so now everything isn't so crammed! Not that we all didn't enjoy their original house, this one just says, "I'm still awesome, I just stepped up a notch." Everything is delicious. I love their 5 Spot, the waffles are great, and their lunch specials are always amazing. If you like jelly - try their homemade stuff. Try the bacon.

On the advice of a friend stopped in for breakfast. So glad I did. Was told that at times the line is out the door. Thankfully, waltzed right in and was sat immediately at the bar area. I was not that hungry but the aroma's coming from the kitchen made my mouth water. Instead of getting a single menu item I opted from the offerings under "On The Side". My dish consisted of one egg over easy (perfectly cooked and tasted farm fresh), think cut bacon (oh my, simply delish) and toast with homemade preserves. It was easy to tell that the kitchen took pride in their dishes and uses only the highest quality ingredients. If I had to complain about anything would be the noise level. With so many hard surfaces conversations definitely bounce around this tiny gem. But I'll take it. Service was fast and friendly. Absolutely charming, will be back!
Probably the best breakfast place in the US. Worth the wait every time. And the staff always welcome me in and always say goodbye. Thanks Matt!

I had a cheese omelette with spinach and onions with hashbrowns fried in butter. It was decadent. My wife had a waffle and bacon. It was amazing as well. The strawberry jam and sourdough toast were worth the trip by themselves. Great coffee and outstanding service. We had a little bit of a wait but it was well worth it. I can't eat like this every day, but that's what vacation is for, right?

This location is downstairs from my work and the food is excellent.  I had the chicken sandwich and the portions were great with homemade potato chips.  I also liked the bottomless coffee.  The only concern was service was kind of poor and the waitress looked very rushed.  I would however definitely go back and breakfast is really what put Matt's on the map.

I arrived there at 5:30 this morning for breakfast. After finding a table that wasn't wobbly I ordered the  cheese omelette with mushrooms. It comes with toast and potatoes. The potatoes were undercooked and room temperature. The toast was room temperature and wouldn't even start to melt the butter that was put on it. They brought me a new batch of potatoes and new toast, which I appreciated. It seemed to me that the omelette was not freshly made. I've never tasted one like that before that was freshly made. From the way I was dressed it was obvious I worked at the airport and wasn't just passing through. I probably won't go there again. I am always happy to support local businesses over chain restaurants, but it was a really simple order and most of it went wrong, unfortunately. The waiter, however, was really nice.

Matt's is my new favorite place for breakfast. The price is right, the food is good, and the service is awesome. Let's not forget about that thick peppered bacon. It's not the healthiest food around, but who cares it tastes great. Eat, love, sleep.

Again, people must understand that good things (food) come to those who wait.  Imagine if Matt's Big Breakfast seated as many as a Denny's.  They'd be forced to mass cook, quality would go down and service would suffer.  True, this place COULD be a tad bigger, but you can't discount them for being delicious and popular.  The time my wife and I went, there was only a 20 minute wait, so we strolled around downtown Phoenix, visited the local organic grocer, which I highly recommend, and the time flew by.  We sat at the bar and got the inside scoop on the place as we chatted to everyone from the busboy to the owner.  And the scoop was, they are opening a high-end organic coffee shop on 5th and McDowell or Thomas,
Delicious omelets, bacon, pancakes, killer yummy home fries and hash browns, fresh squeezed orange juice!!! We went on Mon @10:30am and wait time was ~15min but Food came really fast! :)

This review is NOT for the food, it is for the wait.  Seriously.... 2 hours PLUS.   We sat in the hot Arizona sun with my hungry child in a questionable part of town and the only thing I received was a sun burn and major irritation from the wait. After waiting 2 hours, that was it for us.   *************************My philosophy is anything tastes pretty damn amazing when you are famished and dehydrated. ********************

The BACON is sooooooooooooooooo amazing. It is a must. Did I mention the bacon? Food selections are the basics but done well. Only complaint I have is the wait at times can be very long. How about a bacon sample while I wait? One can hope.
Breakfast sandwich was money! Thick cut bacon was the star attraction! Would definitely recommend

I have been dying to try this place! We went on a Thursday morning and we were seated immediately. The service was quick and our waitress was friendly. We had the waffle and the eggs benedict, both were delicious! The atmosphere was great and the prices were cheap. We will definitely be returning!

Matt's Big Breakfast should be at the top of anyone's Phoenix "Must" list. All of the food is locally sourced and served up so fresh you really can taste it. Everything from their kick ass bacon to their bread to their coffee and juice will knock your socks off with their freshness. It is no surprise that even on a summer's day people sit outside in the heat and wait for a table.  I'm surprised by comments about the service here because all of the girls came out to check on those of us waiting outside and even took our orders in advance so they would be prepared the moment we were seated. Everyone working there was very sweet.  My last visit was a sad one however because I was suffering from a brief but very severe hangover (what I like to call an Express Hangover) that was so bad all I could manage was a few sips of juice and coffee. If Matt's is in the future I have to make it a point to behave myself the night before because passing up such a great breakfast is a crime in this Yelper's book!

ok. parking here totally sucks. luckily, we ate here early in the day, and people were leaving, so we waited a bit and took their spot. (when going downtown, carpool, people!) we were promptly seated, and just in time, as a bunch of people came in 5 minutes later, and had to wait outside.   i had the daily special of chorizo with eggs and jalapenos, my bf had the sausage and eggs combo (forgot its actual name). i personally don't really care for rosemary, but if you like it, the potatoes will rock your socks off. we were both stuffffffed. the food was incredibly hot, fresh and delish (and spicy!). service was fast... so we were happy. until we thought about how much butter we were consuming. but bc it was so yummy, that we decided we didn't care.    the homemade toast and preserves were also pretty killer. even though i was stuffed to the brim, i ended up eating my bf's last piece of toast and preserves as we walked out. they were that good.  i just wish there were more menu options...
Food is very good. ALWAYS SO BUSY. Parking is hit or miss especially on weekends. My only complaint is how loud it gets. I wish there was some way to lessen the echo and noise.

I know better than to have high expectations when going to airport bars and was having a great time at this place. But then the bartender, Lisa was a little rude. First she rolls her eyes at me when I tell her there's an error in the check as she charged me for a more expensive vodka and I guess it was to much trouble for her to change it as she tried to downplay the error saying they were the same price when they are not. Then after I gave her what I understand is the usual $1 per (airport overpriced) drink tip, she starts acting up and being sarcastic about her service not been good and that we should let her know what she did wrong so that she can get better because we gave her such a bad tip. I honestly never had a waitress or bartender ever give me crap about my tip before I even leave the place. What a shame.
At Matt's you get huge portions!  I got the eggs and sausage breakfast.  They have great county potatoes!  Love the old fashion country decor.
Tried the waffle. It was excellent. Fluffy and great syrup. Probably one of the best I've tried. Although I wasn't a big fan of the peppered bacon.

Get the Hog and the Chick! No wait... The Chop and the chick...NOOO, get the special! Ok. Just get it all!! Thick cut bacon, fresh squeezed orange juice, crispy has browns, fresh preserves on sourdough toast.  Oh man, is this place good. Yes, you might have to wait a while to get seated in this TINY place, but it is worth it!   The service is very friendly and very quick.  I enjoy sitting along the window with their cute little knick knacks.    I hear the lunch menu is just as good at breakfast, but I have yet to try.  I honestly wish this place was open for dinner..."brinner" is my favorite meal! ;-)

My mom took me here this morning after I arrived on an early-morning flight, we had a craving for coffee and a new place.  First impression: Small brick building by what looks like a roach motel and a parking lot totally full. Some really weird icky smell was in the air too..? Inside is cramped with little orange tables, totally kitsch and cute. The staff were all very friendly and made sure our orders were taken as soon as we were ready, even to the point that different waitresses were asking to make sure we had coffee on the way. The coffee's great and I was impressed with raw sugar on each table.   The menu is small [literally] and I ordered the cheese omelette [cheddar] with mushrooms and hash browns. The hash browns were ridiculously oily. They would have been tastier without so much grease. The omelette was mediocre and I could have made the same in my own kitchen.  The whole wheat toast was probably the best part of the meal, and the jam tasted homemade and flavourful. I am not used to really greasy food like I was served [nor did I expect it] and therefore could not get through half my breakfast before my stomach started aching.   The jist? Small cafe, great waitstaff, subpar diner food. Oh, and this might be good to know: there is no restroom in the place, so if you need to use one, you will have to go next door to that sketchy motel.
The best breakfast in phoenix! Salami eggs were great, a bit spicy and delicious! Good coffee and the bread and strawberry jam is to die for! Can't wait to go back!
Always worth the wait. Food is awesome and so is the service. Definitely recommend. This spot is a tad bit small so I wouldn't recommend bringing a party bigger than 4.

Matt's Big Breakfast has amazing food. I always enjoy getting my breakfast or/and lunch here. The five spot is so good!! Also, the service is always great and the staff (Daniel) is always cheerful and welcoming! Thanks for the sweet experience!!

The food at Matt's is quite good. My issue is with the service. I'm gluten-intolerant and so I asked for my breakfast that normally comes with potatoes and toast to have extra potatoes instead of toast. I was taken aback when the server said no substitutions were allowed, not even for food sensitivities. I understand that a small restaurant that wants to turn tables quickly may not allow substitutions for any reason, but then they should clearly state that on the menu. I probably won't be back.

Great breakfast spot! Friendly service and even better food. Love that they use locally sourced foods whenever possible. My husband and I both had the "Hog and Chicks." I had mine with crispy bacon - fantastic, crispy, not greasy - and eggs over easy. My husband had scrambled eggs with sausage, also excellent. Loved the homemade sour dough toast and strawberry jam. Hash browns also were good. What a gem in downtown Phoenix.

The wait was long because we went on a weekend but the food is worth it.  Their food is really good and their wait staff is great and attentive.  I could see what the fuss was about.  This place has a reputation for being busy and always crowded on weekends, but it is because the food is delicious.

Well, someone goofed. Shortly after I ordered one of the daily specials today someone crossed it off the board. I kept expecting someone to come back and tell me they were out, but nothing happened for 15 minutes after our ticket went into the kitchen. Finally the waitress came over and relayed the bad news. So we sat for another 10 minutes waiting for my replacement order. Come on, guys.

First off i absolutely love the modern decor and the laid back style of the restaurant. The menu isn't huge which means what they do they do right! My waffle was perfect and the home fries were amazing. We left full and happy.

It's worth avoiding LAX layovers just for this restaurant.  They have some awesome cocktails and even better food.  I love the waffle and thick bacon.  They also have an amazing grilled cheese.  Everything tastes really good and its very reasonably priced.

So I had the pleasure of eating at both locations while in PHX and this one out did the original!  I had this gin, lemon and soda water drink which solved my pissy attitude towards the airport :).  For food I had the grilled cheese and tomato soup and added bacon to the grilled cheese.  They had awesome buttery bread and the soup was nice and thick.  Every employee seemed like they were having a great day which helped as many of us were grumpy from canceled and delayed flight.  Prices were good so I strongly recommend!

sorry, everyone else---all the crybabies that want a big place to get a table fast, absoulutely comfortable refrigirated air, and room for your party of 38.  this is not your place, so deal with it.  what it is, and the only way i found the place was doing some work about a couple blocks away, and wanted to get a good bite to eat.  nothing special, but something close.  someone on our work crew steered me here.  i went back the second day as well.  the food is fresh, plentiful, and the service--at least to me was really attentinve.  i was lucky to hit the place where i did not have to wait.    places like this are the kind that i keep coming back to.  the quality of the food that i had was very very good, and the prices are reasonable as well.  it's a cute place, but if you don't want cute, don't want to wait, and don't appreciate the kind of place that matt's it----go somewhere else.

Solid breakfast/brunch choice if you're at Sky Harbor. Waffles and Nueske's bacon were very good, my husband's Hog + Chick (eggs/bacon/toast/potatoes) was standard, and they kept the coffee coming. Friendly service.

Breakfast was good but the server was a little much. To each his own but the flamboyant flirting was quite offensive and after years of construction I am hard to offend. Since I was displeased with my service and just wanted to get out of there i opted to leave no tip. Michael our server decided to in a round about way make comments on tips and so on and so on make the experience even more awkward. Like I said food was good but the pet nick names and service made for an overall poor experience. I will stick the the original restaurant from now on.

I haven't been here in a while.  Stopped in Monday AM and didn't have to wait for a table which is rare.  I had their special which was scrambled eggs with apple sausage and spinach.  Served with hash browns and toast it was a great way to start the day.

By 'big breakfast' they really do mean BIG BREAKFAST. Affordable breakfast place with a straightforward menu, and a few locations scattered throughout Phoenix. We hit the 1st street location on a Monday morning, 8:30 am, and apparently beat the rush - as a party of two, we were seated immediately, but as we ate we watched with some surprise as pretty large groups kept coming in and were willing to wait for quite awhile - can they not tell it's a tiny location with primarily tables for two? As for the food, my tomatillo/eggs/tortilla/pinto beans were pretty good, though not the unforgettable experience I'd expected, judging by the other Yelp reviews which guided us here in the first place. My husband outright hated his eggs & salami scramble, describing the salami as 'rancid.' But honestly, eggs and salami together sounds awful anyway, so perhaps he should have played it safe and gotten a classic eggs & bacon option. Coffee refills slowed down as the place became more and more busy.  Anyway. We're glad we tried it as it filled us up for several hours, and it didn't break the bank.

Been here three or four times this year for breakfast.  Their food is very good and the portions are quite generous.  I usually split one of their omelettes and the country potatoes are delicious.  The jam for the toast is outstanding and their coffee is solid as well.  Get here early to avoid a wait on weekends and you're good to go.

So as I strolled through the Phoenix Airport I moved passed the regular fast food breakfast fare and came across Matt's Big Breakfast and thought "this is the place."  The tables were packed and the "to go" line seemed to be moving quickly.  I checked my phone (25-30 minutes to boarding STARTED), read over the menu (Breakfast Burrito for the win) and got in line.    The young guy working as very nice despite the fact he was obviously SLAMMED.  I should've taken the clue that 1 guy taking all the orders, pouring all the coffee, and having to run around the bar to pick up the to go food was a harbinger of issues to come, but I forged on.  He took my name and gave me my receipt.  As time continued to pass I started forgetting who ordered what and when and I noticed the crowd outside of the restaurant continued to grow, and grow, and grow.  It was cool though, I still had 20 minutes left.  Around the 25 minutes of waiting mark I figured it was time to see if I was close.  As I waited in the line AGAIN, to check the status of my food, I noticed that 3 of the 7 people in the line were doing the same thing.  I reached the front, informed the clerk that I NEEDED my food because I'd waited 30 minutes and my plane was boarding soon.  He informed me my food was up soon.  I waited about 7-8 more minutes after that and was handed my burrito.  No bag, no napkin.  Just the burrito.  As I ran off I overheard another lady requesting a refund because she couldn't wait for her food anymore.  Once I finally boarded my plane (and had to check my bag because I was one of the last 5 people to enter it), I was ready to eat.  The burrito itself was "meh" at best.  The standout was the bacon, it was amazing and it was obviously this wasn't some low cost meat, I found myself wishing the rest of the burrito emulated this taste.  It didn't.  The eggs had next to no flavor and were oily, and I'm about 90% sure the potatoes were cooked in some form of olive oil as well, because that's the only taste they had.    Overall, I wished I had as great an experience as everyone else who sat down, ate and reviewed, however I wasn't so lucky.  Beyond having a friendly person, the express counter was a joke (40 minutes, that's good right?) and the burrito beyond the bacon completely lacked flavor.  Maybe it was just a bad day I attended, but I don't know if I'll roll the dice again.  If you go, make sure you have an hour plus and skip the burrito.

Best breakfast in Phoenix hands-down! Love, love, love the Chop and chick!  The pork chop is cooked perfectly.  First time ever I've had a pork chop cooked and seasoned perfectly that I didn't make myself :)
Bringith the masses and come hungry! Huge portions of comfort breakfast. Beware, you will be in a food coma after.
Loved the strawberry preserve on sourdough toast. The potatoes were a little under cooked though. Cool atmosphere and good service.

The food is always amazing!!! There are a few servers that exceed expectations every single time and one of those individuals is Daniel. Always greeting customers with a friendly smile and  concerned about the entire experience rather than just the meal. Love coming here!!
Maybe it was just all the hype beforehand.  I had heard about this place for six years.  I was ready to be amazed.  Unfortunately it is very, very mediocre.

The service sucks at Matt's. Unfortunately for those of us that like good food AND good service the food is crave worthy- better than any breakfast I have ever had, so simple and so, so, yummy. That being said, I have never been to a restaurant that ran out of cream for coffee. Not only that but they made it seem like no big deal, no apologies. I had one too many bad experiences and have not been back since. I have been tempted many a time to go back and see if they have changed their evil ways, but I just can't bring myself to do it. We'll see- life is too short to hold grudges, especially when good food is involved, right?  UPDATE: Ok, we ventured back to Matt's to celebrate my birthday in April and I have to say that the service wasn't bad at all.... no more snotty waitresses, so I am adding 2 more stars. If they would make the effort to be really friendly they would get my 5th star... but I won't hold my breath, I think it is just not that kind of place. Now if you really are a thrill seeker I have a challenge for you... go to the bathroom at Matt's (go ahead and ask them where the bathroom is and you will see what I mean)... and if you want to have a good laugh imagine a nine months pregnant woman trying to go to the bathroom at Matt's... yeah, that was fun, luckily I escaped with little more than a pinch on the thigh from the toilet seat... but unless you have a death wish you should definitely empty your bladder BEFORE you go to Matt's...fair warning.

Literally got off our flight and were starving. We looked up some breakfast places in the area and chose Matts. The wait was a little long but it was worth it!!! The bread that came with our meal was AMAZING! The waitresses were very kind even when we had a tired screaming baby on our hands.

Not my cup of tea. Very sweet Rosemary potatoes, prefer garlic and green peppers. Salami scramble, unempressive. Rubbery salami and tasteless eggs. Cold coffee.  Healthy food? I would loose weight by eating a lot less, if this was my only choice.

I would really, really like to give Matt's more stars, but this place just doesn't do it for me (and trust me - I've been back three times in hopes of a better experience!).   Ambiance: Great! Trendy and modern, and the Marina Heights scenery is GORGEOUS! But...I wish they utilized the space a bit better. We're in the peak of patio/outdoor seating in Phoenix, and Matt's enormous patio continues to go unused with no tables or outdoor seating options!   Food: Standard. It's really good, simple fare. But...I could make it in my own kitchen (that's how simple it is). They use fresh ingredients that are sustainably sourced, so I have peace of mind there, but the menu is limited, and again - I could make lots of what they serve at home in under ten minutes.   Service: ...wish it was better. It's not that the servers are rude (and again, we've been three times, so I've seen a decent sample of what's to offer), but they don't always feel the most hospitable. I've gone long lengths of time with an empty water glass or coffee cup, and find myself flagging down waitstaff to add items to my tab. I've seen food delivered to the wrong table multiple times, and overall, just don't see the service team working well together.   So, the wrap-up is that this is a great place to try if you're not on a budget and are in the mood for a simple, no-frills breakfast meal. Expect to wait a little, spend a bit, and walk away satisfied but not blown away. Could be a great place to stop if you're taking a stroll on ASU's Tempe Campus or in the Marina Heights neighborhood and are wanting a bite!
This place has fantastic service and delicious breakfast burritos. We always go here when we're in town

Portions are big, tastes pretty good too. Service was relatively fast for how busy they are and the wait time is lower than other places.  We got a to go order with our meal and they left it on the counter and we had to ask for it again because we were done and still waiting for it.  Also, the $3.25 chocolate milk is a glass of milk with chocolate syrup on the inside of the cup and you have to mix it with the straw which is kinda weird. Like why am I paying so much to mix my own chocolate milk...? Lol
Hands down the best breakfast join in Phoenix. Good atmosphere, good service, and absolutely amazing breakfast food.

Stopped by Matt's when I was visiting from out of town and it's a solid breakfast place.   There was a long line though because it was a Saturday, but wasn't anything unbearable. I had the cheese omelette and hash brown and the portions are h u g e. The top of the hash brown was nice and crunchy (and really good after you add a little more salt and ketchup) but the inside was a little soggier than I would like and I think it's because it's so thick. The omelette was really good - not too much cheese - but needed a little salt and pepper for more flavor.

This is one of those places that you drive by all the time, thinking "Man, I should try that place." but never get around to it. Today I finally stopped by with some friends and I am SO glad I did. Matt's is a perfect early-bird breakfast stop with plenty of options for everyone. The waffles are crack and the hash browns are meth

Employees with attitude. A forgotten order that was then rushed through. Food that was undercooked and unappealing. Told it would be 10 minutes. Found the absent management after 22 minutes. Pointed out to them that 22 was significantly more than 10. If you only have one machine then you probably shouldn't make promises you can't keep. Heard an employee make a rude comment about the  22 minute wait. Avoid, avoid, avoid.

My wife and I had an awful 13 hour lay over in Phoenix. We arrived around 8 pm and our flight wasn't until 10 am the next morning. The original plan was to eat a good dinner and try to fall asleep... Unfortunately our plan didn't work out.   We didn't get our bags until about 845 and all the restaurants were closed, so we scarfed down a pizza. Around 2 am I was searching on Yelp for some good breakfast.   I got the steak and eggs and it was cooked to perfection. Most steak and eggs are overly cooked but this steak was JUICY. My wife got a waffle with bacon. The waffle was so fluffy and had just about enough sweetness. The bacon here is also amazing. Never had bacon like this before. It was a thicker cut and seasoned with pepper. She also got a mimosa and I got a Bloody Mary. Both were really good. Thanks Matt's Big Breakfast for making this long lay over enjoyable.

Matt's is one of my go to breakfast spots in Phoenix. I've been coming here for about 2 years now and they never disappoint.  Nothing fancy on the menu; just basic meals made incredibly well with freshness you can taste. I'm vegetarian so I can't comment on the meat but the pancakes, waffles, omelettes and potatoes are perfect. Even their toast and jelly is amazing. AND they have real maple syrup!  Only downside is the wait time to be seated on weekends (which doesn't personally bother me, they're a great restaurant so you expect it). But, once you are seated and order, the food comes fast!
Could be one of the best breakfast I have eaten outside of my kitchen.   The staff is friendly and the food came out fast and hot. I will be back in the near future.  Order the OJ is is fresh.

If you want a healthy hearty salad order the  healthy salad with grilled chicken. Outstanding quality. Great service. Our server had a very short haircut with pretty eyes. I did not get her name but she was so kind.

Finally made my way down to this place.  Was avoiding it because of the long wait everyone talks about but I had more time on my hands today so decided to give it a try.  Arrived around 12p on a Sunday and we were seated in about 45 min (party of 2- apparently, parties of 2 or 3 get seated the quickest).  Th wait wasn't so bad being that we found so shade and I had my phone to keep me occupied.  The hostess was very friendly.  The place is small.  The menu was a lot smaller than I expected.  For breakfast dishes, there were about 5-7 egg dish choices and a handful of other choices.  I opted for the griddlecakes and my husband ordered an omelette w/ cheddar, sausage and mushrooms.  He had coffee and I had the honey lemonade.  The lemonade was very refreshing, fresh squeezed and just the right sweetness.  As far as the food goes, it was good.  The sausage has a nice spice to it, the griddlecakes were light and fluffy, the strawberry jam and toast were yummy and the omelette was tasty.  My hubs ordered the hashbrowns with his dish and he prob should have gotten the home fries b/c they looked a lot better (based on the table next to us).  I give it 3 stars b/c it's just good fresh food and, for the most part, cooked well (the hashbrowns were a litte more greasy than I prefer).  I don't know if I would go through the long wait for it in the future.  Coming from San Diego (Hash House, the Mission) and LA (The Griddle), it's missing something more unique to make it worth the wait.  I've waited 60-90 min for those places.  Def give it a try if you've never been.

I'm  going to stop being such a taker, and give for once! I use Yelp along with other reputable websites to help make my dining, travel and shopping decisions and I never take the time to give back!! I know, I know....awful. I'm turning over a new leaf! Here is my first Yelp. Please don't judge. It's my first time.... Okay, here goes. So, I went to Matt's for the first time a few days ago....  Food- Amazing.  Best pancakes ever! I'm not sure what the secret ingredient is but they are beyond good! Fluffy little cakes of love. I also tasted the butter burger. Very, very, yummy. If you decide to dine here make sure you try the bacon. I don't think I've ever tasted anything like it. Sweet, savory and cooked just right.  The building is very small, the wait is extra long and make sure you don't overindulge on the free refills of ice tea because there is NO BATHROOM!! The seating is cramped and the service is rushed, but the food is worth dealing with Matt's shortcomings.
I walked 7 blocks to revisit this place rather than partake in the "all you can eat" breakfast at my hotel. You get lots of tasty, quality food for reasonable prices. Highly recommend.
Had the Rueben w steak fries.  Great corned beef.  Paul the bartender has a great personality and seems to like his job.  Hard to find good peeps behind the bar anymore.   Especially in an airport.

Matt's Big Breakfast is good. Not like St. Francis good, but like the best diner food without the transients and lard that one would come to expect from traditional breakfast joints.  They mostly local and farm fresh, quality ingredients and although there isn't much variety, they do standard breakfast well.   If you want a fresh American breakfast with freshly squeezed juice, come here. Be prepared for a long wait if you snooze.

Well my sister and I decided to try Matt's in Tempe today and the food was good but the service well inadequate at best.  Our girl server came and took our order I had a few  questions (dietary needs and all) I ended up ordering the BLT since it was breakfast I requested the breakfast potatoes instead of chips and coffee. Well my food came with chipsI let the server (not the waitress) know I didn't order chips but the potatoes she immediate brought a side of the potatoes (great service) and I ordered sourdough but got wheat bread no biggie. We continued to eat and my coffee was running low waitress no where to be found however the server was close by "don't know where our waitress is but can I get some more coffee please" she immediately brought more coffee, great service!  We continued to eat our meal and talk and yet again I had to ask another person for more coffee since our waitress was no where to be found.  We where done with our meal and sat there waiting for our illusive waitress, we had to ask the very attentive waiter (very nice young man who knew his regulars) again "we don't know where are waitress is but can we get a couple togo boxes and our check" really!!!  I am a very good tipper I always give more than 20% however this time I did not tip a cent food was great just make sure you sit at the table where the young man will wait on you.

I love the waffles.......they completely blessed my hunger, took a walk, and had a nice stern talk with my appetite....this is my 2nd time eating here and I like it better this time than I did the first time.

Food was good! We had a large group of 25 and the service was sporadically good but could def be improved upon! I was actually surprised that refills on soda are not free. I thought it was an April fools joke but apparently not! Food elsewhere is just as good with better service and you don't have to spend $$$ on refills that cost a few pennies!

"How far is the drive from LA to Phoenix?"   I recently caught myself contemplating this one morning in my home in LA. That is how good this place is!   Recently, on a business trip, we went for a sort of brunch/lunch. My wife had already had breakfast there that morning and insisted we return. Myself, being a skeptic, lowered my expectations so I would not burst her bubble. After my first bite of their Reuben sandwich and their hash browns I began to bubble myself! In a good way of course!   The combination of the QUALITY ingredients and the simplicity of the items made everything we ate a joy. This is a trait I have seen through most of Europe and hopefully the trend is coming here. Quality and simplicity are king!   Now the trick is to somehow get back to Phoenix. Foiled again, I knew there was a catch to this place!

Matt's in the airport, love it. This was one of our favorite meals in Phoenix and now we can get a taste even when just passing through the city.   Great food for breakfast or lunch, fun music mix, and nice staff make this a go to spot, especially in an airport!

This was a great way to break up an airport layover.  I had the BLT which was served on thick toasted bread and had delicious thick cut peppered bacon.  To my delight it was served with homemade kettle chips and a pickle that was pure pregnancy heaven.  I asked for another pickle and to my surprise three more were served up on a plate pro bono.  Seriously this is no Vlasic, this is some a-grade zmyology.  The kiddie meal of an egg, two pieces of the same high quality bacon, and hand-cut thick fries were a steal.  I was tempted to order a hand squeezed honey lemonade or a hand squeezed oj but I stuck with water.  They even had a high chair.  The food here is prepared with quality ingredients.  For example they make their own corned beef versus cheap-o deli meat. This ain't yo average airport fare.

Fantastic breakfast place.  Always worth the wait.  Found the place from Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives show.  I'm a big fan of breakfast, but I also know what a great breakfast tastes like.  This is it.  Don't be discouraged by the wait time or the close quarters.  Belly up to the counter if you're claustrophobic.     Everything I've eaten off of the menu has been stellar.  Some reviewers said orange juice was small, but it's fresh-squeezed and delicious (unless you just brushed your teeth).  Hog and Chick, Griddle Cakes, Waffle and Bacon, all phenomenal.    Service is always excellent here.  Sometimes there were three different people waiting on our party, but we never lacked for a thing.  Give it a shot!
Awesome spot in Phoenix! Check the specials first before you order. They are definitely worth a look! Jalapeo enchilada scramble was awesome

I heard many people saying we should try Matt's Big Breakfast so we had to go.  This place is VERY small with very limited seating inside and no outside option when we were there.  We waited for about 45 minutes talking to people outside about how good it was.  Once seated, on the window bar stools, we were promptly greeted.  Service was good if not abrupt and to the point.  The portions were a good size, but there are bigger out there for sure.    Our food was good but nothing great as we had been hearing.  This is NOT worth the wait if you ask me, but I would go there as a neighborhood staple if no more than a 10 minute wait.   For my $ and time, I'm going to Farm House in Gilbert if I had a choice, now THAT PLACE is worth the wait.

A nice alternative to big box breakfast places.  We all liked our food.  We loved the strawberry preserves (bought 3 jars to take home!).  A few hints:  the bacon is pretty heavily peppered and the hash browns come as an oily brick shape.  They're good but just oily.  Our order was 100% correct, which says a lot considering the volume of orders!  One negative: only one mens and one women's restroom...between the people inside and the people waiting outside, you'd think there would be more than one for each gender.  We'll be back.

Saw this place several years back on DDD.  I finally flew through Phoenix and went to see the place.    This is the best breakfast place I've ever been to!!!!  I am a breakfast snob if it's not better than what can do at home it's not worth paying for is my motto. Everything was awesome I mean everything.  No wonder it's gone from a tiny little place in downtown Phoenix to a three store chain.

Tried this place for the first time last month with my girlfriend and it was amazing. It honestly blew away my expectations. I was mainly impressed because I really do NOT like waiting more than 10 minutes to eat somewhere, let alone breakfast. I was miffed being outside in the heat to wait, but as long as you're cool sitting at the bar, you'll get right in!   This place is WORTH THE WAIT! And do not let the limited menu fool you, everything impressed us, from the iced coffee to the Skinny plate I had and Chorizo special plate my girlfriend had. The value is also great too. I was more than full after clearing my plate. Everything was fresh, delicious, and the interior, although loud, was everything you could want from a quaint, downtown Phoenix breakfast place. I can't wait to go again!

Hubby and I had a kid free and lazy weekend. We got here for brunch at 10am and the place was slammed. As we didn't have anything else going on, we waited the 30 mins for a table, but they really move the crowd along so dont be too intimidated....  Well worth the wait! The freshly squeezed honey lemonade was outstanding. Menu relatively limited which was great as everything looked great. No salami scramble for me :( [next time...trying to be good] We both had the super yummy 'Skinny' which comes with a fresh and light side salad which was great, but our table neighbors hash browns looked incredibly crispy!  Even though MBB was busy with a long seating waiting list, we never felt rushed by our server. They are a very well managed eating establishment. Interior design aesthetic is fresh, fun and modern. My only personal preference, with counter seating and hightop tables options I would rather not sit at a lower table and would be willing to wait longer until either of those choices became available.  Will def. be back! Outside of the downtown Scottsdale area, Arcadia is pretty underserved for great breakfast spots so a great location for us. Parking is easy. We regularly attend swim meets at Phoenix Swim Club/Phoenix Country Day school, the close proximity means the kids can have a 'great feed' as they open at 630am or better yet, we can go there after we drop them off for warm ups!

Solid Phoenix brunch spot!  We were out-of-towners visiting for the weekend, and we were hungry the minute we landed. Matt's was a highly rated brunch spot, and it definitely met my expectations. We were anticipating a potential wait on a Sat. afternoon, but there was luckily none!  I ordered the egg dish special of the day: -Egg scramble: delish, except I ended up picking out some bacon pieces  -House potatoes: made crispy and flavorful esp. with the rosemary garnish = addictive -Sourdough: perfect with their house strawberry preserve  Best part of Matt's is the hospitable service and affordable dishes. Food came out soon after we ordered and the refills and followups were continuous.

Matts is such a wonderful place.  My daughter & I found this gem on yelp. And it has now become our fav. We drive from Tempe to matts. The waffles r amazing and the griddlecakes....need I say more.  Try this place if you haven't.

Unremarkable chicken sandwich served by unenthusiastic wait staff.  Sandwich was supposed to have a pesto taste of which there was none.  Even the addition of the missing romaine lettuce would not have helped flavor wise.  Paid an outrageous $11.50 for a 5 oz. pour of Kim Crawford Sauvignon blanc.  I give it 3 stars because this is my first negative experience here.

Excellent service and great portion size.  The bacon is out of this world!  The weekdays aren't as busy as the weekends. Overall the food is reasonably priced and high quality.  This was our first time and we are definitely coming back!
