Worst airport food ever! Cancelled my salad because there was a roach running across the bar. I got my margarita and there was something floating in it! I wouldn't complain about the glass being dirty and just send it back but that was one to many for me

Place is crazy good. Breakfast favorites that don't skimp on flavor...or saturated fats. Isn't that what breakfast is all about. If you're only going to eat out breakfast a few times a month, this is the spot.   Don't be fooled by other Phoenix Yelp haters..."too loud", "not worth the price", "I want to love this place, but...", same old tired reviews left at all of PHX's favorite restaurants. Check this place out, grab a coffee while you wait, and hope the Matt wants to expand the operation.
Arguably the best breakfast in town. High quality ingredients cooked properly.

Was sat quickly, table was clean and waitress was quick and friendly. I decided to order the meatloaf because the waitress said it was yummy and she was right! The meatloaf was grilled on both sides to have a crisp carmellization. The mashed potatoes were delicious with a great grace and the side asparagus was perfect! I will definitely be back. Thank you!

This place has great food, great service, great atmosphere...but a crappy wait.   I love eating at Matt's, but I don't go as frequently as I would like because of the wait. I think the food is better than most, they use fresh ingredients from the farmers market down the way, which always improves food quality.  Some people don't like the size of the restaurant, but I love it! It wouldn't be as fun and intimate if it were bigger. I have had Matt's a few times, but today I went at 6:40 (10 minutes after they open) and it was incredible. There was no line and no people, making the feel of a "small breakfast joint" feel real. It was calm, quiet, wonderful and reminded me to write a review! So, if you're an early bird and can get there around opening time, I highly recommend it! Otherwise, it's good, but prepared to wait while sipping on some yummy grapefruit water.
You have to love a place that still cares enough to use half a stick of butter when they cook your meal.  Throw in some Bourbon candied sausage and you have a real old fashioned breakfast cafe.

Believe it or not, I finally had my first Matt's experience this morning... I'd been hearing about Matt's Big Breakfast for ages, but never really wanted to make the drive to wait forever just for a greasy breakfast!  However, we were talked into Matt's by some friends of ours that were also Matt's virgins... we met there around 10am, only to find that there were about 2 full pages worth of names ahead of us, and that they would not quote a wait... Matt's was smaller than I imagined, so I knew it would take awhile.  We debated going elsewhere and even went over to The Turf for coffee.  (If the service there were better there, we probably would've just stayed there, but we figured if we were going to wait, we'd just wait for Matt's).  My pregnant friend went into Matt's at one point to use the bathroom and they told her she had to go to the hotel nextdoor and 'ask for Mike.'  That was a bit shady...  About an hour and a half later, our party of four was seated... and needless to say, we were all starving by then!  We started with some fresh squeezed OJ and coffee.  (The OJ glasses were tiny, but each sip tasted like heaven... and I was pleased to see that they use coffee fresh from Cave Creek Coffee Co.)  When it was time to order, I was extremely disappointed that after that long wait, they were out of whole wheat toast.  I ended up getting an egg white omelette (yes, they do egg whites), hashbrowns, sour dough toast + preserves.  I could eat only about half of it... but what I did eat was good, greasy, and filled me up for most of the day.  I don't really see myself rushing back to Matt's again anytime soon - unless it's on a weekday when the wait isn't so bad.  But I will say I'm happy that I finally made it to Matt's - and oh, what an experience it was!

I'm a huge fan of Matt's Big Breakfast -- this location in particular.    The staff is super friendly, the vibe is laid back and fun, the food is pretty delicious, and the portions are indeed HUGE!  On a recent visit, I ordered the griddle cakes for the kids and a side of bacon.  Just as I finished taste-testing to make sure all was edible, I started saying that the pancakes are the best in town and my husband was saying the same thing about the bacon!  The kids enjoyed both as well...  I had "the skinny" which is a scramble with egg whites, spinach, gruyere cheese, and chicken apple sausage, and comes with a huge side of mixed greens...  We also had a breakfast sandwich, a hog and chick, and the Sunday Steak & Eggs special at our table... Needless to say, it was a ton of food, but those leftovers are going to be great tomorrow!  I'd love to see some fruit and maybe another healthy option on the menu, but this place still rocks... especially if you're looking to fill your belly and you're not counting calories!

Our flight to Newark was scheduled to leave at 9:45am this morning.  By the time we made it through security, it was 9:20... (I'm one of those people that cuts it a little too close sometimes).  I was starving though, and knew I needed to eat something prior to the five hour flight!  Luckily, Matt's came to the rescue!  I ordered a Sonrisa Burrito to-go.  It comes with eggs, cheese, jalapeno peppers, potatoes, and your choice of bacon or sausage.  I ordered mine with sausage and no potatoes.  It was a generous serving and I actually ended up splitting it with my husband.  We devoured it and agreed that it was delicious.  I would have liked some salsa to go with it though.  Next time, I'll ask for that!  I'm now writing this review on the flight and feeling good after filling my belly... If you find yourself at Sky Harbor anywhere close to Terminal 4 - B gates, Matt's is a great option.  You can eat in or take it to-go.  So glad that we have so many decent options at the PHX airport now!  Bon appetit and safe travels!
Needing my protein for supper, and my low carbs. Love that I found a place in the terminal at PHX that serves breakfast all day. The hostess, Chyrisse, was extremely helpful and friendly.

I love this place! The food is delicious and they are on top of their game. I've eaten here a couple of times and each time the food was delicious and the bacon is amazing. I always liked bacon but typically, bacon is bacon but not here- this bacon is amazing! The staff is great and they work well together like a well oiled machine. You will not be disappointed if you try Mikes Big Breakfast!
Recently moved to Scottsdale and driving home from a doctor's visit and we discovered Matt's Big Breakfast. Great Eggs Benedict, wonderful hash browns along with fresh OJ.  What's not to like.
We love Matt's Big Breakfast. The food is fresh and the portions are a good size. We love breakfast food and Matt's Big Breakfast hits the spot. We are excited to return.
Would be a five, but only one bathroom per gender. Seriously? Everything else was great. Super efficient and great food. But figure out the potty sitch!
Not a fan but the service was good. Nothing wrong with the food it's mediocre and overpriced

I decided to try something different, and I'm so glad I stopped by. My wife and I both had the Saturday Special Scramble. The egg, chorizo and jalapeno peppers were cooked perfectly. Great flavor with just the right amount of heat! The coffee was good and our server was kind and thoughtful. I will definitely be back!

Charge your phone, drink your beer, and have an epic burrito.. What more could you really want? We didn't get them but the server told us how amazing the waffles are, definitely on our list for the next time we come back.

Simply one of the best breakfasts in the valley. From the food, to the attentive service, they never disappoint. I usually order a coffee and the special, and they are always superb! It's always fun to go to the location downtown, but it does usually have a long wait, so I prefer going to the newer location at 32nd Street and Camelback, where the wait is generally much less time.

I love this restaurant. My one complaint is that they don't make or provide salsa. And hot sauce just isn't cutting it. But you don't need salsa for everything and I find that if you order the special of the day, you have the best experience - it's what the chef feels like making! Go on a weekday morning to avoid the crowd.

I CANNOT believe that I have not rated this place yet... what the?!?!? I LOVE it here. Every time I have tried something different and every time I  am glad I did. This place is not only great but everyone is nice.  Ive even waited outside in the summer...that alone should say something!!

We went to the location in downtown. I ordered chop and chic and my husband ordered the second daily special; the first daily special ran out just as we were ordering.  I thought my chop was a bit over cooked but it was seasoned well. The rosemary potatoes was delicious.   The second daily was eggs with apple sausage and has brown.  I thought the sausage was a bit bland.   The 'toast' that came with the entrees was deliciously fresh.

My husband and I made it to the Farmer's Market early on a Saturday, which is quite a feat, so we decided to reward ourselves with breakfast across the street.  We'd heard great things about Matt's and I always see a crowd of people waiting outside.   He waited for our table while I shopped across the way at the farmer's market.  While he was waiting he went inside and asked for a cup of coffee.  He was told that they only sell coffee with to-go orders, so he asked for a coffee "to go".  He was turned down, so he walked across the street to the farmer's market and bought some coffee from a stand.  When our table was ready, they made him stand outside to finish his coffee because they have a strict "no outside food or drink" rule.  Pretty lame.  As far as the food, I had an omelet with spinach, mushrooms, and fontina cheese.  My husband had an omelet with hard salami.  While the food was good, it wasn't anything I couldn't have made at home.  The star of the meal was the locally made fresh strawberry preserves, but nobody told us that was coming and it didn't go too well with my husband's sourdough toast.  A heads up would have been nice.  I think part of the allure of this place is the fact that there is almost always a crowd of people waiting outside.   There's very little chance I'll ever join them.  I'll stick to the breakfast gyros and free samples across the way at the farmer's market.

The place was hard to find and I would not have found it without using the navigation on my cell phone. I spent $20 on the scrambled egg special with a side of bacon and a side of hash browns. I don't mind paying good money for good food but the food was mediocre at best. After one bite of the hash browns I set them to the side and refused to try another. The bacon was delicious but a little undercooked, and the fat was still elastic. The egg special was delish. The server was prompt and manorly. The menus was small enough that I was not jumping out of my chair to try anything new.

I usually try and stop in when I am connecting in PHX as their food is pretty darn good. However today the service was extremely SLOW!.  They need to remember people have connecting flights and don't have a lot of time. Took 90 minutes to get in/out today, almost missed my flight. If my flight wasn't delayed I would have missed it. I had to ask for my check 3x.  So if you have less than two hours I wouldn't bother here.

Pro: Huge stack of beautiful pancakes. Con: Thimble of syrup, and you have to pay for more. Weak. And why do waffles include a side of bacon, but the pancakes don't? Isn't it the same batter? A steakhouse-style a la carte approach to breakfast seems like hustling backwards.

I love this place. I've never had a bad meal there and the staff is wonderful. The only reason I take away one star is because I really just don't like waiting outside. But the griddlecakes and sourdough toast (complete with homemade jam) are amazing!  Hopefully I will be able to visit on a day where I won't have to wait outside for too long.

I enjoy cooking breakfast. But sometimes I don't want to cook, I just want to eat something delicious...and simple.   There isn't much on the menu. Good food doesn't have to be complicated. My favorite breakfast here is their griddlecakes. They are like pancakes but better. Paired with their thick cut bacon (and hash browns if you're REALLY hungry) you won't be disappointed. And customer service is top-notch...EVERY time.

Not impressed. The customer service was awesome and the coffee was hot. Otherwise, this is a no go. Door was expensive and cold. Watched the food sit at the window for 10 minutes before it made it to us. The price to quality ratio is way off. Maybe the main location would be better.

This is a great spot. The people are friendly and the food is delicious. Its a small menu, I particulary enjoy the weekend specials but from my experience its all good. Expect a wait but its worth it....
The potatoes are to die for and the special is always amazing.  Everything I have ever eaten here has been magnificent.  Love, love, love MBB.

My friend and I decided to have brunch at Matts... I have been dying for a delicious homemade breakfast with an over size biscuit and bacon so crispy....you want to smack you mama.....   Well Yelpers I  found the place.... it's tucked away in strip mall were you can drive right passed it ....   We had a short wait (15 mins) which I heard it great for any place that services brunch on a busy Sunday. We were seated my a man who could have been an actor or an actor type....lol....  I immediately ordered a cup of coffee...now we know most places which have a diner feel have the worse coffee...... WELL BLOW ME AWAY....this coffee was so damn good...I have two refills before I actually ordered breakfast....   I ordered scrambled egg whites, home fries with toast and of course BACON......   We waited patiently for our meal and then from the corner of my eye.... I see it.... pure bliss....  The plate looked like a work of art..... my mouth began to water and eyes were tearing...   I couldnt even wait until the cute waitress placed my plate down in from of me. I grabbed the first thing on the plate and by the grace of everything  holy...... it was the BACON..... lite, crispy with freshed cracked pepper on it....   Everything was seasoned well and tasted delicious...the home fries with rosemary and carmalized  onions....Wowwwww!  Look I already have a another day planned for breakfast this week.... I know I may need rehab... I would have given Matts 5 stars but they only serve biscuits on Tuesday's......bummer!

Went for brunch during the week, and were not disappointed! Great spot for brunch!  It's just street parking around the restaurant, and I can imagine that when this place is busy, parking might be kind of difficult.   Inside it's wide open seating with a small counter/bar seating area as well. It's pretty noisy/loud inside, but not to the point where it bothered us. The service was excellent! Very fast! Very friendly!  The food was also excellent! We had the Skinny and the Special (egg scramble w/ schreiner's chorizo, jalapeno's, white cheddar, potatoes). Both were delicious, and were only $10.95 with good size portions! We also had the signature bourbon cherry sausage, which was a really interesting mix of flavors, and had a nice crunch to the casing. We definitely left very full!  Overall, great brunch spot in Phoenix! Highly recommend this place!

no place i would rather be on a Saturday at 6:30 a.m.  then at Matt's Big Breakfast -definately we worth getting up early for with a small group of great friends - the best breakfast joint in Phoenix!!!

Okay, I admit it - we are waaaaay late to this party. We tried once before but the hour-plus wait was just two much for the four starving carnivores with me that day. This time our strategy was to go early on a Saturday morning as close to 6:30am opening as possible. We arrived around 7:15 (it WAS the weekend after all) and only waited about 20min for a table for two.   I had the special of the day - 3-egg scramble with andouille sausage, fresh local baby spinach and fontina cheese - YUM! The sausage had just the right enough of bam and the home fries with rosemary and onions rocked. My companion had the hog and chick - awesome meaty bacon with that.  Great value for the price - I packed up at least half my meal for the starving teenagers at home (who could not be roused at dawn). If you haven't been, get up early, bring a newspaper and rest assured Matt's Big is well worth the wait.

Came here today with friends that were visiting from San Diego. The wait for a table was about 45 minutes when we went. They have nice seating out front and they also supply fruit infused water with little paper cups while you wait. The 45 minutes went by quickly and we were seated at a table in the back by the daily specials wall. For drinks, ordered the strawberry honey lemonade and that was amazing! The drink was refreshing and not too sweet with great strawberry flavor. I could seriously drink these all day long. For breakfast, I ordered the waffles which came with thick bacon. The bacon was thick cut and was cooked perfectly for me.. nice crunch but not burnt. The bacon seemed to be peppered whatever the seasoning the taste was good. The waffles had a good flavor to them but I wished my waffle had a nice and crisp outside with the fluffy inside. The entire waffle was soft which made me a little sad but it still tasted good. I tried some of my friend's hash browns and that was delicious! They were clearly browned in butter and had a really nice buttery taste to them and they were perfectly textured. Great crispy outside. I also tried another friend's home fries and those were delicious as well. They had a very distinct buttery rosemary taste. Another tasty item I sampled was the strawberry jam that came with the toast. It wasn't too sweet at all and had a creamy texture to it. I wish that I had that option for my waffles instead of the syrup because I don't like syrup and the jam was scrumptious.   The staff was really friendly and attentive. My boyfriend's coffee was never empty. They would continuously refill without us having to ask. They were super busy and still had great service!
Good service every time.  Paul is great bartender!  Amazing bacon Bloody Mary .  See you guys next time.

Breakfast food is my favorite and Matts Big Breakfast is THE BEST in Phoenix!! They use quality food that tastes amazing!!! I always get the bacon, scrambled eggs, and potatoes. The toast and fresh made preserves are out of this world you have to get a jar to take home!!!! You won't be disappointed with anything you try I promise!!
Great food but wait times can be long, especially on weekends.

My absolute favorite place for breakfast!!!  The waffle literally melts in your mouth.  I have been going to Matt's for over 10 years now and have recommended it to hundreds.  The owners and staff are amazing.  The ingredients are fresh and I have yet to have a dish I did not like.  I would come early as it is very busy, but worth the wait!!!
A delightful eating experience. Chicken apple sausage was tasty and cooked to perfection.  Waffles with crispy/buttery edges... Delish! I would highly recommend this breakfast spot
It was about a 15 minute wait ; the weather was okay but the food was amazing . There bread & fresh jam is everything . Definitely a go to breakfast spot if your in Phoenix .

In downtown Phoenix for work, wanted to get a good breakfast. This place was just fantastic! Good portions, fresh ingredients, and great service. If I'm ever back in Phoenix again I would absolutely come here for breakfast!

Great food, fast service and if you hit it at the right day/time, no waiting. Unfortunately 4 stars for the ultra skimpy/tight shorts that some of the wait staff were wearing. I'm no prude but come on girls, this ain't Hooters!

IMO this is currently my favorite breakfast place in Phoenix. The menu is pretty basic and straight forward but everything I've had so far is absolutely delicious. Even just a cheese omelet and hash browns with toast is incredible! The decor is very cute and it's a seat yourself kind of place.

After waiting outside for a table we got one close to the bathrooms and it was heinous. The large orange juice should have more water than orange. The ambiance is pretty busy so the waitress. Hence, it is a whole mess without mention that the bill arrives just on time to kick us out and welcoming the new victim. The food was ... Oh yes it was as bad as the service. Probably it wasn't my day and not even the sort of place I will repeat. PD: I am not a bacon person.... If you are not a bacon person don't waist your time.. If you are... Check other reviews !

Not impressed.  Guess I should've read reviews ahead of time and stuck with waffles, pancakes, or homestyle fries.  Place was busy...no one at hostess stand to take names, leaving everyone crowded and confused. He finally hurried over and kicked us all outside to wait in the cold because we "couldn't be blocking the door". Finally got seated on the barstools (annoying).  We all got omelets and hashbrowns. I got the "special" with polish sausage and peppers. It sounded better than it was. Omelet was runny, hate that. And just unimpressive.  Only good thing about the meal was the thick toast...but really....its toast. There's nothing "big" about the portion either, so I don't know about the "big breakfast" thing. Everyones plates in the place looked unappetizing and boring, honestly. Worst breakfast I've ever spent money on.

01/26/2014- broke down when a memory of a once delicious waffle came to mind and returned after I swore I wouldn't. Why can't I just listen to myself? Took 1 hour to get seated, brought out a burned waffle, screwed up my husband's order, let our coffee cups go empty (never 1 refill) then 5 different people asked us 8 times if we were all finished, would like anything else, can I take that check even though I just brought your plate, aka GET THE HELL OUT. Ok, this is my last mistake. Matts Big Breakfast I'm gone peace out used to love you but you wrecked our relationship with your dumb hipster waiters

Pretty good. Better than most other airport food place. I had cheese omelet w all the add ons. Makes it a $13.99 omelette but was pretty good. Onions were a little mushy but not bad. I would recommend this place. Almost worth 5 stars

I showed up this month for the Yelp breakfast club.  To me this is a really good neighborhood breakfast/lunch place.  Not necessarily a destination place nor worth the wait outside.  The food is good and priced correctly.  The space is still cramped for parties of 5 or more

Hey, Matt's with parking! Matt's always does a solid job with their meals and service. A destination place? Probably not. My friend and I picked it because it was a known place about halfway between us for an early morning breakfast.

Holy cow! Matt's knows how to cook potatoes. Whether you order them as home fries or hash browns, you cannot go wrong with either option. In fact, I would recommend building some sort of combination of both style of potatoes with a side of toast + strawberry jam because those are probably the best items on the menu.   I ordered the Hog and the Chick, and the pork chop lacked seasoning. My friend wasn't particularly fond of it either.   I do recommend ordering the strawberry honey lemonade. It's a little on the sweet side, but still highly satisfactory.  I am still day dreaming about those potatoes and wish I had placed an additional order to go.

Matt my friend,you never disappoint!   I chose to meet here for a business breakfast and was very happy with my choice. The goal: local, character, solid meal, easy parking  and central location. Mission accomplished.   Had the daily special with home fries - my MO is to trust the daily special and I'm always happy. Always love the coffee - though I would love to see some fresh cream from a local farm as an option.
Great breakfast.. the wait was a lil long but all in all some good food..  the bacon reminded me of the pepper bacon at stater bros

Look, there is no reason for you to read the 51st review on this place unless you specifically sought me out and you trust me.  Matt's is good!  Go stuff yo face in a waffle and that thick cut bacon.  Mmm!
Good hearty breakfast accompanied by superior service. Omelet delish and hash browns crispy.  Nice jam with the toast. Very good service and attentiveness. Thank you all beautiful. Will return.

So here is a crazy, slightly relevant way to describe Matt's Big Breakfast.  Matt's is one of the places you are almost obliged to like, because if you don't, you look like a total, unsophisticated schmuck.  No one talks shit about this Phoenix icon!  To speak one bad word of Matt's is like cursing the Virgin Mary.  But here is the thing, all the genuine, honest compliments you can heap onto Matt's is well deserved.  It's like the cool kid in school is well liked for legitimate reasons, not just because he/she is popular.    Meal: The fianc does a great job of always getting something new here.  Typically its a vegetarian omelet.  I typically get the slinger (shhhssssshhhh, secrete menu item!) and whatever special lemonade is available.  Taste:  Every bite is pure heaven.  The homemade jams are special and remind me of home in the midwest.  The ingredients are fresh.  The homemade bread is spectacular.  The meals are amazing.  I feel like its a safe bet in saying that Matt's is the best place to get breakfast in Phoenix.  10 out of 10.  Value:  You aren't going to get a steal here, but then again, this isn't Home Country Buffet.  The portions are above equivalent to Denny's and the prices are about the same.  Because of the great taste and freshness, the value is above average.  4 out of 5.  Service/Cleanliness:  This place is busy.  There are always lines, but they are efficient and quick.  The waiters and waitresses are always pleasant.  The are knowledgeable and the seem genuinely excited about the food they serve.  They sometimes lack attentiveness, but it doesn't come off as being inept.  8 out of 10.  Atmosphere:  Matt's fits the the downtown scene.  And Matt's is the type of place where the things on the wall don't distract from the food.  The crowd is very diverse and the dining area is kind of loud, but kind of perfect.  5 out of 5.  Overall:  If heart disease didn't run in my family, I would eat here way more often.  Believe the hype, Matt's is the place to be! 27 out of 30 points, 5 out of 5 stars.

It was the 6th month anniversary for The Breakfast Club UYE (woot woot) and the placed picked to try was Matt's Big Breakfast.  I picked this place because I had heard they do take reservations of a large groups and thought how sweet is that, I called them and verified that they do, then told them I would call back with the final details.  When I got all the information, called them back and told them what day & time and how many, and was told then that the reservations is actually for groups of 5 or smaller :( whomp whomp , but was told that they could hold a party of 15 we just needed to get on the list, and then she asked what is the meaning for the reservations, and I said we are monthly breakfast club and we picked Matt's to try this month, I was then told that Matt's turns tables over fast is it's not really the type of place to hold meetings, I laughed and said the type of meetings we are doing is eating.    Got there around 8am on Sat morning, put my name on the list for a party of 15, I was then told that the entire party needs to be there in ordered to be seated, I told her that I would need to be saving one seat, someone is running late, I was told only way to save a seat is to order their food for them that way all orders are going in at the same time.  Just stating this on the review to give people with groups the heads up. Everyone showed up, and we were seated pretty quickly!  When I figured out that we were headed to Matt's Big Breakfast, what I wanted to order, had to have, needed to taste was there waffles, when I got into Matt's and seated at the table I looked up and saw the daily special and said, oh that's what I'm having.  It was three eggs scrambled with Schriener's chorizo fresh jalapeos cheddar cheese and home fries and flour tortilla. This dish was delish!! The jalapenos where so fresh!! The home fries were perfectly cooked; the eggs & chorizo were very good stuffed in that flour tortilla! Only thing that could have made this better was some great hot sauce! The dish for me was lacking in heat, but was great in flavor!   I did see a waffle or 2 at the table, and let me tell you, they looked great, but I think I made the right choice, see I like to have some waffle of pancake with my syrup and at Matt's you get 2 ounces of real maple syrup, additional 2 ounces can be bought for a buck 50, so if it was me, I would be spending like 5 bucks just on syrup.   Wonder if I can bring in my own haha  I have wanted to try Matt's Big Breakfast for a very long time now and am very happy I did, everything is fresh and fast! I look forward to coming back!

If you're looking for breakfast at any time of the day, look no further. You will be filled up and be leaving satisfied as the portions are indeed as the name indicates: BIG. The quality of the food was perfect. Absolutely no issues and everything was cooked to order.   The service was AMAZING. If you have a chance, ask for Emily "Monster." She was the most hospitable waitress and had everything to the table promptly and had a smile on her face the entire time.  You absolutely should eat here if you're at the airport and looking for a quality meal.

A small but busy diner/breakfast joint. Fair prices for what you get. Food is good, we had the skinny, waffles and the special (3 egg omelette) and a side of hashbrowns.   Waffles were dense, syrup was real maple and bacon was smokey. The Skinny salad was great but I thought the chicken apple sausages were a bit too sweet. Salad on the other hand pretty good. Hashbrowns tasted like real potatoes... Which I don't get very often. The special was good, the preserve served with the bread was quite delicious. We did find it a bit peculiar that it seems AZ eggs are smaller than CA eggs ... Not sure why.   Overall good quality food, perfect portion (not too much and not stingy) and fair prices. We waited half an hour and thought we made the right decision. If the wait was about 1hr+, then we would have said not worth the wait.

Airport restaurants and bars are almost always going to be lesser than their counterparts. You're naturally going to get bottom of the barrel employees. Ones that can't get the same job outside of the airport.   But, this place is especially bad. I'm an okay cook. Maybe pretty good. But not great. I could make better food than this place all day. It's terrible. If you need to eat a meal, it will do the job. But that's it. For example, the burger is really just pathetic. It's a very low quality ground meat. I mean something you wouldn't even see available at the grocery store. The bun overwhelms the meat because the burger itself cooks to a withering lump. Everything they put on the side to load the burger is equally unsatisfying. Nobody cares about the price in an airport. You have a captive group of buyers. Make good food.   Service is sub par but nothing unusual for an airport. Just your typical waiting too long for everything even though you're obviously waiting to catch a flight. When I'm flashing my credit card though, let's get the transaction done. Don't walk away telling me my receipt is in the cup next to me. When is the last time somebody looked at a receipt in a restaurant. Just pay me out.

Came here this past Saturday (9/24/16) after an early morning hike at CamelBack Mtn.  It was our first time here, and decided to go with their Breakfast special - 3 eggs with bacon and jalapeno, hashbrown, and tortilla.  They use thick-cut bacon (my favorite!) The tortilla really complimented the eggs and added a nice touch. Overall, a good experience.  Didn't really see anything too special, but will come back again.

We went on a Sunday afternoon, the wait was 45 mins for 4 people. We waited because everyone keeps talking about it. Man, was I starving to death when we were seated. I had the ham and cheese omelet and everyone shared an order of waffle with everyone else. The omelet was good. The waffles were light and fluffy. Good but not to die for. I personally think it was over hyped. It is good breakfast food, not GREAT.
We went to the original location years ago and it was amazing!  The wait was crazy though since it's such a small place but it was worth the wait.  The food is delicious!

Always worth the wait. Their food is consistently delicious and the staff is fun and friendly.   I highly recommend ordering the bacon- it is the best bacon I've ever had- thick and crispy.   Love it!

Seriously, Matt's cooks up some of the best breakfast food I have ever had. I've been going here for three years or so, and I have never been disappointed. I've never waited much more than 30 minutes, but that's probably because I never go on weekends after 8:30 AM and never at lunch time on weekdays.   Their eggs benedict is hands down the best I have ever had. It's a special, so you have to be lucky to get it. Before I ever had their eggs benedict (the first was actually a sausage benedict with their AMAZING sausage), i had never really been a fan. But their benedict sparked such a deep love that whenever I've been in a restaurant that serves benedict, I always get it, but it never measures up. Their fresh hollandaise, perfectly poached egg, delicious ham and wonderful english muffin... just cannot be beat. And then you have their oh-so-buttery hash browns that I crave on a regular basis. I used to have a problem deciding between their also awesome homefries roasted perfectly with rosemary, but now I can't resist the hash browns. Also, their bacon is absolutely heavenly, and I'm not really a huge fan of bacon, so I always end up ordering a side of it. The omelets and pancakes are also always perfectly fluffy and delicious, and I've never found their portions to be remotely small. I always leave completely fat and happy. My only complaint that I can think of is that their delicious orange juice comes in an insanely small portion, but their delicious honey lemonade makes up for it.  This is always on my list of restaurants I absolutely have to go to when I'm home from college.

Loved the food, best breakfast I've had the portion is huge and priced very well. I was full for most of the day after eating here. I would definitely go back food was on point I had the waffle plate it was sooooo  good! Excellent choice!

This is more than just great food.  It's traditional breakfast fare, creatively prepared  and served by friendly and attentive staff.  I went for opening bell, which is a bit early for most, but no line up.  This is the kind of place you'd want to go back until you've had everything on the menu, except they also have daily specials, so you'll just have to keep coming.

This is by far my favorite breakfast spot in Phoenix, and I love the location. I always the waffle, with the amazing bacon. There coffee is surprisingly good as well. Whenever my wife and I try to "find" a new spot for breakfast in Phoenix, we always just end up at Matt's. It is that good.  Also I work at a restaurant down the road, and we get a lot of travelers. Anytime I recommend them going to Matt's they always come back saying it was a great experience. I am glad that there is a place that I have enough confidence that no one will leave disappointed!

I like to go too restaurants that have four or more stars. I usually get a good meal and enjoy the visit. This was not the case at Matt's. The way this place is run is outside the normal. We had a seat at the counter and our order was taken by a waitress not the person behind the counter. When orders would come up at the window, it was very obvious that the person behind the counter had no idea who the order belonged too. This resulted in plates set in front of the wrong customers. We watch my wife's order set for five or more minutes till it arrived. My order set for a couple minutes until the person behind the counter had to ask the waitress who it belonged to. As expected the meals were cold. Not only that but the food was three to four stars at the best. Coffee was cold and we made a comment to the person behind the counter. She was able to make fresh pots but again with a delay. A place with this good of a rating should be able to handle a full house but it didn't. Service was poor but friendly until you got to the cashier. And that is a story for another day but not another visit. Oh my wife's toast was given to person down the counter.
Stay away from the Cobb Salad. Mine was soggy as if the ingredients had all been mixed together and then everything was refrigerated. The dressing doesn't compliment the salad very well either.

Best breakfast place in the greater Phoenix area! The problem with most places that have high reviews is that they don't live up to the hype and your expectations are too high. That being said, I went to Matt's with high expectations and they exceeded them. I think a lot of breakfast is bland and similar to other places, but not Matt's.   Sure, it's busy all the time...that's because it's good. Sure, it's loud...that's because it's busy. Service is good. I love sitting at the breakfast bar because the service is even better.   My favorite dish is the salami scramble with added jalapenos. Waffle is the best I've tasted. Hash browns are up there with the best i've tasted. Hell, even their jelly is better. I've been here about 10 times and never left dissatisfied. Only tip would be to get there early. After about 8:30 it really starts to pick up, at least on the weekends.

After waiting outside in the rain for over an hour to get in, we finally got one of the only ten tables (if even that) in this place.    I do have to say that everything was fresh and everything tasted great... But... it's breakfast.  I know that big chains can somehow screw it up, but for the most part, it's not that difficult to pull off.   This is one of the better places I've had breakfast... Maybe it was the hype, maybe the wait in the cold rain, or maybe it was just the food.    Was it worth waiting in the rain for an hour?  No.  Was it worth waiting an hour without the rain?  No.  Was it some tasty breakfast?  Yes.
This is hands down my favorite breakfast place in Phoenix. Their food just tastes like food should! There's a reason that there are always lines of people waiting to get inside; it's just THAT GOOD.

YUMMMMMM!!  Had the days special scramble: sausage w peppers w hashbrowns; just perfect w a crispy crust & perfect inside not mushy. BF had Chick n Chop. I'm not a fan of pork chops but thaws were flavorful, tender and just super yum!  My only gripe is that I ordered fresh, i got a bout 6oz,  for $2.75 yikes!!! Caution it can get crowded and its a pretty small location. But I think it was good, luckily we only waited 15 min but locals say sometimes it can be pretty long

This is to-die-for foodie experience.  Every taste bud in your mouth is entertained by the bountiful food flavors.  The staff is friendly and efficient. The fresh squeezed orange juice is incredible.   Go there hungry. Leave there completely satisfied.   This writer will be a frequent visitor,...YUM!
Enjoyed the huevos rancheros for brunch! I thought the potatoes were really good and seasoned. I went on a Monday morning so didn't have to wait to be seated.

I feel like a douche bag for giving Matt's only 1 stars when everyone else raves about this place and the owner truly is such a delight so in my defense let me explain: This place is a hot spot, every time I've tried to go there, it's packed.  Each time, I've never wanted to wait so I went on my way. One Sunday, I was just down the street from them at Valley Youth Theatre watching Winnie the Pooh with my son and I thought how great it would be to take my son to this popular joint for a bit of breakfast afterward.  When we got out of the theatre, it was pouring rain in giant buckets, one of those rarities in Phoenix where you can't see what's in front of you cause it's raining so hard.  Well, we braved the rain and drove to Matt's~ 5 mins. after their posted closing time and yup, you guess it~ despite me and my 3 1/2 year old son drenched wet and  looking pleadingly at them for some warm food and a place to stay for awhile to get out of the rain, they told us they were closed and sent us on our way.  Talk about tough standards~ I guess when you are as popular as Matt's you get to make and stick by the rules you make. Despite that experience, I still wanted to try Matt's because of all the applaudes I've heard about the place. Finally I made it there on one of those days when I had the time for the long wait and sadly for me, I was sorely disappointed by the breakfast served to me. I had remembered reading some article about the BIG BREAKFAST served at Matt's and that's what I was expecting.  I ordered the waffle with bacon for $9 expecting a Denny's portion of food but with flavor and excellence.  The place was packed so I had to wait 30mins for my waffle to materialize in front of me.  When I got the one piece of waffle and one piece of bacon served to me, I thought perhaps while waiting I had accidentally swallowed Alice (in Wonderland) tonic and was now a giant looking at my rather small serving of food on my plate.  Seriously, I almost felt tears come into my eyes, I was so disappointed.  Needless to say, after trying so many times to go to Matt's and finally getting there just to have not a big breakfast but a are you kidding me?  where's the rest of my food experience, I will not go back there.  It's a good thing too cause it's far from my house and I hate waiting!

I'm sure it's excellent -- but after waiting on line for 30 minutes on a Saturday morning, we sat down and realized that their menu is pretty small, and almost all dishes contain some sort of pork. That narrowed our choice to pretty much pancakes (just say "killing me softly with your buttah.."), so we bolted -- to Palatte.   I'm sure it's great if you like good ol' home cookin' diner food, but for this New York food snob, the choices are too few to wield my wallet.

We stopped here on a whim because we heard so many good things about this restaurant. They are open until 2:30PM each day and serve mainly breakfast (although they do have some lunch items). I had the eggs Benedict which was good but not great. My husband has the 5 points breakfast sandwich - again, good but not great. What was great; the service and the rosemary breakfast potatoes (if you like rosemary - these are a MUST).

What a great place. Fort of all I have to say you will never wait to be helped or served once you get a seat. All the wait staff work together to make sure no one goes for more than a few minutes without being helped. What a great concept. They do not have a huge various crazy selection of food options, which at first seems limiting but when you realize that what they do have and serve is done right, fresh and full of fresh local flavors. A++ to the all the people who make this a great breakfast spot!!!!!

Good breakfast place! Fresh and simple ingredients on the plate that was great tasting! No GF exchange available. Was able to get a slice of tomato instead of toast. GF option would have been a 5 star rating. Reasonable prices!

I was starving after my breakfast meeting this morning so I stopped in at Matt's since I am not usually on this side of town. Service was great and the breakfast potatoes with rosemary and onions were yummy. I also love the homemade preserves with the toast.  The nicest part was I was writing a letter to my son on the back of the paper placemat and the server was so sweet to offer me another placemat to finish my letter. He even made sure I didn't forget the letter when I left.

They'd rather ignore you than deal with you. Don't go in anywhere close to last call. Rude bartender. Our waitress was nice- her name was Katrina I think? But the lack of communication got in the way of her doing her job.  I had a "please just let me give you my money" smile on my face, but nobody would make eye contact. Bummer.  And dear host- if it's that close to last call, don't encourage people to go in and give it a try... It's embarrassing for me as I sit and wait, and embarrassing for you when I walk out disappointed. My advice- just be nice and be honest!

Mom and I stopped in for breakfast on a Tuesday morning and the place was packed (which is a good sign!). We only waited a few minutes before being seated at the counter (which we were glad as the dining room was packed and noisy). The food was great (had the cheese omelet with mushrooms-excellent!) However the exception was the home fries, which came in a large block, were greasy and tasted like they were previously frozen. Other than that, the service was great, coffee was good and they kept the refills coming. I'll def be back but will choose the homestyle potatoes instead.

This was a great discovery. Breakfast anytime. The 5 step breakfast sandwich was awesome and the happily kept the request for no onions off with a smile. The chili burger was a real life medium like I ordered. I am impressed with any plane that does this let alone a place in the airport.

This cute little breakfast/lunch establishment is always bustlin', though I got lucky at a 9 am time slot on Monday morning with no wait!   Location/parking: This is downtown Phoenix, so there's some street parking and meters near by.  I live close enough to walk.  If you're waiting, you will likely wait outside.   Variety: Not a huge menu but typical breakfast offerings of eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, waffles, and breakfast sandwich. There's an option with egg whites and vegetables.   Food:  I ordered the cheese omelet with potatoes and toast.  The omelet was perfect and cooked just right - a basic cheese omelet with my choice of cheese.  The potatoes were delicious, but some were not cooked at all. They were flavored with rosemary. There are various options for toast; I chose sourdough. They brought it with delicious jam.   Service: Efficient and quick.  Most everyone was friendly.   Ambiance/noise level: It's going to be busy likely, and it's cramped, so it's not super quiet but I could still hear everything.   All in all, a good experience!

The menu is limited but it's because everything they do they do great. Hands down one of the best waffles I've ever had - just the right amount of crispness - and the bacon is always cooked perfectly.

Absolutely AWESOME!!!  Best breakfast ever actually recommended to us by a homeless man who said they have fed him from time to time even let him work for food a few times.  These are great people serving AMAZING food!  BTW the one in the PHX airport has the most AMAZING Bloody Mary...must try!!!

Finally got to try Matt's EARLY one Sunday morning with the family.  Luckily they arrived well before I did and I didn't have to wait very long.  The place is small, like previous posters have alluded too.  You don't get how small until you actually go.  10 tables and 7 seats at the counter, tops.  The waits can be long and now I know why.  So we were a party of 8.  The parents sat at a table and the "kids" sat at the counter.  The menu is simple with not a lot to choose from.  I heard the pancakes were great, but I like a little more substance with my breakfast.  I chose the special, 3 egg scramble with bacon, cheddar, and fresh jalapenos, rosemary home fries and a tortilla.  Not being a huge jalapeno fan I almost had them nixed from the order, but decided to go with it.  Glad I did.  It was great and the peppers added a nice little bit of heat.  The rosemary home fries were outstanding!  I know all of this sounds very simple and you could probably make this at home, but it always tastes so much better when someone else makes it!    I think this place is worth the hype!
Loved it!  Great service, food and prices!  Excellent quality and quantity.  Fresh squeezed OJ was very good and so was the home made toast and jam.
Thumbs Up!  I vouch Matt's Hog & Chick is worth the long wait!

Worth the wait, best waffle I've ever had in my life. You only get one waffle, but it's flavor is caramelly and rich, topped with sweet cream butter and authentic maple syrup.  It also comes with two delicious slices of thick cut bacon.  If you come here be prepared to wait a while for a table, but it really is worth it.

So today I decided to take my wife and daughter out for breakfast being Valentine's day. I've been to the downtown location and  never had a problem. We decided to try the biltmore location this time and was very  disappointed in there service. The wait time is usually  a bit long but we knew we were going to wait especially being Valentine's, surprisingly we only waiting 45min to be seated. We have waited longer at other times we gone. But from the time we sat down took like 10min to get someone to help us then the part that got my wife  and me more upset is that we had put our order for the food and it' took 45min to get our food. People that were outside waiting were seated and got there food first than us and we asked this waiter if he could check on our food because we been waiting for awhile. HE  went to the back and never heard from him again finally 10min later we got our food. And we never got our receipt either we usually get it half way through our meal. So we had to walk up to the front and ask for it. Was the worse experience at this food chain the food was great but the service was horendous.

Went here for the first time last weekend. I was so amped to eat there because I had seen many reviews of the restaurant on Triple D and other such shows. I ordered the Hog and Chick, which is 2 eggs, potatoes, breakfast meat and toast. Eggs were cooked as ordered. Sausage links were the maple-rosemary variety, which I found to be unpleasantly sweet and over-seasoned. The home-fries were overcooked and not crispy. Toast consisted of home-made style bread, which is about 1.5 inches thick. Best part was the strawberry jam. And the iced water. It was hot!!

Had breakfast here today - Let's just say there's a reason it's called Matt's "BIG" Breakfast. Had the scramble special. It was full of flavor, cheesy (like me) and filling.   Oh... and the never-ending coffee gave me LIFE!!!   We will be back for sure!

The wait was a bit long but definetly worth it! On a sunday morning at 830 the wait was just under 15 mins for two. Once seated at the bar area the menus were provided...very simple one page menu but dont be put off - the items they make they make very well and in generous portions. We both ordered the chic and hog with ham (dollar extra but worth it). The hashbrowns were a bit undercooked but still delicious...the home fries came with sauteed onions. The toast is awesome...very thick slices and comes with jam and butter! The coffee was nice and strong - much appreciated on this sunday morning with bottomless refills. Overall an amazing find...very affordable as well.

This restaurant is very good. You will have a long wait, but it is good. If you're willing to sit at the bar your wait will be shorter. I would recommend getting there close to opening if you'd like to be seated right away.

Visited the establishment twice.  Both times on a weekend.  Parking was difficult but expected since it is located downtown.  Breakfast was good but not great.  Expected amazing so I was left somewhat dissatisfied.  Service was just OK.  Will try again and update if my mind has been changed.

After the we arrived from the Phoenix airport we arrived here due to the good reviews on Yelp. The food was good not breath taking. House potatoes were a bit overwhelming with spices (Rosemary I believe) and had to drench with tapatio for different flavor. Eggs, bacon, sausage link and waffle were great.  RC cola was there soft drink choice, which was pretty cool to me because you hardy ever see that.

Honestly, I wait in line for the bacon.  Matt's bacon is not for everyone, that's for sure. Vegetarians, look away! 'cause this stuff is fatty, medium-rare, meat candy! The pepper sounded off-putting to me until I tasted it, and oh, how I enjoy it. Been there many times and whenever my Foodie brother is in town, he takes me there so he can get 2 or 3 orders of bacon. Great on the side of their Griddlecakes, which taste like a combination of a corn muffin and a pancake. De-lish. Worth the wait. Oh, and remember: this is a Divey Diner in an undesirable section of Downtown Phoenix--so SNOBS BEWARE! The rest of us will continue to enjoy the homemade goodness.
Matt's is my go to breakfast spot in AZ! I always get the hog and Chick! I definitely recommend them as the best spot in AZ

I like Matt's.  I understand some of the criticisms but I also understand the raves.  Pros:  -The food IS good. Some of the items are breakfast basics, sure, but the pancakes are anything but ordinary.  They're almost perfect.   The home fries are great - rosemary goodness. There's also a great menu selection - a nice mix of breakfast standards with unique and special twists. -The atmosphere.  Yeah it's small, but it's part of the charm.  Con: -It's expensive.  There's no way around it. - It IS small.  You will have to wait, sometimes for a long time.

When I'm looking for a breakfast that reminds me of what my grandmas would make.  I love their food. The cheese omelette is solid. I've also had the salami scramble, which is really good. The oatmeal is good if you're looking for a healthy option.  I think what makes Matt's stand out from other breakfast joints is their ingredients.  They make their jam from scratch, which is a nice touch. The thick-cut  If there's one complaint, it's the home fries.  Not a big fan of the rosemary seasoning for breakfast -- just a personal preference.

We are a big fan of Matt's Big Breakfast Downtown. Food is amazing, even though the wait is frustrated sometimes. I love their 3 eggs scramble special. Also the waffle is delightful. When they opened new one in Camelback location, we were so excited since its much closed to where we live. Even though same owner and menu, the food is not quite the same. May be just my taste. Anyway,  Matt's Big Breakfast is still one of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix metro!

I've made this mistake twice. First time, it was a rude waiter that rubbed me the wrong way. Second time...25 minutes for an order of oatmeal. The take away counter is chaos. The person working there cannot both take orders and serve food. There's too many people. Chaotic.

Service was fast and good, but that's about it. The chicken Cobb salad was lack luster. The chicken was not fresh. Same with the bacon in the breakfast options. Nothing felt fresh, but all of it was greasy, even the salad! Skip this place.

We stayed at the Sheraton downtown and Matt's was a short walk.  Definitely worth the walk, and it helped to justify eating such a large breakfast.  There is probably something there that is not very good, but we did not find it.  When you get there, make sure you check in with the person running the register

My favorite breakfast spot and the ONLY reason I enjoy not having a direct flight with a layover at PHX airport is this place! They have such healthy and delicious options. Everything is so fresh! Can't wait until my next layover to eat here!
Absolutely delicious, humanely raised eggs and bacon, real maple syrup, homemade bread, good coffee, and super fast delivery of our food to the table. What more could you want? Highly recommended!

Great place for breakfast. The owner is very down to earth. The pancakes are amazing and so is the steel cut oats. I always get a bunch of items and eat a little of each. Now this place is in the 4th terminal in the airport and  I am thrilled. Going to this restaurant back in the day and waiting sometimes 2 hours just to eat in a small restaurant with on small air conditioner....now they have expanded and have several but I am telling you that is how good their food is!

I went here for the first time today. I honestly was not impressed with the lunch menu & food. I had the cobb salad and I was disappointed. The lettuce was old and wilted. I'm sure their breakfasts are a lot better (since that's what they are known for.) The service, however, was fantastic. The lady was so nice and made up for the not so great salad!

This was one of the worst breakfast experiences we have ever had at a restaurant.  There were so many issues that it's hard to know where to begin.  I guess it all started with a dirty water cup.  Hubby ordered water and I got freshly squeezed OJ.  The water cup had food residue all over it and there was also something floating in the water.  As we were waiting for our food for over 30 minutes, we observed servers giving food to the wrong people on multiple occasions.  We know that we were waiting for our food for over 30 minutes, because I checked in on Yelp right after we ordered so we had a time stamp as a reference.  We also observed the manager scold a server in the middle of the dining room.  The server was visibly mad at him.  When our food came out, the server gave it to the people next to us while we were trying to tell him that it was ours.  It was very obvious that servers did not know table numbers because so many people were given the wrong food.   Hubby and I both ordered the scramble special with Havarti cheese, sausage and spinach.  When we got the food, the eggs were severely overcooked.  There was no cheese in mine nor my husband's scramble.  The potatoes, which I took some photos of, were so charred that it looked like there were chunks of coal in them.  My husband sent his plate back because it was so bad.  When the manager brought out the newly cooked plate of food for him, he tossed it down in front of my husband and said "Here ya go, dude."  NO apology, no nothing.   I have never seen such apathy from a restaurant manager before.    The kitchen was obviously in the weeds the entire time we were there.  There seems to be a huge training issue that spans from the kitchen to management, to the servers.  I think this location has bitten off much more than they can chew.  It's giving MBB a bad reputation.  I have written hundereds of reviews, and I very rarely give a one star review.  MBB earned that one star.

I'm in agreement with the masses about Matt's Big Breakfast.  It's super tasty!!  I have brought two groups of out of towners to Matt's when they've landed super early at Sky Harbor and they have all been impressed.  I am in love with their strawberry preserves.  I also love the sauteed onions in the breakfast sandwich.  Everything is better with sauteed onions.  The orange juice is fresh squeezed and deicious.

We have tried this twice now and won't go back.  the noise level is so high you can't hear yourself think.  the tables are crowded together and the prices are as high as the noise level without the quality.

Don't go if you are in a hurry but definitely go if you're really hungry. I went on a Saturday morning and waited about 45 minutes. The servers were really friendly and not pushy even though you know they have a line of people waiting outside. I had the griddlecakes and my (very picky) friend had the salami scramble which he devoured. The food was really good, but I wasn't floored like I expected from what I've heard. I will definitely return though, it's a fun place to take people who don't venture to Phoenix much from the suburbs or are from out of town.

I hit a lot of airports in a year and this is by far the best breakfast available. Most airport food is like hospital food. Frozen, bland and warmed over. This morning I ordered hog & chick with a side of patty sausage. Everything is hot, fresh and made to order. Eggs over easy, thick bacon, sausage patty, country potatoes and wheat toast.  Oh, the service? Fast and friendly and they make sure everything is good. Most important, they kept my coffee hot! I'll definitely come back.

I used to love this place, and actually got a longer lay over today just so I could eat breakfast here. I'm so disappointed,  the service was horrible, you can here the servers talking trash about tube customers. The hottest just screamed out "we are about to have a fight today"! My server just served me burnt bacon, Never return things but it was bad, he docent say sorry ,or oh let me fix that, he say snotty, new bacon? , then runs of and brings be barley lest burn bacon, again no apology,  then I see him go talk shit about to the hostis. I'm so sad that this place sucks now it used to be my high light of coming to this airport, and now that I have no reason to come here anymore I will be making my connection thru a different airport all together from now on.  What bad service completely , undeserving of a tip at all.
Great breakfast place. I loved the bacon, eggs and hash browns. Griddle cakes were very good.

I can't believe I have never left a review for Matt's before. My wife and love this place so much. It is defiantly my favorite breakfast spot. I usually get the special or go for a scramble of some sort. Everything is always rich in flavor and the service is always great as well. Also make sure you get toast so you can enjoy their flipping amazing jelly they make in house.

Best Breakfast I've had at lunch time in several years.  Service is friendly and attentive only surpassed by the food!  Restaurant was clean, kitchen staff was well groomed and I highly recommend if you are in the neighborhood or looking to take a drive.

A delicious meal and a smile is definitely what I needed today! I was having a bad day, and needed to get a quick bite. From moment I walked in, the staff was helpful and positive. My order only took about 10 minutes, and was given to me with a smile. Just from the customer service alone, I would return to this place. As for the food, you have to try it for yourself! Cooked just right for me and smells amazing! Great job to the morning staff of Mike's Big Breakfast!

This place seems like a cool spot from the exterior, but is an utter disappointment as soon as you cross through their opposite an of ergonomic front door. The host is rude and seems like he is trying to relive his frat star days. He accidentally crossed our name of the wait list and proceeded to seat multiple parties before us. No real apology followed and we continued to have to wait. The food is fine. Literally nothing special. Go support another local business and get better food with friendlier staff.

First of all, they charge $12 for Maker's Mark on the rocks. I asked for a double and barely got what would be a single pour in any respectable bar in STL. Then after questioning the pour, the server tried to convince me they overpoured the drink. After that I ordered a BLT. Clearly they didn't explain the B in BLT stood for bread. The description in the menu said bacon, lettuce and tomato. Clearly the person in charge of doling out the bacon just got finished pouring the double shots of Maker's Mark. They told us we were getting, and they actually got excited about this, freshly made kettle chips. If they didn't open a bag of Walmart kettle chips and pour them on the plate, then I've clearly never had authentically made kettle chips. The portions are a joke, the prices are high and the servers aren't very personable or accommodating.

Finally getting time to get down to write the review for this gem of a breakfast/lunch spot. Its places like this that make me want to move more and more to downtown Phoenix.  Ive been here a few times already and I try something new every time. I do have to say that the steak and eggs has been the fav thus far. A true man's man meal meant to satisfy that inner lumberjack. They cooked the steak just the way I like it which rarely happens. Unless you go to some pricey steak house, they always like to cook well done or still moving. Not Matts I washed it down with their  absolutely refreshing, fresh squeezed oj. Even their toast and jam was addicting. Breakfast has to be my favorite meal of the day, so a ideal breakfast spot is key. Matts has secured its way as a top performer in that category.  Moving past the enticing grub at Matts, the customer service was excellent. The place always seems busy driving by but when you go in, they usually get you in right away. The staff is more than friendly and always checking to make sure your dining experience is great. The joint is small but put together very well with a vintage, yet modern vibe. Watch out when you first sit down though, Its like planting your ass on the toilet in winter. Seats are metal so it takes a minute to warm up.
Solid place in Tempe to grab a good breakfast. Pancakes were good. Hash browns tasted to much butter. Pepper bacon was a nice touch

My husband and I came here for the first time today and it was amazing! The staff was so friendly I wondered for a second if I knew them. Lol the coffee was nice and hot. The food was delicious, nutritious, fulfilling, so tasty, and the portions are generous. My husband and I eat out a lot. We couldn't decide between Le Grande Orange or Matt's Big Breakfast, as far as which was better. We were so surprised but we loved it!
Mediocre at best. The place is small so it fills up fast and gets very noisy...not something you want with breakfast ...especially if the side of bacon is served cold.

Ok.  I'm finally getting in tune with Yelp and I'm writing a long overdue review of one of my favorite restaurants of all time-Matt's Big Breakfast.  When I think of what is important to me in a restaurant, it's two things plain and simple-food and service-and Matt's excels at both.  Honestly, these are the type of people, Matt and Ernie and their staff, that America's needs more of...good hearted, honest, hard working people who give a shit about their customers.  They're as American as Apple Pie!    The food: everything on the menu is very good but in my mind two things stand out and they are as good as it gets in Phoenix...the waffle and the cheeseburger.  Oh, and the bacon.  A cheeseburger brushed with butter.  Get the fuck outta town.  This is the mother fuckin shit y'all.  I consider myself a burger afficianado and this burger is the bombay.    There is an occasional wait because Guy Fieri pimps this place on the Food Network all the time but hell, why wouldn't he, it's the shit.  I pimp it all the time myself.  I may get a Matt's Big Breakfast logo on my pimpstick it's so good.  The best times to go are during the weekdays in the early morning around 7AM or after 1:00PM.    GoGOGOGOGOGOOGOG....you'll be glad you did!
I stopped here during a 4 hour layover and had the waffles and they were great.  I had cranberry juice and water and was well satisfied.  This was a pleasant experience.

Went in to get brunch with my boyfriend. We sat at the bar. It took some time for the bartender to notice us, but they were busy- so I understand! I ordered the Reuben sandwich and my boyfriend got the BLT. I hate rye bread so I nicely asked the bartender if I could change the bread. Basically anything besides rye would have been great. He then proceeded to tell me in no possible way could the kitchen do that. I thought he was joking! He wasn't. My boyfriend asked if he could change his bread to rye bread. The bartender again says no because they "save the rye for certain sandwiches only." What the heck? I've never heard of that before. Well, here's a solution! Why doesn't my boyfriend get my rye and I'll take his bread! We got another no. Again, I'm so confused. Not sure what his problem was, but we felt extremely uncomfortable. He made it seem like we were making a big fuss. We went ahead and ordered it how its made. Once the food came out we just switched the bread ourselves. I don't see why they couldn't have done that in the first place. We never saw the bartender again. Drinks were empty, service was just plain BAD. I'm a server myself and I've never experienced anything like that before. I really wish I would have got the bartenders name. I don't think we will be back :/

I love this location! The food is amazing and I think that staff that works here is great. I usually go on my lunch break so I usually order to go. Daniel usually takes my order and he is the best! He is always greeting everyone who walks in the door and always helping out with whatever is needed.

I visited Matt's for the first time in 2010 before moving to Phoenix. Not only was the food fantastic the staff was over the top too. I've been recommending this place to everyone that I know who plans to visit. Great atmosphere and the experience of the food and staff was again just amazing. Even if you have to wait it's well worth it.

Have been wanting to come here for months. Consistently spoken of as one of the best breakfast joints in Phoenix. Happy coincidence that I was downtown in AM on Eggs Benedict day! Ambience is casual just like I like it, but the Eggs Benedict were first class. Delicate, homemade Hollandaise, real thick-cut Canadian bacon (not just thin sliced Lunch meat), toasty English muffin and perfectly cooked eggs. Hash browns were crispy & fresh--and plentiful. Can't wait to come back again and try more items from the menu!

Oh how I love a good breakfast!       My first experience at this quaint little establishment was this past weekend, my sister, her boyfriend....my girlfriend and I decided we needed a bite to eat after a looong night of celebrating....they chose to make the trek from Gilbert to our side of town...our first logical choice laying in bed with a swelling head you ask?  Of course we had to try Matt's...after all, we had been hearing for weeks about the bountiful breakfast that awaited....       I absolutely love something about a place that can make you feel as though your a tourist in your own town...and this one does it, very small inside....no waiting area except the side walk in front....you have to "sign in" on an ordering pad (cute touch in my opinion)...any how, after seeing what we were up against....I thought the worst, you know what I'm talking about....long wait!  Thankfully I was wrong, we were sat within about 10 minutes!  (Side note, I think we were a bit lucky on timing....as we left, there were a LOT more people waiting, I believe we got there around 9-9:30)       Ok....for breakfast we all tried about the same thing....."The Hog and Chick"....fancy(kind of ;) way of saying eggs and some kind of swine....anyhow, all the basics are included here...potatoes (your choice, home fries or hash brown)  I chose home fries...and let me tell you, I was pleasantly surprised...with out a doubt the best I'd ever had!  Along with the potatoes there were onions and fresh rosemary....honestly the rosemary made them.  The eggs were cooked wonderfully....over easy seems like an easy fix...but its truly amazing how many times this can be a disaster.  My best friend had the ham....and let me tell ya...Nicki loves some good ham...and she got it!         I have read some other reviews of this place....some talking of prices too steep....not sure where they were coming from, but all four of us....huge plates, soft drinks and or milk....with tip about 45 dollars...not sure I would classify that as "over the top"....not for a meal of this magnitude...maybe Denny's...but hey if you want that...you know where to go ;)       Only quark with our truly wonderful experience you ask?....we got the wrong drinks....regular instead of diet....other than that, the wait staff was cheery and funny...two things that are a must with me when I'm baby sitting a hang over.  Like I said...I love a good breakfast...Matt's truly delivers!  Thanks Matt....I will be back, very soon!

I love Matt's Big Breakfast so was glad I had enough time to eat before my flight. I ordered the 3 egg omelet. The server asked me if I wanted cheese and if I wanted anything else in the omelet. I ordered provolone mushroom spinach and peppers. The food was good but the surprise was when I got the bill as I was charged for the cheese and the veggies. Did not realize I would be charged as the server made no indication and I did not initially ask for these items until prompted.  Beware.

Finally got something I've never had at this place: Good service....obviously a Phoenix landmark that should be visited by all at least once, but new location loses some of the old charm.  Limited menu, but pretty good...expect a long line...

I ordered the pesto chicken sandwich for lunch. I could barely taste the pesto. It would be better if it was served with pesto instead of, what I'm assuming they do, just marinating the chicken breast cutlet. The macaroni salad was amazing and it is the only reason why I'm writing this review.  Great macaroni salad.
Great Airport Burger  & steak Fries!

Amazing Food! The staff is very friendly and the service was fast and fresh. The food was delicious and came out very hot and fresh. The staff seemed to help each other out and the best part was they never let your coffee cup get empty!

I was underwhelmed with my experience at Matt's Big Breakfast, although I visited the place prompted by reviews from others.  The location is cute and the place delivers wholesome foods made with fresh, organic ingredients.  The breakfast fare here is nothing spectacular, although they do simple brunch foods well.  Don't expect anything fancy or fusion.    My waffle was perfectly adequate, and while I thought the almost spaghetti-like hash browns were interesting/tasty, the rest of my table disagreed.  Standard breakfast fare done simply, nothing to write home about.

It's just a regular breakfast place. I can't say nothing special about it. The food comes in large portions hence the name big matt's. I honestly don't like my food portions that big so I won't be going back. But if your okay with some ordinary and big portions it's a good place to go to.
Easter Sunday breakfast was worth the wait.  Awesome food and portions.  Friendly staff who really hustle, too.

Organic style breakfast with limited menu but daily specials. Wait time anywhere from 30-45 minutes although I did come on Memorial Day. Service is quick & the food is good! I got "The Skinny" and it was very tasty. They have bar seating but no alcohol. If they give you a "window" seat it is actual a bar seat in front of a window that faces the street. I will return!

Great food. Got a veggie scramble. A lot of food! Good house potatoes that are seasoned with rosemary. The rye bread was very good also. Only complaint was the water tasted gross and consequently the ice tea tasted gross. They should use filtered water if the tap is that bad.

Ate here since it was relatively close to the airport, and it was good but not great. The waffle was buttery with a light crunch. I wish it came with some fresh fruit or something to top it off with though, it was a bit plain by itself. The menu is quite small as well.
Great breakfast spot.  Visited initially because of the triple D exposure but definitely plan on coming back.
Friendly. Delicious. Fun. Awesome. DEFINITELY stop here--great food. Very reasonable prices. Best part is the service is outstanding!!

Solid breakfast, good service, long waits. 3 1/2 stars.  I first went to Matt's Big Breakfast years ago when it had first become really popular. I was pleasantly surprised to see that it's still going strong years later--although I wasn't as excited to have to wait in a long line, just like before! The new setting is at least twice as big as it used to be, so it packs in a lot more people than in years past. Although they're still turning out some solid food, it doesn't seem as inspired as before. It seems to me that the push to grow has resulted in some decrease in quality. Maybe this is a nostalgia thing for me--the past is always better in my memory.  Setting: This place has a very cozy feel to it. You sit very close to your neighbors, so you shouldn't bring your most private conversations here. I like the breakfast bar area the most. It's a pretty simple setting--it's about t he food!  Food: I have had a number of items here over the years, and they've all been really good. The bacon and sausage selection has always been particularly good. During my latest visit, I had the day's special, which was a 3-egg scramble with sausage, spinach, mushrooms, and some cheese, served with potatoes and toast. I think that the savory dishes like this (as opposed to sweeter dishes like pancakes and waffles) are what Matt's does the best. I wasn't really impressed with the sausage in this scramble. It seemed more like a mass-manufactured sausage than anything I remember having at Matt's before. The potatoes were over-oiled, but everything else was decent. The highlight of my breakfast may have been the preserves for my toast. The blackberry preserves were really good! Lots of chunks of real berries. Despite what I said about the savory vs. sweet thing, the waffle was pretty good, too.  Service: Solid. There is usually a decent wait here, especially on weekends. The best time to come is during the week if you are able to do so, because the weekend waits can be an hour long.  I'll come back when I have the opportunity again in the future, but my breakfast attention has drifted elsewhere.

Butter Burger. For breakfast.  What part of that is ambiguous?  No reason to waste space saying what has already been said: best breakfast in town. Sure Matt is mean to me. And I don't go there enough. But my wife is 10 years younger than me and I have to maintain my svelte figure.

The breakfast menu is fantastic and the service is top notch. Every time I go there, though, I have to ask them to move the baby highchairs and extra metal seats out of the narrow hallway so I can reach the ADA bathroom. I have tried to explain to them it is against the law to inhibit access by clogging up the pathway to using the facilities. They say but we have no where else to store these chairs. Then, next time I return, we do the same horse and pony show again...and again.

I'm giving 4 stars under the qualification that it is airport food.  We arrived for breakfast and the place was packed. We only waited a few minutes to be seated, but the wait was much longer for folks that arrived shortly after us. The hostess was friendly. The waitress was not the best but what can I say...it's an airport and people are in a hurry to get to their planes. The food was good. We had the very tasty sonrisa burrito that did indeed put a smile on my face. The place is located in terminal B.

Oh my! Everything is as it should be at Matt's. The waffles are from scratch. The seasoning on the potatoes is addicting. In a time of house BBQ sauces and organic syrups Matt's breaks the mild with their house ketchup. I can't explain the feeling of eating a hearty breakfast made from fresh ingredients.
