What reminds you of a greasy spoon diner ends up being a beautiful place for serious coffee and food. I would advise you to not pass Matt's by because of the wait. The time goes fast and they turn tables over quickly.
I love the food here. They open early and always have a crowd. The menu was accommodating for non-pork eaters as well, so that is a huge plus for my fianc and I.

Went here for the first time last month. I had read a lot of reviews and was expecting a wait. It was about 15-20 minutes so it was not too bad, and definitely worth it. The place is just so cute inside. The bread was amazing and the preserves were awesome. I love that they only cook with real butter and olive oil. The husband loves green Tabasco on his eggs (any pretty much everything else) and they didn't have any so that was a bummer but the food was very fresh. A very unique place, I would definitely recommend it!

Everytime I visit Phoenix I try to visit Matt's. It has my favorite pancakes. I would recommend the home fries over the hash browns. The omelettes are generous with cheese. The menu is pretty simple but there is enough choices to pick from. The portions are pretty large and this place is really affordable. The staff is always friendly and the seating is comfortable. It can get a little loud but we try to go earlier to avoid waiting and loud groups.

Proof that great things come in small packages :) Matt's Big Breakfast is SMALL, lol!   The local organic coffee that they serve is awesome & I have to drink it even when I'm melting outside.  My must have, by far though, is the honey lemonade.... oh yeah!   Everything they make is fresh, organic & delicious. I had the breakfast special. I have to say that the eggs tasted a bit different to me, but maybe it's because I've rarely had REAL eggs before, lol. I'm used to the thin shelled, mass produced, break up a bunch & keep them in a container till someone orders something with eggs in it kind of taste. They don't even crack them open until they are making your order. Cage free eggs from happy well fed chickens is the way to go :)  The only con I have to point out is the waiting line if you don't get yourself down there early enough. Especially in this heat! My friend decided that we should, but if her makeup started melting off we'd have to find somewhere else for breakfast, lol. Fortunately, we were called in just on time!

I like the new digs ;)   The new location, although larger, still feels snug & homey to me. The personnel are wonderful as ever! Friendly and competent :)  The food is delicious, as always. I had the Hog & Chick, which is 2 eggs, thick cut bacon & home fries. The eggs where just the right size (I was complaining about tiny eggs at another establishment earlier, lol), the bacon was perfect & my favorite part were the home fries, which were cooked to perfection. My daughter had the Waffle. I'd tell you how that was but she had inhaled it before I got a chance to taste it :D She told me it was really good & it's too bad I didn't get any, lol!  This time around my baby & I stopped in after hiking South Mountain. You know how some people look good no matter what they've been doing? That's not me, lol. But I have no shame, I stopped in anyway! You'll see all kinds here, people dressed to impress, some who look like they're headed to work, others who look like they're having a PJ party, some who look like they're going to or coming from the gym & then some who've just come off a mountain :D Regardless, it's one happy family here & there's a feeling of real camaraderie, all based around the love of fresh, yummy food!

Great breakfast spot! Love that they advertise their use of cooking with cage free eggs and real butter and evoo. Makes the quality of food that much better! Came on a Saturday morning around 10 and with a party of 6 I expected there to be a decent wait but within minutes we were seated! Guy working at the front was awesome, very friendly and efficient! Our waitress was just okay but the food was great!! Hubby got the waffles and they were honestly phenomenal. And as for the bacon, I cannot wait to go back and get some more! Bacon was out of this world. Great food at decent prices, I'll definitely be back!
Great Breakfast - fresh ingredients, professional service and a nice atmosphere. The daily breakfast specials are off the charts.
It was really good nice place to eat but if you have to wait on parties or other people to show up I don't like that you have to wait for everybody to show up at one time

Loud, busy, but not bad. French toast was good, loved the whole sausage and pork chop got a thumbs up. The chairs aren't comfortable, 5'2 and my legs and feet were falling asleep. Wakes was nice, had to ask for water twice. They don't have cream for coffee, just milk. The place was kinda small but loved the decor.

I've heard many people ranting and raving about this place and I was a thinking it was "too good to be true".  I went, I tried, and yes, friends - it is so good and so true!  The breakfast here is "wait - for - it".....LEGENDARY!  The toast was good, thick and crunchy.  Same goes for the bacon!  The hash browns were probably one of the best hash browns I have ever had.  They were cooked oh-so-perfectly and we didn't have to wait too long to get a table.

I am so happy that there is another Matt's in the Phoenix area! Sometimes, I don't like going downtown so Camelback and 32nd Street is the perfect area.  We came on a Monday morning and the restaurant was not crazy and no wait for a table. I have no idea if the word is out and if there's a long wait on the weekends (like the downtown one). The service is pretty good and the food is just like I know Matt's to be - freaken delicious!   I ordered the Hog & Chick and hubby ordered the Five Spot. Total of the bill: a little over $20.

I've heard about this place from so many friends and colleagues that I had to try it for myself.  So, I head into downtown Phoenix between breakfast/lunch to grab a bite.  I got lucky and found a parking spot in front just down the street....be warned though, it's metered parking and it's an old school meter, so you need quarters & dimes.  I only had enough for 45 min, so I prayed that it wouldn't be packed inside and that I could get in/out without a parking ticket.  I walked in and found a seat at the bar.  I saddled up to the counter and browsed the menu.  I ended up ordering:  Five Spot Breakfast Sandwich (Eggs, Cheese, Caramelized Onions, Thick Cut Bacon) w/Hash Browns, $5.95 http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/matts-big-breakfast-phoenix-2?select=BnXYQfUHaR_ajW8_Wy5oUA#BnXYQfUHaR_ajW8_Wy5oUA http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/matts-big-breakfast-phoenix-2?select=Ky1EPe539GhuY-nM_9J5RA#Ky1EPe539GhuY-nM_9J5RA  The order came out fast.  I took one bite and loved it.  It was full of flavor...the Caramelized Onions really added to the taste of this Sandwich, I was impressed.  The Bacon tasted great, but was a little undercooked for my tastes...I should've known better and asked for it to be cooked crispy, especially since it was thick-cut...my bad.  It was till a great Sandwich anyway.  Except for the Caramelized Onions, it's exactly how I'd make a breakfast Sandwich.  The Hash Browns were good too, went well with the Sandwich.  The service was great, I was in/out in 30 min....so I had 15 min to spare on the meter.  Lunch menu looks interesting, I'll have to come back and give it a try.  Return Factor - 90%

OK, I've wanted to try Matt's for a while, but I had drivien by and seen how small it was and heard of the long lines to get in. When I get up, I'm hungry and ready to eat...  I happened to get up early last Saturday and thought "Hey, maybe I can get a seat at Matt's if I get over there early!" In a few minutes, my companion and I were on the road and on the way to Matt's as fast as her little Scion XB could carry us...  My master plan was a success and we were seated within minutes of arriving. I ordered the Chop & Chick, and my friend ordered the special which was a scramble with chicken sausage, cheese, and greens.  We were seated at the window bar and enjoyed several cups of good diner coffee (nice and strong, without being bitter) while we waited...   and waited... and waited...  We noticed several tables come and go while we were waiting and as we were starting to get worried, Matt came to our table and apologetically told us that our ticket had fallen and gotten lost for a while and that our food was their top priority at that point. In the next five minutes, I'm pretty sure that every employee came by to apologize to us and ask if there was anything that they could get for us.  When our food did arrive is was steaming hot and delicious.   The Chop & Chick was exactly as one would expect. Perfectly cooked over-easy eggs, no gooey whites, but plenty of liquid yolk with which to dip my home fries in. The pork chop was of average breakfast size, but cooked well and still nice and juicy.  My companion's special scramble was so good that it made me question my undying love of the majikal animal (pork) and the hash browns were awesomely crispy (but begging to be covered in gravy ;-)  As we ate, Matt came by and apologized again for losing our ticket and asked us to enjoy our breakfast on the house. It was so good that I kinda felt bad about taking them up on their offer, but I decided that I'd make it up to them by going out of my way for more early breakfasts there.  So, was it a perfect breakfast experience? No. But the manner in which the mistake was handled, the professionalism of the staff, and the quality of the food puts Matt's Big Breakfast at or near the top of my Phoenix breakfast list.
I would give them 5 stars if their coffee was better. Everything else however is fabulous! The bacon, rosemary potatoes, fluffy griddle cakes aka pancakes are to die for!

The special - sweet and savory French toast - was amazing! The omelets and home fries were superb. Even the wheat toast was phenomenal with homemade preserves.  We are planning breakfast for the trip home!

This place definitely lives up to the hype. I love their breakfast and would go every day if I could. The line may be long but it's definitely worth it.   My favorite meal to get is to split a waffle and cheese omelet with a friend. What really makes the meal is the potatoes! The rosemary gives them such a nice flavor and I wish I could eat them for every meal. I also love the bread and jam. It's an all-around perfect meal and I won't stop going there. This location is very crowded but it definitely has a fun atmosphere.

How can something so simple taste this wonderful?  Mine is not to question, but simply to enjoy. The omelet with hash browns and sour dough toast with strawberry preserves was excellent. The bread has the proper balance of crunchy and chew!  That is the only way to describe the bread!  The pepper bacon was phenomenal today. Not too crunchy and really lean.

They have the best bacon in town. I'm sure it is sourced locally. If you find yourself downtown at breakfast time, do yourself a favor and drop by for some fresh O.J., coffee, and anything on the menu (that includes bacon). There is many times a wait, especially on weekends. Allow an extra 15 minutes in case.

This place is AWESOME.. Went twice this week. Tuesday and Wednesday.. This is my favorit stop for breakfast everytime Im in town. Food is good, prices are good the coffee is awesome. Love this place. the waitress Trina is so nice.. Food is always hot and fresh.. You can taste the quality....

The restaurant is a family oriented sometimes you get the chances to see the owners serving you or their children. This makes the restaurant more comfortable for the audience because the staff is really nice. Even though, the there is at least a 40 min wait to get into this restaurant, the wait it is all worth. Once you get in, the food comes out so quick and not only that their concept is also make everything with natural ingredients. For example, the made their drinks with honey instead of sugar.Also they have a variety of options of food for you to choose.

Because of the famous Triple D, we had to make an appearance. The wait wasn't so bad, about 15 minutes for a Wednesday morning. But it def picked up after we were seated so go early.  The menu was very simple. I really wanted to try their Biscuits and Gravy but they only serve them on Tuesday, I think. Different special every day. I came on the wrong day.   Everything was good. $60 for four people for a 15 minute breakfast seemed high. I understand paying more for better ingredients but dang people, let me enjoy it!!! We were so rushed to eat (pressured to order fast AND received our check after my second bite). I like to sit an enjoy a meal, especially brunch time!!   So great food, but no time to enjoy it.

Awesome place! It was packed but we had great service at the counter, the menu options were great with organic items and cage free eggs.  The home fries are out of this world! Fun atmosphere, they know what they are doing here!

It's diner food that's decent, but nothing stood out to us as worth another visit. The staff made us feel incredibly rushed, brought our bill with the food, never checked on us, and started clearing the table as soon as we took our last bites. The restaurant was half empty so we weren't sure why they were rushing us out.
If you are anywhere in the areas and need breakfast this is the place to go! Great food and fast service. You will not leave hungry!
Great food! The waffle is delicious and you could never go wrong with the special! Definitely worth the wait!

Today happens to be the first day of my Thanksgiving break, so I figured I should hit up a breakfast or lunch place that I wouldn't normally get to go to.  I read up on some of the reviews here and felt a bit unsure, as there are lots of negative ones but decided that I trust David SB, Mr. K and Pierre much more than all the naysayers.  I'm glad I did.  I also, for some unexplainable reason, did not think there would be such a long wait on a random Wednesday morning.  I mean, don't people have jobs?  We ended up waiting about a half hour, which wouldn't have been bad but it also happens to be one of five days that it rains in Phoenix.  The wait was long, and both Nathan S. and I were getting close to regretting our decision.  There was great people watching though- a man running into The Coronado Hotel (that boasts an RCA electronic system and refrigeration) with a case of Natty Light, many people rushing out of Matt's to save their car from the meter police and just generally, the meter police vehicle.  We were seating and immediately served coffee which I don't usually drink.  Nathan S. assured me that this is not the kind of place with french vanilla creamer, which is sad for me, but overall a good thing and compliment to Matt's taste.  I ordered the griddle cakes and a side of hash browns.  Our food arrived at different times which wasn't cool but I figure that kitchen is tiny.  It didn't take too long for his to arrive, so we just had to wait a few minutes to dig in.  One word- BUTTERTASTIC!  I am not a breakfast girl, and I attempt to eat healthy (mostly to offset the booze intake) but this was amazing.  I knew it was a very naughty breakfast, but delicious all the same.  Nathan S. also commented that the mushrooms in his omelet had definitely been marinated in butter prior to being put into the omelet, which made me like this place more.  If you are into naughty breakfasts, Matt's is your kind of place.
Coffee cup was dirty, the replacement cup was dirty too. Both times they served it. Do they not look at the cups before serving it?And do they not wash dishes?

A perfect breakfast. I went twice in two days when I was in Phoenix at a conference. The food was well-prepared, the service good and the prices right where they should be. My only gripe is that I didn't see an option for a half order and the servings are huge. People should always have the option of eating less and wasting less.
Never had the chance to try the food... When I asked them how long the wait would be they told me they don't give wait times.... Snooty
The waffles/syrup and eggs were mediocre. Sausage, bacon and homestyle potatoes were really good!!

I've wanted to eat here for years and finally made it. It was a Tuesday around 11:00AM, it was very busy but not packed so I only waited for about ten minutes.   I ordered a cup of coffee to drink and the cheese omelette with a side order of bacon. Ordering the side of bacon was a must based on word of mouth and all of the reviews.   Coffee was very good and fresh.   My omelette was excellent, fluffy and full of melted American cheese. It was served with either hash browns or home style potatoes. I opted for the potatoes and they didn't disappoint. Seasoned with rosemary which was unique and delicious.   Now to that bacon...It was probably the best bacon I have ever had. Thick cut, peppered and tender. Cooked just right. Oh so good. All of those reviews were spot on.   I am already looking forward to my next visit.   Matt's is a must!   Enjoy!

Great breakfast place! It's usually pretty packed here, though a little less busy than their downtown location.   They offer your usual breakfast and lunch menu. Nothing weird!  I usually order the cheese omelette with a side of bacon. They have really amazing bacon!  Their hash browns are really good too.   One of these days I'll try lunch, but it's really hard to stray from their amazing breakfast.   Be sure to allow some time, chances are you will be waiting for a table.   Enjoy!

Went for brunch Sunday and the food was terrific!  We had a party of six and wrre seated in the semi-private area. The menu is small and straight forward.  The food was hot and delicious.  The servings huge,vand the ingredients fresh.  It was wonderful.  Will definitely visit again

This was the aboslute BEST breakfast I have ever had. Every single ingredient is so fresh and tasty. I ordered a cheese omlet with a side of pancakes. My sis and I shared it. We also got orange juice and coffee. We were in heaven! We did not have 1 single complaint. From the service to cleanliness to the food it was a 10!! If you are looking for a delicious breakfast experience THIS IS THE PLACE!!   I plan on going back asap!
Killer breakfast spot - great food - great people Pork and Eggs - Really more like half a smoked ham and some eggs - WoW

Matt's has great food and service. We felt warmly welcomed and our server took time to patiently answer our many question. The food is very, very good, and actually healthy. They use many local organic ingredients and you can taste the difference. Our litmus test at every breakfast or lunch restaurant, to see if they really care, is to check the ketchup bottle to see if it lists high fructose corn syrup as an ingredient. The logic is that natural sugar ketchup costs more, and restaurants who serve it up really care about our health and theirs, down to the smallest detail. Matt's passed the test! The food is ample and delicious, and you will leave very satisfied.

stopped in today with some friends for lunch and got the scrambled eggs with hash browns, cheese, and sausage.  The hash browns were cooked awesome and the sausage was amazing.    The place is kinda small, and VERY loud (it was pretty busy).  It also has a whole "hippie" feel going on which was a little weird, but i didn't care, the food was good and Our waitress (and almost all the others) were hot!

There's little more to say that hasn't already been said.  Matt's has very familiar items on their menu, but each that I've tried really is impressively delicious!  Expect to wait...if you're impatient there are plenty of others who are willing to wait (me included) for 40+ minutes on a very empty stomach.

This was a YELP guided breakfast stop on our Spring Training week food tour. I trust YELPers to guide me to the best places and they always come through. They were right on about the wait. Mid week around 9am and there was about a 30 minute wait with lots of people waiting outside the tiny little restaurant. Luckily we were just a 2 waiting for a seat, as opposed to the party of 9 who would have to be broken up or wait for hours to be seated.... (HINT HINT, not a place for groups. 2 is ideal. 3-4 is max unless you do not care about sitting together.)  Having been on day four of greasy high caloric breakfasts, I opted for the steel cut oatmeal with the raisins and brown sugar and an OJ. SG got standard egg plate with eggs, toast, ham and rosemary potatoes. SG was very happy when his plate arrived. The large piece of ham and the delicious rosemary potatoes set this place aside in his mind. My oatmeal was very good, but my humungous raisins put it over the top. The service was great and Matt himself was even there helping out.   SG said this is how a breakfast place should be done and this is the model he would use for his own breakfast place (that will most likely never happen). The menu is limited, but offers the usuals. There is special attention paid to those things like the potatoes and the raisins that makes this place special.   Check it out. Expect a wait, bring a news paper.
Food is great....5 stars.  The wait....1 star.  Sorry...no place is worth two hours for breakfast.

The hype is huge....but well deserved. One of the best breakfasts I've ever had. Everything is so clean, servers are helpful, friendly, and effective.....and the food is outstanding.  If you haven't eaten here by now, what are you waiting for.

Awesome place but the wait is dumb. Also the way they handle it is archaic and not efficient for how long the line is.   Because they have a paper list and so many waiting guest everyone stands in the lobby blocking the servers from getting around. One girls sole job is to walk around and scream names of people on the list. Inside and outside. Another girl spends half her day explaining to guest that they never quote a time and no the can't just sit at the counter like other restaurants. To many staff not enough system. Counter productive, and un-scale able. Labor cost are prolly killing this place.  Business aside... Food was great and staff is friendly! I'll come back if I have all morning to wait around
Awesome breakfast spot. The home fries were amazing. Had fresh rosemary on them. Get some fresh juice and the coffee was spot on.
Their food is so simple and there is very few options to choose from. It's not worth the price. I paid with cash and the waiter didn't give me my change back.

If you want simple breakfast nailed to perfection, with excellent customer service, I highly recommend this place.  As always, I tried to keep my expectations super low because of the hype, but honestly, it deserves the hype!  It was rainy today so we got an unusual late start on the day. Worked in our favor because there was no wait when we arrived (about 1pm).  Everyone there was super nice. Like, genuinely nice. We ordered coffee and the fresh squeezed honey lemonade. The lemonade was delish! They must put a ton of honey in there because you can really taste the flavor. It's so good. The coffee is great too. It's a special blend made especially for Matt's from Cave Creek roasters.   For food we got the special - 3 egg scramble with andouille sausage and fontina cheese. Omg... Now you can imagine how easily it would be to screw up this dish. But it was not greasy, eggs cooked perfectly, and the HASHBROWNS WERE THE BEST I'VE EVER HAD. No seriously, how do they get those hashbrowns so crunchy?!?! The andouille sausage was nice and spicy. Great dish.  It came with a side of sourdough toast and fresh house made strawberry compote. Soooo good and fresh. Compote not too sweet. Great!  The waffle was light and crispy. Bacon was the real deal y'all. Thick. Crispy. And they have REAL maple syrup.  So...they forgot our waffle and we had to remind them of it. No big deal at all to us. But the way they handled it, they comped the waffle and apologized over and over. Over the top customer service. Over the top.  It really doesn't get any better than this for me. Simple food cooked perfectly and great customer service. And the place is adorable too. Will be back for sure!

I arrived in Phoenix from San Francisco and was starving so I Yelp'ed breakfast joints in the area and Matt's Big Breakfast was one of the places with the most quality reviews so I said why not?  Upon arriving there were a number of small parties waiting outside so I knew it was going to be a long wait. Me and my sister ended up waiting an hour as the morning Phoenix sun started creeping up on us. We were able to sit at the counter which was awesome because I was able to see Matt cook in the kitchen. I ordered the hog and chick which consisted of scrambled eggs, fat slices of bacon, hash brown and wheat toast. In addition I ordered the orange juice which was freshly squeezed. The toast is freaking amazing! Best toast I've ever had! The homemade jam was tasteful because it didn't taste like the nasty jam you would get at normal diners. The hash brown was perfect! Crispy brown on the top and bottom and juicy in the inside. The hash brown was the best I've had because it wasn't dry which makes eating that much more enjoyable. The bacon... It was freaking delicious! 4 fat slices of bacon. Yum! I rarely finish my breakfast but I surprisingly finished the hog and chick plate at Matt's.  I will most definitely be back if I'm ever in then phoenix area. This is the best breakfast joint in Arizona and maybe the west coast. Try it out but beware of the wait.
The BEST breakfast spot in all of Arizona!! There's a special everyday!! I go here every Friday an the food is always on point!!

This is a place that truly knows the art of breakfast. Their bacon is hog heaven, their eggs are perfection, their hash browns and home fries are off the charts, and the service is just as good as their bacon. This place is 5+ stars in my books. I wish I took a picture, but my motor skills weren't working fast enough to take the picture, the fork was in my mouth too soon.

The staff was very pleasant and friendly. I ordered the Special which was 3 eggs "scrambled " with jalapeo sausage and cheese with a dude of homestyle potatoes. The eggs were still runny and sausages didn't even seem to be cooked all the way.  The potatoes were still hard... Its likely I won't order from there again.... what a waste of $16...  I work in the building next store and would rather drive somewhere else than eat that food again.

Extremely disappointing!  Overpriced $8:00 for plain pancakes which came with maple syrup - then charged extra for a bit more maple syrup.  Pancakes were dry and flavorless.  Oatmeal was good. Home fries were sludge - far from crispy.  Thick bacon would have been good but for way too much pepper.  Waitress was a humorless zombie.  Also refused to do two separate checks.  Geez how hard is that!! We will not be returning.

Food is good. Simple. Not worth the prices nor the wait. A small glass of orange juice is $2.50, which seemed a little pricey. Menu is small.  Highly recommend going just to try it yourself, seeing how much fame it gets. I think they can pull it off giving that there's not many places that serve breakfast downtown.

Matt's Big Breakfast!  Best breakfast downtown!  Guy Fieri's been here!!!!!  Hold on a minute.... once you get over the hype, unfortunately, you find that Matt's is just average.  We went recently and contended with the customary long wait for our table.  Once seated in the cramped, homey space, we were ready to be dazzled.  Problem is, my griddlecakes were just average.  In fact, the pancakes I make at home (America's Test Kitchen recipe) are probably better.  My daughter's waffle was fine, but again, nothing extraordinary.  Our waitress seemed to always be forgetting something - water, oj, side dish, etc.  For the hassle, Matt's is not worth it.  I'd rather have breakfast at Province in the new Westin down the street.  Once you get over the hype, you'll get over Matt's.
The breakfast burrito was delicious. It was filled with peppers and chunks of bacon. Matt's obviously specializes in bacon.

stopped in again last sunday before picking someone up at the airport. breakfast was flawless (again). i had the hog and chick this time and was very happy. hashbrowns were crispy, but not burnt. eggs were scrambled and fluffy. the jam of the day was strawberry, and some of the best i have ever had. love me some sourdough toast & jam. i waited less than 5 minutes ( it was only me), sat at the bar, and enjoyed swift, friendly service. coffee was fine but not great. if matt's is going to improve, i say the coffee is where to start.

What's not to love?   Cool small-diner atmosphere, crazy good food, ginormous portions, decent coffee (so many places underestimate the power of a good cup of joe), and you can laugh at Guy's stencil near the register.   4-egg chorizo and jalapeno scramble... if you see it on the board, GET IT.

This place is very popular, they have a very flexible schedule and are open very early 6:30, and they have a very fast service that I really enjoyed. But i didnt like their fresh squeezed orange juice (that didnt taste fresh at all) and their food wasnt very well seasoned. I have mixed feeling about this place. Their price is okay and you can probably share with someone else. Their strawberry jelly is very good

For so long I have been encouraged to explore the breakfast happenings at this local spot in Phoenix.  I believe I am going to be one of the few who was not wowed by what Matt had to offer.  Matt's gets a big gold star for its earth friendly and locavore kitchen.  The menu features "cage free eggs from humanely raised chickens", grain fed pork and natural beef, as well as local organic produce.  You will only find a breakfast and lunch menu here, and the items are unpretentious and down-home - virtually anything I could easily whip up in my own kitchen such as BLT's, tuna salad sandwhich, tossed cobb, and burgers.  As the name infers, breakfast is big here.  And greasy and indulgent.  The "five spot" breakfast sandwhich appears to be the most popular item here and comes on a roll with two eggs, two slices of bacon, American cheese, and grilled onions.  (Personally, I feel American is the worst cheese in America, and I wish that government regulators would ban it from kitchen tables.) And when you add greasy grilled onions to an already greasy sandwhich with very un-American cheese, you get some bad bed-fellows.  So, unfortuantely, this breakfast for me was under-appreciated and finished by my breakfast date who had the same thing.  Other breakfast items included omelets, salami scrambles, griddlecakes, and waffles.  Notable drink items were fresh squeezed orange juice, honey lemonade, or organic chocolate milk.  Vene Vidi Vici.  But I likely won't return.

I visited the Phoenix area last week and had the pleasure of eating here. The menu and dcor in this place are very simple, but don't let that fool you. The food is absolutely delicious!   I ordered the special of the day, which was called the "Classic Egg Benedict" or something like that. At first glance, its just eggs and Canadian bacon on an English muffin along with some hash browns. However, the taste was absolutely sublime! Much better than any eggs and ham I've eaten at other breakfast type places. They put some sort of creamy sauce on top of the eggs, which really made the difference in terms of taste. It wasn't exactly the most health conscious thing I ate during my trip, but it was well worth it.   I strongly recommend this place if you're looking for a big filling breakfast and don't care about the calories. 5 stars!

Read this place was all the talk and have been wanting to try it out. Wait time was typical 30 mins so not bad. The food was fresh and AMAZING! the only reason I didnt give it a 5 is because I paid 3.50 for lemonade with no free refills. I would not have gotten the lemonade had I known. $3.50 is a bit much for a drink with no refills.

I have to say, I have never really been much of a breakfast person. With that said, Matt's Big Breakfast may change that. Why? Well, let's get crackin'! :)  The Food:  First and foremost, let's talk about the menu. It's small, but covers all you bfast must haves. Eggs to ham, oatmeal to waffles, they have you covered. They even have a big bowl of Frosted Flakes on the menu (ummmmm yum!). I got the Hog and Chick, which is two eggs any way, bacon or sausage, hashbrowns or homefries, with toast and homemade strawberry preserves. I got my eggs over easy, and I mention this becausemost places can't seem to make them right, but Matt's made them perfectly! The homefries were delish, and the toast and preserves made my tummy VERY happy.The only problem I had was with the bacon, too peppery. That is a personal preference though.   The Service: The service was good. It took about 30 min to be seated, which is to be expected. It allowed time for me to walk around a bit and chat it up with my friend. So no complaints there. Our server (and I feel terrible because I can't remember her name) was very sweet and attentive. Only towards the end did her service become slow, but the drinks and food came out in a respectable amount of time.   The Atmosphere: It is a smaller establishment, so its a little "cozy", but don't let that scare you away. Everyone is there to enjoy a good breakfast, so you're in good company. :) It's decor simple. It's pretty contemporary. It's very clean as well.   The Verdict: Matt's Big Breakfast is awesome! Worth the wait, and worth the trip downtown. I gave Matt's 4 stars because I wasn't a fan of the super peppery bacon, and the service got a little slow at the end. Other than those two, everything else was great! I will be returning, and with friends.

Wonderful place for breakfast, recommended as a must by Sheraton, and they were not wrong! I travel extensively and this is as good as it gets......great food, excellent service, wonderful teamwork by entire staff. Every dish ordered was unique and surprisingly good. Only complaint was the wait, but it is definitely worth the wait.

I went to Matt's Big Breakfast on Tuesday for the first time as I heard so much about it.  I will tell you about my experience.  There was a wait, as expected.  My sister and I didn't mind because we had a lot of catching up to do.  Our name was called and the Host asked if sitting at the bar was ok.  We said yes.  We started to sit down on the stools but decided that it was not very comfortable.  My sister noticed that there were two 2-tops available and asked the host if we could sit there.  He said that that was fine but to let him know ahead of time "so that we didn't have to do this dance again."  We swallowed our pride and sat down.  The female server never smiled and we had to ask for another cup of coffee so she was probably "slammed" with tables.  The table next to us got their breakfast first even though they were sat after us.  We did get our food eventually by someone other than our server.  The food was fabulous as expected.  But please don't let the poor service keep you away.  I would have given all five stars had the service had been as exceptional as the food.

While I have raved about this place in the past, I wanted to once again extol the virtues and, more importantly, the family feel of this place. Ernie lights up the room with her smile. Once that happens, the coffee is served, and the service begins then the rest of the breakfast is just a wonderful continuation. Peg and I went for my birthday (actually, we try to extend family occasions so that we can visit the family of chefs with whom we have grown since we moved here in '97). The OJ was fresh, the specials are always superb, and there is a continuity in the kitchen that virtually assures that the quality will be stellar.  We can't wait for the new addition this month, and Peg and I always will support Matt, Ernie, and of course Christopher!  Dr. B

What is so special about Matt's?  I couldn't figure it out from the pictures on Yelp.  However, our car rental guy recommended it, so we decided to give it a try.    I showed up with low expectations because I am extremely spoiled by the amazing brunch places in SF.  It can't be better than the Bay right...?  The long wait and Phoenix sun made me a little annoyed and my expectations got higher with every minute that passed by.    When we sat down, I looked around, and the whole place was pig themed.  How fitting... my fianc and family calls me a pig all the time.  They say you are what you eat... *shrug*.  So all the signs pointed at me to order their bacon with eggs.  It sounded so simple... so what's the hype?  Their sunny side eggs was cooked to perfection for me to dip my perfectly peppered thick and crispy bacon in the runny yolk.  Their homefries were crispy on the outside, yet soft on the inside cooked with caramelized onions.  Lastly, their sourdough bread was perfect with their delicious strawberry jam.  The dishes are so simple, but their ingredients and cooking skills kill it.  We came here at the beginning of our trip and I couldn't stop thinking about this place on our last day.  I wish I ate here again.  I was about to come grab bottles of their jam as gifts, but they closed early.  So much regret for not planning to come earlier...   If you are my friend and going to Phoenix and reading on my review right now, will you bring me back a jar?  Pretty please?! :D

Very much appreciate the new space with bathrooms and room to move. And also happy that the food quality was not impacted the slightest. The wait makes it all the better. And that strawberry lemonade?! Whoo, tasty. Just lighten up on the ice! But for those who are looking for veggie options, they have a lil' bit, particularly the standard omelet with cheese. Would like to see a bit more variety without the meat. Otherwise great work.
Got the daily special on a Sunday morning. Food was oversold and under delivered. Not worth the wait for me...
Really good lemonade and ham (not necessarily together). Their eggs are just eggs but they have a few unique items that really are good.

So sorry to say but won't be back after waiting several weeks to try. The service was horrible, had to ask someone when we could place our order. My husband had the Cobb Salad and they must have not had lettuce left so they chopped up lots of the core. I told him to send it back but he didn't want to wait again for a new plate. I had the egg with bacon, cheese and onion. The bacon was dry and burn't and the sandwich on a whole was cold. We won't be back anytime soon.

I have been going here for years but after yesterday I will NEVER return . After ordering my food I asked for more syrup for my pancakes and they said it was additional 1.50 . You have got to be kidding me, I took my food and left will never go back . As a restaurant there are something that you just DONT do .  I respect my hard earned money way to much .
Small seating area, long wait. Bathroom was in motel next door. But the food is excellent, definitely worth the wait. Good prices. Currently, my favorite breakfast experience in downtown Phoenix.

What a great place. Terrific food and friendly, attentive staff. I had the french toast combo. OMG! Delicious!  My husband had Matt's Big Breakfast. He thoroughly enjoyed it. Melinda was our server and she is amazing! The handsome, dark haired waiter who served our food is also great. Two thumbs up.

I have been here probably five times, but not for awhile.  The only reason for that is that, by the time I'm ready to get breakfast, I'm pretty hungry and can't stand waiting 30 minutes to an hour to get in.  Last Sunday, I actually packed a snack and sat on the curb to face 45 long, hard minutes of being tantalized by delicious smelling food.  I had forgotten just how great this place is.  The service is super friendly and very efficient.  Once you get in, you get served very quickly.  I could swear that they laid down our enormous spread of food within 5 minutes of us ordering, and it's not old, sitting-around-under-a-heat-lamp stuff, it's hot and fresh.  I got some eggs (fresh and cooked to perfection), and wheat toast which was thick cut and had some delicious local strawberry preserves with it, but the standout is always the hashbrowns.  They are the stuff of dreams: a giant, salty, crisp on the outside/soft on the inside, just greasy enough slab of heaven.  Sweet Pea got his usual Hog n Chick that comes with the thickest, most peppery bacon I've ever seen.  And THEN we split a waffle, also delicious (not as outstanding as the rest, but I'm not usually a waffle person.)  If you want the real deal, a straight-up BREAKFAST - no frills and newfangled foods, but just really quality delicious stuff, then pack a snack and get to Matt's. Nobody does it better.

My friends and I stopped here for Saturday brunch after the gym.  The place wasn't very busy for being Saturday morning. It was open and airy - great atmosphere. Food was okay. It was exactly what you'd expect from a generic breakfast place. I had The Skinny, but subbed hash browns for the salad. The egg white, chicken sausage, and kale scramble was good. The hashbrowns were a little soggy.  Why I gave this place two stars was because of the service. Our server, Michelle, was a total bitch. Every question we had, she answered like we were incredibly stupid. We felt like a complete burden to her. In addition to her, the manager gave us weird, creepy vibes. Won't be coming back.

First big shout out to Stephanie, my server. Incredibly helpful and great attitude. Same with Jonathan! They both helped me to forget about my two hour flight delay. Good was great. I could've gone 5 star easily but I think it's a 5 star for a 4 star establishment. The place to eat when you're in gate B. There's also a bar with TVs on.

I was skeptical but decided to try this restaurant upon hearing all the talk or hype.  My son was visiting and thinking he would order pancakes since he loves them. Well he ordered the skinny and not any pancakes. We had a short wait around 11:20 AM on a Friday cause this place stays busy.  First thing ordered was coffee and it was mediocre which was not good because now that set the tone for the meals. Our meals came out hot and delicious. As was said in a review, the menu is not big but the options on the menu are done well. Staff is great and menu is priced right. Oh and those Rosemary potatoes just fabulous.
Best place for breakfast. Must try there waffle and  bacon. Hog & chick is amazing my wife loves there eggs and toast so fresh.

Always delicious !! Had their sausage with my breakfast this time, awesome!!  Extra special bonus on my last visit...hot chic working there was wearing super short, super tight skirt, and little... to no underpants..and she kept wanting to pick things up from the floor, this was a great day.

Work out at the Mountainside, right across the parking lot of this location.  Nice and open with a nice patio. Too bad patio's view isn't the lake and just the drive between all the tall buildings. Indoor seating is very load. Host, the day we tried, was very short and rude with us. Wasn't a great first impression.  We all tried different dishes. 2 of us were happy with their meals, 3 of us, not impressed for all the hype. And watch your coffee closely...they are so quick to top off without asking...just after you got it perfect.  We all decided to have a cocktail for dessert. If that was all we had and we didn't encounter the rude host, I would have given a 4...the margarita was the BEST! Would go back for that...but nothing else.

For any of you that have been to Matt's and don't like it, no offense, but we wouldn't make a good breakfast eating team.   Because I love it. I had read and heard many a glowing review of this place from friends but the lingering question in the back of my mind was "How can bacon, toast, and eggs be that good?" Candidly, I still don't know the answer to that question. What I do know, however, is that it is, indeed, that good, if not better than I ever dreamed simple breakfast foods could be.   The line can be a formidable obstacle. There is a pad on top of the water by the front door where people write in the name of their party and number of people and you just wait for them to call your name into the tiny restaurant. I saw quite a few people outside, content to be waiting with a book, obviously knowing what they had in store.  As for the "too much butter" complaint from other reviewers, my advice is don't worry about it. If you want a light breakfast, Matt's isn't what you're looking for. For an obscenely delicious plate exploding with flavor and goodness, bring a book and post up at Matt's. It's worth it.

Really fantastic breakfast. Not for vegetarians, I guess, because one of my dining companions was not impressed (except, I think she liked the eggs), but I was in hog heaven. Great atmosphere in a city bereft of great atmosphere. Seriously. I asked the hot counter girl what there is to do in Phoenix. She seemed confused by the question. But at least she was hot. Yeah, sorry for even going there, but all the women who worked at Matt's when I was there were really friggin' hot, and I can't honestly say as an honest Yelp reviewer that it didn't count as a factor in the number of times I returned here. But what I can also say is that I wouldn't have gone near the place, hot serving wenches notwithstanding, had the food not been completely, utterly satisfying. Totally worth a drive across the "city" for. Really. I mean. Being from New York, I tend to compliment nobody. I enjoyed Matt's. So congratulations, management. You hired the right people. You cook a mean egg. You know what to do with pork. All of this was appetizing, satisfying, and filling. YUM.

I must agree with reviewers who have been other than taken aback by the place and agree with Jerry J's assessment of it.  Took the advice of a seemingly seasoned lady I am working with. She is a doll and I trusted her judgement of this greasy spoon.  If she reads this, she'll know I'm speaking of her.  We arrived to hotel last night and she mentioned she would be going here for brunch.  I am an avid breakfast lover so sounded good to me, even spectacular.  I walked there from hotel, wrong shoes to wear my bad, no one elses, got blisters. The place looked like a dive, as I was told it would, so not surprised. Saw the menu, their special of the day was biscuits and gravy which I love.  But wanted more than carbs so opted for eggs, bacon, toast and hashbrowns.  I did ask my server, "could I pay more and get the biscuits and gravy without the toast", she said unfortunately no. Not her fault I understand but how dumb of the proprietors rules to make that not an option, I said I was happy to pay more.  They lost out on that option as this may have been a bettter review as she'd said the B&G were very good.  The breakfast came, unimpressed visually.  2 eggs over medium, 1 was a broken yolk but they gave it to me anyway.  I found that odd, they goofed, why give me their whoooopsie? How hard is it to make another egg? not.  The bacon was very crisp which is usually fine, but over crisped and way too much pepper is another.  The sourdough toast was wonderful as I'm a bread maker as well, and the strawberry jam was good also, not mine, but good.  The bacon I took wrapped up with the rest of the jam on it as I'll eat that later in the day when I want a little something to munch on.  The hashbrowns : oh soooo very grease laden.  Pleantiful, which I did appreciate but my gosh there is just simply no reason to douce them in oil or grease, whatever it was.  I know how the perfect hashbrowns are made and as easy as they are I would only answer the how to's if our kids asked me. They deserve my answers and recipes.   But as easy as they are, often times you get an oversogged in grease outcome.  They were hot, appreciated that but all that clear liquid just made them pasty/gooey and not in a good way.  The server was a nice young gal and of that I'm appreciative also. I won't go back nor will I tell anyone to go there.  Simply lack luster and mostly due to the food.
This is the best place to eat ever! I love their home cooked potatoes. I go there at least once a week. Staff is friendly and the price is right too.

I too saw the dinners drive in and dives show on this place. Two words, not impressed. I to was looking for the French toast which is not on the menu. I ordered the special which came out luke warm. The home frys drowning in rosemary. As my wife was still waiting for her cheese omelet which was the same luke warm. Are friend had ham and eggs which was the smart choice. At a price that we were scratching our head. Point being is don't always believe what you see and hear on TV
Such a great breakfast!!  Wait was a little long.  Not sure I can say the wait was totally worth it but I loved the food!  Waffle was great!!

We ate here last weekend and it was nice.  The wait was long but if you've never eaten there it's worth waiting for.  Once you get in there you'll see it's a fun place to be; a combination of hip/50's dinner with real all American food (especially breakfast).  I had the salami and eggs breakfast which was ok.  I thought the salami was way too salty.  The hash browns on the other hand are amazing.  They were made from real potatoes, cooked just right with plenty of grease and I loved every bite!  I also had a cup of coffee that was average at best.  My wife, on the other hand, had a glass of lemonade that was made from scratch and was sweetened with honey which we both thought was awesome.  If you're going to come here bring a small snack you can munch on outside because the wait could be up to an hour and a half.  Best thing is to call before you come and ask how long the wait is.

I had the waffle it comes with butter and delectable syrup! Hands down the best one I have ever had! For a Monday morning it was pretty busy and chaotic really made an interesting breakfast! All the employees seemed to work together to serve each table which makes it quick to get in and out. It was a great experience!

This joint earns a strong five stars, and I am so lucky it is just down the street from me.  My first time was today, and on the walk back I actually considered the budget of eating there DAILY.  Could this be done?  Hmm.  I recommend this to everyone - locals and tourists!  I heard the crowds were bad - notsomuch.  I found two seats at the bar right when I walked in at around 9am on a Friday morning.  The waitress was cheerful and energetic.  I ordered the hog and chick ... phenomenal bacon.  I want to try the lemonade next time I'm there.  The guy next to me at the bar kept going on and on about how amazing it was.  Like almost sexually.

Really happy to find this place the morning of my flight home from Phoenix.  The servers are super cool - fun & cheery which is just what a weary traveler needs.  The couple sitting next to me were totally cracking up at their server - I had a different server but he was fun and attentive as well.    I had the breakfast burrito (vegetarian) and it was delish!   Coffee and water were kept full and the burrito was sooo good.    I'd definitely recommend.

Have been eating here since the TINY spot.  The food is always so fresh and yummy and service  has always been perfect. Have tried almost everything on the menu, never been let down. Love that they try to stay local on all they cook. My favourite breakfast is the salami scramble, but the waffles are so tasty too. Lunch fav  the burgers and BLT the best. I could go on about so many other yummies on the menu, but once you try them you WILL be back. ENJOY.    P.S. brought friends from Colorado and they come every time even at airport location.

Had a great first experience at the Tempe location. It's located on the ground floor of one of the business buildings in the Marina, wasn't where I expected but decent signage helped me find my way. You have to park in a parking garage but during the weekdays first 2 hours are free so that's nice and it was easy parking. Matt's is a big, open restaurant. Went on Wednesday and it wasn't very crowded, service was great! Our server kept checking in without checking too much as we talked a lot before we ordered. I ordered the Salami Scramble as I saw someone raving about on Yelp! I know why! It was delicious, awesome fresh bread! They use a lot of locally produced food. I'll definitely go again when I'm in Tempe

Bacon? Outstanding.  Griddle cakes?  Crave-worthy.  Home-fries?  Awesomely awesome.  Service?  Ehhh.  Love this little joint tucked into a one-bedroom house!  The food was amazing -- I can still taste those griddle cakes, BUT the service left something to be desired (more about that later).  My hubby got the three-meat scramble with hashbrowns, and it came with a tortilla.  He gobbled it down, apparently it was really good.  We never got any hot sauce, after two requests.  I ordered the two-egg breakfast with bacon.  The bacon was to die for, the best I think I've ever had.  The thick sourdough toast which accompanied my meal was served with real butter and fresh strawberry jam.  The combo was killer!  All in all, a fantastic breakfast!  About the service -- The female waitress who greeted me at the door specifically told myself and two other parties that were waiting that they ONLY SEAT ENTIRE PARTIES, no waiting at the table for someone else to show.  She must have said this three or four times.  I pointed to my hubby, who was parking the car across the street and told her he'd be here in just a minute, and she reiterated, WE ONLY SEAT ENTIRE PARTIES.  I was told to add my name to a list outside, even though he was 30 seconds away!  An older woman appears at the door and asks for a table, and tells the waitress her husband is parking the car.  "Oh, okay, I can get you a table right now," says the waitress.  No "WE ONLY SEAT ENTIRE PARTIES."  No "ADD YOUR NAME TO THE LIST OUTSIDE EVEN THOUGH HE MIGHT BE HERE IN 30 SECONDS."  Noooooo.  Instead it's "Oh, okay, I can get you a table right now."  GRRRRRR.  I piped up and said, "Oh, here he is.  We're ready now."  The waitress responds, "I'm going to get her a table, I'll be right back."  GRRRR.  I HATE people who say one thing and do another.  I was seeing red at this point, but the place is so danged small I couldn't tell my hubby what I was so pissed off about!!!  Anyhow, the waitress "that wouldn't seat us" buzzed our table once or twice, and I asked for water THREE TIMES before a very kind gentleman waiter got it for me.  They forgot my OJ -- he brought it out after I asked the other waitresses TWICE.  Hot sauce?  Never appeared on our table, even after two requests.  Just a tip -- the female waitresses were ditzy as hell.  Ask for a male waiter!!  (sorry if that sounds sexist, but I'm a woman and I know what good service looks like.  This was NOT IT.)  My rating above is based on the FOOD (5 STARS) minus one star for the SERVICE (TWO STARS).  (I know, I know, five minus two is three, but I just couldn't bring the food rating that low, It was THAT GOOD)  In fact, I think I'm heading out now for some of those griddle cakes.  From a male server.  See ya!
There was a wait, but once you get seated they have quick service. The place is always packed. Venue has amazing food, especially the honey lemonade. It's a life changer! 2 thumbs up for sure!

so the quest is finally over.  i have found my hangover breakfast spot.  although not hungover on this occasion, i believe that matt's will fit the bill for my greasy big breakfast need after a long night.  came in around 11am, because i can never seem to make it up before 10, and there was no wait and we were greeted and seated right away. started with a coffee which was SO good, some of the best diner/breakfast coffee i have ever had. i went with the salami and egg scramble with hashbrowns and sourdough toast, and my friend went with the chick and hog with bacon and home fries. the food came up pretty fast and i dug in.  fantastic.  the eggs were cooked perfectly and the salami was out of this world. the hashbrowns were a little greasy but i mixed everything together and it balanced out. a little tabasco sauce, and i had one bomb breakfast. i tried my friends bacon and it was phenomenal. crispy, thick, and peppery. delicious. their oj is like drinking straight out of an orange. the toast was great, and their jam was just the right amount of sweet. their portions are HUGE, i couldn't even finish my breakfast. my friend was as impressed as i was. it wasn't overwhelming loud inside like some small joints are known to be (like over easy...) and it wasn't crammed at all, even though the place looks incredibly tiny from the outside!  excellent service, stellar food, cool atmosphere, all for only $20 plus tip. i'm jumping on the matt's bandwagon.
This was a decent meal, expensive and service was iffy but it was an airport location so I think that is to be expected.

The food was amazing, really filling and satisfying. I would've giving this place a 5 star but the manager or whatever he is, the guy up front is some what of an ass. Jason is his name, noticed he is rude to his servers. And definitely had an attitude when my group came in. Not cool sir, not cool!! The servers and other staff was great and attentive.

This is the place other breakfast spots aspire to be. With incredible ingredients, top notch preparation and even better service this is truly a Phoenix gem. Owned and operated by Matt and Ernie, their family atmosphere and attention to detail assure a perfect visit every time. DON'T MISS IT!!!

The breakfast at this restaurant was over the top. The breakfast sandwich was excellent. I think the key was the sauted sweet onion and the excellent roll it was made on, gave it a little bit of sweet almost maple syrup flavor. Our server was also excellent I asked for a little more coffee right as the bill came and she filled up a to-go cup for me.  My girlfriend got a Bloody Mary that I am pretty sure could have served as a meal in itself.

This was excellent. Wish I would have taken a picture of my salami scramble with home fries done crispy. Delicious! Highly recommend this place. Cannot wait to visit my son at GCU to have breakfast here. Yum yum!

For an airport breakfast this restaurant was over the top. The breakfast sandwich was excellent. I think the key was the sauted sweet onion and the excellent roll it was made on. Our server was also excellent I asked for a little more coffee right as the bill came and she filled up a to-go cup for me.  My girlfriend got a Bloody Mary that I am pretty sure could have served as a meal in itself. And the price wasn't bad for an airport. The breakfast sandwich with potatoes was $10 and too much food for me to finish.

Fun, hippy, eclectic yet completely off the charts kind of place. Been coming here for three years now and the menu items are all to die for. This time I got me an old fashioned, and that drink is very well made here. For my dinner I got the mac and cheese, one of my favorite dishes here. Very creamy, cheesy dish that makes you want more. I also ordered a side of hand cut fries and those were amazing as well. Definitely recommend this place and I'll come back again. Have low expectation for seating and be open minded, you'll have fun.

Holy freaking deliciousness! My boyfriend and I were spending a few days in Phoenix for a mix of work/fun, and he found this place on Yelp. We waltzed in for breakfast around 10am on a Tuesday and were seated immediately. My first observation about this place was the high energy atmosphere, which made me feel really excited to be there. Noise level was moderate - buzzing with conversation but not noisy, making intimate conversation easy. I also got my coffee immediately, and my request for almond milk in place of regular was accommodated. Always a good start :)  After poring over the variety of unique menu options, my boyfriend ordered the Griddlecakes with a side of Thick Cut Bacon and I went for the Salami Scramble. Griddlecakes were pleasantly fluffy but maintained their flavorful density, and the bacon was coated with a sprinkling of peppery goodness. The Salami Scramble was equally enjoyable - thick cut strips of salty/fatty (that's a good thing) meat distributed throughout a helping of scrambled eggs. Ironically, my FAVORITE thing on the table was the side of potatoes that came with my scramble - thick chunks tossed in a perfect medley of sea salt, olive oil and the FRESHEST rosemary. I typically try to shy away from starchy carbs - not for lack of obsession, but out of consideration for my waistline. These potatoes, however, were irresistible. I literally couldn't stop eating them! My boyfriend seemed to share the same sentiment.   If we ever make it back to Phoenix, I would certainly put this Big Matt's location back on my bucket list for breakfast or lunch.

I really enjoy eating at Matt's and have been to the original downtown location about 11 years ago, the Tempe location, and surprise the airport. I am a creature of habit when I eat out for breakfast. Two eggs over medium , ham, hash browns crispy and dry sourdough. Matts cooks my eggs perfectly, the ham is never salty and the hash browns crispy and brown. I love the sourdough and house smashed strawberry jam. Consistently consistent. Great job to Matt's crew members

2.5 stars. My cheesy chorizo omelette was very delicious but the homefries included, what seemed like, and entire rosemary plant! It was so overpowering even after spending 5 minutes picking out all that I could. Such a bummer! Service was less than mediocre. Never got a refil or a check-in from our waitress besides when she first brought our drinks over. I think I'll give it one more go and make my final review then!

This was my first time and with the construction in the area it was hard to find. Once in and seated my eyes wandered, everything that came out looked delicious. I thought it was a little expensive for a traditional egg breakfast but it really was delicious. I would definitely go back and recommend it.

I was super excited to try this place after reading all the great reviews. I'm here vacationing with my family from Austin, TX and staying in a downtown hotel so this restaurant is walking distance.   The wait was about an hour but I expected it since it seems to be a popular place. The hostess did a great job of keeping everyone in the loop of the status of seating and they even served cold water outside. There are several benches to sit as well as a couple of trees for shade.   After being seated the service was pretty fast. Our drink orders were taken promptly and shortly after was our food order. I ordered the griddlescakes and was quite disappointed. They were very dry and not at all what I expected. My cousin ordered the pork chop and eggs and his pork chops were dry. My husband ordered the pork and chick which was eggs, bacon, potatoes and toast. Everything on his plate was really good. The toast was amazing.   We had to ask to have our drinks refilled a couple of times but they did the best they could given the best they could.

I have no words for this one. Those place, as the name implies, is a breakfast place. That's their emphasis. So why do they have no half- and half for coffee?  All they have is milk. Saying this is a gross oversight would be an understatement.

Great, real and fresh breakfast in a super cute teeny tiny spot.  The space is so small that they don't even have a bathroom and could probably only serve 20-25 people at a time.  We waited about 15 minutes on a Thursday morning, but i would assume the wait could get scary on the weekends.  The food was totally spot on.  From the thick sliced perfectly baked bread they use for toast to the honey lemonade, all the small details take this spot to another level.  I ordered the special scramble which was ham, fresh jalapeno and cheese with a side of hash browns.  Tobin ordered the Hog and Chick (pork chop with eggs) and a side of bacon.  While the entire meal hit the spot, the hash browns were the highlight with a perfect balance of crispy top browned bits to the soft buttery layer underneath. The bacon was also legit, perfectly thick cut and cooked to perfect chewy goodness.  The staff was very friendly, quick and attentive and all seemed to thank us as we as we finished up and walked out.    This place is a definite must see as it is everything restaurants in up-and-coming neighborhoods should be.

I was so excited to be in the area after seeing Matt's Big Breakfast on the Food Channel years ago. I ordered waffles which I will say to my surprise very light and fluffy.  My boyfriend ordered bacon sausage and eggs. Nothing spectacular, a bit over priced my one waffle with no sides was almost $8. I'm glad I tried it but was not overly impressed.
Way overrated very loud not comfortable service was fine food was very expensive not anywhere near the quality that the reviews have done I give it one star
Usually ALWAYS busy, especially during prime time breakfast hours! Plan ahead and arrive early or after the breakfast rush. Busy and upbeat atmosphere, all food choices get a thumbs up from me!

Very disappointed. They're in an airport, and I k JW it's not fast food, but I ordered a waffle. How long does it take to make a waffle. And then they bring me French toast a half hour later. I told them I ordered a waffle and they said it would be a while longer. Can't review the food because I didn't get any.   On top of that when I sat down the counter was wet and dirty. The staff said they'd wipe it down. It took them 15 minutes before they did that. Poor service.

I've been coming to Matt's since it was in the tiny hole in the wall place down the road from it's new location and I have never been let down.  Their menu is fairly small but their portions are gigantic. Just the waffle alone takes up a whole dinner plate, and their omelets are to die for. Literally the first bite always brings a tear to my eye. I always go for the ham, red pepper, and American cheese which just oozes cheese and its innerds with each bite. Their bacon is also soo good, thick cut and well seasoned. They sautee their onions in some delicious oil that I have yet to place but always tastes fantastic. And their lemonade is the perfect mix of sweet and tart, and made fresh daily with real cane sugar and comes with fruit options as well. And each breakfast comes with your choice of bread (sourdough, wheat, white, and occasionally other options) and a side of freshly made jam of the day which is always incredible. I go for their sourdough which is always wonderful but their wheat is just as good.  The only thing I have found lacking is the hash browns, some days they are great but more often than not the bottom half is under cooked and soggy, get the home fries which come with sauteed onions and a sprinkling of fresh rosemary (they are sooo good).  Its family owned and Matt (the owner) gets all of his ingedients fresh from the local farmer's market. It wasnt uncommon in the past to see him helping out tables at the old restaurant but now with the new locations, he's more busy making sure each location is as good as the original.  Parking can be a bit difficult but their is an ally that connects the new restaurant with the old which allows more parking. And their is often a wait if you come before noon, but trust me it is well worth the wait. This is by far the best breakfast joint in town.  I would recommend this place to anyone, whether you just picked up friends or reletives from the airport or if you're just looking for a good hearty breakfast. It can get loud and it is a bit longer wait for large groups (come after 1pm and you won't have a problem) but everyone will thank you for the amazing meal. I seriously suggest this place to everyone I know and everyone says its the best. Whether you stumble in after a long night drinking (they open at 6am and the food is just as good then) or if you're grabbing a bite before starting your day everything here is incredible.   And hey now there's an airport location with a full bar, which I've heard has the best bloody Mary's. The other locations definitely don't match up with the original though so try the place where it all started first.

Good food. Good drinks - they don't skimp on the booze either, full glass of champers for the mimosa and the Bloody Mary is filled with goodies and a lot of vodka! Not quick though, only stop in when their busy if you've got at least an hour to spare.

Man this place is packed but the turn over and service is impeccable. Came here and had a special eggs with chorizo jalapeo and white cheddar yummy!!   My friend had a waffle. It was really rich and good as well. Their bacon is thick and wonderful. Hash browns could have been cooked longer but that's ok.   Overall I would definitely come back.

I've been dying to go here since the last time I was in Phoenix! Nobody does breakfast better. The bacon is delicious. I've only been twice but I love the hog n chick! They have a homemade jelly and their toast is huge. Haven't tried the lemonade yet but I've heard it's good.

My family and I ate here while waiting to board our very delayed flight back home to LA. Initially, it was very crowded and we were told it would be half an hour wait. In their defense, we were flying on 4th of July most of the other restaurants in the airport were closed. But we ended up getting seated within 10 mins.  My only complaint would be that it was a pretty long wait to get our food but when we got it, it was great!

Located near gate B4 across the US Airways customer service. Daughter loved her Big Butter Burger and wife liked the egg and sausage. I had the pork chops and eggs. Very good. Son didn't like the Mamacita Burger.
Expect to wait for about an hour. The food is ok nothing spectacular. There are too many amazing dining options in downtown phoenix to wait so long here for basic food.
I used to drive and queue to eat at Matt's but not their Biltmore location is right by my house. Consistently great breakfast and attention.

I've had Matt's before and I wasn't impressed because all the meat, but I gave it another try at the advice of a friend and this time was so much better! Plus the wait time at this location was zero on a Saturday morning at 9am! That's pretty much a miracle for MBB!  I am vegetarian for the most part and I'm the only one I know that hates bacon (I know, I know). So after I told our waitress my food restrictions, she suggested the hash w/veggies with an egg on top. YUM! We also had a stack of their pancakes with real maple syrup. They were delicious! The service was great--our very attentive waitress, Michelle, made sure our order and our checks were correct (we were in a group of 7 people and we split checks).  Minus a star because a busser took our pancake plate before we could down the last bites. Maybe they are inexperienced at it and didn't realize they should just ask, "hey, can i take your plate?" Other than the over-eager bussers, the staff was nice, chairs and table were comfortable, our waitress was awesome, and the food was delicious!

I'm not sure why everyone loves this place.  Maybe it's the gigantic portions of meat they serve.  I was not impressed by the veggie section of the menu...oh wait, there's not one...and no, I don't like oatmeal or f-ing grapefruit for breakfast.  ick.  I've waited in line once--that'll be enough for me, Matt.

Michael was the best waiter ever! Early morning flight that was an issues but eatting here and having Michael as our waiter was great. The food was really good but even if it was bad the service was ON POINT. THANK YOU for a wonderful exsperience!

I only had 36 hours in Phoenix, and wanted to make sure I had the "Only in Phoenix" meals.  Everyone told me to go to Matt's (the bartender at Barrio cafe, the concierge, the Uber drivers).  But really, can't you get eggs and bacon anywhere?  I'm from Northern California, and organic is everywhere so I didn't feel this was that special.  But Monday morning, I woke up at 6 am and was starving by the time my lecture was over, and figured Matt's was the closest.  I headed over there and had the best meal in Phoenix.  I had the Monday Special, which was Huevos Rancheros.  Can eggs, tortillas and cheese melt in your mouth?  First time it did for me.  Also, I could just eat their strawberry preserves for breakfast.  Next time, I'm bringing ice packs to bring that jam on the plane!

came here for our last breakfast before I got sick on vacation (isn't that great) anyway it was delicious and I was happy to have fresh chocolate milk compared to the out of the bottle at other places. my husband loved his food (can't remember what he got) I wasn't a fan of the home fries but I didn't realize what they were cooked in. should have got the hash browns. no wait when we went and it's definitely a local kind of place which is exactly what I wanted.

Yeah...........What everyone else said.........Food is great.  Restaurant is small.  Line is long.  Service is great.    If they delivered this would be the world's best breakfast place.  Even if they had take out.  But delivery?  That would be fantastic.  I could totally picture myself hung over eating a hog and chick in bed.

Should be greeted with a smile no matter how busy. We were greeted, instead, by a rude host who was clearly showing stress over the long  lines and people waiting to be seated. Attitude is everything. Would NOT recommend this restaurant unless you want to start out with a stomachache even before you take one bite of food. Definitely not going back.
This place is so cute and the food and staff are phenomenal. Great prices. They really thought about every aspect of a great breakfast place and then went above that.

I'm quite impressed.  Very clever business model -- they work extremely efficiently, given what little space they have.  Despite how many people are always in line here, the wait is fairly reasonable.  They have you check-in when you first arrive, and they'll do periodic spot-checks to see who is still here and who just returned from a neighborhood walk.  With that comes wonderful service -- the staff seem genuinely happy to be there.  Service with a smile, really, and they were running about the organized chaos.  I never saw any one staff member stand in one place for more than a few seconds, which is nice because it shows dedication to the business.  I ordered the salami scramble with potatoes and sourdough toast.  I honestly think the best part of my meal was the toast -- crispy on the outside and soft in the center, serviced with some delicious strawberry jam (but it was fresh and tangy and flavorful!).  I think I would have been crazier about the jam, but I'm weird and not huge on jam.  I wish they had the option of butter instead.  Anyway, the salami was almost too rich for me, but it paired well with the eggs, which were nice and fluffy.  I also enjoyed the potatoes, though I thought they were a bit heavy on the rosemary, which actually surprises me because I like my food heavily seasoned.  I had a bit of my fiance's chicken artichoke sausage, which was part of the special, and that was divine.  The orange juice tasted like an orange in a glass.    A little pricey, but considering the quality of the ingredients you get (organic and local), I understand the markup.    Personally, the atmosphere isn't for me -- it's loud and clanky, but that's just my preference.  Doesn't mean it's not a good restaurant or business.  I just like it when I can have a conversation without raising my voice.  Great place, though!  Definitely a place worth checking out.

Disappointing.  I have been hearing about this restaurant for YEARS and was really disappointed.  While the quality of the food was exceptional, the dining experience was marginal.  Difficult to hear, too much traffic, too small of a location.  Clearly, this is an acquired taste by a loyal group of patrons.  Glad they use cage-free eggs!
I love this place. Very clean. Great food, great service. Classic breakfast with a new age twist.
Amazing place. I've only been here once and I always recommend it to people. I STILL drool over the coffee creamer. No joke probably the best I've ever had. Coming back here shortly!

Last Sunday I was excited to finally try Matt's Big Breakfast. I walked in through what I thought was the front door and stood there feeling dumb for a few minutes before a woman walked up and asked if I was eating. I responded with yes and she proceeded to that there was a huge wait and stared at me waiting for my response. When I didn't offer one she reiterated "like a really long wait. Like 40 minutes" and waited agin for a response so I said okay. She responded again "like at least 10 people ahead of you." And again I said okay. At this point I was frustrated. She let out a sigh and said "okay well to check in with the hostess" and walked off without even pointing me in the right direction. I walked around for a minute or two but I couldn't find the hostess and was so upset I just left. I will be going to the Phoenix location to finally try Matt's Big Breakfast, which is upsetting since I work right next to this one.

First timer here. Came around 12:00PM to avoid the anticipated lines.  There were no lines :)  Ordered the Waffle, which was delicious. It was Belgian style but also had fluff to it. Ordered toast and their homemade preserves and that was excellent as well. Probably one of the best waffles I've had in some times. The waffle also came with bacon, which was thick cut and tasted excellent. I'll be back!  5 stars for customer service 4 stars for their food quality  5 stars for their restaurant cleanliness 3 stars for their location (parking building)

Hearty diner food with good flavors. Nothing extraordinary. Limited menu. Was hoping for an Acai bowl or green drink but that's not this type of place. The real downer was the small dining space which was super noisy and not cozy. Hipster place with a rustic industrial/farm decor. Overhyped but super popular with college crowd.  Friendly service:)

Sat down. Ordered a cheese omelette. People sat down next to me (2 different parties) and ordered, got their food and ate it before I got mine. One of those parties even cashed out and left before I got mine.  I asked the waiter what happened and he said the chefs get food tunnel-vision and miss orders. I had to take my order to go and bring it on the plane. Super stressful to hope it was going to show up before my plane started boarding. Took over 30mins to get a cheese omelette.
Wow!!!! What a sleeper. I went inside to grab some dinner a kill an hour and a half. Food was outstanding and the services as even better.
The french toast is RIDICULOUSLY delicious.  I love Matt's! Definitely one of my favorite breakfast places in Phoenix.

Was told on 3/30/28 at 8:13 am that we could not sit outside (north side was full) on the west side because they wouldn't be able to see us over there.  Great weather and had to sit inside. Come on MBB you're better than that.

Have always wanted to hit this place in Phoenix.... wait, now they are in the Terminal at Sky Harbor Airport... baaam hellllooo layover.
