Food was solid, had a name your omelet with sausage, veggies and some queso.  Potatoes had incredibly flavor with the seasonings and little extra they throw in there.  Service was great, my coffee cup was always full.  Definitely the right spot when stuck in Sky Harbor which seems to be EVERY time lately while they work on the runway.

Big. Awesome. Delicious.  Stopped in here for breakfast one morning while in Phoenix.  My other half had the blackboard special of Chorizo Sausage and Jalapeno Omelet with potatoes and a flour tortilla. It was big, awesome  and delicious. It was so big, she couldn't finish it.  I had the stack of pancakes with a side of sunnyside up eggs and ham off the bone. It was big, awesome and delicious. And I finished it all off because I'm a gavone.  Service was attentive. Whenever you need a coffee refill, BAM, it was refilled. Nice.  The only thing that was odd, to me anyway, was that the pancakes came served on a hot plate (Ruth Chris Steakhouse style) and the maple syrup was also heated up.  Other than that, breakfast was Big. Awesome. And Delicious.

Atmosphere was welcoming and food was good. But the servers dress was inappropriate for a breakfast place if I wanted to see that much skin I would have gone to Hooters at least there they don't look like they just got out of bed.

I so love this breakfast place! This is right by downtown ASU so I always go there when I was in school. Coming back almost 2.5 years later, it hasn't changed a bit. It was still so busy but charming!   In general, everything here is good. They have different specials for each day so I always like to get that. However, this time I got the salami hash and hash brown. It was seriously so bomb! They use organic eggs and just organic everything. Food definitely taste fresh. I brought my boyfriend here to try my favorite breakfast place and he had no complaints either! He ordered a traditional breakfast plate and it came with eggs, sausage, hash browns, bacon, and toast. Oh my gosh, this hash brown is the best I have ever had. I almost forgot how good it tasted before going back this time! It was so crispy and not oily at all. I also want to rave about the toast here! It was just on point! I usually don't like toast but this one I could not pass.

Loved everything about this place, decor, service, food, all get 5 stars. Simple, high quality ingredients cooked perfectly always make for a great experience in my book. Had the Nieman ranch beef burger and it was out of control. Gotta go back to try the namesake Breakfast!

Came here on a Friday for lunch with a couple of friends, and am so glad we did! Fortunately, we did not have to wait at all and got seated right away! I ordered the freshly squeezed honey lemonade and waffle with bacon. When I drank the lemonade, I thought it was good..but more honey than lemon than I wished. Now...I'm craving for one.   Our food came surprisingly fast given how busy it was. I chowed down and cleaned up the entire plate very fast...the waffle was crispy on the outside and super soft on the inside, and the bacon was thick and yummy. Yum yum yum.   I tried my friend's potatoes and wheat toast with jam, it was so good! I'm a PB without J kind of person...and I really liked the jam. My bill was like $14 total..I would totally go back again for the food.

Ask your server what's good. I'll give you a hint, *ANYTHING* with the word  "salad" in it is a dud. Not because I don't like salad, I LOVE salads! But the fancy salad, tossed "cobb" salad, egg salad sandwich, tuna salad sandwich, and macaroni salad are all VERY bland. Trust me on this one. And the tomato soup tastes like maranara sauce, but is super good for dipping the awesome grilled cheese into. Tomato soup by itself....meh. Plus....it's $7 DOLLARS for one bowl of tomato soup. No. Everything else is well worth the money. If you have any issues with your food ever, just let your server know (nicely) and they'll gladly fix it for you, seriously. Also...they don't carry ranch. WHAT!?!?! In America?????? Lame. But all their food is seriously thebomb. com, and I suggest you get with your server to help you choose. they're usually WAY busy,  but most of the time very friendly and willing to give you an honest opinion.   Personally, I recommend the Sweet N Savory french toast. WOW. And that applewood smoked pork sausage???? WWWWOWWWW

The first time I came here (their old location) I sat outside and waited for an hour and a half in the pouring rain. I had biked over, so I literally had nowhere indoors to sit and wait.  Although I was hangry (adjective: angry from hunger), soaking wet and slightly impatient (this was back before they offered wait times), it was worth it.  Matt's hash browns are perfectly crisp and golden. The eggs are rich and delicious, unlike the ones you find in chain grocery stores. The coffee (from a local roaster) is clean, fresh and bright. Their 5 Spot sandwich is a perfect sampling of all their delicious breakfast offerings, and the simple Hog n Chick is a fresh, local take on a classic egg and ham breakfast.  I would recommend Matt's Big Breakfast to absolutely everyone.  Tip: If you don't want to wait for half an hour to 45 minutes, come between 7:45 and 8:15 nearly any morning of the week. The wait will be ~5 minutes, and you'll be leaving just as people begin to pile up!
This place is an institution in downtown Phoenix! And for good reason - great food cooked just the way you want it and lots of it. Every time I am downtown I want to eat here.

I tried the Special of the Day which was Ham,Cheese Chile Omelet with the home fries. My Husband tried the Sausage patties  and Eggs with home fries. These dishes were very good. The server was very attentive plus there was no waiting in line to get seated. The food was served very promptly while it was still steaming hot. Will definitely return to eat here on our next trip to Phoenix..

Fantastic.  Hadn't been to the new location until today.  Love the size of the new location.  You don't feel like a scumbag if you want to sit and talk for a bit since there is room for others to sit.  The food is excellent as usual.  Today it was the omelet with provolone, mushrooms, and sausage.  The sourdough toast was thick, crunchy outside with a chewy inside.  And the hashbrowns were just the way I like them - crunchy, but not too crunchy.  The service is attentive even when it's busy.  A must visit if you're downtown for breakfast or dinner.
meh. i've experienced better.

I am seriously shocked at any good review for this restaurant. I ate breakfast here this morning, and it was the worst breakfast I've had... Maybe ever? The home fries that some people rave about were soggy, greasy and heavily over flavored with rosemary, not to mention Luke warm. The bacon was inedible salty. The toast came out with enough butter for a whole loaf of bread. The over easy eggs were actually fine, thus one star. The waitress never asked why I left all of my home fries uneaten, not a sign of good service. Expensive and NOT worth it.

If you're looking for a great breakfast spot and don't mind a bit of a wait, Matt's is an excellent choice. The building is pretty small, so there are not many tables, meaning you could be waiting awhile. The food is definitely worth the wait though! I tend to get the pancakes, they are huge and delicious. I always get a cup of coffee, and it is always a good idea. This last time one of my friend's got the chili, and she said it was terrific. I love going to Matt's on Sundays for an after-church brunch, and I would say if you're on that side of town when it's open, go in and get some good food.

Love this place!  I love it even more now that they moved to a significantly larger location.  Everything I have ever eaten there has been scrumptious.  My only regret when I go here is that I cannot fit more of the deliciousness into my belly!

Super cute place to get brunch! We ate at the Camelback location. I saw this place featured in the Phoenix magazine and was excited to try it. It was very busy, we were told a 50 minute wait but only waited 30 so that was nice.  I had the cheese omelette with breakfast potatoes. I added mushrooms - it was excellent and the portions are big. I could've eaten five plates of the breakfast potatoes. My boyfriend got the pancakes and loved them, said they were very filling.   The service is great. Our coffee mugs were never empty. Everyone is your waiter/waitress so you can ask whomever to help you. They were all friendly and efficient.   The only reason Matts doesn't get 5 stars for me is because the seating was so uncomfortable. We sat at a high top and the stools are hard metal squares. Maybe I have a big ass but it was not enough room and definitely not conducive to wearing a dress. Space is also cramped.   If you can avoid the high top seating, I highly recommend Matts!

Not sure why all the hype. Food was extremely average. Couldn't get a crunchy breakfast bread to go with. Eggs weren't hot. Bacon not crunchy either. Wait staff not interested in making it a great experience. Just overall.. meh.

This is a chain breakfast spot that serves breakfast foods all day. This location is in the airport. You can order at the counter and get it to-go or sit-down with waiter service. This place has bar seating as well. I tried the $13 chili cheese burger and the $9 breakfast burrito served with chorizo. You could choose sausage or bacon instead of chorizo. The burger was huge and came with a side of French fries. My bf thought they didn't give enough fries. The burrito came with a side of pico de gallo. It wasn't enough so I asked for a 2nd but I think 3 would have been enough for me. I liked the burrito more than the burger. It was surprisingly super spicy. The burger had an awesome fluffy bun but a very thin piece of meat and some drier chunks of ground beef in the chili. The chili was more just ground beef and some beans than a chili. It wasn't very wet at all. The shredded cheese inside wasn't really melted. The water they gave tasted like there was a bit of lime. It had a metal flavor to me. I like the interior decor (had a giant pig on the wall and large bench-style seats with long round leather pillows) and music playlist (indie music). Their downtown location was featured on the TV show Diners, Drive-ins and Dives.
The service is always horrible. The 2 stars are for the food. There are restaurant with better service and food  in Sky Harbor if you don't have a lot of time pass this one by!

Have also review this place under it's former address just down the street - but have only eaten at this particular location.  Went in for lunch last Tuesday but got breakfast. Still was pretty busy but managed to get a parking spot in their tiny lot behind rather than pay a metre. Inside, we were almost immediately offered the bar area but, after sitting, found the seats are polished steel and I kept sliding off. They are not made for larger customers and some cushions with traction would not go amiss. So, we waited an extra 10 minutes for a table.  Got a large Belgian-style waffle with butter and syrup and the daily special lemonaide (strawberry honey). The lemonade was tasty and the waffle was delicious, but honestly a little costly for the amount of food. I definitely should have gone with the omelette - which is the same price but you get a huge omelette and a side of bacon and home fries! The waffle - which also comes with excellent thick-cut sliced bacon - definitely needs to come with a side of potatoes. A side of potatoes ordered on it's own is over $2.  However, service is super friendly and attentive. Still recommend this place but if you're hungry, skip the waffle and get something more generous!

While waiting to be seated I was acosted by an agressive panhandler :(  That being said we had coffee while we waited. On to the food...everyone in our party thought it was great...had the Hog & Chick myself.  The menu prices have gone up from what I saw on-line though...need to update their website!  Ernie (Matt's wife) helped us and was very nice. Overall was worth the wait...about 30 minutes on a Saturday morning.  There is a Farmer's Market across the street that you can check out while waiting :)

The food is amazing and the service is always friendly.  I came here today with a large group of 45 and the staff bent over backwards to accommodate us all.  We were alll in and out within 60 minutes and the Reuben was delicious as always.

So much no.    We decided on this place without much research. Big mistake.    The location is quite beautiful, in the Marina Heights district.  It's nestled in the midst of large high rises, near the water. There is a swanky gym nearby with lots of that foot traffic about.  Matt's appeared to have a wait as there were quite a few people waiting outside.    We were a party of 2 and waited about 15 mins to be seated.  That wasn't bad, but WHERE we were seated was HORRIBLE. It was a tiny little table in what felt like the middle of the lobby.  It was the first table right inside the door so everyone waiting is in your face staring and the constant door swinging made it quite chilly. Yuck!   I opened the menu and was greeted by a lack of choices.  Super disappointing. So the menu was disappointing, I hated were we were seated and then the really nice server brings us water and iced tea in these TINY glasses.  That was enough for me.  We left.    Now we are at The Oink instead, about 10 mins away and MUCH MUCH happier.
This place is always busy -takes a while to get a table but the service is always great and their food is great. I love this place from brunch.
Terrible place.  Bacon and potatoes are covered in pepper.  Eggs over easy were raw and cold.  Toast was cold.

Every time we come here, we were very pleased with its tasty breakfast and brunch. It was always packed with people and bit loud. This might not be the best place to have conversation but the food never betray you. The place has a good vibe and they seem to know how to manage the restaurant. besides the main dishes, try a cup of coffee, it goes well with your meal.

This place is so bomb. It was Sunday so tried the steak and eggs special. Loved how the potatoes came with caramelized onions and rosemary. Eggs were cooked right and steak was good. Added a side of pancakes and was delicious. Definitely recommend this place to anyone.

Love that they have Four Peaks beer on tap, including my favorite, Hop Knot. But I'm wishing I had made a different food choice. l ordered the grilled cheese with creamy tomato soup. Because I figured it was impossible to go wrong with a comfort food staple and I'm tired of burgers at the airport. I must have had a shocked look when my food arrived. The tomato soup was no where near creamy, but a chunky-ish tomato soup with no cream. The grilled cheese was no where near the gourmet sandwich the menu promised. So not worth $10. Should have gone to NYPD pizza instead.
The food was as good as the original downtown location.  Service was solid.  This location is trendy and much larger than the other locations.  I will be a regular!
Airport location is not as good as the location downtown.    They get really busy here and often have a 15-20+ minute wait.  From this experience I will not return to the airport location again.

Fathers Day breakfast at our favorite breakfast spot.  Food is exceptional here, staff was spot on and they are very consistent in the kitchen.   Wish they'd open up their patio more.  This morning would have been perfect outside!

If you're at all a "Foodie" you can't come to Phoenix, or anywhere within 50 miles and not visit Matt's Big Breakfast.  The wait outside is just part of the ambiance and culture of this tiny little place.  I hope they don't very enlarge this place....it would so spoil it.  Food....have anything.  Its all cooked to perfection with love and kindness from a kitchen staff that really cares about freshness.  My personal fav's are the Waffle and Bacon and the multi grain toast with the fresh jam typically made locally....changes frequently.   This was on Diner, Drive-ins and Dives a few years ago and its still the same bustling place as when Guy was there.  Side note...this was way cool.  On our last visit there were 4 of us, and if you've been here you know there are only a couple of tables that seat 4.  So we're waiting outside when the server comes out hands us menus, takes our orders.  When we're seated about 15 min. later our food was delivered within minutes of being seated.  Helped us get in and out and helped them move a table.  Much appreciated service.
Great fresh food. Have been there dozen times or so wait can be long but its worth the wait.

This place was out of this world, great staff and friendly. Chicken apple Gouda with cage free eggs and spinach was delish and OMG the home fries were outta this world. Nice tasty thick sliced wheat toast and homemade strawberry jelly to compliment the meal was one experience I will never forget. Matts Big Breakfast is a must to visit again when in the 602 area.

I've always had a great experience with the location on Phoenix, but I have not enjoyed my visit to this location once. The first time I got a breakfast burrito, and while it was good, there were so many jalapeos on it I almost got sick. The second time I ordered a burrito with no jalapeos, but they were still included on my burrito. The service at the to go counter isn't great, if you're going to eat here take the time to sit down for a meal.

OMG! Our favorite place to go anytime we are in Phoenix! Rode the light rail all the way across town to make it there before heading to the airport! The absolute best customer service we received at any restaurant while on vacation including an expensive spot in Sedona! Food is always top notch quality and best ingredients like sweet cream butter and real maple syrup. Love love love Matts!!

First and foremost, a huge and sincere thanks to William and the entire staff of Matt's Big Breakfast. Your hospitality and generosity opened the door to visit you all week during our stay in Phoenix. I have always had a tendency to support local restaurants and the quality/engaged service you provided made our group feel comfortable.   The items that I order included were the amazing & fresh pancakes (Monday), Waffles (Tuesday) & Bacon, French Toast (Wednesday), Chops & Potatoes (Thursday) and Waffles & Bacon (Friday). I can honestly say that I did not have a favorite breakfast.... they were all amazing in their own right. Fresh thick bacon and divine rosemary potatoes were amazing and the strawberry honey lemonade made my time away from home worthwhile.   By the way, I am still shaking my head at the separate check/separate payment method confrontation that occurred between my collague and your owner on the final day of our stay yet since I am choosing to leave it to it being a simple miscommunication, I am rating you on the entirety of the visit.  Thank you again for doing such a fantastic job!

To the man sporting the mun on 4/28/18 at noon seating people. Do you realize that your job is a people job? When I asked you how long the wait was you rudely answered, " there are 3 parties ahead of you." I gave you the opportunity to redeem yourself or to realize you hadn't answered my question. When your response was equally brusque and you again didn't have the courtesy to look at me you weren't only rude, but you minimized a customer, not once but twice. Had I not been with other people I'd have left. Maybe you don't need my business so screw you, too. I won't return.  Not to any of your locations. People like you forget that yelp is our voice. Keep forgetting.  BTW, the Cobb salad? Wasn't fresh.
I hit the MBB every time I'm at sky harbor airport and it's amazing!!! They can turn tables fast and the food is always consistent.

Horrendously slow!  It's an airport, if you're this slow, you're no good.  Worse yet, I'm just talking about the to go line!  To go, to them, gets no preference.    On top of that, they give the wrong food.  Given their before mentioned slowness, after receiving my food, I had to get on the plane, only to then discover, instead of oatmeal, they gave me an egg, bacon and cheese sandwich with potatoes.  While I'm sure it was tasty (maybe), it most certainly is not in my eating habit.  So, there I am on a 3 hour morning flight with the choice of either going hungry or eating some crap that's going to make me feel sluggish and bad all day.  I chose hunger.
It was a step up from a typical breakfast plate but still very good! The pancake was very good. I recommend if you aren't looking for lots of options since it has a very simple menu.

Breakfast is always good here, but tonight I tried the BLT with fries.  Lots of crisp, thick bacon on toasted bread.  Fries were also good, and the service excellent.  Spend the extra for the orange juice.

Great Breakfast place, well worth the wait!!  We were really happy with our meals.  I had the Egg, spinach and fontina scramble special (out of this world)  Coffee and water never went empty as they continually refilled...  Definitely a must go to when you are in Phoenix.

My husband had been buggin me to go.... always at least an hour wait, so I went with my sister who was visiting on vaca form LA.   only 25 minutes outside on a midweek morning about 930 ....  weather was good so that part was fine.... I had the special, which was a pork loin benedict, and she had the hog and chick (ham and eggs).  I ordered the wrong thing for sure.    the server recommended the hashbrowns, but my husband said home fries (of course via text, after I had ordered).   the hashbrowns were DROWNED in butter.   Not a bad thing but a heart attack waiting to happen, for real.   service was great, they churned and burned us and got us in and out.   But not sure what the hype is about.  its close, but not cheap as far as diners go, so in my mind I think i would have rather just eaten at home.   so 3 stars, for locally grown food, good service, and a little pricey.

My boyfriend and I used to go to the old Matt's location pretty often. We loved the food but we got sick of the wait times and stopped going. We decided to give the new spot a try and I'm so glad we did! We arrived around 9 on a Sunday, ready to wait. But although the restaurant was full our wait was not long at all! Less than 20 minutes maybe? Although it could be because we were willing to sit at the counter. Whatever, we were happy!  We settled in and opened our menus happy to see old familiar favorites. I ordered the waffle with bacon and my boyfriend got the pancakes. They were every bit as good as we remembered. Huge portions and full of flavor. The pancakes and waffle have almost a sweet flavor to them but they're not sugary. Just right. The bacon is my favorite thing though. Thick, peppery, bacon-y goodness. I'd say it's the best bacon in town.   I'm so happy to have rediscovered Matt's. It's sure to become a regular choice for us once again.

Matts feels like home. The tables remind me of snack time in Grandma's kitchen, the salt and pepper shakers remind me of the ones that sat on my neighbor's counter in her collections.... even the slightly wobbly leg of the chair reminds me of my college apartment furnished with family castaways and thrift shop treasures.   REAL food comes from a place that feels so much like home... by real, i mean... real eggs, real butter, real sausage....   Food at Matt's is pure and innocent... Pancakes with butter. Eggs with potatoes and bacon. Classic.   yum.

If you enjoy fruit flies swarming around your beverage, having your meal given to the table next to you (and eaten before they discovered the problem), slow service, then THIS is YOUR place!  Hopefully I Will not get sick from the flies in my beverage!!!   Guess I will need to wait for the next 48 to 72 hours to see if I get sick.   I expect this in a foreign country or open air restaurant but not at an airport!

Hi all! Went to Matt's last night for the PJ's and Eggs! Matt was great a bunch of the guys from Hickman farms were there having breakfast too! The special was steak and eggs, while I originally had my little heart set on a butter burger I had to try the Steak and eggs. I was not disappointed it was fantastic! Just as I suspected. I think I am becoming a Matt's groupie! lol. I can't help it between the cozy atmosphere, the friendly staff, fresh delicious menu choices and given that I am supporting a family business I am hooked! Now I will say last night we waited about an hour and there were 5 of us but all agreed it was so worth the wait. PS I had to get a butter burger to go I had it for lunch today YUM! Thanks Erenia and Matt!

The food was okay, the lemonade was AMAZING, the service was the worst I've ever had. I know it's a serious allegation to make, but I think the staff I encountered on the day I went there with my girlfriend were likely racist. I'm not saying they were for sure, but to me it was strange that the waitress wouldn't make eye contact with my girlfriend, much less even look in her direction. In fact, I had to order for her because she blatantly ignored her. I even tried flagging a different waitress down and was met with the same behavior. I'm the first to admit if I'm being a D-Bag or rude but all we did was sit down, place our order, and eat so I can't think of any other reason why we were treated this way. We eat out a lot and were from out of town so I think our table I side manners were fine. I don't want to say this incident is representative of the staff in the restaraunt as a whole but it was definitely an unpleasant experience and I will never go back when I go back to Phoenix and I will recommend people against it when they decide to go too given it's a fairly popular restaurant. Sourness aside, the food was decent; a little cold and the honey lemonade was to die for. I've tried making it at home to no success. To bad this place is mediocre and is staffed with mediocre quality people otherwise I'd go back every time I go down to Phoenix.

We went early, 8am on a Sunday for breakfast.  There was a 5 minute wait (although they don't quote wait times), and we sat at the bar counter.  The coffee was delicious, as was the daily lemonade.  We ordered an egg special with country sausage patties, homefries, and toast.  My husband is a huge sausage fan, and he thought it was very good.  The bacon was delish, and the pancakes were simply but fluffy and flavorful.  We will be back, but we will go early because by the time we left, there was a very lengthy wait.

Good service. Good pancakes and the home fries / rosemary potatoes are great.   Got us seated and food came out fast.   One warning: the children's options are HUGE. Share with kids and save the waste.

Food isn't bad for an airport restaurant. Service is HORRIBLE!  No teamwork, tons of servers, but no structure, people grouped up talking, I would say it's horribly managed..... waited 30 minutes for a BLT with chips. Never once checked on my drinks or came by to inform me of the hold up. Do yourself a favor and keep walking......
Great Food, cool spot, great coffee... What else do you need? The thick cut bacon was amazing!

I love places like this.  Had the hog and chick: eggs over easy, thick cut bacon (you always know a good spot if their bacon is legit), hash browns and homemade sourdough toast. Totally solid and cheap.

Dive side of town but a really dynamic local diner. Short hours and a small footprint make it a tough call, but it's worth the visit. We arrived early, 15 minutes after opening and there was already a 30+ min wait on a Saturday morning.    Good diner-quality breakfast with quick service, good hot cakes, eggs & potatoes. Cheap and a giant meal on a large plate. The place was full of locals; we were the only out-of-state license plate on the street.

I never ordered a scramble at a breakfast place before in my life. Matt's Big Breakfast changed that. I decided to order the Saturday special and it included a scramble of jalapenos, bacon and  cheese with a side of country potatoes. The tortilla that also came with it was like the icing on the cake. I enjoyed every part of the breakfast including the rosemary country potatoes. I couldn't have had a better scramble experience and I recommend coming to this place 10 times out of 10. Yes, the line may be long but it is well worth the wait.

The Hash browns are an amazing butter-delivery system. The bacon was thick and wonderful, and everything was spot-on delicious. It was worth the 40 minute wait, but I wish they would have more outdoor seating for when you're waiting.

I visited Phoenix this past weekend and Matt's Big Breakfast was our first stop upon arrival. Honestly, I wasn't expecting much from this place but I was pretty impressed! The menu is small and consists of your basic eggs/meat/potato dishes, scrambles, and waffles. I ordered the Hog & Chick - 2 eggs, potatoes, your choice of bacon/sausage, and bread. My favorite part of the dish was the house potatoes - crispy and infused with rosemary... so good! I also really liked the sourdough bread, although it is heavy as it's covered in butter. Prices are low. Service was great.   We got there around 1:30pm on a Saturday and there was no wait.

We just landed from kc, we were hungry and wet from the rain.  A 20 minute wait and a good table, my birthday got brighter.  The bacon was extra crispy and the orange juice had bits of real orange.  Service was quick and organized.  The place is small, but clean & bright.  If you are ever there when they have the three meat scramble with eggs, spicy peppers & cheese- get it!  My partner ordered this & I had food envy.

This place is absolute heaven when you are hungover.  The omelets are huge and fluffy, stuffed with deliciousness.  I love the thick cut bacon!  They definitely do not skimp on the good stuff!  I was talking about it with a guy at The Roosevelt later that night and he told me Matt drives out to Gilbert once a week for that bacon.  Definitely worth it!  The hash browns are even better.  Perfectly crispy without being burned.  Matt's will definitely fill you up at a very good price.  Loved seeing Matt at The Roosevelt that night!  He's awesome!

Stopped in Saturday morning, early enough to beat the crowds. (After 7.30ish, fuggetabouit....). Ordered Hog (sausage patties) and Chick, but really didn't want hashbrowns. No subs tough, so got a single pancake side. Sadly, I must say it was only an average breakfast. Eggs OM as requested, and sausage good, but almost too spicy, overpowering the pork. The hashbrowns are a waste though, like an afterthought to fill the plate. Almost burned, raw in the middle. Easy enough issue to fix though. Matt should bump up the quality control to keep the place hoppin'. No big worries though, I'll be comin' back!

When people say Matt's is small, they're right.  I think there are maybe 8 tables and some stools up at the bar and that's about it.   Also, don't expect to walk right in & grab a seat.  Popular spot + tiny place = waiting (we waited about 45 minutes for a table for 2).  Thankfully, it was a pretty nice day, though there isn't a whole heckuva lot to explore in the area.  Plusses:   -They serve RC cola!  Fun times.  I haven't had an RC since I was a kid. -Their waffle is really good.   Light, sweet, buttery deliciousness.   -Small place = intimate setting.  It's a good place for conversation, at least in a small group setting.  Minuses:  -The place, and my silverware, weren't especially clean.  Having a knife that's gunky doesn't make me want to eat. -The bacon was underdone.  I like chewy bacon, but mine was almost oinking.  I'll take a steak medium-rare, but please not the bacon. -The aforementioned RC cola gets served to you in can form.   All-in-all, the food was pretty good, but not a place I'd wait outside for 45 minutes for.    3.5 stars.

Came to town for some training and wanted to try this place out. Not just because it was on Triple D but it got great reviews on Yelp too. I had The Five Spot with a side of homefries. The food was excellent, has to be the best breakfast sammich ever. The homefries are really good too, but the sammich was the best. Definitely worth checking out. I went on a Monday around 1 pm and the place was pretty full, but no wait. Its good enough to wait for though.

My husband came to my work to have lunch with me the other day and being how all I hear about in this area is Matt's, I decided we would go try it. So we pulled up outside and found a parking spot, WOOHOO!! (there seemed to be limited spaces unless you want to meter it) I looked at the outside and was again scared of the size (I really do have claustrophobia) but decided I was going in! It was VERY small but we got a table in the "back room" which cracked me up because there is this really small step to get to it and all the workers' kept saying "watch your step", it was just really funny.   So, I had the cheese omelet and home potatoes with bacon. It was delicious! My husband had the salami and egg scramble with hash browns and LOVED it! This is our new favorite breakfast spot! The only bad thing was the restroom which has been mentioned in other reviews, it's next door at the motel which is not so desirable so go to the bathroom before you go to Matt's and everything should be fine. The service was excellent and I will definitely be back, oh and no wait! It must have been my lucky day!!

Not as good as it once was. The food is good and the service is nice and friendly but I think the food is not as good as it once was.  I use to love fighting the crowds to eat here.  I still like the place but I have had better in the past.
We had a great breakfast.  Fresh home style cooking.  Not frozen and reheat like what would be expected from an Airport eatery.  If you're hungry and looking for good food Matt's is the place.

I'd been waiting for the perfect time to experience Matt's.  This Wednesday morning I felt like that time had come.  I figured Wednesday at 11am shouldn't have much of a wait.  It didn't, and we were seated within 10-15 minutes.  The place is cute and the service is really great once you get seated (until then everyone looks kinda rushed and annoyed by you).    Our experience had it's high points: *Our extremely sweet server (love those glasses) *The ridiculously good coffee *and the novelty of eating in a shoe box.  I got the Hog and Chick with Bacon.  It was yummy, but...gasp....nothing to wait an hour and a half for like most people do on the weekends.  Yes the bacon was thick cut, and the preserves for the toast were lovely, but still, I actually had a hard time picking something off of the menu because nothing seemed to jump out at me as unique or unmissable.   One thing's for sure though, they do the classics well. For me, the above high points are enough to bring me back again, and hopefully next time the special will rock my socks off.    Matt and Ernie have a great group of concepts, thanks for bringing downtown up a notch.

This place is always so hard to get into on the weekends for good reason. Delicious, homemade breakfasts with prompt, friendly service. Couldn't ask for more! I ordered their Friday special, which happened to be chorizo, Jack, jalapeo, and a tortilla. Would drive all the way back downtown from Peoria for that again.

Stopped by near the end of their day as it was convenient and didn't know what to expect. The servers were excellent though they must have been getting geared to shut down. It was late enough we had no wait at all and our server encouraged us to take our time ordering and enjoying the meal. I wasn't super hungry, but I tried the special (three egg skillet with peppers and other goodness) and it was amazing. I will definitely be back next time I am downtown in the morning.

Matt's is pretty good breakfast. I am glad that when I went we had no wait whatsoever. Not sure how we pulled that off on a beautiful Sunday morning...happy though!  Definitely overrated. No question there. However there is a certain extreme eating quality to eating at a place smaller than my living room with other guests. I might go back if i spy the line is nonexistent, otherwise...there are other places down the block that are better and you can walk right in and eat!

Love this place! Come here every time I am in Phoenix. The food is incredibly fresh and everyone who works here is very friendly. Usually a wait, but completely worth it. My only complaint is that their daily specials aren't full time on the menu, especially the Eggs Benedict (which is only offered on Thursday's). Their hollandaise sauce is made from scratch and out of this world!

Big. Big might be a bit of an understatement when describing this place. The portions are HUGE. I ordered the 3 egg omelette with salami, which also came with hash browns and toast. The 3 eggs was more like 4. Half the plate was eggs/salami, the other half was hash browns. Then she brought the toast out, with a homemade jam. Then I had the nerve to order a side of bacon.  *sidenote* the bacon was 3 thick strips sprinkled in pepper. When I bit into that first piece, the amalgamation of pepper, maple and succulent pig meat did a slow sensual tango with my tongue. I immediately looked around to see if anyone else was having this same experience. Yes. I was not the only one. Bacon. Get it. *end sidenote* There was so much food I had to map out a quick strategy. Started with the bacon. (BACON. GET IT) then dove into the eggs which was very good. The hash browns were on point, and the jam was very good.   The only reason I didn't give me a 5 is because of the wait. This is a popular spot, so be prepared to wait about 45 min. The place isn't that big, so we waited out front for just about 45. The wait was def worth it.

We came here when I was 9 months pregnant, that was an excellent choice. The orange juice was great, and so was our food! The pancakes were amazing, I kept stealing them from my husband. Will definitely come back!
If you are looking for a tasty Bloody on your way out of town for vacation or a Egg White & Spinach omelet before heading off for a business trip, this place won't disappoint.

I was super excited about this place opening in tempe! but man am i disappointed. walked in the side entrance i guess because we were not greeted by anyone, no one even looked up, no acknowledgement. we found the host stand and some guy with spiked hair and slippers on asked our name and how many, still no hello or how are you, then didn't even tell us our wait time. pretty confusing on where to wait, i guess their large patio is not in use or something? but no explanation. we were seated in a timely manner. our server didn't really greet us just kinda asked what we wanted. didn't tell us about the specials, also dropped off our drinks with her fingers touching the top rim of the glass, which is a huge no and i'm pretty sure you learn that the first day of server training at any restaurant. food came out quickly and was very good, we had the pancakes. the only reason i'm giving any stars is for the manager? with the slicked back grey hair, thanks for helping  us out and at least saying bye to us! service energy was very low, but his was not. we had to pass 8 or 9 breakfast spots around mill to get to matts big breakfast, we went out of our way to go here when we could've stopped at any of them we passed. service is almost nonexistent.
Awesome food, i ordered Chop and chic.  Lovely food and ambiance, would stop by here again. I have been to pheonix airport so many times but did not happen to be here.  Will recommend for sure.

I had such high hopes for Matt's Big Breakfast, but I left unimpressed and really disappointed.  Why only 3 stars? Service, food options and coffee.   Service My sister and I visited at 9am to avoid long waits, and it was perfect the entire restaurant was pretty much empty. With that being said, I expected decent service but nope. Our waitress, Michelle, wasn't very kind and didn't welcome us when she first arrived to our table. She also never once checked on us during our meal. And instead of saying thank you when she dropped off the check, she just put it on our table and walked away. I wish I could've given the tip to the manager, I think his name was David, instead of her. He checked on us AND picked up the dirty dishes.   Coffee Oh my god, the coffee was just terrible. Very bitter, I couldn't even finish half the cup.   Food options Everything has Pig products and you can't substitute anything for those products. We had to say no bacon and pay full price for another side (hash browns). Instead of just switching them out like they do at every other restaurant.   So.. why did I even give them 3 stars instead of 2 or 1? The manager did a great job checking on us, the whole place was spotless, the food was good (especially the strawberry jam) and I feel like being nice.  Would I recommend Matt's Big Breakfast? No way! And I will NOT be returning.

Seriously good stuff here.  Yes, the lines are long but that's not really their fault.  The food is great and people want to come here.  The waffle here is simply the best.  I've never had better, anywhere.  I've also had the burger, which was really, really, really good.  Next time I'll see if they can put a different cheese on it because I'm not a big fan of American cheese.  Regardless, everything here was delicious, regardless of the line.  If you're willing to wait, or maybe come at an off-hour, it's definitely worth the wait.

Its been a while since the hubs and I had been to Matt's.   We woke up on New Years Eve and I knew Matt's had to be our last breakfast of the year.   We got there at about 930 and were 5th in line! Wooooot!   The hubs and I grabbed a spot on one of the benches and had fun watching all the newbs come up. They always walk right past all the people standing outside waiting, past the sign in page and march inside like they own the place. soooo funny.   The food and service is still as great as its ever been! The waffle was sent from heaven and so was the bacon!   Even though our visits have become few and far between due to moving further away, Ernie still knows who we are and keeps teasing us and asking when we are going to have kids, she is like a distant aunt! Love her!   Keep it up Matts!

Matt's Big Breakfast has been a favorite, must go to spot for my wife and me every time we come to AZ. We sort of miss the original small building as it was so cozy, but the new building provides the same excellent food and great service. Thanks for the continued wonderful experience Ernie!

The aptly named Big Breakfast isn't the only thing they should be famous for. The food is not only generous, its fresh. The potatoes are home made (nothing processed here) and the bread appears as if its never seen a bag in its life.   They kept the coffee coming!   We didn't wait at ALL on Tuesday at 7AM so if you work downtown, do yourself a favor and hit Matt's before work one day..you'll beat the traffic, the Saturday lines and be so full, you probably won't need much of a lunch.   In short: fresh food, tall coffee, tasty treat. Well worth it. Even with a wait.

No wait to sit at the counter what a mistake. Worst service I ever had. No set no acknowledging I was there ask for coffee twice.  No silverware.  Never got a refill.  Order came out cold  Just a horrible service experience. And the restaurant was only two thirds full.  If you need to be ignored and eat overpriced even by airport standards cold food. Served by staff that should not be dealing with the public then eat here.

The food is awful!! Very few choices. I ordered the cheesy omelet with mushrooms and saugage. Which I had to pay 2 extra dollars for. Barely any mushrooms or saugage just all cheese. Don't get me wrong love cheese but it was gross. The hash browns were disgusting and were actually the color grey. The only good thing was the side of toast which is the only thing I could eat.

Breakfast was good. Staff was great. Wait was long, if your really hungry bring a snack.. we ran errands while waiting. I would go again with people who haven't been, but mostly for the novelty of experiencing breakfast that you have to wait an hour for..

In a word...Magical.  The best breakfast you'll ever have.  Homemade breads, sausage (cherry & bourbon was the special one day)...   Ate breakfast everyday of our trip.  Had heard about it from DDD and after all these years business sent us out there.  You know when you work up a place in your head to be great....this place exceeded expectations.  Great staff, friendly, amazing food.   ENJOY!  -  Mal from NJ
Horrible service at the bar. Understaffed. Decent beer list but overpriced garbage for wine. If you have time, go to Blanco Taco in the A gate area. This place is a joke.

What more can be said. Amazing food. Right next to the Farmer's Market on Saturday's. Friendly staff especially the ownwer's wife who noticed that we were new on our first visit and went out of her way to welcome us. The pancakes? Wow! 'Nough said....

Off the chain as my dad said haha.   My dad was in town so we stumbled across this little joint and we were surprised. There was a little wait but the host informed us that it was a short wait compared to the traffic they usually get on Sunday's. We were seated quickly at the bar which we didn't have an sue with. It's on the louder side, but I don't mind at all.   They have their daily special and Sunday happened to be steak and eggs which sold out a few minutes after we go there, and I ordered the waffles. Everything was so yummy! Truly like a southern breakfast. The waffles were so soft and fluffy, and the eggs were also cooked just the way I like. The ingredients they use seem to be pretty good for you too (real butter olive oil cage free eggs if you're into that kind of stuff)   The staff were so nice too even though it was packed. I'll be returning :)

We've been to Matt's several times, but it's actually been a couple of years. Last time was actually pre-Yelp for me.  Anyhow, Matt's has not skipped a beat since our last visit. Once you get seated (there is usually a wait) the service is fast and efficient. When I say fast, I mean we ordered and the food was on the table in less than 5 minutes. I had the Skinny, an egg white scramble with chicken sausage. Damn tasty. Wifey had the stock Bacon and Eggs. Matts bacon is the reason we come here. Excellent. Noisy, busy and crowded...but highly recommend.

Awesome food in a fun setting.  Small place - only about 10 tables plus 4 seats at bar but worth a wait! Go during non peak times and you won't have to wait as long.  The fresh juice was good but in a TINY glass.   It is a fun place but not sure I would wait over an hour for it!

This place is insanely overrated. Walking in, the place was dirty, and people were running everywhere yet we couldn't get a seat until a waiter yelled at us from across the room to grab a seat in the corner right next to the bathrooms where people kept coming in and out. Being next to the bathroom probably ruined the experience because of the smell. Why even have tables there??   I ordered the skinny with potatoes. It was nothing special whatsoever. The eggs were super greasy and had my stomach churning. The potatoes were also way overcooked, and the rosemary tasted like ornamental, not cooking rosemary.   For the price there is no way I'll be back, but Matt's get's 2 stars and not one because my friend liked his waffle

The food was decent but not exceptional. The pancakes were way to sweet. My husband got the Chop and Chick and couldn't even cut into it because it was hard. The service was terrible. On the menu it's stated that you get bottomless coffee, that may be true if someone actually came to refill our coffee cups. I will give them one credit - the portions are large but that's expected for their prices. This was my second time there to give it another shot and will not be returning.
Great food. Attentive servers. Coffee and water refills without asking. The best thick cut bacon! Soooo good. Will be back again and again.

What an amazing breakfast experience. Different but all so good. I LOVE that they use all organic products for their food. The toast and strawberry jam was mouth watering. Bacon was so good. We had the daily special and it was so good. We will be back if we ever come back to AZ. I highly recommend this place for breakfast.
Hidden gem downtown Phoenix.  Service was fast & friendly, and the pancakes fluffy & perfect for soaking up butter and syrup.  And it's a great deal to boot.  Love this place.
Matt's is DELICIOUS. Yes there is a wait but it's so worth it. Best waffle I've ever had!

Not seeing why this place is so popular. Crowded. Atmosphere is like eating in a train station. Food was either very bland (the eggs) or spiced up so much (the pork chops) I didn't recognize it. I wouldn't eat here again even if they lowered the prices.

For breakfast purists!  Simple food, simply delicious.  The service is never amazing, but the food always is.  Worth the wait in line if there is one.  I especially love the fresh squeezed orange juice and homemade jam.

Yes, I'm giving five stars to an airport restaurant. Here's why. My husband and I stumbled into Matt's after being stuck overnight in Phoenix, having missed a connection on our way home to CA. Without makeup, in day 2 clothes, and jet-lagged out of my mind, I just wanted to use our meal vouchers on something. Anything.  What we got was just wonderful. Fresh, delicious comfort food. I got a hearty breakfast sandwich with egg and bacon that came with a side of rosemary potatoes. My husband had a giant crispy waffle. My Bloody Mary came garnished with peppers, pickles, cheese cubes, celery, and a slice of bacon.  But what really pushed this review to 5 stars was our server, Michael. He greeted us with sincere warmth and good humor, and kept us laughing and smiling through our meal. Believe me, that was no easy feat based on my mood! He made great suggestions for food and drink, letting me sample the Bloody Mary mix from the drink I selected before ordering (I went with a different one based on his recommendation and I'm glad I did). And when our meal vouchers exceeded the tab, he used the extra to provide us with bottled water for our flight. Not sure when I'll be back in PHX, but I'll eat at Matt's for sure, and will hope for Michael as my server.

This place is my favorite breakfast restaurant of all time. If you like hash browns, this is your place. It's at a great location and I'm normally not a person that eats in the morning but whenever we go here, I eat.

I don't even know what the hell I had because it was soooo dang good that I ate it all and went into a food-itis coma instantly.  Nah just kidding about the memory but totally serious about the food coma.  We checked this place out on an off day and it was still pretty populated.  Breakfast anytime CAN NOT BEAT THAT!!!  My bro and I got the the same platter which was the special of the day.  Linguisa with sourdough toast, hash browns, home fries, eggs, homemade preserves!!!  Everything was SPECTACULAR!  Like seriously!!!  It was a very homey and neighborhood feel to the restaurant with super excellent service.  Ninja water and coffee refills, great timing and check ups!  I think that it was part of our server as well but she was magnificent as well.  The overall experience was really enjoyable and I'll definately be back!

This place is the only reason I get up at a decent time on the weekends. My boyfriend and I love it! We were going to the downtown location a lot and now we go to Biltmore because it's closer, but downtown always has good service and great food! Love this place so much!

So in love with this place! My boyfriend and I come here all the time, first going to the downtown location a lot and now that Biltmore is open, closer to us, it's our new regular spot. Service at both of these locations has been great, and so has the food!

Matt's Big Breakfast is soooo delish! The first time I ever game was after graduation at ASU and it was still in the old location that was tiny! It definitely lived up to everything I'd heard about it. It tastes like good home cooking and everything on the menu is yummy. I also like that them menu isn't huge. My dad and stepmom always want to come here when they are in town visiting and I definitely have no problem with that! I think I would go a lot more if I lived closer to downtown..this is more of a destination breakfast for us (but worth it). The hash browns that come on the side are sooooooo decadent and amazing. Probably the best hash browns I've ever had. There is always a wait but it goes by fairly quickly and there are a couple benches at the newer location so you can sit and wait. Five spot and hog & chick are notable faves. You won't be disappointed!
Over priced breakfast all hype sorry just my opinion I was really let down since friend always talked about it ..you will pay 10$ for breakfast ..eggs and hash browns

Since moving across the country, I have yet to find a place that even remotely compares to Matt's.  Reasonable prices and delicious specials - the wait is totally worth it.  They could tell me I'd be outside for 3 hours (okay, it's never THAT long) and I'd probably have done it.  The best trick is to put your name on the list and check on the market on Saturday and then come back.  Food is delicious and the orange juice is amazing.  Minimum wait time is usually 15-30 minutes on a good day... but if you want to make your day good, you'll go despite the wait!
Great food. Great coffee. Great service. Cute waitresses. Long waits but worth it. I recommend the daily specials but Waffle and Bacon is my favorite.

It was crowded but I didn't have to wait since I was a solo diner -- sat right at the counter.  Their bacon is the thing to get. But I really really liked the hashbrown. Typical breakfast platters. I got the hog and chick: 2 eggs, potatoes, bacon, toast!    Get their hashbrowns. They are what dreams are made of.

Amazing place. Very charming and the servers are very nice. It was a long wait but it's only expected... busy means good food. I have their sirloin steak special. It was delicious. They make their own jam and you can taste the love cause it was to die for. They make their own bread and thick cut and you can tell it's healthy. I'm glad we took the time to look where to eat in this area.

I have been here many times. Thought I had reviewed it back in 2010 but guess not. I try to bring all my out of town visitors here. The trick is missing the lines. Best way is to get there 20 mins before the doors open. Their toast alone is worth coming for. Everything you order is cooked to perfection. The homefries are yummy. My friend got pancakes and wanted to get more to bring home. They were that good. Just crowded.

I was very disappointed. After seeing this restaurant on Triple D  I was expecting much more than we got. The service was poor, we had to walk over to the counter to ask for drink refills, they didn't  come around asking if we needed anything, and they charged us for 4 drinks instead of 2. The waffles were good but, snall, the real maple syrup was tasty, bacon was good, the potatoes were good. But, the prices were steep for what you got. Won't be going back. Going back to The Place restaurant on 51st ave and bell.

Saw this place on diners, drive ins, and dives so when we planned our vacation to AZ we included this place. Amazing!   When we first saw the menus we were a little worried as it was a bit limited. Once we got our food we knew why. Absolutely delicious!! Most definitely recommend eating here!!

I got the Salami and Egg Scramble with a hashbrown and unlimited coffee! This place felt very homey, which is how the food tasted as well. You get what you asked for, there's no surprises, no secret honey sauce in the eggs or anything. BUT IT WORKS! I loved the eggs and potatoes!

This place is delicious and I'm not even a huge breakfast person. This was the first time we have been to their new location and its a lot bigger but still quaint. And it made our wait 35 minutes verse the 2 hours it would take before which is awesome! The waitress was attentive and got everything out fast which was nice since we had our wild child with us. Restaurant is super loud so it wasn't a big deal when my daughter got hyper. I got the blt this time and it was great the bacons is thick and crispy. I don't like tomatoes so I should have added avacado or cheese for a little more flavor but still one of the best I've ever had. Lots of homeless people around this area which is fine its phx its to be expected but for some reason they really bother you when you are waiting.
I've been coming here since I was really little, and honestly since they have moved building the quality in both food and customer service has gone down significantly.
If you have FOOD ALLERGIES you may want to rethink coming here. They DO NOT allow you to substitute and will NOT accomidate you at all. I was dismissed, and treated rudely.

I really wanted to love this place after it was on tv and considering how much locals rave about but after 3 trips I think its just underwhelming.  Don't get me wrong its better than a chain breakfast place but its not amazing.  I liked their gravy and their preserves.....
Incredible breakfast.  Great service.  Only the best ingredients are being used here.  Very fresh and cooked to perfection.  Prices very reasonable.

Surprisingly the line moves quickly.  I was expecting an hour wait when I saw the line but we were seated within 15-20 minutes.    The menu is very limited and somewhat disappointing.  The daily specials are nice additions but they were unwilling to substitute anything so that was a let down.  I just wanted a different cheese in the scramble and they refused to do so.    The food was good but between the parking and lack of selection I'll probably go elsewhere in the future.

I honestly believe the food and setup here is better than the original restaurant downtown.  I had the breakfast sandwich on toast instead of the roll (highly recommend).  If you have an hour plus until your flight and want some breakfast, look no further.
A solid breakfast, but a long wait. Overall it's overrated. At the end of the day they have eggs and bacon and there's nothing much special about that.

So glad we stopped here while on vacation! Biscuits and gravy were amazing! A little spicy for my daughter but perfect for me! Rosemary potatoes....can I have the recipe please! The bacon was phenomenal! And the strawberry lemonade was the most refreshing drink I've ever had! My oldest had the sandwich hich she was really really good. The staff was quick and very polite! They had a huge line outside but they got people in and out quick without making you feel rushed!

This place rocks!  A buddy and I stayed at the Sheraton. We wanted to eat a quick, good, filling breakfast before catching a flight. The walk from the Sheraton to MBB was easy and quick.  This is definitely not a chain. We got there about 7:15am and we were able to sit down right away.   Our waitress was terrific. We told her we weren't trying to sweat her, but we had to catch a flight so she took care of us. Service was prompt and friendly. I wish i remembered her name.  Wasn't sure what to order. Asked her. She said waffles. Definitely the waffles. I RARELY order or eat waffles. I don't know why. I just don't. They were awesome and hit the spot! The bacon was thick cut, crisp, and flavorful.   Coffee was good.  We left around 7:45am. The line was out the door.   I strongly recommend MBB if you are staying downtown. It will be well worth it!

No matter how many times ive returned here over the years when im back in town, this is still my number one go to for breakfast in Phoenix! Everything is as fresh as fresh can be! Their honey lemonades have been my favorite beverage to go with their delicious and hearty breakfasts. Food here is next level flavor, dont believe me? Come in and see for yourself! Ask for home fries, not the hash browns!!!
Definitely worth the wait. I love this place! What a neat spot. The waiters were friendly the food was great and the atmosphere was wonderful! We will definitely be coming back!

Drive all the way from Buckeye to Matt's at least once every other week. It's so worth the drive...and the wait Beware...you will have at least a 15 min. wait. But it is soooo worth it! Best Waffles I have EVER had. Bacon is as it should be, thick, crispy and MEATY! I haven't even started on the homefries...YUM! They use all fresh ingredients bought locally, even the coffe is bought from a local place, Cave Creek Coffee. They have me hooked...  Do yourself a favor, come down here, order ANYTHING and enjoy! You will NOT be disappointed.
Spot was dope!  Nice view!  Staff is super duper friendly! Menu could use a little more variety, more non pork items!  Food was good and larger portions!
A little pricey but very well worth it. Everything even the ketchup and sauces are from scratch. Great sized portions. Absolutely delicious.

The Good:  I like the vibe of this place, a pleasant neighborhood type greasy spoon, but not dingy and grease-spattered.  Attentive wait staff.  Good opportunities for people watching.  I had the Hog and Chick.  Excellent hash browns...riced potatoes with a nice greasy bottom with pan drippings and pepper clinging to them.  Just the way I like them!   The strawberry jam with the toast was superb.  And the coffee hot and tasty...no need for cream.  The bacon was curiously unflavorful.  Next time I'd get sausage.  Not sure what went wrong with it...not enough salt/smoke in the curing?  It was cooked okay, just not a lot of flavor to it.  (Of course, I still finished it...even mediocre bacon is still bacon!)  $12 for a breakfast seemed a bit on the high side, but not super exorbitant.  Had the bacon been good I would not mention the cost.  Still a fan though.  3.5 stars would be a better rating.

A-OK is right and the hype is not always worth the wait. I will keep it simple since there are probably 500 reviews on the place.  Pros:  Great Hashbrowns, and made from scratch food  Good specials to keep things mixed up  Great company and service  Cons:  Guy up front says a little over 35 minutes but really means an hour and 45 minutes  Pricey for some dishes  Interesting people around while you wait to get inside (street walkers, etc.)  the fresh squeezed orange juice is enough liquid to maybe fill up a double shot glass  Overall I would love to give this place more stars if I could get in there without wanting to eat a finger due to starvation, and leave a bit more satisfied. Anyone who has eaten at Bryan's in San Diego would know what I mean.
best breakfeast downtown ... bar none ... it's far more "healthy" than I traditionally prefer but the place is beatiful, very cool and has an ADORABLE waitress ;) !!!!

Service was efficient and friendly. The omelette and hash browns  were amazing. We were disappointed with the pancakes. they were so dry and crumbly. Extra syrup didn't help much. Coffee was really good but no half and half milk only

Fact: Matt's Big Breakfast has pretty much ruined breakfast for me for all of eternity. Since first trying it a few years back, I've found that it's done so exceptionally well that I'm constantly making comparisons between Matt's and every other breakfast place in Phoenix. And my conclusion remains consistent:  Absolutely no one compares.  Thriving off of simplicity in a similar manner to Pizzeria Bianco, Matt's doesn't need 500 different types of pancakes, all with varying amounts of rubbish dumped all over them. Blasting thumpy music, making up stupid names for omlettes, or serving up liquor in the AM as a means to be "edgy" are all silly gimmicks that are absolutely unnecessary when your food tastes like this. The fact is, when your food is good, you don't need tricks and tactics in order to compensate. Keep the choices minimal, the dishes fairly traditional, and the quality high and you have an automatic formula for success. Don't believe me? Look at the lines on the weekend.  Practically all foods you find here are either homemade or outsourced locally. I'm told there's no freezer and technically, if food is fresh, isn't that the way it should be? I typically order the Hog & Chick, scrambling up my eggs with one or two of their cheeses. The bacon, which comes from the Pork Shop in Queen Creek, is thick, juicy, peppered, and absolutely fabulous. There is no bacon I've found that even comes close. Add in some hash browns (extra crispy) that have butter cooked directly into them, some toast that's complimented by homemade jam that's personally made by Matt's wife, and you're pretty much covered for a great morning meal. The jam can also be purchased separately by the jar for home use. Even their orange juice and honey lemonades impress!  The Five Spot, which is a sandwich that combines some of the ingredients I just mentioned, is also worth trying. Although I prefer being able to appreciate these foods individually rather than combining them all. Their griddlecakes and waffle are excellent, being served with syrup that's actually hot (other places should take note of this). Although I don't regularly order either, as they come at the expense of missing out on the smaller side dishes (unless your stomach has the extra space).  Service is good, food is great, and parking is a pain (an unwritten legal requirement for all good restaurants near downtown). I've been told they have a great lunch, but with breakfast this good, I don't think I have I'll ever have the willpower to order anything lunch-related.  French toast, which is strangely absent from the permanent menu, is actually a special on Wednesdays and also worth checking out.   Highly recommended!

Imagine the original Matt's Big Breakfast, only in a slightly smaller setting. The menu is the same, the food is the same, and the service is the same. The only difference?  Now, you actually have a place to park your damned car!  We've been waiting on this Matt's location to open for quite some time to the point where they were so far past their originally projected launch date that I had almost forgotten about it. And then, just on a whim, browsing through Yelp, I noticed that it had quietly opened its doors back in January.    Honestly, there isn't really anything I can say about Matt's that I didn't say in my review of the original location. The breakfast served here is what I consider to be the gold standard. It's traditional breakfast food that thrives on simplicity, without the need to be annoyingly trendy with stupid gimmicks like 500 different types of omelets or offering up liquor at 7am in the morning. Keep it simple, keep it good, and ultimately, you don't need all that other crap to keep customers coming back for more. Now, if you're used to only going to breakfast places that offer a Bible-sized menu of dishes to select from, this might not be the place for you.  In my opinion, you really can't go wrong with anything, including the thick cuts of peppered bacon, butter-infused hash browns, homemade jam, and various honey lemonades and orange juice. The quality of the food at this location is consistent with what we've come to expect.  If you come during busy weekend hours, don't expect the addition of an extra location to have an impact on wait times. It's just one of those things that we've all learned to tolerate. Good food can't always be kept secret, unfortunately.  In some ways, I do see this location as kind of an odd choice. It's not really very far from the other Matt's, so it's not like anyone is pocketing all this extra gas money by going here instead of downtown. But in the end, who really cares? Matt's could open up a location at the bottom of a tar pit and I'd still give them five stars for the food alone.  It's simply the best!

Everyone loves Matts. I don't need to review it...   I do want to fill you in on the new location they just moved to in 2013, a block north of the old. It is larger, thank Gawd! but not much, thank Gawd again. That was part of the charm. Go on a weekday, when you have the day off and it wont be crowded. Being a sucker and going on Saturday at 9:45am is surely going to cause you to wait in line. Thats rookie business.   But the new location, is still small enough to keep its charm and unique, downtown, local vibe but large enough to not have to pull tables together for a 4 top!   Their food, menu, daily specials, and coffee all still consistent and amazing as always.

Decent food for an airport.  Everything was fresh and all American.  Was disappointed in the foul language coming from one of the servers who wasn't quite sure what he wanted to be yet??  Food was great. Language and his obnoxious demeanor were strange.

Read the reviews and I was excited.  Good service.  Clean establishment.  Seated quickly.  We had a waffle and the egg/sausage/hash brown combo.  Both came out fast and were very good.  The fresh OJ was ok...not as amazing as I had hoped.  Overall I liked it and I will return.  The omelette with everything is the best in Phoenix.  Truth.

I found this place by accident I had family visiting from out of town who wanted to find a local breakfast joint so we just ventured off and luckily we did. I just relocated from Denver and live in downtown only a few minutes from Matt's Big Breakfast. They seem to always have a wait even during week but to me it's well worth it.

My fianc and I stopped into here because there wasn't much to choose from at the Phoenix airport. We arrived around 7:30-8am and it was packed. We were seated fairly quickly though.   We were originally seated at the one of the tall tables and after sitting on a plane for over 5 hours, those chairs are so uncomfortable. A booth became available and we asked to be seated there and they let us. So I was thankful for that.   The food was pretty good. Just your regular breakfast options. We ordered Matt's big breakfast with an extra egg and toast to split. It comes with sausage, bacon, two eggs, home fries and a pancake. I enjoyed everything except the sausage, but my fianc liked it all. Home fries were flavored very well. Eggs were cooked perfectly. I also ordered a side of Mac Salad, which isn't normally available until 11:30, but they had it ready so they let me.  For the amount of people that were there and only 3 guys cooking, the food and time that it came out in was impressive. Our server was very friendly and she was very accommodating. We had a good experience here.

Matt's is a solid breakfast spot. It's an upgrade on a typical breakfast diner except high quality food and coffee and done from scratch. Try to get there before 9am because a line will start forming! I love that they use whole and natural ingredients and even make their own berry preserves and ketchup. The service is also fast and staff are great and friendly. The main reason I don't absolutely loooove Matt's is because the food never "wows" me. It's meat, potatoes, and eggs. (Although the homefries are awesome with little bits of fresh rosemary and herbs) They have rotating specialty items every day of the week and I would love to try their eggs benedict or biscuits and gravy but I work full time and will never make it on a Monday or Tuesday.

I attended a 3-day conference in Phoenix in June, and ate breakfast at Matt's twice. Both times I ordered the standard eggs, potatoes, bacon and toast, and it was absolutely perfect. To a "T". Eggs were cooked exactly to order, the bacon was among the best I've ever eaten (maybe THE best), and the rosemary potatoes simply delicious. What impressed me the most was that everything was precisely, perfectly the same on the 2nd visit. I can't go halfway across the country just to go to Matt's, but thinking about it sure makes me want to plan a trip to Phoenix!

I heard good things about the main Matt's Big Breakfast chain, but this one was very mediocre. Maybe it's because airport food is never as high quality as outside food, I'm not entirely sure.   We had the Sonrisa Burrito, which was decent. I liked the thin tortilla that they used and the salsa was a nice addition, but the burrito was very oily and dripped a ton as we ate it. Their potatoes were also undercooked and had a weird texture to them...   I'm usually a huge fan of breakfast burritos, but I wish I had skipped Matt's Big Breakfast and tried Sweet Republic next door at the terminal (even if it was 10 in the morning!).

Amazing! Such a fun little restaurant. It adds character to downtown Phoenix and the food is great! I got the hot cakes, which were huge and tasted so free, with real butter and real maple syrup. The service was friendly and the atmosphere made me feel like I was back in time at a cute little dinner but with a modern twist. My friend had the special, which was eggs benedict and hashbrowns. Also amazing and you can tell all the ingredients are farm fresh. I'm salvating just thinking about it! The wait wasn't too bad for us. We got their right around 9am and waited for 20 minutes, ate in 40 minutes. However there was quite the line of people after us. I don't suggest going in a large group and only go if you have time for a relaxing morning, long wait but they feed you quickly- but not rushed!

The orange juice tasted kind of off but everything else was delicious. My favorite might have been their homemade jam with the thick cut toast. I ordered scrambled eggs and potatoes as well, and the potatoes are full of flavor. I definitely left full and would come back again.

It's simple food served quickly in a trendy area. High prices but the quality was there to back it up. Nothing blew me away to warrant this place's high ratings, but it may be because I don't eat eggs--I had the Waffle, hash-browns and sausage.

Was a tad tricky for us out-of-towners to find. Just look for the white and orange sign that will lead you to the free covered parking lot. Breakfast is as good as I remember from the original location. The most tastiest pancakes ever. The only reason I did not give the 5th star is they do not allow outside beverages to be brought in. I sadly sucked my iced coffee down in a hurry.

The food was great, and very reasonable. The food is simple breakfast food, nothing too fancy. There is a lunch menu, but breakfast is the star of the show.  The hostess was very rude, which is why I only gave 3 stars. When we arrived and put our name in, we asked if we could have a glass of ice water, as it was rather warm out. She said we could pay for a glass, but would not give us water until we we were seated. This is ridiculous and her curt tone added insult to injury.

There is always a wait unless you get here really early, but it is worth it if you know what you are getting in to. There are always so many tourists here, but it is understandable cause the food is great. It was recently my fourth time at Matt's Big Breakfast and I finally got my own plate of waffles instead of eating them off my boyfriend's plate. Best waffles ever and I don't usually go for the sweet breakfast foods.   If you like reubens and it is lunch time here then GET THE REUBEN!! It is so good! The bread that it is on really makes the whole sandwich.   Everyone in Phoenix should try Matt's Big Breakfast at least once.

Great place - but get here early if you want to get your day going!  This place fills up fast and stays full!     Small place but personal service.   Coffee and creamer is excellent - not sure of their secret ;)  I've had the pork chop plate (don't recall the name), waffle, and the Schreiner's local sausage and egg scramble.   No, I didn't have all this at one time, this was over the course of several trips LOL.   Everything was excellent with the exception of the Schreiner's deal - I didn't realize it had rye seed in the sausage and I'm totally anti-rye.     Other than that everything I've tried, the experience, and service was great.  Clean.  3.5 stars easily earned, I'd give 3.9 actually...

My sister, a family friend, and I visited Matt's Big Breakfast this afternoon at lunchtime and had a great meal. She opted for a simple eggs and sausage breakfast plate, he had the daily special (a scramble with chicken sausage, potatoes and cheese) and I had the salami scramble. My sister enjoyed her food and she even ate some of the sourdough toast which is a huge deal because she rarely eats bread. It's THAT good! My meal was delicious: the hash browns were crunchy, there was a hefty amount of salami in the scramble, and I, too, enjoyed the toast and House-made strawberry jam that accompanies it.   However, I took away a star because the service wasn't great. Having worked in the food service industry in the past, I know how hard it can be during a lunch rush, and I tried to be understanding. But the seating area at Matt's isn't large and I watched our server stand and do nothing many times while our drinks were only refilled once the entire time we were seated and eating.

Love this place!!!  I was able to get seated immediately.  Service was excellent.  The food was awesome.  Definitely recommend the waffle.  This location was great but unfortunately cannot say the same about the airport location.  Service was extremely slow for being in the airport.  Would definitely recommend the downtown location though.  I will be back next time in Phoenix.

Outstanding breakfast joint also has lunch menu.  Prices fair, portions good, food taste amazing,wonderful customer service. Very clean establishment, alot buisness attired customers. I luv it!! Food presentation is outstanding. Well done, id come back for sure!!

I just... what? What's all the fuss about? This is literally one of the worst breakfast spots I've ever been to. Bland eggs, bland hash browns, bland potatoes, bland toast. At least the blueberry jam was nice. Everything I paid $12+ for here, I could have made at home, for better quality. No biscuits and gravy??? I... what??? If you're going to have such an extremely limited menu, you better do it right, and matts isn't doing it right.  The waffle was pretty good however.   Way too many good breakfast spots to ever come back here.

Had a late breakfast at Matt's today and loved everything about the experience. The space is super cool, the service is excellent, and they have the BEST waffles. I left with a very happy belly. I'll definitely be back soon!!

Look. Matt's is good. But is it great? No. It's just good breakfast. Sure, it's a lot better than Denny's or IHOP, but there's a lot of great breakfast places in Phoenix that I'd rather go to, not really wait in line and get the same quality food.

stopped by here on the way back home to eat something for breakfast while driving so I ordered The Five Spot w/o grilled onions.. it was really good and would order it again, I ate half of it and was saving the rest for later and my wife threw the bag away damnit! also got the honey lemonade and really enjoyed that also

Ive always been afraid to come here because of the wait. I finally said screw it since we didn't have any plans so we might as well wait.  I ordered the pancakes with a side of bacon and my wife and daughter shared some eggs with hashbrowns and my picky grandma got a cheese omelette.   The pancakes are great but just like any other breakfast place you never get enough butter and syrup.
