The bacon was the BEST ever and everybody really liked the hasbrowns. you could go eat just the bacon and be happy and leave oh and they strawberry lemonade was really good also. would love to come back.

Does anyone actually wait more than once for this?  We waited 1 hour; thankfully, it was a beautiful morning.  Once inside we had trouble sitting on the bar stools, they are so small and slippery.(We aren't large people)   I stood up to eat my breakfast.  My husband enjoyed his Iowa pork chop, but my ham and cheese omelet was generic.

I heard lots of good stuff regarding this place so I decided to check it out and here's what I concluded  1. Space: first of all this place is really, really, really tiny so sitting situations are way too close for comfort.  I recommend small party with 4 people max.  2. Menu: just because its listed does not mean its available.  3. Quality: not so great, my hash browns were burnt (more like hash blacks) and the rest of the food too greasy. I myself is not a big fan of Fat.  4. Beverage: uh, I rather go to Circle K and get a cup.  5: Service: ok, but for such a limited customers how can service go wrong?    All in all I was not impress with this place.  I even went back for lunch thinking maybe it was only during breakfast that this place lacked the hype that everybody was talking about, but once again I very disappointed.    BTW i like my Burger with Butter and not Butter with Burger.

Loved it. Had the Skinny which was the perfect light breakfast before heading out to hike Camelback. Andrea and the rest of the staff were great and backed each other up like a well oiled machine. The coffee was robust and never emptied or cooled too far. Orange juice was fresh and complimented the egg whites and spinach of the Skinny just right. Good playlist in the background as well. Couldn't have asked for a better breakfast that Memorial Day morning.

FLY THRU BREAKFAST  I was flying through the PHX airport & had a 3 hour layover. I searched Yelp & found many 4 star restaurants. How could this be? It's an airport! Airports never have good food, so I decided to spend some time walking around checking them out before making my choice. I finally decided to eat at Matt's because it seemed like the all American Breakfast.   The place was packed at 8:30 in the morning. I wanted to sit at the bar but took the first available seat at a community table. I then noticed there were power outlets scattered through the space but not every seat had access to power. I then asked the hostess if she could find me a spot where I could eat and juice up my phone. She spotted an opening at the bar & told me to grab it. When I arrived I had to squeeze between two guys. My new neighbors were excited to learn about the outlets & they quickly plugged in their devices. So be aware power is available here you're just going to need to find it before you sit down.   I looked through the menu & I wanted to eat everything. I finally decided to go with Matt's Big Breakfast. It had a little bit of everything. I must also point out that the food is made fresh from scratch with the finest local ingredients around. I love that & I could taste that love in the food.   My dish came with 3 fresh cage free eggs which I ordered sunny side up. These eggs were no yolk. The eggs tasted amazing & reminded me of Phil's Organic Eggs we buy in the Chicagoland area.  This place locally sources there food & it makes a difference.   The thick cut bacon is from a local butcher in Queen Creek, AZ & it was so delicious. It was cooked perfectly & had hints of pepper on it. My breakfast even had sausage that was formed into patties. The sausage came from a local butcher up the street near their downtown location. It was some of the freshest sausage I've ever had. I loved it because it reminded me of the sausage patties I make at home for breakfast. It is so nice to have a hand formed patty &!not something over processed & frozen in a factory.   I really liked the home fries. I'm usually not a fan because this breakfast item at other restaurants is always tasteless & dry but not here. A lot of love goes into this side dish. They take Yukon Gold Potatoes, first boil them, then they bake them and finally finish them off by frying them in butter. They also add some sauted onions & then season them with salt, pepper & rosemary. These potatoes are as good as my breakfast potatoes & I don't share that kind of compliment with just anyone.   I washed all of that down with a house made griddle cake which is just a fancy word for pancake. This was one of the best pancakes I've had in a long time. The best part it was topped with real sweet cream butter & real Maple syrup. Both of these toppings pushed this amazing griddle cake beyond extraordinary. I didn't use all the butter but it tasted like real butter which is something I don't taste anymore with all of the fake processed food we are being served. I'd like to pass a law that says, "If there is no Real Syrup then you can not serve pancakes!"  Sorry Aunt Jemima but you don't cut it anymore. Real is the way to go.   Prior to leaving to go & catch my plane I stopped at the pass to tell the staff how much I loved their food. I wanted them to know I appreciated all of their hard work.  They were cranking out some great food. The kitchen space is not big at all yet they kept making fantastic food to hungry travelers.   There were many breakfast options on the menu. I was enjoying seeing what all my neighbors at the bar were getting.  The scrambled eggs with spicy salami looked so good. It was on my list but it didn't come with a pancake so I opted for Matt's Big Breakfast. The breakfast sandwich & breakfast burrito looked good too. I would love to mention that this place is priced great & it won't break your travel budget. My whole dish was $12.50 which is totally reasonable for everything I ordered.   I must mention that there is a full bar. Everyone around me was drinking but it was 8:30am on a Friday morning. I couldn't do it, after 8 days in Vegas. I really didn't want to see liquor again.  The real temptation was when the person across from me ordered one of the Bloody Mary's. I wanted to ask them if I could take a photo of it but I didn't want to be that guy. It was one of those that was not only a drink but a meal too.  I will always have an image of that masterpiece in my head.   So if you're flying through PHX then do your foodie homework because there are many great options to eat at here. You will really be surprised at all the great ratings for the restaurants. I do highly recommend you stop in here for breakfast. Matt's has a great All-American breakfast that will keep you going all day long. You make me want to connect through PHX now when I fly.
My wife and I enjoyed the food at Matt's. The hash browns and homemade sourdough bread was amazing!

The hash browns had a unique sweet taste, the vibe was hipster and vintage, sourdough toast was thick and tasty with a unique side of actual fresh blueberry marmalade. I enjoyed my salami scramble and will probably be back soon!

There was a bit of a wait for breakfast here and now I know why!  It was absolutely delicious.  I love the decor as well.  But the food was what really rocked my world.  I had the salami scramble, i think it was called and I added cheese to it.  It was amazing.  The hashbrowns...to die for.  I was in food heaven.  I also love that the butter your toast so the butter melts, I miss that in Chicago.  Overall, a great experience!

Finally made it over to Matt's Big Breakfast, and I'm glad I did!  This place is your quintessential get-in/get-out breakfast joint, but with local ingredients in a clean open atmosphere.  We ordered the breakfast sandwich (bacon, marinated onions and american cheese) and salami scramble for breakfast.  The scramble came with a choice of hash browns or home potatoes, so I went with the hash browns.  I must say, I think those were my favorite part of the meal!! The outside of the hash was super crisp, and the inside potatoes were luscious and almost creamy tasting. 10/10 would order again.    Service was also good.  Our waitress was fast, sharp and on point.  She was good about keeping our water and coffee glasses full, and I appreciated the amount of times we were checked on.  All in all, I had a enjoyable quick breakfast, and look forward to going back to see what else they have to offer :)
Matts big breakfast is awesome. It took me back to when I was a kid and how my morning breakfasts with the family were !! I will be back

This might be a top 3 breakfast I've ever eaten. Perfect size portions and reasonable prices. The bacon is delicious it's a pepper crusted bacon. The home fries are delicious potatoes with rosemary. The bread that came with it was a sourdough. I couldn't get enough of. Service was great everyone working there was friendly. I will definitely be eating here in my return flight next week.

Garbage service, garbage food loaded with butter, not fresh, super greasy. My husband and I had a stomach ache all day after that disgusting meal. After all that when paying the bill the stupid waiter asked us to get up and go so that they can seat others. So extremely rude and an awful experience. Never ever will I go back there. YUCK!!

We liked the citrus infused water while you wait on benches under shady trees. The freshly squeezed OJ which was so good, thick sliced bacon (the meat is fresh from Queen Creek), the hash browns were freshly shredded, the jalapeos were fresh, the waffles with real whipped butter and real Vermont maple syrup were mouth watering! I loved the fresh roses on the tables, the exposed brick on one wall, and the big windows on another side with natural light coming in. The servers, managers, and all the staff were friendly and nice, too! We WILL definitely be back! It was worth the 40 minute wait for a table.

Ok so the look of the portions in the pictures are very deceptive.  The waffle and pancakes arent big as they look, however I am stuffed so I guess the waffle was big enough.  the food was very good, I thought it would be better, but I am not disappointed.  I would come back here :) the waffle was not as good as the farm and the pancakes were not as good as first watch. but thats just my opinion.  Next time I want to try some of their scrambles.

Hey this place is a classic down town breakfast joint. They sure dont need a A+ review from me, but what the hell. This Place Is Awesome.I love riding my bike to this funky little diner. I always get the breakfast special; this time it was scrambled eggs, ham, fresh jalapenos, and pepper jack cheese, with a side of home frys. Holy Sh** it was good! Everything is super fresh, affordable, and clean. The portions are big, so be mindful of spiting with a friend if so inclined. Also I would recommend getting your delicious food to go and sit in the park just to the south. The wait to sit inside can be very long.
There 5-10 min.  Employees make eye contact then ignore. Tell manager and she gives me the "oh so sorry" scripted response.  Terrible customer service and based on mgrs response I know why.

I had a layover in Phoenix and decided to get some breakfast for dinner (the best time to get breakfast, right?). Matt's biggest breakfast was large enough to split between two people. The highlight was definitely the griddle cake - it was crispy yet fluffy and just really flavorful. The eggs were good, the bacon was super flavorful and the sausages were smashed and delicious. We ordered a side of toast, but we could have skipped them - they are a little too thick for my liking.  If you're in terminal B1-14 and you feel like grabbing some breakfast foods, you can't go wrong here.

60 degrees and they had the 20 feet of doors open. asked the waitress and she said management wanted them open. Heard at least 3 other customers complain but to noavail. There was a young man there that appeared to be the manager but not sure. Ordered the pig and chic, bacon good, eggs were very small. one piece of sourdough with some strange tasting preserves. The potatoes were raw in the middle and the rosemary and onions were burnt, inedible. Wife got a waffle and said it was good, asked for more syrup and was told its organic and its a dollar more. barely enough for half a waffle i work at marina heights and smell the food every morning and wanted to try it since seeing the diners driveins and dives show. Well 25.00 later and wont be coming back here.

As a person that travels for a living I've had my share of bad airport food but this place makes up for all of it. Excellent food, fresh, plentiful and great service. I will make it a point to visit them again and I bookmarked the main restaurant in the city.  The waffles were perfect and the Reuben was too.  Don't hesitate to visit them when you're at the Phoenix airport.

While in Phoenix, walked to Matt's for breakfast on Saturday morning. Not being really familar with it, I had no expectations. We ended up having to wait over an hour to be seated - mostly because this place is really freaking small. (If you have a big group, you'll take up the entire restaurant and that's just rude.) The menu is pretty sparse, but has something for everyone. I got the hog and chick - with scrambled eggs (just ok), thick cut bacon (it was heavy on the pepper but good), hash browns (odd, the home fries looked better) and sourdough toast (next time, I'm just getting the toast. The sourdough was awesome). With a coffee, I think my total was around $10-11 - not too bad.   Overall, if it was a random day during the week with no wait, I'd be more excited. I'm not sure it was worth the wait - but my cousin is still talking about how great it was.

I love this place ! Came all the way from California to try it. We were in Arizona 3 days and went to Matts every morning!! Love the quality of the food. I enjoyed the bacon and eggs and I especially loved my toast. Some people don't know quality if it slaps them in the face. I Also got an oj and a coffee! Next time I'm In town I'm going straight back to matts

There aren't that many good places to eat in Sky Harbor...mainly bland chains or local restaurants trying to do their best impression of their original location but falling far from the same. This Matt's is definitely not as good as the original in downtown Phoenix, but when you have no choice and need a good breakfast before your flight, stopping here is a fairly good choice. My wife and I ordered the hog and chick. The meat was savory and the egg was adequately seasoned. I loved how the bacon was a little more wet/chewy than dry/crispy, as I tend to dislike the latter. I didn't get a chance to try their signature pancakes this time but they didn't look that bad either.

Okay, I think I was a dick the first time I wrote a review of Matt's, so i'll try again.  I don't like lines.  No, I mean I really don't like lines and I have horrible Disney World nightmares that sometimes wake me up.  Despite my hatred of lines, I love Matt's and I dream of Matt's, too, and sometimes I even find myself in line at Matt's in the blazing heat, waiting for those wonderful pancakes and floating like Bugs Bunny to a carrot.  I think I said something silly in my last review, like, "I won't go back for months because of the lines," but I was back and I felt guilty, so I'm rewriting the review to assuage my guilt and allow me a future guilt-free experience as I devour their pancakes.  I wasn't kidding about the scooter gang, though.  Seriously, there was a scooter gang in line.

Had a lot of breakfasts at Matt's, but this morning was terrible.  Found a hair coming out of the top of my wife's omelet like a weed.  They apologized, but they didn't comp the omelet.  WTF???  Bad management.  Won't go back. Yuck.

Well, I have heard such good things about this place and well...it didn't live up to the hype!  The poached eggs swimming in water and the mini sausages had no flavor, and the hashbrowns were just gooey inside! But the bread and jams were a treat and the attention that we got from OTHER servers and management was impressive!  But I will not suggest going nor would I visit again!

Wife took me to breakfast this morning. My daughter told us to try this place. So here we are at around 8:30 AM and the place is busy. Had to wait about 10 minutes for a table...beats waiting an hour on the weekends. If your a twosome, you have a faster chance of getting a table. I had their Salami Scramble with hash browns and sour dough. My wife had the Hog & Chick with home fries and sour dough.  The last time I had soppresata salami was when I was a kid. The dish was great as long as you're a salami lover. It just brought back great memories as a teenager in North Beach in San Francisco eating a salami sandwich on a hard roll for lunch.  The hash browns were a little over cooked, but hey, they were hash browns. One other thing, the sour dough was actually sliced from a loaf of sour dough bread which came with homemade jam. We will return.

Who is Matt? Why is his breakfast so big? Why are there lines out the door on a regular basis? Why am I able to without hesitation give this place full marks?  I took Kristy to this place one cold Fiesta Bowl morning when Jonny decided he needed to sleep in rather than entertain his guests!  Somehow, I remembered that I needed to arrive around 8am if I would get a seat and parking and not starve at the door.  We walked right in!  This intimate kitchen setting stashed in the middle of downtown nowhere really is the BIG attraction in the area.  Wholesomely good with organic everything and home grown and home made this and that, I found myself ooohing and aaaahing before even opening my mouth to sample the tea and grapefruit juice!  EVERYONE's food seem to lure me in and I actually had a VERY hard time selecting just one item that I wanted for breakfast.  The menu is not big. But my eyes were as a re-contemplated the implications of not getting one item or selecting another option over another.  I landed somehow on the omelette!  Original n'est pas? I enjoyed everything about it.  Kristy got the pancakes and coffee and is still talking about how this was the next best thing to do if  you were denied a promised road trip by a hungover friend to Sedona!

Maybe I am missing something but I don't understand the hype.  They didn't have soda on tap and just RC Cola cans which is fine but I do want my caffeine in the AM and I'm not a coffee drinker.  The food on the menu sounds excellent but once we received it I was underwhelmed. It felt like items I could easily make at home.  Gave it two stars because the bacon was good and crispy.
Get the blueberry honey lemonade! Three egg omelette and pancakes were good! Busy but short wait on a Thursday morning at 10am.

IT WAS AMAZING. My friends and I were on a road trip to the Grand Canyon and also visiting a friend in the area, so we decided to stop by this place. It was featured on Guy Fieri's Diners, Drive-In's and Dives and definitely worth every minute of it!   We got their daily special - spicy chirizo sausages with eggs, jalapeos and with hash browns on the side. The food came out pretty quickly and it was just perfect. The fresh jalapeos added a slight kick but the spiciness did not overwhelm the taste of the sausages. The eggs that were scrambled in with the meat was perfectly light and fluffy. Their hashbrowns were fried with butter, so it tasted a bit different from your typical hashbrowns. I am not a huge fan of butter fried anything, so I didn't really care for it, but my friends all LOVED it.  One of my friends got the waffles with a strip of bacon, and the bacon was thick and crispy, cooked just right. Also, don't forget about the coffee! It's delicious - not too acidic like Starbucks, just the way I like it.   The decor in the restaurant is also very cute - bright yellow doors, retro looking posters on the walls, a small traditional diner like table sectioning off one of the corners. All of our servers were super friendly and made the entire experience a blast. If you are in the area, it's definitely a place you have to check out!!!

Best breakfast ever.  Matts never lets me down.  Amazing pork chop breakfast. Perfectly prepared. Great 1 inch thick sourdough toast. Fresh squeezed OJ.  Nice people. Great bar.   Great surprise at a major airport!

I like that they use local farm products and some of the stuff is organic. The strawberry honey lemonade was different and good. I got the hog and chick breakfast - eggs were great, hash browns were super greasy, but spot on with the texture and taste. I prefer crispy bacon, which this wasn't but it had a good flavor. And the strawberry preserves on the white sourdough toast were excellent. I like that they have different specials every day of the week, so I need to come back and try the eggs Benedict, French toast, and biscuits and gravy at some point!  Very tasty menu and a cute little place.  There wasn't much of a wait - and the service was quick so that was nice.

I will not be back.   Yes, the food is very very good... but it is not the best breakfast I've ever had.   We waited outside for an hour.  There are only two umbrellas for shade and this morning, there was no water in the jug.      The service could not have been worse--everyone seemed slow and apathetic.   When we were finally seated, we were placed on stools in the window where tourists were taking pictures of us eating/the inside.  If you need to use the restroom, they send you to the hotel next door.

Let me preface that I am 6'4" and 275lbs so when I found Matt's Big Breakfast I felt at home.   I had a waffle and two strips of bacon.   The Bacon was excellent and the waffle was nice and crisp.   The reason for the 2 star rating was related to the "Big" reference.  I had different expectations obviously.  So I ordered eggs on the side, 4 to be exact.  I asked the waitress for some more syrup for my waffle as the portion served was meager to be kind.  It was explained that it came from Vermont so I was only getting the portion that was previously provided but I could have blueberry preserves if I wanted something else.  I asked the cost of more syrup and I opted to try the Blueberry preserves.  I don't remember the exact quoted amount but it seemed excessive as my check was already just shy of $20.00 and that is just drinking water.    For what it is worth the location and convenience was great.  The food was tasty and the waitress was great.  I was just expecting more from "Big" breakfast.

I stopped in here for dinner on a Sunday night and where the terminal overall was slow, this restaurant was hopping!  Pretty popular place it seems.  I was flying solo and was found a seat quickly when I approached.     I tell you, the customer service here alone was enough to make me want to go back!  The host and the server were both excellent.    The food I had also was spot on!  I had burger with this jalapeno aioli that reminded me of hatch green chilis!! Not sure what they did but man it was so yummy!   I also paid a couple extra bucks and got the steak fries.  Normally not my thing but these came out crispy and were served with an A1 BBQ sauce.   So good together with the burger.  I can't speak to the breakfast as I only had dinner here but I'd be willing to try it out if in Phoenix for breakfast!    Safe travels!!!!

Having never been to the infamous downtown location (it's still on my radar) I gave the airport location a shot. First of all, what's with all of the uber-popular eateries coming to Terminal 4? I've see Le Grande Orange, Olive & Ivy, Four Peaks, Blanco, Chelsea's.. I mean seriously.   OK, not sure about the negative reviews so far. This is a WYSIWYG restaurant, no gimmicks just good American breakfast and lunch food. The griddlecakes were awesome, and their bottomless coffee was great to wash them down. I had to ask for more maple syrup as I like to drown my cakes! I was catching an early flight to Dallas so I beat the "rush" that I've seen in other Yelp photos. The staff was friendly enough, I'd just wish the seating area was more spread out (it feels congested) but I guess they h ad to work with the space they were given.   The food is excellent, the prices are fair, the service was fast- I was in and out in 20 minutes. I say give this place a shot!!

Came here while on vacation here! This place was amazing. Can be easily found near the light rail station. The servers were  very freindly and remembered me after I had come in the day before. The food was awesome! The bacon was thick cut and well cooked! They make thier pancakes from scratch and also thier jam from scratch. This place can get busy on weekends but don't always expect a line out the door as some of the Yelp pictures suggest. Great experience and will be back if I return to the area.

Not about taste, as my To Go order was very tasty.  I ordered 2 scrambled eggs, subbed pork sausage for chicken apple sausage, didn't get the toast, and hash browns ... $15!!! Are you KIDDING me???? Do you realize how many other places a person can go for eggs and sausage for half the price?? And there was only 1 sausage link! There was nothing fancy or special about it. Sorry, Matt's ... not paying $15 again.

During my Spring Training trip in Arizona, my friends & I wanted to look for a good place to either get breakfast or brunch in the morning.  We found Matt's Big Breakfast on Yelp; and with over 550+ reviews with an average of 4-stars, we decided that this was the place to try out.  We came here on a Friday at 11am on 3/27/15 during Spring Training.  We thought that if we arrived after the breakfast hour and before the lunch hour, we could beat the crowd.  We were wrong!  This place was ultra crowded!  We put our name down and still waited 30+ minutes for a party of 3.  The good thing is that while we waited for a table, we had plenty of time to check out their menu and their specials, so we were able to order once we were seated.  They even provide you with water outside their restaurant while you wait.  As for the food.., it was very delicious!  They use real maple syrup, their strawberry jam has actual strawberries in them, their bacon was crispy and NOT greasy!  Their quality was fantastic, their prices was low, and the quantity was very good.  Other than the long wait for a table, I loved everything about this restaurant.  I will definitely dine here again the next time I'm in Phoenix!

Visited morning of 10/5/2015. Had the cheese omelet with mushroom and onion, hash browns, and wheat toast. Also the "Skinny" I believe it's called, it's an egg white scrambler essentially. Went because they have a big following in the valley. Staff was great, which made the experience, however for the hype, the food was good, if not basic, also everything is very heavy on the oil and butter, making the meals quite greasy. I'm a fan of some butter and cheese but it was a little overkill, we'll give it a second chance.
Not my favorite.... if you come on a weekend, prepare to wait! The food is okay... but the orange juice is phenomenal

My wife took me to Matt`s Big Breakfast on Camelback this morning. Well, as I always say " if it starts out bad, it usually gets much worse". Damn, I was right. First, they seated us next to where they bring the dirty dishes...really noisy and crowded with servers and dishwashers. They should move this station outside the eating area, for sure. I ordered the cheese omelet with chicken apple sausage. The waitress brought me the hog and chick. Not ever dining here, I thought that it was what I ordered. The omelet was definitely not Big, the potatoes were very salty and the chicken sausage was ok. My wife and I ate our meals and then asked for the check. Wow, it was over $37.00 for an omelet, oatmeal and a $5.95 Five Spot. When I asked the waitress, she said that the cheese was $2.00 extra and the sausage was a $4.95 upcharge. What a ripoff and not Big like the name says at all. The waitress asked me to speak to the manager and at 1st, she reduced the bill by 20 cents...no typo...20 cents and she told me that it was organic and the sausage was locally obtained. Who cares! It was overpriced and not all that tasty. To top off the experience, I have been sick all day since leaving the restaurant and think that I got food poisoning on top of a lousy meal. First and last time to Matt`s Big Breakfast!!

This place is truly THE BEST breakfast spot. My daughter and I drove 45 minutes just to try it out and it was more than worth it. It has a nice vibe and a welcoming hello when you walk in. I had the Tuesday Special, biscuits and gravy with eggs and home fries plus I had a side of bacon. My daughter had the Hog and Chick (eggs, sausage patties, hash browns and toast). The biscuits and gravy was the best I've ever had, the bacon was delicious, I don't normally like sausage but the sausage was amazing, the hash browns and home fries were perfect, the toast is apparently delivered daily and it's wonderful. Oh, and the fresh squeezed OJ and lemonade was actually FRESH SQUEEZED! Our server was great and the managers were all friendly and made sure our visit was perfect!  I will definitely be back, especially on Tuesday's for the biscuits and gravy.

Blink and you might miss where Matt's Big Breakfast is located. But don't let the small size of this breakfast hot spot fool you, nor let the long wait deter you. Matt's had been right around the corner from me, and I had no idea until today what I had been missing out on. A group of friends and I all sprung for the daily special of scrambled eggs incorporated with hot links, white cheese, and peppers paired with delicious home fries. So while the wait, especially during a blustery summer day in Phoenix may make you want to stray, don't, and you will be in for a treat!

This place is so overhyped. The food is your average breakfast food at a premium price you pay because it was featured once upon a time on TV. The service was even more laughable as the last time I visited I had to actually get up and ask for the remainder of my order. And don't even expect to be able to just pop in and out like a normal breakfast joint, the wait times along ensure that you will be there for at least an hour or more.

Well I was underwhelmed! However the toast, and the strawberry preserves are the best I have ever had. It was good but the wait was long. I was a little disappointed because I was expecting more with all the hoopla surrounding matts. To be completely fair if there was not as much hoopla surrounding matts I'd rate it higher. it is an above average breakfast spot.

Had a relatively high expectation. Got disappointed fairly quickly. Waited about 20 minutes and sat close to the entrance. No problem, no big deal. In fact, I expected us to wait before being seated.   The daily special ran out right after I ordered and lot of the things were out by 11am. I understand the business is doing well but you really cannot allow things to run out more than few hours before close! Sad. So instead of the pork chop and the daily special, we opted for the waffles and the 'new - updated' daily special.   I guarantee that this place is much better than Denny's. It's ludicrous to compare Matt's to Denny's. Sure it may look similar but the quality of the ingredients and the dishes themselves speak for themselves. But, to me, Matt's wasn't all that special. Perhaps all the hype and media have changed the restaurant a little bit? Who knows..

Really yummy. I recommend this place. Except they brought out a few tablespoons of syrup in a little cup for my waffle. When I needed more they said I'd have to pay more for it bc it's "real" syrup. My hubby and I had a laugh about it bc why not just charge a few cents more for a waffle that comes with enough syrup?  Oh well!

Meh.... I have wanted to try this spot for a long time. I'm glad I did but I won't necessarily come back. We were seated pretty quickly and the service was quick and friendly.   Cons: menu is very limited and the food, well the food was just okay. Nothing special. And it was kinda overpriced for what you get.

I checked out this place a couple years ago and was not impressed.  I came back today since they relocated and still not impressed.  The waitress was not very friendly,  the hasbrowns were soaked in butter, if you love butter you will love it.  The coffee and homemade jam were both good.  None of the wait staff seemed happy to be there.  They really needed someone at the door directing people.

Tuesday, 1:00PM.  Caught them dealing with a rush. For those ordering pickup, there was a slow moving line. For those dining in, there were delayed orders. Poor customer rep at the register did her best to handle the wave.   Quickie: +Clean +Menu variety  And then...? Actual sandwich was decent. Delay in getting food (+15 min) because of understaffing. Willing to give MBB another go.   ********** Stuffed my face in: 1. Classic Reuben      +Sauce complemented corned beef into savory bursts      -Chips were stale      -Pickle lacked crunch  Constructive comments: *Compost and clear recycling bins *Sustainable cutlery *Streamline system to handle patrons who are dining in and taking out
Good food, but I felt rushed.  I hadn't even taken my first bite and already received the bill!

Orange juice is damn good. it's really good. I would argue perhaps the best thing on the menu. Omlette was good, but not the best I've had. It was a little on the soft side and wouldn't have hurt to use a little more cheese. I had to be liberal with the salt and pepper. The toast was cut very thick. One of the highlights was the fresh homemade jam, but you really had to slather it on heavy to have the flavor balance out how thick the toast was with each bite. I would have preferred thinner slices.  As compared to other places I've eaten with "big" breakfasts, this "big" isn't really that big. It's actually quite manageable, which I appreciate and would return for. The new space is beautiful - very old meets new industrial diner feeling. Love the giant wall board in the back creating a hallway to the bathroom.  No wait when we went, which was definitely nice. Seems like a really family friendly joint.

Great restaurant for the neighborhood.    Great atmosphere and a perfect place for all ages.  Nice patio and inside is very spacious.  Had the tri tip sandwich.  Was a little small but that's alright bc most places serve too much.   We will be back when we are on that side of town.

Just as excellent as the downtown location.   Had the Chick and Chop.  Normally I have to get the nice thick cuts of bacon though.   Sourdough toast tastes like it just flew in from SF.  And the preserves are so good I could drink it.  Wife had flapjacks, not a big pancake guy, We didn't  think they were that special.

Last visit was not a pleasant experience. I was dining alone and carrying a briefcase. I was given a seat at the bar that is ahead of you and to your left as you enter. Not the long tables facing the window. But the smaller one across from that.   There was a piece of scrambled egg on my chair. I grabbed a napkin from the unused chair next to me to wipe it off. I sat down on my newly cleaned chair and put my briefcase on the empty chair next to me and started looking at the menu. 30 seconds later someone informs me they are planning on squeezing in next to me. You are practically elbow to elbow at that bar. So I take my briefcase off the chair and go to put it on the floor (no room on the table) and I'm disgusted by all the pieces of leftover food littering the ground.  I'm not putting my stuff on such a filthy floor. I walked out and headed to Phoenix Public Market. On the way, I phoned Matt's and asked to speak to the manager. I explained what happened, she said that they ALWAYS keep the floors clean, so she doesn't understand how it happened, and would I like to come back and get a to go order ? No. I would not.   I've been here once before and thought the food was pretty good. Although it's really not worth dealing with all the hassle of the long waits, small tables, and sassy help.   It's bacon and eggs and waffles. Not exactly 3 star Michelin fare. There are plenty of good, CLEAN, breakfast restaurants in the city that have the same type of food. So I don't plan on going back anytime soon.

Quaint, home-style breakfast place. Visited for lunch after a hike in Papago Park. Ordered the hog n chick with a pancake for myself and a plain pancake for my daughter. The portion size was huge for the hog n chick. I got my eggs scrambled with cheese and the home fries. Both were okay, the home fries had a strong rosemary flavor. Came away from the meal $30 poorer. Could have easily gotten a similar meal at IHOP for much less.... Only difference, thick cut bacon.

My Dad has been wanting to try this place since he saw it on the Food Network. Well, now that he's in town, he got his chance.   It's a great little place to get breakfast. And by little, I mean very little. Matt's is tiny. We went on Tuesday morning, at 10am, and waited about 10 minutes to be seated. The first thing that opened up was at the counter. If you go on Saturday or Sunday, good luck.   Having said that, everything else about Matt's is great. I had some great griddle cakes there. I didn't even have to order a side, those three pancakes filled me up for hours! My dad had the special, which was eggs, sausage, fontina cheese, and potatoes and toast. My mom had an egg and bacon and cheese Breakfast sandwich. No complaints across the board.   The staff does a great job in the small, crowded environment. Each server seamlessly tag teams you during your meal. One person took our order, another gave us our drinks, another our food, and another handled the bill. Somehow they're perfectly organized in what appears to be total chaos!   I'd recommend checking Matt's Big Breakfast out sometime!

Newer, bigger, modern and just slightly up the road location. Same wonderful food. Matt's Big Breakfast may have lost it's dive-status, but it's still a great place to eat.  The menu, like the restaurant, remains simple and small. But all the offerings are delicious and plentiful. I decided just to go with the griddlecakes. I was left happily stuffed for hours.  Even with a few more tables than at the old location, I'm willing to bet that there's still a big line on weekends, but at 7:30am on a Tuesday, the restaurant was practically empty. If you're around downtown Phoenix during the early morning hours, why not stop in a Matt's Big Breakfast?

I've lived downtown for 5 years now and never heard of this place until I saw it on 'Diners, Drive-ins and Dives'...  Just kidding. I'm a semi-regular. I say "semi" because I go in series. I'll go four or five times in a two week period and then have to lay off and hit the gym to work off the 20 pounds I gained. But I keep going back.  Matt uses a lot of butter when he cooks, which makes everything taste better. The fresh made pancakes and waffles are awesome with real maple syrup. The pork chop and eggs is a delightfully dangerous breakfast, marinated in a homemade pesto sauce (the porkchop, that is - who marinates eggs?). The thick cut bacon strips are great for breakfast and even better in the BLT (which I sometimes order with a fried egg on it for breakfast, a BELT).  It looks as though most people are saying this is a '$' place but I would give it '$$'. I have yet to leave there with a bill under $10.  Some complain about the wait but I have and answer for that - don't go if you're in a hurry. If you go on a weekend, bring an iPod or something to read while you're waiting.
This place is the real deal. Awesome portions and variety. I literally spent over an hour eating here because I had to savor each and every bite of the deliciousness

I hate when people compare restaurants, but I'm gonna do it. Matt's is in many ways the opposite of Snooze - it's quieter, the menu is simpler and pretty classic. I loved the decor and fresh flowers in the tables, it wasn't too trendy or trying to hard. You seat yourself. It has a very small business feel to it. The staff was friendly and attentive. I saw a manager on the floor all morning working with them. The food was pretty good - again, this isn't Snooze, so don't expect anything out of this world crazy. Think basic omelettes and waffles.  They have a rotating daily special: Monday's are huevo rancheros, another day is biscuits and gravy, ect.  I think my family's disappointment came with the price - they charge a lot for little things. An extra side of syrup cost an additional $1.50. That just seemed ridiculously expensive. My dad thought it was a marketing ploy to make the pancakes a little dry purposefully so you'd have to order more syrup. Dorky MBA family humor. But seriously. A dollar and a half for a little dinky thing of syrup is too much.

The ambiance is nice and hip, but the waiters will try to sell you more things as side dishes to drive the bill up a bit. No harm really, but they can be a bit pushy. Foods okay. Pricing ain't too bad either, considering you're in an airport

We tried to get to breakfast here 3 times, and this last week we finally got in.  Matt's has moved to a bigger location, and the old location will be for take out.  The pork chop was delicious, along with the eggs, potatoes, bread and homemade jam.  However there is always a wait.  I guess I can compare this to Martannes in Flagstaff.  They have both been written up in A Z Highways.  We were in the area for 2 nights and ate breakfast at Matt's both mornings.

Overall, this was an amazing restaurant! The food was outstanding, and I would definitely recommend the breakfast and hash browns. Another great aspect about this place was the staff, they were so friendly, outgoing and made the experience even better!
Didn't realize how big the salad was lol but the egg white omelette was very good. Loved the chicken sausage
This little place was great for breakfast.  Service was great and the food better.  It was paced and the just keep the coffee coming.  Was worth the wait.

REAL food (not the processed crap you find at Denny's).  Super friendly and fast service.  Family owned and operated.  Local ingredients  Great portions.  What more can you ask for?  Oh, maybe a few more tables to shorten the wait.  But that's all part of the charm!  This is my pick for the best breakfast in Phoenix!  SOOOOO delicious!!

This place seemed like one of the top rated brunch places in Phoenix, so this was the perfect stop for my boyfriend and I to check out right when we landed early in the morning to start off our Labor Day Weekend!  We got in on a Thursday afternoon and there was probably only a 10 minute wait. We started off with their highly recommended lemonades (me with strawberry, boyfriend with blueberry). For the main dish I got their homemade belgian waffle with bacon and my boyfriend got the chop and chick with bacon on the side. We shared half of each dish with each other and both dishes were great! I was a huge fan of the pork chop and rosemary potatoes that came with his chop and chick. The belgian waffle is also a must-try; it was very fluffy and just the right portion size. It is divided into four chunks so it is easy to share.  Service is fast and friendly here. Everything is reasonably priced as well! With our drinks and dishes, our bill came out to be around $35ish from what I can recall. This is a great spot in Phoenix to try for brunch, either at this location or at the airport if you happen to catch it there as well!

This brunch spot is a MUST go-to either here or their location closer to downtown! I was pretty happy being able to start and end our trip here in Phoenix with Matt's. It's a great Phoenix staple!  First things first, service here is FAST which is very appreciative especially at an airport. They have portable credit card machines they will bring to your table after your meal to pay so three people could pay at once without having waiters scrambling around the small space to run your card, run back to you, then run back to the table to pick up the tip receipt.  We got sat right next to the waiter station and our waiter was very attentive and fast. I got the chop and chick this time because I really liked the pieces of pork chop I stole from my boyfriend last time ... :P and he got the breakfast sandwich. Instead of the lemonades, he got a bloody mary and I got a mimosa in a stemless wine glass.    I would say quality, service, and prices are the same at both locations we went to. This would probably be the definition of a good restaurant to try out at the airport here.

Being a huge fan of breakfast (who isn't?) I got really excited when I found this place using my handy dandy Yelp app on my iPhone. You see, me and 3 of my friends were in Phoenix to see the Dodgers play the Diamondbacks in a big league game at Chase Field. The bad news is the dodgers lost, but the good news is we had breakfast the next day at Matts.   Reading the reviews on Yelp got me way excited to eat there. People were raving about this place as if it was a small piece of heaven on earth.   We walked there from our hotel and Were quickly seated. Our first thought was, 'tiny'. But we liked that about the place. Very cozy and welcoming. Old school almost.   I ordered the pancakes with a side of egg and bacon. I always have to try the pancakes first whenever I go to a new breakfast joint. It's my measuring stick. If the pancakes suck, most likely everything else will also.   After waiting about 10 minutes the kind and very friendly waitress began to bring our food out. One at a time. Over a few minutes. She explained to us that they only had one grill so they would bring out the food as soon as it was done cooking. Again, 'tiny'.   Let me tell you the wait was worth it. The pancakes were amazing. Soft, fluffy, stick to the roof of your mouth goodness. The best pancakes I have ever had. Not to mention the maple syrup was amazing. Top notch bacon and the eggs cooked like my mom made them. I was in breakfast nirvana. My only regret was leaving bits of pancake on my plate. After eating different, but equally amazing, items from my friends plate I was full. I felt like I had let my pancakes down.   As we left the restaurant we did the touristy thing to do and took a picture next to Guy Fieri's image on the wall. And had no shame about it.   If your in Phoenix you have to go to Matts Big Breakfast. There's nothing really 'tiny' about the flavor of the food there.   Oh and the people who were raving about Matts as of it were a small piece of heaven are all wrong. It's more like a bog chunk of heaven if you ask me.

We stayed in Phoenix over the last weekend and Yelp helped me find this breakfast wonder.... Matt's was awesome. Locals wait in line for this great good. Service was fast and efficient, food was great quality, home fries with Rosemary were outstanding, bacon was love in my mouth, and the best part.... Their strawberry honey lemonade. This is legal "crack" if there is such a thing.  It was rather loud inside but not annoying for such a small place. Since the weather is so hot, while you wait outside they have refreshing lemon water to keep you cooled off. Had to split checks at the minute and it was not a problem. Definately visiting there again if I ever return to Phoenix!

Simple breakfast, but very very yummy!   We walked in just after 8am on a Sunday, which was perfect - the place wasn't packed yet and we were able to be seated right away. By the time we left (about 9am) every table was taken and there was a wait.    I ordered the belgian waffle with a side of hash browns and fresh squeezed orange juice. Everything was so good!  I would definitely return again soon!

We were visiting Tempe and decided to stop by because we saw the place in a TV show.  The place is a bit hidden but very cool, staff was extremely attentive and nice. The best of all was The Classic Reuben, Just amazing combinations of flavors that I absolutely loved! Their waffles look very good too but I just had no room to try it... The rash browns are made in a very particular way, I also loved it!  I recommend this place!
They are really good. I recommend them. Not the best I've had but better than most places in downtown Phoenix.

MBB is one of those places that I really like, but can't really explain why. Maybe it's the fresh jam, the perfectly cooked bacon, the cute old fashioned style of the place or  the fact that you tell yourself it just has to be great if everyone else is willing to wait in the desert for up to an hour-ish to have their hand at some..I dunno.   It is indeed tasty, and I've yet to try anything that disappoints, but the menu (in my humble o-pinion) doesn't really offer anything extraordinarily fantastic enough to warrant the wait. That said, if ever I drive by the place in the a.m. hours and happen to see that there's no line, I will consider it my lucky day and likely mosey on in.

Excellent farm fresh breakfast! You will pay 2$ extra than what you would at Denny's but you won't get homegrown, good for you taste like this at Denny's.  Service is genuine and quick. The food itself is phenomenal. The eggs are fluffy, the browns crispy, and my sausage spicy. Throw some hot sauce on it and it's for the win. I might've downgraded them for not having Chalula, but Tapatio isn't far off, so I'll let it slide. They buy their meats from the best butcher in town, Shreiner's, located right up the road on 7th st. Everything is local bought and preservative free.  Get yerself a Big breakfast with Matt and co.

I was there around 6am on the Sunday before Thanksgiving. It was quiet and my server was a delightfully friendly guy. The food came out hot and super fast since they were fairly empty. The server, whose name I have forgotten, even filled up my water bottle and packed me a complimentary to-go cup of coffee. I think the prices are reasonable for freshly made food; just watch out for those drink peicee

I have been to hash brown heaven. When I order hash browns I usually have to specify that I want them extra crispy otherwise I get a lump of anemic grated potato.  Not at Matt's.  They know what kind of hash browns this girl likes - a good crispy crust with a creamy almost mashed potato-like interior.    I also ordered the waffle and bacon.  The waffle was light and fluffy and very tasty with the real maple syrup.  The bacon was thick cut and had a delicious peppery exterior.    Now, if only I could get them to open one up in San Francisco.

Daniel the waiter is personable, professional, and genuine. The other servers and service less than fair/ok. 8 minute wait to be acknowledged, 15 minutes for meal was understandable as I asked for well done bacon. Manager on duty looked like he just rolled out of bed (untucked shirt and beach shoes).  My bearded waiter was more concerned with counting the cash in his pocket wallet than seeming customers as more than a potential tip. Check boxes for service checked off but interactions were not genuine.
Best breakfast burrito!  Great service from the "Lisas".  Good spot to kill some time on a layover.  Seriously, the breakfast burrito is delish.  Grilled with just the right amount of spice. Enjoy!

Stopped in for drinks and a bite in between flights. Great service, excellent food!! Erika was an amazing bartender/server! Had a tasty breakfast joined by a couple really good Bloody Mary's.  A definite must stop when in terminal 4.

Start off by saying vague options for breakfast....service semi-okay...when order brought to table not complete and never did the rest come out....ordered BLT in which the bread was really hard to bite and bacon more undercooked then I prefer. My husband however did enjoy his eggs Benedict and recommends!! Unfortunately the worst part was when we got to the counter and asked for our bills to be separated due to Meals being granted by my work the server said he is unable to do that and has never had to do that. Which  I felt is very poor customer service and that should be something that the facility should do when asked especially since it seemed as though many diverse groups of people go In there and don't pay off one check!! Maybe better service next time will get you more stars!!!

Came here on a Thursday morning with the boyfriend to eat and was greeted by a girl who looked like she just got to work after a night out At the club. I couldn't decide what to eat from their huge menu of 7items. The night club waitress informed us that the eggs benidict was the special today. So we ordered one each. Low and behold the plate was 11dollars each. I wouldn't have minded paying that if the food was good but it wasn't. Small portions and incredibly salty. Just terrible! I couldn't even eat my food. I wouldn't even go back if someone paid me. Maybe the people there should pay more attention to the food instead of trying so had to be hipsters.
I had lunch there last sunday me and my wife had a great time good service great food cant wait to go back there again

Best bacon I ever had. Eggs were cooked perfectly to order. Great pancakes sour dough bread and hash browns. Coffee was fantastic. Can't wait to go back next time I'm in town! Atmosphere was awesome as was the service. I'll be back!

Sixth "meeting" for The Breakfast Club UYE, and my second time attending. Oh come on  . . . meeting?! "Our Meeting is Eating!" Stick it on a shirt already. Also my first time at Matt's.   We had to wait for our entire party to show up, fourteen total. Staff was very accommodating of us and ended putting several tables together for us.   On Jennifer O.'s suggestion, I tried the waffle with bacon. It didn't leave me with that carb hangover feeling you often get from waffles and pancakes, which was great seeing as I had to get to the gym shortly after. Real maple syrup; just the right amount for me. Watch out though, if you like a double dose, extra syrup is $1.50.   The bacon was what bacon should be: Thick and delicious! A little on the peppery side, but can you really complain? It's freakin' BACON!   For a place as well known and busy as Matt's, our dishes seemed to come out rather quickly. But as Preston S. and many others have mentioned . . . this tends to happen at the Breakfast Club. A lot. :)   No split checks, but we were all able to pay out our amount at the end with no issues.   No frills breakfast, but quality for sure. I will be back!   Shout out to Monica O. for orchestrating this whole thing!
Great place food was good as well. There's a bit of a wait, but it's well worth it. Try the specials, you can't go wrong

*Warning - devoured the food before any pictures were taken*  Just flew into Phoenix from Detroit last night and already knew we had to come to Matt's Big Breakfast this morning. I found out about this place from Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives and had to try the famous Chop & Chick. Splitting this between two people and then adding a side of the chicken apple sausage was definitely enough for both of us!   Although the service from Gabby was great, I was a little disappointed with the size of the pork chop. It wasn't as big as I was expecting, but it was still delicious.   All in all, I will still recommend this place to anyone that comes to Phoenix. I'm kicking myself now that I didn't get more sourdough bread for the road because it was that awesome.

I'm not sure what happened but Matt's Big Breakfast on 32nd St it is NOT what it used to be.  We used to love their food and service on a Sunday Morning.  This time the quality of the food has dropped and the service wasn't the expectant smiles from servers we always received in the past. I ordered the Chick and the Hog and the bacon was undercooked and my wife's was also undercooked. The coffee was way too strong and when my wife got to the bottom of hers there were coffee grinds on the bottom. I couldn't even finish mine.  The service was a mixed bag, also. The hostess while friendly and smiling couldn't keep straight which customers arrived first to seat them in order. Then our unsmiling waitress took our drinks and order but never came back once to check on us. She even had another waitress bring us the check. I hadn't even complained about any of this until the 2nd waitress arrived with check and all I mentioned was the coffee. She did take that off the bill so Yay for them.

Daniel and staff were great! Additionally the food was phenomenal! If you work in the area or are just stopping by I highly recommend Matt's Big Breakfast. The manager Jason stopped out after I received my food to make sure everything was great and it was!

For the price, this place is a very good deal. Food was delivered quickly, was hot and service was very attentive. Portions were large and tasty. Concierge at the hotel recommended we try it. Said it was one of the best in town. The ambiance is equivalent to a subway station, when there are trains on the track. It was loud, VERY LOUD. It is a rickety kind of place that I am glad I tried.
My husband looked this place up & was determined to eat breakfast here soon as we landed!! It did not fail us!! The breakfast was so good & it was a lot of food!!!

12/10/09 Finally had the chance to take Mom in to enjoy breakfast at MBB!  I tried taking her here once, but the line out the door was ridiculous; Even today there was a bit of a wait, and it wouldn't have been so taxing if it weren't so cold!  (We arrived at 10:15a, sat down at 10:45a, and had our meals delivered at around 11:10a.  Again, the wait times wouldn't have been so bad if my Mom wasn't due to be at the airline gate at 11:40a!) Mom ordered the 3-egg salami omelette and hash browns w/ cranberry-walnut toast http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/-050d_XIor1NpCuWkbIVaQ?select=-gdeqfSkpFBnCfkRo3Lcng#-gdeqfSkpFBnCfkRo3Lcng, while I had the ham steak, hash browns, eggs (over-medium, please!), and whole-grain toast.http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/-050d_XIor1NpCuWkbIVaQ?select=OCEqJ846dKKtI2TLJ3mg5Q#OCEqJ846dKKtI2TLJ3mg5Q  (Let me just say that we both LOVED the cranberry-walnut toast!  Is it MJ bread or from Simply Bread??  I've got to get a hold of some to have at home!)  I enjoyed the ham steak and the hash browns were wonderful, as always.  Eggs are always delicious here- aren't they from local Hickman Farms?  Mom didn't enjoy her omelette so much- too much salami!  I don't like salami, but I tried a bite anyway.  Yep, I STILL don't like salami...  However, she did enjoy the eggs, after picking off most of the meat, and the bread w/ the plum jam. I'm always happy when my Mom enjoys herself at a restaurant that I take her to, so thank you MBB for helping her start her vacation right!
Great place !! Friendly service . Managed well .. Food was great !! A must stop in Phoenix for breakfast

- Service disappointing. Irritated host around my request for a specific table. Server dripped coffee on my leather jacket; didn't seem too concerned, but did bring napkins after I already used the napkin on the rolled silverware to clean her mess. Table was ridiculously wobbly; there goes more coffee into the table. Good thing she brought clean-up napkins already.   - Food disappointing. Lemonade tasted like dirty dishwater; replaced with coke which tasted fine. Ruben sandwich was a let down. Grilled bread was not well grilled; more of a greasy, un-browned mess. Corned beef was a little scarce, especially for the price.   - Overall impression. I've heard good things about the MBB downtown but only had the patience to wait in line once in my life (my recollection was the breakfast was...ho hum). This was the first I've heard of MBB in the airport. It was generally disappointing and I wouldn't go back if I had other options. Also based on the Reuben, the place clearly shouldn't be called Matt's Big Lunch.... Final tip - there's a Wendy's two shops down.

Ok, I've seen all the positive reviews on Matt's Big Breakfast and had to try it out.  I've never been to the original location, so this was my first time eating here.  At first I have to admit I thought that this just might be a lot of hype.  Just another downtown hipster joint with over priced food.  Man I was way off when I saw the menu and eventually received our food.  I ordered the breakfast sandwich and the wife ordered the waffle and bacon.  Man both were really really good.  The bun for the sandwich tasted like it was freshly made, and the bacon was great.  I ordered it without onions, and sadly didn't order the home fries so I'll try that next time.  I tasted the waffle and it was fantastic along with the thick cut bacon.  The syrup was very tasty and real butter was a nice touch.  Even their coffee was good.  We had great service and were lucky enough to get seated right away.  I really enjoyed our breakfast and for 2 it was right around $20 bucks.  I'm not a real big fan of eating out for breakfast so for me to give a breakfast place a high rating is something to say.  I'm glad I finally tried out Matt's.

Love Love Love this place, the salami scramble is amazing and the berry jam that you get is delicious....  If you are leaving out of the Phx airport out of terminal 4, make sure you get there early enough to enjoy Matt's on your way out of town.  If you are a local, then enjoy it daily downtown.  Get there early or you will be waiting at least and hour to eat...

It's obvious you guys love what you do! The portions are plentiful, served up fresh and extra hearty.   They have a daily special- My fav is the jalapeo & ham scramble with home fries on the side OR the chorizo scramble.   If you're skipping b-fast try the burgers here they're uhhhmazing, along with the chili, it should not be missed!   Did I mention the pancakes? They will change yo life ;)   It's definitely worth the trip downtown, stop by and support what is probably one of Phx's best local Mom & Pop breakfast joints around.

WOOOOOOOOWWWWWW!!!   I FEEL LIKE I'M TAKING CRAZY PILLS!!!   What are all of these people doing giving such high reviews???   Once a month, I meet up with my ladies. But after one of our foursome flaked, it was me and another femme with our name on the list for 3.  (We were waiting for drunky who probably slept in).  We went to the brand-spankin' new location which is apparently huge with a whopping 9 whole tables!!! (It could be more, but I am not exaggerating, I can only remember 9) We waited for 20 minutes in the waiting area, and our friend was still not there (suspected hangover) but they called our names and we were seated.  Our lovely young male waiter came along and we ordered drinks and told him our friend would be along at any minute.  He said no worries and would be back with our beverages.    Let me start off by saying I NEVER go to breakfast joints because I do not eat eggs.  No I'm not a vegetarian or vegan, I just hate the idea of eating a fetus.  That's all.  Unfortunately that left me with one or two options with the VERY egg heavy menu... A Waffle meal, a side order of sausage or juice.  Bring on the waffles!!!! We wait, and wait, and wait for our slacker friend for ten minutes. During the ten minutes waiting for our friend, it began to get PACKED at the front door with foodies glaring at our horrible twosome, for taking a four-top. HOW DARE WE!!!!! Don't blame us for where the hostess seated us?  After 10 minutes, the hostess walks over and asks us what the hold up is.   ?????   I'm sorry are we not shoveling down your "BIG BREAKFAST'S" fast enough for you?!  We politely stated, that our friend was going to be there any minute (she was, she was texting us that she was down the street).   THEN THE HOSTESS SAYS (verbatim): "I'm sorry we're not supposed to seat parties until everyone is here. You're going to have to order right now."  ???  Appalled, and not willing to fight, I say: "Okay, well I guess we were both getting the waffles and Britney will order when she gets here".   THE HOSTES REPLIES: "Unfortunately I'm going to have to ask you to order for her, or we wont be able to accommodate an order for your friend."  I giggled thinking she was joking.  She stared blankly at me...  WHAT??????????????  So you're telling me, that we gave you our name and our party number, 3.  You saw two of us even though your little notebook clearly said 3.  You sat us at a large table leaving the masticating buzzard hoard to wish us dead. We've been here for ten minutes when most brunch places expect you to wait at LEAST 10 minutes before ordering.  We cannot enjoy our drinks or reading the menu without feeling harassed. We have to order before our friend OR ELSE. THEN YOU TELL ME, that you will not serve a paying customer because she will order 5 minutes after us???? That's a joke right???   No joke.    (I smiled while all of this was being screamed at the hostess from my angry brain)  I tried to text Brit, but as she was parking she didn't get back to me quickly enough so we decided to order 3 Waffle breakfasts and hope Brit wasn't allergic to anything in the meal???  Luckily the second the food came out she was there and she enjoyed her waffles.  I with a bad taste in my mouth from that did not enjoy anything after that experience.  Separate and apart from the hostess being a B, the waffles were decent, but not 4.5 stars decent. I would give a solid 3 for those.  Our waiter was clearly embarrassed that we were being blamed for the hostess's mistake and told us that we should take our time and enjoy our breakfast. I wish I had gotten his name because he was the only redeeming factor for this place and why it is getting 2 stars instead of one.  He is white, skinny, 20-something and really chill and relaxed. Nice guy.    I will not be returning and will find another breakfast place just as good in Phoenix, like I have all over the valley.  Plus, with more egg-less options as well!  This place has Pizzeria Bianco syndrome where they think their food is heaven sent and give you garbage service because you should be thankful they even gave you the right to eat there.  No thank you.  The bill was appropriate, not exorbitant.  But if I want to be harassed while I eat my breakfast I'll eat with my parents.   Thanks but no thanks Matt, I wish ye well. But perhaps with a better hostess.

Besides the fact that they are using cage free eggs and all natural chicken, pork and beef, I'm not too sure what all the rave is about. I wasn't impressed with the service or the food. It's actually really basic and there's not really much to choose from the breakfast menu. I ordered the cheese omelette with onions and for some reason the whole thing was super watery. I get there may have been a little oil or something from the onions but watery eggs are not really appetizing. I couldn't even finish my plate. My boyfriend ordered the pancakes, which aren't anything special or fluffy like other breakfast places we've been to. It's always so busy here so it's more like an assembly line and I feel like the servers are trying to get you out of there so they can seat more people. Don't come here if you are a slow eater or don't want to wait longer.

Sorry fellow yelper's, only 3 stars for me.  This place was good. Was it great? No. Was it awful? Absolutely not. Will I come here again? Sure, I just won't wait 45 min for a table.   Maybe I ordered the wrong item. I don't know. I'm a sucker for pancakes and waffles, and I didn't order them. Apparently that's what this place is known for. I got eggs/sausage/potatoes/sourdough toast. It was good. Nothing out of this world.  Workers were nice and food came out in timely manner.   Again, this place isn't bad, it just isn't "OMG I HAVE TO EAT HERE EVERY TIME I COME TO PHOENIX"...

Food is phenomenal here....that sums up why it is so popular and you always have a wait.  I try to come here early during the week before all the Central Phoenix Millennials wake up.  Anytime before 9am is good, ha ha.  Parking is tough if you dont get a spot behind the building.  My favorite is the bacon and eggs...simple but the bacon is more like a steak!  The potatoes are just awesome, with all the herbs they are so flavorful that I am craving them now as I right this review.  The place is larger now that they moved a block away and very nice and modern inside.  Highly recommend visiting here before you die...and not on the weekend.

What a great find at an airport location . Gone are the egg mcmuffin and breakfast burrito meals. Matts makes everything fresh and quick onsite . Simple fried egg, bacon , cheese and grilled onions on a soft potato roll makes an unbelievably tasty irresistible sandwich all day . I guess airports are improving their food offerings and places like Matt are making it into reality. If you are at Terminal 4 at sky harbor don't miss this place.

Truly, a Find. Delicious, simple, ample, well prepared food. Thick, juicy pork chop with fresh eggs, house made thick toast and house made strawberry preserves. The rosemary home fries are the best I've had anywhere. Great staff all around- Alexas is a joy.  Already considering returning for a late lunch.

Not impressed. The menu selection is small. Their dishes are basically breakfast meals that I can make at home. Unfortunately the eggs benedict and special kinds of scrambles are only made once a week!  Even their waffles only had butter on top with 2 pieces of bacon! I mean cmon?! Throw some other kinds of fruit and whipped cream on there too! But No! They don't do that.  If you want just a simple breakfast, then come here.

Wowzer...seriously...Matt's Big Breakfast is the real deal!  Things to expect:  *You will wait no matter what time you go BUT the line moves fast.  *Their bacon is re-donk-u-lous! Seasoned with black pepper...oh man.  *Eggs are organic and cage-free, score!  *Go with Hog & Chick to get the best of both.  *Strawberry jam is home made and I could just drink it like a fruit drink...so good.  *Friendly service...mostly young kids who are going to school nearby. ASU.  *Inexpensive for the amount of food you get.  *Bread taste's like it's made in house...yummy.  *Coffee isn't life changing but it will do a good job of waking your butt up. *Check out their daily specials it happened to be the one my wife picked and it was delicious!

While visiting Phoenix for a family reunion: we saw this breakfast spot had more reviews than any other spot. It's bright, cozy& the staff is super dooper friendly. The bacon! Oh my bacon. I had a Blt w/pesto instead of mayo. The mixed berry honey lemonade was yummy! Annnd Chelsea, ridiculously sweet & full of charm. Awesome service! So awesome, that I left my new sunglasses at the table and she came chasing us out to give them to me.   It's only 4 stars because I wish their menu was a tad more extensive.

Everything was great, the lemonade, orange juice, waffles, pancakes, too the fresh jam etc. everything was seasoned very well  and u didn't have to add anything. It's really not geared toward large group but they fit all 9 of use mostly kids( 9 months - 13 years old). We will be coming back when visit my family in Arizona!!!

One of those places where "nobody goes there anymore" because "it's too busy". Classic.  Waiting around for a table and ordered right away. servers were all very busy so a coffee refill and getting the check was a bit tricky but the food made it totally worth it.

Noisy.  Limited menu.  Controlled chaotic restaurant environment.  Took forever to get a table, so we left.  Went to the Breakfast Club in Scottsdale.  Nice location, seating outdoors, and food that rivals Matt's.  No longer have any reason or desire to go back to Matt's.

100% love this place. I've been three times, all when passing through Phoenix, and I will be surely sorry if this place ever changes. I appreciate their choice to use fresh, wholesome ingredients, and their food is delicious. Amazing hash browns, fresh juice, homemade preserves, great bread! Everything is tops. The only bummer is that it's always packed, but I don't hold that against them.
I would rather have medium poached eggs and wheat toast here... than any dessert offered worldwide.

This is the slowest moving airport restaurant I've ever been too. The employees do not seem to care that there is a line of people waiting to check in as they are standing around joking and laughing. After flagging someone down because we saw an open table we were finally seated 15min later only to be told the kitchen is running 35-40 min late. Under normal circumstances fine, but this is an airport where people need to catch flights. We had to walk out because after the wait for the table, and after the time it would take to order and settle in when we finally would have received our food we would have had to leave to board. They could have told us before we waited for 15 min that the kitchen was behind but they did not.  So now I have two hungry small children unable to eat before a long day of traveling.

This place is definitely very popular, but I think it's a bit over-hyped. We went on a Saturday morning around 11 am. The estimated wait time was approximately 30 minutes for a table for 2. But we ended up waiting 45 minutes. :( During the wait, no one bothered to come by and refill the empty water dispenser for all the customers waiting in the Arizona heat. When we finally sat down and got out food, I would say it as pretty average. The only food item that really stood out was the homemade blueberry jam, paired with your choice of toast. This place is nothing special.

Ordered the chop and chick. It was good! Very filling breakfast. I just wish the pork chop had a little more flavor. The hash browns are AMAZING. Blueberry lemonade is not bad. My friend ordered a butter burger and he also wished it had more flavor. No wait on a Monday morning. Good place

Great breakfast place!  1st timer here  The long wait is definitely worth it people! ( only waited for about 20 minutes )  I had the scramble special and it was delicious! Home made strawberry jam is AMAZING!!

This place is one of my favorites. I travel for a living and I always stop here when I can. Coffee is great and the service is always friendly. The waffle is my fav especially with the thick cut bacon. Give this place a try, I don't think you will be disappointed.

Good atmosphere, great food. I got the five spot which was amazing, great bread that was soft and made it easy to eat.  The home fries  with fresh rosemary had great flavor too even though I usually prefer crispy hash browns.  Coffee was fresh and yummy too!

Came in for some breakfast with the bf during our weekend escape to Phoenix and we were not disappointed! We arrived early enough to not have to wait more than 5-10 minutes for a seat, which was amazing. We had the best service by the ladies working the counter and the food was cooked ridiculously fast by my LA standards! I ordered the waffle with bacon with a side of egg whites and fresh OJ, Totally hit the spot. Tried a bite of my bfs pancakes, wow! Best pancakes I've had in a while. A definite must visit for foodies looking for a straightforward American breakfast!
Overpriced tourist trap. Save your money and have breakfast at Lux or The Market by Jennifer.

My co-worker and I ate here before boarding a flight.  It was packed with people and for a good reason. The food was worth the wait and cost. Which really wasn't bad for an airport. Our food came out fast and fresh. No waiting for slow service. These people have it together. Both of our dishes were very tasty. We each had Matt's Biggest Breakfast. My eggs were perfect and I'm hard to please. I could have eaten more and wished I did, since it was a wait for dinner as we missed lunch traveling.  The coffee was great by the way.

Went for breakfast yesterday, the food was decent, I didn't like the home fries, they had a overload of rosemary on them and the waiter told me they couldn't be cooked without them because they come like that, so I switched to the hash brown, they were really good with tons of ketchup. The pork chop was really good, better then I expected, the egg was egg, and the coffee was ok. Probably won't be going back.
Perfect time to come and no line out the door. Great service, delicious specialty foods and cool temperatures. Hell Yeah!

Always busy and always an excellent meal. Came here for a late breakfast a few weeks ago and was not disappointed. Ordered the hog & chick, scrambled eggs, bacon and hash browns. All was delicious and extremely filling (needed a nap afterwards!). Would love to come for lunch one day and try something different.   Also, the airport location makes an outstanding bloody mary!

Great local breakfast spot that is a fan favorite for out of town guests. Plan on getting here early or waiting a bit because it is not the largest restaurant and it gets very busy during peak times. They have always changing lemonade flavors that are fresh and delicious as well as daily food specials. This past visit I tried the "hog and chick" which comes with two eggs, either country sausage or super thick cut bacon, and either hash browns or breakfast potatoes and toast. The sausage comes in link or patty form, I ordered the patty form and made a little breakfast sandwich out of the ingredients. The five spot breakfast sandwich is always a great value for only $5.95. If you have some time stay around for lunch, the butter burger and macaroni salad are out of this world!
Except for the lines, this is our favorite breakfast spot. Great food and friendly service. Can't get much better than that.

Excellent location. Better parking than downtown location. Still the same great tasting entrees that use fresh ingredients. Just mad that it had taken this long to open up! Still has the best bacon in existence.

words can not describe the goodness that is matt's big breakfast. i came out here while on business/vacation and had matt's waffle. i have since been on a tear back here in L.A. looking for a waffle of equal caliber, but to no avail.   light, fluffy, perfectly sweet. i've even contemplated braving the 120 degree + weather just to savor the waffle that obliterates all other waffles.

Look no further for you have located the best breakfast in Phoenix!  Fresh squeezed orange juice, homemade jam, gourmet ketchup, decent coffee, rosemary potatoes, thick sourdough bread.  I ordered the omelette with caramelized onions and sweet peppers with one of three cheeses, provolone. It was divine.  Everything I tried was delicious.  The place was packed and we had to wait, but it was worth it.  The service was great, especially sitting at the counter.  They had 5 different lemonades to choose from.  Two styles of potatoes.  I opted for the rosemary home fries and they were incredible.  I tried my partners waffle with real maple syrup and it was also good.  The jam for the bread was not too sweet and when it combines with butter, you have a real winner.  I only wish they had at least one veggie meat option, but other than that it was perfect.  They moved up the street from their old location. The new location is bigger and more modern, but they have an old school vibe, even down to the salt and pepper shaker.  The counter was concrete with a thick clear coat.  The coffee mugs were even cool.  Simply put, they know what they are doing here.  They have two other locations with one being in the Sky Harbor Airport.  I skipped lunch that day and didn't even miss it.
