It was alright.  The prices were a bit steep for the portion (from my perspective), and the food was just okay.  No minds were blown away at my table.  Service was good though and the place was tastefully decorated.
Their bacon alone is worth the 5 stars. So is the strawberry jam they serve with their toast. Oh yeah the egg dishes are pretty good too.
Amazing breakfast! Very busy place, that's why I had to try it out. Can't wait to go back.

Very good traditional breakfast spot. I stopped in just as they opened during the week to make sure and grab a spot.  I was treated with a really tasty plate of eggs and peppered bacon.  One of the biggest pluses, Matt's actually knows how to cook hash browns, I didn't need to order them well done, they come nice and crispy as is.  The real show stealer is the toast and home made jam.  Nicely done breakfast at Matt's, go grab some!

What else can you give this place! Ernie is the best, most kind beautiful hearted restaurant owner there is. Their food is top quality and delicious and so is their coffee. Ordered milk for the kiddos and it's organic. The bread is so good and they make their  house-made Blueberry  preserves, and their home fries with rosemary are soooo yummy.I can't believe she remembered me. What a compliment, "I can never forget your eyes" she said. Thank you Ernie!!! You know how to run a restaurant

A great experience. They get busy so go a little early. Free coffee refills. The pancakes and waffles were a big hit. I loved the skinny platter- the scramble was awesome. I recommend ordering a side with it though if you have a big appetite. Yummy food, give yourself about an hour altogether though.

The neighborhood is so glad they're here in Downtown Tempe! They 100% live up to the from-scratch hype. Order the Chop n' Chick and a greyhound. (Pro tip: the recipe is actually printed on the wall near the ceiling.)

Worth the 30 minute wait in 105 deg Phoenix!!  Everything is fabulous! Had the bacon & eggs (Hog & Chick)...absolutely best bacon & eggs I've ever had.  High quality food and I'm not even a breakfast person.  Griddle cakes were fluffy and delicious.  Homemade bread for their toast and fresh farmers market cherry jam for spread.

I was honestly surprised at how small their menu was, but it definitely did not disappoint! The steak my brother ordered was cooked to perfection and my waffle was so light, fluffy, and delicious! Their syrup is pretty outstanding too! The hash browns were perfectly crispy on the outside and the fresh jam/jelly/fruit spread was just the right amount of sweet. The location is kind of a downside - hidden behind&between corporate buildings, but it is a big area and their outside waiting area is spacious.

Yes, we all know about the breakfast....I give it a 4.   Today though, I went in for lunch. Gosh dang, 5 stars, it was amazing!  I ordered the Chicken sandwich - Heaven!  My friend got the butter burger and he claims it may now be his top burger in Phoenix (even over the Chuckbox!)   Homemade chips, toasted buns, garlic pickle, and just perfectly cooked meat.

They say when traveling, go where the locals go and this a nice gem. A little hole in the wall place but with all the people outside waiting to get in, you know it has to be good.  They even make homemade jam for their toast! Nice place.

Yes, I will admit that my family watches Triple D.  Now with that said my wife and I have been to a few of the joints showcased on that show.  As many of you that have started this journey like we have you find killer places and some okay places.  Matt's is a KILLER place.  My wife and I were recently in the Phoenix area for a part of our vacation and planned to stop in for breakfast at Matt's the first morning.  We got there ~8am on Saturday morning and only had to wait about 15 minutes.  Yes the place was small but being the two of us it was not a challenge.  There are about 9 tables total (assuming setup for 2) and 8 or so counter spots.  The food is awesome!!  It was so good we changed our plans and went back the next morning!   Here is what we had:  Pork chop marinated with pesto and eggs with home fries, side of bacon and toast with their very tasty home made jelly.  The pork chop is to die for.  I am a big pork chop for breakfast fan and usually very disappointed.  Not at Matt's, it was tender and cooked perfectly.  My eggs were cooked exactly like I asked for and the bacon is like think slices of heaven!  I had to have bacon both mornings and I am not a breakfast bacon fan usually.  This bacon would make anything taste great!  My wife had the daily special which was chicken sausage, fresh spinach and fontina cheese scramble.  Once again cooked perfect, not greasy at all but with big flavor.  We both had home fries which were incredible.  Nice crust with some rosemary and caramelized onions.  Pretty close to perfect!  The next day my wife had the waffle, which she liked.  The fresh maple syrup was the real star of this dish.  She was kind enough to pass the bacon to me (I know twist my arm).  I had the breakfast special which was a sirloin steak, eggs and hash browns.  The steak was SUPER tender and cooked EXACTLY how I asked (you can tell I do not experience that often).  It was obviously a good cut of meat and had been seasoned very nicely.  The hash browns were very nice.  Crust on both sides and tender in the middle.  Exactly what you would hope for.  Lastly was their toast and home made jelly.  It was like butter!!!  Nothing like your store bought jelly.  I am not a jelly fan but ate all of it both mornings!!!  As for the service it was pretty good.  They were slammed on the first morning but were pleasant.  The family atmosphere really made the hustle and bustle not so bad.  The second time we went in they remembered us and took the time to talk for a few minutes and show their appreciation for us coming back so soon.  Very nice touch!  Overall this now my favorite breakfast joint from Triple D.  Whenever I travel to Phoenix I will plan to stop in.  I would highly recommend it to anyone that wants breakfast cooked the way it should be!

Loved the food! The location is a little tight though, so be prepared to sit very close to other tables. I wasn't a fan of how clustered it felt. But the food was delicious. Eat the sourdough bread with the homemade jam! Talk about a perfect blend of flavors. I could eat it all day. Ordered a breakfast sandwich and it was great. I'll be back.

The low down: Small Menu , fresh local ingredients, long wait...  Food Ordered : The Skinny (4 egg whites scrambled with gruyere cheese, local organic baby spinach, and chicken apple sausage cooked in olive oil and served with a simple little salad) - the scramble was very good but had a few shortfalls - they were 'skinny' on the egg whites and over compensated with too much gruyere. The simple salad was simply tasty and refreshing.  Waffle (made from scratch Belgian style waffle, sweet cream butter and real maple syrup with two slices of thick-cut bacon) - basic breakfast selection that didn't disappoint.  Overall we were satisfied with the newer location. However, they did not start our experience off on the right foot. There was a 30 minute wait to be seated so we went next door to get a coffee. When our table was ready they told us we could not bring in our coffees but could sit them at the front of the restaurant due to "health code violations"  (No such code exists) so word to the wise, if you don't want to waste your $6 Starbucks coffee then I'd skip going there while you wait.
Seriously my first experience was a few weeks back and it was one of the worst breakfasts I have ever had.  I wanted to like this place but our meals were awful.  Very bland

I went to Matt's today for the first time with my wife.   I was pretty excited to try this place as I heard it was the # 1 breakfast joint in the Phoenix.  Well if this was the best place "Phoenix we have a problem".   My wife ordered coffee and it was cold and the cup was cracked.  I ordered the Huevos Rancheros special on Monday and it was bland cold and looked like crap on a plate.  My wife ordered eggs & Bacon with Hash browns.   They gave her cold eggs burnt bacon and potatoes not hash browns.  Really very disappointing and I  expected to love the food.   I can't believe the food was this bad maybe they had an off day but it's going to be hard to get me back.

Pancakes were awesome, strawberry lemonade was great. The chop and chick was pretty good, it's why we went. The home made strawberry jam was the star!! We had a miscommunication with the server and my plate was taken prematurely. Other than that, it was great.

I just don't get it.  I have been there twice.  First time was about 2 years ago and both my wife and myself thought it was nothing more than average.  We thought with all the popularity there must be something great here and were somewhat disappointed so decided to try again.  This time was even more of a disappointment.  Somewhat of a long wait.  Then the food:  well if your going there for a standard eggs, bacon, hash browns....you may as well go to Denny's.  I'm not sure what they did to the hash browns but they were terrible and tasted nothing like hash browns.  As for the price I recall being $9 +.  Very expensive for 2 eggs, bacon, nasty has browns and toast.  I always like to give a restaurant a second chance so now I am done with Matt's big breakfast.  Of course there are many other menu items and based on the crowd they always have, they must be doing something right.  I'm just saying that if all your looking for is a standard egg breakfast, this is not the place you want to go.
Good food. Nice location. A little loud inside due to high ceilings and outside due to jets flying overhead.

Great service and great food. The seasoned bacon is to die for! Portions are very large and filling.  Minus 1 star due to Mimosas being $8 and very small (could barely taste champagne), and when I asked for a toast substitute the only thing they could offer was 2 slices of tomato, that's it. (Most restaurants would offer fruit or cottage cheese).  Will definitely be back!

This is the greatest little breakfast joint in downtown Phoenix! We stopped here on our way out of town. The staff was incredibly friendly, everyone checked in on us, not just our waitress. The food was amazing. They have a simple menu and are excellent at preparing the food that they offer. The biscuits and gravy tasted great, and came to the table very quickly. We would definitely recommend this place, and will visit again!

Why go to Wendy's a few steps away when you can get a high-quality, wholesome breakfast from a local diner?   We had a pretty darned good breakfast -especially for airport food. I loved our awesomely sassy server who offered gracious, quick, and efficient service.  I ordered a waffle with bacon (next time I'll get even more of that crazy delish bacon!), which came with real butter and syrup. My husband ordered the hot oatmeal -without the listed raisins- and our server very thoughtfully brought a side of a fruit compote as a substitute add-in, which was perfect.  Including fresh OJ for me and unlimited coffee for him, our total was just $27.  Our server even brought a coffee to-go for my husband to take on our flight. We'll be back!

Picasso. Michelangelo. Da Vinci. What do these names have in common? They are some of the world's most renowned artists... each contributing    their different talents to this dynamic field. There is another group of modern artists who are taking the world by storm and changing the way we do breakfast. These amazing artists are the Matt's Big Breakfast chefs. Two words: pure craft. Breakfast at Matt's isn't a mere quick two egg breaky with some hashies and meat; rather, it's an art form. This experience will change your perspective on what breakfast is and what it can be. I would write a more descriptive account of Matt's food but I would not be doing it justice. "Art speaks where words are unable to explain". Matt's Big Breakfast is like a hybrid between Disneyland and the Grand Canyon... a harmonious combination of pure happiness and awe.  Also, the bacon is dumb THICCC

An hour wait and well worth it. This breakfast will put you into the best food coma you've ever had before noon. When you wake up at 3 pm all you'll be thinking about is the amazing bacon and fresh squeezed orange juice that put you out.
I love this place. I always get the salami scramble with strawberry honey lemonade. ALWAYS. Because it's the most amazing thing on the planet. Just go for it.

3.5-4 stars. Bumped up the rating because the servers were so nice considering how crazy/busy it was.  Small hole-in-the-wall breakfast place. Loved the cranberry walnut bread. Coffee was good. Had the 3 egg, mozzarella, spinach special which was good. Nicely made home fries & hash. Fast but very friendly service.

My husband and I just moved downtown and were excited to explore the local breakfast places. Matt's was within walking distance so it was one of the first places we tried. We did have to wait a little bit but they have a nice seating area outside with water for those hot days :-) we were so glad we waited because the food was outstanding! Reasonably priced, fun atmosphere and great food. We can't wait to go again!

It was my friend's birthday and she wanted to celebrate it here and have brunch. Coming here, I wasn't sure where to park & I couldn't find a parking spot so I parked at the visitors parking lot right beside the old Matt's big breakfast ($4 for 2 hrs). The wait was not bad, we waited for 20 mins. for a group of 7. When we were inside, the noise level was very loud, it was busy. Our table & chairs was set up really close together with the other tables so there's no room, we can't extend our feet and arms. I have no where to put my purse so I hanged it on my chair. I ordered the Hog & chick, it was very delicious. The hash browns were crispy, bacon was thick and yummy, my egg whites were perfect and my sourdough toast was very good with their home made jam! I also tried their freshly squeezed orange juice, i love it! it was not too acidic! Service was good they keep up with refilling our drinks and if we need anything else. I love everything!

I thought the food was really good here. I went just like everyone else because of Diners, Drive-in's and Dives and some other local input. I can't even tell you how long we waited. It was unbelievable. The quality was good and the price was great. I would have given it 4 stars if we didn't wait outside for at least 2 hours. The place only holds like 5 tables so the service better be good. We have not been back because it's hard to justify that length of time waiting to eat.
I went here for breakfast this morning and found 2 large black hairs inside of my pancakes.

Matt loves Big Breakfasts and he cannot lie.  (You other brothers can't deny) --Rejected Sir Mix a Lot lyrics  I've had Matt's bookmarked for a long time and had the morning off so we decided to try this spot out. The restaurant is in a commercial building complex almost exclusively consisting of State Farm Insurance around the Tempe Town Lake area. Parking was easier than I thought. Once you enter the Marina Heights garage there's a sign that tells you where customers can park, and the garage offers your first two hours of parking for free.   Once you get to the restaurant there's a takeout entrance and the regular entrance. The regular entrance is a bit weird in that you have to go through the patio to enter the front door.   I had the scramble daily special. It consisted of fluffy eggs, leaf spinach, lightly sweet Niman Ranch apple chicken sausage, and Havarti cheese. You have your choice of potato and toast- I chose home fries and sourdough. The home fries were perfectly seasoned and delicious. I also enjoyed the sourdough toast.  I had a bite of the salami scramble with hash browns. The salami was cut in long chunky strips and tasted good with the eggs. The hash browns were nice and crispy but were waaay overseasoned. It was too salty for my tastes and when we flipped the pile of hash browns over we noticed that the entire bottom portion was totally coated with their salt/pepper mix which explains the overseasoning.   Prices were reasonable for the quality of food we got. I appreciate that they use sustainable and more humanely raised meats, and that to go boxes are in compostable containers.  So if you're in the Tempe Town Lake area and want breakfast, at Matt's, this Breakfast Got Back!

This is my favorite breakfast spot in the city. The food is fresh and delicious, the portion sizes are large but not giant, the lemonade and jam are pretty much straight off the tree. And the specials have always been artfully paired and very tasty. I just wish it was physically larger, but that is the nature of downtown.   If there was a West Valley location, we'd be in every other weekend.

Great atmosphere and service. Fresh, home cooked breakfast with house made blueberry preserves for the yummy while-wheat toast. I had the scrambled eggs with salami - the salami reminded me of our trip to France. My husband had traditional eggs and bacon. The bacon is thick and peppered. I had the famous home fries - potatoes, onions, and fresh rosemary - great flavor an huge portion. I will ask for a small side next time! I hope Yelp updates the address - they've moved a few doors down. Try out Matt's Big Breakfast next time you are downtown in Phoenix.

Sit down breakfast options are super limited in the Phoenix airport and Matt's in generally packed.  I ordered the salami scramble and fresh juice that was pretty good.  Service was okay.  Nothing spectaular, nothing terrible.  OK option if you're not in a big hurry.

Went there today... very good food and good prices with quick and friendly staff. I saw the restaurant on Diners, Drive ins and Dives... I'm from out of town but I'm sure I'll go back this weekend before I leave!!!

We love that Matt's opened another location! The food is just as good as the original and makes us love them even more. I always get the waffle and my husband gets the special of the day. The orange juice is to die for and so fresh, I usually end up ordering two large Oj's and then one more to take home (yes I know I might have a problem, too bad there is not AA for orange juice addicts)!

I enjoyed the atmosphere of Matt's Big Breakfast near Tempe Town Lake...however, that's about all I can say for the place. The food was mediocre at best, not even as good as an omelette you might order at a Denny's or IHOP.  They brought us over coffee as soon as we sat, without asking if we wanted it (at first we thought this was a nice gesture, until two coffees popped up on our bill later).  For a breakfast joint located in Arizona, the hottest salsa they have is Tapatio- they don't even carry Chiluba or Tabasco for heavens sake (sacrilegious in my book).  Also, I must say that the menu was quite small; I felt that there were very few options, it was almost too easy to decide which entree to order.

Ok so I heard great things so maybe the bar was set unreasonably high.  Ham on the bone- awesome Bacon- good, great if u love lots of pepper Poached eggs- really good Toast- great Pancakes -awesome Scrambled eggs- average Potatoes- awesome Hash browns- not fresh so oily Extra syrup for pancakes 1.50. Really?  Just charge me more upfront for the pancakes and save me the story about syrup direct from Vermont Staff- awesome Dude at front counter- possibly too much coffee this morning, to tight of a blue shirt, or just an ego issue.  He was not equally not polite to customers and staff.  All in all par
All yummy food! Make sure you go to Downtown location. Tempe location is not as good as the original. Will definitely be back

What a great place. We were greeted by friendly people and seated in an open air dining room where we enjoyed delicious food! The home fries were stratospheric and they are a must! I had eggs with tortillas and beans with Chile sauce.  Chi chi! Arrival! Que bueno. My son, Ned, had the waffle which he loved. My wife had the bacon and eggs with home fries of course and loved it. The coffee was good! Everything was great.

Kayla Becker's "Fleek Scale" (5 being SUPER ON FLEEK, 1 being FLEEK-less)   **5**  SUPER ON FLEEK- This is my favorite breakfast spot downtown. I like that their menu is limited, so I don't have to worry about my indecisiveness getting in the way. I almost always just order the special. If you go on the weekends, prepare to wait, but I promise the lines move quickly.   Things I'd like to see: mimosas and bloody Mary's. My friend and I asked once if they served mimosas and our waitress looked at us like we were alcoholics. We aren't, but if we were, even more reason to slam some OJ and champagne in front of us.   Things I could go without seeing: Since alcohol is not served, I'd assume this spot would qualify as a family establishment. With that said, the waitresses could cover up their tatas. When I ordered biscuits, what was busting out of their shirts weren't what I meant. But your boyfriend might be okay with it.   Overall - love this spot. I crave it often.

Got 3 dishes because me and the boyfriend are greedy like that.  Eggs with salami was truly outstanding. Creative and delicious. Eggs and pork chop were ok. Chop flavor was good but a bit over cooked. Waffle was good, nothing special. Hash browns and home fries both pretty good, not great. Good coffee.

Delish!! I went here with a friend a few weeks ago on a Sunday. We were expecting a huge wait but luckily we just beat the Sunday church rush. The menu is simple, but it definitely works. The waffle was amazing! I personally hate bacon, but even that looked delicious. It isn't just another breakfast chain down the street, it is really about quality food. I will definitely be back :)
Outstanding scrambles!  Great food and friendly service.  I ordered the special - a scramble - which was the best I have ever had.  I'll be back.

Before flying out of Phoenix, we decided to fuel up by having breakfast here.  We were drawn to the location based on the number of reviews.   So, we decided to give it a try.    We ate in their new location, apparently, the restaurant was down the block and about 1/2 the size it is now.   The staff/workers all welcomed us with friendly chat.  They all sported vans, skinny jeans, t-shirts and a zip up sweat shirts.  The industrial like environment made conversations bounce off walls which caused it to be loud and sometimes difficult to hear.  But, it was clean and service was FAST!  I ordered the breakfast special.  Our waiter praised the deliciousness of their french toast and apple smoked sausage.  Wow, was he correct.  The french toast was incredible.  The sausage was good.  I normally do not eat pork products anymore, so my rating of "good"; I am sure does not do it justice.  My husband does not eat pork products, so when we asked about alternatives like chicken sausage, turkey bacon or Soy; they did not have any.  So, his breakfast choice immediately became limited.  He ordered the cheese omelet.  It was filled with mushrooms, and red peppers.  Potatoes and a side of bread accompanied his dish.  The coffee was not bad; but at the same time left us not thrilled about it either.  So, we strolled a few blocks down to buy some strong brewed Starbucks coffee.  We enjoyed our experience.  If we lived in Phoenix, I am sure we'd eat there again.  However, on our next visit; we'll probably choose another place with meat alternatives and more green chile.

My wife, my 2 boys and myself were in Downtown Phoenix this weekend and ate at Matt's.  We now have a new favorite. Everything we ordered (Pepper Scamble, Griddlecakes, Waffle, Hog & Chick) was the best we ever had.  This place is like breakfast Heroine.  We are addicted and cannot wait to go back.

I am not really sure why I haven't reviewed this place before.  This is probably our favorite place to eat out for breakfast.  While we certainly haven't tried all the breakfast establishments around, we haven't felt the need!  I LOVE the pancakes here!  Hands down, the best I've ever eaten!  I also enjoy the toast and housemade jam.  I remember when this place was in that teeny, tiny spot downtown and was soooo happy when they moved to a larger place...and now new locations!

The place is so cute and unique. It is always crowded. I crave for their harshbrown. I think theirs is the best I ever tasted! It is crunchy and yummy. My husband loves their pork chop. I recommend to come early because they are usually packed with local people

Upbeat and urban very much a change of pace from your everyday breakfast & brunch dinner. Staff is friendly and catering to every need. Don't be scared of by the sworn of people waiting outside, good eats await you inside.  Looking for some good pancakes you found the place. Fluffy and filling and don't forget the homemade lemonade.

This place is awesome.   It was the 1st time I had been there and I  sorry I didn't go sooner!   They have excellent food and lemonade and have fast, friendly service.   The bacon is to die for!   Will be going back soon!

My all time favorite place to have breakfast! My girlfriend takes me there every time that I am in town! I recommend the Belgium waffle and their bacon is amazing! I absolutely love this place! They should have more nationwide!

My Uber driver advised I try this place before I left Phoenix, so I took the recommendation. It was more crowded than I expected but all good places are. I waited for the hostess to take my name down but he kept acting like people weren't standing and staring at him to say hello. After a few times of this a waiter spoke to everyone which saved me from walking away. The hostess still hadn't said a word so I did and just decided to sit at the bar since something was available. I ordered the French Toast an egg and a Mimosa. So GOOD!!! The ladies at the bar were quick and pleasant, made sure everyone was served and would check back frequently. Everyone else and the food made up for the flustered hostess. Glad I got to visit, I'm sure I will be back!

Come hungry!   The portions are generous.   My husband ordered The Pancakes, nice flavor and very fluffy.  Served with maple syrup.  I used my blueberry preserves from my Toast.    I ordered the omelette with cheese, lots of cheese.  I ordered a side of bacon with my eggs which I expected it to be included in my meal.    The Vibe is cool here!  The crowd is loud.  Good place to meet friends for breakfast, just don't expect anything fancy.    Simple is good.    Servers are quick and friendly.  My coffee cup was always full.
This place is soooooo good, a must when traveling to Phoenix!

We found this gem while traveling. This is seriously one of the best places I've ever had breakfast at. I had the omelet with cheese and sausage, served with hash browns, strawberry honey lemonade, thick cut wheat toast, served with homemade preserves, and the pancakes.  -The Omelet was very hearty, I ordered it with sausage crumbles, and hash browns that were super crispy, which I loved.  - The thick cut wheat toast that came with my meal was insanely delicious with the homemade strawberry preserves that was served with it.  - The pancakes were huge, fluffy, and super delicious. I used my leftover strawberry preserves to use as a topping for my pancakes. OUT OF THIS WORLD!  This will be my go-to place, anytime I go to Arizona. I know it gets pretty crowded, we lucked out ND got seated right away. I honestly wouldn't mind waiting. The quality of food and service here will make it worth it. I look forward to visiting soon!

Ordered the smothered and covered.  The food came out nasty and covered in cold gravy!  WTF!  The food was cold.  The ideas was great, the flavors reminded me of Hamburger Steak with gravy back home in Hawaii.  Also, if you ask for hot sauce, specifically Tabasco, they only have Tapatio!  WTF, cheap hot sauce.  Luckily j brought my own Tabasco sauce to the party!

I love a good breakfast place on the weekend but...I don't like to drive (and sometimes I don't have time to catch the light rail from Tempe to Downtown) so though I love Matt's Big Breakfast, my culinary dalliances with this well known establishment were sadly, few and far between.  However, to use a cliche, as Mohammad did not want to take the time to get to the mountain, the mountain has come to Mohammad with an extension of this chain right near ASU in the buildup of State Farm and many other places along Rio Salado. As such, I set up a breakfast date with friends, put on my hoodie (it's chilly early on a January morning folks) and peddled over to this location, and it lovely!  Nestled amid a delightful little corporate park, with plenty of space for tables and a long breakfast bar, it is hard to imagine the original and tiny location that is now just a storage space.  One side of the restaurant has glass doors through which one can see the outer area (which is lovely) and of course, when the weather is warmer, they can be opened up for outside seating. As for the food, just as good as the other location(s) with a focus on simply prepared but delicious food. I had the waffle with two strips of bacon for about $9 and added two scrambled eggs for another $3. I also had a cup of their wonderfully strong Joe so make sure to ask for cream if you want to take the edge off.   As it is near the college I'm sure you can get breakfast all day so if your Saturday or Sunday starts when others eat lunch, you are still good. The one thing I don't think they have is any adult beverages, which is not uncommon at many establishments in the Tempe area so something to be aware of if that is a consideration on your part.  Oh, if you don't want to ride your bike there is free parking by the restaurant so you don't necessarily have to park in the parking garage (and I don't know if that requires payment or is free, like I said, I tend to ride my bike in this area). So, go check out their newest location.  I don't think you will be dissappointed.:-)

Sorry but I really don't get the hype of this place. As you may know from reading my other reviews, my bf and I are poor and like to eat cheap. This is why we consult diners drives in and dives everytime we go to a new city. My bf and I were super excited after a positive experience at Chino Bandido (which was also a DDD recommendation).   I will admit that I'm a little biased when it comes to breakfast food (I hate the majority of it) but the Chop and Chick seemed non breakfasty enough for me especially since I got homefries. They didn't know what I meant when I asked for a soft boiled egg so I got my eggs poached. BF got the hog and chick.   We were so disappointed when our meal came out. The portions were normal sized and everything just tasted ok. The sourdough with fresh strawberry preserves was the only special thing about the meal. I wished the sourdough were more sour though. The porkchop didn't have much flavor and was a little tough. My BF felt the same about his order. We walked out feeling like we would've been just as happy going to Dennys (and then I would have had more non breakfast options too!)
We got seated right away waitress was polite and food was awesome we will definitely be back

I love this place!   Yes, the wait is long. I knew that going in, so it didn't really upset me. It's not as long if you go a little earlier in the morning.   The service is great. The owners are warm and cheery and remembered me the second time I went in!   The fresh squeezed orange juice is super yummy! Last time I went I got the porkchop and eggs. Mmmmm....

Love this place. Love this place. Let's talk about the bread and jam. It is to die for. I could eat that as my meal. But every time I go I order something new and it is great. I would recommend everything on the menu. I'm really happy that the moved to a bigger location because I use to wait in line for this food. This is a must go.
Service was great. Food was healthy & fresh with homemade jam & amazing pancakes! We will return for sure! Highly recommend it.

Oh my god. My first experience at MBB was on Good Friday, and it made it an Awesome Friday. The bacon was one of the more memorable things. Thick and cooked perfectly. Oh! And that delicious Honey Lemonade. Such a quaint little spot. Cute, small restaurant makes it feel small-town. The wait wasn't too bad either, but, I haven't been on the weekend yet.  Can't wait to go again!
This place had a really laid back vibe that made the experience welcoming! Everyone was extremely nice and everyone was helpful. The food was amazing. Def coming back when in Phoenix!

Thanks Yelpers, I found this place when looking for a place to have breakfast and all the good reviews were spot on.  The menu is limited but the food is delicious.  The only reason why I don't give it 5 starts is because of space in the restaurant, but other than that, it is a great place and I'm definitely coming back when I'm back in Phoenix.

It's ok, and it is different.  I don't really get all the excitement about, it's novelty food.  I had "The Hog & Chick" and wasn't really impressed at all.  The novelty factor going on is a play on the word "big."  But it's not big servings, it's odd cuts.  Instead of 2 slices of toast, you get a single slice that's about an inch thick.  Three strips of bacon that are about double thickness.  To me it was just novelty though, there's a reason toast isn't that thick and bacon is usually sliced thinner.  When it's cut this way the toast was just a bit too much like a mouth full of bread, and the bacon was chewy, not crispy.  On the positive side, the hashbrowns were great, the over easy eggs were done perfectly, the waitress was very friendly, and the service was amazingly fast (Tuesday Morning, 7:30AM).  I'd consider going back for the service alone.  But I wasn't a fan of the food.  It was fairly average, which I guess is impressive for novelty size/slice items?  But I don't get how this can be getting so many 5 star ratings for being great service but otherwise just high priced novelty food.

Everything here was amazing, from the service, to the food! This includes the coffee. From the time I sat down, ordered my food, and received it, it took 10 minutes. The eggs were some of the best I've ever ate. I'll be traveling back to this area in a month, and will be hitting up this place.

Matthew was my server and he was fantastic!  He was prompt, efficient, friendly, and got my order right!  He was working a number of tables and I was quite impressed watching him maneuver and ensure everyone was cared for.  The restaurant is in Terminal 4 so quite busy but they seemed to be turning the tables well.  I had just a couple minute wait but they also have an express option - takeout area - for those that don't have time.  I had an omelet that was very good.  The restaurant itself is clean and comfortable.  The hostess was friendly as was the person that delivered my food.  Good experience all around - which I certainly appreciate when in the midst of airport hustle/bustle.

The Chop and Chix was pretty good. The sourdough toast was huge and thick and the home fries were delicious. The only thing I didn't like was the lack of seasoning on the meat. It's as though they didn't use any salt. The Blueberry lemonade was amazing!! It reminded me of being down South.

I take all of my out of state company to Matt's. Solid, farm fresh, local menu. Thick cut, peppered bacon, housemade lemonades and orange juices and Cave Creek Coffee are just a few of the staples here. Try the chop and chick -traditional egg breakfast, served along a smoked and seared pork chop. To die for!!

There are not enough words to describe how much I like Matt's. It is the most awesome breakfast place ... not just in Phoenix, not just at the Airport, but it is the top of our list ANYWHERE! We recently had the opportunity to be on a flight that was late and missed our connection causing an overnight ... woo hoo ... we got to go to Matt's for breakfast!!! Great service ... spectacular menu ... all the things we like in a place ... AND good coffee.

As a Matt, and as a breakfast lover this was a slam dunk.   As far as airport food goes, this is one of the better places I've had and with reasonable prices. I think it was around $9 for the Five Spot Platter and around $8 for the egg salad sandwich. Both were big portions and I distinctly remember the bacon in the Five Spot Platter being extra-large, juicy, and thick.   Sometimes, after a long flight you want to get fed and filled up like a dump truck. Matt's will take care of that for you. It was also close to our American Airlines terminal.  Also, it was open late which is a relief because as it turns out there are a ton of options to eat in this airport but a lot of them aren't open late (11pm or later).   I should also shout-out our waitress. She was an absolute hoot. Being from drought-stricken California, I asked for water tentatively. She responded by ribbing me and saying she would have to check if "water" was on the menu. All in good fun and she was super attentive even though Matt's was packed. Must be the whole open-late thing.   Very hefty, very filling, and because everyone says breakfast is the most important meal of the day, I would recommend putting Matt at the top of your list of places to eat in Phoenix's airport.

One of my favorite downtown breakfast places.  Do wish they opened earlier on weekdays.  I love the bacon--some of the best I've had--and recommend the french toast, the pancakes.  The coffee and OJ are fine, the service is fine.  Had one dish w/ the hashbrowns--they were so-so..don't recommend them.    But the french toast and bacon are what's worth coming back for again and again...

Been to the 32nd st location a few times, been to the downtown location a few times....great food at both locations, what I appreciate is the consistency.  Some of my favorite bacon of any restaurant.  Had the Hog & Chick (bacon, scrambled eggs, hash browns, toast).  Everything well prepared and tasty...the strawberry preserves for the toast was good.  Coffee and OJ completed the meal.
Excellent food, fantastic atmosphere. I would eat here everyday if I lived here. The waffle was the perfect and everything was absolutely phenomenal

Went here this morning for breakfast with a friend. Waited about 10 min to get a table, not long. The honey lemonade was amazing. I ordered the special, French toast... It was crispy, moist, and delicious! I wanna go back next week! Lol   Service was good, food came out timely, correctly and cooked well too.   Prices are average for breakfast place.   Overall I really liked it and being my first time here, now it won't be my last!

Truly the best breakfast we have ever eaten out. Everything is fresh and above quality ingredients.   The omelet had sauted portabello mushrooms, thick cut bacon and real cheddar cheese.  Belgium waffle so fresh and tasty served with real maple syrup. The add on hash browns were real fresh shredded potatoes.   Plan on an hour wait for a table but the staff is wonderful and food is so worth the wait.

Please, people! For the love of God, stay home! Do not come to Matt's Big Breakfast.  You will not enjoy the crispy, fresh hash browns. You would not like the weekend specials, such as huevos rancheros with fresh salsa, or scrambles made with seasonal, organic ingredients. A cheese and mushroom omelette will not appeal to you. They do not serve delicious Wildflower Bread toasted with most entrees. The coffee will not be piping hot and the iced tea will certainly not be tasty and delightful.  And whatever you do, please do not order one of the waffles made from scratch. They come dusted with powdered sugar, served with warm syrup and a big scoop of butter. You probably wouldn't like it.  If, for some unknown reason, you found yourself at Matt's for lunch, you would not enjoy the Butter Burger. It would not be served on a delicious roll and topped with gooey melty cheese and a thick slice of tomato. No it wouldn't. The macaroni salad is not an excellent substitute for the kettle chips that normally accompany said Burger.  For the last time, please stay away. May I recommend you get your breakfast on at the perfectly adequate U.S-Egg-Good-Peep, or First Watch? The lines at Matt's are long enough as it is, and the regulars are getting cranky about it.

So this place may be a bit overrated. I arrived around 9 on a Tuesday morning, and I only waited about 5 minutes. I was happy not to wait long, but shocked at the ridiculously small space. Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives really makes it look much bigger.  I don't know if it's my roots in southern breakfast or the mediocre flavoring that caused me to leave this place without much of a lasting impression. The staff was extremely nice, and I loved the fresh squeezed orange juice. Just not worth me getting up extra to include the place in my stops before work in Tempe, AZ.

Get take out or go late in the morning to avoid the long wait. Aside from that, this was the best breakfast I've ever had. Period. The pancakes were perfect. I didn't know pancakes could be this good. The bacon and hashbrowns were equally amazing. You might ask, how can you improve upon bacon, hashbrowns, and pancakes?  A fair question. The answer is, go try it and find out, you slacker.
Local breakfast spot. Awesome. My wife loves the Waffles. I tend to get different things everytime and the eggs are bomb. There's almost always a short wait but that goes by quickly.

Just be informed!!   My Husband and I went to Matt's Big Breakfast in Tempe. After waiting 45 minutes I noticed that several groups of 3 and 4 people, who arrived and registered after us, had been seated and were eating.  When I asked the host if he had forgotten us, his comment was, and I quote, "no I haven't forgotten you, I just don't want to waste a table on you." As he explained, when busy,  all the parties of two are seated at the counter, on metal stools without backs. If he would have informed us of their seating policy when we checked in, we would have politely gone somewhere else. As it was, I was hungry and unhappy. We stayed, the food was pretty good and we are never going back.....Just so you know!

Overrated, overrated, overrated.  The food was OK, the service sucked, they don't have ranch dressing, and they don't  have any restrooms on site... which is unacceptable in my opinion.  After waiting over an hour and listening to all the people raving about how good the food was outside, I had high hopes. My over easy eggs were soupy, more like under easy, nasty, and the guy next to me complained hes eggs were soupy as well. Something as simple as eggs should be cooked to perfection if this place was so good. The bacon and ham were pretty good, but nothing extra ordinary. The hash browns were soaked in butter and cooked with some short of pepper mix that tasted like crap. The pancakes were just pancakes with maple syrup, tasted exactly like pancakes from crackle barrel, whatever. The only thing at this place I can honestly say was the best I've ever had was the whole wheat toast.   The food was ok. If their wasn't a wait it would be worth eating at, but other then that, places like Chompies and The Breakfast Club are far superior.
Love Matt's! Simple and delicious! Pancakes are so yummy!

MY GF and I drove here on the Harley. Nice day, and nice ride into town. We got there just in time for a 1 hour wait. We just sat inside and waited our turn and just people watched.  I got the Cheese, bacon omelette with a side of bacon, and rye toast. Omelette was very good, they dazzeled it with Rosemary, that set the omelette off. The bacon is thick as Sunday ham slices. It's also prepared with cracked pepper chucks on the bark (outside of the bacon). Very yummy, I'd go back just to order heaping plates of those slabs of goodness. Coffee was a local roasted bean, couldn't say I liked it, couldn't say I loved it, basic drip coffee, im an expresso man so my tastes are cor stronger coffee. Toast is cut nice and thick! They provided some Blue Berry jam that looked home made, it was defiantly a flavor bomb.  I will be back.
It was delicious! Loved atmosphere, very busy at the time I went on a Friday morning sometime between 8 and 9. Food was fresh! Highly recommend!

This place was featured in Food Network and since I was in town, I thought I'll give it a try.  I got there around 12pm (rush hour) and waited 45 minutes for a table.  The staff was very friendly and helpful but super busy.    Coffee was your typical coffee, nothing special there.  The salami scramble was to die for, the flavor was amazing!  The waffles were awesome, so fluffy and soft.  The bacon was thick but it was too burnt for my preference.  The fresh jam on the thick white toast was delicious!    Overall, the food was excellent and it was worth the 45 minutes wait.

Such incredible breakfast! It loses one star because of the waiting time, expect to wait an hour, but the farmers market is across the street on Saturday so just tell them you'll be there when you put in your name and problem solved! Pancakes are huge and delicious and everything else is up to par :)

I have friends that rave about this place but because it's a ways from my neighborhood and due to the wait, I just never made the effort to try it out until this weekend. I met up with a couple of friends yesterday for brunch. There was a line when we arrived and I think we ended up waiting about 30 minutes, which was fine and expected, we used the time to catch up. We were seated in the little semi-private room right up front where an old skillet is - very cute. The menu is diverse but isn't huge. Two of my friends got two of the breakfast items I was eyeing and said I could try some, so I got the Big Butter Burger and Honey Lemonade. The honey lemonade is amazing. Something you could definitely make at home but I did not mind paying for that sweet sweet juice. The burger was very good, not extraordinary. I thought I would be fine with the kettle chips but I wish I had gotten coleslaw instead. What blew my mind though was the griddlecakes. OH the griddlecakes. Honestly. So good. And the bacon. Fantastic. Their lunch is good but they serve breakfast all day so just go and eat griddlecakes and bacon.

Everything that everyone says it is and more. Super delicious. Everything was made to perfection! I had the waffle and bacon, my friend had the pancakes. May have been the best pancakes I've ever had.
The wait here is horrible! We were quoted 30 minutes & now we're still waiting more than an hour later! Sorry Matt's but you suck!

GRANDMA !!!!!! ARE YOU BACK IN THAT KITCHEN?? GET OUT OF THERE!!!   That's basically how I always describe this place.. "Its grandma breakfast"... you know fresh, cooked to order, and way too much!   I have always loved Matts and have been coming for many years...the only thing I hate.. the wait.. (well, that and the unfinished, sloppy paint job in the dining room)   The food is ALWAYS great here... their pork products are amazing! Super fresh cage-fee chicken eggs, local produce and hearty THICKLY sliced breads served with a side of strawberry lavender preserves... yummy. If you're not in a hurry and have the time to endure the wait... this place is HIGHLY recommended!   Although my grandma left me many years ago... her breakfast spirit lives here!

I ordered 2 eggs over medium hashbrowns & the Griddle Cakes. My husband had the Classic Reuben.   SERVICE - 2 stars - Waitresses were rude. And were transparently erked when we asked for Non Dairy Creamer. TASTE - 4 stars - Food was really good. But my eggs were over easy not over medium, the way I ordered them.  VALUE - 1 star - they give you 2oz of syrup for an entire order of Griddle Cakes... then charge you $1.50 for every 2oz of extra syrup you order. My husbands Reuben had hardly any meat on it.   OVERAll - 2.3 ... Taste was excellent but service and bang for my buck did not meet, even my most minimum of stanfards.  BOTTOM LINE Will I be going back?... probably not.  Will I recommend to a friend... NO!

First time here and I was very impressed!   Really wanted an omelette and great hash browns and that's exactly what I got. Everything from the house made jelly preserves, to the organic chocolate milk, I fully enjoyed all the food.  The server was a little slow but I understood because it was a packed house, the lovely manager and food runner with short hair were helping us with whatever we needed and we appreciated it!   I will be back for the amazing bacon however, perfectly peppered and thick, just how I enjoy it!   5/5.

My favorite place when at PHX airport.  The food is delicious, service is absolutely great!  I've spent 10 minutes to 3 hours there depending on flights, and I'm always treated to good food and good service.

Delicious food and amazing service! We got the Hog &  chick, very good thick pepper bacon that I loved. Ask her eggs over easy, should've said over medium.  Just delicious! Potatoes were amazing! Love the rosemary!!

I've decided to make this one short and sweet...  The Menu - Too Small. The Food - Good, but nothing special. The Service - Stellar. The Aesthetics - Cute, 5&Diner-ish, CRAMPED! The Wait - Too long & clearly not worth it.  Just because Guy Fieri ate here...Puh-leeze. 2 Stars because I genuinely appreciate a warm and attentive wait staff.

I have stopped by for a breakfast a few times in the past few weeks.  Great food, reasonable prices, and the City of Phoenix parking meters don't start needing coins until 8 am.  The best part of the place?  Chelsea and Torie (Tory?) are the best servers I have encountered in a LONG time; friendly, attentive to your dining needs, willing to spend some time to get to know you, interested in what you as the customer are doing (with Torie it's books and reading, with Chelsea it's career and family).  Makes for a very pleasant eating experience.

After all these years, I decided to see what the hype was all about. Well I can say that I'm right with the rave reviews. From the fresh squeezed orange juice and perfectly cooked eggs to the amazing bacon and delicious preserves, everything was wonderful. Great service as well. I'll be going back.

Breakfast is the most important meal of the day, and Matt sure likes his eggs and bacon in the morning hours!  I was actually able to get into their newest location and sit a the bar.  I'm not a big lady but the stools were tiny and I kept slipping off the stool.   The staff and service was great.  She was busy however able to fill up my coffee cup without being asked.  I ordered the omelet with cheddar, mushrooms and of course bacon with hash browns and white toast.  Surprisingly the toast and jam, I really enjoyed the most! The omelet was filled with melted cheese, grilled mushrooms and bacon.  The eggs were cooked perfectly and overall the dish was tasty.   Matt's prides itself for making everything from scratch or most of it.  And it is really good, if you are into traditional bacon and egg kind of dishes for breakfast.  The coffee was actually really good and didn't leave a bitter taste.    I would recommend getting there earlier than later due to Matt's reputation in the Valley. The place does get crowded even if it's in a bigger location.   Next time: Waffles!
Pros:  - Bacon - taste beautiful  - potatoes - good - Waffles tasted homemade - Toast - jelly taste homeade  Cons  - the wait time. - the butter burger could've been better.

Just found this place on a drive up Camelback Rd.  Great vibe, great food and really wonderful staff. 3-egg scramble full of bacon, spinach and a little cheese...homemade strawberry jam, hash browns cooked the right way.  My coffee cup never cooled down! All this for less than $20...

Just had breakfast at Matt's on Saturday after moving my daughter into her dorm. It was a short walk away. This is one busy place. You will wait if you have a large party, but I thought it was worth it. Really old brick wall place that has tables and counter service. I had the scramble eggs with bacon, toast, and home fries. The bread and jam are home made! Really good. Bacon was thick cut and had great flavor. No complaints. Everyone enjoyed their meals. I had to finish another one since my wife couldn't.

I came here with my boyfriend Friday morning, it was not very busy. I usually go to the location on downtown, but usually that location is always super pack and the wait is at least 45 min. Food is always amazing here, however the service was not the best. The original location people are super nice and attentive. My server after getting my Oder disappear until she drop off the check, when I was not even done with my food. In my personal opinion I find it a little disrespectful that the servers are rushing you to get out of the restaurant. I hope the service gets better.

Yes you will have to wait. Is it worth it? YES. Today I visited with a friend of mine. I could smell the scent of bacon, coffee which fueled my appetite but I was craving a burger. You know a burger is good when no mayo, mustard, or ketchup are needed. Just the taste os a well cooked burger (side of kettle chips).  Expect a wait, most of the time. Come hungry. Waiting is outside (it is a very, very small building), but worth it. Next time, I will order the breakfast.

Been to this location twice and both time have truly enjoyed my experience. Service has always been great.  The food is simple breakfast done right.    You can't go wrong with Matts Big Breakfast. It can get pretty busy here so if you come during the rush expect to wait 30-40min as it's a small location to begin with.

One of the best parts of my career is that I get to eat around. If eating were sex, I'd safely call myself a whore.  Matt's Big Breakfast isn't just my favorite breakfast in Phoenix. It's quite possibly my favorite breakfast anywhere. Matt and Ernie do it right, and Phoenix is one lucky town for it.  When I work in Phoenix, I conveniently stay just  few blocks away. On my last visit, I made it into Matt's no fewer than four out of the six days I was there.  Yes, you will likely wait outside if you go on the weekend. Not so much on a Tuesday, but perhaps. You never know. It's not important, though. It's so worth the wait. (weight).  Having tried a good portion of the menu, I keep coming back to the "Salami Scramble". It's one of those things you may make in your own kitchen and eat too much of when no one is looking. It's exactly what you imagine it is and, when paired with their amazing hash browns, close to perfection.  If you're feeling hungry enough, the Chop and Chick is the way to go. A delicious, well chosen pork chop with eggs. Sigh.  The quality of the food at Matt's is memorable for its flavor, temperature and love which is clearly sprinkled generously on top of every buttery bite.   Big Breakfast. Big Love. Big Belly.

They pull off the dinner, but in an upscale way. Eggs over easy with hash browns and a pork chop...basic dinner food, but better. The eggs were cooked perfectly, the hash browns were some of the best that I have ever had, and the pork chop was flavorful. The toast, that I put under my eggs came with homemade strawberry jam so I ordered a second order just so I could try it...and it too was great. Their prices are only slightly higher than a dinner. The atmosphere was done very modern but with a salute to an old school dinner. I actually came straight from PHX airport and got there before the crowd. I heard my waitress talking to someone else and she said the "wait" usually starts around 8:30 am. By the time I left, they were on a wait.
Matt's Big Breakfast is hands down the best breakfast spot. The wait can be a little long sometimes but it's 100% worth it once that special comes out. Living in walking distance is dangerous

Great food and service. Pretty simple menu, so if you're looking for anything fancy this is probably not your spot. This place gets busy so expect to wait a few minutes for a table. Worth the wait and visit!

The rental car agency recommended Matt's when we arrived in Phoenix on  Monday morning. She said it's best place in town and normally there are long lines on the weekend so we be good time to go. When we drove up there were people waiting outside, which confirmed the fact that it obviously was well loved. After waiting a short time we were seated. It's a relatively small space but atmosphere and wait staff was great. There is a relatively small menu but everything look and smelled great. Ample servings size, quick service and very helpful and friendly wait staff. I had the chorizo and jalapeno pepper omelette with toast and my wife had the breakfast sandwich. Everything was great and the toast with homemade preserves and butter was amazing.

I know I'm gonna make a lot of enemies with this review but here goes.  It doesn't quite live up to the hype.  Having gotten rave reviews from the local paper and from the community in general, always be prepared to wait about an hour to get a table.  The food is by no means bad, but with the exception of their daily special, their selection is ordinary - this took me by surprise considering how many people rave about the place.  On top of this, the service hasn't been great.  The only time we've had decent service was when the waitress was trying to flirt with my friend, which was honestly rather amusing.  That aside, they do make pretty good pancakes and if you do really insist on seeing what the hype is all about, I advise you to stop by within an hour of opening to avoid the wait.

Mmmm I know everyone raves about Matt's and they aren't necessarily bad, but I don't think they are the best as many may claim.  Let me start off by saying, their service isn't great.  I've been to their original location, before and after the relocation, and now this new one, and hardly ever will you get a smile from anyone working there.  And I've dined there when they've just opened for the day, I've dined a few hours in, I've been there around lunch, on both weekdays and weekends, and smiles have always been, and probably always will be a rarity.  On the bright side, this location did care to ask if we wanted refills for our drinks cause the original location definitely did not.  The food is a little on the pricier side.  Though unfortunately, there isn't much on their menu, and honestly, after not coming to Matt's after all these years, I was expecting to see a little more variety on their menu.  Instead I saw the exact menu I had several years back but now with a little printed insert listing the specials of the day for the week.  In my mind, their saving grace at the original location was the chalkboard, decorated with the special of the day.  Quite unlike the regular menu, it was often something interesting, but this insert was less than interesting that I actually gave it a skip.  Note that whenever a friend dragged me to the original location, I would without a doubt, order the special of the day.  With a side of pancakes.  I guess their food isn't bad, but with all the hype, coupled with less than stellar service, and a menu that hasn't changed all these years, I am a little disappointed.

I love Matt's, BUT! (read on)  I love Matt's - the food is amazing! I love that Matt and his wife are so friendly and they always remember me whether I come into Matt's or The Roosevelt (granted, I AM pretty memorable).  However...  The wait - it is out of control. Now I understand why Hawaiians hate mainlanders - because they have to wait at their favorite spots due to clueless tourists!   Here is my solution, and Matt, if you read these reviews, seriously, consider what I have to say because I am in Mensa (not officially, but I would be if I took the test... I'm certain of it).  Set aside a certain block of time for "LOCALS ONLY", for example, from 6:30 - 8:30 only locals are seated. How does one weed out locals from the lemmings in Tommy Bahama shirts and cameras standing outside? Easy. You must have a card that is punched each time you eat there, and once you have received 5 punches you are considered a local (granted, the first 5 times you go you will be treated like a tourist, but if it's your first time and you're a local, well hell, you're a tourist in my book). Once said card carrying local is verified as legit, he or she keeps the validated card and presents it from that time on.  Now, I can already hear all the naysayers finding fault in this idea, including you Matt. But here's the truth - LOCALS keep this place humming. Tourists are one time tricks, although they do contribute to sales, it is miniscule in comparison to the long term revenue generated by Phoenicians.   So please Matt, do something that is not pc, but is good for the people that take care of you - take care of them back, get the locals in before Mr. & Mrs. Tommy Bahama. This is an amazing idea, and some restauranteur will read this and do it if you don't, so be the first, be a rebel - locals will love you for it, they will cheer your name in the streets and name their first born after you.   Love,   Brandon  (dictated but not read)
Awesome foor. Great service.  Prices are reasonable. Worth the drive. Go during the week for shorter wait

Matt's Big Breakfast was featured on Food Network's Diners, Drive-ins & Drives! And this meant that even though it was a 45 minute wait for brunch, we were going to wait and stick it out. This isn't really related to the food or service but they have a really fantastic mural on the side of their wall. A cute photo op for sure! Anyways, they have a pretty small menu and it's very straightforward. All their lemonades are made with honey too instead of sugar which is an interesting change. We ordered their Honey Strawberry Lemonade and weren't quite sure if we liked it or not. Maybe lemonade is just meant to be made with sugar!  We ordered The Five Spot with House Potatoes (breakfast sandwich with 2 eggs, 2 slices of thick-cut bacon, American cheese, grilled onions) and The Chop & Chick with Hash Browns (2 eggs, skillet-seared Iowa pork rib chop). Now, Guy Fieri actually said on Food Network's Best Thing I Ever Ate that his breakfast of choice is The Chop & Chick. It didn't look too impressive when it came out and it didn't taste all that impressive neither so I have no idea what Guy Fieri is talking about. The pork chop honestly was thin, dry, and pretty flavorless. We didn't like it at all as far as pork chops go. I wouldn't order this or recommend this dish ever. My Five Spot was a little better but it wasn't anything that I could't make at home. Nothing special at all. Just your average breakfast sandwich you can get anywhere. The one thing that really made Matt's stand out was their potatoes. It was seasoned to perfection with herbs and aromatics which made the potatoes the best part of our breakfast. Also the toast and preserves that came with The Chop & Chick. That was also delicious.   Honestly, I wouldn't really recommend Matt's Big Breakfast. It wasn't worth the wait at all and I didn't understand the hype. I don't even understand why it's called Big Breakfast when the portion size was average at best. If I had to dine here again, I would just order their house potatoes with some toast. At least then I wouldn't walk out feeling like I spent too much on some mediocre food. 3/5

Has the semi-fancy breakfast place finally jumped the shark?   I am not sure, but the lines outside Matt's Big Breakfast were certainly an indication of the semi-fancy breakfast joint has remained popular. But why exactly?  Matt's Big Breakfast has good breakfast, certainly. But it wasn't so much different than typical diner food. I will credit them with some of the best bacon I've ever had: Thick cuts of fatty, salty, peppery bacon. Definitely amazing.  But otherwise: Eggs, slightly too herbal potatoes, some toast for $9.  The menu is also surprisingly small with typical waffles and omelets at a definitely price premium. They even have a bowl of Frosted Flakes for $5. Why anyone would go out to eat and pay $5 for that, I cannot fathom.  If it wasn't for that amazing bacon, I would have frankly felt ripped off and that I had wasted my time in line. That's the problem with a lot of semi-fancy breakfast joints, the hype leaves you disapointed.
Close your eyes, spin the menu, point, and order. You will not be disappointed with anything on the menu. Start with the bacon as your meat of choice though.

Disappointed sums it up. I don't understand why this place is so busy? My pork chops with eggs was average at best. Nice sear to the pork chop but it was dry. Would only go back if any co workers wanted to try it out. I'll try the  omelette next time.
The best jelly I have ever tasted, amazing fresh serves orange juice as well. Always very packed! But hey. The food is amazing!! I recommend the waffles!

Went to Matt's this morning for the first time. It was awesome!  Great atmosphere, great food, and great service.  I would highly recommend this place but be prepared to wait for a table. We got lucky and got two seats at the counter. Check it out!  It is worth it!!!
The wait was about 35 minutes on a Monday around noon (party of 2). Food and service was great...we're thinking about going again tomorrow lol

Im here visiting from CA and wanted some breakfast before starting work. I found this place on yelp and decided to give it a try to to.its amazing reviews.  I walked in and they greeted me immediately.  The  girl behind the bar was nice enough to give me $1 change because I didn't have change for the meter.  There menu isnt large at all, limited options. I order the waffle with 2 strips of bacon and ice coffee.  The coffee sucked but the waffle and bacon were AMAZING! !!   I would definitely come back to try something new:)  I would give it 5 stars if the coffee was better.
Amazing breakfast with friendly service and large portions.  Fresh food and great atmosphere!

I found this gem on yelp and we are so glad we did.  Not only was the food excellent but the service was stellar. Everyone was friendly making sure food was good and filling our glasses when they were close to empty. As we were walking out everyone said thank you for coming in and good bye. Wow!! We will definitely be back. Thank you!!

This place is amazing organic local food small business ! They have the same prices as the place they have in town. Hogs and chicks are awesome with peppered bacon the sausage is amazing too. If you order with someone else get one of each so you can share and get both. By far the best dining experience I have had at an airport . Our waiter TIM was outstanding and a great asset to Matt's Big Breakfast! Way to go Phoenix AirPort for allowing local business!! If you go here comment and tell me what you think. Oh ya cheap too $
I know this isn't really a bar but these were absolutely the worst Bloody Mary's I've ever had.

First time checking out this location.   Went on a Saturday around 10:30am so expected to wait. Manager quoted us 30-45 minutes. Lots of open seating which made it seem understaffed.   Waited about 30 minutes.   Service was meh. She greeted us quick but not friendly. Kept up on water refills but didn't check on us too much after we got our food.   We waited about 20-25 minutes for our food. Boyfriend ordered the special which was a three egg scramble with pork tenderloin, Fresno peppers and Cabot white cheddar served with a tortilla and home fries. He requested home fries extra crispy and they came out super soft. There were two tiny pieces of the Fresno peppers in the scramble and the pork tenderloin was roughly chopped into large pieces with little to no flavor. Pretty bland.   I ordered the five spot with a side of hash browns. Both of mine were absolutely delicious but very greasy. They may have confused the "crispy" request for my hash browns but they turned out great.   Took a while for our server to get us our check and a box. Bathroom was out of paper towels. Overall just not a great experience. I'll definitely return but either during the week or earlier on the weekend.

I heard about this place on diners, drive ins, and drives and wanted to try this place for years. So I finally had the opportunity today. I had looked in the previous reviews and pictures and had my heart set on the French toast only to find out it is not on the menu everyday ( it is a small daily menu) needless to say I was disappointed by that. I ended up getting an omelette with mushrooms, onions, and cheddar that came with hash browns and sourdough toast. It was good but nothing to write home about. I'm just glad I didn't have to wait an hour in the blazing sun for it. I would come again.   I came on a Monday morning around 11:30 am. No wait at all probably because of the larger locations.
Great food. Great atmosphere. Good people. Love the eggs Benedict. I had heard a lot about this restaurant and it has completely met my expectations. Will definitely be back again soon!!
Probably a little over rated. Food was pretty good but the pancakes were a bit tough. Nice atmosphere and pretty good service.
Seating service was slow for an airport.  Breakfast was big serving but toast came out cold.

As soon as I found out I would be traveling to Phoenix, I began looking up places to eat. Matt's Big Breakfast was the first thing to crank up my Yelpdar!  B R I E F  S U M M A R Y -- Probably the most reviewed/well known place in downtown Phoenix -- Featured on TV like everyone else said -- This newer location is a block further than the old (way bigger now!) -- Warm & welcoming ambience -- Friendly and attentive staff (seems like they have a system) -- I recommend coming early, only 6 tables @ 6:45am (Wed morning) -- Salami scramble was definitely unique but needed some cheese -- Potatoes had decent flavor (rosemary) but I wish I got hash browns -- Waffle was hot & fresh & syrup was high quality -- Sourdough toast was thick & good -- Strawberry preserves were delicious! -- The regular menu is very limited -- Staff recommends trying the specials -- Very sad I couldn't try the french toast, it's ONLY a special! :(  Well I woke up super early because I didn't want to get stuck here and I had a meeting at 8am! I forgot that AZ is an hour ahead of CA. I woke up so tired and barely made it here at 6:45am. I walked from the Westin which was a healthy walk at 6 in the morning! I was a bit disappointed to find the old location but luckily I saw the new location was only a block further.  I really like the feel and ambience of Matt's Big Breakfast (MBB). The wait staff were all ladies and they were all very friendly and attentive even at 6am! I was barely awake and I wasn't sure if I was going to come here again so I ended up ordering basically 2 dishes so I could try 2 things. My server loves the waffle so I had to get it. The special she also recommended but I'm just not a fan of apple sausage so I opted for the salami scramble.   I'm from the San Francisco bay area so I'm almost accustomed to what MBB is doing with fresh, local ingredients. I applaud them for keeping their food quality so high but I wasn't uberly impressed because I'm sort of used to it. I expect to pay a decent amount of money for high quality food. I didn't feel like MBB was overpriced, I thought the prices were about right in my opinion.  The waffle was above average and I could taste the quality of the syrup. I really wanted the french toast but it wasn't being offered. To me, if you're famous for french toast, you should offer it on your menu! Nevertheless, the waffle is a good alternative.   The salami scramble was so unique and different. I've never had anything quite like it but I really wish they would have added some creamy cheese to smooth out the salami after taste. I think I added some ketchup or hot sauce to my potatoes and it helped balance the salami. If you like salami, I recommend. I probably wouldn't order again, I just was feeling adventurous. I was a bit surprised that the sourdough bread was so thick but it was still good. The preserves really enabled me to eat all of it otherwise it would been just too much bread for me.  Clearly this place is living up to the hype as it is the number 1 rated place in downtown Phoenix. I didn't search further than that because I didn't have a rental car or anything. I would definitely recommend coming here and if I'm ever out here again, I hope that I can grab some of their french toast!

My dad and I went there for Breakfast.  It is a little hole in the wall joint which only seats about 15 people.  The prices are high for the amount of Food.  Three pancakes were $8.00 and they were not big at all less than half the plate.  My dad had a bowl of oatmeal which cost $5.50.  I was not impressed the food was just average nothing to rave about.  Also there is no parking except on the street which has meters and no bathroom you have to go to the hotel next door which has a bathroom.  It is very cramped and hardly any room.  I was impressed they had organic milk on the menu but beside this the food was just average.  I suggest not to make a special trip unless you're a DDD person and want to experience it like most of the customers were when we were there.

If I could just get a bowl of their butter and eat it like ice cream or yogurt, I would. Everything we had was sooo good! I ate every single morsel of food on my plate. Between their house made preserves and butter, I was in heaven! Service was attentive and everything moved like a well oiled machine. Only odd thing, if I can use that word... was that they don't have half and half or cream for the coffee. Only organic whole milk. The coffee was still delicious

Absolutely love this place! We chose to go to breakfast on a Tuesday and only had to wait 30 minutes for this delish meal! It was a good time to look over the menu and decide what we wanted to eat. The menu isn't big but everything looks good! Since we were only getting to try one meal at this place, I decided to go all out and get the Chop and Chick with a side of the bacon and a strawberry honey lemonade. The food was amazing. Hash browns all the way! And the bacon...oh the bacon...and the bacon! It was worth it for me to get the extra side of bacon. Did I mention the bacon?   I do have a critique on the lemonade. It was a bit too sweet for my liking. So i diluted it with a bit of water and that made it just right for me. I'm going to have to try other menu items...I'm not a fan of waiting an hour, so it might have to go again during the week to avoid the much talked about morning crowds. You gotta try this place if you are in Phoenix!

Had the bourbon cherry sausage with rosemary potatoes and eggs and it was unreal good! Service was friendly, prompt, and the waiters had  good personality.   If you're a jam lover the strawberry is well worth the price to pick one up.
The waiter Micheal is amazing and makes this place a great place to eat. Keep it going Michael.

Great waitress, good food. But why would you have a patio at a restaurant that you can't eat from unless you have a dog?! Beautiful weather in Tempe...restaurant with a patio...but can't sit out there. What's the point?!

Visit date: 09/14/14  Can I say the best griddle cakes I have had in a long while???  This was the first for me and my husband.  We try to check out a new breakfast spot every weekend.  I had heard about Matt's from friends and read some Yelp reviews.  I glad we decided to eat at Matt's.  I know there is usually a long wait, which I was worried about since we havea six month old (teething) baby.  We went prepared to wait.  The wait was not so bad, I think we only waited about 15 minutes.    Once we were seated it did not take that long to order and receive our food.  Everything we had was delicious.  I ordered the griddle cakes, country sausage patties and home fries and my husband ordered that days special.  Everything was flavorful.  Our server was great and were in and out of there pretty quickly.    We definitely be making another trip to this restaurant!

The perfect breakfast spot!  This was my irate time and I'm head of heels for it. I had the special: French toast with bacon. Seriously, the best French tat I've ever had! I'm going to guess this has more than a little to do with the fresh, local made bread. Follow that up with some strawberry lemonade and this is the absolute best Saturday morning breakfast.    Oh! And if you can get there before 7:30-8am ish, you'll likely be able to snag a seat immediately. The place is small and popular, which leads to crowds, but that seems to move smoothly and quickly.

I love the interior and welcoming feel of the place. Unlike a lot of places nowadays, the food actually tasted and felt "real." Super tasty! As for the service, you're just part of the family to them. I'll DEFINITELY be back!

The first thing I noticed upon sitting down was the noise.  Wow is it noisy!  I will not return as I could not enjoy being there due to the noise.  I could not hear the person I was with, who sat across the table from me.  Everytime someone pushed out their chair, I crindged!  Regarding the food, it was so,so.  I had an omelet with onions and peppers (blah), chunk potatoes hash browns (they were overly peppered), and sour dough bread (looked great, but no taste).  Coffee was the best!  Customer Service was excellent!  Disappointed after all the hype!

Limited menu selections for breakfast. I had a cheese omelette which was thin and flat; no fluffiness whatsoever. Not a fan of their style of hash browns either, and while the thick toast is good, you only get one slice cut in half and an additional slice is $2.50! The best thing was the coffee! I would have given 3 stars but the noise level is painfully loud. Metal chairs scraping across the floor make you teeth hurt! Very disappointed!
Fast, attentive friendly service. Definitely a great breakfast hotspot just outside Phoenix. Excellent food, well put together, all was delicious and came out very quickly. Well done operation

Was visiting Arizona for Spring training and was looking for a country kitchen type of breakfast and omg was this place good! We got some seasoned potatoes that were perfect in every way, my husband got a Belgium waffle that he said tasted amazing (he's a very picky eater), white toast which paired perfectly with the home made jam. The place itself is kind of small and the wait wasn't too long. Customer service was awesome..needless to say, we will be visiting again & recommend it!
Totally worth the wait. Even the toast was amazing. Fresh, cracked-to-order eggs make the difference.

This place gets zero stars. Not sure how they stay in business. If you like getting what you pay for this is not the place for you. Where all the good reviews on yelp are coming from is a mystery to me. Coming here Was the biggest mistake we made this morning. It is not a spur of the moment joint. Plan ahead because you will have to wait 35+minutes just to be seated. Not a good place for a party greater than 4. Ladies: there no where to place your purse so you either eat with it on your lap or put on the floor, which is gross. We Waited the time,got seated & had to wait 10 min before anyone took our drink order. Thankfully we placed our food order at the same time. Waited another 8 min or so to get the drinks.
