Food took longer to come out. With no kids meal options we were forced to order large plates for the children. So big sad face for that. Food came out & the waffle was good, eggs over easy was fine. My daughter's scrambled eggs were fine. My omelette with cheese bacon ham looked promising & then they didn't get eaten because they were not cooked thru in sections. Figured I'd enjoy hashbrowns but they were terrible. Unseasoned crisp outside & straight baby food mush inside. Yuck. My daughter's homefries were ok except half of them had burned bottoms. I love that they use thick cut bacon but hate that they burn it black so it tastes like charcoal. All in all we spent $75 and change (tip not included) for a party of 5 & TERRIBLE food. Don't waste your hard-earned money here. Unless you like paying for bad food- go somewhere else. Not worth it. You don't get what you pay for. Plan on paying for parking because it is all metered.
good, but not worth the hype. Especially for the wait time.

I recently moved back to Tempe from the east coast, and I was excited to see Matt's had a location on Rio Salado. I used to make regular trips to Phoenix when they opened their original location, and I was always willing to endure the long wait because the food was that good.  I've now been to the Tempe location twice, but I probably won't be back anytime soon. The food is still good, but the service is terrible. The last time I went, I waited 20 minutes before a server came by to bring water. The guy working the door overheard us talk about leaving, and he promptly came to take our drink order. He was the only reason we stayed. But the service remained bad the rest of the time we were there, and the place wasn't even that busy. In fact, there were a bunch of servers just standing around talking most of the time we were there.  I've had similar service at this location twice now, so it seems like a management problem. Too bad, because I always thought the original Matt's was incredible and worth a wait. Hopefully someone can make a change to get the Tempe location better.
The Reuben is fairly decent for airport food. Home cut fries as well. Make sure you order an IPA to wash all that down.
Always consistent and quality.  The have also opened up at Sky Harbor Airport for when you are traveling.

Brian's Big Disappointing Breakfast   Guess my high expectations got the best of me? Been wanting to try MBB for a while now (long while since DDD!), but this first visit was sad.   Had pork chop, eggs, and hash browns. I asked them to make the hash browns crispy. They came out extra soggy. Couldn't figure out if it was grease or water, I didn't finish them.  I asked for over easy eggs, they came out over medium plus. And my sister asked for home fries, she got hash browns. The pork chop was alright.  Service was good, but if you see brown on top of the eggs, they are most likely not over-easy.   I'm sure they would have corrected everything, but it should come out right the first time, especially if there are only 3 other tables seated. I've only sent my food back twice that I can remember (once was a $50 over cooked steak).  $27.58 plus tip for two entrees and one coffee for an ok breakfast. Thumbs down. Had way better at Ronnie's Cafe for a third of the price!  My sister flew in from out of town and I wish I would have treated her to Snooze or Daily Dose or even First Watch instead. Thought this place was bomb for nom nom, but much the opposite.  The ambience and decor are fabulous.   And please tell the manager to stop saying 'you guys'.  It's unprofessional.   Glad people like it, but I won't be back.   Sincerely,  Unimpressed

More like matt's small breakfast!  The big name and high prices were certainly not reflected in the portion sizes. That being said, the portions were more than enough for me and I left with a full tummy. Some of the ingredients were organic and local (yay!!), but the actual food was nothing special. In fact, the raspberry preserves were the most impressive thing I ate at matt's. I feel like I could have cooked everything there (and probably more to my liking) with the ingredients in my refrigerator and saved a chunk of change.

The best breakfast I have had in Phoenix. Hands down. All natural, real butter, Maple syrup!  The pancakes were soooo delicious. They come out buttered with a little jar of maple syrup to pour over them. I thought the syrup was not going to be enough to satisfy my need of having to eat pancakes smothered in syrup, but TRUST when I say these pancakes were so good that they did not need to be smothered. Also had an omelette with bacon, sausage and peppers with a side of home fries. Yes, it was as delicious as it sounds. I love food and Matt's did not disappoint. Portions were large, expect to take home leftovers unless you arrive with a hungry man appetite :) the only bad thing I can comment on is the wait. If you do not show up bright and early, expect to wait at least 30 minutes. But once you are in you will realize the food was worth the wait :)

It's unbelievable slow, which can be understood, given it's an airport.  People sit down to eat either waiting on their flight to take off, or their connection flight.   The food being slow is for sure an inconvenience.  But given that these things happen, you would expect them to treat you with respect and be empathetic of travelers time.     But they have no patience with their customers.  I witnessed a waitress yell at a patron,  tell him if he had a problem, he could yelp about it.    He didn't.  But I did.     32 minutes for a grilled cheese and tomato soup.    The soup never came and I missed my connection.

This place is a Phoenix staple. Fast service and amazing, fresh food every time I go. I always send everyone to Matt's when they are looking for a good breakfast. Love that they added the new location on camelback!

Can't go wrong with this place for.breakfast. I love waffle and they have the BEST waffle and bacon dish. I'm known for being picky with food and wow I didn't want to put my fork down. The food was delicious,the servers were amazing, the service was fast. The wait time was not too bad even with a lot of ppl waiting because the staff were quick. Definitely My go to breakfast spot whenever I'm in Phoenix.

Matts is a place everyone has to go to at least once and if you don't fall in love with place idk what to tell you...   The staff is super friendly I got to have a little chat with one of the managers (I believe) he was really nice and seemed to very much love his job! Their food is super tasty and pretty affordable too. But heir strawberry jelly my gosh! DELICIOUS! Their menu is sweet and short just how I like it. Honestly I can't stand when places have an encyclopedia of a menu. I will get overwhelmed with all of the options I would probably just walk right out. The deco is really cool pretty industrial. I believe this place was on the food network so that says a lot! Also I recommend coming here early as they do get super packed. I remember trying to get a table on a weekend forget about it! It was an hour wait. I'm sorry you can be the best restaurant in the planet and I will still not wait that long.  However a definite must try!
I've been here a few times and there is always a wait but its really worth it. The food here is everything you want out of a big breakfast lol.

Pretty good stuff, Though I waited near 30 minutes for a two top :)  The food was good, the hasbrowns , cooked in REAL butter were nice and crispy, the griddle cakes muy deliciouso!  I don't recomend the bacon, as it was a bit undercooked, but do try the honey lemonade! WOWZA!  I am considering going back when it's not so busy.
Great food. The bread on the sandwiches was really fresh. The iced tea is amazing. The atmosphere is nice too. Definitely recommended.

This was our first time here and we LOVED IT!!  We sat at the counter facing out to the street.  We ordered after 5 minutes and within 10 minutes we had our order!!  They are quick and service is GREAT!!  I had the five spot and I definitely recommend it and my husband had the hog and chick and he recommends it too  All I can say, looking forward to visiting Phoenix again so we can come back to Matt's!!!!!

Overhyped? What am I missing here? I was very excited about checking out Matt's. We went on a Sunday morning, so I expected a long wait (I even brought a book). There was about an hour wait ahead of us, so I was already happy it wasn't longer than that. The exterior is cute. I was already giving the place a point on style alone and because the interior is oh-so tiny!  They had some retro looking fans going-we ended up sitting in the rear room. I had the eggs and sausage, with wheat toast. Meh. I wasn't crazy about the food. The prices were very reasonable though. My toast was way too thick, and was more a multi-grain than a wheat (hey I know the difference). I like thin, crunchy toast, not giant slabs of semi toasted bread. There is no bathroom-you have to go next door to the creepy motel to use the bathroom which is in a room .Did I mention creepy? it's super creepy. Back to the food. I didn't notice any size selections for the juices. I had an orange juice. It was freshly squeezed and very tasty, but oh so tiny. I could have finished it in a gulp. No one read us any specials, though I did hear the people next to us were read the specials (hey maybe I wanted the steak and eggs?! At least gimme the option. hmmph). The service was hurried, but not rude. Our drinks were never refreshed.. so I was licking the pulp out of my cup by my 3rd bite. My husband had the belgian waffle. Again, Meh. Nothing special. There was really nothing special here that would make me come back, the wait alone, though not as long as I expected, will keep me away.

Food was good, big and fairly priced.  They got our large group in quickly.  Things I would change.  Waiter was only so so.  Asked what the head of the table needed never checked with the rest of us.  Never got water the first time I asked.  Never got water the second time I asked -  gave me a second orange juice instead.  Other people who got one pancake got the same size mini container of syrup I got for 3.  When I finally stopped someone and asked for more syrup they told me I was going to have to pay $1.50 for another mini-container.  Did not make me happy.  I wasn't crazy about the pancakes anyway - they were way too thick for my taste. I would have like to have seen more creative choices on the menu.

I have to give it four stars because there is nothing else like it at the airport.  Very, very trendy.  Good service.  Reasonable prices.  Delish food.  I had the traditional egg, etc breakfast and the only thing traditional were the eggs.  Toast was presented in a fun way and tasted great.  Definitely high quality bacon but maybe too much pepper on the edge.  Orange juice tasted freshly squeezed.  Potatoes were yummy.  Next time I'm going to try one of the waffles.  This part might surprise you...I wasn't departing or waiting...I just landed at 9pm and saw it on the way to exiting the airport and knew that it was going to be a better meal than fast food on the way home. Go Matt.

Sorry, but the wait time and food don't add up. Not trying to be a hater but a friend and I ate here, wait time was close to an hour. Had a standard breakfast and to be honest, It wasn't all the hype this place receives. I would much rather go down the street for no wait and enjoy bangers and mash over at Turf. Sorry Matt, I won't be back.

Was waking by and had time to kill. This place was really busy and breakfast before a red eye flight sounded amazing! Say at the bar and Maria A was on point. She was one of the best servers/bartenders I've had. She was manning the bar herself and also helping some other staff. She saw your glass nearing empty before you thought about it. She also kept a smile on her face with every customer encounter. The service definitely enhanced my dining experience. All the plates coming out of the kitchen looked delicious. The Sonrisa Burrito (minus meat) was fantastic. Had great conversations at the bar. Definitely worth stopping in.
Such fresh food and the best hash browns I've ever eaten in life!   The 30 minute wait for a table was well worth it!

A small local restaurant with excellent service and food.  I was seated at a window seat immediately and was promptly served.  The hog and chick was delicious.  Worth a visit if you are staying in the downtown area.

Bit of a mixed bag experience here. I thought there were two separate lines for take out vs getting seated to dine in, so unfortunately we got passed up a few times before we got a table. Service was ok initially but we ended up waiting a very long time (maybe 40 minutes?) for our food. We flagged down another server once we noticed several tables who arrived after us were getting their food.  Someone came back to our table and told us our order had been lost and they had to take it again! Our original server never came back to our table once our order had to be re-taken but others came by to check on us several times.   In the end, the food was very delicious and our bill was taken care of but I probably won't be bringing my future mother in law back here ever again... I understand that mistakes happen but kinda disappointed that our original server didn't seem to notice or care how long we had to wait for our food even after we made them other servers aware of it.   I'll give this place another try with my bf instead cos the food was so good

Always on Point with Quality, Product, Service.  I typically get the Five Spot Breakfast Sandwich. It comes on a soft bun/roll with 2 strips of thick cut-smoked bacon, cheese and 2 eggs cooked over medium. The price is only $5. The Taste is outstanding. Perfect combination of textures to taste. 5/5.  I also order the hash browns. Its only $2. They are freshly shredded and cooked in organic butter from a local farm. Taste is 5/5.  I save the best for last. I will eat my Five Spot and Hash Browns then I will order the 3 stack of pancakes at last. They are very quick to bring it out. It usually takes less than 3 minutes to deliver the pancakes. It comes with organic butter and real organic maple syrup. These pancakes are the best pancakes I have ever had. 5/5.

Tucked away in downtown Phoenix, Matt's Big Breakfast offers Big flavor (see what I did there?)  The menu, albeit small, has all the breakfast comfort food that most diners have (i.e., waffles, scrambles, pancakes, etc.) I ordered the special which was an egg scramble with jalapenos, ham and cheese. It also came with a side of potatoes, either hash browns or country style.  The best part of my scramble was the succulent ham. I never tasted breakfast ham so good. If you go to Matt's try their ham, it is no doubt, the best I've ever had.  My hashbrowns were fried to perfection: Crispy outside and soft and silky inside.   I also tried their bacon which is a thick cut peppered bacon. I don't prefer thick cut bacon, but if it's your style, you'll most likely love it.  The service was great and the food is awfully cheap. Wish they had more to choose from on their menu though!
This absolutely the best and most reasonable airport food around!!  Had the omelet with mushrooms, peppers and bacon - done to perfection!!

Been looking to visit Matt's Big Breakfast for a while. Today finally I had a chance to stop by. Place was busy but I was seated immediately. The food is getting all the stars, service was impersonal and never felt welcome, also they were complaining about another customer "complicated" order, not cool at all. The waffles were awesome and the hash browns were burned, bacon is one of the most flavored I had so far. I might try one of other locations cause this one didn't worked for me.

Came here for breakfast, it was my last day in Phoenix and I wanted to eat at just one more place before I left. The have a daily specials menu for breakfast but you cant mix and match days. I didn't care much since they still another option i wanted. The service is a little slow but I guess that's what happens when the place is packed. The home made jelly was very good but it needed some sugar. I chose not to add any extra sugar since it would just ruin the flavor.
Never disappointed. Had the huevos rancheros. The honey lemonade is the bomb. No wait. Went in around 9am on a Monday. Great place for locals and visitors.
The Hog and Chick is excellent.  The coffee is locally roasted.  Be prepared to wait though.  I prefer the home fries over the hash browns.  The bacon is excellent.

Ooh--nope. No need to go here.  V OK to bad service. Don't go if you need eggs with green salsa on Tuesday. They'll tell you come back Monday. You ask for eggs and hollandaise on Monday they tell you come back Thursday. Why. My kid can't eat here.

While my friend Austin was here in town, he had wanted to eat at Matt's big breakfast after hearing about it on a travel channel show.  So, we wandered downtown and tried this place for breakfast.  When approaching the restaurant, we noticed that parking was limited.  Mostly sidestreet metered parking.  We found an open meter, and went inside.  The place is really cute from the outside, and crazy small on the inside.  Its more of a simple decor, with orange table tops, and white walls.  We had a small wait, and put our name on the list.  Eventually, we sat at the bar after waiting about 15 minutes in the sun. I ordered a cheese omelette, and Austin ordered a cheeseburger.  Both our food came out, and it was tasty!  Service was quick, and we were in and out of there in less then an hour.  O, and a word of advice.  The bathroom here is located in the middle of the kitchen!  I had "to go" while we were waiting, and I was surprised at the whole thing.  the bathroom is teeny tiny, and you have to walk through the kitchen to get to it.  Plus, its located immediately next to the grill!  If you can help it, either "hold it" or go before!  Fair warning for bathroom users!

Arrived for the first time here at MBB!! I agree with the others that there is no sign to say be seated or seat yourself. We also stood for a bit... then I asked. Yes sit anywhere!!  We found a nice table and we were greeted by a nice man named Blake. Ordered iced tea and he told of the days special. Went to get our drinks and another friendly young lady came by for our drink order!!  Love this!! Better to have too much attention then none!!  Iced tea was amazing.  Husband ordered a cheese omelette with home fries ( caramelized onions and rosemary) and a cup of chili.  I ordered the waffle that comes with Pepper bacon. Omelette came out with hash browns.... oops.... quick fix. Boom they are back with the wonderful potato's!  Food was Amazing . Service outstanding!  Blake told us of other great things to order next time we are there!  Can't wait!!

This is absolutely the best place for breakfast in town.  I've never had a bad meal and only wish they had another location further north.  Their hash browns are some of the best and I love how they use fresh ingredients.  I would try a week day for your first experience so you don't have to wait as long for seating.

Excellent breakfast ! Best hash browns I've ever had. The strawberry spread is to die for ! I think it's just strawberries lemon and honey - so delicious. The owner was sweet and kind and checked on every table / I'm very impressed - now let's get Matt's Big Breakfast to Florida

MATT'S! I don't even need to write this review. Everyone already knows how awesome Matt's is. AND IF YOU DON'T KNOW: RUN THERE.  Whenever we have to drive up to or through PHX from Tucson, we stop here. We go without eating breakfast, drive the 2 hours, wait in line and eat here. It's just that good.   This place is simple. The frills* are few but they make a hard impact. The thick-cut sourdough toast with super excellent fresh homemade jam (*frill). The rosemary (*frill) on the home fries. SIMPLY delicious.  My go to is the 5 Spot (breakfast sandwich with egg, melty cheese, GRILLED ONIONS (*frill), and thick-cut bacon, and one pancake on the side (real butter, real syrup *frills).   For the two of us to eat here: full breakfasts with coffee, it's under $30. The wait on the weekends for two is usually 30 minutes, so not bad for regular breakfasters like us.   Seriously, the food is so fresh and that's just what makes it so good. The staff is so efficient and extra friendly. We always have so much fun and such a good meal here. This is a place where we will always visit as much as we can.

The overall environment is modern.   We had to wait 30 mins to be seated but we dint mind.   The food's comes from a simple menu is basically breakfast & then lunch after 11, and the portion sizes are decent, but yet the food did not full me. Service was prompt and courteous. The 4 stars just stems from the fact that the food didn't fill me, and they ice the water to death (Don't mind me. I hate ice in my water.)

I have been here several times however today was different. I found the food to be so-so. Everything was over cooked, not 1 person asked if was wanted anything else or how was our meal. The service was horrible. I won't be back nor will I recommend it anymore

I love this place!  its so small but so cute at the same time. I think nearly everything is homemade which is great! their homemade strawberry jam is delicious!! They have the best pancakes! No syrup needed!  You MUSt get the hashbrowns!! everything tastes so fresh and flavorful. Its one of my favorite breakfast joints. The only reason they didn't get 5 stars from me is because the staff is kind of ALL OVER THE PLACE which tends to get a little annoying. Other than that, no complaints! Go here and BON APETITE!

Checked out the new location which is much nicer and roomier than the old one. I loved everything again and their homemade jams from scratch is the most amazing thing ever!   Initially I gave them 5 stars but I decided on 4 this time because almost their entire menu has nothing but pork! Come on, not everyone eats pork! :(

Friendly staff and great service. Love the homemade fruit compote they serve with the toast alongside the meals and the fresh lemonades they offer. I always get something different when I go typically the special of the day. One of my favorite breakfast spots.

Despite the rave from yelp reviews, I thought this place was just OK - nothing special if you ask me. Nothing wow'ed me. I came in around 6:30am so beat the crowd which started pouring in an hour later.  The food portions are generous.  Pulpy orange juice - YUM  Hash brown was bland on its own (ate my friend's hash brown), not as flavorful as I would've hoped. I still ate the whole thing with ketchup and pepper.   I ordered The Hog and Chick with eggs over medium, thick bacon and wheat toast. The home fries were too hard for my taste, wanted them to be more on the softer side with crispy edges but it looked and tasted overcooked. The bacon was thick but it also tasted overcooked. Again, I still ate everything so still good.  Service was great - they came around a few times offering coffee and water refills, asked how we were doing.   I'd still recommend a trip here but go in with low expectations. It might have been all the hype about the placed that I heard (it was featured in Triple D) so I came in thinking this was going to be a diner with something unique to offer...
This place was Amazing. A little busy but really great food and perfect portions. The only complaint I would have is it was a little cramped but again they were pretty busy

Came in for some brain food right before a final. We specifically asked our waiter if the turn around time was quick since I had class in an hour. I think mentioning our hurry made him pay less attention to detail. We ordered a plate that came with bacon and we stated we were vegetarians and that we wanted to sub that out for hash browns. When we got the food, there was bacon right across the entire plate. He didn't even notice until the second time he came around and said "aw they gave you bacon?" And proceeded to charge us for both bacon and hash browns. We didn't have the time to even point out the mistake. Honestly this was the worst customer service and worst breakfast I've had. Far from brain food. Was late to my final. Oh and they "don't do creamer" for your coffee.
Great food awesome atmosphere fast service about a 30minute wait on a sunday morning.  loved the breakfast sandwhich

Was in town early March and looking for something to do for breakfast.  Matt's did not disappoint.  It was a Saturday morning and we managed to get in before the crowd but by the time we left it was packed.  Portions were perfect and the service was outstanding.    There was a good selection of breakfast choices and the lady beside us even asked about a BLT lunch sandwich and they said they could do it!  Our food came out in good time and was fresh and very well seasoned.  The breakfast special was incredible and the potatoes were perfect!    Will definitely be back the next time we are in town.

I guess they just opened a location here at Sky Harbor. I had never been to the original location, so I guess this is a truly objective review.   I'm not from Phoenix; just here for work and decided to have lunch here before my flight back home. But I wasn't that satisfied.   First impressions: great looking menu. I love american breakfast so I was very excited to try it out. I remember seeing the original location on an episode of Triple D as well. Apparently there's always a huge wait at the original location; definitely not the case here. I was seated in 10 seconds. Few reasons include the new location, noobie visitors who have never heard of it, and just the location in general. It's airport food, so you're only going to eat it because it's convenient. I wonder if anyone's ever booked a flight for another airline just because they know MBB is at Terminal 4! Furthermore, there's also a take-out section of the entrance that was completely empty as well.   The service was lacking. Don't get me wrong, the waitresses were very friendly, but they're definitely not on their game. First of all, I was seated at a long counter area that had customers on both sides -- not a problem. Probably could have sat 15 people staggered. Most people are dining alone anyways so no complaints on my end. What made me a little fed up was they seated another man RIGHT in front of me. Mind you, they were NOT busy and the counter is hardly 2 ft wide, so this man was pretty much breathing on my food. If I had leaned in another foot, I could have kissed the guy. I'm sure he wasn't happy either. Dude, stagger your customers if they're dining alone. If all other seats are taken, ask for the permission of both parties. The rest of the counter is empty. Even the guys next to me at their booth were like wtf. C'mon.   Every single person around me was missing something before they even got their food. I didn't receive a straw. My new involuntary best friend in front of me didn't get a napkin or utensils. And the other tables around me didn't get utensils or condiments. Get it together MBB!  Now onto the food. I ordered the Chop & Chick and asked for a waffle instead of toast; didn't mind paying extra. Waffle wasn't bad; tastes like a pretty good waffle I could have made at home. The pork chop and home fries had way too much rosemary. Also, the home fries weren't fries at all, they were just stir fried potatoes, but apparently most people are aware of this so that's my problem. The pork chop was good, a tad but overcooked but the flavor was good. Nothing I'd go out of the way for. and not that juicy either.   When I received my check, I noticed that I was charged for 2 full meals when I simply asked for one replacement item on my meal. They had charged me for a full waffle plate as well as the full chop & chick. The waffle plate comes with bacon ( I didn't receive bacon) and they didn't subtract the toast from my order. The toast wasn't a big deal at all, but the waitress could have told me that they don't have waffles a la carte instead of making me pay for 2 whole meals. This is NOT acceptable.   I was running late for my flight, so I didn't have the time to waive down the waitress. I just paid for the bill and left pretty irked. My meals are covered by the company, so whatever.   Won't be coming back here again. 2 stars.
Really good place for breakfast. Fun environment and the food was delicious. Parking is paid only and there was about a 20 minute wait on a Friday. Definitely will be back!
Awesome service & Food!!! Having wonderful service and then awesome food just makes this place ROCK!!! First time here and it was Great!!

Yes, the food is fresh and tasty and fairly priced and locally owned, woo hoo!  But is it worth two hours on a Monday morning to get a place for 3 people to sit? No. Not ever.  So even though I won't fight to get a table there again, I can say that my omelette was hot and tasty, the rosemary potatoes savory and filling, and the toast thick and...toasty. I like my coffee a little stronger, but hey, I recognise that many people don't, so no points lost there.  Because even though they have real butter and syrup, the whole reason I go out to breakfast because I want the time-saving convenience of having someone do everything for me. In that amount of time, I could have done the shopping, made the food, and cleaned it up, and I would have used real butter, too!
Probably the best breakfast potatoes I've ever had. Bacon was superb. Even the oatmeal was tastier than usual. Fast service was a huge plus too.

I have been told about Matt's countless times and always heard about what a tiny place it was, but until I actually went for the first time, I never got the irony in the name "Matt's Big Breakfast."   I was doped up on anesthesia, so I really enjoyed sitting at the window bar so I could people watch, and so that the other patrons could not watch my weird facial expressions.   For a vegetarian, the menu did not have a huge offering, but it was a clear choice for me: egg and cheese omelet with cheddar and provolone, hash-browns, sourdough toast and coffee.   Ummm... DELICIOUS!!!! Seriously, this breakfast was really awesome. I might have gained five pounds from the butter it was all cooked in, but really, who cares.   The blackberry jam they happened to be serving that day was absolutely phenomenal, and I hate jam, so you know it must have been good.   I don't know if they have a bathroom but it did not appear so. As previously mentioned in probably every review and earlier in my review, this place is reallllly small.   The service was great. They served our drinks, took our order and served our food quicker than I expected, especially since the place was packed the entire time.   The only thing that kept this place from being 5 stars was the coffee. It just wasn't good. Call me a coffee snob if you must.

Thank goodness I finally made it. Went on a Sunday morning around 10am expecting a wait and didn't wait longer than 5 minutes, I think the horrendous construction might be keeping people away.   The flavors in my Saturday Special three egg scramble with Cabot cheddar, sauted jalapenos, and Shreiner's chicken enchilada sausage were bursting. The jalapenos had great heat. The hash browns come in a slab with the perfect ratio of crispy top and bottom to a soft, almost creamy center. Then, as if you needed some more carbs, they throw a large tortilla on top of it all. My scramble plate and his waffle were easily shared with two of us- we both left stuffed. $27 including coffee.   Coffee- great! Waffles- light, fluffy, savory, and slightly sweet, served with real maple syrup.  The incredible bacon like they serve you reminds you not all bacon is created equal. Service- fast and friendly.   We have so much more to explore on the menu. Can't get back soon enough.

Breakfast was delicious!!! Service was excellent too. Breakfast for 2 was $28!! Not bad. Always wanted to try this place as it was on Diners Drive in and dives! I would definitely come back. We came at a good time as there was no line to wait to be seated.

went back for a second time and got the waffle, oats, and eggs Benedict. I really wanted the french toast, but it's only served on Wednesday. The waffle had a really good flavor. Similar flavor to the pancake. I would suggest the waffle or pancake at this place.
Very good breakfast!  Big Servings!  Good price!  The Bloody Mary is a meal in its self!

What can I say that hasn't already been said...  Should you go: yes Does is live up to the hype: yes Is it worth the wait:yes  K, got that out the way. I'm always a bacon, eggs (over easy), potatoes and toast for breakfast guy-its exactly what I need and always perfect here. My wife goes with the pork chop breakfast and loves it.   Food is hot and fresh as can be. I haven't been disappointed yer. If your a "breakfast person" this place is for you

Good thing we had a long layover..... Potatoes only tasted like rosemary. Bacon wasn't salty but thick. Bread was great. Over easy eggs were dry.   Seating for 2 are so close to your neighbors that I saw a heavy set guy walk away from the place.   Even regular sized customers were way too close together. A shot of Baileys for your coffee was $12.00 and they had no idea what a side of red was..... I don't frequent Phoenix but if I did, I wouldn't go back.
Based on service, cuisine and originality alone I would back Matt up in a knife fight any day.

Yum! Very much enjoyed my breakfast!  The family and I stopped in before an appointment down town during the week, perfect time because there wasn't a wait at all, even for 6 of us. We got to sit at the cute table in what looked like their front area that doubles as a prep kitchen.   We did have to wait a few minutes to get drinks, seemed to be last on the waitresses priority list. Over all service wasn't stellar, but the food was great so I didn't mind much. My brother did enjoy his strawberry lemonade tremendously, if I am correct it is house made lemonade and homemade strawberry preserves added. Looked yummy!  I got a traditional 2 eggs over medium (made perfectly! just runny enough with no snot on the whites), hash-browns and bacon. The bacon is awesome! thick cut and peppery!  A few others got their special that day, eggs and churrizo and a tortilla, wow so good! Not too spicy and tons of flavor!  Matt's is pretty darn good!

WOW!  We haven't been to Matt's Big Breakfast in ages... and that was in downtown Phoenix.  Since they have more recently set up a place close to our home, we made it today!   The location is part of the Rio Salado complex on Tempe Town Lake.  Very beautiful day and location.  Parking was interesting, only because 2 out of the 3 of us are gimpy.  So while there, I asked how to park closer and that was very helpful.      Our server was Daniel.  If I could hire someone, it would be Daniel in a heartbeat!  He was kind, thoughtful, friendly and there for everything we needed.  The coffee...  well, I loved it!  It is hearty and isn't the watered-down version of coffee that most places serve.  ("Roastery of Cave Creek. Ground daily.")       Two of us had "The Hog & Chick" with 2 eggs, toast, hash browns or homefries, and meat.  I had it scrambled, white toast, sausage patties and hash browns.  It was perfection plus strawberry preserves!  Everyone ate everything!  Our friend had the waffle and bacon... the first words out of her mouth were "OH MY GOD!" after her bite of bacon.  She kept looking at it and chewing and she could not believe it was that good.  All of us loved loved loved the meal and the attentiveness of Daniel.       I must also mention the person that cooked our great breakfast, Forest!  I met him at the counter and I must give hats off to the person who hired these guys!  Forest did a great job, because each of us wanted to lick our plates.      We will be back.

So I'll probably get some hate, but whatever.   It's good, but not top ten best breakfast places in the valley. I enjoyed it and the service was solid but I wasn't wow'd. Have it a few tries and never had anything I couldn't reproduce at home with some effort.   Like I said the food is good and the service is solid. Especially for the price, but come on! Lol  I'm shocked at the amount of 5 Stars this place has... either people just blindly love all things DDD or they need higher breakfast standards.
Good, fast service, large portions and tasty food. It's nothing fancy, but they have perfected what they have! Love it!

We stopped here in Arizona for an airport layover and we had around 1 hour to spare.  We were in and out in 30 minutes.  Depending on whom you get you can order lunch and dinner.  If you get the muscular bald headed guy with lots of energy he will make it happen.  I ordered the pork and eggs and made a sandwich out of it.  The blt is goof as they use the fat bacon.

Yes, I was there.  I had breakfast too.  So did my wife.  I had a cheese omelette with a side of bacon.  What I got was a cheese and bacon omelette.  But it was good.  A bit dry, but good.  The hash-browns were really good too.  The iced tea was fresh.  My wife liked whatever she got too.  The place is small, crowded and noisy, but to be fair, there was a large party of large and noisy people seated next to us.  Our server was sweet.  We knew her from another local dining spot, so we chatted a bit.  She was a big fan of Fox restaurants.  So are we.  But this was Matt's, not that other place.    Service was excellent, food was pretty good, ambiance just so-so.  I really don't get places that think the Industrial look with zero sound insulation is a good idea.  Nobody can hear their table mates talking, so they just talk louder.  For someone like me (hearing impaired), it makes it really difficult to have any conversation whatsoever.  I usually just take my hearing aids out and wink and blow kisses at my wife now and then.  Once I missed and I got a really weird look from the hotty soccer mom that was staring at me from the other booth.  I didn't tell my wife.
Consistently the best breakfast joint in Phoenix. This place blows the competition out of the water without any pretension. The line is long but worth the wait.

Very good filling breakfast with great service and a fair price. I was in town on business and I like to look for a local place for breakfast rather than the hotel. I was pleasantly surprised. No complaints. I would go back if I'm in town again. Thanks for the great breakfast.
This is strictly because - why on earth would a place as popular as this one not have text when your name is called available...or shaded/covered seating while you wait? In ARIZONA???

This is a fun spot in downtown Phoenix.  I had the salami scramble and it was amazing.  The menu is kind of small, but the food is good.  It's a small restaurant, and I don't think they have a parking lot.  I'll be back.

Matt's at Terminal 4 in Sky Harbor.  What a great concept (adding a full bar).  The restaurant and bar, counters and tables are just beautiful.  Nice decor that reminds you of Matt's downtown.  However, the food here is just not the same.  Scrambled eggs were dry and seemed like they had been cooked for a buffet.  Potatoes not as good as the original.  Toast was superior (they must have stayed with the same baker).  I saw so much food being thrown away (folks just weren't enjoying their breakfast).  Overall, I was disappointed.  I'll give Matt's another try next time I travel and hope the quality returns.  Come on Matt, get it together and serve quality breakfasts like you are known for.

I ordered the cheese omelette with provolone, added mushrooms, roasted peppers, and sauted onions, and a freshly squeezed orange juice. The omelette came with hash browns and sourdough toast with house-made strawberry preserve. The omelette didn't have much flavor, and the insides were a bit watery. The hash browns were too oily and didn't have much flavor. The best part of the breakfast was probably the strawberry preserve, which, well, wasn't supposed to be the star of the breakfast. The freshly squeezed orange juice was fine too. The service was pretty good, but the food just wasn't up to par.

I've been here twice, and each time is amazing. First time I had visited with some coworkers. The food is awesome and the service is so kind!   This place is so busy! If you're looking for a quiet place for food and conversation, this isn't it. I don't care, because it can tell everyone and everything is upbeat.   I recommend going on Sunday for their steak and eggs, the hash browns are amazing, and the steak is a much better quality than I thought we'd get.   Only downside is that they don't split checks, I totally get it, but when you visit their Tempe location, it doesn't make sense to not split checks since they are in a work campus for Statefarm.

If you are craving basic nothing special breakfast food save yourself the hour long wait outside in the 100 degree heat and go eat at Denny's or IHOP.  Trust me you'll pay half as much and leave feeling less icky.  I seriously don't understand the draw of this place.  The whole restaurant seats maybe 20-30 people, so we ended up sitting outside in the heat for over an hour waiting for a table.  Other reviews claim much longer wait times.  When we finally got a table our waitress was friendly enough and got our drink orders pretty promptly.  When they brought us our food  was nothing special just eggs, bacon, and hashbrowns.  The quality was no better than what you might get at any typical breakfast joint.  Seriously Food Network I don't understand what all the fuss is about.  The waitress forgot to bring us our bread.  After two requests and our meal just about finished our bread was finally delivered to the table.  Unfortunately, my boyfriend's bread had a little something extra...a nice long hair.  Disgusting!!    Never again.

I just went to Phoenix for the first time this past week, and one of the must stop places on my list was this restaurant: Matt's Big Breakfast. This place has been featured on Dinners, Drive-Ins, and Dives on the Food Network. On the third day of our trip, my husband and I went here, despite warnings from my cousin that the wait could take hours. Fortunately for us, we only waited twenty minutes. Upon entering this tiny retro diner, I ordered the special, an egg scramble with thick bacon, fontina cheese, and baby spinach in it. This was accompanied by hash browns, homemade bread and homemade jam. I was very pleased with my choice of meals, it was awesome!! My husband ordered the Hog and Chick. This is a meal that comes with two eggs any style, ham, fresh bread and jam, as well as a choice of hash browns or potatoes. My husband said the ham was incredibly delicious. I tried the potatoes with fresh rosemary and liked those even more than my hash browns. Both of our meals were around $8.00 each. There were not too expensive and they kept us full all day. Despite working in tight quarters, the waiters and waitresses were friendly and helpful. Because our overall experience was so good, my husband and I returned here the morning we left for the airport. This time we both had the hog and chick. It was just as good as what I ordered previously. I highly recommend this sweet little joint in the heart of the southwest!!

Amazing! This place is what breakfast is all about! Everything was amazing. Me and my sister both had the pork chops! Pork chops for breakfast!!!!! There was nothin left when we were done! The food came out quick the wait was short! Next time I'm in town I will definitely be stopping here.

I was really looking forward to eating here. Unfortunately, it turned out not be as good as I expected. I was in town and staying near the airport with some extra morning time and decided to take the light rail system to downtown and walk to Matt's. First, it's in a great area of Phoenix, near the downtown ASU campus. It's a little bit of a hike from the train line to Matt's but the walk was great. I sat at the counter and was greeted very warmly, with was the best part of the visit.  All of the waitresses were great. I went with a simple breakfast, eggs in a sandwich with bacon, which was pretty good.  I also ordered the homefries, as opposed to the hash browns. Can get hash browns anywhere and wanted to try their personal touch on fries.  Absolutely plain and lacked much flavor. Too chewy and rubbery.  At that moment I wish I had ordered the hash browns.  It's a cute place, service was great and everyone was very friendly.  But in this particular case, I was disappointed in the food. I'm not a big meat eater and that is probably what sells best here.  Maybe next time it will be better.

I landed at the Phoenix airport and wanted a quick sandwich before my next flight. This isn't the place. The service is slow and the staff is inattentive. Had the waitstaff been working and not not talking or standing around, the service could be better. Hopefully their chicken sandwich will be worth the wait.
Food was pretty good, although watch what you order " la carte". It will add up FAST!

Greasy spoon with quality ingredients cooked to harden arteries. The service was less than stellar, but the atmosphere was cozy (read: tight) and not terribly unpleasant. The food was standard tasting - this place could do with a regular deep cleaning and perhaps some attempt to de-grease the food prep. The service could also use a bit of a boost... perhaps they should partake of their own coffee - the caffeine could help wake them up a bit.  There are some great little places like this dispersed around central Phoenix that give the downtown area some great character. This one is on the low end of the group. A few small changes and this place could easily improve to a 5 star  - but since it's so popular, there's hardly a reason to change anything I suppose.   I'm thankful that I live near downtown Scottsdale where awesome breakfast choices are bountiful. Matt's is worth a visit, but only just.

Yes, you have to wait a long time to eat here... I came to Matt's on a Saturday with a friend and we waitedddddddd, but boy was it worth it. It could just be that I was just THAT hungry and anything I ate at that point was going to be amazing, but I'd like to think it was because the food wasn't some greasy no flavor mess you get at iHOP or god forbid...Denny's. They use fresh ingredients and they have REAL butter on their pancakes and waffles!!!! btw...the waffles are like....how do I put this?.... Waffle heaven! When they offer you the home fries or the hash browns, say home fries! and I only say that because I have not tasted the hash browns and I think the home fries are amazing! The home fries are potatoes made in buttery goodness, rosemary, and onions (not over-onion-baring at all). The freshly squeezed orange juice is tiny but it is sooo worth the $2.50 for those exquisite 6 sips! Staff was very attentive and friendly, the hostess was apologizing to everyone for the wait... and I think she really meant it :)

I have been here twice now and both times were great!  The food is fresh and tastes wonderful.    Pros: +excellent tasting food +excellent customer service +locally brewed coffee (from Cave Creek) +thick slices of bacon +fresh squeezed orange juice +real maple syrup +you do NOT feel terrible after eating here, like some places!  I felt energized and ready to take on the day  Cons: -may have to wait for a table, but worth it -no biscuits or biscuits & gravy on the menu -would like to see an all-natural sweetener such as Stevia available -would like to see organic ketchup available as a condiment  Those cons are very minor and aren't even a big deal.  I highly recommend this restaurant!

First the good, then the bad. I arrived at 1:45 PM and was seated / waited on in a very timely manner. Service was good and the food came out quickly ...... too quickly as you will read in the bad. The potatoes were hot and well seasoned, the eggs were as ordered (over easy). The toast was very good, but only one piece (thick toast).  Now for the bad. The bacon was not even close to being cooked (half raw) and I sent it back. By the time the bacon came back I was basically done with the other food. The worst part was the amount of oil in my plate. It had to be almost an 1/8 of a cup of oil.  I am not a health nut I have eaten at plenty of greasy spoon restaurants and would gladly go back to a few....... but this was ridiculous.  I mentioned this was my first visit when I ordered and as I was paying the waitress asked how my breakfast was. I told her "I have never seen that much oil on a plate and as you know they bacon was almost raw" .......  her reply was at least it is olive oil.

For two and a half years I have been anxiously waiting to try this place.... I saw it on diners drive in and dives before I moved to Phoenix and couldn't wait. Things kept getting in the way but today was the big day! After waiting HOURS in the social security office close by, I became starved. I drove on over and had to find parking behind it in the TINY parking spaces, typical of downtown. I was greeted instantly by a waiter and he gave me plenty of options. I sat at the bar and was greeted by a friendly waitress. I opted for the special and a side pancake. The coffee, was awful. They did not also have cream and only offered milk. I was really disappointed as I like a very simple coffee. My pancake was delicious but the rest was subpar. They only offer one hot sauce and my hash browns were mushy. It was a downtime but the waitresses were all talking amongst themselves eating and the chef staff was in the kitchen being ridiculously loud and goofing off the entire hour I was there. I am really disappointed with my visit and will be sticking to my usual US EGG, breakfast joint. If you're in the mood for pancakes and you are downtown I do recommend this place, other than that... try somewhere else!

The name makes my mouth water.  Matts Big Breakfast.   Quality food, this location will make you proud of what downtown phoenix has to offer and what is to Come.  From the vegetables to the meat selection hand picked food creates quality dishes.     This location serves a  big breakfast in a small place. I look forward to seeing this place grow, do i hear patio?

I never do one star reviews, I leave that to other  folks however I have to keep it on the realz. Absolutely the worst customer service I have ever experienced not once but twice.  Had to drop my kiddo off at the airport super duper early today. I always wait at the gate with her. I grabbed my usual coffee from the Refuge and they are always awesome! Decided to grab a sandwich to go from this place and walked up to the "to go" counter and the waitress who was prepping said and I quote "I have to check to see if we are open" and walked away. The gentlemen who was in line with me said they open @ 5:30 (it was 5:30) so they are open. There were 6 people working, bartender, host, cook, mgr and a couple other people. Why comeeeee the waitress never came back, no one acknowledged the growing line of folks waiting to order. I walked over to the bartender who was actually taking food orders for the folks who sat at the bar and politely asked if someone was going to take our orders and she said without one glance that the waitress will be over in a min. Mind you we had been standing there for 7 mins, every single person that worked there looked over at the ever growing to go line. I/we watched the waitress go get water for a table, coffee then slowly walk to get a coke! Reallyyyy folks... really! After almost 10 mins I was like let's bounce. As I walked by the waitress was taking the food order of the one table she had. Everyone else was sitting at the bar! Still not one person working there went over to the "to go" line.   How very very rude. This  place needs to get it the heck together and revisit their customer service etiquette. The shift manager was there too! Wow just wow.    Done and done....never again!

The food here was AMAZING! I felt like there was not a huge amount of variety in the menu, but what Matt's does, they do very well! The bacon, in particular, is thick-cut and delicious. It took us about twenty minutes to get a table, but it was worth it for sure!

The waitress' chests were the BIG in Matt's Big Breakfast...  When we travel, our days revolve around our food...always trying to find that town's "wow" restaurant. While Matt's Big Breakfast was super super friendly and quite quick at seating us and serving our food....the meals were just okay...nothing really special. I ordered their daily special which was a scramble with spinach, cheese and sausage. The portion was perfect...not too much, not too little....definitely not BIG. My error was ordering something I can get at any breakfast diner I guess. BUT it was healthy, that's a plus! My husband ordered the pork chop...again, it was good. Nothing "wow'd" us as we had hoped....well maybe we were wow'd when the waitress would lean over and refill our coffee cups. Again, we found Matt's BIG in the low-cut tight dresses of the waitresses, no complaints there though.

First review ever about an airport restaurant as they are usually mediocre at best.  But just had best airport breakfast ever with perfectly cooked over easy eggs, thick cut bacon, home fries cooked with onion and rosemary, and a nutty home grain toast with fresh raspberry jam, and locally roasted coffee and fresh squeezed orange juice.  The service was quick and the waiter was friendly and unhurried; he even brought me a large go cup of coffee gratis.  The restaurant was like an oasis in the desert after suffering all the indignities of PHX TSA. I will definitely be back.

I drove past this restaurant and saw people outside waiting. I immediately yelped and found it. The reviews are right on the money. Yes there will be a wait, yes it will be crowded, yes it will be loud and yes the food is amazing and worth all of it. Came here for breakfast on Saturday got in line around 11am got seated right before 12pm. So we ended up have one breakfast dish The Waffle with Bacon and a lunch dish the Butter Burger. There were both delicious. The Waffle is fluffy buttery and fresh the crispy thick cut bacon is salty and balances out the sweetness of the real maple syrup. The butter burger is on point the meat is fresh and cooked to your liking the bun is the icing on the cake it's sweet and tasty. We also had orange juice and when I say orange juice I mean fresh squeezed right into the glass.  It tasted like I had an orange with a straw. The strawberry lemonade was sweet and tangy. The staff was friendly and helpful they took very good care of us. We will definitely be back I hope your enjoy your experience here as much as we did. Thanks for reading. Enjoy!!

Really people? You all think this place is good? Actually I apologize, their bacon is incredible, if you want a great experience from here order 5 pounds of their bacon to go and never look back.   My fianc and I drove from Las Vegas and got to Matt's BB right in time for it to open so there was hardly any line for us which was good because I'd have felt like a real sucker if I had waited long. We walked in and the floor had gum all over it..yum? And also a smelly dishrag smell going on, I'm not going to lie the place looked a little iffy when it came to cleanliness but maybe I'm just particular about that kind of thing. Any way we sat ourselves at a tiny table and opened our tiny menu, there wasn't much on the menu and the stuff that was on it was kinda boring. All the waitresses are wearing whatever they rolled out of bed in i.e. tennis shorts that just covered their butt, and cut off jean shorts with strings and pockets hanging off them, my fianc made a comment about Hooters which was appropriate for what most of them were wearing. I ordered the Five Spot which was reminiscent of a breakfast jack from Jack in the Box. My fianc ordered the waffle which he said was good but left him hungry.   Later on we drove past and saw a huge group of people waiting outside I felt like warning them. Any way we came here because of Diners Drive-ins and Dives and this place was definitely a dive, it was our first triple d experience and we felt cheated by Guy, and really thought of not going anywhere he recommended again, I'm glad we did though because for dinner we went somewhere awesome, I'll review that place little later!

Food was good, phenomenal if you consider the fact it's airport food, and the service was quick, I had mine 10 minutes after I sat down. Toni was very attentive and made sure I had everything I needed when I wanted it. The quality is not quite on par with the downtown location, but it is defiantly above the rest for PHX.
Got the 5 spot and special scramble with schreiners sausage.  Always a favorite breakfast spot of ours
Drove out of our way to try and we were not disappointed! Fast Great food in a funky close atmosphere, and amazing food !

I get paying what the market will bear, the basic economic principal of guns and butter.  But I'm still aggravated when I pay exorbitant prices at the airport and feel slighted, which is all too common.    Not in this case, Matt's Big Breakfast at the cost of $10.83 (pre tip) delivered a quality meal, good service, and a fair price.  I had the Sonrisa Burrito which satisfied my hunger, and was top shelf quality.  It had plenty of scrumptious bacon, jalapenos, potatoes, and perfectly cooked eggs.  The highlight was the swine, they make mean bacon strips!  Another plus was the side salsa they provided, much better than anything that comes out of a bottle.  I washed my burrito down with a cup of coffee.   The physical location is open air, bright and friendly.  They also have a big square bar which can seat around 20 people.  I found my way to the sit down counter, where my server was Kristie, she was friendly, but obviously busy.  I never say this, but I was completely satisfied with my bang for the buck!
The breakfast and coffee were absolutely amazing. Small venue which allows to hear the conversation of your party. The service is excellent. Not a long wait time to be seated. Will return again.

The bacon..... OMG. that is all. If you come here, please please buy the bacon. the waffles are fluffy and yummy as well. The only downside to this place is there is always a wait :/ But once the food comes out thats all that matters to me and my hubby. Overall, staff is friendly and service is quick and to the point but the food trumps it all.

We went on a weekday, which probably helped minimize the notorious wait time.  We were seated at a high table, in the front/private dining room, which also serves as a storage location. There was a lot of traffic in and out, but not to the point of being bothersome, and the view out the front window made it well worth it.  I ordered the special, a Denver scramble, and had cinnamon raisin toast, with homemade strawberry jam.  The scramble was delicious, but the jam was amazing!  I enjoyed my meal, and my experience, and will likely return.

Totally worth the wait! First time in Phoenjx and I'm glad this was my first dining experience.  I loved how the staff worked so efficiently together and there is always somebody waiting to help you with refills and anything you need.  It was definitely a show of good leadership with the owner walking around to help. I would definitely plan to eat here many times over if I'm back in Phoenix.  I had the cheese omelet, side of bacon, hash browns and sourdough toast.  Everything was beyond delicious and I would highly recommend the hash browns - crunchy on the outside and so creamy inside.  Killing it Matt's Big Breakfast!!!

WOW! I WASN'T Expecting my flight to leave so soon! I had already ordered my food and they had served my friend and I a cup of soda . I got curious and checked the time we were suppose to go on the plain. We had 8 minutes to board! The employees understood out situation and didn't give us a hard time! Next time I'm here I will thank them personally! Sorry guys!

After finally going I definitely believe all the hype. Everything I got was delicious; the pancakes, waffle, eggs, bacon, hash browns and even fresh squeezed orange juice. I got there at 9:20 on a Sunday and there was about an hour wait, but it was well worth it.   It is a very small restaurant, but that obviously does not stop the people from enjoying their great food. The service was on point, our food came out right away and when I ordered some extra things, that came out right away too. I would definitely like to try their lunch menu as well.

My dad and I stopped in here a couple weeks again to get a quick bite to eat. This place has become one of the most popular and talked about breakfast spots in Phoenix. Now that I finally got to try it I can taste why it had so much hype. From the customer service to the food and the decor everything was great. I can't wait to go back and try a different dish.

Don't think it lives up to hype. I only come here when my friends want to come but I think there's way better food and overall friendlier service elsewhere. If you're in the area I recommend First Watch across the street.

I'm a huge fan of matts. Have been for 2 years now. Their service is great, but more importantly their food is amazing. Always order teh home fries. My favorites are the hog and chick and the big butter burger. The only slight downfall is the wait, if it looks like there are 25 people in front of you on the list, it might be best to just go another time.  Unless you're willing to wait more than two hours.
I have to say that for breakfast or brunch this is the spot to go. I haven't been here in awhile but like always they never disappoint.

I am another who does not understand the hype about this diner. I have been there twice.  I have had the waffles and hash browns.   The waffles were soggy and the hash browns were very greasy (both times).  I could have done that at home without the 45 minute wait.  Plus, the coffee is putrid.

I went to Matt's the other morning for a solo breakfast before work. I was treating myself because I'd been on a gluten-free diet for over a month and that was the day I was reintroducing wheat after getting some blood drawn, and I'd been literally dreaming about waffles for weeks.   Diet aside, it was such a nice, cheerful way to start my day. I'd been to Matt's before for a Sunday brunch, and we waited forever outside in the heat. This was totally different: I walked in and sat down at the counter, no wait at all, and the waitstaff is very attentive and quick. I found myself smiling out at downtown Phoenix through that big picture window before my beloved waffles had even graced my place setting.   Waffles: solid. Belgian. Bacon: thick-cut and peppered. I could have eaten 5 more slices. Homefries: this is what I remember as being so stand-out from my first visit, and they did not disappoint the second time. Crispy, tasty potato chunks with caramelized onions and sauteed bits of rosemary...oh yum. And they're not even made of wheat.  Thanks, Matt, for giving me a lovely mid-week breakfast experience.
Breakfast in downtown .... the line and wait is worth it.  Wish they had a bigger place !

I normally LOVE this place because any other time, I would've given a five star rating. Today, I went for the first time in a couple months. Normally, to keep my toddler distracted I give him gold fish or some kind of snack from home. I know that's he's hungry and toddlers don't understand the idea of waiting. I was feeding him gold fish when a waitress came up to me to inform me that I can't bring outside food in. His sippy cup was allowed but that's it. Are you serious? I didn't bring Taco Bell in. I brought in gold fish for my toddler who would, if I let him, cause mass destruction just by running around. It was ridiculous.   The food was good but to be informed I can't give my toddler snacks from home inside, it gives me a reason not to come back. I know, I know most people wouldn't see this as a problem but if you can't accommodate my child, no reason to come back.

I've been a fan of Matt's for a few years but today's experience has soured to a point that I doubt return is likely.  Historically, Matt's pancakes have been the tastiest and fluffiest pancakes so much that when the craving strikes, no other pancake will do.  Ordered the pancakes this morning expecting the same fully goodness and was unpleasantly surprised with a gummy, chewy and dense-with-a-hint-of-stale stack of nastiness.  Think pre-teen hockey puck.  Couldn't even choke half of one pancake down.  Between the declining quality of their food and the obnoxiously loud dining room, you'd be better off skipping MBB.
honestly, its all about that toast and homemade jam! place is crazy busy during peak hours.

Probably give the food about 2.5 stars and the service about a 1.. we came about 20 minutes or so after they opened so they weren't super busy yet.. the waitress came and took our order and got our drinks but that's about the only time we had anyone take care of us.. they dropped off our food and just left... there were no "do you guys need anything else?" Etc etc.. the waitresses kept refilling everyone else around us but for some reason they just skipped our table every time... the food was simple breakfast food but it was just okay don't know what the big fuss is about this place.. their bacon was good and their strawberry preserves that came with their toast were pretty good.. (bought couple jars to take home) but their hash browns were greasy and the waffles my boyfriend got he said were just okay.. I don't think I'll be coming back but now I can say at least I try the placed out..
Delicious! Everything was made from scratch and taste homemade. I would definitely recommend giving Matts a try, you won't be disappointed. The service was great! (Art took great care of us).

I wouldnt recommend this place for vegetarians, as they have zilch, excpet for pancakes, toast, omlette and stuff, for which I can go to ihop next door to me. The omelettes for vegetarians doesnt make the cut for me as on top of not having too many options for vegetarians, they charge much for every single topping on it.  The place isnt as big as the name suggests ;) but I love places like that which remind of an old house converted into an eatery. dont get me wrong, but the place is too small, but is super popular in circles, so expect a long wait time, we waited for 30 mins for 2 PM on a Tuesday.  But the price suits well for the Big in the name, the servings arent as big though as the name suggests. I like the build of the place, but I am not going here again.

How do biscuits and gravy SUCK here!!!? And it's supposedly a daily special?? Bluh...first time here and I thought it sucked. Muppy biscuits and soggy.   2 stars because they have stevia on the tables.

The food was good but nothing special on the menu - same old breakfast - bacon and eggs, pancakes, etc.  They do have one special per day, but again, same old, same old - Sunday was steak and eggs.  Also disappointed there was no alcohol on the menu - I love a good Bloody Mary or a Mimosa on the weekend.  Extremely loud inside, chairs constantly scraping on the concrete floor.    I prefer the Matt's at the airport.

I really enjoyed this place when I went a few weeks ago.  I hear that there is usually a long wait to get in, when I went I was lucky enough to only wait about 5 minutes before there was a table ready for us, but then again I went at 11 am on a Tuesday so I think that helped a bit.    I went on the advice of a family member.  What I wish had been mentioned was the process of how you put your name in for a table.  There is a notebook outside the front door where you write your name and the number of people in your party on.    The coffee i had was AMAZING, and it set high expectations for the meal which were definitely met.  I had a special for that day (egg scramble with artichoke chicken sausage and gruyere cheese I believe) with sourdough toast and a side of the homefries.  I would eat this meal again in a heartbeat.  Everything was incredibly fresh down to the homemade strawberry jam.    This is a place I definitely want to go back to.
Really good french toast and coffee was excellent. Came in on a Saturday before 0900 and waited for only 5 minutes. Staff were friendly and courteous.

my best friend and I went to Matt's Big Breakfast a few weeks ago after I read the rave reviews here on yelp.  postitives: free parking, HUGE portions, delicious food taste just like your grandmothers big yummy breakfast, really cute and quaint decor, we were seated immediately, great location downtown phoenix. I ordered the cheese omelet, it came quick and it was gigantor and delicious, thick slices of toast came with it and my hashbrows were the best I've ever tasted in life  negatives: it can not be underemphasized how miniature this place is, very small menu options, cost is a bit inflated  I recommend it for a try.

So bomb! Bottomless coffee is what I like to hear when going into a breakfast joint. Very homey cool vibe to it. Very laid back. Felt like I could go here all scrubby or more casual and cute. I went here with three other people when we woke up one morning and we all got different things for about $10 each. Supppppper good prices!! Service wasn't that great I would say though. Over all rly good and I am wanting to go back.

The best waffle of your entire life awaits you at Matt's Big Breakfast!! It is absolute delectable fluffy yet crispy goodness! Also one VERY important note: the waffle automatically comes with REAL maple syrup; none of that disgusting liquid sugar crap here! And, yes, the serving size of maple syrup the waffle cones with is totally plenty and you do not need to pay the charge for extra syrup! It's the late (sleep in on the weekends) brunch spot of choice for my husband and I when we want some great food - rather breakfast or lunch! And if you're feeling lunchy instead of breakfasty the Butter Burger, or my personal favorite, The Rueben are the perfect choices!  Okay...why are you still reading this review?!?! Go to Matt's - go now!!

If I had to wait for Matt's, I don't think I would like it so much. I mean, it's good, but it's not "I will wait an hour in the Phoenix summer" good.  Fortunately, I've live across the street from Matt's and discovered they have takeout! There is nothing better than walking out with my takeout while people who have been waiting for an hour enviously stare.

I had high expectations after seeing them on Diner's Drive Ins and Drives, and they were exceeded!  We went at around 10:30am on a Wednesday and there was about a 30 minute wait.  It was myself, my wife, and our two kids (3 and 5).  We had a waffle, griddle cakes, and the 'Hog and Chick'.  The waffle was amazing, it went quick between the kids and my wife.  The griddle cakes were good as well, and didn't last much longer.  I had the Hog and Chick with sausage patties, hash browns and wheat toast.  The sausage was great, most likely from the Pork Shop (as well as the bacon), the eggs were pefect, and the hash browns were very good as well.  Even the toast was excellent and came with local strawberry preserves.  I can't wait to go back.  Once we got inside, the service was very good and quick.  We were in and out in just about an hour total, half of which was waiting outside.

Do check out! Today was my first experience at Matts & I would recommend this delicious breakfast/lunch spot! Impressed with Ample parking, short wait time. The employees were all very nice and accommodating. The menu is small but covers all bases: pancakes, scrambled, & breakfast sandwich. Our breakfast was prepared quickly! I really appreciated they use cage free eggs, extra virgin olive oil, & real butter! I was pleasantly surprised to see all of the improvements to downtown Phoenix!

After a few times of walking past the group of hungry patrons waiting for their table at Matt's Big Breakfast, it was about time to stop in and try it myself. It was certainly worth the wait, and there is definitely nothing small about the breakfast. I had the special of the morning - three egg scramble with provolone, chicken sausage and spinach, and Sean S. had the griddlecakes. My scramble was the perfect mix of egg-y cheesy deliciousness for a Sunday morning breakfast. The home fries it came with were also mouthwatering. I think onions and fresh rosemary can make any potato taste good, and Matt's certainly had mastered this mix. I did try some of Sean's griddlecakes, and they were perfection - melt in your mouth, fluffy, and buttery. Finally, the service and the atmosphere were great. I don't think my waistline could handle Matt's often, but the breakfast is worth the indulgence occasionally.

I thought the food was very basic. We started out with Mimosas (because hello we were going to Hawaii)... It came out as a full glass of champaign (yes, please) and you got to add orange juice. We got the burrito and Matt's Big Breakfast to share... It cost about 50.00, which I wasn't surprised since we were at the airport. Our waiter was excellent, very very funny guy!!

My SJ buddies and I came here for breakfast one weekday morning.  Now I know why Matt's gets such great reviews.  The only draw back to Matt's is that it is just so small.  But then again, that is part of it's charm.  This is a tiny little house on a corner in downtown Phoenix.  I can just imagine what the weight is like on the weekends.  They have great fresh food and coffee.  I had the "Hog an Chick" meat and eggs....applewood smoked bacon...YUM!!  And the potatoes reminded me of my Uncle Ernie's potatoes.  So good with herbs and onions.  I gobbled up every bite!!  My coffee cup was never empty and the sourdough toast was .....mmmmm toasty.  I loved Matt's.  Just be sure to bring lots of quarters because there is nothing but metered parking all around.

When I used to live in Phoenix I would be here a majority of my mornings! The Staff is so friendly and the food is high quality. I always stick with the classic bacon and eggs with some coffee, but I've had friends get the sausauge and steak which I tasted to make sure it wasn't poison...and I haven't tried anything that wasn't good! Part of what makes this place so good is the atmosphere. A tiny, trailer-esque diner? Sign me up! If there is a wait they usually have some water or lemonade to sip on while you wait....but the table turnover isn't too long, so it's nothing to complain about.

This is my favorite breakfast spot in Arizona hands down! Every time I have visitors from out of town I suggest this for breakfast. Even when they were at the smaller location I would bring my friends from CA there when I used to live in downtown. I come here a lot with my man and the family and it is never disappointing. The prices are unbeatable for the quality of the food. My favorite item that they serve is their hash browns. I can't put my finger on what make them so delicious, they just are. My last visit they served us burned hash browns but they fixed it right away with the delicious hash browns that I love so much. I usually get some coffee and share a five spot with Eric. The five spot is an amazing breakfast sandwich that has thick bacon, egg, cheese and grilled onions all on delicious bread. When we have a crazier appetite we go for the five spot with an order of waffles. WOW. Unbelievably yummy. There's usually a wait but it's well worth it.

One of the worst dinning experience of my life. Checked in with a party of three and was told the wait was 20-30mins after waiting almost an hour and a half and watching four other parties get seated before mine (was told no room for a party my size even though they sat a group of three that checked in after us) only to be seated and have our waitress take the order of a party of 8 that was seated after us was the last straw! If your going to go to eat here make sure you have an extra two hours to kill...

If you like breakfast and everything it stands for, you've got to come to Matt's.  The reviews on Yelp sent me here, and I'm so glad they did.  The food is delicious, and buttery, and fatty.  But if you know in advance what you're getting in to, there's no room for complaints.  The food isn't healthy to put it mildly, but it's delicious. And it's perfect if you're hungover.  Seriously.  Go have breakfast here, take a nap when you get home and you'll be good to go.    Be advised that there is quite a wait on the weekends.  I had to wait around 35 minutes the time I went, but after reading all the reviews, I knew what to expect, so I didn't mind it. Good food usually means a considerable wait, so just suck it up and go anyways.  Once you try the food, you'll forget you had to sit outside for 40 minutes.

Can't believe it took me so long to try this place! Heard about it from friends and of course saw it on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives and I had been wanting to try it forever but just never had the chance. I finally tried it with some friends and WOW was it good! I had the salami scramble which was DELICIOUS! Never though of putting salami in eggs but I knew I had to try it and it was really delicious...the eggs and salami combo was really tasty. Got that with hash browns and sourdough toast...I have to say, the hash browns were the BEST I've ever tasted. I have no idea what they do to them to make them so good but they were amazing! Very crunchy too which I love. The toast and coffee were quite good as well, and I can't wait to try the pancakes next time!! Best breakfast I've had in a long time!

Ok, folks. I liked this place but it wasn't an OMG jaw dropping experience for me. I appreciate the freshness of the ingredients and the simple presentation. Cannot complain at all about the service (great hospitality from everyone we encountered!) on a very busy Sunday morning. I had the Five Spot, hub had the Belgian Waffle. Both were fresh, hot, and made with good ingredients, but I'm not sure it's worth the drive across town and waiting an hour for (thank you for having inside waiting areas for these hot days.) Giving it four stars on ingredients and hospitality. Otherwise, it would be a solid three.
Excellent food! It not as good as the original, but it's great to have some local food in the airport.

I had been to the original location and thought I would checkout the newer one on camelback.  Was quickly seated at the bar.  Exceptionally clean and very busy.   Ordered a cheese omelet, side of bacon, with hash browns.   Everything was delicious and tasted very fresh.   I actually give this location a slight edge to the original once.

Fantastic breakfast place! Very trendy. The restaurant was very busy when I came in snuck in at the counter. Service was stellar. I had the waffle with bacon. I would highly recommend it. Will be back for sure.

I would have given this restaurant 4 stars except they charged us $1.50 for extra syrup. That just seemed petty and honestly put a damper on the meal. Really Matt??  Come on!  What next?  Charging for an extra squirt of ketchup?  The food overall is solid but they should rethink this policy. Why put a bad taste in customers' mouths over a buck?
