My husband and I have been going to Matt's every Monday for two years now and we love it!!! Everything on the menu is fresh and served hot!! The special of the day is amazing and the waffles are perfect!!
Most amazing breakfast I have ever had in my travels. So much food, service is friendly and fast.  Highly recommend.
Good but not great like I heard it was, pork didn't have much flavor at all, waffles were pretty good though

Overall delicious food. I am not a breakfast person, but I wound up going here for a family member's birthday and was pleasantly surprised. I ordered the Five Spot, an egg and cheese sandwich with bacon and onions. I loved it. It was extremely satisfying, great service from the waitresses, and fairly reasonable prices. The only downside was that it was very busy and the menu was very limited.

I love going into this restaurant. A dear friend and I would go here back in the day. I hardly doubt yelpers had even yelped this house yet. It has a super special place in my heart.  I ordered up the eggs and bakie. Comes with tasty hashbrowns. The sourdough toast is thick as is the bacon. The preserves were awesome. Everyone is very attentive and pretty happy.  Congrats Matt on the upcoming move into the old verde house and the front room we have been enjoying breakfast in since 04 becomes Matts fast food takeout. I wish you well. And congrats on having your very own bathroom soon, lol.

Happiest place in Phoenix! Awesome experience all around. The Hot Spot Breakfast sandwich was delish! The place was extremely clean to include the restrooms. The food came out hot, fresh and fast. The vibe in this place is so cool, everyone is smiling and genuinely happy. I asked one of the staff members what was the secret to everyone's super happy demeanor, she told me that everyone really enjoys working here, the management is supportive and you pretty much have to know someone to get a job here which gives it that tight knit family environment. Wish this place was closer to home I would come here everyday just for a dose of happy
This place has a really good breakfast selection and the food itself is very amazing. The staff was super friendly and able to provide a wonderful service.

It's everything the more flattering reviews say and more - including the wait outdoors. Mine was during a rare Arizona downpour, but even so, it was well worth it.  I waited about half an hour, sharing an umbrella with strangers.  When it was time to be seated, I was asked "are you ready, honey?" by a woman who might have been half my age, if that.  Even though the place was cramped and extremely busy, all of the staff were friendly and accommodating.  Not long after being seated, I was poured the first of what turned out to be four cups of delicious, freshly-ground coffee, at which time my order was also taken.  I had the special - 3 scrambled eggs with locally-raised ham, roasted red peppers, and provolone cheese.  It arrived promptly, and was savored thoroughly.  I'm leaving Phoenix in less than 48 hours, but I'm definitely planning a return visit.

You might have to wait if you visit the downtown location but no wait here. They pour a generous mimosa. Their BLT come on fresh sliced bread, with thick slices of bacon. I like to add avocado. The pancakes are perfect and served with real Vermont syrup. Great place to eat before you get on a long flight.

Every part of this breakfast was perfect. The ham was the way God intended country ham to be. Cut the leg off a pig, cure it, smoke it, slice a huge chunk off of it fry it up and eat! The hash browns were....crunchy and creamy. I have never eaten a hash Brown that I considered delicious until today. Topped off with two perfectly fried eggs and thick sliced sourdough toast with home made strawberry preserves....heaven on a plate.  Service was attentive and quick...highly recommended!

I love breakfast food. Usually there are great options for non-meat eaters. But this is really a meat-eater's breakfast paradise. We realized during the long (1  1/2 hour) wait that we would have limited offerings, but everyone leaving assured us it was worth the wait and it was too late to get breakfast someplace else.   Matt's served the hottest, best tasting scrambled eggs, amazing coffee and some pretty good pancakes.  My companion ordered the tuna sandwich. Good, but not worth the wait. Four stars for the food, minus the wait and the choices.

Ordered the waffles and omelette special (eggs, andouille sausage, pepper jack cheese, and jalapenos) with homemade fries. Waffles are fantastic if you smear the butter around and mix it with the syrup. Nice and soft. Slightly sweet when waffles are by itself. Bacon that came with the waffles were tasty, as well.  Omelette was flavorful, but a touch of tabasco sauce enhanced the flavor. Homemade fries are delicious. The housemade strawberry jam that came with the toast was delicious, as well. Friendly staff. Very busy here - like a 30 min wait.

How I'd have loved to see a Tofu Scramble or a Vegan Pancake option on the menu for the fellow vegans and vegetarians? Sadly, I had to make by with the oatmeal. My husband had the toast and home fries. The blueberry spread was good. Neat location, inside Marina Heights. 4 stars for the great service.

A simple breakfast menu with consistent good results! The coffee is good and it is a place to go to if you want to meet and get out quick, not the kind of breakfast place you want to linger at, too busy and noisy, but worth those for the food.

First and far most expect to wait if not here by opening. Very popular spot. Pork chops and eggs for me both times. First visit fantastic, second visit not so much... manager had my back.... thank you. I'll definitely be back. Understand this place gets BUSY, so yes servers are doing their best to accommodate... try to avoid the frustration if it takes a little longer than normal to wait... then again reminders don't hurt. You can get eggs anywhere... next time I'll be ordering a special... FYI French toast a definite if having a sweet tooth.

My partner and I took her family to eat at Matt's Big Breakfast in Phoenix to try a new breakfast place out. It is in a strip mall next to a grocery store. It was very busy and took about 35 minutes to get a seat for 6, no big deal- I just figured this meant that it was good. The service was friendly enough but they seemed understaffed. It was very busy on this Monday morning after Xmas and our table didn't get much attention (no greeting, no goodbye, only 1 coffee refill, etc). There are no vegan options here. I appreciated that the server knew the hash browns were not vegan but the home fries were. She said the beans were vegan but I could not order them as a side only as part of the chilaquiles meal but since I am vegan, I obviously wasn't going to order that. And then my father in law ordered the chilaquiles and the beans came in a small dish on the side. So I ate home fries and drank coffee. The coffee was good and so were the home fries (I asked for jalapeos and onions to be cooked in with them). The rest of the family enjoyed their meals but wished for more attentive service. I would not go back but I think the meat eaters in the family will!

Mmmm love this place!!!! Love the waffle, and I also really like making my own omelette. It's a nice place to go with friends, family or even by yourself. Gets pretty busy for sure, but I've never really had a huge issue getting in. I feel like Snooze down the street is significantly more difficult to get into... the wait there is like 2 hours! The longest I've waited at Matt's was probably 15 or 20 minutes. Maybe. But delicious food!

Pretty good. Cute little place with a quaint atmosphere. Definitely busy, but the wait wasn't long at all for this location. I had the breakfast sandwich and it was alright. I think I should have gone with the Belgian waffle or pancakes instead, but the sandwich was okay. Everyone was friendly.

The food is good but way over priced, one waffle and a piece of bacon for ten bucks. It had a cool atmosphere, and the people were friendly, maybe I am just to dollar conscious for this place. It was worth it to go once. You won't be disappointed on the quality.

We were so excited to see what all the hype was about... I'm not sure what people think is so great. Three staff members told us about the Tuesday special and how great it was. So hubby and I both ordered it. Then we were told they only have enough for one, so my hubby changes his order. Then another waitress comes and tells us they're completely out, so I also had to change my order. Hubby paid over $14 for the most bland omelette we've ever tasted. And my chicken sandwich was just okay. It was also very bland. The one yummy thing was the hash browns. And they have this great all natural ketchup. That was about it.   Also for a place called "Matt's big breakfast" you would expect something to be large about it. Not so much.   The only other upside was the waitresses are very nice and pretty attentive.
Always and I mean always yummmmm! Service fast and friendly. Local,organic market fresh foods! Bacon big flavor.
Service terrible first time and second time. Food small portions and eggs underdone. Sticking with the original downtown . Somewhere customer service and great food lost .

I had my first experience with Matt's this morning. A friend of mine had seen it on Diner's, Dives and Drive In's (or something along those lines) and was excited to try it out. The wait was about 20 minutes(arrived at 9 am) and seating is very limited but worth it!  I'm all about the breakfast food so I was excited to try somewhere new. The menu is limited but covers all bases. The coffee (a special blend just for them) is local as is everything that they serve. I swear the bacon tastes better when it's from around the corner.  I decided on the belgian waffle and a side of hash browns. SUPER YUMMY!! I appreciate the note on the menu that they only use butter and extra virgin olive oil... No trans fats here! The hash browns were a bit oily but tasty overall.  As I was leaving I saw a huge stack of pancakes on their way to a table... I know what I'm getting next time!!

We went this morning for breakfast and I was pleasantly surprised. My sister is a student in the area and had been once before so she took us out of Towners.  My mom got the skinny, which was egg whites with chicken sausage and spinach, she's all about that stuff so she loved it. My sister and I both got the hog & chick. I got ham which was a thumbs up & sister got bacon. Both delicious. Step dad for the special which was steak and eggs. The steak really impressed me, not only was it cooked perfectly, it was a nice thick piece of meat, they don't cut corners. The toast might have been everyone's favorite part of breakfast, even my carb hating mother. I didn't give 5 stars because I wish they had a bigger menu, just a few more choices!! :)

Breakfast, as good as it gets! The food, YUM!  The service, outstanding! The vibe, hipster chill. The wait at 8:45 on a Sunday morning, 5-10 minutes. Phew, I would have happily waited 30 minutes.  Matt, I applaud you for taking the time to prepare everything from scratch with only the finest ingredients.  It shows in the homemade belgian waffles with sweet creamery butter & real maple syrup, the thick sliced peppery & oh so perfect bacon, the omelets made with Wisconsin cheddar, the rosemary home fries, the breakfast sandwich, the fresh-squeezed OJ and, of course, the bottomless cup of locally roasted dark roast coffee.    I can only imagine how good their biscuits & sausage gravy would be... if they had them, but I love a restaurant that does a few things very well, instead of trying to be all things to all people.

Sunny side up eggs were perfect which is not all that common. Thick cut peppered bacon was perfectly crispy, thich cut rye, and amazing rosemary potatoes. Coffee refills were also served promptly. This place in the airport rivals some popular breakfast joints in Phoenix.

Seriously as good as it looked on Food Network.  bacon was top quality.  I got the special which was chipotle cheddar sausage scramble and a side of bacon.  honestly the star may have been the strawberry lemonade though.  fresh made with strawberry puree it was delicious.  thank god for the time difference we got there early enough the wait was only 20 minutes.  a million thumbs up
Busy diner, but worth the wait. Their flavored lemonades are fresh and on point. Would visit this again when back in Phoenix.

Excellent breakfast! Had this place on my list and it didn't disappoint! Came on a Thursday morning, no wait, small crowd. The food and drinks came pretty quickly. I had eggs, potatoes and bacon which is great. I was very impressed with the flavor, portions and overall experience. Would definitely go back!
You know it's good when you have a line out the door and cold water outside to keep you hydrated. Great place, tremendous food and good portions. Love this place!

So I was excited to find out there was this location.  I visited the one downtown a few times and it was always amazing.   I came to this location and first off my waitress was so weird and like high, she's like I'm sorry I just need coffee. Im like okay, we ordered food. I liked my boyfriends rosemary potatoes the best. Everything else sucked. My bacon looked great but fell apart when I bit down,  too hard and too crunchy for my liking. Beef jerky would have been better than that bacon.  The waffle was okay.   Overall, disappointed. I was so sad walking out.
Love,Love,Love Matt's and I am loving the new location right across the parking lot from my work. My new breakfast spot from now on

My husband and I are pretty new to the area and we found Matt's Big Breakfast and were pretty impressed with their breakfast fare... until our last recent visit just yesterday.  I decided not to order my usual 5-spot breakfast sandwich and had the Hog & Chick menu item for a change.  I ordered my eggs over easy and hashbrowns, instead of the country potatoes.  All three of us order the hashbrowns and all three of us were very disappointed.  The hashbrowns were soggy, lukewarm, and almost the consistency of mashed potatoes in the middle.  Yuck!  My easy over eggs still had runny whites all around the yolk... double yuck!!  The only saving grace was the yummy bacon.  The food certainly wasn't worth waiting in line to get in the joint.  If we go back, I would stick with the 5-spot breakfast sandwich and the country potatoes.

Wonderful place...terrific menu selections very unique all fresh natural local Ingredients...in a lovely comfy, casual  atmosphere with fast, friendly service...no surprise it's a local and national hit...try all 4..!!!

My husband and I were visting Phoenix this past week. We looked on Yelp for a recommendation for a great breakfast place that wasn't far from our hotel downtown.   Boy were we happy we found Matts! It was Thursday morning and the wait was only about 10 minutes. The restaurant is small and lively. The service was fast and friendly. And the food was FANTASTIC!   I got the H & C - with delicious thick cut peppered bacon and fluffy scrambled eggs. The hashbrowns were delicous and the thick slices of sourdough toast with raspberry preserves completed the meal. The coffee was also very good. My husband had the salami scramble and thought it was very tasty as well.   Matt's was one of the highlights of our week!

Very friendly welcome when u walk in. I walked from the Sheraton on N.3rd, nice quick walk. I ordered The Five Spot platter with the strawberry honey lemonade. It was DELICIOUS. Grilled sweet onions gave it a great flavor. I normally don't eat onions with my food, but the sweet flavor mad it worth it. It's an upscale Bacon, Egg & Cheese sandwich for my fellow city New Yorkers.

My family and I parked our asses at the breakfast bar after a 45 minute wait.  And had a perfect breakfast.  Ernie was delightful to chat with, but more importantly, the breakfasts were spot on.  Great cakes, great scramble, amazing chunky breakfast potatoes, and am I imagining it or did I get served a bloody mary?  Hey, a guy can dream.  :)
Great food, nice place. A little pricey but a good experience.

The only breakfast meals that my husband likes are pancakes and waffles, and he is very particular about them. He was not impressed with NCounter's Belgian waffle, but he gave 5 stars to the waffles here. They are served with real maple syrup and are a generous portion.   I had eggs, bacon, homefries, and toast, and my meal was delicious and fueled me into much of the afternoon. You can tell that the ingredients here are fresh. The slices of bacon were thick, and the bread from which my toast slices were cut was made that morning.   The entrance to the restaurant is located within the State Farm complex, with a few parking spots available directly in front of the restaurant. We walked from the AC Hotel along the bike path. Our service was friendly and quick. When we travel and eat out, we try to explore as many different restaurants as possible, but this place was so good we were both tempted to have breakfast here again!

This place is a joke.  They are supposed to open at 6:30.  At 6:50 we're still waiting to seated because "we've gotten a late  start".  Then, someone, a server, finally suggested to the manager sitting with her coffee playing around on her lap top, that they could open the to go place line only. I'm sorry, but I have no patience with business owners / bad managers that can't get their stuff together.  Great way to kill s business.  I know I will NEVER PATRONIZE THIS  ESTABLISHMENT AGAIN.

I had a very nice meal here. My waffle was absolutely delightful, bacon was flavorful and crispy like I had asked for, and the blueberry lemonade was so refreshing. I wasn't a huge fan of the home fries just because I like them much crispier and these were honestly pretty mushy. My grandma said her pork chop was bland but still tender and tasted better with A1 sauce. All of the employees were welcoming and attentive. I would've liked to have seen some more sweet breakfast options, perhaps with fresh fruit or something like that. All in all, a great breakfast.

Excellent breakfast place  Had a work breakfast and came away impressed. Nice restaurant design and things were spotless.  Service crew was super nice and quick to tend to everything we could ask for.  Drinks were on our table within two minutes of order, breakfast plates hit about fine minutes after the waitress walked away, and drinks were always refilled.  Food was very good, though we ordered the basics. I'll take my family to try some sweeter carb fare.  If they rave, I'll update and give a fifth star.  They're a true Phoenix gem!

Does anyone else have mega love for their patio? The food and service is always on point, it's the homestyle hospitality that gives you all the mom-and-pop feels! And the hash browns, so so so good. Definitely recommend for a no-fuss breakfast in Tempe!

Matt's is in a league all it's own! Accidently stumbled upon it today when going to the new Mountainside Fitness located in the StateFarm Mega Campus surrounding Tempe Town Lake. Considering my wife and I are absolute foodies to the core, we both dropped the ball on this place! As in how have we not heard of and already made this gem a regular in our good eats rotation!   Now for the food!   Me: The Five Spot, 2 eggs real butter cage free, 2 ridiculously thick pieces of suculant bacon, Wisconsin cheddar on a hand made roll! This thing was 5 bucks... Get real! I'd show you if I didnt eat it too fast!.  Wife: Cheese Ommlett: honestly we didnt speak the entire meal nor have time to look at each other's plates; too concentrated and focused on each and ever bite! So, it was spectacular or my wife would have been chatting away as usual!   Please if for no other reason you come here though, at least venture in to have a glass of the no lie 100% winner of a prize I will only give out once in this lifetime...... World's Best Lemonade Period... Ok so this award won't be featured in the NY Times, and I don't have a plaque or ribbon, however you do have permission to add this prestigious title to your official menu! Who knew honey was the missing ingrediant in each amnd every lemonade recipe world wide! #SaveTheBees  Concluding this essay I've typed up for you other locals, and or tourist/ASU parents, let's recap your options: IHop, Chompies, U.S Egg, Sooze. Let me solve the dilema of having options, and point you to the lakeside eatery I've been to only once and know where all future breakfast runch\lunch dollars will go if we are eating out!   PS stellar service, every single staff member was vigiliant, respectful, and happy. Had a Trader Joe staff kind of feel if you know what I mean!

Excellent little breakfast place. A great local hangout but come early to beat the crowd. Service is quick and polite w many friendly faces.   Breakfast menu is all natural ingredients. Haven't tried the lunch menu yet but it all looks good.  You will definitely feel full when leaving!

Always worth the wait! You can taste the quality and freshness in each bite. You can't go wrong with the pancakes, just make sure you are prepared to take home leftovers. The jams is a must so make sure you order a side of toast to try.

everything has pepper on it, the bacon overcooked with bacon, potatoes has rosemary all over it. If you did not want something that is comes with, could not get substitutions, the tea is awful, do not have plain tea, when asked for tea bag, they gave you one and charged extra for every tea bag, service was awful and place small, this is not the best place at all for breakfast I do not care what anyone says, it is GROSS, there are better places then this.
This breakfast was very very basic and quite gross. I found a long piece of hair on my toast and my waffle was undercooked. Feel sick after eating here don't eat at matts big breakfast.

Everything about this place is amazing!!! The food, the atmosphere, the staff, the food, did I mention the food?  My family of 4 all picked something different, and we all said ours was the best, so of course we had to try everyone else's.  We were all right.  You can't go wrong, there is something for every pallet and appetite.  It is cozy, so be prepared to wait and sit close to other satisfied diners.  We lucked out and sat next to an amazing retired couple from Sacramento.  Eat here NOW!!!

This is a must visit. The place is small and simple, yet if you go at the wrong time you'll wait in line. Luckily,  we went early and ate at the bar. The service was great, the food was great, and the bacon was off the charts!

If you are ever in Tempe, Arizona just outside of Phoenix, then go to Matt's Big Breakfast for food that will not disappoint:)  Located in Marina Heights near the State Farm building, this famous Arizona breakfast branch is nice and clean, and ready to take your order.  I ordered the pork chop with 2 overhard eggs, home fries with rosemary, and wheat toast with a side of berry jam.  The bottomless coffee was very good especially with the small tin of milk versus creamer provided.  The rosemary was prevalent in the pork chop that was perfectly cooked and succulent in taste.  Speaking of succulent, there was also a succulent as a table decoration that added a touch of Arizona.  The highlight was the addition of thick cut bacon I ordered to compliment my meal, which were 3 apple smoked and peppered pieces that were so crispy and flavorful, I wanted to hug Matt and thankfully say "now this is how bacon should taste!"  This organic farm to table type establishment was an excellent representation of what a modern breakfast in Arizona should taste like and worth eating on a placeMatt;)
Cool vibe, very friendly staff and really good food. If you're downtown this is a great place for breakfast.

Mmm...my buddy suggested this tasty place while continuing to validate the original esteemed praise from "Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives".  We split the Tuesday Special of Biscuits & Gravy and ohhhh am I satisfied.  Get the side of thick bacon.  Matt's has a kind atmosphere and a young service that is very attentive. We always had water in our glasses, (and she always remembered to keep the ice from me! ) There was misbehaving couple whose toddler was continually blasting screams, but we were still able to appreciate the designed experience.  I'll happily return when in Phoenix. There's probably a weekend line, but it'll be worth the wait...
Great menu, albeit limited.  Unique dishes that make it hard to choose.

This place is the best breakfast in town. It used to be so easy to get a table too until Guy Fierri  had them on his show and now you wait at least 45 mins for a table.  But the food is so good OMG it is still worth it. It is so tiny but the food is huge!! The fresh fruit preserves on the homemade bread, the home fries with fresh rosemary and caramelized onions, yummy sunny side up eggs with a GIANT piece of ham. I just cannot stress enough how mouth watering delicious this little gem is :)

I love breakfast and their breakfast is my favorite, but that is beside the point. A lot of places make good food but I don't review a lot of places. I'm taking the time to write this because every time I come here I'm blown away by the service. These men and women hustle. Few places in the valley keeps a staff that even pretends to be accommodating. There is usually a line out the door. The staff is always moving, always seating customers, always following up and getting food out. I love it.
The breakfast sandwich was incredible!  The bun is a cross between a bagel & croissant. The waffle was the best I've had - 100% maple syrup  Would definitely go back

This place is seriously on point.  My wife and I are here with some friends for spring training.  We were told to come here for breakfast and it was probably the best breakfast I've ever had.  The location is great, food is awesome and great customer service.  Blake was our server and he was on top of everything.  He took our order promptly and was quick worth he drinks.  I had about 5-6 iced teas and never had to wait.  Then the food came.  Omg! Amazing.  I had the Chop and Chick, my wife had the special scramble and our friends had the Hog and Chick.  We will definitely be back next time we are in Phx.     Thx again!!!!

The service is on point. Best service I have ever seen, and they are super efficient. But you only get to see this is you arrie well before 9:30 or there will be a minimum of an hour wait.  Luckily we got here at 8 am.. and it was great. The coffee is roasted in cave creek, and being a coffee snob I fully approve.  Pancakes amazing Breakfast sandwhich - minus bacon + sausage patty = WOW the spices on that patty were incredible Omlette special - I was jealouse my friend ordered this and I didnt.. I almost took it from here and ended our friendship so I could enjoy her food on my own Hasbrowns - mor elike hash mashed potatoes with amazing spices and the best hash I have had in a while  Toast - YES THE TOAST IS GOOD. How can toast be worth mentioning... because it is.

I've been to Matt's Big Breakfast twice. I was not impressed by the long wait or the atmosphere. It  was small and dingy. The bathroom in the dive hotel next door was really disgusting.  I did enjoy the food though. The first time I got an *egg white and vegetable omelet*, which was ok. It was fresh, which was good. The real stand out for me was the *toast*, they said they said it was local and the bakery sold at the farmers market around the corner. It was really delicious. I also enjoyed the *hashbrowns*, they were greasy but yummy. They used a spice that I couldn't discern. I think it was a little bit of nutmeg. It really popped.   The second time we went, I got the *egg salad sandwich*. It was well balanced. Same good bread. I got a side of hashbrowns, because I enjoyed them the first time.   My husband wasn't impressed at all. He thought his omelet was average and didn't really care for the atmosphere.  Because of the cost, and atmosphere, I don't think we will be returning anytime soon.
Amazing food and atmosphere. Best breakfast in PHX

Yay! I'm a fan! I tried Matt's Griddlecakes and Salami Scramble. Also tried the freshly squeezed orange juice and sipped on their coffee.   Here's what I liked -- the griddlecakes are 3 stacked pancakes with "mystery" ingredients. It seems like they infused the pancakes with butter and milk. They place sweet cream butter on top! Please make sure to share this plate! It's very sweet and I could only eat half! They also mention to give real maple syrup on the side, which is a nice touch. I'm just a tad skeptical though if it is real.   I do like their hash browns and salami scramble. It's a little on the salty side, but it is tasty! The orange juice to my surprise did taste great! I would definitely recommend this place to a friend!

A little confusing walking into the side entrance for take-away. I almost thought it was a order and then sit down establishment. Once we found the hostess stand and were seated the food I must say was good. the service however I must admit for not good. No refill on my coffee, waitress never came back to check on us and I ended up having to ask for the check from whom I believe was a manager.

Service was excellent, food and drink, not so much. I had the chorizo scramble with country style potatoes. The potatoes weren't cooked evenly, because they weren't cut the same. Some pieces small and overcooked, some pieces huge and raw. I definitely didn't care for getting a huge rosemary stem in one bite either, gross! I ordered the blueberry lemonade with honey. The blueberry tartness was there, and the lemon sourness was there, but the sweetness of the honey was definitely missing. I didn't drink half of it. It's too bad that the food standards were lacking, because the service was upstanding. I won't be back any time soon.

Not sure about all the reviews here?  This place was so LOUD that you couldn't even have a conversation.  The food was mediocre at best.  Not bad, just nothing special.  Same waffles at an IHOP for example.  You know that little metal pitcher of syrup you get with a waffle, the tiny size...well, if you want more syrup ... that's another 1.50$ please.   So, the prices are fine, family of 4 for 50$, but not worth going back to for the ambience for sure... my ears are still ringing .
Went for brunch with some friends. Had the griddle cakes and hash browns which were so good! I am definitely ordering the honey lemonade next time. The only downside to the place was the noise.

After all the raving I have heard about Matt's Big Breakfast and the long wait I was so excited to enjoy my food. The quality of the ingredients were high; however, the service was not so great. I felt that the waitresses were attempting to rush us out of the restaurant. I realize that it is a busy place, but their overt pushiness was not warranted.   Overall I would not go back again. The food was made with great ingrediants, but it just didn't "do it " for me.
Can't believe what a great breakfast place this is at the airport they need to open all over the valley if you are in terminal B ask for Katie she rocks!!! Great friendly customer service !!!

This is not a place for the calorie conscious, so dieters need to swear off this place like the plague. Even the salads here are smothered in bacon, eggs, cheese and dressing. But if you feel like punishing your arteries in the most delicious fashion, I highly recommend Matt's Big Breakfast. I've heard from just about everyone I know that this place is the bee's knees, the elephant's eyebrows, the eel's hips...and the buzz wasn't wrong.   This place has some amazing hangover food, so after a night of indulging we arrived at this little diner around noon thirty and had to wait about twenty minutes to be seated. The temperature was well over 100 degrees by that point, which is not good on the dehydrated and hung over, but they were kind enough to provide a giant tub of ice water so that waiting diners didn't drop like flies before they could be served. Two stacks of complimentary foodie magazines were also present for perusal, but my brain didn't feel like thinking yet. However, by the time we were done with our dining experience at one twenty, there were empty booths all over the place, so if you're impatient, go during the last hour they're open.  Once inside, we sat at the bar, right in the path of the air conditioning vent, with a clear view of the kitchen going ons. Seeing how I drank my share of water outside I ordered an RC Cola (I didn't even know that brand still existed!) that came in a can. While waiting to order, I did some pretty extreme rubbernecking, judging the deliciousness of every dish that came out of the kitchen or was being munched on by others. The menu was modest in size but boasted that they used the freshest organic ingredients whenever possible, and after watching everyone else I was pretty excited when the time came to order.   I decided to go with my traditional breakfast fare, so I could accurately compare it to other brunch joints: eggs over medium, bacon, hashbrowns and sour dough toast. The Hog and Chick!  And. It. Was. Heaven.  It's clear that everything they offered was as fresh as it could possibly be. The toast tasted freshly baked, doughy yet crisp, and was delicious dipped in my eggs. Thick cut peppered bacon melted in my mouth. The hashbrowns had to have been made on the premises, because they looked exactly like the ones I make in my own home, greyer than the freezer variety and a bit gelatinous. There was even a tiny tub of fresh apricot puree that tasted like there wasn't a lick of processed sugar added.   And everything was drowned to a lovely crisp in butter.  I only wish it were in Tempe instead of Phoenix, because I'd love to try the other menu offerings. It's cheap, delicious, friendly, and some of the best damn hang over food I have ever had.

Second time here.  Great food and service both time.  Perfect example of keeping it simple and reciting well.  Wife had the cheese omelet and I had steak and eggs (Sunday special).  Everything was cooked perfectly and the steak was tender and flavorful.  Would definitely recommend for breakfast or brunch.
Fun staff. Sit at the bar. Mamacita burger add egg was awesome

While waiting outside, the fresh smell of BACON & waffles are waffling thru the air on the patio. There's a bird whistling a happy tune while the patrons come in and out of this small red brick building. When you cross the threshold to the other side, you are greeted the the diner atmosphere to the smell of fresh bacon.  Freshly squeezed OJ & lemonade are on the menu w/ the freshest ingredients known to man kind.. Hence due to the caption on the back of the menu with the smell of waffle & bacon waffling around my senses.   -Did I mention the smell of bacon? ..probably Ooh three or four times already. That's how good it smells while tantalizing my sense of smell.  I can't wait to get in the door to the kingdom that's is Matt's.

Five stars alone for the perfect crispy, buttery char on the hash browns and for the wonderfully loaded and homemade jam with a fat piece of wheat toast. The eggs, over easy were perfectly cooked and the pork chop was nicely seared and had a great flavor on it. The bacon was fat and crispy as well. Everything I had was well done and makes me want to go back on a Monday so I can try their heuvos ranchero with green chile sauce.   Friendly staff, nice ambiance, and an owner or manager who walked around and checked on customers. It was well worth the trip downtown
A good restaurant. Always very busy.  Don't confuse the Midwest Chilli with Cincinnati Chilli.  It is not over spaghetti.

Love this place! Been going here for years. The service and food are always great. I would recommend the steak and egg omelette special that they usually have on the weekends. Everything else I have had is great as well.

Great Food! Better Environment!  Visited this place solely because I it was on "Diner, Drive-ins and Dives" soon realized what all the fuzz was about. Sure there is a long wait but it went by fast. All food was made with the freshest ingredient and portions were well served.

The PERFECT Breakfast :)  If only I could have this every day :)  Matt's is all you want a breakfast spot to be...cute, friendly and the most amazing food out there.  I highly recommend the hog and chick.  You just can't go wrong with eggs*, bacon*, home fries* (get the home fries, not the hashbrowns) and their toast* served with Terra Verde Farms preserves.  * = best ever, ever, ever  I could write on and on...you've seen the reviews.  Just make sure to make it there, you won't be sorry, you'll be addicted!
Best bacon I've ever had at a restaurant, and I'm a farm girl!!  Everything was farm fresh and high quality...highly recommend.

Not much to add that everyone else hasn't already said, this place lived up to our expectations. The waffle was pure heaven, I'm sure I could have inhaled it if no one was looking. The thick cut bacon will make you question all other bacon you've ever had. Ham off the bone? A religious experience. Both the honey lemonade and the fresh-squeezed orange juice should be sipped like fine wine. Go here. Bring someone with you so you can steal food from them. Seriously.  Besides the food, the service was wonderful. Our waitress was extremely attentive and personable even though the restaurant was busy. The wait wasn't as bad as some make it out to be, be patient and your chance to enter Valhalla will come.

Just arrived in Phoenix last night and was looking for a place for breakfast. We picked Matts Big Breakfast based on Yelp reviews and because it was close to the Sheraton.  We got there about 7:30 and had no trouble getting a seat but by 8:15 or so people waiting in line.  First of all, the waitstaff were fantastic. They must do some sort of "collaborative" serving here because it seemed as though every single one of them was taking care of us.  It was not as though they were constantly interrupting our meal to ask us if we needed anything, they were quite simply on top of taking care of our every need regardless of which one of them happened to walk by.  I ordered the eggs Benedict with a side of bacon because that was the Thursday special and it was fantastic. I would definitely come back for breakfast or lunch.

I got the waffle breakfast with bacon and eggs. It was delicious.  My boyfriend got the steak and eggs cooked to perfection and my friend got the special of the day that she was happy with. It seems like there is a very low chance of being disappointed at this restaurant!

I have always loved Matt's Big Breakfast.  The staff is always friendly, and very knowledgeable about specials and the downtown area.  Matt's restaurant is  located in an awesome area, located centrally in downtown Phoenix!  It is adjacent to the Phoenix farmers market and other local restarants.    Due to Matt's popularity, it is extremely busy with limited seating.  However due to the quality of their food and customer service it is well worth the wait in my opinion!  My girlfriend and I were told there would be a wait time of about 25 min.  We went to walk around and when we came back we had already been called.  The waitress in the front told us that it's okay and sat us as the next seats became available.  It's things like that, that seperate mediocre service to superb service and I will always be a customer of Matt's for that!

Favorite breakfast in Phoenix!  Real ingredients, real people and really good. I get the same thing EVERY time I visit. Waffle (with real maple syrup) + extra crispy thick butcher cut bacon + crispy hashbrowns (grilled in real butter - you can really taste it). This meal is not for the diet conscious. Hubby always gets the Chop n Chick (as seen on Diner's Drive Ins & Dives) - this is tasty too!  Simple, no frills food with outstanding taste. LOVE this place!

We are from out of state and were looking forward to today's breakfast for some time.  I had a cheese omelette, country potatoes, toast, and a side of bacon. The country potatoes were so greasy making  them inedible. I asked for hot sauce and was given a bottle of their own hot sauce that tasted more like barbecue sauce minus any kick. Nothing particularly special about this place or the service, although it is pretty cute.

Since we were on vacation and Guy Fiere had suggested a breakfast place my wife agreed to go to Matt's Big Breakfast in Phoenix. This place may have converted my wife to becoming a breakfast liker.  Though there menu below is kinda of lite on options. Nine breakfast items and if your there after 11am you can choose from another nine lunch items. If it wasn't for Guy Fiere featuring them on them twice on the Food Network we would have skipped this place. How could any of these common breakfast items be so good to wait in line for about forty-five minutes.  Overall the restaurant can hold maybe about fifty people. I wouldn't suggest this place if you had a party of more then four. They really don't have room to combine a whole lot of tables. Also they don't quote wait times be scared, be very scared or bring a newspaper or your phone with a 2 person game like we did. We like playing Connect 4 it's an easy game but both of us are pretty competitive, so time passes fast.   We got seated at the bar, the service was prompt. We ordered coffee's, Griddle Cakes and The Chop and Chicks. Took under fifteen minutes to get our food out. The food was hot and smelled amazing.  According to my wife these are the best pancakes the ever! She almost couldn't put the fork down. They were really light, sweet and fluffy pancakes. It was served with a nice dollop of butter and warm maple syrup.
4 stars only cuz the wait is sooooo long! Outside - line around the block, no lie. Good food! Matt can cook! The food is great but when I want to eat, I want to eat!!

What can I say about this place. We were referred to by a good friend of my girlfriend and we said that we should try it since all of the other places didn't appeal to us.   When u walk up to this location the have some kinda corral outside of it. Idk what's that about but whatever. This place had a nice atmosphere and seem really bizzy like it was a good local hang out. The staff was friendly which make it a plus.   The food was mediocre and kinda bland. Plus they didn't bring part of our order so it was like cool we don't want it anyway. It seems like the normal complete meal that you get from any other breakfast place you have to add it on here. Then the food took some time to come out. Smh. We were like it doesn't take that long to make breakfast. We were not impressed with this place at all. Sad to say but we won't be going back

Truly an awful disappointment. Service flat out sucks. The 1st time my wife and I are here there was an insect in her food. Instead of yelling fire in a crowded theater I quietly notified the manager. His response? "Our food is organic, local and sometimes this happens." WTF? NO! It means you're not washing your greens before cooking you dolt! DISGUSTING! Matt's breakfast is all hype and no substance. The only thing big about it is the check. Go elsewhere.
What can be said which hasn't been all ready??!!  Great food, service and prices!  Endless coffee, fresh squeezed oj and excellently prepared meals.  Definitely worth a go!!!
simply amazing. the wait is so worth it. i love everything i've had so far. i'm obsessed with the orange juice.

Wow! This place is great. The breakfast specials are amazing. You can't go wrong with the steak and eggs or the 3  egg scrambled. The fresh squeezed orange juice and blueberry honey lemonade make everything feel right in the world. One thing you have to be prepared for is the wait since its first come first serve, but it's well worth it.

I always thought I would never write a review and post it. To me the option of others regarding an establishment is moot, we all have things we value over other things when to it comes an establishment. However the one thing EVERYONE can agree on is getting what we asked for in a timely manner. That brings me to this review about Matt's Big Breakfast.  I have wanted to try Matt's Big Breakfast for a while now. I know there is usually a decent wait to get a table, but I had a foodie friend in town from NYC and thought she is the perfect person to go with me. We got there on Monday after the Super Bowl at around 11am... as I thought we were on a wait, 30 minutes, not bad.  They called our names and we sat right by the door at the bar that looks outside to the street. Our server was fast to come to us and take our drink order. Our Strawberry Honey Lemonades arrived and she took our order and went to put them in. Now it doesn't really matter what we ordered but I will tell you anyway; The Hog and Chick, with a side pancake and the daily special (omelet of some sort) with a side pancake.  After about 10 minutes The Hog and Chick plate arrived, 3 minutes later both side pancakes arrived, 2 minutes later the bill arrived. When the server came back I told her our whole order had not come out. She said oh yeah you didn't get your toast, she leaves before I could say anything. She brings back a side of toast and I said the other dish, the daily special didn't come out yet. She goes back brings more toast and says she put in the daily special. 5 more minutes go by and the same server takes away my plates (yes I ate, I was starving) and she asked did we get the bill. I tell her yes, but we still are waiting for my friends order. 5 more minutes go by and I go to pay. I told the manager behind the counter about our missing meal, so it could be removed from the bill. The manager asked if I had told the server we didn't get our entire meal... yes I told her. The manager just seemed more concerned that she pointed out the error of the server, because she asked me this question 2 or 3 times. The manager then asks the kitchen, the kitchen didn't know anything about a daily special on that ticket or about having one told to them 5 minutes ago about it being done on the fly.   The manager removes the meal; just the daily special and I pay for the rest. The manager says they will get the daily special out for us right away. I tell her I am done, my friend doesn't want it and we are leaving so there is no point. The manager insisted that we wait and take it, okay I think she is trying to make it up to us... we will wait. So 5 more minutes go by and I see a bag up in the window, a few more minutes go by (as it sat in the window) and I tell my starving friend let's go. As we are getting up to leave a server runs over and says "here is your to-go order" TO GO ORDER! That is funny!! I ask for the manager and she said "you already spoke to her."   I was not happy that the manager didn't deliver it herself and apologize to my friend, I was not happy that my friend now had a horrible experience and was still starving, I was not happy that the server said I had already spoken to the manager.  I am disappointed that a small restaurant in downtown Phx that was featured on a national TV Show didn't care enough about a local to come over and say anything, giving us the meal to go was pointless (it went in the trash)  Next time work on customer service, not pushing the bill on guests (there was no longer a wait) and make sure EVERYONE in the party has their meal. It's a little late to ever change my opinion, maybe my friends (yes I have told a lot of ppl about this experience) will still go and judge for themselves. If they do my advice I told them... don't go hungry, you may not get your food.

Been here a couple times.  Liked it a lot, the food was good, the service is warm and friendly and the wait was fun with friends.  I don't have anything against Matt - I love the Roosevelt and visit there fairly often - I just don't see the point in waiting, in the sun, for breakfast - when it's not that special and if you have to walk into the hotel next door to use the restroom.  I am looking forward to some competition.
Amazing French toast and they use all local companies for their bacon & sausage, yuuummm!

They say breakfast is the most important meal of the day.  If you are looking for quality than look no further.    My coworkers and I been to this location many times.  And every time we came it was a great experience.  Every time we come here there is always a long wait.  But it's worth it, the quality and the ingredients are top notch!  The hams and the bacons.... amazing!!  The food here is definitely worth the wait.  The place is alway very cramped but it's okay, it's a small little place.  They also have another location, but I have not been to that one, I think it's at the airport.  Overall this is a great little place in the downtown area, I highly recommend this place.  You won't be sorry about the quality, there's a long wait here for a reason :) ohh yeah parking sucks, you might want to carpool!

I have been wanting to try this place because of the breakfast! I ordered a waffle with bacon the waffle was phenomenal but the bacon was burnt. My boyfriend ordered the house potatoes and as much as it looked appetizing it tasted like I took a mouthful of RoseMary. The freshly squeezed orange juice was great! And we had great, friendly service!

Reviews scared me a little but I can say my experience was very good... service was exceptional. I had the French toast and sausage...very good...and the orange juice is fresh squeezed...at least that's how it tasted...none of that funny added sugar many restaurants serve...for an airport extremely reasonably priced....had the sausage not been a little over cooked this would have been 5 star rating

Was visiting Arizona and asked where would be a decent place to eat. When I first found this place it didn't appear to be a hot place. Appearances can be deceiving.   I have had some great food in my travels. But this was the best overall experience I had. I ordered a regular breakfast and had pancakes on the side and of course an RC cola.   The wait staff was attentive and very friendly. So friendly that I felt like a regular. The place was packed with customers but the wait staff worked as if it were not an issue. My food arrived hot and quick. It was absolutely delicious.   I would personally recommend matts big breakfast to anyone. I will be returning when I visit arizona in future.

Could not be better in any way!  Service was very fast and the food is amazing.  The bacon was very thick and fresh, potatoes were perfect and had some fresh rosemary in them. This is the best toast I have ever had, nice and thick with a nice homemade jam.  I hope I'm at the B gates on terminal 4 again soon to get a meal here! So good!

This place definitely lived up to the hype! I have lived in Arizona for a month now and this was on my restaurant list because I'm a big fan of Triple D. Coincidentally I moved 2 blocks away from this place.   There was a 15 minuet wait but so what, it is worth it. I got the hog and chick because I had to try the bacon. It was GREAT! I like my eggs cooked runny and they got them perfect.   The staff was quick, efficient, and friendly. My coffee cup stayed full.

I wish I could write a review based on their food because it is pretty good but for me if the service isn't up to par I can't completely enjoy myself. I was really disappointed the last time we went in at the attitudes of the staff. They seemed almost cocky as if they were doing ME a favor allowing me to eat there. They wouldn't tell us an appx wait time, refused to split check saying we could do the math ourselves and just let them know, and several other rude responses to our questions. They really forget that there are tons of other good breakfast joints in the area and we don't need to go there. We are central Phoenix residents and for many of our friends and family the go-to for restaurant recommendations. After the last visit I am taking them off our list of breakfast to recommend. It's a real shame and I hope if we ever go back we will be met with friendliness and an appreciation for our business.

That's big breakfast holds the best bacon I've ever ate!! If you order anything from here make sure it has bacon!! I honestly don't know how they do it but I've never ate bacon like I do here. They always have daily specials that I do recommend to go with because their specials or pretty much their signatures. I highly recommend this place for breakfast

Never before in my life have I tasted breakfast this good. The place is small (very small), expect to wait around an hour on the weekends.  Once you get in here try the "Hog and Chick", I suggest you get the hash browns over the potatoes, and you MUST MUST MUST try the bacon! (if you're a vegan - let it go for one day!)   Their waffles are to die for too.  Another 100 places like this and Downtown Phoenix will be THE place to live!!!

My first visit to the new bigger location and I was shocked to still have to wait for 30 min on a Wednesday am. I think it was mostly spring training tourists. Anyway, I finally got a seat at the bar and once again enjoyed my favorite breakfast in the world. I can't explain how Matt makes a simple breakfast so remarkable - I'm just glad he does. BTW the new location is only 100 yards north of the old one. Try the bacon! the fresh OJ is to die for, and the hash browns are potato perfection.

Ok, so first for the bad:  So the first time I went there was when some friends invited me. They were already at the restaurant, I was still in bed at home in Avondale. I showered, dressed and drove over there...they were still waiting for a table. In fact once I got there we waited another 30 minutes for a table. that means my friends were waiting over an hour and a half for a table. My other complaint is that my potatoes are always too burnt, even when I tell them not to burn them. They are closed on Monday (you would have thought I would remember this the first two Monday;s I came to eat here) So now for the good: Everything else! I love the food! The Chop & Chick and griddle cakes are my fave for breakfast and for lunch I love...well just about everything! Can't wait till I move back so I can go again!!

Good breakfast spot from the B-terminal.  Our family landed at 6 am with a 3 hour layover until our next flight.  The hot coffee is decent.  We got Matt's Big Breakfast x 2.  One order we subbed the griddle cake for toast.  The griddle cake is sweet and delicious (almost reminiscent of corn bread).  The toast was a large slice of multi-grain with a very tasty raspberry jam.  We also got sweet and savory which includes two french toast with a sausage.    The short: good place for breakfast indeed!
The food here us pretty good and service is usually friendly. They are slowwwwww. Really not a good trait for an airport restaurant. Only eat here if you have at least 45 mins til boarding.

Yes it is very busy, yes Guy Fieri went there... but OVERRATED! The food is fine but with the rep this place has, it really should be a whole hell of a lot better. The coffee is great but everything else is something I could whip up in my own kitchen
Great food and excellent service!!!  I had the Sonrisa burrito.  I would highly recommend it.

Sat at the bar and had a great breakfast.  The waitress/bartender was very attentive and give us some great suggestions.  I wanted just a standard 2 eggs OM sausage patty, hash Browns and toast.  Simple and delicious!  They moved over a couple of buildings into a bigger space.

Probably the best breakfast I've had at an airport! The seating was pretty tight but you can't expect much at an airport restaurant. I ordered the cheese omelet with potatoes and sourdough toast with the strawberry preserves. Everything was great quality and for a reasonable price when compared to other airport restaurant prices. Friendly wait staff as well. Would definitely recommend!

Matt's, not just for breakfast! 10 of us gals, (yes 10) rolled into Matt's for one last drink (after draining Costco's wine section for 5 days straight) and a bite to eat before boarding our flight home. While this is one of the nicest Airport restaurants I've eaten in, and the food (when it finally arrived) was quite good, there were just way too many snafus for me to give them more then 3 stars.   To start, 3 of us got there before the others - thank you priority check-in! So we ordered a good 15 minutes before the rest of the group. Needless to say, after 45mins, watching the rest of the group get their meals, and finish, we still had not got our meals. Everyone shared, so I can tell you the Cobb salad, super good as are the fries. Now after trying to ask our waitress, a few times, to find out what happened to our meals, she kept saying the kitchen was busy and it will come when it comes... We all knew this was not right, no matter how busy a kitchen is, food ordered first, comes first if it is the same item. Well after 45 minutes of ignoring our concerns, finally she let us know that the food runner had brought our 3 meals to another table over half an hour ago. Right.... So now we need to board a flight, they quickly make us our meals, it comes out under cooked, we have a few bites before running to board, we get the bill and the 3 of us have our meals 10% compt. 10 freaking percent?!!! You have got to be kidding me Matt's! That is so unacceptable for a 45 minute wait, major screw up and then undercooked food that comes out and the 3 of us ate less then a quarter of. Not impressed.

We finally made it to Matt's! How many YEARS have we talked about going here? I don't remember, but I'm glad we did.   My partner and I picked out a weekday to venture out to Matt's since I'm not big on waiting for food. I'm hungry, get me a table, take my order and put the plate in front of me a few minutes later. Matt's did just that and more.   After a quick drive into Phoenix from our home in the vast wasteland of corporate chain restaurants that comprises Desert Ridge we made it to Matt's. YEAH!!, no wait we were seated right away. Our server came by quickly and took our beverage orders while giving us a few minutes to peruse the menu.  I ordered the special and he had the Chop and Eggs. We shared a side of sausage. TI hhe coffee was amazing as were both breakfasts. I'm not a fan of their Home Fries but you should try them anyway...it may just be me.  I haven't looked yet, but there are probably hundreds of reviews for Matt's. We were probably just the last ones to get there. Unless you go after us for the first time, then YOU'LL be the last ones to discover this amazing breakfast spot.

Oh. My. This place is phenomenal. Super good food!! The place is always packed, but totally worth the wait to get in. They use the best ingredients (like real butter), and everything we've had is heavenly. Fantastic scratch lemonades too!!
Saw this on triple D. Gave it a shot on the way The science center. Fresh food. Fresh ingredients. Unique items on the menu. As well as the classics. It lives up to the hype.

When I think of a great breakfast place I would take my friends, I think of Matt's.  Hands down the best breakfast joint!  I understand that waiting for a seat can be long but it is worth the wait.    I know the new place has been open for awhile but I love it!  Bigger location but still the great food and friendly staff!  I am just drooling over the thought of the Belgium waffle with REAL maple syrup and BACON!  All of my favorite foods on one plate.  The Chicken Sandwich with pesto, provolone and peppers is the juiciest sandwich I have ever tasted.  The peppers are not on the usual sandwich. I believe it was the lunch special.  Matt's is a fixture in Phoenix and they are here to stay.    I wish I could give you more stars!!

Place was packed on the Tuesday morning I visited. However, we found space at the bar to be serviced immediately. I ordered the salami scramble which came with your choice of toast and breakfast potatoes. Food came out timely and it was very good. Potatoes were my favorite. The jam they provided for the toast was delicious, too. Customer service was great.

You seriously cannot go wrong if you've wound up at this place.  Everything on the menu is simply fantastic.  When I finally ventured to have lunch here I got blown away by the grilled chicken sandwich.  Its really small though so you usually have to wait.  And its so small you usually have to wait outside.  Because its so small.
One of our favorites on our "Breakfast Circuit." Small menu with the basics done extremely well. Good coffee. As with any place worth going, get there early, ESPECIALLY if you have a group.
Good but not worth the wait, we waited over 2 hours for a party of 3.  Very nice staff and place looks clean.  Nothing really stood out to justify that type of wait.

Terrible service. Their employees are so rude and make you feel like they almost don't want you there. Service was terrible but I don't mind dealing with people like that when I'm on the go. What just made me never want to come back was when I saw the host ask a guy that was sitting at a table to get up and move (mid meal mind you) to another place outside the restaurant because "he had takeout" it was from their same place!!!! And there were about 6 other open tables!!!! Are you kidding!!?!? Never coming back! I'd rather get a prepackaged crappy sandwich next time.

Got the special Classic Eggs Benedict.  I have never had eggs Benedict and I loved it. The only thing that threw me off is that it is a plate that could be eaten at lunch or dinner. I think I would enjoy more if it were for lunch or dinner.  This could simply be that I am inexperienced with eggs Benedict. The service was great and quick.  The vibe was great as well.  Well done everyone!

Matt's Big Breakfast is a great place to have well... breakfast. The new location is great, although I wish that they could have added a few more tables.  There is one thing that I hate...Lines. Seriously. I would rather have a reservation. But I hate lines. especially in 100 degrees.   Matt's would get a 5 star, except for the lines. It is a great place for breakfast, and I still highly recommend it. ( I always go for a special.... something new...something different).  Their honey lemonade is awesome :)

I enjoyed it, the family wasn't impressed. I'm a bit of a breakfast snob so when the kids and wife pressure me to go to Denny's, I turn up my nose and refuse to be a party to such heathenism. I ordered the chop and chick. The eggs were undercooked (wife and I ordered over medium)I made due because the toast was no lie, 2" thick, so I had plenty of real estate to mop up the runny whites and yolk. The pork chop was good, but I really enjoyed the home fries which much to my surprise were grilled up with fresh rosemary. Don't get the hash browns you will be disappointed. The family wasn't impressed by the thick cut locally farm raised bacon or the cage free eggs, or the fresh squeezed orange juice. Hell even the ketchup was non GMO. Oh well... On to the next, I refuse to give into the big breakfast corporate juggernauts.

This place is amazing! The blueberry honey lemonade was to die for! The sourdough toast with blueberry preserves were out of this world! I can't wait to go back! The price was just right and the decor was adorable! I highly recommend!

Beginning the day as I do most, with a morning run well before the sun is up, the first stop on this 6-stop tour would be downtown - a place I've now discovered to be devoid of most signs of human life on a Saturday...except for a small parcel of land at 801 North 1st Street entitled "Matt's Big Breakfast" where a line of thirty or so was already waiting for the approximately 20 seats inside.  Having heard of the nearly decade old establishment owned and operated by Matt Pool during my first visit to Phoenix but unable to make it downtown before ten on any day during that trip (when lines reportedly top two hours despite triple digit temperatures) I have to admit that I really had not anticipated the line to be so long at 6:55am and for a moment I contemplated heading elsewhere, but with my books in hand and nothing better to do my curiosity won out and I added my name to the paper list and took a seat in the rapidly dissipating shade.  Sitting and reading while a pair of ASU students talked about having seen Matt's on (presumably a repeat) of Diners, Dives, and Drive-Ins the previous night I tried to ignore them (and Guy Fiere's existence in general) while a few people trickled out of the restaurant and with my name at least ten parties down on the list I was surprised when it was called - the solo diner benefit, it seems, landing me an end seat on the counter only fifteen minutes after I arrived and given the expedient service at Matt's a fortuitous happening that had me leaving the restaurant before the aforementioned students had even entered the doors.  Seated at the counter with a menu I'd already memorized in hand and a daily special that held little interest I perused the interior - small, stark, but efficient and exceptionally clean - before my server filled my water glass, offered me coffee, and fielded a pair of questions prior to taking my order and handing it over to the kitchen less than five feet away.  With the space tight and my location literally on the verge of the kitchen and the pass it would not be long before my coffee was filled - a single pour that I subsequently sent back due to a combination of thin mouth-feel, acrid flavor, and no artificial sweetener - and even less time before my stool would be bumped into for the first of thirty times...to say the least this is not a place I'd choose to linger.  Seated and watching the action of the kitchen as plate after plate came through the window and regular after regular chatted with Matt's wife at the cash register it would not be long before my order would arrive and with the restaurant's strong dedication to local/organic/fresh sourcing the items that were presented quickly made me realize why so many people deal with long waits and less-than-comfortable seating to experience Matt's Big Breakfast - the food is really quite excellent, beginning first with a perfect hotcake served with pure maple syrup and far too much (or perhaps just the right amount of) butter for $2.75.  Moving from the dainty golden flapjack to something more substantial, my second dish would actually consist of two plates and four items in the form of "The Chop & Chick" - an $8.95 breakfast comprised of a Pan Seared Iowa Pork Rib Chop with 2 Poached Eggs, Hash Browns, and Whole grain Toast with Blueberry Rhubarb Jam.  Apparently their most 'famous' dish it is a little difficult to decide which aspect of the plate was the best considering the quality of perfectly poached eggs (something even good restaurants tend to overcook,) crisp yet buttery potatoes and lightly herbed juicy pork chop but in the end I think I would have to give the nod to the toast - hand cut thick, rife with seeds and a rich earthiness, and topped with house made preserves featuring what seemed to be no sugar at all but rather the essence of blueberries with a slight savoriness from the rhubarb...a strong contender for best jam/preserves I've ever encountered and reason enough to revisit Matt's when it moves to its new digs a few doors down (and hopefully decreases wait times and seat bumps...and perhaps finds a coffee roaster whose beans better compliment the quality of the food.)

We came here for breakfast while vacationing in Phoenix, heard some great things mainly about the freshness of food and how delicious it is. I orders the cheese omelette with hash browns and my husband ordered the Five Spot sandwich. Everything we ate was so delicious! Some lad we came here, seems like a great local gem from all the regulars that were there. Definitely recommend!

Let's just say thank you yelper for getting me pretty solid reviews on this place so we don't spent a lot of time figuring out some of the must haves.  This is consider one of the decent breakfast I had in awhile.  Coming from LA area we had tons of authentic breakfast here and there, but we focus so much on specialties and yet we forget the traditional american style breakfast is liked.  Let's get to it!   Food=  4/5 nothing special made but the portion and the quality is decent to pass expectation.  The sausage is kind of overrated in my opinion, but the sandwish is a must have for first timers.  Service= 5/5 the food came so fast we don't even have the time to prepare ourselves after setting up our kids in their high-chair which is pretty solid.  When it gets busy you tends to lose their attention but when you ask any of the passing by servers, they will get to it ASAP.  The managers and the owner of the business were very friendly with greets. Wait time= 4/5 the wait can be long but we were able to get right through due to early arrival @ 6:45AM.  The parkings fill up in the back pretty quick. Location= 5/5 the location is right by the freeway so it's pretty hard to ignore/miss in my opinion.   I would give a solid 4.5 but in this case I will give them a 5 since the experience was very pleasant; this is what a good restaurant should be like.

This place is amazing....the food is delicious and quick...worth the wait all though they said about 1/2 an hour we got seated in 20 mins...the staff is super friendly even though it's really slammed....I got the five spot best egg sandwich I have had in a long time...the organic apple juice is great as well as the strawberry honey lemonade....come down to matts big breakfast :)

1st time trying this place...hopes were very high sadly our experience wasn't great.   3 stars   -Service was alright  -food we ordered (the chop & chick) was dry -the coffee wasn't good as well tasted very bitter...we paid for our meal wish it was better.

Yum-o! After seeing Matt's on triple D I knew that we would have to hit it up on our trip to Phoenix, and it did not disappoint. We arrived at about 10:30 on a Friday morning and waited for about 10 minutes before getting seated at the bar. I started with the OJ, my husband got the strawberry honey lemonade, both were amazing! For breakfast I did the omelette with cheddar cheese and bacon, husband got the eggs and sausage patties. There is an up charge for the bacon in my omelette but it was totally worth it, there was tons of delicious bacon in my omelette. The highlight if the meal was he amazing sourdough toast and jam. If I hadn't been so full of bacon I would have gotten an extra side of toast - so good!  I wish we lived in Phoenix so we could go back!

My final meal in Phoenix, which was breakfast. This small brick place has made me famous with the name (of course) and was honored with a "Review of the day", which seems like a distant-memory ago. My first visit and first meal back then was a monumental one. Will my return to "my" breakfast place be a repeat?   Some things hasn't changed much about my place. There was a little wait for a table, especially on a early weekday morning. "My place...why should I have to wait for a table?"  This time, my return back has got me ordering one of the breakfast specials, which was the Salami Scramble. For $5.95 and affordable meal too, I get three scrambled eggs mixed with Soppresata Salami with a side of Hash Browns and a pair of thick toasted Sourdough Bread with Strawberry Preserves. The crispiness of the sliced salami blended with the scramble eggs made it a tasty combination. The hash browns were tasty and a nice compliment to my meal. And the thick-ass toasted Sourbread bread with melted butter and the preserves was crunchy with a powerful explosion that can be heard all over the small diner (in a good way).  My place hasn't failed in my return. I'm always welcome to come back and dine at my breakfast place whenever I come back to Phoenix. And so, you can too.
Amazing! Honey lemonade so yummy, coffee on point, five spot- delicious, hog and chick -nom nom! :) Highly recommend!

The food deserves a 5* rating. Always fresh and delish.  But the service could use a lot of help. First off they gave us silverware that had old food stuck to it. They didn't refill our drinks, had to ask the manager after waiting forever. They gave us the check as we were finishing our food, which was fine But we went to the restroom and came back, They had already dumped everything at our table and seated someone else in the 3 mins we spent in the bathroom. Our check "was" on the table. We paid still.  But we were NOT done. I found this very rude. If  it happens again.  I'm not paying. The one downtown is much more respectful.

The food here is AMAZING! It was featured on the food network. I met a friend here and was genuinely surprised on how good this place was. They pride themselves on fresh ingredients and they deliver. Its a bit eclectic and the area is interesting. Yet, even so I would say its a must go!
The food is OK. It's the hype on television that make it a big deal. Snooze is the best breakfast place EVER! Go there instead:)

What a fantastic spot to grab a meal. I got the Bloody Mary and meatloaf. Every ingredient in the Bloody Mary was perfect. Extra crispy celery. Briny olives. Crispy thick bacon. YUM. Meatloaf was excellent.

Two visits a row = very disappointing  Twice now the eggs over medium are runny - I guess when you ask for the whites to be cooked through it doesn't matter; toast not toasted?? What's up Matt??  I don't want you to "take care of my breakfast" I simply want to enjoy a good breakfast before my flight, and I'm happy to take care of the bill.

Waited 40 mins for our table. I was expecting the food to be better for that long of a wait. Took them almost 10 minutes to bring me water. The food was just ok. Also, I asked for a side of syrup, and it was a $1.50 extra for a small amount. I don't mind the extra charge, but 1.50 for like 2 oz? If anything it should be an extra 50 cents. OR there shouldn't even be any charges cause it is a breakfast place!

Matt's was my favorite breakfast place ever but now I have to add a caveat.  Do not go to Matt's during a busy if you want to hear anything the waitress or anyone that is with you.  The food is still fabulous and it is great that you do not need to wait long but the noise level is a constant roar of voices.  Even if I was alone it is uncomfortably noisy.  I would not go there again for breakfast until at least after 9 AM .  Maybe it gets busy again for the lunch crowd but I have never been there  after 10:30AM

My bestie and I stopped in today. I don't know how I didn't know about this place sooner! It's a little hidden in the Safeway shopping center. We came in around noon and it was pretty packed, luckily they had one last booth available for 2. We got seated fast, shortly got our order taken and our food came in no time!   We both ordered the Hog & Chick (eggs, potatoes, bacon and toast). It was great!! Especially the bacon! Super thick cut and they gave 3 slices which is awesome. Oh yes, and the toast with jam was a pleasant surprise too! They gave fresh jelly that had pretty much whole blueberries in it! Soooo good. The whole plate was -BIG- and for under $10 for those quality ingredients, it was totally worth it! I'll definitely be back to try other signature dishes.   Also, the service was great, we were checked up on by multiple people who were all so nice. The ambience had a typical diner feel, but more modern.  Five stars easily!!

This is one of the best breakfasts I've ever had. I got The Hog & Chick and it was amazing. Scrambled eggs, amazing thick cut bacon seasoned to perfection, delicious big sourdough toast, and hashbrowns I could eat for the rest of my life. Everything's made in house or sourced locally and it tastes like it--super fresh and satisfying. Even the iced coffee is ground daily and was lovely. Couldn't have asked for a better meal. Also the decor and entire old school hipster branding fits perfectly--very appealing.

Long wait but always worth it. The bacon is amazing here, so don't try Matt's without enjoying it! Coffee is also great here. I appreciate the small menu as I know they are good at what they do. Not too fancy, but good ol' fashion good breakfast. Come early as the line gets a little crazy.

In Phoenix for work, staying downtown. Matt's was exactly what I was looking for as an alternative to the hotel restaurant or Starbucks. Cool atmosphere, great service, and good food. I had the Huevos Rancheros special on a Monday morning. Didn't finish it all (big plate!) but it was a delicious start to the day. Highly recommend.

Until I read the rant reviews about Matt's I never knew there could be so many people with cold coffee running through their veins.  Wow.  Summing it down, it seems the #1 complaint is at Matt's (unlike Denny's) they have to wait in the hot Phoenix sun to get in or that the place is "small".  DUH!  If you go to a place that serves better-than-average food, and it is a small old historic place it's not going to be the same as squeezing your tubby stomach into a booth at Denny's and ordering an "out of your mind" $1.99 breakfast to make your butt even bigger.  In other words, if you like Denny's so much why did you go to Matt's?  Make your choice ... pre-processed food from a mega-chain, or fresh food from local guy who works hard to serve locally grown/bought products and has gotten extremely popular because of it.  Small?  Are you kidding?  That's GOOD, not negative, how can you possibly rate a place bad because it is small?  Hate the Food Network?  Geez ... then don't go to a place that has been so highly rated.  Why subject your tender spoiled body to waiting in that "miserable" Phoenix sun?  People waiting in line means they know where to find great food.  BTW, my first few visits to Matt's were BEFORE Triple-D and it was and remains a place to go for people who have good taste.  And the complaint about having to go to the bathroom in the kitchen is pure BS - the clean bathroom is in the motel next door, not the kitchen.  We only have one Matt's in Phoenix and thank you heavens.  Is the food good?  Yes?  Is it fresh and uses the best local products?  Yes?  Is the service friendly and local?  Yes (if you're a tourist or Snow-Bird you just won't get this concept anyway).  Somebody believes the OJ is $2.50 for 2 ounces?  Really?  REALLY??    Here are a few personal observations:  I don't eat potatoes much, but I almost always finish Matt's home fries.  I am not a big bread eater, but I love Matt's fresh home-made bread.  Their eggs are local and bought by Matt every morning (he doesn't own a refrigerator or microwave at his restaurant).  The bacon on NOT what you will find at Denny's (a place you can walk right in to without having to spend 30 minutes of your precious self-consumed life standing in that horrid Phoenix sun). No, NO, I'm serious, there are actually tourists who reviewed Matt's and compared them negatively to DENNY'S!!!!!!!!!  Where Matt's really shines is not so much their excellent breakfasts, but the fact that they probably make one of the best Reuben Sandwiches in America.  Yes, better than Manhattan, better than that place where you chomp into a lot of fat and bread and pay twice as much for the privilege.
