Not only is the sandwich great but the side of homemade macaroni salad is big enough to serve the entire restaurant.  Want to avoid the 30 minute wait for breakfast?  Go to Matt's for lunch when the place is much less busy and get to know the people who work there and why their food is several cuts above most of what you will find in Phoenix.

It finally happened! After an eternity we finally got to visit Matt's on a day (Veteran's Day to be exact) when the line was only about 10 minutes long. We've been hesitant about the new location after years of eating at the original location, would the new location totally suck, would the food be different, would it be "downtown cold and impersonal"? We had this fear that Matt's had hit the big time and that old comfy place was gone forever.  Well, not so. The area when you first walk in has an uncanny feeling that you are in the old Matt's. The same is true with that weird little closed off room in the front; it had a lot of memories of that weird little closed off room to the left when you walked into the old Matt's. The big dining room has the biggest changes, and guess what? I didn't dislike it. It had that loud high-school cafeteria feeling to it still, tables packing in tight, funky but not pretentious (hard to do). The overworked staff was just as much "family" as in the old Matt's. The menu looked identical, the prices looked about the same, the portions were ... okay, not so "big" as I recall. Big yes compared to Denny's for about the same price (eeech, like someone would actually choose Denny's) but to my memory not quite so overwhelming as it used to be.  Bottom line: the "new" Matt's is still Matt's to me. I'm flexible and I can adapt.  My rating is still zero stars, hated it, horrible food and service, cockroaches in the food, a place even a homeless person wouldn't eat for free ... that "rating" is for the newbies. Please stay away until us locals have had our leisurely meal at Matt's, then make your reservation for, um let's say, about 2 AM on a Tuesday and get your butt out of there in 5 minutes or less to leave some tables for us "Matt-afficionados".  Biggest NEGATIVE? They deleted all of the old reviews just because they moved to the other end of the same block. BOO!  That to me is just kind of chickenshit. If you want to be so pretentious, change your frigging name. Otherwise just man up to the fact that a review for Matt's Big Breakfast should be a review forever. You lost a whole star for that crap, Matt.
The food is fantastic, and the coffee is great! My go-to dish is usually the waffles or pancakes.  The food is really flavorful, the portions are huge. I've never been disappointed :)
More like "Matt's little breakfast selections"  No vegetarian options and they don't even have avocado

Amazing food - subpar music selection. If they could stray away from using 2005's top 40 hits that would really elevate things. I will say that they had excellent service - in the words of the supposed manager guy. Chloe was an incredible server and I hope she gets promoted.

Was not impressed. Overly priced items. They do not allow substitutions. Ordered breakfast and would not give me Sausage and bacon. Even though they charge $1 per bacon strip, i couldnt get it. This is just poor service. Regardless if the owner doesnt allow. This is rediculous. Their shared service is confusing. Did not know how to ask for refills or when they did not deliver all our food. I ordered scrambled eggs, and they were not real eggs. Orange juice was mediocre. Had better experiences with breakfast else where. I came here because i saw it on the food channel. Will not be returning due to the experience.

Matt's Big Breakfast has high quality, simple food done right. Their griddlecakes are tender with a good rise (although, a tad too sweet for my preference). I also had the "Hog & Chick" with bacon and over easy eggs. The eggs were tasty and the bacon was perfectly done, but the star of the show for me was the hashbrowns. They are simultaneously creamy and soft, with a fabulous crust on the exterior.   Service is so efficient and friendly. For example, our table was a little wobbly, so we brought it to someone's attention. And, the guy had a wedge in his pocket so he was able to fix it right then!  The wait can be long, but the neighborhood is cute so you can walk around to kill time. I visited in winter and didn't have to wait out in the hot sun. If that had been my experience maybe I would feel differently about how the wait affects the overall rating.

Stopped in 1st time and was very impressed. Seats were open at the bar and we ordered the omlet and BLT. Both came with side of hash browns which were amazing! My omlet was huge and I wish I had ordered cheddar but ordered provalone instead. I could only finish half due to the amount of food. The sourdough toast was awesome as well with the fresh made jam/jelly. Service was great. Highly recommended. They have lunch items as well.
Was very busy but service was good.   Got pancakes and bacon.   It was good.  They are a bit pricey.

This has to be the best breakfast I've ever had!  I ordered the special which was scrambled eggs with sweet peppers, whiskey fennel sausage and Havarti cheese.  It was outstanding!  We had to wait for over an hour which we knew that going in.  The food was definitely worth the wait.  Looking forward to going back again!

Dear Matt (assuming that Matt exists),  This is not about the food - it was excellent.  This is not about cleanliness - it was spotless.  This IS ABOUT ... Alexa, our server.  She was beyond excellent.  Clone her.  Really.  We arrived on the red eye from Kona.  Good olde American Airlines decided to skip feeding us in First Class, saying that the 5 hour flight allowed insufficient time to serve 12 people the "Full Breakfast" that was listed on our itinerary - I kid you not.  Just shut up and each your potato chips.  Coffee?  Cold.  Decaf?  Instant.  First Class, my arse.  We arrived early, hungry and cranky.  There was a bit of line.  The restaurant seemed packed, yet we were seated immediately.  How'd you DO that?  (By paying attention and sweating the details).  Waters arrived immediately.  Lemon?  Let me get that!  Coffee followed promptly.  Hot coffee, thank you.  We never saw the bottom of our coffee cups.  The breakfast sandwich and breakfast burrito were both excellent.  The portions were generous. Hot food, hot.  Cold food, cold.  The Bloody Mary's ... rock.  And ... Alexa also pointed out a virtually hidden AC outlet so that I could (re)charge my phone.  She's an important asset to your success.  Treasure her.  Nurture her.  Reward her.  (No, we are not family.)
Cute spot. Great location. I never understood how a place can mess up traditional breakfast plates so 5 stars bc I love breakfast pretty much anywhere and anytime!

The food was excellent! It was a bit crowded but our party of two was seated pretty quickly. I'll definitely be back again as the menu seemed to have a lot of good things to try.  The orange juice was fresh and the coffee was hot and flowing! The atmosphere was busy and not good for a private conversation but who really has those over breakfast?!?

Ok. Not great, barely good. Just ok.  Maybe I just expected too much, I don't know, but the potatoes were bad, the omelette was average and the service was adequate (I asked twice for water which I never got.) Oh. And I didn't even finish the slice of bacon - which borders on sacrilege.   With the big lines, I thought they did a good job of cleaning tables and readying them for the next group but that's not a big reason to endorse a restaurant, huh?

down-home Southern-style - a cut above for airport food  I had the reuben sandwich with a side of macaroni, with the freshly-squeezed lemonade with honey. The marble rye bread on the sandwich had crust embedded with what tasted like caraway seeds, and was lightly toasted, and fresh-tasting. The pastrami is made in-house, the sign says. The meat was so-so with more fat than I expect, and the sauerkraut lacked flavor. The macaroni salad was really flavorful and I savored each bite. Now the standout for this meal was the lemonade!! I could suck down a gallon and still want more. Ironically, I was trying to avoid excess sugar, and though the sign claims that there's no added sugar, they do add a LOT of honey, which does contain tons of natural sugar, though sugar is sugar, and as addictive as cocaine and heroin, I keep reading in my holistic health blogs. That comes as no surprise.   I'd love to write more, but I am way behind on everything. Anyway, what a buzzkill I can "bee". Get the lemonade here, and enjoy life! Airports are really hard to be in, with all the waiting and the loud jarring noises, abominable behaviors right and left, and being WAAAAYYYYY to close for comfort to everyone in all those hellhole godawful tightly crowded stinky nasty airplanes (I don't fly first class - I'm so middle-class I can't bear to part with extra money for a few hours of a little more leg room and I don't need free cheap headache booze and used dirty blankets), so soothe yourself by eating what makes you happy, then exercise like crazy later.  What's not clear at all is that if you order at the counter, you take your food to go and you are supposed to eat it elsewhere, like at your gate, not in the restaurant, I later found out. Well, I committed a faux pas, unknowingly, and sat in the restaurant at a table right behind the counter where I placed my order. I apologized to the waiter who came by, and I asked if I should move, but he was gracious, and let me stay.   The other menu items, like the cheeseburger, looked really tempting.   People were enjoying themselves with beers, watching the futbol/soccer highlights reel at the bar.

The potatoes here are amazingly delicious!  I had a cheese omelette, bacon and the sourdough toast is thick and yummy.  The strawberry Jam is perfect  There are so many good things here it is well worth the wait  it's noisy and it's crowded and the food is wonderful!!!
Great breakfast place! Huevos rancheros verde is the most unique and special breakfast I ever had !

Stunning, stunning, stunning food. The whole town was here on Christmas Eve and it's our new favorite breakfast stopover while in Phoenix.  Try the eggs Benedict special, and do yourself a favor and try their amazing coffee! They'll even pour a fresh cup to go for you, which is excellent if you're about to begin a long drive like we were.

So we ordered a simple omelet breakfast with hash browns well done. The first time it came out with breakfast potatoes not hash browns so instead of leaving the omelet they took the whole plate back and gave us hashbrowns (not well done) and the same omelet (now Luke warm). We send it back again after I had to get up and find a server becUse it was impossible to signal one even though we were waiting for ten minutes not touching our plate. I get a server someone comes over and says they'll fix it. We get toast ("on the house") in the meantime (we had already eaten our 2 orders of toast at this point ). We get our order again with a Luke warm omelet and breakfast potatoes (not hashbrowns). This time they leave the plate and say they'll bring us a side order of the hashbrowns well done. We get Luke warm hash browns not well done. They ask us if it's better and since it's already 1030 and were hungry we just say yes. They only comped the plate not our oj or toast and still charge us 6 bucks. Oh the best part our waitress stopped by once...and wasn't even aware we had sent our food back a second time. We are not picky people but have both been on the restaurant business and know how food should be cooked and customer service should be provided and this is not it.

Amazing breakfast! Small spot with big flavorful food. I got the Five Spot breakfast sandwich, amazingly soft bread!! You can taste how fresh all the ingredients are! First time here loved that we walked in and thru a large window you could see staff hand jarring jam! This place is a hidden gem!

I must say everyone here is super friendly!! Their customer service is really great! I had a scrambled egg, bacon, cheese sandwich with hash browns and it was all so tasty. A lot better than most breakfast places!! It was crowded, and I can definitely see why!

This is the perfect spot to get a great breakfast. There's usually a good wait included here. The food is great. The pancakes are big, the eggs are on point, as are the hash browns. The sausage and bacon is good too. I love their honey lemonades. I will try and make this my breakfast spot every time I'm in Phoenix.
This place is worthy of their reputation. Great food and fast service.  Loved the pork chop and eggs.

The thick cut bacon is the THING TO GET. It's very crowded, so make sure you have a little extra time just in case. They have different specials every day of the week, so check before you go! The home fries are also delicious, with good spices.  The restaurant is loud, busy, and very casual.

Saw this establishment on Diners, Drive-ins, & Dives. Guy Fieri was raving about his termed out of bounds breakfast choices. Matt appeared very courteous. Not as good as they say. They are all right. The reason is there's always a line is because this place is so darn tiny. Didn't have a restroom available... What's up with that? Will admit the service was efficient.
Chop and Chick breakfast was just ok. Pork chop was paper thin and way over cooked - tough and dry.   Eggs, hash brown, toast was good.

Matt's was absolutely fantastic. Got there at 2pm on a Sunday, which is apparently the time to do it (half an hour before close), as we walked right in, sat right down, and had food in 5 minutes or less. Brilliant.  I had the Five Spot which was simply the best egg sandwich I have ever had. Two eggs, two huge slices of perfectly cooked bacon, american cheese (my favorite with eggs when I'm not going fancy-style, reminds me of when I was a kid), and well grilled onions round it out, served on a fantastic roll.   By default, this item doesn't include the normal potatoes and toast, so I had them add homefries--they were magnificent, and entirely unnecessary. A huge portion of them, with a wonderful smattering of rosemary to punch them up, they were delicious, but I couldn't finish them.  The girlfriend got a waffle with bacon and it should just be said that restaurants who serve waffles without real maple syrup are simply criminal. Matt's brings the good stuff, and it's MUCH appreciated. Perfect for dipping both waffle and bacon alike. The waffle was fluffy, light, and had that good, homemade flavor.  I can't get over how filling and delicious my sandwich was. Service was prompt and friendly, and overall, it was a great experience. Added a glass of OJ and a coffee to my sandwich with added homefries and her bacon and waffles bringing our tab to right about $21. Absolutely worth every penny. Will be coming back. Probably near 2 o'clock again, to avoid the wait!

Matt's has become what some may say is an addiction of mine. I prefer "hobby". But Matt's did make it into our wedding vows. (True story.) You see, since I first tasted the glory of the Five Spot, I've basically made it a point to get one on every available weekend day. So my wife thought it wise to pledge support publicly in front of friends and family for my perhaps less-than-healthy "hobby".  The wife works a lot of weekends, and I've found out that the Five Spot can travel the 10 minutes or so to my home largely intact. A perfectly balanced combination of spot-on eggs, melted cheese, grilled onions, and THE best bacon possible makes this the absolute best egg sandwich I've ever had.   Every ingredient is so delightfully high quality that the sandwich shines, bursting forth with flavor and cholesterol and existential angst. (Or, as some might call it, "maple syrup that I dip it in".)   Make sure you order a side of home fries. They're specifically not included with the sandwich which is "how they get ya", but I can't go without. Crisp, delicious potatoes served with a few sprigs of rosemary and... also dipped in syrup.   I had over 140 check-ins to Matt's before they moved and Yelp created a new profile for them. Every single one of them? A Five Spot with Home Fries. I'm pretty sure if you ordered a "Chris", that's what you'd get at this point.   Their waffles are amazing too, along with basically everything else on the menu. Absolutely perfectly fluffy, flavorful, and delicious, from what I've stolen off the wife's plate. And Erenia and the rest of the staff are as kind and amazing as can be.  The wait is rough, there's no doubt about that. But whereas most breakfast places slog along with watery eggs, sub-par, see-through bacon, horrible, waxy cheese, and no twists or turns, Matt's gets it perfectly right every time. Or at least all 140 times and counting.

Matt's Big Breakfast did not disappoint! Arrived before open .  Tried 3 other times the wait was too long. The Hog with the $1 ham was salty and delicious their potatoes have onions and rosemary yummy The chop was cooked crispy and was not dry Eggs over easy The sour dough toast with amazing fresh strawberry jelly I could eat all day long. Good coffee that was filled often  and even gave us  to go cups. We will be back

This was an AWESOME surprise!  Enjoyed Breakfast with friends today, I ordered waffle w/ bacon. OMG !!! The Bacon!! Yes the waffle was great ;)  BUT THE BACON!!!   WELL you go and try it. Please let me know what you think !!!    Go see Daniel he's gonna make your day !
Amazing breakfast spot, give this place a try.  Despite being packed, we were still seated within a decent amount of time (10 min tops).
I tried this after referring a friend from out of town. Great choice and great food. A little crowded and noisy but the food was hot and great! I will return!

Came after seeing this place on the tv in England! Was really amazing such a great breakfast! Defo worth a visit! Don't reckon they need this review from how busy it was go early to avoid having a prolonged wait or missing service.hours!

I was pretty excited to come here after reading the reviews, but after going, I don't know what all the hype is about.   The ambiance is quaint. Small house filled w lots of small tables. Service is quick and nice. I ordered the waffle which came with 2 thick slices of bacon for about $8. The waffle was yummy. The bacon was thick but way too peppery for my taste.   In my opinion, this is a good breakfast place in the heart of downtown. But nothing crazy special. There's a very small parking right behind the restaurant but it was full when I went on a Thursday morning, so I had to find street/meter parking.   Environment: 5/5 Food: 3/5 Price: 3/5 Service: 4/5
The food is very good but the wait is long at certain times of the day. Still worth it.

Always a wonderful experience here. Fantastic staff, big portions, reasonable prices and delicious food. The new location is great - you still have to wait, but there is a lot more room inside and nice that there are more parking options outside.

I absolutely love Matt'a Big Breakfast! I started by eating at his original location in downtown Phoenix, and have since eaten at  both the airport location and the 32nd St. and Camelback location (the one I frequent the most). I usually get The Skinny, which is an egg white scramble with sausage and gruyere cheese. It also comes with a spinach salad with a very light dressing. I usually ask them to go light on the cheese. The best part about the meal is that they use Schreiner's sausage mixed into the scramble. Schreiner is a local company that has been around for years at seventh Street and Osborne. 5/5.   My guest had the Salami Scramble. Again, the eggs are organic and locally sourced. In addition, the salami is procured from Schreiner's sausage. It came with a generous portion of hashbrowns, and whole wheat toast with homemade jam. 5/5.  The ambience is fantastic because the walls contain a painting of old school Phoenix. Included in the mural is the Graham's Fruit Stand at 36th Street and Camelback, which I used to frequent as a kid. It is since been leveled and replaced with townhomes (bummer). It brings back great memories and makes me proud to be a native. Next time you are yelping and looking for a place to eat breakfast, look no more and definitely stop here for a visit!

Bored with the hotel breakfast options we ventured out from our downtown hotel after finding Matt's on Yelp and seeing that it had been on triple D.  It was early Sunday and the place was already slammed. We ended up sitting at the bar, which had a cool concrete top and a kitchen window, allowing us to peak in and see the cooks and kitchen staff.  My wife ordered 2 eggs scrambled, hash browns, bacon and toast. I ordered an omelet with sausage and cheddar, got an RC Cola in a can for good measure.  Everything was great. My wife said; "this is the best thing that has happened in Phoenix so far--I could eat here every day." I guess she liked it.  I was impressed by the cooks, managing all the orders, the quick service and the flavors.    Get to Matt's Big Breakfast and start the day off right, your stomach will thank you.
way overrated! bathroom in the kitchen, gross!  know what you're eating!  how much was the oj again?
This place was unreal! Great food, great service, great overall experience. Looking forward to coming back on my next visit. Recommend the hashbrowns! My exact text to my wife was they were insane!

Reviews were correct - this place serves amazing food.  Fresh OJ, omelet, and home fries were spot in.  They turned tables over quickly, so even with about 15 people before us, we waited less than 10 minutes to be seated.  Prepare to be stuffed in the most delicious way possible!

This is one of those hole in the wall restaurants you hear good stuff about and is actually true!  When I first arrived I was a bit apprehensive having to write you name with pencil down on a piece of paper that the hostess only checked every so often. After about a 30 min wait (Saturday morning) we got a table. It is a very small place but cozy and bright as could be.  From the coffee to the breakfast sandwich, everything was great. As long as you aren't counting calories I would recommend it to anyone.

Obviously I've been here for breakfast.  I got the steak and eggs and I was amazed.  This amazement isn't from the steak or the eggs, even though they were both delicious, but it was with the toast.  I have never had such great toast before, and the jam was so fresh....  The wait was long, and we were there in July.  Limited shade outside, but at least they had a water jug for the people waiting.  I recommend preparing for the heat if you decide to go during the summer.

If I lived in Phoenix I'd be a regular here. They've apparently been on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives and I can see why. The waffle was perfect and the bacon was perfect as well with a peppery flavor you don't get at most places. My coffee was constantly refilled almost faster than I could drink it and service was VERY friendly. Yelp is right on this place, check it out for sure.

Was in Phoenix over the weekend and grabbed breakfast here on Monday morning.  I ordered "The Chop & Chick" with bacon and had my eggs scrambled.  Food was great and the service was even better.  Will definitely grab another meal here next time I'm in the Phoenix area.

This is the best Yelp suggestion yet.  Matts Big Breakfast is amazing.  The prices are great, the food is wonderful and the people are absolutely incredible.  Gonna miss this place the most when we head back home to Colorado.

There is no "big breakfast". Matt told me himself. What you will get is a delicious, fresh, locally grown breakfast served by really nice people. Line was super long and I thought servings were average so I gave it three stars. Really nice place and I definately recommend it.

One of the most popular breakfast places in the Valley, and it lived up to its billing! Had the special, which was a 3-egg scramble with chipotle ranch sausage and cheese. Side of home fries, delicious, thick wheat toast served with some amazing raspberry jelly, and (based on all of the reviews) I got a side of the bacon.   I don't know where to start. The scramble was great, the sausage with jalapeos were awesome, the home fries were a great complement and the bacon. The bacon was legen-wait for it-DARY!!!  Can't wait to go back, sit at the bar and hang out with Bre H, who gave us some great tips on what to order and kept a smile on our faces!  Last tip: make a reservation if you can, as the line is apparently always long, even for the counter.

Ok, I'm sorry people of Phoenix, but I will go here every time I am in town. I saw it on the triple D and had to try it. We waited for about 20 minutes on a (late) Tuesday morning. I ordered the Butter Burger with Maytag blue cheese and my man ordered the waffle...neither disappointed. The service was fast and friendly. Loved it! Oh yeah, the place is TINY, but who cares when the food is this good?
Monday special: Huevos Rancheros Verdes are a must!! The home fries were tasty!Great option for a quick and healthy bite before heading to the airport. Friendly, quick service. Coffee is delish.

Dang this place was good! Before traveling, my SO and I stopped here to eat since we had time and I was not disappointed. The hostess was a bit dry, bored, and wrung out but the rest of the staff was very welcoming and friendly so I won't let her influence my opinion. This place seems like the spot that would be packed all of the time, so expect to be rubbing elbows with a stranger while you eat. Aside from this, the food was great! I got their grilled cheese and french fries which were fantastic, they use a really thick bread which made the sandwich even better. I would definitely come here again...if I'm ever delayed and forced to fly Southwest again -_____-

I'm not sure what all the hype was about. My server was friendly and cheerful. The dining area was clean, but it was also 7 am so it shouldn't be too dirty. As far as food, eh.   I've been wanting to try the location in downtown but there's always a long wait. So when I saw Matts Big Breakfast at the airport, I had to try it. I definitely will not go to the downtown location now. It's not worth waiting in line or going out of my way. It's great for anyone who wants lots of food for a reasonable price, especially at the airport. But taste wise, you're better off going to Dennys. Meaning, don't come here looking for good tasting food. There are plenty of great local restaurants in terminal 4.   I'm giving this place 3 starts because the service was good, location is good, and the place was clean.
Amazing! The best waffles I ever eaten, actually everything we ordered was very good. Great quality!
I had the Sunday morning breakfast scramble special. Absolutely delicious! Great flavors. Service was awesome too.
Consistently fresh and good. Prices have gone up a little over the years, but the quality has remained high... still recommended - here and the one on Camelback near 32nd Street.

Huge line outside Saturday morning. We put name on list but only waited 10 minutes. We sat at the bar, really nice servers. Excellent breakfast here and ours was served really quickly.  Hot toast! Fresh squeezed Oj!
Love the meatloaf and Elizabeth is the best. I comeback every week and she makes me feel like part of the family.

It was a nice surprise to know Matt's Big Breakfast opened a new location a little closer to home. The new location is beautiful and has a nice wide open view of the kitchen. We sat at the bar area and had great interactions with the staff. Of course, the food was amazing and was fairly inexpensive. I highly recommend the Sunday Steak & Eggs special if you get the chance.

The premier close to downtown/ASU breakfast spot in Phoenix. They have one in the B finger of terminal 4 at the airport too, and while good, it's just not the same. Excellent wait staff, yummy food (waffles are great, with just enough flour to hold the butter to-gether!!! and the chilli is a lunch time must have!). Remember they are two blocks north of their old location! Look for the orange umbrellas...

Wake up in the morning, food was on my  mind. Whats a good place to eat? "Heard the food portion at Matt's was astronomical!" Asked myself, Am I really that hungry? Yes, Yes I AM!   Knowing that a trendy brunch place like this would attract a lot of locals and travelers. I had mentally prepped myself to wait an hour. But who knew Matt's big breakfast would be contained in such a small place. I had waited almost 90 minutes to be seated. Good thing it was breezy that day, or it woulda been pretty intense wait.  Once seated, pretty much knew exactly what I wanted to order until I saw the special. 3-egg scramble with andouille sausage, fresh local baby spinach and fontina cheese. Sounds amazing. Got an order of that and an order of the Hog & Chick w/ hash browns.  The 3 egg scramble Definitely prettier dish of those 2. The presentation was definitely on point, the plate was full of fluffy eggs with melted fontina cheese on top. The rest of the plate was filled up with the country fries(potato). The bed of baby spinach added contrast to the plate. A dish that pleases the eye as much as the tongue. The andouille sausage/egg/fontina cheese was good combo. The flavor of all 3 really worked together, instead of fighting each other.  Hog & Chick w/ hash browns This one was less aesthetically pleasing. But don't let looks fool  you. This piece of pork chop is mighty tasty. The hash was real good. They browned both sides of the hash, and added some other stuff. It was tasty and had good consistency. Wish the chop was a thicker cut. I'd pay more for a thicker cut.  Everything here tasted good, and stood out from other diners. It was not expensive at all. But good food from a small place like that just means a long wait in line to be seated. I think they do take out. So'd recommend take out or showing up early.  But if I had to wait in line again, I would totally do it.

I wouldn't wait an hour in the heat, but the food is amazing, the pancakes and bacon especially, and who can fault hand-squeezed orange juice?  Come early, or in the middle of the week to avoid the crowd.

The best hashbrowns I have ever had. Cripsy, buttery, not soggy or soaking in grease. Cooked well done, can't wait to go back. I went for brunch around 10:30-11am and the wait is not as bad as earlier in the morning.

Good food, decent prices, solid service...Didn't have to wait despite a bustling Friday morning scene...sat at the bar...Had the five on a spot breakfast sandwich which was very tasty...Lovely freshly squeezed orange juice, the real deal here. The con ? It's a very loud space....  I'm glad  I tried it after hearing how popular Matt's wash...Everything seems freshly prepared, the atmosphere is upbeat and you can be in and out of there in a snap...  Unfortunately, I live in North Scottsdale and there aren't places like Matt's by me...Hopefully one day. Good job mates...keep up the good work...

Best breakfast I've had, the bacon was absolutely delicious. I really wanted French toast but they didn't have any I guess it's only a certain day. Well we were in town from CA we went to see the Rams & cardinals game. And this was the best food I had on our trip. I would go back for the bacon and pancakes
This place is amazing. Certainly beats out Denny's or IHOP. The eggs and French toast were amazing. I'll be finding myself back here soon enough :-)

By far the worst experience of my life.  Not only did we wait forever to get seated but the food and service was horrible. The noise level was loud it was hard to have a conversation with the people in my party.  The waitress got my order all wrong.  We did not get our food at the same time.  My omelet was over cooked my daughter's waffle was undercooked.  I had high expectations based on previous reviews. Definitely not worth the wait.  Highly overrated....

Come on, people.  The food is good, but it's not orgasmic.  And the service sucks.  It's freakin' breakfast, and there's really nothing remarkable about any of it, except that people line up out the door for what might as well be a self-serve diner, once you count a wait staff who are so completely stoned, inattentive, and possibly mentally-deficient that having a conversation as simple as ordering turns into a game of "how is that possible an answer to the question I just asked, and what planet is he on?"    The only thing worse than the service is the parking.   Better than McDonald's, not as good as Mom's.

Simply the best place in Arizona for breakfast!  Matt's does absolutely everything right.  No freezers in the back, fresh produce from the market, and quality ingredients all the way around shows just how amazing independent restaurants can be.  The obvious bad about Matt's is the wait.  There are few breakfast places that don't have a wait on Saturday or Sunday morning and Matt's is no exception.  The problem is, however, due to the limited capacity, the wait can become excessive.  I've never waited more than 90 minutes (that was with a group of 5) but when you are hungry, 20 minutes can seem like an hour.    If you can occupy yourself with a Kontakt or the Farmers Market long enough to stick around, the rewards are great.  Wonderful, quaint diner setting filled with bright white and orange walls and counters.  An intimate setting where you can be sure you will interact with at least someone else during your meal.    The food is great and I have yet to be disappointed.  I usually just order the Special, whatever it may be.  It makes it easier than trying to decide.  The Five Spot is another favorite of mine - egg and cheese breakfast sandwich that is top quality.  The wife always orders the hog and chick (meat and eggs).  The best part of every breakfast is the hashedbrowns that are cooked in butter and better than you've ever had them.  The workers are sweet and full of personality.  Matt sometimes stops in to drop off milk or eggs or to say Hi to his wife.  She is usually running around making sure everything goes smoothly.    Do not let the wait deter you.  Go to Matt's.  Take every one of your visiting relatives and friends to Matt's.  Make a special trip from the far east or west valley to go to Matt's.  Just don't do it the day that I go.

I had a difficult time finding great places to eat in Arizona. Maybe it's just me but I just couldn't find anything worth my money other than MATTS BIG BREAKFAST. it was really good and I was soooo happy that I found this place. The waffles are awesome and the bacon OMG the BACON super awesome get an extra side of it. You'll thank me later lol. They can have a bit of wait to be seated (30+min) so make sure you get there before you're stomach starts growling. Worth the wait super neat place.

Local Staple with Great Food  We frequent here almost every week, and the Camelback Matt's consistently delivers great food! My favorite dishes are the steak and eggs (steak is always perfectly cooked) and the chorizo cheddar jalapeo scramble special. I don't think you can go wrong with any of the menu options, and the portions live up to the name. Matt's modest focus on serving great food is a strong contrast to Scottsdale brunch spots that are more style over substance. More than likely we'll be right back here again next week!

The breakfast sandwich was fantastic and a great start to our vacation, but far and away the real star was Michael. He was so energetic,  funny and helpful. I have flown through this airport at least 2x a month for 18 years and he has been the best server I have had. Thanks for truly kicking our vacation off right!

First I have to say, we went to Matt's big breakfast after seeing them featured on Diner's Drive ins and Dives. Have to say its good but nothing special. The service was great, ambience good. We were pretty able to get seated right away. I ordered the cheese omelet with hashbrowns and hubby ordered the hog and chick. Hashbrowns good, bacon good, but wasn't really nothing special. Good portions, the flavor is fresh but just a basic breakfast. Menu was small not a lot to offer. Wouldn't say we wouldn't go back but its not all what its cracked up to be.
Best dang breakfast in Phoenix, fresh homemade and delish.  Definnitely worht the 45 minute wait.  The potatoes are to die for and the pork chop is, well what can I say you just have to try it out.

This place has the best breakfast and super reasonable.  I make it a point of going here every time I come to Phoenix.  I don't like coming to Phoenix but this place makes the medicine go down.  The bacon is insane!  The servers are great and you can get seated in a reasonable amount of time - 30 mins. on a Sunday during prime time.  My only complaint was the coffee was weak.  Totally surprised because I thought they served Stumptown, Intelligentsia, or something along that ilk.    I saw a review that said they didn't serve non-dairy milk.  Matt, I think you should offer almond milk or soy creamer.  It's really not that big of a deal.  Better yet why don't you MAKE your own almond milk.  I am totally confident you can make us proud.  Don't get me wrong because I don't think it's a restaurant's duty to cater to EVERY type of patron unless it makes business sense.  You do everything else so well why not be the only dog in town to be all things to all people.  Just sayin'............

Not a fan at all! I randomly woke up one Saturday morning and researched the best breakfast in Phoenix. Matt's big breakfast was really close and voted very good. I showed up, drove around forever looking for parking, waited in line for 30min to be seated, then had very mediocre at best food. Overpaid for boring food, soda sold by the can, so no free refills. Very bad experience. Food wasn't good enough to recommend. We left very unsatisfied, then I believe went to burger king to satisfy our stomach
I come here all the time!  Simple traditional and organic breakfast served every day! Friendly stuff and fast service. 10 out of 10

Ever had slimy hash browns before?  Neither had I, before my visit here.  Definitely should've researched before I showed up at Matt's Big Breakfast because I've noticed I'm not the only one who wishes they had ordered home fries instead.  It's odd to me that you can only get certain menu items on certain days, especially since the regular menu is really small.  Service was just OK, but I'm usually impressed when I get better than terrible service at any restaurant or bar in Tempe.  If I go back, I'll probably order waffles or pancakes as that seems to be Matt's specialty;  I had eggs Benedict since it was Thursday and didn't find them to be special.  Would be 2 stars but I bumped it up for the cool location.
Great, friendly and beautiful staff! Food was amazing! The cheese omelett was amazing, hashbrowns to die for and freshly squeeze orange juice was amazing! Coming back soon!

Menu items are simple and delicious. Pepper bacon is perfect. Homefries are light and perfectly cooked. Pork chop was flavorful and perfectly seasoned. Bread and homemade jam were perfect and the atmosphere and service are impeccable. I never had an empty glass or mug which is a rare treat at any small restaurant.  With a mix of industrial and retro, it's a hipster's delight, but no so much so that my hillbilly husband felt out of place. I'm hard to impress but this place did. Protip: come early or the line will be out the door but the food and service are worth the wait

Maybe I'm biased because I can make a damn tasty breakfast myself at home, but for all the rave reviews and even being on TV, I expected this place to be a little above average.  Decent food, awesome waitstaff.  Let's weigh the pros and cons.  Pros: *good tasty bacon... *hashbrowns to die for - crunchy on the outside, creamy inside... *definite use of fresh ingredients...  Cons: *it felt like eating in my pantry with 25 other people... *all the cooks get to hear you peeing in the water closet (and I mean closet)...(maybe this is a problem only for the female persuasion?)... *almost $2 for a CAN of RC that probably cost them 25 cents, no free refills... *one egg was undercooked and one was overcooked... *feeling rushed to finish and get out of there as people outside stare at you wondering why you're taking so long to eat...  Oh and not to mention the butter burger that was ordered with blue maytag that I had to try a bite of - and ended up with a couple of tablespoons of hot boiling butter in my lap.  The maytag was yummy and fortunately I could taste it despite my scorched tongue.  We definitely left with full tummies (including my red burnt one) but more cons than pros means it was worth it to try for the first time, but I think the only item I might crave is the hashbrowns.  If I ever REALLY have to have their hashbrowns, I'll order it to go!

The restaurant is cute and the menu is original. The place was really busy but the service was quick, short food wait time, and the service was friendly. Expect it to be loud since a lot of people enjoy eating there as much as we did. Great place to visit for yummy breakfast!

I ate one meal meal here passing through at the Sky Harbor Airport.  Of course the restaurant name has "breakfast" in it but it was lunch time and I did not want breakfast.  I approached the desk and waited for a few minutes to be acknowledged.  I was seated at the only empty table in the place and wanted to make sure that there were non-breakfast items on the menu.  I decided on the chili cheeseburger with steak fries.  The patty was large which was good for me.  The chili surprised me because it it had beans in it.  I usually eat beef chili with no beans on my burgers.  The burger had good flavor to it as they use butter on the buns.  The fries were very good as I like the steak fries.  Overall the food was good.  It took a while to get seated but the service was friendly and was a good experience.  I didn't feel super rushed as the food came out fast enough and I had plenty of time to eat with time to spare to board my next flight.  I was definitely full when I left.  This was a three star experience for me.

Not impressed. My homemade pancakes are way better than these. Bacon and eggs were tasty, but again, pretty easy to duplicate at home. Plus, they nickel & dime you. $1.50 for extra maple syrup?!? I don't care if is the real stuff; that's just bad customer service. No need to come back.

I was treated to a great breakfast for my birthday.  We ordered waffle and bacon and steak and eggs. I had the delicious waffle.  I did try the steak and it was very tender and tasty.  They also have a cold coffee it's called nitron but didn't get to try but it's equivalent to a cold brew. This is a great cheat meal or if you just want a great treat.

This place has moved, couple blocks toward the freeway,  save your time it is way over rated. It is so noisey it hurts,  why people bring babies is beyond the border of cruel and inhuman punishment.   This was featured on Triple D, Guy you weren't in this place, the guy bussing tables & seating must own this because he's working harder than ALL the stuck up Waitress' combined. Probably not fair, some of the snobby girls were working, had to in order to makeup for the others. Maybe it's just age discrimination or ... .  Food was very limited, few egg plates, no flexibility didn't prepare as requested, had to send it bsck, while mine was getting cold trying to be polite and EAT TOGETHER.  We have deleted all reference to this & other MBB establishments, if this is how they hook us it's not worth it.  The food we finally did get wasn't anything special, beats McD, but not byuch except cost, way too oops much.
Teeny Tiny little place with little room to breath inside. Food was just OK IMO.

Long Long Long Long Long Long Long wait, for average food. I remember saying to myself "We'll this was not worth the wait" the entire time I was eating. If I knew I could get a seat right away, I might frequent this place. Otherwise, I am not wasting my entire morning waiting on a meal that I could make at home in 1/8 the time.

Love the way they converted Matt's to an airport concept. Much more successful than the attempt made by Lolo's Chicken & Waffles. For those of you just passing through Sky Harbor, these are both local Phoenix institutions worthy of a try.  I think Matt's effort here is more successful simply because they have their own dining space to manipulate, not a shared space. They use it well. Some tables. Lots of counter space for single travelers. Some communal seating. Lots of outlets. A take away counter. Great breakfast food early in the day and a full bar for later. Or breakfast food later in my case. A lunch menu is available as well. And it's all priced pretty reasonably for an airport. Well done.
The best breakfast place in Phoenix. Everytime I go i get the special.. which changes every time.. can't go wrong.... it's a long wait and small place but it's worth the wait

Matt's infinitesimal breakfast is pricey.  I was not very hungry so I thought I would order an egg and a little sausage with my drink.  What arrived was a tiny little patty of sausage that brought to mind that "where's the beef" commercial from the 80s.  The egg was fine and the service reasonable or this would be 1 star .  I feel cheated.

This place is awesome.   I tried the downtown location and this location is just as good,  but bigger.   Line out the door so be prepared to wait.   I got the Salami and eggs with home fries and tortillas.   The salami was excellent.    The eggs were cooked perfectly.   The home fries were great.   My wife got the cheese omelette with hash browns and toast.   The omelette looked average,  but then again a cheese omelette is kind of plane.   Hash browns liked like normal hash browns.   I recommend the home fries.     The toast and homemade strawberry jam are a must.   The people next to us got the ham steak and bacon.   They looked great.     Next time I may just get eggs with toast and bacon because everything will be awesome.

Yay, finally got to try this place today. I had the waffle which came with two slices of bacon and I added an overeasy egg. Best Belgian style waffle I have ever had. It really is amazing. Butter was tasty and I even loved their syrup (I normally despise syrup). Their syrup lacked that really pungent smell that usually makes me a little sick. And it was a lot thinner than most syrups I've seen. Very yummy. You can tell everything is really fresh. Would highly recommend it. Service was friendly and came around frequently, but the wait and metered parking knocked it down from 5 to 4 stars.

So, everyone and their grandmas been talking about this place, I had to tske my family here to try it out. Nice layout. Love thw chalk board special.  :) So, Ummmm yeah. Phenomenal breakfast!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! My cheese veggie omelet was amazing, I asked for jalapeo in it whooo. It was bombbb. the hashbrown was crispy yet soft. I loved my meal :))  The waffles were delicious :)) oh, and the wheat bread, it was thick and so filling.. It came with strawberry jam.   Service wise. We had literally five people helping us.lolz. when we needed napkins or more water, we didn't know who to go to.   Anyways. I'll be coming back. :)

Best breakfast I've ever eaten. I travel for a living and therefore eat out a lot. Matt's had great reviews and exceeded them and my expectations with super friendly service and amazing food. $14 I've paid a lot more for much worse. Excellent!

After a late incoming flight and not much sleep, I woke up hungry and needing caffeine in the worst possible way. When my sister woke up we began exploring breakfast options before heading out for a hike. She mentioned this place and a few others but this one was the only one I had Bookmarked on Yelp and I'd really hate to waste all my research time. So we loaded up and arrived around 9am and there was already a 30-minute wait--ordinarily I would've gone elsewhere but I was on vacation and the weather was perfect so we just chilled. Almost 30-minutes to the T we sat down and ordered our repast.   Coffee- I thought it was pretty standard diner coffee; nothing good but nothing great. Apparently they sell bags of it to take home if you really find yourself enamored with it. 3*  Bacon- Pretty amazing tasting bacon--might be the best I've had at a breakfast place. It's thick-cut and loaded with pepper and you can tell it's high quality stuff. 5*  Sausage Patties- Pretty good homemade sausage patties that had some nice spice to them. 3.75*  Waffle- My sister jocks their Waffle pretty hard and after having a taste I can see why. It's light, crisp and has a terrific Buttermilk flavor. She eats it without syrup (heresy, I know), but I can see why.  4.5*  The Chop and Chick- This breakfast comprised of two Eggs over-medium, bone-in Pork Chop, Country Potatoes and Sourdough toast. The eggs were cooked perfectly; the potatoes were great and I really liked the Rosemary they put with them; the Sourdough was hearty, but nowhere on the level of SF Sourdough; and the Pork Chop was cooked well and left a bit pink--the way pork should be. My only qualm was that everything was served with very little to no salt on it; which is fine, I suppose, because I'd rather it be under than over. 4*  Blueberry Jam- This came with the Sourdough Toast and it really deserves its own special category because Matt's really outdoes themselves with it. Maybe the best blueberry jam I've ever had--not too sweet and tremendous blueberry flavor. 5*  Service & Ambiance- Really good and friendly service that kept my coffee cup full and checked on us frequently. Matt's looks a lot bigger inside than does outside and has a modern-industrial feel to it. 4*  Value- Everything is very reasonably priced as none of our dishes cost more than $10; compared to the Bay Area this is an outstanding value. 5*  Matt's is a terrific Diner that offers top quality food; fast and good service; and is value priced. I'd probably rate it at a solid 4.5-stars but I'll round it down to four because the underseasoned breakfast was a bit annoying. Other than that it's highly recommended if you're in the Downtown Phoenix area!
Great fresh breakfast with outstanding bacon and decent coffee. My omelet had large cuts of peppers and onions but no avocado ... Wish it had the avocado.
I was on a detox/diet when we came here. They did great at accommodating my requests. Will definitely be back again to try the pancakes. They looked amazing.

Took two brother-in-laws who had just arrived to spend a week here from Northern California. Food was just ok nothing or standing or memorable in a good way about it. Service was below average. I don't really care to get my toast half way into my meal with hard butter that couldn't even think about melting. Ask for creamer and be prepared for the "organic" blah blah blah. Hash browns were mushy and they could not accommodate adding onions and peppers into them.  I've been to the other locations and it's always been an average experience.
My potatoes were swimming in olive oil. Service was great but limited menu compared to other breakfast places in the area.

Nice brunch place! The wait was about 20 minutes for a Saturday morning. The host called out name when we were at the farmers market but he put his bag in front of the line when we came back. The hashbrown was different from most hashbrown you would get at like a Denny's. It was a brick shape where it's really crispy on the outside but on the inside it was soft so I wasn't sure if it was cooked all the way. Not bad though! Just nothing too special from most brunch places.

The food tastes amazing. I don't want to know how much butter they used to make my waffle, but I sure made it disappear. The staff is intelligent, friendly and efficient. There is sometimes a wait to eat here, but they have a waiting list and try to get new customers in quickly. I have eaten here twice this school semester (it's very close to the ASU downtown Phoenix campus) and I keep talking new classmates into going back with me. The ingredients are fresh and very high quality. No wonder they were featured on Food Network's Diners, Drive- ins and Dives. Yum! Try the omelet, it's my favorite.

Jennifer, thank you for your great attitude today; you were genuinely very sweet and gave stellar service to me and the folks at my tall table.  You were very attentive, and went above and beyond to give us what we wanted.  The lady next to me did not like bacon that is not super crispy. You saw she did not eat it and came right back with some lean, crispy pieces. She took my silverware :)  The gentlemen next to me asked for a drink which Matt's serves on ice which he is not used to. You quickly apologized and wanted to make it right.  Matt, you need to give her a raise to keep her on staff; folks like Jennifer are rare and you cannot afford to lose valuable employees like her.   This is a great spot if you are sick of standardized chain food in airports looking to serve shareholders rather than customers BTW.

Place is super cute and very busy for a Thursday morning. We ordered the Eggs Benedict's (Thursday special) and waffles. The waffles were delicious and worth getting! The bacon was my favorite part, it had this peppery smoke to it! The Benedict's were just ok for me. The English toast that the poach egg and ham sits on isn't my favorite and the hollandaise sauce wasn't a wow for me. BUT, there hash browns extra crispy we're so good for being thicker than what you usually see for hash browns. Place was packed but service was fast!   A lot of reviewers mention friendly staff but we didn't get that warm, happy and welcoming vibe. Host was a gentlemen and he wasn't rude but was running around the place and just quickly took your name (appreciate that his a fast and hard worker but a quick hello and letting us know how long wait wouldn't hurt). Our server wasn't rude but also did her job, hello. Took our order. Checked back. Drop check. Nothing engaging to remember or make the visit better. When dropping off a check, one should let the guest know when your ready to pay, you can take it to the encounter. Don't assume everyone is from that town...
Best breakfast spot in Arizona. A must try for anyone visiting or new to the valley! This place is money.

Not sure what I can say that everyone else has not already said:  Their Pork Chop is excellent, I generally get the Waffle (it is very hard to get a good waffle that uses it's own batter versus pancake batter) and sub out the bacon for the Pork Chop (+4.25), their hashbrowns are amazing one of the best ever (per Mrs D) and their homemade strawberry preserves are exceptional  The more simple a dish is, the higher the execution needs to be and the sourcing of the ingredients needs to be, and Matt's does an excellent job of both - They do a great job with a small menu that they can execute at a high level, for American Breakfast food you cannot beat Matt's if you can get there before it is packed

Thought it was very high priced for what you get. When we got there and walked in there was no hostess and people were all over the place. Finally a guy came up and asked our name and how many in the party. Then he just walked away. We didn't know if we were on a list or even if there was a list. Finally I went up to the counter and asked if we were on any list and turns out he had put us on a list but didn't have our name correct. None the less we got seated eventually. The food was good but not out of this world My wife and I each had breakfast, orange juice and I had coffee. With tip it was almost 40 dollars. For that price I thought we should be able to take the pig home with us.

First timers at Matt's! Overall really liked the place! It was a little difficult to find at first but once we parked it was all good. You get 2 hours free parking if you park in the garage. My fianc ordered their special of the day which was a chorizo scramble came with two tortillas and home fry potatoes. I ordered The Skinny which came with a side lightly dressed salad. Food was great! At first we ordered water with lemon but it tasted like dirty tap water. Ended up getting an iced tea and a coffee. We asked for to go drinks and it was no problem. Would definitely return again if in the area.
By far THE BEST place to go for breakfast when you're in Phoenix.  Now stop reading, get off the Internet and get to Matt's right now.  The line will be long.  Enough said...

If the Chop and Chick is Guy Fieri's favorite breakfast dish, his credibility has dropped a few points.  I wanted to like it... heck, this was one of the reasons I drove out to Phoenix, but the pork chop didn't do it for me.  It was dry and there just wasn't enough pesto to grab my attention.   The hash browns saved the meal for me though.  They reminded me of the way my mom used to make them: very thinly-sliced, a little on the oily side and extremely crispy.  I can eat this forever.   Yes, the place is small and the wait is long, but I won't dock any points for that, even though it was in 100+ degree weather; waiting is all part of the experience.

Let me start by saying I have been to the original Matt's location. I love the original Matt's location. So I was pleasantly surprised when I saw this one on a long layover in Phoenix. I was a little skeptical when I got closer. The walls are subway tile and there is a lot of orange and chrome, making it feel more like a diner than the funky downtown Matt's. Not only do they have breakfast all day, but they have a Ruben. A crazy good Ruben. Upgrade to the steak fries, you'll be glad you did!  The rye bread was buttery and toasty.  The corned beef was flavorful and tender. To top it off, my server Miguel was awesome. I travel for work, so I eat alone a lot. He was attentive without being intrusive. When you dine alone you tend to notice when service is slow or around too much. Miguel really had a knack for being there at the right time. Thanks for the great dinner. I will now have to schedule my trips with a long layover in Phoenix.

Breakfast review. Came in when it opened. Waited a while to be served. No gluten free menu options. No fruit options instead of bread, only a sliced tomato. Only dairy options for coffee (no heavy cream). Having a place with cage-free eggs doesn't necessarily make you a healthy option merely conscientious. Probably wouldn't return. I also thought it was slightly overpriced.

Small cozy joint.... great coffee... friendly servers....simple menu.  Another Triple D find worth going to...... I am finding Guy F. loves Arizona... after spending a week here I can see why.. tons of good eats super little time! Got here after the business people but before the slacker crowd (back home that means somewhere between 8:30 and 9 AM). So we had no wait....  I got the five spot which totally kept me full for hours...that and the three cups of local coffee... The peppery bacon this joint uses is to die for...My five spot: The sweet onions, the bun, the bacon and the perfectly cooked eggs.... solid breakfast. I had a taste of Julie K's griddlecakes and they were yummy.   I appreciate simplicity and this place has some basics on the menu but do them well. Reasonably priced menu... I highly recommend :-).  Few things 1. BRING QUARTERS ....  lots of places to park but it is metered parking 2. come early and make sure EVERYONE in your party is there 3. Bathroom is next door (TALK TO MIKEY.. he is a very wise and amazing person)
Matt's is the best. The food is simple, but delicious! Great atmosphere with reasonable pricing!
I haven't eaten there yet and after reading all the reviews it made this fat boy hungry. I'm heading there when I get in town on June 30, 2016!!!!

I love matts big breakfast!!! it's such an amazing place to start off your morning, but it's always packed (even though they recently expanded), so give yourself some time to find parking and wait for a table. their service and staff is amazing, your glass will never find itself empty. the waffles are ridiculous and I've never had a weekly special that I didn't absolutely love. totally worth checking out.

I have found that during the summer on a Sunday morning before 930 is the best time to go to Matt's....at least that is my favorite time.   Why you may ask? No wait!  I have yet to wait in line at all when I go that early.  But mostly I have been by myself and I find a seat at the counter.    While I scan through the specials, I find myself more often than not, getting the Hog and Chick with Bacon and Hashbrowns.  I have tried the sausage patties and the ham.  I was not impressed by the saugage and while the ham is VERY good, the bacon still wins out.  The hashbrowns alone keep coming back for more and I am not a big potatoe fan.  But I admit I am spoiled living just a few blocks away....

Rather than making this another dissertation on every detail of my restaurant experience, I'll try for once to keep it short and sweet. I came here on a Tuesday morning with my friend and my toddler, after a short wait we were seated. We both ordered the bacon and eggs with hash browns. Mine scrambled, hers sunny side up and I also got a pancake on the side for the toddler and me to share (so he wouldn't steal all of my scrambled eggs). The food came pretty quickly and everything was good. My friend said the hash browns were better seasoned last time she was there (they needed a little salt). They were actually made from honest to god, real potatoes, and when was the last time you saw that? I saw in the reviews that they have the best scrambled eggs but I wouldn't go that far. They were good. They also needed a sprinkling of salt and pepper but they were not the best. You have to go to Essence for that. The bacon was nice and thick and delicious and the raisin bread that came with my breakfast delighted my toddler. My pancake was OK. It tasted like a typical good restaurant buttermilk pancake. It did come with warm syrup though and that always makes me happy. Would I come here again? Sure! Would I wait in line on a Saturday for an hour and half? Are you f-ing kidding me?
Amazing. Well worth the wait no matter how long. The coffee is delicious, the food is fresh, the pancakes are divine.

I was so pleased with the service and the food. I had the chop and chick. The chop was juicy and seasoned well, and the potatoes with rosemary were delicious. I would go again. The wait was a little long but worth it in the end.

After spending a whole year thinking Matt's Big Breakfasts logo was too similar to Whataburgers to be coincidence, I finally decided to go out on a limb and check it out. Turns out, the decor is cute and simple...sort of farm house-y. Definitely not what I was expecting! I came around 10am by myself since it was a pit stop before Safeway. The place is always packed, and this morning was no exception. Thankfully, there were some seats at the "bar" - perfect for solo diners. It took exactly 14 minutes for anyone to acknowledge me, and I only point that out because everyone else around me got greeted etc. almost immediately.  I got my order in - the waffle with bacon - and it came out in a flash. I can definitely tell that everything here is fast fast fast. Their menu is not painfully extensive, and they cover the basics and have a sprinkle of unique dishes. Everything looked pretty food, and I would consider coming back to try something else.  My actual meal was delicious. I wouldn't go all out and say it was the best waffle ever, but it was pretty darn up there. The portion was pretty spot on. Looking around, I'd say that everyone else had plenty of food on their plates. Their bacon is thick cut, peppery, crispy on the edges, perfectly fatty, aaaand I need to stop because my mouth is watering.   Overall, food was good, and the prices are reasonable. I would also note that they don't have alcohol (if that's a concern).

After consulting Reddit on what I should check out for breakfast, Matt's Big Breakfast seemed to be the resonating winner across different comments and "Best Of" lists.  I ordered the hog and the chick and my girlfriend had their Friday scramble. Both sounded promising, but maybe because we aren't breakfast people that it didn't really strike me as anything special.  Overall, my breakfast plate was just mediocre throughout. The bacon was bacon, the eggs were eggs, and the hash browns were just hash browns. You get the idea.  My girlfriend's home fries were good, but someone went HAM on the rosemary. I love rosemary. I use it when I sous-vide my ribeyes, or if I'm reverse searing some ribeyes with butter, but this was just too much. It was overpowering and I couldn't enjoy the potatoes themselves. It tasted like I just ate a sprig of rosemary.  Service was good though and the prices were reasonable. I probably would have enjoyed their lunch items more though.
Our waiter, Michael, was GREAT! He was entertaining and wonderful! My order wasn't 100% correct, but it was super yummy anyway!!!!

I have been here before and felt very welcomed. But today. It's a beautiful day out side. And we wanted to sit on the patio. We were made to feel it was a inconvenience. Then the food showed up on a dirty plate. Service really needs help.

What can be said that hasn't been already. First time back in a long time, when they were at the other location a block over. Excellent - went Hog & Chick, add Chicken Apple Sausage. How the heck do the make something so simple so good??!!  You have to try it to understand. 6 Stars! The new location looks great.
Best pancakes I've had so far.  Bkfst potatoes were very good.  Salami omelette wasn't the best so I'll try something else next time.

I have been hearing rave reviews about this place from all my co-workers, so I decided to give it a go.  I called to place an order and the girl accidentally hung up on me. I don't know why that bothers me so much, maybe it's just because you should know how to operate your phone?  When I went to pick up my order the place is busy, as always which is a great thing. It's like going to a Mexican restaurant and seeing Mexicans, it just means the food is good.   I got the omelet with onions and ham, with hash browns and wheat toast. The top half of the hash browns were on point, crisp and tasty. The bottom half . . . soggy and soaked in grease. GROSS.   The omelet was huge! If you are looking for a lot of food this is the place to go, though if you are looking for taste I would skip the omelet. The only thing that didn't taste like cardboard was the ham. Thank God for the ham.   The wheat toast was ok, though the spread they include has chunks of fruit in it and is amazing.  Don't order the OJ to go. You get about 3oz. of it in a plastic sippy cup. I don't know if they thought I was heading to the airport?   Anyway, if you want a huge obese enticing portion go here you will get it. If you are looking for a non soggy breakfast I would keep looking.

I'm from out of state, and my father and I love going to places that we see on Drive-Ins, Diners, & Dives. Although we hadn't seen this episode, we had heard good things about it. I'm not much of a breakfast person but I made an exception here. Their Waffle is one of the best tasting waffles I have ever had. The cream butter and powdered sugar topping was well portioned; their 100% pure maple syrup was an amazing touch to the waffle as well. Also, make sure that at at least one person in your party gets their homemade Honey Lemonade, especially their raspberry one if it's available. Their bacon is thick and cooked nice and crispy. I would definitely come back again if I were in town and it is definitely worth the wait.
This place had absolutely delicious and unique breakfast food! The service was great too. I only wish we lived closer and we'd be there all the time.

Amazing food and amazing service! I only wish we lived closer and we'd be there all the time. The potatoes were so good, I ate every last one and barely had room for the rest of the delicious stuff on my plate.

Happy St. Patrick's Day :-)  I can't believe this was my first time coming to Matt's Big Breakfast!!   "I'll be back" (in my best Arnold from Terminator voice)  Wow what an amazing experience. Definitely worth the trip/journey if you'er not in the area. Don't let the wait time scare you, it's so worth it.   We had to wait a half an hour to get seated, which wasn't too bad. The beautiful AZ weather made it a pleasant wait and it went by quick.  We were seated at the bar which was quick and convenient, but the bar stools were not that comfortable.    The food came out relatively quick for how packed the place was.    I wanted either pancakes, french toast or a waffle.  The waffle decision was made easily because the side of bacon it came with sealed the deal for me.  The waffle was cooked to the perfect consistency and you could tell the batter was home made and not some Bisquik instant waffle. Very flavorful.  The side of crisp peppered bacon was the perfect savory compliment to the sweet delicious waffle.    I also sampled my buddy's pancakes, they were amazing, very tasty.  Simple menu, but the food speaks for itself.  I can't wait to come back and try something else ;-)

Love the food. Love the staff. Hate the wait. Only solution for us is to try to hit it at an off time. Good luck. The bacon is superb and the rosemary potatoes are a can't miss. Everything else, including the vaunted pork chops, are good, but hardly off the chart. I get the charm thing, but it's breakfast and I'm hungry. Find me a seat.

I think there was way...too much hype for this little place. The food is good, but it wasn't worth waiting over an hour to eat here. I was lucky enough to have come by here and while waiting I walked over to the Farmer's Market, it helped kill my waiting time and standing in the heat.  No joke that the place is tiny. They do have a friendly staff and have lots of staff to help with the crowds they get. So the service is good. I had The Chop & Chick, the chop was pretty tasty. The homefries were just okay, the hash browns tasted better. I also tried The Five Spot and it was good. There are lots of great reviews on the bacon from this place and...it is good, but I wouldn't want to pay $2.50 for a side order of bacon.

Not recommended in any sense! Matt's Big Breakfast might be the slowest restaurant I've ever experienced. The quality of the food was barely approaching average and the cost was typical of an airport eatery. It was probably half full of customers and they appeared to have a full wait staff on hand. I sat at the bar and saw at least ten plates ready for delivery in the kitchen while the staff just wandered about ignoring it. The only people that appeared mildly interested in working were the cooks and the bartender. That being said my egg and bacon bagel was of the quality typical of a hungover college student. For the amount of time that I waited and the cost I could have left the airport and eaten at an actual restaurant.

I LOVE THIS PLACE. I am usually not the biggest fan of breakfast places, as breakfast is not my favorite meal of the day, BUT this place is my new favorite. You may spend the extra dollar here and there, but the portions are huge and very tasty. I had the omelette and hashbrowns, and honestly, I don't know if my mom could have made them better!  Another nice surprise was their jelly/jam. It was fresh and flavorful-not at all like a Smuckers package!  I'm very glad to say I'm within walking distance because I know I'll be coming back for more. I would say though, the lines are long for a reason! Save yourself some time and call it in to go if you have the chance!
Food was fantastic !! Came into town from California and it hit the spot!  Place is super trendy and friendly .. Ice tea was bomb !! Daniel .. and Janiel are so sweet !! Sit in their section

Was told this was a "must do" for brunch in Phoenix - wait was about 45 mins for 3 people.  The 5 spot and hash browns came highly recommended by Russ, the bartender at Bitter & Twisted.    I would say the overall sandwich was good, the bacon was good, the roll was ok and the hashbrowns, while crispy on both sides, was runny in the middle!  Not great.  My sister had the home fries and said it was delish.  The honey lemonade was really good though.  Service was nice and efficient but I think overall, not worth the hype and/or wait.
Great specials, decent service. Definitely a local hotspot. Board was not current.

This is the #1 local breakfast restaurant chain in Arizona. The way they make classic breakfast food doesn't compare with any breakfast restaurant I have ever been too. Only the best ingredient's. My favorite is Hog and Chick with hash browns, thick bacon, sourdough toast and homemade strawberry preserves.
Good breakfast at typical airport prices. The bacon is good quality and peppered and the strawberry jam tastes homemade. The wheat toast is thick multigrain and tastes like Beyond Bread.

There are very few places that I'm completely OK with waiting thirty to forty-five minutes to eat breakfast, much less in the Phoenix heat, but when it comes to Matt's Big Breakfast I don't think twice about it.  It's actually a regular occurrence, while sitting on the outdoor waiting benches, for the guests who are leaving to assure you it is worth the wait.  The place is small, you might even say cramped depending on where you are sat, but the food is second to none.  I always get the special, which varies from day to day.  It's typically a scrambler with generous helpings of meat and cheese, and some locally grown veggies or peppers.  I recommend a side of home fries with rosemary as opposed to the hash browns.  If you're not in the mood for eggs try the waffle or pancakes (seriously it's just all good), and if bread doesn't come with what you order you've got to try the sourdough toast with house made organic blueberry jelly...so delicious.  In addition to the amazing food, the service is always great.  Hands down, Matt's Big Breakfast is my favorite breakfast stop.

The food at Matt's was delicious!  Went there on Thursday and got there around 10 and only waited 5 minutes.  I had the pork chop which comes with eggs, potatoes, and toast.  My son had the waffle with bacon. I also ordered a side of bacon so I could try it as we'll.  It was all delicious.  The food was very flavorful and well seasoned.  My son is 10 years old and is a picky eater.  He loved the waffle and ate almost his whole plate.  I will definitely be back!

Just as wonderful as the downtown location.  Even one more advantage is they have French toast on their regular menu and it is a special at the downtown location.  I ordered it this morning and amazing as always!  They opened up around 5;40 am and I was able to order and eat and be done by 6am to make my 6:30 flight.  Great service too!

Food is pretty good here. I went here for the first time because Snooze AM had a horribly long wait. I have had one of the breakfast sandwiches here and the pancakes. Sandwich was good, pancakes are excellent. If you are looking for a place to go out for breakfast or brunch, then this is a good place to try out.
Here's what I look for in a breakfast place: good coffee, good food, good service, fair prices. This place meets all of those criteria, so you can be assured that this restaurant is good.

The Chop and the Chick..............oh my pesto encrusted pork chop will I ever get to have you again? It was over 100 degrees, it was over an hour wait, but they keep ice water outside so you don't die, and, in my opinion, its worth the wait to experience dining inside- at least once. After that if you wanna come back, just order your goods to go.   But back to the pork chop.......it was incredible. It was perfectly cooked, and sometimes Porkchops are hit or miss when it comes to moist and dry. But this chop was plump and moist and pesto-y and out of this world. The ambiance and decor of this place was retro-vintage-mod, mostly white w/little but unique decor.  I loved my dining experience there, from the service to the food.  I'd definitely come back!!

I have only been there once, so I will probably go back to give it another shot, but I can tell you that I had a very basic breakfast, and it was good...but very overpriced.  $11 for scrambled eggs, toast and potatoes?? I'll give it one more shot and try something with a bit more substance, but for now...I think there are other places nearby that I would lean towards before here.  The only major upside is that it's close to the same parking lot as my office.
A serious disappointment. The original Matts big breakfast is great but the airport one is nothing like it and the food is just overpriced and tasteless.

First time at Matt's and breakfast was great.  Waffles were made perfect served with a side of thick bacon which was nice and smokey.  Griddle cakes were light, yet rich and melted in your mouth.  Atmosphere was extremely casual and help was warm and welcoming.  I will definitely go back, already craving the waffles with bacon.

Great breakfast stop! It seems to be popular with local and out-of-towners, so it may be busy - the food is worth a short wait though! Service was friendly and fast with the prices also being very reasonable.  I really enjoyed the griddlecakes - great consistency with a slight sweetness. Their bacon is also excellent - peppered and cut thick.  All in all, MBB is a great find for a tasty breakfast. Be sure to check out their location in the Phoenix airport as well!
Loved the Rueben! House roasted corned beef and spicy mustard on the side. Great value for unique food.
Food was amazing! My son who is beyond picky ate his whole meal!

Visiting Phoenix for the weekend found this place on the best breakfasts in Phoenix. Definitely glad we came. We got there about 8:35 ish. We waited for about thirty minutes. It was well worst the wait. The service was great food was delish! I had the Hog and chick. It came with toast and home fries. Everything was so yummy! The house made strawberry jam was delightful! Stocked we came! This place has made this girl very happy! :)

I'm pretty pumped that its cooling off outside cause I'll be able to make my way down to Matt's for breakfast on Saturdays again. I tend to stay away during the summer months cause I sweat like a fat kid in a cannibal camp and would rather not wait the hour or so it takes to be seated.   Very few places in town do I feel as "at home" as I do at Matt's. The staff is always friendly as are most of the patrons. For such a long wait and for the patrons to be in such good moods they have to be doing something right! The food is fantastic. I love how they find locally grown and raised food and only stock what is in season. The food alone makes Matt's one of my favorite spots for breakfast in town, but its the consistency in the ambiance that makes it my #1 breakfast spot in town.

This place rocks. The food is great. The owner is awesome and very friendly. The service is just as good as the one downtown. Since this is less than a mile from my house I will be here a lot. I am so glad they are open in the neighborhood now :)
