The wait was a little long but the waitress was able to take or ordered while we waited, as soon as we were seated our food arrived. I had the waffles with bacon.  The bacon was crisp and the waffles were like cake, so delicious.

Fate led me to dine at Matt's Big Breakfast yesterday. We drove by this tiny restaurant while on our way to find somewhere to eat brunch. The sign indicated that they are closed on Mondays but we saw people eating inside so we sent a representative to inquire. I should note that the restaurant closes at 2:30pm and we arrived at 2:25. The waitresses were more than happy to serve us even though they were technically not supposed to be open. Score!  I ordered the insider burger (not on the menu) and it was honestly one of the best burgers I have ever had! How is this possible, you ask? First off, the meat is cooked in butter. You heard me right. Butter. Second, the burger is topped with 2 eggs AND bacon. As if this weren't enough to convince you, it comes with a side of homemade chips and a pickle. Love it! I didn't even care that my face was covered in egg yolk.  If you're more in the mood for breakfast, Matt's has plenty of options. Their breakfast potatoes have the most intense rosemary flavoring, the bacon is thick and tasty and their homemade toast and jam is wonderful. Order anything on the menu and you won't be disappointed. This is a great restaurant with friendly service and awesome food.

Definitely not worth the wait.    55 minute wait of close to in order to have been given the waitress Allison and her sour mood.  Never once smiled, did not bring the order correctly (and when I mentioned it, she rolled her eyes and smacked her gums as if I was the problem.  I said I have a pork and berry allergy (so please no jelly) and I did check to see if they used different pans and cooked on different grills.  My food came with Jelly; and as I said when I mentioned it to her; chomped her gums and rolled her eyes.  The nicest person in the place was the man whom was cleaning tables.  He was constantly smiling and just a great aura about him.  The GM I am guessing was nice enough to come ask me how extreme an allergy was.  IT IS AN ALLERGY and if I AM SAYING SO, must be EXTREME!  My dates food came, mine came roughly 7-9 minutes after; I am glad she did not wait or hers would be cold.  I had an open face cheese omelet as when you walk in the door you see their staff checking other omelets with a  fork on the window sill and then putting it back - to then check another one.  To me that is a bit gross and with a food allergy (thus me asking for open face), it concerns me.  Cheese omelet should have been called open face greasy melt...  Lastly, one other gross thing that caught my attention.  The man collecting payment, he touches money (counting it as well as collecting from patrons, credit cards and the such, even picked up trash from the floor; then turns to the window and brings food to a table.  Never once in my 1.25 hours there did I see him wash his hands or leave the floor.  They will not go broke do to my one post - yet if it helps one person - then I am glad.  I would not go back, service sucked other then GM, food was second rate, and wait time - not worth it.

Giving this place 5 stars because it is definitely the best breakfast spot in Arizona.   Everything was cooked well and was delicious, felt like homemade breakfast, not like the Venice chain breakfast places. Tried the honey lemonade it was a bit sweet for me but still was good.   Really enjoyed my breakfast here, and the staff was friendly! Will come back here hopefully before I leave back to Cali.

I've heard a good number of acquaintances say how good Matt's is so I was glad when a small group of friends wanted to meet here for breakfast.  First I'll say the staff are very friendly. Most everyone I saw made it a point to make eye contact and say hello.  That is so unusual by today's standards.    The coffee was good, much better than typical diner coffee and staff kept our cups full & hot. Each of our breakfasts were hearty and good.  Portions were reasonable and we all walked away full.  I'd describe it as good home cookin' with very fresh ingredients.

If you check out my profile, you will see that I don't often leave negative reviews, however I'm going to have to add one for the terrible food I received here today.  I ordered the Biggest Breakfast with scrambled eggs and what came out can only be described as the single worst plate of breakfast "food" I have ever received. Most of the components where flat out inedible. My scrambled eggs were the consistency of an eraser. The eggs were clearly forgotten about on the griddle and simply chopped up when it came time to plate them, after they set into hard plastic discs. The sausage was even worse! Small salty dried out pucks. I actually knocked them on the plate and they made a hard pinging sound which amused my neighbors. The potatoes were soggy with grease and tasted like funky rosemary. My hotcake came out flat as a crepe. It at least was edible after I drenched it in butter and syrup. Even the bacon was dry and chewy. How do you mess up bacon???  I hope the management starts to pay better attention to the quality of the food being served. I've worked in restaurants before so I know breakfast can be especially hard to manage and I don't like leaving bad reviews but what happened today was inexcusable.
Delicious!!!  Crowded and loud but food was fabulous!  Service was great and will be back to try more!

You know those mornings when you don't want to wake up? When you just want to lay there and rot?  Well, next time you feel that way and roll yourself out of bed, reward yourself with breakfast at Matt's Big Breakfast!  YUMMMMMY.  It's all you need sometimes.   It's like homemade breakfast served to you in a cheery atmosphere, even a fresh little flower on your table.

Great place for breakfast at PHX! Service was 5and the food was really good. Wonderful bacon and potatoes. The pancakes were freshly made and super yummy. Our server Michael H. Is great and made us feel like family. Good job!

Peppered bacon and sweet cream butter griddle cakes.  Mmmmm.  The griddle cakes get this nice little crispy edge on them.  Can I get a big woooooot wooooot!!!  MBB is an awesome LITTLE joint to stop at for breakfast.  I stress little because while the food is tall in stature, the place is small small small.  If you're going to go on the weekend, go early.  You probably have much less chance of a wait during the week.    Definitely a hot spot for breakfast in Phoenix.

Went in for a quick bite based on friend's suggestion.  The food was pretty good and service was attentive.  I ordered the Skinny, which had so much sausage I had to leave most of it. The salad it came with was dripping with sauce, way overdressed.  I left half of it too.  Not bad, but no where near what I expected.

This is literally my favorite breakfast place in the whole wide world. If I lived in Phoenix I would probably go broke because I'd be here every day. The pancakes are everything a pancake should be: fluffy, melt-in-your-mouth goodness. The home fries are an explosion of flavor in your mouth. I look forward to eating here every time I visit!

Food fair @ best. Got the BLT which was on dry toast & over done bacon- Cole slaw was an upgrade dont bother! Dry cabbage is what you get- Tomato soup is pretty good tho it takes an act of Congress to get some oyster crackers to go with it. Customer Service sucks! Had to go up to the bar to get a soda refill not once but twice & to ask for crackers- Waiter no where around- this is the 2nd time we tried this place with the same terrible customer service- don't waste your time- there are plenty of other good places in the terminal to get a good meal with good customer service!
Wait, you're shitting me, right?  35mins+ wait in the hot sun to eat bacon and eggs?  No way.

Came from airport with family visiting us. Daughter found this on Yelp. I wish I was hungry because everyone ordered very delicious items at a very affordable price. The service was equally exceptional, never had an empty cup or glass. Every time I looked up someone came over to see if I needed anything. Downsize is you need quarters for the meters. This breakfast in North Scottsdale would be three times as much with half the food.

I was staying in Phoenix overnight at the Sheraton & didn't want to pay $20 for the average quality buffet in the hotel.  This place is a short walk (10 mins) from the Sheraton & the food was excellent.  I arrived was quickly seated at a very busy place. I selected the Skinny without cheese & really enjoyed the turkey sausage, egg white omelette & the fresh salad.  The staff were extremely friendly & the atmosphere in the place was fun to go with the decor!!  It ended up being about $14 as I got tea as well.  I will be back the next time I am in town.

The food here is goooood!  It can take a while to get in but once you are seated that service is fast and efficient.  This is a favorite spot!  We take out of town visitors here all the time and they love it.  The sourdough toast is amazing, and I really like that everything is pretty much fresh locally sourced!

At first I wasn't a fan of this location, after being a downtown regular our first couple of visits here were honestly disappointing.  Everything from food arriving cold or one time burnt, to waiting almost 45 minutes to get food at all after ordering.    This location is closer to home and so we waiting anxiously for this new location to open... however, once it did it was not the well oiled machine we were used to downtown, far from it.  So we took a few months off and gave it another shot, the last three times we have been here have been great... whatever kinks or growing pains they were having have been worked out and service is now quick and friendly, and the food is on par with the downtown location.     I am a huge fan of Matt's so I held off on writing this review for quite awhile but after another good meal this last Saturday I would now recommend this location.   There is typically a 30-45 minute wait during peak breakfast hours.   I WISH THEY HAD A TEXT BASED RESERVATION SYSTEM... but otherwise solid four stars!
Butter fried chili burrito and green honey ice tea while Waiting for next flight!  Friendly not cheap.though
Service was good. Place was clean. BUT the food was kinda bland and unseasoned.

After thinking about it for almost a year, I finally tried this place out! Truly great food (had the omelet and other signature stuff), friendly servers, and well, the waiting line was not that long - or perhaps I just made a right decision to go early in this regard.

Really great experience for myself, mom, sister-in-law and two year old niece.   Enjoyed the waiting area, cool bench, muriel and WATEr. Plenty of space for the niece to walk around and be entertained.   The interior was hustle and bustle. Friendly wait staff. The place is buzzing with energy.   Unfortunately the food just isn't that great. Everyone was happy and full but no one was impressed.   Unless we want a cool place to hang for breakfast, not likely to return anytime soon.

On a layover in the Phoenix airport I decided to stop at Matt's for a drink and quick bite to eat.  After grabbing a seat at the bar it took over 15 minutes for the bartender to address me and provide me with a menu.  After another 10 minutes I was able to order a drink, however, based on how long it took to just order a drink I decided to pass on food, as I was on a layover and needed time to make it to my next flight. I received my drink, which had no alcohol, so I addressed in with the waitress, who gave me an attitude.  After that it only went further downhill, leading me to ask for my check and leave.  I can only imagine working in an airpot restaurant may be tough, tired customers, rushed to get drinks and food, etc, but I was none of those.  I only ordered a drink and expressed a concern, especially for the price I was paying and received an attitude.  Definitely not the customer service experience I was hoping for.  I will definitely pass on Matt's next time I am in the Phoenix airport and visit another patron.

We ate here on the recommendation of a friend and I'm glad we did. Arriving early enough to beat the lunch rush, I was drawn to the Big Butter Burger.  It was a toss-up between that or the Cheese Omelet, but the burger's menu description won out. The BBB is half a pound of hand-pressed Niman Ranch ground chuck grilled in butter served with American cheese- yum!  The service was great and we had our food in no time. If you're expecting me to say that the burger was dripping in butter, it wasn't, but that's a good thing.  It was a tasty cheeseburger and I liked it!  The only drawback is that I wish it were served with fries; potato chips are what you get with this burger.  Other than that, I can truly say that I'd eat here again and look forward to trying a Big Breakfast next time we're in town.

Do I really want to add to the love-fest? Yes I do.  I've been here twice, and gotten in once (the wait got me the other visit). But now that I've made it inside, I can tell you that the wait is well worth it.  M had it as simple as you can get: A single egg, scrambled. And it was light, fluffy and perfect.  I had the Honey Lemonade and wish I could have it every day.   I also had the waffle & Bacon, both were amazing. The thick cut peppery bacon is soo good. I don't eat a lot of pork; so for me to love bacon, it's a big deal.  The waffle is the best I've ever had. the exterior is perfectly golden brown, and the inside is like eating a cloud. A tasty tasty cloud.  Wait it out, it's worth it.

Matt's is the best! We always love be the food no matter which location we go to and the Tempe Town Lake local is a great place to relax and take a walk after.   Would definitely recommend it here and we try to come often!

First off, lemme just say that this review reflects neither on the quality of the food (fresh) or the service (excellent).  But seriously, I've had better.  Contrary to other reviewers, Guy Fieri is not the savant of Flavortown the Food Network makes him out to be.  Mom really wanted to try this place, particularly the "Chop and Chick" porkchop and eggs dish that Guy had on DDD here and the reason his face is tie-dyed sprayed on the wall with the words "Guy Ate Here".  We altered our exit strategy from the Armpit of America (aka Phoenix - 120 degrees at 8am, no sir!) just to sample this mythically delicious dish.  The parking lot is the size of a postage stamp, and while there are several sizable parking lots nearby, you can't park there because it's private property and Phoenix PD don't mess around.  Which leaves metered parking along the streets.  a quarter earns you 10 minutes at Matt's Big Breakfast, and the wait time is about fifty cents on a good day.  You sign your party up on the list near a ceramic pig by the door.  The restaurant itself is exceedingly small.  Get to know your neighbors, you'll definitely be talking to them at some point in your meal.  I had the organic chocolate milk which tasted exactly like the kind I have at home, an omelet with no special ingredients to set it apart from a Denny's omelet and Belgian waffles that weren't much better than the kind I buy frozen at Costco.  The menu at this Matt's location (I was told there are three around the Phoenix area, each with a more expansive menu than this location) is very limited and the ingredients are too.  No substituting fresh fruit, they don't have any.  That Chop and Chick that cost us $3.00 in metered parking?  I doubt Mom would have given it 2 stars.  Overall, it wasn't a terrible experience, but it wasn't something I'd do again.

Took my girlfriend here to start the day off. The food in here is very good. I had the skinny which consists of eggs with spinach and sausage with a side of salad. My girlfriend has the five sandwich having eggs, bacon and onions in it with toast. I loved the meal that we had. The place looks nice and gets packed quick so get there early.

My favorite breakfast spot in downtown Phoenix! Great atmosphere and service. You can tell everything is made from scratch. Their fresh squeezed orange juice and honey lemonade is delicious. I usually order the special and the griddle cakes to share with whoever I'm with. I recommend sharing to get the best of everything.
Updating my review. Been here twice since my last review and seems like they have stepped up their game and the kitchen is rock'n now.   No more cold food and fast service.

The best of the best. I eat here almost once a week - it's that good!  The OJ - fresh squeezed and always perfect. Wish it wasnt so expensive but you definitely get what you pay for.   I get the waffle everytime. It's literally the greatest waffle this side of the Mississippi (actually its the best one ive ever had but trying to sound slick LOL).   The butter - swear it has crack in it because you will want to put it on everything!!   And now the best part of Matt's (dont laugh!), the sourdough toast. Man ol' man!!!! I swear its better than any sourdough toast from san fran. Amazing!! I get two orders everytime.

Ok, so here's the deal. The griddlecakes here are delicious. And I mean good. Everything else is not so good.... I found that out this morning. So we waited for awhile and were seated in the back of the little room, not the one with the kitchen. The roof was leaking right next to us from the rain last night and it kind of smelled weird. Also, the service was not so good.... we asked for cream and never got it.... asked again.... finally got it. And this coffee needs it badly... so bad. And I'm still mad they stopped serving cream and started serving some fat free garbage. So anyway, I went with the BF for breakfast and he was getting the griddlecakes and I didn't want to get the same thing as him so I ordered the salami scramble. That thing was inedible. It had so much salami that was so fatty... the only thing I could taste was fat. Not pleasant. And the salami's texture was really chewy and weird too.... the home fries that come with it are good, the toast is not so great... came with blueberry preserves which was also not great. HOWEVER, go get the griddlecakes. They are awesome. I just can't say a place is four stars when only one thing is five stars and everything else is like 2. So there ya go. Go get some of delicious grandma's griddlecakes of awesomeness. Skip everything else.  Update: The BF and I went again today..... what a disappointment. His bacon was waaay too peppery.... like he didn't eat it, it was inedible. ugh. We waited over an hour and got seated at the counter.... pretty lame. Got the hotcakes...they were still good, but I just don't think I'll be back here anytime soon. Sorry guys.

I have had a love/hate relationship with Matt's, but in the past couple of months since they changed locations it has definitely been on the love side! I have gone to the new location a couple times and I think I have figured out the 'secret' to eating here. I live about 3 blocks away from Matt's so when I want to go I get up super early and arrive no later than 7:30. This generally ensures that I do not have to wait. Then, I order either the griddle cakes or the waffle, with the waffle being the better choice. The waffle is light, yet obviously bad for you because it tastes sooo good. Unlike the griddle cakes, the portion isn't crazy over the top and it comes with bacon which I like to tear into small pieces and put a piece in each of the little waffle pockets (or indentations or whatever those things are called). This plus the real maple syrup and butter is a sick....deliciously sick....combo. The griddle cakes are still awesome...like I said before, they taste like pancakes your grandma would make if your grandma was a really awesome cook. Also, the coffee no longer tastes like metal, it is, in fact, quite enjoyable. All in all, this place is good, especially when you don't have to wait.

Food is delicious! I have been several times and you should expect a wait. They have several 2 person tables so if you have 4 or more people that wait just got worse. There food is natural and its so good...Its not too expensive either. The place is very small and parking is a problem.
Love this place! Great food, nice people fun  Atmosphere. Just crazy busy on the weekends

We were visiting Phoenix and stumbled upon this gem on Yelp! It's located downtown but parking is not inconvenient at all; there is a small lot or metered street parking, which seemed ample even during the lunch rush. We arrived around 11:30 on a Friday afternoon. The restaurant was fully sat but no one was waiting in front of us. We had a party of 6 and I would recommend to try to keep your group small. This is a very quaint little space with limited room for large groups. It's only a one room restaurant. That being said, we waited about 25 minutes (which we were accurately quoted).  We sat down and were greeted promptly. Long story short, the service was friendly and the food was amazing.   Highlights:  -Iced coffee: I almost never order iced coffee in breakfast restaurants because it is almost always completely diluted by the melted ice. Here, they anticipate this and double-brew their iced coffee which leaves it tasting extremely bold (like a cold brew).   -Apple juice: seems like a weird thing to choose as a highlight, but it was so fresh and I believe cold-pressed!   -Strawberry honey lemonade. So refreshing in the heat.   -Chicken Apple sausage: just omg. Must try.   -Rosemary potatoes: life-changing. No one at the table could stop raving about them!   Also, the gentleman greeting and coordinating the seating was friendly and helpful. The owner also stopped by the table which I thought was a nice touch.   I would definitely recommend this place! You won't regret it. The menu is a little small but only because they take so much pride in the things they do serve.

What can I say about Matts, it's an awesome place. I've been here several times and also took my friends visiting from NYC and they're always spot on with food and service.   It can get crowded at times but never to long a wait.

This place was crazy packed at around 10:30am on a Tuesday. I honestly thought they had reinvented eggs and pancakes.  Everything was good I'm guessing the hype is over the breakfast meats which I don't eat. I have to say even as a pescetarian the bacon and sausage looked good. I wouldn't go back alone but I would definitely take some of my carnivore friends there. Staff was great and the place was very accommodating to children. Super pork-centric. If you eat pig, I would recommend you get yourself in there.

I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the food and I was amazed at how delicious everything was. I got the hog and eggs w bacon. The eggs were lightly fluffed w just the right amount of butter, the bacon was thick cut and they give you hearty portions. The strawberry honey lemonade was absolutely delicious and so was their Rubeun. I would definitely recommend this cute, hipster place!!!

One of the best breakfast places I have ever been everyone is friendly and the food delicious.  The item on the menu is probably overlooked.  Sour dough toast it' tastes like someone just baked it and it comes with homemade strawberry jam.

I met a friend at Matt's Big Breakfast for Breakfast (of course!) on a Wednesday morning.  The menu is not too complex and offers staples of an American breakfast.  The real winner here is the jam to go with your toast.  The jam is what makes the breakfast!    Due to the location, parking can be a bit of an issue at times.  This place does get busy for breakfast too.  I give Matt's Big Breakfast 4 stars because of the jam!

We went here today. I must say it was the best breakfast spot my family been too. I had the oats and it was delish. My husband had the special. It was the buttermilk biscuits and sausage gravy. It was absolutely incredible. And my kiddo got pancakes! The were fluffy and oh so good. Run don't walk here!! Great place!

A little hard to find if you don't know what your looking for. Kitchen staff was super friendly when we walked in, all saying hi and welcoming. The front of the house staff didn't seem to care we were there. We were told to seat ourselves. There weren't many tables open so we sat at the bar. Our server quickly got us water and our drinks but after that we couldn't get her attention to order to get refills, at one point. We just asked whom ever we could for more coffee and water and even our check. It was a real disappointment, I had been looking forward to trying that place out for a while. The food was good but the menu is super limited. Everything we wanted were only specials on certain days which is weird because Eggs Benedict and French toast are usual breakfast teams. When we left we saw out server walking back with Starbucks, that explains why we couldn't get service haha! We're pretty laid back but when I have to go find my server so I can order there's a problem there. We won't be going back to Matt's Big Breakfast, there are so many options in the area that do it better and with better service. Which is too bad because that kitchen staff made a great first impression.

SO GOOD!!! Found this gem via Yelp and all the other great yelp reviews so my bf and I decided to check it out on a Saturday afternoon 3 weeks ago. There was a 20 minute wait for only bar seating, but the brunch was definitely worth the 20 minutes we waited!  I ordered the waffle (amazing, so tasty) with bacon and my bf ordered the pancakes with hash browns. Pancakes were good, but the waffle hit the spot - so I'd highly recommend getting the waffle.

This is it! I found it!  The one place that has the best bacon, the best hash browns, the best eggs, the best pancakes, the best maple syrup, the best toast, the best jam, and the best coffee all under one roof!!  I love Matts BB!  It has a local, relaxed vibe, the clientele is hip and  cool, and the staff is friendly and attentive.  There can be quite a long wait if you decide to go during peak weekend breakfast/brunch hours, but trust me, the wait is worth every minute.  When it comes to breakfast, I'm a pretty straight forward guy.  Bacon, eggs, potatoes and toast please.  And if I'm feelin' really hungry (and who are we kidding?  I'm always feelin' really hungry) i'll order a pancake for dessert.  Oh, and don't forget the coffee and OJ.   The bacon is unbelievably good; addictively good; sinfully good!  Thick, smokey, peppery, and mmmmmmmmmm, just perfect!  The hash browns are another masterpiece.  Crispy outside, tender and buttery inside.  The pancakes are delicious.  Light, fluffy, and and hot off the griddle; not dense and doughy like most diner pancakes.  You can taste the quality and freshness in every little detail.  The eggs, the toast, the jam, EVERYTHING!!  the decor is simple and unpretentious.  Just one big room with a bunch of tables, a bar that seats about 8 peeps, with a TV to watch Sunday morning football, (thanks for that, Matt!!), and a little side room that seats about 6-8 people in case you have a big group.  If you're ever in Phoenix, hungry, and looking for a down home place to have some down home grub with top notch quality, freshness and love for food, this is the place to be.  I cant wait to go back.

Delicious breakfast foods, cooked with love and served in heaping amounts! We had a little trouble getting a table because there were 7 of us, but parties of 3-4 were getting seating rather fast. Totally acceptable, I understand it takes some time to get a table(s) for that many people. They were kind and courteous and kept us informed of when a table would be available. For as small a place this is, and as many people were there, it was managed very well. Servers were constantly walking around filling coffees and waters and our waitress was bilingual which helped my in-laws in ordering. I know it's a small thing but it really helped them out. I would be happy to come back here!   PS - the coffee is great!

LOVE the food here at Big Matt's but the service at this particular location was terrible! Waited a good while for even someone to come by to take our drink order and once our food came out, our server(s) disappeared. At least the food was great!

If you ever want great service to go along with the best food in the valley, then go here!! The breakfast is to die for, and the service tops the chart! I always have the daily morning special along with a side pancake. And believe me there is more than enough food here to satisfy my big appetite! The pancakes are out of the world with maple syrup!! I love Matt's and always highly recommended it to friends and love ones. You can't go wrong here!!!

If there was any place in town that is worth getting up at 6am on a Saturday to get in line for breakfast food, this is it. Everything I've had here is amazing and worth the wait as everyone else said.   The ingredients are local, the staff is friendly and the setting compact. Not a place I would try to to bring a group larger than 4 to though so if you have a large group, pick out the 3 others you like the most and ditch the rest! ;)

Everything was well worth the wait to get in.  The food was delicious and while a small menu a nice variety of items.  The homemade strawberry preserves were SO good I was eating them with a spoon once all my bread was gone.

Aside from the fantastic food, MBB has exceptional service. We are on vacation and Yelped to find good brunch spots. The reviews do not lie! MBB was easy to find for us "out of towners" and did not disappoint our tummies.   Only con is their very small parking lot, so we did have to pay to park on the street. Not a huge deal, as the meters do accept cards or coins.   I loved the Matt's Traditions menu found on the placemat. Today, their feature menu item was the biscuits and sausage gravy... talk about delicious! My boyfriend got the five spot and I would definitely order that on our next visit. Both meals exceptional as well as their friendly staff and service.   It's an epic five stars from this Hoosier!

My second time here today and this place is really exactly what you want in an airport eatery- quick service with a smile. Sat at the bar both times and the bartenders have been attentive and welcoming.   Settled on the omelet last time and this time I went for the burrito sans the jalapeos...since I can be a wimp about that. It comes out looking delicious and tasting the same. It took only 8 minutes for my food to come out too- which is pretty awesome if you ask me. I walk over here from the A gates because I prefer this breakfast to others- it is this specialty after all. Check then out if uou're here in the AM.
What's there to say that hasn't already been said? Great, hearty food that sticks to the basics and very good service.   If there is a special of the day - get it. You wont regret it.
Small place, but a great breakfast. The waffle was perfect and the service was prompt. We went during the week, and the wait was about 10 minutes.

My friend recommended this place when she was visiting me in Phoenix because she heard about this place on food channel. It was on triple D's (Diners, Drive-in, Dives). We came here on a Sunday morning for a late brunch (around 1pm).  When we arrived there, it was street parking. We were able to find a place on the street. The place is very small, it reminds me of a very casual, good home-cooking restaurant - not fancy but just good food.  We put our name on the list outside. For a party of two, our wait was about 30-45 minutes. It was long but it didn't feel too long. It was a hot day so we waited in the shade. The hostess that sat us was very nice. We sat at the bar. My friend ordered the scramble special and I decided to order the Chop and Chick with wheat toast, hashbrowns and over easy eggs.  They served water in a little jars which I love. It's so cute and it reminds me of a simple, home-cooked. I looked around to see what everyone else was eating, it seems like couples like to split the food because the portions are big. Hence, the name "Matt's Big Breakfast."  Service is quick. The waitress and waiters are attentive and they are constantly moving. The food came out in a decent time, it wasn't too long but not too quick.   When our food arrived, I almost thought they forgot my toast with my order. I asked them about it but they assured they did not forget me. My pork chop tasted like a pork chop I can make at home. I was a pan-fried pork chop that was oily and greasy. It wasn't seasoned too heavily, it wasn't too salty or peppery. The hashbrowns were very oily as well. I would like the hasbrown to be more crispy than oily. It was softer than I like. The wheat toast came with homemade strawberry jam. The strawberry jam was very sweet and had a strong strawberry aroma, I like the jam.   My breakfast was decent, it wasn't spectacular or horrible. It was a little more oily than I expected. It is your typical homecooked breakfast, they didn't mess up my order or anything.

We go to Matt's Big Breakfast everytime we are in Phoenix. We bring our volleyball team here every year or visit during spring training. As featured on DDD, the pork chops and hamburgers are the best!  Sometimes the son is working. We've watched him grow up. He is too cute! Friendly and efficient service; great food.  Went to Phoenix for Spring Training and discovered Matt's Big Breakfast located in the airport. Most of the favorite dishes are served in addition to more lunch and dinner entrees.

We were surprised to find Matt's Big Breakfast at the Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport. We usually visit the downtown location when we travel to Phoenix, but ran out of time this trip.   Low and Behold, we got our fix at the airport. The menu is a little different than the restaurant. Caters to breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  The food is still great!

Didn't love it. I tried it because of Food Network, but I did not have a good experience. My omelette was luke warm, and the potatoes greasy. It's very loud, and it is extremely obvious that they want you in and out asap. There was one guy racing around, yelling to people like he's had way too much caffeine. I really have no reason to go back.
Crowded! No wonder, the food is fantastic- perfect breakfast- the best fried eggs and bacon I've had in a while, the potatoes with rosemary were just perfect. Nice service too.

The food is decent. The coffee; not so good, pretty acidic. It's nice that they will give you honey to sweeten your coffee with, though. Also, I believe they only use butter and olive oil to cook with, which is A+

Worth the wait!  Keep in mind there is always a wait.  They have a a water dispenser outside and benches while you wait.  I prefer to keep an eye out for the limited waiting area seating inside, though!!  While waiting, people forget the seats inside free up as those people are call to their tables.  Staff is very efficient, yet still personable to their customers.  On our last visit I loved how the hostess called me by name when she came by to check on my table.  And you don't just have one person checking up on you.  They all do!    Now, on to the food.  There is a reason why Matt's Big Breakfast is iconic here in Phoenix.  It's delicious!  The menu is simple and straight forward, but anything you order is phenomenal.  And although you've had a version of everything on the menu before, the way Matt's make it is so much better!  They also have specials so even if you visit more than a few times you can still try something a little different on each visit.
Food was pretty good. Very busy around the clock. Parking sucks, but it's Downtown Phoenix so what can you do? Service was great. Will be back.

Love this new breakfast option in Sky Harbor! Been there twice now (first time was late afternoon). The service at the bar was friendly and fast both times. Bacon Bloody Mary's adorned with cheese, pepperoncini and a thick slab of pepper bacon are a must! The waffle is light and fluffy and delicious. The omelette is big, cheesy & comes with mounds of home fries perfectly seasoned.

Eggs are eggs, let's face it, but Matt does the other things very well. For starters, the home fries are phenomenal. This is how they should be done. The orange juice is squeezed there and it's very tasty. The toast is enormous and the jam they make there, which is great if you love strawberry. I didn't have the bacon, but it looked and smelled phenomenal. However, the real winner is the pancakes. They were really well done and probably the best I've ever had. They has a very unique taste I can only compare to the buttery taste of Ritz crackers. Putting the maple syrup on it was actually a travesty; do it without the syrup. Overall, great breakfast spot.

Was in Phoenix for just a short bit on our way to Sedona and was looking for a breakfast place for our family of four. Matt's Big Breakfast came highly recommended on Yelp and we were not disappointed. Went on a Saturday morning around 9:30 and there was a short wait. Waitress was friendly and efficient and the food was delicious! Wish we lived in the area so I could go again!

The food is good and worth it but this place is very UNACCOMMODATING for vegetarians. They refuse to do substitutions. They will gladly take something out but don't expect them to put something else in. Also we were seated in this weird room where they kept all their cold items... Our table was the only one in there and I had to physically move 5 separate times so a waiter could come and grab milk from the fridge.

On the weekend typical 30 min wait. Great omelettes, great waffles, great bacon, and hash browns. But....but... the restaurant always make you feel being rushed by the servers...they keep coming asking can I take your plate?????

The Place:  After reading many of the hundreds of reviews talking about the size of Matt's, I was still surprised when I pulled up with my family and the restaurant was the building that looked like a small shed.  LOL.  Forget small, the place is micro.  It has a bit of an urban chic/diner-vibe, but there is nothing to the appearance that would make someone ooh and aah.  Our table was two tables for two, butted together with two chairs facing the window/wall, and the other two facing each other, an odd, but space saving layout.  We were in the first room where there is also a tall bar to sit and eat, however that bar is also part of the "list".  The Food: I ordered the Hog & Chick with scrambled eggs, bacon, wheat toast, and home fries.  The bacon was as good as most have commented, a little sweet, smokey, and peppery.  The wheat toast was thick-cut and super grainy and served with raspberry lavender jam, both super.  The eggs were fresh, but just scrambled eggs.  In my opinion the highlight of my dish was the home fries - these potatoes were cut into chunks and fried with fresh rosemary twigs and onions.  I thought I needed ketchup for them, not hardly.  My wife tried the pancakes and wasn't particularly impressed, nor was I when I tried a bite.  They were okay, just not amazing.  Since there is no kids menu (which is an oversight in my mind) my older daughter ordered the waffle.  It smelled great, and she polished it off before I could get a taste.  I thought it looked good - and she said it tasted great.  Nice touch is that both waffles and pancakes come with REAL & VERY HOT maple syrup.  My other monkey, er daughter, had the Hog & Chick as well, however she had the hashbrowns and country ham.  The ham was good, but salty like good ham should be.  The hashbrowns were REALLY soaked in oil/butter.  They were crispy on both sides, but whoa ... really soaked.  The Bottom Line: We got REALLY lucky in that we got there and were able to get seated within about 5 minutes.  This was around 8:30am on a Thursday, as soon as we were seated, the crowd showed up and there were at least 20 people milling around outside waiting to eat.  The parking stinks, micro lot behind the restaurant, and other than that it's metered parking.  $.60/hour is still cheap though.  I enjoyed the food and the experience was a little to crazy for my family of four with two squirmy kids.  I'm not a hater, but I'm not going to tell you it's the best breakfast I've ever had either.  The prices were fair, but again with a family of four with two small kids we tend to appreciate a place with a kid menu.  If it was only adults and we weren't so wiggly it might have been a different story.  I'm not sure I'm headed back there any time soon with my little wiggle worms.  That being said, you should try it and see what you think.  (big plus is that they took AMEX - one of the few small shops that do)

The best hamburger in Phoenix is Matt's BIG BUTTER BURGER, bar none.  Get it cooked medium and get the HASH BROWNS on the side, we like them crispy or well-done.  The meat is so tender and flavorful, it melts in your mouth, and the bun is specially prepared just for them.  Super fresh produce on the burger along with a big ole slab of American cheese makes this a burger you'll dream about later on. The Griddle Cakes are our second-favorite item and when we go, we share a Burger and one order of the Cakes and we are both FULL and satisfied.   Matt's is truly a hole-in-the-wall, but don't let that deter you.  Figure out when the lines are short and GO, you won't regret it. WE LOVE THIS PLACE.

Went for the first time this week.  I don't stand in line for eggs, so went for lunch.  REALLY good chili.  There wasn't a wait at lunch time mid week.  It's noisy, so it's best for a casual, catching up with friends lunch- not for 'business'.  I would go again.

Meh.  I don't get the stellar reviews.  It's fine, but it's loud and there is almost always a wait for some reason.  It's overpriced for breakfast food.  The food is fine, but I wouldn't say fabulous.  The staff is always in a rush.  For me, the noisy environment and the price keep me from going back.

I was really pleased with breakfast here! What's great about Matt's is they do all the basics right. EVERYTHING is flavorful and delicious, down to toast. It's evident REAL, and FRESH ingredients are used. It's when you can get the basics right and genuinely delicious is when you have a gem on your hands. Matt's, open one is the Sierra Vista area!
I haven't eaten anything here yet (still at the table), but they don't have espresso so they top out at 3 stars. Breakfast place without breakfast drinks makes everyone sad.

we sat at the bar this morning while waiting for a flight and the bartender was phenomenal.   The food was okay. But as a frequent guest at the other Matt's locations I was disappointed with the quality of the food.   It just really isn't the same.   But better than eating at McDonald's so there's that.

Excellent attentive servers. Timely service (food to table time) less than 10 minutes. Freshly squeezed OJ is truly freshly squeezed!   Don't miss out on their daily specials - check the placemat under your menu!

Not much more really needs to be said for Matt's. The wait seemed intimidating but they have it down to system and it was hardly a wait.  Food was fresh and delicious and we all enjoyed our meals. I ordered the pancakes and they are everything you hope a pancake would be.

Server was nice...had heard about this place from hotel. Excited to try it. Long story short...paid 20.00 plus including tip for Pancakes, bacon, and juice. Pancakes were big...3 of them...given about 1 oz of syrup...requested more...they charge 1.50 for extra syrup. Asked for coffee with cream or half and half...they don't have it, just milk. OJ was 4.50 for 12 oz. They do use maple syrup, but honestly it tasted like any other pancake syrup. Pancakes were dry as I really didn't want to pay extra. This is the first review I have ever written...downloaded yelp today. I feel this strongly about reviewing this place. Very disappointed. I feel like price wise they are like an expensive steak house where you are nickel and dimed to death. Not at all worth it. Just my humble opinion. Sorry, not usually one to complain...

*burp* You know you have to put the guilt aside when it's lunch with your girlfriends.  More so when Dottsy suggested Matt's.   It was my first time, I remember it like it was yesterday.  Or, a half hour ago. Sign-in at the door to wait to be seated.  Gorgeous day out, so no big deal.  I took a seat on the bench outside and waited for Dottsy.  Then a lady sat at the other end of the bench and my side flipped up.   I had heard it was small...but not *this* small!  It was really cute and the staff was super-friendly.  I had to pee, though.  Apparently, the bathroom was off the kitchen.  OK.  I hope to myself as I make my way past the grills that I am not posing a health hazard to Matt's.  I mean, I was wearing a baseball cap, but no net!  Bathroom was tiny with no mirror.  That was ok for me, because, as I stated, it was baseball cap day.  The bathroom and its location are the only reason I took a star off. I got the cheddar and mushroom omelet.  Came with a side of hash browns and toast.  With a little cup of jelly.  At first, I didn't know it was jelly...until Dottsy saw a man put his little cup-o-stuff on his toast.  Omelet was huge, as was the hash brown.  The omelet was stuffed.  STUFFED with cheese and mushrooms.  I could see the butter on the plate.  Oh, man, this was gonna ROCK!  The hash brown was made from spaghetti-cut potatoes. Mmmmmmmmmmmyummy! I ate it all.  Everything.  I mean, I waited a half hour to be seated.  And my 20-year High School reunion isn't until July.  So, that's ok that I cleaned off my plate.  Right?  RIGHT???? Oh, and I ran into Dallas there.  Always a plus!

This is the first breakfast place I tried when I moved from Indiana to Arizona in May 2010. It is fantastic!   OK, let me get the "negatives" out of the way:   1. Small Place, (possible) Long Waits  - Most people are impatient, no matter how good the food. If you are one of those people and want to eat here; get here BEFORE the doors open.   2. OK, can't think of any more.   All the Positives:   1. Yes it is small, but it has a wonderful old-school diner feel.  2. The wait staff is friendly and attentive.  3. The food is worth the wait!   On my trip to Matt's I had:   1. Honey Lemonade (not as sweet as you might fear - very tasty)  2. The Hog and Chick  (Two eggs and choice of off-the-bone ham, thick-cut bacon, or country sausage - I went with the bacon)   The eggs were perfect; I always ask for over medium and rarely does a place get the consistency right (Matt's did).   The thick-cut bacon was always cooked to my specification - not too crispy; I still like a little chew to it.   Since I got there at/before they opened, I was in right away, got my food, enjoyed it, and was out in about 30 mins.   A small place, with great service, great food, and a loyal following. I can see why!

Good breakfast. There was about a 15 minute wait but the meal was not disappointing. The bacon is sooooo effin good but the breakfast sausage is kinda bland. The staff is nice and it seems like they all work together to get stuff done. Will definitely be going back.

I went by myself and waited an hour and a half on a Thursday morning. The hostess was rude, after a mix up when she called me (the name she called before me didn't come so she went to seat me, but then realized that she said the name wrong so I waited ten more minutes and then she called tables who were after me), she told me "oh there's a table inside in the corner you can go now". I felt super rushed and that I was inconveniencing the restaurant. The waiter I had seemed not all there. The food was ok but definitely not worth the hype and price.
Really great breakfast. This place is always busy! Def try their homemade bread and jam!!

I'm a breakfast guy. I love breakfast. Like a lot. This place was worth the wait, fresh flavorful food served by a friendly crew. I had the special which was a scramble and fully satisfied me but the piece de resistance was the waffle. Most waffles are good, there's an expectation that gets met, but this was hands down the best waffle I've had! A unique flaky texture with real butter and maple syrup. Can't wait to come back next time I'm in Phoenix
Very delicious food! Very quaint atmosphere!  Super busy, so prepare to wait at least 30 minutes.

because of the Guy Fieri review, my husband and I went there for breakfast (duh).  The lauded/drooled upon pork chop on Triple D was dry and very thin.  The breakfast was honestly nothing all that special. I prefer the meal at either Eggstacy or First Watch

We actually preferred eating here b/f our flight to kick off our vacation!  The original downtown one wasn't near as positive an experience as this one turned out to be!  Service was the best, food was excellent and even though everyone is there waiting for a plane-we weren't rushed and they made us feel valued!

My husband surprised me with breakfast take-out here a few weekends ago and I was a giggling mess. I had the perma-grin waiting for him to get back with my favorite item, the Salami Scramble. It is scrambled eggs mixed with sliced salami, with their awesome thick toast and your choice of hashbrowns or home fries. The jelly they give with the toast is delicious, as well. I can't say I am a huge fan of the potatoes as both the home fries and hashbrowns tend to be really greasy. That's okay, though, because the rest of the food is great. They also have thick-cut bacon you can order on the side that is pretty wonderful. I have eaten in the restaurant, sometimes, and I never had to wait too long and usually the wait seems to go by fast. Inside, the service is pretty efficient which at times can seem like they are pushing you out. But everyone is really friendly. I love that the farmer's market is right across the street which is great if you want to get out and have a nice breakfast before hitting the market. Matt's is closed on Mondays, FYI. Don't be like me trying to hit it up on a Monday off and throwing the collossal temper-tamptrum in the parking lot.

What hasn't been said about Matt's???  It's great food and the folks that work there are as friendly as they can be.  Get there early or you'll wait.  Every time I bring the two year old with me the staff goes out their way to take care of this Daddy on a date with his daughter.  Hog and Chick is the staple and the hash brown taste like they've been cooked in a pound of butter.  Be still my beating heart... Eat any more and we'll see that.  The Missus had the pancakes and they were also great.  Fresh ingredients abound and you syrup isn't flavored corn syrup.  Real maple syrup!!!  A true Phoenix landmark and place to eat

Bacon O' Bacon!!! This place was one of those random "let's see what's good in this area" excursions. WOW. I was excited by the reviews and the fact that it was featured on DDD (secret foodie mission of mine is to try EVERYTHING on DDD). Well, it was worth the wait and had the best bacon I have ever tried! They were quick and attentive once inside. HOWEVER, I did wait for over an HOUR on a half broken milk crate I turned up-side down, outside in the JULY 100+ degree weather. They had one bench that seated four with some shade and the rest were out in the open. They do have a crowd and I understand a wait for good food but, it was uncomfortable. They also have an honor system scratch pad under a paper weight, that is barely monitored and I saw a few people try to sneak their names on! Thankfully, people who are hungry are ruthless and they didn't get very far! A hostess would help IMMENSELY or a police officer in case a fight breaks out ;)...   OVER ALL- once I was inside, it was a good experience, fresh food, cozy atmosphere and great service!
Stopped in while waiting for a connecting flight. Absolutely awesome cheeseburger. One of the best I've ever had. Not something you'd expect at an airport. Service was great too.

After hearing such glowing reviews, my boyfriend and I got up super early to be there when Matt's opens. We were underwhelmed. The service was fine. The ambiance was fine too. We just didn't think it was anything special. For a place called Matt's Big Breakfast, I didn't think the breakfasts were very big, and neither were the options. It wasn't bad-it just wasn't great.

It was alright. The food was really good, but the portions were pretty small. There are only seven or so options in the entire menu. The bacon was amazing, so definitely get something with that. No avocado or tobasco sauce unfortunately. The hash browns have a lot of butter, so they actually taste more like mashed potatoes.
Delicious food great quick service of locally and organically sourced ingredients...   They get me, i want amazing food fast at the airport!!!

Wanted the check you what all the hype was about at this place.  Was very disappointed about the breakfast not to mention the price.  It was outrageous for two people's breakfast.  We waited in line for at least 30 minutes only to be disappointed with the food and especially the price.  Not worth the money.

Eh....Guy Fieri can keep it.  The good:  strawberry preserves are amazingly good, sourdough toast thick and well-buttered, good coffee with real cream, and hash browns fried in butter.  The wait wasn't too terrible for a Sunday morning after church.  My daughter's pancakes were fluffy and good.  Now for the not so great:  burned bacon, burned hash browns, dry overcooked pork chops, and my scramble was watery because they didn't saute the jalapeos first to  get the water out of them.  When I'm paying $100 (including tip) for breakfast for 6 people, I expect a higher level of cooking skill than I can achieve in my own kitchen.  We weren't coming back anyway, but the noise level added to everything else guarantees it.  They are very big on fresh, local, and cruelty free ingredient sourcing, which is fine, but I think you pay for that gimmick much more than the cooking skill.
The best comfort food I've had in some time. MBB nails it! Everything I ordered was prepared just the way I like it. I think I've just found my new favorite breakfast place.

Pretty good food! Quick service and clean bathrooms. Most of the servers were wearing "MBB" tee shirts and jeans, but I was extremely distracted by the server who thought it was cool to wear a tiny racerback t-shirt dress with her bra and breasts hanging out. Did not fit the venue at all, and you could see several other customers noticing her outfit. Other than being annoyingly distracted by that, it was good.
Second time I've been the Matt's while traveling and will return again, service staff are absolutely the best, try the grilled cheese and tomato soup and all of the hamburgers are great

I'm an avid food network watcher, and heard about this little breakfast joint from both Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives and Phoenix Magazine's "Best Of" issue. I'd actually tried it once before last summer and been only mildly impressed...To read about the experience that changed my mind, visit my food blog:  http://eatinganddrinkingacrosstheusa.blogspot.com/2011/07/downtown-phoenix-az.html
Good food great people and atmosphere Really enjoyed the staff very accommodating highly Reccomend....

If you are a breakfast place, than learn how to make an omelette !  Mine was dry, like-warm, flat, dense and not presented well either! Also: no cream for coffee! Do you know what that does to coffee?  Disappointing - for the price you charge, you should do much better !

I went to Matt's Big Breakfast with my wife on 08/15/14. We were staying at the Westin and a front desk employee had recommended Matt's to us. The reviews on YELP were great and it's only a short walk away, in the hot Phoenix sun, so we thought we'd check it out. When we walked in we were promptly greeted and seated ourselves at a table for two. There are tables and a breakfast bar to eat at. The restaurant was busy but not crowded. I can imagine that people are waiting in line to eat at Matt's on weekends. Our waiter and waitress, yes, we had several people take care of us, quickly took our order. Great team work! I had the Hog and Chick, with an extra egg and bacon. My wife had a waffle with a side of bacon. My meal came with home fries and toast, I also ordered a freshly squeezed OJ and we both had coffee. The coffee was good and refills were plentiful. The OJ was freshly squeezed and delicious. The service continued to be great and our meals came out in a timely manner. I had ordered my eggs over easy because I like my eggs runny. Two eggs were cooked perfectly but one had no runny yolk. My home fries were cooked with onions and rosemary and were piping hot. My toast was only one slice of wheat but was very thick and easily compared to two slices of regular wheat toast. The star of the show, for me, was the bacon. It was two of the best slices of tender, thick cut bacon I have ever had, at a breakfast place. My wife told me that her waffle was really good and agreed with me on how good the bacon was. Matt's Big Breakfast did not disappoint. If your visiting the area or just dumping your kid off at ASU, definitely head to Matt's Big Breakfast.
Little restaurant, big flavor. We waited for about 30 minutes to get seated on a Sunday morning. Honestly, it was worth it. Plus, their freshly made lemonades are so good.

Have eaten here three times and each time it's been great! Food is fresh, tastes great, good coffee, great service.  Try the Belgian waffle you will love it! The owner makes his rounds regularly. Matts and St Francis are my fav Sunday brunch spots!!!

Ooh, I can help push Matt's to past 100 reviews!   Before, I only got stuff by takeout because the wait was just too much. This morning, decided to just suck it up. The fact that the downtown farmer's market is right across the street helps. I recommend signing the wait list before you're actually hungry and go check out all the local vendors.  I previously had the hog and chick with "off-the-bone ham." Mmmm....the ham is always flavorful and just the right amount of tender. I love how the toast is actually hunks of sourdough or wheat rolls with jam that's not a little Smuckers packet. Back to what I ate this trip, I finally had their Belgian style waffle. It was bordering on perfect--crispy in all the right places and steaming and soft inside. I love how they serve the syrup warm. The bacon was thick but not too dense. And the freshly squeezed orange juice of course complemented it all. Hard to believe that they don't add any sugar to the juice. I like how the hash browns aren't greasy like what you'd get at IHOP or Denny's.   The staff are quite friendly and make sure you've been attended to. The atmosphere in the little red brick house is a jovial neighborhood diner feel. Our wait was not quite half an hour but that's after we returned from the farmer's market to check on our wait. Time it all before you're actually starving and you'll be good.

Excellent breakfast food, and my new go-to lunch spot on weekdays. Everything is freshly made and locally sourced, and it shows in the flavors delivered. I especially recommend the airy griddlecakes and delicious toast with their home made strawberry preserve. Can't recommend this place enough for the quality of food, and the friendly service and reasonable prices just enhance the experience.

I almost like this better than the downtown location just based on size alone. But both locations tend to execute quickly and provide tasty food. They also have the best bacon, most deliciously seasoned potatoes, and garagantuously trimmed $14 bacon Bloody Mary's (for airport food, I'll take it). Their sourdough toast with housemade jam is also not to be missed.  Worth the treck to the B gates if you have the time before takeoff.

So this place was such a let down. With all the hype I expected amazing, one of a kind eats. Instead, I got any other breakfast joint that made good food. I definitely wouldn't pay for parking and wait more than 20 minutes for their food.  You're better off driving to Arcadia area where thwy have several restaurants with the same kind of ambience, price, bigger portiins and free parking. Also, if you're a breakfast place in AZ that serves eggs and don't carry Chaloula that's just blasphemy. The service was good, their definitely quick. Although, they forgot our sausages by the time it came out we were done with everything else. But that happens sometimes, I'm sure they were just busy. The decor is cute.

Let me just say that this wasn't my first taste of Matt's. I've enjoyed some of this deliciousness at the Sky Harbor location, but this spot has a much better vibe and the same great food! I love that they use locally roasted coffee (Cave Creek) and everything tastes so fresh. I went in this morning and thoroughly enjoyed the special for today which was biscuits and gravy. It was more like: perfectly flakey biscuit smothered in chunks of sauces with just enough gravy. Someomes this combo can be runny, mushy, taste too fried, or be far too heavy. This dish was none of those. Instead, it's everything you want it to be. Tasty, great texture, and a little spicy. So good!

The hash browns were good; inside of them were soft, and the outside crispy. Unfortunately the employees were just as crispy.  They had an edge on them, sharper than the knife I used to cut the sausage patties I ordered. Our waitress gave me anxiety- I literally took my clonazepam at the restaurant. She talked to us super quietly, at about 1,000 mph. The specials? Couldn't tell you because we don't know what the hell she said. So we ate fast, drank our strawberry lemonade  (that was regular lemonade with red dye... I don't know either) and took our check to the front.  The girl at the front had a cute sweater on, but her math skills weren't that cute. We asked her to split the bill but she said "you need to do your own math." Uh okay. So we pull out our calculators and figure it out,  then tell the girl with the cute sweater how to charge us. Good thing we all have iPhones; I don't know what the poor girl would've done if we didn't figure it out. We dodged the hoard of homies blocking the front door and safely made it to the car (granted, we had front row parking)!  We left full, but confused and a little traumatized.
Omelette and hash browns were alright. I'm not to big on omelettes though. Orange juice was fresh, mmm!!

I love this place - it's cozy, clean, and very well designed. The staff is all very friendly, the food choices are good, and everything comes out relatively quickly. Everything you'd want from a diner.  That's really all I have to say. Go here.

First tried this lovely little breakfast joint about two years, and have been dying to come back! It usually ends up that I'm in a different part of town or in the neighborhood after Matt's is closed. Absolutely delicious breakfasts! And huge! In a nicely decorated downtown space! The service is on the ball - but you almost feel a little hurried. Still, an undeniably fantastic breakfast! I would rank Matt's in my Top 5 Breakfasts of All Time (yes, I am that serious about breakfast).
Long wait, but very good food! All four of my group got different things and loved their breakfast! Plus, they have RC Cola, instead of.......ya know!....

Don't buy the hype. I love a good breakfast, but that's not what I got here. I had an omelet with ham, mushrooms, and provolone cheese. The omelet was sub standard. The ham was like sliced deli ham very thin. Not at all like the chunks of ham I envisioned. The mushrooms tasted like they came from a can. As for the potatoes, they came overseasoned. So much so that i left more than half on the plate. The only redeeming thing for this breakfast was the toast and jam. The jam was delicious and tasted homemade. Overall though it was an overpriced meal and a mediocre experience. The service was decent and they made sure my coffee was never empty.

sweet baby jesus this place is amazing. We have been on a yelp kick lately and after a heavy night of drinking we decided to do breakfast in the morning. After a short early drive we arrived and were greeted by the most friendly staff I have ever encountered, mixed with a smell straight from heaven. we sat down, and ordered the special which was a egg scramble, the hog and chick, and two waffles. the coffee was amazing, the orange juice was omg, and the service was so fast and friendly. We took one bite of our food and it seemed like a whirlwind. the food is so good that you are in and out of there before you know it. if you go anywhere for breakfast it needs to be here.

Ambience: B- Cleanliness: B+ Customer Service: C Food: B-  Price  -Its an airport, its expensive, end of story. The prices were very inflated but I have seen worse so there is that.    Atmosphere -Again, its an airport. They try to make it look like an old fashion diner, they fail, but it still beats eating Doritos at your gate.   Customer Service  -Its an airport, people are not trying to be there all day. Now I'm not saying the wait staff should put on running sneakers but at least be efficient and by efficient I mean don't be on your phone in view on costumers for several minutes while people are trying to flag you down. On that note, don't look down on your phone while taking someones order and then get annoyed with them when you bring out the wrong order. Unless you were texting the chef, I'm pretty sure it was your lack of listening skills to blame on that one.   Food  It was edible. Again, it beats a $6 bag of Doritos. It wasn't great, it wasn't bad, but it served its purpose in that starve to death at the airport.   Overall I don't think I've ever had a great experience eating at the airport and this was no different. Usually I get decent costumer service though, so that sort of added insult to injury in this case. If you are going to robe me blind by inflating your prices, at lest do so with a smile on your face.

So good!  You will wait to get in, but you'll want to spend at least as much time savoring each bite of your meal.  Everything's super fresh, the coffee tastes great, the staff's super quick and friendly.  What more can I say!    I ordered the Belgian Waffle on a whim and it was light, sweet and perfectly filling.  I totally missed the specials on the board, but I'm using that as an excuse to get back in there for another breakfast--like, really soon!

Oh, my god!!  No, I've never experienced breakfast nirvana before, but I know it when I feel it.  Thursdays are Eggs Benedict days.  GO there.  Eat it.  I have never loved this dish before and now may never love it again having sampled Matt's oeuvre.  My countermate recommended the bacon highly.  While bacon with EB is overkill, I must say that, having ordered it, I was entirely satisfied.  It was firm, thick and peppery - Bacon so good that I will be hunting for slab bacon to hand slice and pepper to copy it.  To top this slavishly positive review, even the coffee was excellent.  Though my bill for breakfast was nearly $20, I didn't feel cheated in the least.  It was splendid.  Oh, and did I mention the home fries...?

I disliked the food and the service, food was cold and we weren't seated probably. The service was subpar from other breakfast joints in the area and took a very long time to get served. My partner on the other hand enjoyed his meal and thought they did and okay job.  As is any review, they are totally subjective to each individual go there and see for yourself.

I'm not sure what Moar O. is talking about. Their waffle is NOT standard stuff you could get at any hotel. I had two friends visit me from out of town, so I took them here. They loved the waffle and bacon so much that they insisted we come back again two days later. What I like to do is go here with someone who likes to share. One person orders the special for the day (usually an omelet of some sort with side of home fries) and I order the waffle and bacon and we split them both. Otherwise, if you eat the waffle by yourself, you will die (or just feel really sick because of all the butter and syrupy deliciousness).  Also, servers and other staff are always VERY friendly. Waiting is a drag, but it's to be expected so you just deal with it.
Great breakfast, we went back two days in a row it was that great. Spring Training and great breakfast!

Worth the Triple D hype. We always stop here when we drive cross country. I think we've been here 4 times, total. They have moved into a larger building and their competition around the corner puts a sign up across the street to lure the hungry waiting patrons away from Matt's. Nice tactic, but I will say this place is worth the wait. Everything is fresh, real, homemade-- doesn't get better. I always get the pancakes, the Chop and Chick is good too.. Their home fries and coffee are great.. Fresh preserves on fresh bread. Just go to there. It's great.
Breakfast for dinner!  Awesome waffles, Bacon really peppery. I love it. Good bar too.
Had a chance to check it out ..was very busy inside and there was a wait., but the food was good even with a limited menu. Id go again if im close by

The food was ok. However the waitress Erika was very rude. After being ignored by the hostess, I finally sat at the counter. Then I was ignored by the waitress Erika at the bar. She seem not to ignore the people beside me. Once I said excuse me can I order? she acted like I was bothering her for asking. When i finally got my order the other waitress threw my meal to go on the counter and said Erika will get you your ketchup.  No thank you, no have a nice day. I travel a lot for a living, especially to Phoenix, but I promise I will never go to this restaurant as long is this is the type of service they provide.  If you get hungry, I would suggest you eat somewhere else. No food is good enough to put up with bad service. I did tip her, because I truly believe in tipping your server, even if the service is not up to mediocre standards.

Bring your appetite!  ASU students nearby have a great hangout and breakfast spot.  Food and service at Matt's was great.  They even have complimentary water with orange slices out front if you have to wait a little bit and it sure was hot in Phoenix!   I'll definitely be back for another go and thank you for a nice experience while just visiting.
We make this a destination for our family as much as we can! The waffles are superb! And the omelets come the size of your face! And you wish you could have more (despite your overstuffed stomach).

It's Saturday so finding parking is incredibly difficult. We arrived at 11:10, did not get a table for 2 until 12:05. You cannot grab seats at the breakfast bar when available, you have to be wait listed for that too. The restaurant is freezing with metal chairs, I presume to turn over tables faster.        We ordered a glass of milk, the strawberry honey lemonade and OJ. The lemonade was heavenly, and the OJ was best. The food and drink is strictly why they got 3 stars at all. I ordered their BLT. Joe ordered the Belgian waffle, a side of hash browns and bacon. We placed our order at 12:10, didn't get our food until 12:36.  The bacon was great, the Belgian waffle was the prefect amount of sweet. Thought we should try out new restaurants since we're in a food desert in Laveen haha. Will not be returning here though, sticking with our favorite Morning Squeeze in Scottsdale or Kiss the Cook in Glendale when permissible.
Delicious food! It was kind of noisy though.

Even though they have moved to a bigger building... Like literally down the street, the wait is still long. Hence why I give them 4 stars.   When it comes to ordering food though, I go for the special when they do their scramble. It's my fav! It'll usually be some kind of meat and cheese scramble that comes with your choice of potato (hash brown or home fries) and a tortilla. Their strawberry honey lemonade is delicious as well!!!
Don't be turned off by the location and size. Good things come in small packages.

The worst customer service I have ever encountered. I went in there with my family for lunch. When I got there, they told me a 4 minute wait then they came back and said 6 minute wait and then they said they could not give me a table as my family was not there. My wife was parking the car. I felt they were racist because I was Asian. I will never go there and will never suggest anyone to go there. Very rude and unpleasant staff

Had lunch there. My wife thought the club was great.  I had the Ruben.  No taste to the sauerkraut and the 1000 dressing was very runny and not very good.  If we go back maybe We'll stick to breakfast.  Went to the one on Rio Saladin.  Parking is a nightmare to say that least

"Guy [Fieri] isn't usually a breakfast fan but he'll stop by Matt's Big Breakfast anytime of day." ? FoodNetwork.com  I'm not a breakfast fan either but I wouldn't say I'd stop by Matt's Big Breakfast anytime of the day.  Then again, it's not like I have a show on the Food Network so here are some words on a screen.  The three of us stopped by after our spin class at Cyclebar.  We were sweaty, hungry, and feeling good after our post-cycle mimosas.  Aw yis!  Run me a bath filled with hollandaise sauce while I devour perfectly poached eggs on golden toasted English muffins while I laugh maniacally over nothing!  Too bad this didn't happen as they do not serve Eggs Benedict on Sundays.  What!?  Sunday is for brunch and Eggs Benedict is the undisputed king of all brunch foods!  My heart broke.  The second heartbreak came shortly after when I was given my can of beer with a freshly-washed HOT glass.  Rapidly warming beer, anyone?  Blegh!  So since the Matt's Tradition, also known as the daily special, said Eggs Benedict was served on a weekday instead, I ordered the Sunday special of Steak and Eggs.  I had ordered my steak medium rare but was given a medium cooked steak.  Where's the ruby red center!?  Lame.  On the side was beautiful over-easy eggs that bled its gorgeous yolks all over my plate with the slightest prick of my knife.  The hashbrowns were super crunchy on the outside and soft and fluffy on the inside.  All it needed was a little ketchup and some Tapitio [no Tabasco or Cholula here, folks] and they were delish.  I ordered rye bread at no extra cost and they were cut thick, smeared with butter, and layered with housemade preserves.  It was like dessert.  Yum!  All in all, it's a solid breakfast place that is easily rated at 3.5 stars.  But still, it's just breakfast --- a locally sourced and organic breakfast but it's just eggs and meat, y'all!  I would come back but maybe not when I'm super hungry because that hour wait is not cute.

My previous experience was very pleasant but today I changed my mind. I sat at the bar solo, one waiter takes my drink order then disappears. Another waitress takes my food order then disappears. A different waitress comes to me and asks how the food was. That's messed up. Who should I tip? And besides that, their attitudes (all of them) are careless and distracted. I didn't even dare to approach the issue that my pork chop steak was tough and insipid. Not only the steak but also the scramble eggs were flavorless, hash browns so oily... I truly exclusively enjoyed the sourdough bread with the handmade jelly and the orange juice. That's why I give 2 stars instead of 1. I read the story on the back of the menu of how proud the owner is to feature quality of food and organic, local-grown products and bla bla bla. But where's the quality? I'm a foodie, I want to eat well. What you gave me this morning was very ordinary, at best. There's a lot of competition in this town due to the fact that there are so many breakfast places. You must give your customers something that will make them come back to you. Otherwise, from now on, big red cross on Matt's Big Breakfast.

I finally made the great Breakfast pilgrimage.  It was worth every minute of the wait.  We put in our names, and walked over to the downtown market to kill some time.  We still had to wait about 15 minutes after that, but it was a great way to go.  Highly suggest it.    The best pancakes I've ever had.  Ever.  And the home fries?  I could eat just a big bowl of that and be happy.  Great rosemary taste.  Really loved the coffee. Yummy peppery bacon.  One of our companions said the ham was the best she'd had since she's lived in Tennessee more than 15 years ago.    Right before we left, we saw someone served a hamburger and we could hardly move.  It was the best looking burger I've ever seen.  We will TOTALLY be back just for lunch. Mmm.  Mmm.  Mmmm...    But Matt himself cracking jokes with the patrons and chatting with downtown neighbors walking by was awesome.  While the food felt made with love, the big guy's personality totally put it over the top. You love supporting him supporting downtown.  Its the kind of business you would almost like to go even if it wasn't that good.  But thank goodness - it is that good.  Can't wait to go back.    Very.  Very.  Soon.

waited for a really long time . . . like an hour and a half.  To be honest - it wasn't all that and a bag of chips like I expected.  I mean, it was good, but I was expecting to get blown away and I didn't.  The breakfast wasn't even that big.  I had the special and I can't even remember what it was that's how unimpressed it was. I won't go back.

Food here is solid - simple breakfast fare for reasonable prices.  I'm a fan of the Five Spot, which is a tasty breakfast sandwich in a restaurant setting for a similar price to what you would expect to pay at McDonalds.  The reason why I'm giving 3 stars here is service.  The service was about what I would expect to receive at McDonalds.  Actually, McDonalds generally treats me better, so I shouldn't bash Mickey D's.  I asked if there was an alcohol menu (hey, I was there with a bunch of nightshifters hoping to have a pleasant bloody mary with my eggs before going to sleep for the day) and got raised eyebrows, a stare, and a short "no."  Our group also received an abrasive "we don't do individual checks" from our waitress as she handed over the check - despite the fact that we hadn't asked for individual checks.  Not a "hey, did you have a good meal, is there anything else we can help you with?"  No smile.  If a meal is truly extraordinary I'll excuse a bit of rough attitude (ex: most french restaurants).  Matt's Big Breakfast is good, but it isn't unique enough out of all the great valley breakfast options to make me put up with the attitude.

I stumbled into Matt's Big Breakfast after a difficult overnight shift with the rest of my night team and immediately devoured a meal.  This place serves the perfect post-shift breakfast, which means that it also probably serves the perfect post-binge hangover food too.  Coffee is diner-style, with frequent visits from friendly waiters bearing big pots of coffee, and the Five Spot consists of a perfect-sized breakfast sandwich with thick-cut bacon and delicious eggs.  Even better, the price for that sandwich is equivalent to one from most fast-food restaurants.  You may have to wait a little bit for a brunch table on the weekends, but that only attests to the quality of the food.  Matt's Big Breakfast makes me look forward to overnight shifts.  That's one of the highest recommendations I can give.
