Yum, yum, yum, with extra yum!  Oh did mention yum!?  This place rocks!  They are well known for the specials which change daily. So I did the three eggs scrambled with southwest chicken sausage, and fresh jalapeo which was excellent. My wife did the Griddle cakes which was awesome!  They might have been the best cakes I've ever had due to the freshness. We will be eating here all week!  The only knock is the noise levels might get a tad high.

What a cute place.  Believe me, the place is small but the breakfast is big.     It is a tiny dwelling and I can't imagine the wait time during their peak business hour but talk about helping the little guy out and everyone there was pleasant and most importantly the food was great.  I want to try everything there when I return.  BTW, they had the best tasting hash browns I've ever had.... Thinly sliced and well done.....Just the way I ordered it.

I can only give this two stars at the airport I love Matts in downtown  But this one lacks the good food and is in jeopardy of being typical vs special  Ordered the bourbon chicken and it was bone dry and tough to cut  Wait staff didn't seem to care  Coleslaw wasn't the same no flavor which they tried to compensate for with pepper I rather walk down to cowboy ciao which is another speciality that so far is holding up to standards

Their breakfast food quality has definitely gone down over the past 3 years of eating here. I used to be obsessed w the home fries because they used to be so soft and delicious, but now they are pretty much always burnt, crunchy, and oily :/ waffles and pancakes used to have this really delicious home made cinnamon taste, but now they just taste like bisquick mix w cinnamon added. The bacon is pretty good though- thick cut and peppered. everything else on the menu is standard breakfast that you could get from anywhere else. Eggs are ehh. Wouldn't recommend. The service is really quick with greeting you and taking your order initially, but since they don't have assigned tables, it's very hard trying to order something else afterwards. Plus It's always packed like a sardine can. You are maybe 6 inches away from another table, and when they seat 3 people at a table meant for 2 (which they do constantly), it really jams up the restaurant. Never order to-go because they will eff it up. Every time. If you're looking for a quick place to grab food for 2 people or less, then this is okay. Lunch is pretty good. The restaurant is way less busy for lunch and the lunch food is good. Just don't order it to-go.

Ambiance: Tuesday morning, still very busy.  Hip cafe/restaurant with mostly 2 or 4 person tables.   Pre-meal: Coffee was smooth and delicious.  The strawberry jam is home made.  Mom couldnt stop talking about the OJ.   Plate: Chop n Chick Pork chop was tender.  Eggs cooked to perfection.    Definitely satisfied.

Soooo good. We were kinda short on time and we're concerned it would take a while....nope! Food was out in no time and yes...fresh! Got a burrito and the kilt lifter. Gf got the BLT and an ice t. Both of ours looked so good we half'd it. Bacon was awesome and the jalapeos were on point! We live here and have never been to the location downtown...we'll  be headed there when we return. Oh btw staff was great. Super friendly and the price was not bad at all....especially for the airport. Can't get 2 crappy pizza and no drinks from pizza Hut for that price. Sold!

Since breakfast isn't my favorite meal to eat out (I like to eat as soon as I get up...breakfast is yummy just rolled out of bed), I had not tried, but  only been hearing raves about Matt's Big Breakfast for literally about a year, so I knew it had to be good...good enough to try breaking my fast outside my own kitchen.  Luckily it wasn't too crowded (as I'd heard it might be).  We were seated at a window counter, but then moved once our food came to a little table by the door.  The staff was ultimately accommodating to the best experience for us.   The food was beyond delicious.  Egg salad sandwich with chips (I told you I wasn't a huge breakfast-out person), a waffle, and potatoes, and chocolate milk.  It was all SO delicious!  And SO MUCH!  We were able to take most of the sandwich home for later.  By the way, the break was AMAZING...just amazing.  My favorite thing I think (besides the food) was how friendly everyone was--from the staff to the customers.  It also was cool because since Matt's is small (but not too small), you wind up talking to the people around you.  Three tables joined in our conversation to complain about State Senator Russel Pearce, who led the slaughter of AZ's education budgets particularly in Spring 2009...but that's a different story...  I need to go back to Matt's soon--it was a great time.

When I recently visited the Arizona area I had heard this restaurant mentioned repeatedly. So l tried the restaurant for breakfast one day to see for myself how great the food was. As soon as I entered the restaurant I was greeted immediately and told that I could sit anywhere which was great. Soon after I picked a table I was approached by a friendly waiter with a menu. Looking over the menu I initially wanted to try the pancakes but the menu offers them alone so I chose the waffle which included bacon on the side. However, I asked if I could substitute the bacon for the apple smoked sausage that was offered with their French toast special. If you want eggs you will have to order them separately which I found a little annoying.  Once the food was served the presentation was great but I must admit I expected more in the taste area. For one when I tried the waffle the taste of flour was very overwhelming to me. I have definitely had better tasting waffles. The sausage that I was charged a extra $4.00 for tasted like a smoked kielbasa type sausage instead of the breakfast style I expected. I also ordered eggs and asked that they not be cooked to hard but they were.     Maybe my expectations were to high from all of the hype I heard but I wasn't very impressed with the food especially at the prices that they charged.
Great food.  House made preserves are amazing.  Love being able to get bone-in pork with breakfast.  Sausage and potatoes well done.  Only complaint was watery, listless poached eggs.

What am I missing here?  I have heard about Matt's since moving to Phoenix almost 5 years ago, but never wanted to wait outside in the heat to try it.  Now that they have moved into a bigger building, I figured I could try it.  The space is cute -- kind of a minimalist industrial theme.  I was not AT ALL impressed with the menu.  Not much to choose from, and you'll end up having to order items a la carte if you want variety in your meal (e.g., I didn't see any meals that included pancakes, a side of breakfast meat and eggs -- in fact, the pancakes don't even include a side of breakfast meat, so you have to order that a la carte).  I ordered the waffle, which does come with a side of bacon, and an orange juice.  The orange juice, although fresh-squeezed and very good, had to be the smallest glass of OJ I have ever seen. It was basically a large shot glass.  At $2.50 a glass, I felt a little jilted.  The waffle was really good!  It was definitely fresh and buttery.  The bacon left a lot to be desired.  It was pretty fatty, and the pepper crust really didn't add anything to the flavor.   Maybe my expectations were too high based on all of the rave reviews I have heard about Matt's, but my experience was just okay.

No greeters! No hostess! Full place and looks like one server for 100 people and 2 bartenders!! Had to seat ourselves at a dirty table and waited for any kind of attention for 5 minutes and then took off!! Nice job Manager!!!

Casual but not very comfortable. Dark & drab. Extremely over priced & their food is not kid friendly.  Their biscuits are good. But for a simple breakfast I'm just not impressed. I can't imagine ever going back.

Whoa - what a bunch of spoilsports!    What's not to love about Matt's Big Breakfast (except for the wait)?  My friend and I are serious breakfast aficionados, hailing from Philly where we regularly b'fast at Sabrina's, Honey's, Carmen's Country Kitchen and Morning Glory Diner - all fine, glorious breakfast establishments.  Suffice it to say that neither of us are slouches when it comes to knowing a killer breakfast when we come across one - and he makes a mean frittata himself and I make sublime homemade buttermilk pancakes.    I read about Matt's online (altho I must say that I somehow fortunately missed the  ridiculously pretentious and nit-picky (too much rosemary for your retainer??? Get a life!) "yelp" reviews) so we decided to stop by for breakfast after flying in to Phoenix this past Saturday.    As much as we love a good b'fast, we both despise a long wait ... but hey, we had nothing better to do and struck up conversations with other waiting souls and paid a visit to the nearby flea-bag Coronado Motel to use the restroom and soak up the atmosphere.  Matt's provides a cooler of flavored water and the time passed pretty quickly.  IT WAS SO WORTH THE WAIT!  It's days later and I can still taste the perfectly light and fluffy (neither undercooked or overcooked) omelette, brimming with top quality cheddar cheese (who could imagine a basic omelette could taste so heavenly?).  The home-fries were bursting with flavor with the addition of rosemary, onions and peppers ... and the toast ... oh the toast ... homemade sourdough cut into thick slices, toasted and served with homemade jam.  My partner's special was eggs blended with some kind of slightly spicy sausage and cheese.  The coffee, too, is perfect, neither too strong or too mild and served with real cream and raw sugar.    Service is fast, friendly and we were treated to the owner's adorable son seating guests and advising of the day's specials.    Didn't need to eat again until dinner - if you're in Phoenix, ignore the "yelp" twitwits - you simply MUST visit Matt's Big Breakfast.
Even though we have to drive 15 minutes to get here we are NEVER disappointed! We love that Matt works with a local butcher and other local vendors too.
Food was great... wait was long but it was because of how popular that place was. The employees were very friendly.

Because of the name of the restaurant and the line outside, I gained certain expectations. I was expecting a BIG BREAKFAST and amazing tasting food. However, I was disappointed.   I had the Chop and Chick with home fries. This item was not worth the wait or the price. The serving size was small. The taste was forgettable.   I also had the Waffle, which saved the experience. I have to admit it was tasty. I love a waffle where the batter is sweet and doesn't need too much syrup. Also, it came with a slice of bacon, which had a kick to it making it super good. Lastly, it was decently priced. I was close to saying that it's worth the wait, but I found out it's not too hard to make a similar waffle at home by just adding malt to your waffle mix.   This wouldn't be my first choice for breakfast, but if you're like me and you like to try places featured on the Food Network, just order the bacon. It's unique and different.

Bad Decisions I've Made in 2017:  1. Picking up a skillet fresh out of the oven with my bare hand. 2. Believing the NY Giants were going to win. 3. Leaning into the trunk of a cab too early, and gashing my head on the rebounding door.  Good Decisions I've Made in 2017:  1. Getting the Sonrisa Burrito before I got on a plane back to NYC.  (Clearly killing it this year.)  Admittedly, my Phoenix airport eatery experience is a bit limited, but after drinking liquor of questionable quality until the wee hours of the morning, this burrito quite possibly saved my life.   Although the menu only lists bacon and sausage as meat options, chorizo was a nice surprise choice. Beware, it's going to take 15 minutes for this thing because it's real food, and they have to grill the burrito. Which is so, so worth it, even if you have to miss your flight and live in PHX for the rest of your life.  Well, maybe not then.

My visit was a complete disappoinment.  I drove all the way from Scottsdale because I had heard such good things about Matt's, so I arrived hungry, and with high expectations.    The restaurant was busy, with only counter seating available, so I took one of the available stools.  They are VERY uncomfortable metal stools.  The seats are round, unupolstered, metal, smaller than most folks butts (I am a small woman), insufficiently contoured, and very slippery. I had to pull the stool in close to the counter, wedge my knees against the counter, and keep my feet on the rungs of the stool in order not to feel as if I would slide off.  The hard metal seat was so uncomfortable that I kept looking around in to see if a table opened up.  So, uncomfortably perched, I decided to try the pork chop, eggs, hashbrowns and wheat toast.  The plated food looked good.  The eggs were fine and cooked as ordered but even after trying all 3 of the salt shakers on the counter, I couldn't get enought salt without opening the shaker, and though I am not a heavy salter, everything needed salt.  The pork chop looked appealing but turned out to be dry, overcooked, difficult to cut even with the steak knife that was provided, and tasteless (seriously),   I could see that the meat was seasoned, but I couldn't tast whatever they used.  I didn't understand the texture of the hash browns.  The top and bottom were crisp and pretty good, but the middle (which comprised most of the order) was really wet.  Hungry as I was, I ate some of the crispy part of the hash browns, a little of the pork chop, a couple bites of toast, and only one of the eggs because nothing appetizing remained to eat with the second one (I can't handle eggs alone).  No big breakfast at Matt's for me.  I was too disappointed to even complain about my meal.  I just paid my check and left for the treck back to Scottsdale with no plan to ever return to Matt's.

Wasn't Worth the Drive Across Town  I had heard a lot of hype about Matt's, and had friends who went there who raved about the place, so I made the 30 minute drive to try it out.   The place was packed, and had people waiting for tables, so I took an open spot at the counter. To start with, the stools were completely made of metal, including the seat which was hard, slippery, and shaped like a button mushroom with no contours for comfort. I was uncomfortable and felt like I had to brace my knees against the counter in order not to slide off.  It didn't take very long to place my order, for the "Chop & Chick" and I was brought coffee right away. The server was friendly. The coffee was alright, but the server didn't return to see if I wanted a refill while I was waiting for my breakfast. The wait to receive my food was on the long side, but I can see that being so busy would slow the process. The wait wouldn't have been a big deal, but my stool was so extremely uncomfortable that I almost left.  When I was just about at the end of my patience sitting so uncomfortably, my food came, and the server finally refilled my coffee.   I can't say anything good about it. The portion was average - disappointing given the "Big" in the restaurant's name. My pork chop was way overcooked (dry) and apparently unseasoned, and there is nothing complementary that I can say about the home fries. They didn't mess up the scrambled eggs, but my breakfast overall was so unappealing that I only ate a couple of bites. Since my server hadn't returned to see if my meal was satisfactory, I decided to throw in the towel and just get off of that stool and out of there. I left enough money for the food, headed out the door, and back across town and had a fine breakfast elsewhere.   At Matt's, I didn't get quality, quantity, value, flavor or service. I didn't even get breakfast.

Wish this place was more consistent. Our best time here was a weekday. and they got 5 stars but my last 2 experiences have been on a weekend mid day on a Sunday which was not favorable; never to return at that time. But we decided to go at 7:30am on a Saturday. It was busy but not crazy busy so we had high hopes for a better experience. And it was better. My husband loved his waffle and bacon.  I had an cheddar cheese omelet with sauteed mushrooms, onions and red peppers that was amazing. The hash browns are great; crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Their bread is very good especially with the homemade jam. The bacon was a little over-cooked almost but not quiet burnt. That was the only downside other than for the awful bitter coffee. I'm sure we will return since my husband does like the waffles.

Matt's Big Breakfast?   I'd say the only thing big about this place is the wait. When you walk up to the tiny place (it looks like a miniature brick block that you're not sure is big enough for humans), you scrawl your name down on a standard piece of notebook paper... and then you wait. Not fifteen minutes. Not twenty. More like 60. At least they have free water outside because, let's face, even in October, the Phoenix sun can be brutal.  Peaking inside, you realize why there's such a wait: about 8 tables (most seat 2 or 4) and about 5 stools at the breakfast bar. It's no wonder... If you do the math, the average person takes about 30-45 minutes to eat breakfast. So, add the ordering time... the cooking time... the debit card time... And you have about an average of an hour per meal. The odds are against you.  But, you put your name down, so you might as well suck it up. It's going to be a BIG wait for Matt's Breakfast. So, it's no wonder the food gets such great reviews. You're ravenous by the time your name is called -- you'd eat the fake flowers if you could away with it.   Coffee is meh. At least they bring ya real cream. That's awesome.   The decor is minimal. It's said the color orange makes one feel hungrier. I really don't think Matt needs to worry about his patrons being hungry by the time they sit down to eat. Again, the wait is BIG.   But, I'll stop whining about that. Moving on...   I ordered the daily special - a scramble with mushrooms and fotini cheese. It came with home fries and two wedges of cinnamon raisin bread. It looked very good when it arrived. One bite of the scramble and I thought, "I could have made this." The home fries were bland... nothing like Kerby Lane's in Austin, Texas (if you've ever been, you know what I'm talking about... please, somebody wipe the drool from my face...). The redeeming piece was the bread. Granted, it's not the best bread I've had, but it was pretty yummy. I made sure to finish all that off, but I left 1/2 my scramble and all but a couple bites of my home fries behind.   As for the service, is was above average. Not extraordinary, like I somehow expected from a place like this that boasts the cozy feel of eating among friends. The service was prompt, though, and the people working were friendly and seemed to be in a chipper mood -- that's hard to imagine when you've been on your feet since before 6 a.m. with a consistent rush. One of the cute waitresses even made people outside laugh with, "We accept all kinds of payment. Cash. Credit. Check. Or you can work in the kitchen for a little bit." I thought her happy-go-lucky attitude was a breath of fresh air.   In conclusion...   Walking away from the tiny place, I commented, "I'm pretty sure I won't be going back there."   From all the great reviews I've read, I had to try this place. I'm glad I did... it was definitely an experience, especially since the police showed up to deal with some next door squabble/drug bust/whoknowswhat. At least while I was waiting, I had free entertainment to occupy my time.
Great place to get good food, people watch and there was no wait! I was able to spend quality time with my dad here and we thoroughly enjoyed our breakfast.

Lunch there too! New location in Tempe. Great stop after a long run around TTL. I went for the turkey rouben. Friend went all out breakfast: pancakes with a gigantic omelet. Do not eat here often. But I've never been disappointed.

Dunno if you can really call it a big breakfast, but it's usually a good breakfast. Seems like it's a scratch cooked kitchen because the food seems so fresh and tasty.  We liked the salami scramble with the fresh baked wheat toast,, it works well.  Sweet as sugar, attractive waitresses who are appreciative of their customers and seem to be right there for ya. They always remember you.  Beware that you are charged for all drink re-fills except coffee, and they may not mention it to you,, and suddenly your bill doubles.  Yeah,,, you have a wait, even for the 5 seat counter,, and sometimes they'll seat an employees family member way ahead of you,, and sometimes forget to check the sign-in list and customers are left stranded outside and ignored,, that really sucks.  If ya feel un-loved outside sitting on the on deck bench, perhaps peek inside and remind them someones waiting.  Bring quarters for the parking meters. A buck fifty an hour.  Cramped and uncomfortable seating throughout. No place for a fat man,, non-fat only.  Opens at 6:30 AM and they usually call it a day roughly around 2:30 PM. Closed Mondays last we rolled through.  I like almost everything on the menu, though it seems when a good food place gets national media attention, their quality thus backs into hell.   We'll see with Matts.

Hardly a big breakfast.  One small slice of toast, a pre-frozen tile of hash browns and a couple eggs like you'd get anyplace.   Matt's has become a chain and defaulted to chain portions, attitude and quality.   Get your order straight, it's unlikely your server will check back on your meals.  If you have attractive girls in your group the female servers will be rude and surly. They eat their own kind.   Uncomfortable seats.   Two and a half stars.  For the money it should be better and at one time it was better.

Everyone kept telling me THIS was the place to go for great breakfast. I found their menu limited. Perhaps this is why they were suppose to be so good? Do a few things "great" and people will come back. I think it's more about a lack of decent breakfast choices for the Biltmore area.  PRO: The wait was only 15mins during a holiday. Bacon was VERY good. Great service and high quality napkins. 100% pure maple syrup and raw sugar. CON: Their coffee, eggs, hash browns, sausage links, waffles, and pancake was just average.  If I was in the area, I would go again. However, being 25 miles away from Glendale/Peoria, I'd stick with U.S. Egg, IHOPs, or Ronnie's Cafe.

I was excited when I had enough time till my flight to eat here. I was a little underwhelmed considering how much people love this place.   They were accommodating and quick, which is important for an airport restaurant obviously.   I ordered the breakfast burrito. It has too many Jalepenos and not enough other flavors. I had to pick half of them out and then add salt pepper and hot sauce for it to taste good. Maybe I just ordered the wrong dish?? Maybe the one in dt phx is better? I wanted to love it but it was just bland.   I'm willing to give it another shot but no breakfast burrito for me again.

I had heard about this place since I moved here 3 years ago... But had been detoured by the long wait that comes with the fantastic reputation. I had some friends in town.. we ventured down there. We waited 45 minutes. We weren't expecting anything great by that point, but were committed to trying it. The gave us menus in line & took our order, so that when we sat down finally, our food & drink followed immediately. As doubtful as we were after standing that long, I have to say it was worth every minute. Down to the coffee, everything was spectacular. I ordered the special, steak and eggs. BEST BREAKFAST EVER! Like me, don't wait so long to try it and don't be discouraged by the long lines. It is phenomenal.

First time here was on a Tuesday morning around 10:30.  I've always heard this place was busy so I thought we'd be good at this time.  We were able to be seated right away but I was still amazed on how many people were there for breakfast at this hour.  Atmosphere was a little noisy but service was quick.  The coffee was just right for my liking, and I had the scrambled eggs with salami with side of hash browns and wheat toast.  I had actually ordered the home fries but got hash browns, which was perfectly ok because they were amazing.  The strawberry jam was fantastic as well.  I'll be going back.
Nice alternative to lgoNo! Pkg & good eats! Lot of great alternatives in arcadia/biltmore area.

Food was great! First time trying out their breakfast food here. I got "The Hog and Chick" and it was fantastic & delicious! It was so packed when we got there and right when we sat down, it slowed down. Service was good even though she needed to smile more lol but it's fine. The food came at the expected time which is great. I liked it!
I chickened out and just got the regular bacon and eggs.  But the Honey Lemonade was BOMB!!

The food was so good! I ordered the waffle and it was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. It was perfect! The OJ is freshly squeezed and you can tell! The hash browns were perfect as well. Go have brunch with a friend:) I recommend it:)

Food was great. Eggs were perfect, delicious pancakes. Very nice servers. Not worth the wait in the summer months. We sat/stood in 90 degree weather for 45 min with minimal shade and seating. No waiting room inside. I'd go again when it cools off
Good food and made fresh to order, but because of the TV coverage on Food Network and tiny size you can expect LONG waits to get in. Not so special it's worth a 60-90 minute wait for me.

First off, we went with a group of six on a Tuesday morning at 10:30am and STILL had to wait about 45 minutes for two tables of 3.  BUT, the food was worth the wait as I had the delicious special with jalapeno and sausage scrambled, with hash browns and a fresh tortilla.  Awesome!  Great coffee too!  In fairness the line moves pretty fast, but this is a small place so if you're considering coming with a big group, be forewarned that you'll wait longer for a table together.  We also learned while we were eating that Matt's was featured on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives on the Food Network.  So that may be the reason for the business too...fewer locals and more looky-loos.  Regardless, I'd go back in a flash and highly recommend Matt's!

The food was good and the customer service was great,  but not sure if the wait is worth being a regular diner here... there was a fantastic coffee shop less than a block to the east where we spent some time while waiting for a table.

Well I finally made it to Matt's on a trip to Phoenix and all I can say is WOW.  Fresh local coffee, fantastic bacon and hash browns too.  Do yourself a favor and put this place on your bucket list whenever you are in Arizona

Where do I begin???? This is hands down the best breakfast place in Phoenix. I went 3 times and I would go everyday if I could. I was in town for work and this was the highlight for me. The reviews are very true, anything you get will satisfy you. I highly recommend the blue berry lemonade made with honey. Absolutely love this place, I got the waffle it was perfect, portion sizes are really great and the staff is always helpful. Portions are fantastic you can't go wrong here.
Solid portions, very flavorful, quick and great service!    Conveniently located and good atmosphere with full bar.

After a late night out with a few college buddies, we woke up @ the downtown Hyatt starving for a hearty meal.  Einstein Bro's Bagels located downstairs, wasn't gonna satisfy our insatiable craving for some rib-stickin, home cooked food.    When we arrive, there are people milling about the exterior of this tiny restaurant, sipping orange infused water provided by the staff.  We assumed it must be excellent, if these people were willing to wait in the sweltering heat for a coveted seat.  After 15-20 minutes, we feel like celebrities on the VIP list as we're escorted through the door.  I order the Hog & Chick, which provided more than enough hash browns, eggs, toast, and sausage to quell the lumberjack appetite I developed.    The staff was friendly & fast, attentive to our dwindling water glasses and clearing plates quickly.  We were more than pleased with the meal, hospitality and price point--happy to walk a little of this hearty breakfast off, on the way back to the hotel.
I enjoyed this breakfast. The vibe was very nice. Our whole table ordered Hog and Chicks and they were tasty...I would have enjoyed a wee bit more seasoning, but still good flavor.
The Hog & Chick breakfast was great! Loved the homemade strawberry jam for the wheat toast!

This was a yelp check by my wife that showed decent reviews - so we tried it out. This is by far one of the smallest establishments for food. Total capacity might be 20. The food is like a home cooked meal. That is nice - I usually want a homestyle breakfast when I am out. The wait is quite long but considering the size of the joint - the wait is self explanitory. The staff are friendly and try to make you comfortable. For the 2 of us at a table for only 2 - it was a little too close to dining inside a phonebooth.
Duh. Because this place is the bomb.com! The pancakes and homemade preserves are the best! I usually always get the salami scramble and the lemonade.....and an extra pancake. Because fat.
I recommend this place to everyone I know. I get emotional from the pancakes. They somehow connect with my soul.
i dont think they care that they are so rude. the worst service i have ever had. i was amazed that they would treat their customers like that.   i will not spend any money there
The waiting time & super noisy small space is too great to ignore. The food was ok but not necessarily worth it. Won't be coming back.

After Hiking camelback we hit this place up for some chow. It was pretty dead so we got seated very quickly. They are small and very clean with great waitresses. The breakfast was reasonable for what I got, couple eggs, potatoes and bacon. The Menu is very limited but they have specials everyday. If your looking for a big menu and a lot of options and a big breakfast I would hit up somewhere else. While this place is good, it has its limits.

Just terrible Customer Service experience. Hostess at entrance has no respect for customers, and cant even commit to basics as:  - "Is the Bar open sitting or List assigned?" - - "It's both.." After having to deal with that, we ended up with mediocre food, in front of us.

Ok, but not worth a significant wait.  The food is good, but anyone from the Midwest (like me) will probably find it to be similar to the average diner back home.  I cannot figure out what the hype is for this place, other than perhaps the fact that this place stands out in a city that really doesn't have too much else to offer.

Really good food I'd say worth the wait pretty much always packed but food is awesome and portions are large service is real friendly. I'd given them 5 stars but the wait can sometimes be a bit much. Thanks Matt

You gotta love Matts Big Breakfast...a simple menu with the freshest ingredients, good service, and a cozy down home setting that makes you feel like you're eating in Grandma's kitchen. We got lucky on our last visit b/c it was later in the day and drizzling outside, so there was no wait at all and we got right in. I don't think I would try to go here during peak hours on a Saturday or Sunday morning, unless you like waiting a while to get seated.   We ordered the Salami Scramble (good) and the Waffle (great), along with a side of bacon. Their bacon is definitely one of the best in all of Phoenix, that's for sure. It's flavorful and juicy and crisp all at the same time.   I don't think I would change a thing about this place, except for the sketchy location that it is in. It's kind of artsy fartsy and trendy on the one hand, but then on the other hand there are about 5 crack dens surrounding it. Let's just say I wouldn't want to be there alone at night.....hence why it is a breakfast place I guess. We actually experienced some of the shadiness first hand when we went to the hotel next door to go pee after our meal (no bathroom in the place). There was a torn up hooker in her 50's arguing with the lady at the check in desk about money with some guy who was missing all of his front teeth. There was obviously something illegal about to do down in one of the rooms, so we peed as quickly and quietly as we could and left the scene before we could get shot. Even so, getting shot is definitely worth the risk for some of their delicious food!
Thick bacon was hard to chew and not as tasty as I dreamed it would be after all the other reviews. The rest of our breakfasts were large and unique. Service was very good

Finally got to experience Matt's Big Breakfast yesterday after hearing about it for so long. We were not disappointed. For Sunday brunchtime, the wait was not too long at approx. 25 minutes. After being seated we were greeted quickly by our server who took and delivered our beverage order. Two people in my party ordered the special and another steak and eggs. The meals were brought out so quickly, it was amazing! They all raved about their dishes. I ordered a waffle with a side of eggs over-medium well which were cooked absolutely perfectly (which happens rarely.) The waffle...oh that waffle!!! It was heaven on a plate! Our server was very personable and kept our beverages filled throughout our meal. A friend had toast with Matt's homemade strawberry jam. Wow!!! Yes...I now have a jar waiting for me in the fridge. So good. Can't wait to go back.
Cute place but food is whatever. It's just a standard place who sells eggs and bacon. Nothing too impressive or interesting. The bacon is good though.

Checked-in and asked for a cup of coffee. Woman at register was a complete bi!$& and was completely disgruntled and on a huge power trip.  I had to purchase a coffee to go and she threw my card onto the counter.
Fantastic breakfast and very good service. The cafe is also very clean. Can't wait to come back and try something new.

High quality breakfast place. Generally get the hash browns, omelette, and toast. The vegetarian options aren't vast but they're all delicious, and the belgian waffle is a rare treat when I feel like ruining my gym routine. That said, waiting for a table is almost always kind of awful, and the wait staff rarely radiates kindness. It's really good food, so it's often worth it, but it's certainly not perfect. Probably still the best breakfast joint in Phoenix tho.
Yummy and friendly staff! Service was slow but their cheerful attitude made it less painful!
The Five Spot was one of the best breakfast sandwiches I've ever had. Was pleasantly surprised.  The bacon was my favorite part! Mmmm mmmm good!

I had the parfait. Very big serving. I can't say I was a huge fan of the parfait, but that was my fault not theirs. I didn't realize greek yogurt is supposed to be sour. The fresh squeezed orange juice is worth paying for. I absolutely love fresh squeezed juice. Service was good, and we enjoyed ourselves.

As someone who has worked in customer service oriented businesses since my first job, I find this as one of the top things when rating all business establishments. From the first minute I walked in, there wasn't a glimpse of good customer service in the place.  The first woman greeted us and asked us to come to her host stand. We said we wanted a table and she told us to write our names down. Already slightly annoying that she asked us to do her job. She told us the wait was 30-45min and that the bar was first come first serve. Since we noticed 3 open seats at the bar, we walked up and got ready to sit down. A man that worked there walked up and said "you need to put your name on the list." I mentioned that we had done that already and that the woman up front had mentioned that the bar was open seating. Very rudely he yelled, "NO SHE DIDN'T!" and then pointed to the host stand. You were not there when she told us it was open seating, so do not tell me what she said. Yes, she may have made a mistake, but that isn't my fault. There are much nicer ways to talk to your customers.  This wasn't even the part that made us want to leave. We continued to wait because of the excellent reputation this place has. We waited, we waited, we waited. An hour goes by and we've seen people who came in after us continue to get seated. So I approached the hostess again and mentioned that we had been waiting for over an hour and that others had been seated before us. She picks up her list and says "well, there's still 20 people in front of you" and shows me a completely different and new page of names that wasn't there before. I mentioned to her that list wasn't there before and showed her where our name was written. She informed us that we had "created our own new sheet" while they still had one they were adding names to and that we put our name in the wrong place. Well, maybe you should have done your job in the first place and written our name down for us. Not only that, even though she knew that we had been there for that long, she didn't offer to rectify the misunderstanding and seat us sooner. I will forever not eat at this place and I urge, nay, I warn you not to eat here either.

if you don't like bacon, i would skip matt's, but if you like bacon, you should go every day. there is no bacon like the bacon at matt's. i have a friend who rants about this at least once a week. i'm certain this is the only meat product this vegetarian misses.  i haven't really tried a lot of things on the menu. i'm a big fan of the specials and the 5 spot.

FIRST!!! The staff was AH-MAAAAA-ZING! Very very nice and polite. Wonderful.   The two stars is because this place is OFFENSIVELY overpriced. I actually left without ordering due to its absurd pricing. LIke Ritz Carlton room service pricing. (Ive ordered room service from the Ritz, I know what that costs) To feed my two little kids and myself breakfast would have been about $50 with tip.     Three pancakes. $7.95  Yes. You read that right. I'm not sure if they have retired US Presidents making them but $8 for three pancakes that cost 3 cents to make seems a bit steep.  Glass of OJ= $4.95  Made from oranges. NOT made from oranges harvested by Angels mind you.  Soda, one brand in a can. NO refills. $2.00 (RC Cola. I didn't even know that they were still in business. Who drinks that crap?) I could go on...  No kids menu. Annoying. NO regualr fountain drinks. Annoying. Absurd pricing. Annoying. Amazing staff. WONDERFUL!  So I think Im going to open a food truck right outside and call it "Matt's Third cousins Big and realistically priced Breakfast. Whos with me?
Food was good but the menu was basic. No great selections, kinda normal. I like the waffles better then the pancakes. Freshly squeezed orange juice was good.
Best breakfast in Phoenix! Great atmosphere, great food, great service. Definitely worth the wait.
Yes x1000! You have to wait to be seated, usually for awhile... But after you order food is served very quickly, and it is ALWAYS worth the wait. Eat here. End of story.

Love this spot in the midst of the tall State Farm Buildings. Indoor and outdoor seating.  Open and modern look to this vibrant restaurant. We arrived at 10am on a Saturday and did not have to wait to sit indoors which was a nice treat. Cameron was our competent and friendly server. Everything was perfect!  Two had the Skinny and I had the Five Spot-for only half the price of most of the other meals it really is the best deal on the menu.  The bacon is thick and cooked right, the coffee is tasty and and not bitter at all. Everything I want in a breakfast. Enjoy a walk along the water after breakfast.

We had heard so much about Matt's that we decided to eat breakfast there this morning.  The food was mediocre.  My husband ordered the waffle and when he asked for additional syrup the server told us that it would be a $1.50 extra.  He declined the extra syrup and said that it was ridiculous.  When the hostess stopped by the table to ask us how we were doing we told her about the syrup.  She did not handle the interaction well, I pointed out that other restaurants never charge for extra syrup and she basically blew me off and said "we are not like anyone else, and if we did that we would have the raise the prices."  You would be far better off with a price increase.  It became apparent after that, when we received our check immediately,  that someone wanted us to leave because we complained.    This will be our first and last time eating at Matt's.  They can keep their Vermont Maple Syrup, which by the way is not $75 a jug.

Look, airport food is never going to be out of this world spectacular, I've accepted that reality a while back. However, Matt's Big Breakfast in Terminal 4 was decent (again, decent for airport food) and the prices were reasonable. I ordered the honey lemonade which tastes exactly how it sounds as well as the grilled cheese and tomato soup. Simple, clean and cheap. Their breakfast looks legit but I couldn't bring myself to ordering pancakes for the second time in one day especially before my flight back to the 305. Best part of the meal? Our server, Jennifer. She was on the ball and knew exactly when  to provide refills, bring the check and was really cheerful. Hooray for good airport customer service, Snoopy knows it ain't easy!

Exceptional service, and friendly servers. I came here for breakfast on a busy Sunday morning and was seated right away. My food was out in less than 10 minutes after I ordered it and I was never low on coffee with the servers constantly making sure I didn't need anything. I had a Sunday special which consisted of a 3-egg scramble and house potatoes. Both were very good. I will be back for sure next time I stay the night in Phoenix.

We saw the sign Matt's "BIG" Breakfast. The wife and i, because we love decent serving sizes, got excited. We were disappointed.  And the service was horrible. Our waitress treated us like we just ran over her dog. Never returning.

Very disappointing . . . I am new to Phoenix and drove out of my way to try Matt's as it had been highly recommended.  The man at the front door was a real jerk.  I gave him the benefit of the doubt the first time and by time #3 I had to leave and go somewhere more friendly. Sorry Matt . . . maybe I will try again another time.
Overrated. Poor service, especially the hosts.  You shouldn't get brownie points for non GMO food- but this place does in Phoenix.

I finally got a chance to check out this much hyped about breakfast joint. The staff were very friendly and attentive. The wait wasn't long since I got there around 8:15am. I ordered the waffle, and hubby ordered the griddle cakes with a side of their thick cut bacon. Mine order came with 2 strips of bacon already. The waffle tasted ordinary. There was nothing that screams WOW to me. Again, the griddle cakes were just ok. There was nothing extraordinary about them. I feel like eating at a friend's house, not a much raved about breakfast place. The bacon strips were actually delicious!!! I love the peppery taste to it. It's an average place for breakfast, but not one of the best.  I wouldn't go out of my way to get here if you don't live nearby. I would give it 3.5 stars, but I can't with this app. Overall,  it was a very nice experience as far as the staff, but I feel the food could be better for all the 5 star ratings I have read about.

Probably just a bad night for them, but I interacted with 3 employees and all were short and rude and Uninterested.  I had to ask for a menu, ask if I could order a beer, and when I asked if they have chips and salsa the bartender said "no" and walked away. Nuthin. Then couldn't get them to process my payment for 10 minutes. The exception was Karina, a waitress who was friendly. The only smile over a 25 minute period.

So until today I didn't know there was a lot of hype about this place.  Ashley L. suggested it and I said sure why not.  While waiting for her in the parking lot, doors locked and windows up, I decided to look at it on Yelp.  Wow was there a lot of reviews.   So we got there early and there was no wait.  I guess that is rare.  We both got The Hog and Chick with bacon and sourdough bread she got eggs over hard and I got them scrambled and we shared a stack of pancakes.  I have to admit that the food was really good.  I am not saying this because others have said it but because it is my own opinion.  Like I said I didn't even know it existed until she suggested it.  The service was great and we had a great experience.  My only problem is the size.  It is tiny.  Wow.  There is a place on the west side known as The Place and it used to be in a small location and moved to a larger one.  Much easier to get in and the food is still great.  They may stay there because it feels quaint but that I think was the only flaw I saw.

So I have this thing about long waits at breakfast places.  Every town in America seems to have at least one annoyingly popular place with a line  around the corner and overrated pancakes, omelets, etc.  Having visited Matt's on two previous occasions I found it to be great, but because it violated my "line theory" I've resisted embracing it.  Until now.  After meeting a friend at Matt's for breakfast this morning (and waiting about 30 minutes) I can honestly say that this place is the real deal.  The food isn't gourmet or even creative, it isn't supposed to be.  Rather it's classic breakfast done to perfection.  Exceptional pork, eggs, potatoes, breads, everything.  Although it pains me to say it, this is a breakfast place worth waiting in line for.

Matts big breakfast was everything it was cracked up to be the wait  was minimal but I would have  waited longer. If needed as a very hip place right off a downtown right now heart of everything I really enjoy the scenery and the service there was top-notch a fantastic place I cannot wait to go back and spend more time which will be soon

Hats off, gents. You've done it, squeezing a bonafide breakfast gem right in between an insurance building and a lake. I'll admit, I'm charmed, not by your $4.50 orange juice, but by your attention to breakfast mainstays. Nobody hashes a brown quite like Matt's.

This place is a tiny hole in the wall, so make sure to come early and prepare to wait, cause it's worth it.  The staff is super nice and very attentive.  While you are waiting make sure to grab a menu, so you can peruse at your leisure.  Not that you are going to need a lot of time with it, unless you are a really slow reader.  There is only a handful of items, but don't be put off by that. Cause what they do...they do it amazingly!  Daughter had an omelet with cheese and mushroom, Son and Wife did steak and eggs.  I had scrambled eggs and sausage.  Sounds basic, right.  Wrong, it was incredible.  The eggs were all cooked to perfection.  Most people don't know how to cook, so it finishes on the plate.  These people should hold a class on it.  Eggs cooked through and super moist.  The steak was aged and tender.  The Sausage were fresh and infused with subtle smoky flavor.  My Daughter's omelet was as big as her head and filled to the brim with cheese and mushrooms.  Each order came with potatoes, so me being a fatty, I always gotta go with the hash brown.  They were crisp on outside and tender on the in.  It was a great compliment to a wonderful meal.  A meal that was elevated to an eating experience by the attentive and caring staff.  As a whole all the patrons in the restaurant should have hoisted the cooks and wait staff on their shoulder and showered them with praise, but alas a heart felt thank you, will have to do.
Good food, but they have outgrown their restaurant.

I visited this place with my parents. The food overall was decent. The hash browns were overdone. The pancakes were a bit over sweet for my mother but that may be preference. The main issue we had with this eatery was that we felt rushed to eat and leave. Especially when the waitress took my mother's plate without asking which still had several pieces of her ham steak on it. It was so unexpected and quick that we didn't have time to correct the mistake.

Was downtown today so I stopped in for breakfast.  Fundamentally not bad.  On the other hand didn't blow my socks off.    That being said I will give them credit for being able to scramble an egg.  Most places don't know how to do this properly (trust me most places make an omelet and chop that up and call it scrambled eggs...its not).  This is a small place and it seems like everyone in Phoenix is trying to eat there.  So one really irritating note.  The place is crowded, I'm waiting and I see two people finished with their meal just drinking coffee.  I get seated...they're still sitting there.  I get my food...they're still sitting there.  I eat...they're still sitting there.  I pay my bill...they're still sitting there.  I leave...they're still sitting there.    WTF!!!!!!  People are waiting and you're just sitting there.  To make matters worse they pulled out a jug of Arizona Tea and started drinking that.  Double WTF!!!!!!  I guess the management of Matts are too nice and don't bounce people when they should. I'm not sure if that's a good quality or bad.  What I do know is I just saw two of the most inconsiderate people in Phoenix today.  Probably a 3.5 versus a 4, but that wasn't a choice.
Solid breakfast place.  I would not wait in line to get in, but if there are tables available it is a good place for breakfast.  Nothing exciting or extra special, but very good quality and options.

Matt's rocks for breakfast, but lunch is also All American awesomeness!  Cobb salad Macaroni salad Strawberry honey lemonade  The Cobb is fresh & unlike any other with their thick smoky bacon. Best macaroni salad ever . It came in a mound with diced veg, tomatoes- wow. Strawberry lemonade with local honey was money/honey. Love Matt's!

We stopped by Matts Big Breakfast on camelback yesterday.  It was nice inside and the employees were friendly. I was excited to eat there because I had heard how busy the other Phoenix location was.  I have to say that the food was average.  It was so greasy and shiney that I thought Rihanna was going to walk in and start singing "shines bright like a diamond".  I hadn't seen such glistening food since living up in the mountains in Montana.  My wife and I had to ask for extra napkins to dab off all the excess oil. I only ate it cause I was starving, but then felt I needed to run home to get my cholesterol pill.  All jokes aside,  it wouldn't be my first choice next time. But I would be willing to try it again in case maybe the cook was a little heavy handed.  One more note to the owners.  The toast was sopping wet in butter too.  I had to tear off the upper layer of bread.  Oil is not the answer for a good breakfast. My wife makes awesome dishes that any restaurant would love and she uses Pam spray.  That's really all you need.  I ordered the 2 egg breakfast with hashbrowns, bacon and toast. + coffe

Expect to wait but the food is worth it. Fresh and local with nice portions. Bacon is thick and delicious and coffee was really good too. I got the breakfast sandwich and the entire thing just about melted in my mouth - the bread was super fresh. Their homemade jams are simply delightful. Will definitely come back.
The food here was really good and quick. I had the chicken apple sausage eggs hash browns and the big sourdough toast. The coffee was a bit weak but the food was good and the service.

Tight, excellent menu. Friendly efficient staff. Great vibe. This is how a breakfast spot should be. I'm impressed - by the quality of the food, the cheery staff, and the fact that they run this place like a well-oiled machine.

Bright and early, there I was standing in line, waiting to get into Matt's Big Breakfast.  The wait was tolerable, perhaps because it was still early (roughly 8AM).  Although, this tiny restaurant only provides limited number of seating; they were well-managed and promptly operated.  In addition, the waiter was friendly and the service was just flawless.  It didn't just take the restaurant's staff members to provide customers' smooth dining experiences; the customers also knew the etiquette.  They get in, eat, and get out, making the wait bearable.  Like the name of the restaurant, the portions of our breakfast were extremely satisfying.  The extra plus Matt's deserves is the reasonable pricing that is particularly easy on your wallet.  Both their breakfast and lunch menu items range from $4 to $8 - incredibly affordable.  I ordered the five spots with home fries.  As the dish was placed in front of me, the smell of fresh rosemary had swiftly increased my appetite.  The home fries were buttery, perfectly cooked, and well-seasoned.  The eggs weren't as fluffy as I'd like, but overall the pros definitely exceed the cons.  I'd definitely stop by whenever I happen to be in town.  Bottom-line, good food, good service, and affordable prices, who wouldn't be a fan?

After a year I finally made it back to Arizona. Matt's big breakfast was the first place I wanted to eat for a morning meal. I was not disappointed at all. The waffle was one of the best that I've ever had. The bacon was tasty and I enjoyed every bite of my meal. The strawberry honey lemonade is great to have as well. It is a bit noisy inside, but you barely notice it when chowing down on the delicious food.

Hmmmmm, another place I heard about for years. Movie stars love it! Locals love it! Food critics love it! I am not a breakfast food eater for breakfast so I figured I would never try it. Hey, I am OK with Denny's or McDonalds for Breakfast! I knew I had to go when the gentleman sitting next to me on the plane recently told me that he purposely landed a layover in Phx just to try the darn place. ( I am like," Really"? But then I thought I might do the same over a great NY pizza sooooooooo I cut the guy some slack-lol) So when I found myself Downtown yesterday I stopped by. Ok, right away I had issues. Nowhere to park. I found a spot on the street and paid 2 bucks for metered parking.( And worried about a break in since the neighborhood is real bad)  We are not starting off well. I then walked the two blocks to the restaurant. Being 10:30 am on a Tuesday I figured the normal 1-2 hour wait would not apply to me, yet the place was not dead. ( Hmmmm, good sign in today's economy) I had to sit outside for a little while but the wait was less than 10 minutes and the woman who worked there was very nice.                                                                                                              The place is an old dive. Now don't get me wrong I love old buildings. Super fan of Coronado Cafe, Teeter house, and other old houses renovated into eating establishments but this place is not one of those. Frankly, it is pretty gross. Small and old looking with uneven floors. It only has 6 tables  or so and a tiny bar. No wonder the wait. The menu only has 6 things on the Brkfst side and 5 or so on the lunch side. I ordered a Salami Scrambled Egg plate with Rosemary potatoes.Maybe I  am not an EGGSpert so I couldn't tell what the big deal was and why they are quoted as being so much better than elsewhere. Now, they are cage free eggs and cooked in butter. They tasted good but I didn't like have a heart attack or moaning fit over them or anything. The Rosemary Potatoes were good but nothing I would wait in line hours for. I have had better. The coffee tasted average. Now, the bread was a different story YUMMERS! Smashing! I asked them if it was homemade and they said they get it at Wildflower Bakery. Soooo I am thinking to myself there are plenty of those in town. I will just go there next time. No wait or parking issues. I ordered an egg salad sandwich to go. Which was delish, BTW and the Homemade Mac salad was outstanding. So, my foodie fingers type, What's the big deal? Did I order the wrong thing? Why the fuss? What am I missing here?  It was very good I agree but Oprah and Guy Fierro????? REALLY? The service was fine. Everyone was nice.  I did go off hours so small wait. I honestly don't know how it made the Food Channel or why people wait three hours in the heat to eat here.      I would go back sure but if I had never heard of the place I wouldn't have ranked it even in the top 100 of my favorite dining experiences.

I totally agree with some of the other reviews. I just do not get it. The food is not good and the service is terrible. They do have good bread but it is Wildflower Bread. I can go there for better food. I guess the whole buy local thing is important but the food is just not that good. I have had better at Denny's. And that is sure saying a lot. I do admit Their Egg Salad sandwich for lunch is not too bad but again nothing to write home about.

The food was just okay for me. Nothing special. I had the waffle. The real problem I had was with the lack of respect this place has. During peak hours they rush you in and out. They practically delivered the check with the food! We couldn't even enjoy ourselves because we were being rushed at every point in the service.
Foods great. Bartender...not so much. Poor attitude and rude. Stay in the main terminal.

Pretty basic airport food. I was expecting a little better based on the look and design of the place. I got the breakfast burritos and it was cold (which was surprising because it came out very fast), the sausage seemed undercooked and my eggs were a weird grey color.

Trip downtown for flowers. Wife had seen or someone had told her about Matt's.  Wow! Did find a place to park but had about a 20 min wait. We were there fairly early on a Saturday morning and really did not expect this many people downtown for breakfast.   Decor was mostly just a large room with a small room and tables.  I am one or the people that say it is pretty hard to mess up breakfast. I am pretty much an egg, bacon, toast person. But there are many things you can do to make this breakfast great.  The eggs were cooked just perfect, the beacon was thick and taste, the potatoes were different from what I expected and were great, now the toast. I usually get rye toast as I did this time. Surprise it was marble rye. My favorite. This is the only place I Have ever gotten it at breakfast. My wife got the same breakfast only with sourdough and scrambled eggs.  The food was very good. The service was OK. I know there was a lot of people waiting to eat. I felt rushed.  When I am in the area at breakfast time I will be stopping in for a meal.
Big plates of food so bring an appetite! Fresh farm to table food that is so delicious and the coffee they serve tastes great!

There isn't much to say about Matt's other than they have the best damn breakfast in the Valley.  You have to appreciate a homegrown diner where the owner makes everyday appearances, his wife runs the place, and they use the best, freshest, local ingredients.  Kudos.  I get the Hog and Chick every single time I go, I never stray.  Eggs over medium, hash browns, wheat toast, and the best damn bacon ever.  Always perfect every time.  I have never tasted bacon so good in my life.  The hash browns are out of this world.  They get shredded super fine and are cooked up on the griddle in loads of butter.  The BEST.  If you want to seem cool and in the know, at lunch time order the Insider Burger.  It's a traditional burger smothered in cheese, bacon added, and topped with an egg.  My brother loves it.  Similar to a Royal Red Robin Burger, but obviously superior.  The only negative is the wicked crowd that can form for breakfast.  Bring a lot of water with you and some sunscreen if you can brave the summer wait.  Simply put, this place is amazing.  I am so lucky to be so close to this place.  Sometimes to avoid the wait, my husband and I wake up at 6:30 on a Saturday morning, head over for breakfast and beat the crowds.  After a hearty button bursting breakfast, we ride our bikes home and go back to sleep.  That is the life my friends.  You should try it.
Awesome food great price friendly staff we will be coming back for sure when we come to Phoenix I would recommend this place to everyone.

Nice new location with the same small feel and long lines to get in. Awesome bacon! I generally order sausage with eggs but you have to get the bacon here. I have ordered the burger before and it is a very good size good quality burger. Don't missed the old location which is less than a block away from the new restaurant. DDD was there for a reason.

Been eating at Matt's Big Breakfast since they were at their original location a couple blocks away.   Always busy with a line to get in but great places are like that so if you want to eat quickly go to Dennys so I don't have to wait so long.  Everything is made from scratch and fresh. The Waffles are outstanding as are the Griddlecakes.   I am a really  big fan of the Big Butter Burger also. The burger is just plain good and when they bring it to you, you will be happy.  If you can make sure you get some bacon here which is very good.  Service is good and the new location is spacious compared to the original restaurant.  What is nice is that the small feel still transferred to the current location.  Would recommend going there either early in the morning or later prior to closing to minimize your wait.  Can't wait to go back!

Well it's been about 4.5 years since I have been back to Matt's, only because I moved away from AZ. This was my first time at the Tempe location. The staff did not disappoint. Everything was a amazing. Can't wait for our next trip back.

We waited a little less than 2 hours at Matt's- we went on a Saturday morning around 10:00am. I ordered the 5 spot with hash browns.  The hash browns were really good, thin & crispy. I didn't really like my sandwich that much, it was ok. I didn't really cAre too much for the grilled onions & thick bacon....I think I prefer thinner crispier bacon? All in all I wouldn't wait 2 hours again to eat here- it seemed average to me but glad I tried it. Oh & one last thing I didn't like that they didn't have free refills on beverages...it was sold by the bottle or can.

Food was okay, I am not waiting all day for it though.  If I could go in and get a table right away I'd eat here again, but waiting more than 10 minutes, no thank you!  I would rather walk to Matadors or First Watch....  P.S. Go for the rosemary potatoes not the hash browns, unless, of course, you would like some hash browns with your grease.

Perfect if you are craving a home-style breakfast.  I had a wonderful mushroom scramble, sausage, and the walnut raisin toast.  The portions were big and the food was very good - quality ingredients.  My only gripe is the orange juice.  It was $2.50 for a shot glass size cup of orange juice and it was half pulp.

Downtown location which was good for where we were staying, we got there early so we beat the crowd, but when we left it looked to be a long wait.  If you have kids I wouldn't say it's the most kid friendly, as I do not have a kids menu  The service was great, and the food came out very fast.    The man you did not have a very big selection, but the food that they did have was mediocre.

So...have been to the downtown and am a big fan of the salami scramble.  Fresh and real ingredients do make for a great meal.  However...the service today was absolutely horrible.  Not simply orders wrong, but drink orders weren't taken for a good 10 minutes and cocktails didn't come out until halfway through the eating our meals.  We were sitting less than 30 feet from the full bar so it was tempting to just go and place an order for the same drinks and see which would get there first.  Location is nice.  Tempe hipsters aren't too bad to deal with.  All in all a good meal, but I'll drive past this location and go to downtown next time.  Addendum:  My Bloody Mary cost more than my entire meal.  Now...maybe it was bottomless, but as stated above...didn't come until late into the meal and never saw my server until he brought the check.

so we came here on a Thursday morning and were able to sit right down which was nice compared to the upwards of two hour wait on our first attempt to come here. Like many we saw the restaurant on TV and thought we check it out given the hype. The menu is pretty limited and it was more than a little loud on the inside but overall kind of your typical hipster downtown location for anything in America.    Instead of your normal diner fair which is kind of what we were expecting there was a lot of nicer styles of foods with definitely a direction towards local and organically grown which is a nice refreshing change. Service was OK as they were definitely moving people in and out.  Ordered the salami scramble and home fries and it was on point. My wife ordered the waffle which was decent.  Had iced tea because that was the most appealing on the menu for a beverage and we got one refill in spite of servers walking by repeatedly most notably one particular blonde female that just kept walking and staring at my empty glass. Overall the staff seem to be pleasant but seem to want to move bodies in and out rather than provide customer service.  Our server for example took our order and that was the last we saw them until it was time for the check.  The food is great and that's the reason why it is scoring as high as it is (wanted to go with a 2).  Service was timely but impersonal.  Clearly they have changed the menu from when they were on television which is neither good nor bad as again the food was great (at least mine was).  I don't see coming back again anytime soon but I will say that I highly recommend the salami scramble with home fries.

What can I say that other haven't? It's all true...this place kicks breakfast ass! I have been to several high dollar steakhouses that don't cook a steak as perfectly as Matt's does. You will be able to find me here at least a few times a month...

Bad food bad service.  Heard about this place . Cold waffle, servers insulted that I would notice cold food.  Would never recommend .  I see they are building new place in my neighborhood. 32nd and Camelback. Will tell my neighbors not to bother.

Great spot. The food is amazing and the wait is absolutely worth it. My biggest recommendation would be to ensure that you have about 1-2 hours before going because you may have to wait 45 minutes to get in. However, if you enjoy breakfast, you will leave here happy.

I ordered Huevos rancheros. It's pretty good. Very good service. Good food. The sandwhich looks good. Good pork chop. Weird restroom place.  There were lots of people lining up to just get into the restaurant. It's easier to get into the restaurant in singles than as in a group. FYI. Great hidden place to dine in.

Best waffle with fresh maple syrup I've had in a long time. Also, the honey lemonade is phenomenal.  Excellent service. Apparently it's very popular, but early mornings before 730 are quiet and peaceful.

i know the real secret to Matt's Wu-tang Style.   some people may think Matt's is over rated. but i know that to be false. Matt's is THE BEST BREAKFAST...period. there has not been a single time i was unhappy with the service, price, or wait.  i would wait an hour, heck two hours if need be.   the 5-spot is by far my favorite breakfast item. its like a full on taste cell orgy. with over 50 taste cells per taste bud and a human tongue containing several million taste buds you have to figure that is alot of ecstasy in your mouth.   if i could justify the time spent waiting as a business expense i would be there every morning.   Matt and Erenia have a great thing going here.
Food is okay, nothing that I would consider great to merit having to wait outside for an hour an a half to be seated just to end up being placed at a bar.

A little late delivering the water, but it was Sunday morning crowd.  Please tell me though, does anyone know how to cook a poached eggs in Phoenix? I keep getting overcooked poached eggs. It is very disappointing. Overall the food was tasty. Just not a big wow.  Note: when I went to pay I mentioned my eggs were overcooked, and the manager reduced my bill by half of the most expensive meal.
